Tailo: I kā só͘ bīng-līng lín tio̍h tsun-siú ê iok tsí-sī lín, to̍h-sī tsa̍p-tiâu-kài, mā kā i siá tī nn̄g tè tsio̍h-pi.
English: He declared to you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even the ten commandments; and he wrote them on two tables of stone.

Tailo: Tse sī in-uī Abulahàm thiaⁿ Guá ê uē, siú Guá ê huan-hù, Guá ê bīng-līng, Guá ê lu̍t-lē, Guá ê huat-tō͘.
English: because Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.

Tailo: Hit nî tshit-.gue̍h, sian-ti Hananiah tsiū sí.
English: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.

Tailo: Hit sî, bûn-tô͘ lâi kā Iésu kóng, Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h Lí kóng tsit-ê uē tsin hùn-khài, Lí kám tsai?
English: Then the disciples came, and said to him, Do you know that the Pharisees were offended, when they heard this saying?

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, I huat-tshut I ê kng tī hit tíng-bīn; I koh kā hái-té jia-khàm.
English: Behold, he spreads his light around him. He covers the bottom of the sea.

Tailo: Nā-sī āu-lâi ê tiōng-hu uàn-hūn i, mā siá lî-hun-su kau i ê tshiú, kiò i lī-khui i ê ke, á-.sī i āu-lâi ê tiōng-hu tshuā i tsò bó͘ tsiū sí,
English: If the latter husband hate her, and write her a bill of divorce, and give it in her hand, and send her out of his house; or if the latter husband die, who took her to be his wife;

Tailo: In-uī tshut ling tsē, i ē-tàng tsia̍h ling-iû; tī kíng lāi só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng lóng ē-tàng tsia̍h ling-iû kah bi̍t.
English: and it shall happen, that because of the abundance of milk which they shall give he shall eat butter: for everyone will eat butter and honey that is left in the midst of the land.

Tailo: Alông sí tī Hol suaⁿ ê sî, tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p saⁿ huè.
English: Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died in Mount Hor.

Tailo: Sio̍k lāi-īⁿ jī-tsa̍p tiú ê tuì-bīn, koh sio̍k guā-īⁿ pho͘ tsio̍h tē ê tuì-bīn, ū lâu ê lông tuì lâu ê lông, saⁿ tsàn.
English: Over against the twenty cubits which belonged to the inner court, and over against the pavement which belonged to the outer court, was gallery against gallery in the third story.

Tailo: I ìn guá kóng, Tse sī Siōngtsú huan-hù Tso-lô-ba-bel ê uē. Kóng, ' M̄-sī īng kuân-sè, m̄-sī īng lîng-li̍k, to̍h-sī īng Guá ê Sìng Sîn. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê. '
English: Then he answered and spoke to me, saying, This is the word of Yahweh to Zerubbabel, saying, Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit,' says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: In thâi tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng, tsiū tshuā gín-á kàu Elī ê bīn-tsîng.
English: They killed the bull, and brought the child to Eli.

Tailo: thang hō͘ lín suh i ê an-uì ê ling-thâu lâi tit-tio̍h pá, hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h i hong-sīng ê îng-kng, lâi muá-sim huann-hí.
English: that you may suck and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolations; that you may milk out, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Lēbī lâng tsiàu tsó͘-tsong ê tsi-tso̍k, bô sǹg tsāi-lāi.
English: But the Levites after the tribe of their fathers were not numbered among them.

Tailo: Guá khuànn, Iôtah ông ê ông-kiong tshin-tshiūnn Le-ba-nòng ê bué-liu; tsóng-.sī, Guá it-tīng beh hō͘ i piàn-tsò khòng-iá, tsiâⁿ-tsò bô lâng tuà ê siâⁿ.
English: For thus says Yahweh concerning the house of the king of Judah: You are Gilead to me, and the head of Lebanon; yet surely I will make you a wilderness, and cities which are not inhabited.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ Guá tuì lí só͘ kóng ê uē, lí m̄-thang puē-gi̍k, tshin-tshiūnn hit-ê puē-gi̍k ê ke, lí tio̍h khui tshuì, tsia̍h Guá só͘ hō͘ lí ê.
English: But you, son of man, hear what I tell you; don't be you rebellious like that rebellious house: open your mouth, and eat that which I give you.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī guá kin-á-ji̍t bīng-līng lí tio̍h thiàⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, kiânn I ê tō-lō͘, siú I ê kài-bīng, lu̍t-lē, huat-tō͘, hō͘ lí thang ua̍h-.leh, ke-thinn lâng-gia̍h, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tsiū ē tī lí só͘ beh ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap ê tē, kā lí sù-hok.
English: in that I command you this day to love Yahweh your God, to walk in his ways, and to keep his commandments and his statutes and his ordinances, that you may live and multiply, and that Yahweh your God may bless you in the land where you go in to possess it.

Tailo: Siōngtè koh kóng, ' Guá beh sím-phuàⁿ hit-ê hō͘ in tsò lô͘-lē ê kok-ka. Āu-lâi, guá ē hō͘ in tshut-.lâi, tī tsit-ê só͘-tsāi kìng-pài guá. ' ( tsù, CSK 15:14 )
English: I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage,' said God, and after that will they come out, and serve me in this place.'

Tailo: Lín ē tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, mā ē kóng, Tī Isulael kíng-kài ê guā-bīn, Siōngtsú beh tsò tuā!
English: Your eyes will see, and you will say, Yahweh is greateven beyond the border of Israel!

Tailo: In-uī lí tī àm-tiong tsiàu án-ne kiânn, tsóng-.sī, Guá beh tī tshing-thian pi̍k-ji̍t, tī Isulael jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng, kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì. '
English: For you did it secretly, but I will do this thing before all Israel, and before the sun.'

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán ê Siōngtè ah, taⁿ kiû Lí thiaⁿ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê kî-tó khún-kiû, koh in-uī Tsú ê iân-kò͘, hō͘ Lí ê bīn ê kng tsiò tī Lí pha-hng ê sìng-só͘.
English: Now therefore, our God, listen to the prayer of your servant, and to his petitions, and cause your face to shine on your sanctuary that is desolate, for the Lord's sake.

Tailo: kóng: Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ tsì-kuân Siōngtsú ê uē. Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú tuì tuā suaⁿ, sió suaⁿ, tsuí-kau, suaⁿ-kok án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá, Guá beh īng to-kiàm lîm-kàu lín, mā beh huí-bia̍t lín ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ.
English: and say, You mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord Yahweh: Thus says the Lord Yahweh to the mountains and to the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys: Behold, I, even I, will bring a sword on you, and I will destroy your high places.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kah Alông, tio̍h thuân-līng hō͘ Isulael lâng kah Aigi̍p ông Huâ-láu, thang tshuā Isulael lâng tshut Aigi̍p tē.
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, and gave them a charge to the children of Israel, and to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kò͘-siú Iésu ê lâng kā I hì-lāng, koh kā I piⁿ-phah.
English: The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him.

Tailo: I sī kìng-khiân ê lâng kah tsuân ke lóng kìng-uì Siōngtè, tsín-tsè tsin tsē sàn-tshiah ê Iô-tá-iah lâng, koh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tuì Siōngtè kî-tó.
English: a devout man, and one who feared God with all his house, who gave gifts for the needy generously to the people, and always prayed to God.

Tailo: Kàu hit ji̍t, Iâkop ê îng-kng ē sue-lám, i ê puî sing-khu ē siau-sán.
English: It will happen in that day that the glory of Jacob will be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh will become lean.

Tailo: Guá beh tshun Guá ê tshiú kā in kong-kik, hō͘ in tuà ê só͘-tsāi pha-hng, hi-bî, tuì khòng-iá kàu Ti-bu-la̍h, in to̍h ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: I will stretch out my hand on them, and make the land desolate and waste, from the wilderness toward Diblah, throughout all their habitations: and they shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Iô-thàm kóng tsit-ê tāi-tsì, i tsiū khì khiā tī Ki-lī-sim suaⁿ tíng, tuā-siaⁿ huah, kā in kóng, Sīkhiàm lâng, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ guá ê uē, hō͘ Siōngtsú mā thiaⁿ lín.
English: When they told it to Jotham, he went and stood on the top of Mount Gerizim, and lifted up his voice, and cried, and said to them, Listen to me, you men of Shechem, that God may listen to you.

Tailo: Guán thâu-khak tíng ê bián-liû ka-la̍uh, guán ū tsai-hō ah! In-uī guán ū huān tsuē.
English: The crown is fallen from our head: Woe to us! for we have sinned.

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, Amí-me-li̍k tsiū huan-hù tsìng lâng kóng, Huān-nā kha̍p-tio̍h tsit-ê lâng kah i ê bó͘ ê, tiāⁿ-tio̍h beh kā i tshú-sí.
English: Abimelech charged all the people, saying, He who touches this man or his wife will surely be put to death.

Tailo: In ē tsáu-lâi tsáu-khì tshuē tsia̍h-mi̍h, nā bô tsia̍h pá, tsiū kui mê thìng-hāu.
English: They shall wander up and down for food, And wait all night if they aren't satisfied.

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am ê bó͘ tsiū tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ, khí-sin khì Sī-lô, lâi-kàu Ahiiah ê ke. Ahiiah in-uī nî lāu, ba̍k-tsiu tshâ-tshâ khuànn bē-tio̍h.
English: Jeroboam's wife did so, and arose, and went to Shiloh, and came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.

Tailo: Sàulô khuàⁿ-tio̍h Tabi̍t tsò ê tāi-tsì lóng tsin tsing-thong, put-tsí kiaⁿ i.
English: When Saul saw that he behaved himself very wisely, he stood in awe of him.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū tshun tshiú ǹg thiⁿ, Aigi̍p tsiū tsuân tē-saⁿ ji̍t o͘-o͘ àm-àm.
English: Moses stretched forth his hand toward the sky, and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days.

Tailo: Kha ē kā i thún-ta̍h, to̍h-sī sàn-tshiah lâng ê kha, khùn-khó͘ ê lâng ê kha-pō͘.
English: The foot shall tread it down; Even the feet of the poor, And the steps of the needy.

Tailo: Gī lâng thó-ià pe̍h-tsha̍t uē; pháiⁿ lâng ū tshàu-miâ koh kiàn-siàu.
English: A righteous man hates lies, But a wicked man brings shame and disgrace.

Tailo: Amátsiah koh tuì Amô͘su kóng, Lí tsit-ê sian-kiàn, lí khì, tio̍h tsáu-khì Iôtah tē, tī hia thàn-tsia̍h, tī hia tsò sian-ti.
English: Amaziah also said to Amos, You seer, go, flee away into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there:

Tailo: Lí ê tshiú nā ū kiâⁿ hó ê khuì-la̍t, m̄-thang the-sî, tio̍h the̍h hō͘ su-iàu pang-tsān ê lâng.
English: Don't withhold good from those to whom it is due, When it is in the power of your hand to do it.

Tailo: Abulahàm it-sing ê nî-ji̍t sī tsi̍t-pah tshit-tsa̍p-gō͘ huè.
English: These are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived: one hundred seventy-five years.

Tailo: Hiah-ê síng-tiúⁿ ê siàu-liân lâng tsò thâu tshut-.khì. Bian ha-tat tshe lâng khì thàm-tsa, in tńg-lâi huê-hok kóng, Ū lâng tuì Sa-má-lī-a tshut-.lâi.
English: The young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Ben Hadad sent out, and they told him, saying, There are men come out from Samaria.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Siōngtè só͘ tsō suaⁿ-iá it-tshè ê ua̍h-mi̍h, tsuâ sī siōng káu-khiat ê. Tsuâ tuì tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Siōngtè kám ū-iáⁿ kóng, hn̂g lāi it-tshè ê tshiū, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h?
English: Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, Has God really said, You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?'

Tailo: Lí lo̍h-.khì ê sî, im-kan tsiū uī lí tín-tāng, lâi kā lí gîng-tsiap; koh in-uī lí, kiaⁿ-tōng hiah-ê bat tī sè-kan tsò líng-siù ê im-hûn, mā hō͘ hiah-ê bat tsò lia̍t kok kun-ông ê lâng lóng tuì i ê tsō-uī khiā khí-.lâi.
English: Sheol from beneath has moved for you to meet you at your coming. It stirs up the dead for you, even all the rulers of the earth. It has raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.

Tailo: Be-l ( tsù, Babúlông lâng ê tsi̍t-ê tsú-iáu sîn-bîng ) khut-lo̍h-.khì, Nebó ( tsù, tsi̍t-ê Babúlông lâng ê sîn-bîng, tsiáng-kuán ha̍k-si̍p kah bûn-jī ) phak lo̍h-.khì; in ê ngó͘-siōng tô tī siù kah tsing-seⁿ ê tíng-bīn; lín pîng-sî só͘ kng ê, taⁿ tsiâⁿ-tsò tāng-tàⁿ, hō͘ ià-siān ê tsing-seⁿ teh tsài.
English: Bel bows down, Nebo stoops; their idols are on the animals, and on the livestock: the things that you carried about are made a load, a burden to the weary animal.

Tailo: Kíng-uē ìn kóng, Tsiông kàu taⁿ m̄-bat ū lâng kóng-uē tshin-tshiūnn tsit-ê lâng.
English: The officers answered, No man ever spoke like this man!

Tailo: In kā i kóng, Guán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi lí, tsiah ē-tàng hō͘ hái pîng-tiāⁿ? In-uī hái-íng ná lâi ná tuā.
English: Then said they to him, What shall we do to you, that the sea may be calm to us? For the sea grew more and more tempestuous.

Tailo: Hō͘ in ê kiáⁿ-sun sí tī lia̍t kok ê tiong-kan, sì-suàⁿ tī ta̍k só͘-tsāi.
English: That he would overthrow their seed among the nations, And scatter them in the lands.

Tailo: Lín bô-lūn ji̍p-khì tó tsi̍t king tshù, tio̍h tuà tī hia, mā tio̍h tuì hia tshut-huat.
English: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì guá án-ne kóng, Lí khì khiā tī tsìng lâng ê mn̂g, to̍h-sī Iôtah lia̍t ông tuì hia ji̍p, tuì hia tshut ê, koh khiā tī Êlúsalèm tsiah-ê mn̂g,
English: Thus said Yahweh to me: Go, and stand in the gate of the children of the people, through which the kings of Judah come in, and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;

Tailo: Lú-tsú ji̍p-khì kìnn ông sī tsit khuán: Tuì lú-īⁿ kàu ông-kiong ê sî, kiàn-nā i só͘ ài ê mi̍h lóng hō͘ i, i suà tuà-.khì.
English: then in this wise came the maiden to the king: whatever she desired was given her to go with her out of the house of the women to the king's house.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā o͘-lîng kah thô͘-bîng hē tī phuàⁿ-kuat ê pó͘-kuà lāi; Alông kàu Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng ê sî, hiah-ê tio̍h tī i ê hing tsîng. Alông tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kā Isulael ê phuàⁿ-kuat khuà tī hing tsîng.
English: You shall put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be on Aaron's heart, when he goes in before Yahweh: and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel on his heart before Yahweh continually.

Tailo: Guá beh kám-siā Lí, in-uī guá siū tsō sī kî-biāu koh thang kiaⁿ; Lí ê tsok-uî kî-biāu, Lí tshim-tshim jīn-bat guá.
English: I will give thanks to you, For I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Your works are wonderful. My soul knows that very well.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuì Isulael tsuân huē-tsiòng kóng, Lín nā lia̍h-tsò hó, koh sī tshut tī Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè ê ì-sù, taⁿ lán tsiū tshe lâng piàn kiâⁿ Isulael tsuân tē, kiàn-nā lán hiah-ê iáu tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê hiann-tī kah tuà tī ū kau-iá ê siâⁿ ê tsè-si Lēbī lâng, hō͘ in lóng tsū-tsi̍p lâi lán tsia.
English: David said to all the assembly of Israel, If it seem good to you, and if it be of Yahweh our God, let us send abroad everywhere to our brothers who are left in all the land of Israel, with whom the priests and Levites are in their cities that have suburbs, that they may gather themselves to us;

Tailo: Ìn kóng, ' Kaⁿ-ná-iû tsi̍t-pah tháng. ' Kuán-ke kā i kóng, ' Tse sī lí ê siàu-tuann, kín tsē lo̍h-.lâi, kā i kái-tsò gō͘-tsa̍p tháng. '
English: He said, A hundred batos of oil.' He said to him, Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.'

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, tuì tshut-sì tsiū nńg-kha, ta̍k ji̍t hō͘ lâng kng lâi hē tī sìng-tiān ê mn̂g, to̍h-sī hit-ê kiò-tsò Suí mn̂g ê, tī hia beh hiòng ji̍p tiān ê lâng kiû-khit.
English: A certain man who was lame from his mother's womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple.

Tailo: Isulael ê tsú-bîn, tio̍h thiaⁿ tsit-ê uē, to̍h-sī guá kóng-tio̍h lín só͘ tsò ê ai-ko:
English: Listen to this word which I take up for a lamentation over you, O house of Israel.

Tailo: Lí beh khí-lâi liân-bín Si-óng, in-uī hiān-tsāi sī khó-liân i ê sî, tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê ji̍t-tsí í-king kàu à.
English: You will arise and have mercy on Zion; For it is time to have pity on her. Yes, the set time has come.

Tailo: Guá tshuā lín ji̍p-khì Isulael tē, to̍h-sī Guá gia̍h-khí Guá ê tshiú, kóng beh siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín tsó͘-sian ê tē, hit sî lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: You shall know that I am Yahweh, when I shall bring you into the land of Israel, into the country which I swore to give to your fathers.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ē kì-tit Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Mô͘se ê lu̍t-huat, to̍h-sī Guá tī Ho-lep uī-tio̍h Isulael jîn-bîn só͘ huan-hù i ê, to̍h-sī lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘.
English: Remember the law of Moses my servant, which I commanded to him in Horeb for all Israel, even statutes and ordinances.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tiān khí kàu hó-sè, tsiū īng pik-hiuⁿ tshâ ê ênn, pik-hiuⁿ tshâ ê pán, jia-khàm tiān.
English: So he built the house, and finished it; and he covered the house with beams and planks of cedar.

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ kûn-tsiòng huann-hí, tsiū pàng Bala̍h-ba hō͘ in. I koh bīng-līng lâng piⁿ-phah Iésu. Jiânāu kā Iésu kau hō͘ in khì tìng si̍p-jī-kè.
English: Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified.

Tailo: Lâi, lán tio̍h ǹg Siōngtsú tshiùⁿ kua! Ǹg kiù lán ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshut huann-hí ê siann!
English: Oh come, let's sing to Yahweh. Let's shout aloud to the rock of our salvation!

Tailo: In huí-huāi guá ê lō͘, ke-thinn guá ê huān-lān, mā bô lâng tsó͘-tòng in lâi pang-tsān guá.
English: They mar my path, They set forward my calamity, Without anyone's help.

Tailo: In kiò tsi̍t-kuá ké tsìng-jîn lâi, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng kóng-uē put-sî teh kong-kik tsit-ê sìng-tiān kah Mô͘se ê lu̍t-huat.
English: and set up false witnesses who said, This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law.

Tailo: Τio̍h tsiàu in só͘ beh kà-sī lí huat-tō͘ ê tsong-tsí, mā tio̍h tsiàu in só͘ kā lí kóng ê phuàⁿ-tuàn lâi kiâⁿ; in só͘ tsí-sī lí ê phuàⁿ-sû, lí m̄-thang phian tsó á-.sī phian iū.
English: according to the tenor of the law which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment which they shall tell you, you shall do; you shall not turn aside from the sentence which they shall show you, to the right hand, nor to the left.

Tailo: Īng uánn lim tsiú, īng siōng hó ê iû buah ka-kī, tsóng-.sī, bô uī Iôséhuh ê pāi-huāi tam-iu.
English: Who drink wine in bowls, And anoint themselves with the best oils; But they are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng kóng, Tsit-ê sī sian-ti Iésu, Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê Na-tsa-lia̍t lâng.
English: The multitudes said, This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.

Tailo: Jiânāu thiⁿ-sài kā guá kóng, Lí tio̍h siá lo̍h-.lâi, siū iau-tshiáⁿ lâi hù iûⁿ-ko hun-iàn ê lâng, tsin ū hok-khì. I koh kā guá kóng, Tse sī Siōngtè tsin-si̍t ê uē.
English: He said to me, Write, Blessed are those who are invited to the marriage supper of the Lamb.' He said to me, These are true words of God.

Tailo: Tì-huī lâng ê uē tshin-tshiūnn tshì, in pian-tsi̍p ê gí-lio̍k tshin-tshiūnn tìng-tiâu ê ting, lóng sī tuì tsi̍t-ê bo̍k-tsiá só͘ sù ê.
English: The words of the wise are like goads; and like nails well fastened are words from the masters of assemblies, which are given from one shepherd.

Tailo: Náthan tuì ông kóng, Kiàn-nā lí ê sim só͘ siūⁿ ê lóng thang khì tsò, in-uī Siōngtsú kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: Nathan said to the king, Go, do all that is in your heart; for Yahweh is with you.

Tailo: Ι bô siūⁿ-tio̍h kha ē lap-tio̍h, iá-siù ē ta̍h-tio̍h.
English: And forgets that the foot may crush them, Or that the wild animal may trample them.

Tailo: Lín só͘-ū siū I tshòng-tsō ê, tī I só͘ kuán-lí ê ta̍k uī, lóng tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú! Guá ê sim-sîn ah, lí tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú!
English: Praise Yahweh, all you works of his, In all places of his dominion. Praise Yahweh, my soul.

Tailo: Guá him-bō͘ Lí kà-sī ê uē; kiû Lí tī Lí ê kong-gī hō͘ guá lâi ua̍h!
English: Behold, I long for your precepts! Revive me in your righteousness. WAW

Tailo: Iô-há-neh tuì tsin tsē lâi beh niá siū sé-lé ê lâng kóng, Lín tsiah-ê to̍k-tsuâ, siáⁿ lâng kíng-kò lín siám-phiah Siōngtè teh beh huat ê siū-khì?
English: He said therefore to the multitudes who went out to be baptized by him, You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

Tailo: ( Hit-ê tē mā sǹg-tsò sī Le-hua-im lâng ê tē, tsá-tsîng Le-hua-im lâng tuà tī hia, Ammóng lâng tshing in tsò Sàn-sòng-bîng.
English: ( That also is accounted a land of Rephaim: Rephaim lived therein before; but the Ammonites call them Zamzummim,

Tailo: Guá tuì lín ê kiáⁿ-jî tiong-kan hing-khí sian-ti, koh tuì lín ê siàu-liân lâng ê tiong-kan hing-khí hiàn-sin-tsiá ( Tsù, guân i̍k-pún im-i̍k tsò Na-tsil lâng ) . Isulael lâng, lín kám m̄-sī án-ne? Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: I raised up some of your sons for prophets, And some of your young men for Nazirites. Isn't this true, You children of Israel? says Yahweh.

Tailo: I ē hō͘ Isulael kiáⁿ-sun tsin tsē lâng ua̍t tńg-lâi kui-ǹg Tsú, to̍h-sī in ê Siōngtè.
English: He will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord, their God.

Tailo: Hit tíng-bīn īng kî-khiáu ê kang-hu só͘ tsit ê tuà, só͘ īng lâi hâ ê kah tsè-si ho̍k sio-siâng ê tsò-huat kah i liân tsò tsi̍t tè, īng kim kah nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu kah kuè-pháng ê iù-tē lâi tsò, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê.
English: The skillfully woven band that was on it, with which to fasten it on, was of the same piece, like its work; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê uē tàu-té sī siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-sù? Ì-sù to̍h-sī, Siōngtè ê uē tī lí ê sin piⁿ, tī lí ê tshuì-.ni̍h, tī lí ê sim-lāi. Tse to̍h-sī guán só͘ thuân ê sìn ê tō-lí.
English: But what does it say? The word is near you, in your mouth, and in your heart; that is, the word of faith, which we preach:

Tailo: M̄-thang tsik-pī lāu lâng, tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn khó͘-khǹg lāu-pē án-ne kā i khuàn-bián; tuì siàu-liân lâng khuàn-bián mā tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn khó͘-khǹg ka-kī ê hiann-tī;
English: Don't rebuke an older man, but exhort him as a father; the younger men as brothers;

Tailo: Tio̍h put-tuān tsuan-sim kî-tó, kî-tó ê sî tio̍h kíng-síng, tio̍h kám-siā Siōngtè.
English: Continue steadfastly in prayer, watching therein with thanksgiving;

Tailo: Guá tsō kng, mā tshòng-tsō àm; Guá tsō pîng-an, mā tshòng-tsō tsai-hō; tsiah-ê lóng sī Guá — Siōngtsú só͘ tsò ê.
English: I form the light, and create darkness; I make peace, and create evil. I am Yahweh, who does all these things.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā phah-sí-lâng ê, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: He who strikes any man mortally shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: Lí ê hiann-tī nā ū tik-tsuē lí, tio̍h khì tshuē i. Kan-taⁿ lí kah i tī-.leh ê sî, tsí-bîng i ê m̄-tio̍h. I nā beh thiaⁿ lí ê uē, tsiū ē huê-ho̍k lín ê hiann-tī kuan-hē.
English: If your brother sins against you, go, show him his fault between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained back your brother.

Tailo: Suà-tsiap i ê sī Hatkotsuh ê sun, Ulīa ê kiáⁿ Melemo͘t siu-lí. Suà-tsiap i ê sī Bí-sī-sat-pia̍t ê sun, Belékiah ê kiáⁿ Mesiulám siu-lí. Suà-tsiap i ê sī Banah ê kiáⁿ Tsa-tok siu-lí.
English: Next to them repaired Meremoth the son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz. Next to them repaired Meshullam the son of Berechiah, the son of Meshezabel. Next to them repaired Zadok the son of Baana.

Tailo: Iésu kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu, koh kā in kóng, Lán ê pîng-iú La̍h-tsa-lō͘ teh khùn, guá beh lâi-khì kā i kiò-tshéⁿ.
English: He said these things, and after that, he said to them, Our friend, Lazarus, has fallen asleep, but I am going so that I may awake him out of sleep.

Tailo: M̄-thang īng lâng ê tsio̍h-bō á-.sī tsio̍h-bō ê tíng-tún tsò tsún-tǹg, in-uī tse sī īng lâng ê sèⁿ-miā tsò tsún-tǹg.
English: No man shall take the mill or the upper millstone to pledge; for he takes a man's life to pledge.

Tailo: Kā lí ê kám bô hut-jiân khí-.lâi, kiáu-jiáu lí ê kám bô tshénn khí-.lâi, lí tsiū ē tsò in só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h?
English: Won't your debtors rise up suddenly, and wake up those who make you tremble, and you will be their victim?

Tailo: In bô kè-sio̍k kah tsò thâu ê Ki-tok kiat-liân. Tsuân sing-khu tio̍h tuì tsit-ê thâu tit-tio̍h îng-ióng, tsiah-ê tsat kah kin tio̍h kiat-liân khí-.lâi, tsiàu Siōngtè ê tsí-ì lâi tióng-sîng.
English: and not holding firmly to the Head, from whom all the body, being supplied and knit together through the joints and ligaments, grows with God's growth.

Tailo: Lín mā tio̍h án-ne lâi huann-hí kah guá tsò-hué huann-hí.
English: In the same way, you also rejoice, and rejoice with me.

Tailo: In mn̄g kóng, Tshut-sì beh tsò Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông ê âng-enn-á tī tó-uī? In-uī guán tī tang-hong ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h I ê tsheⁿ tshut-hiān, só͘-í, guán beh lâi pài I.
English: Where is he who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him.

Tailo: Iésu kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, the̍h piáⁿ pun hō͘ in, hî mā sī án-ne pun hō͘ in.
English: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang hō͘ ta̍k-khuán kî-ī ê kàu-gī tshuā bê-lō͘ khì, in-uī sim-sîn khah hó sī khò Siōngtè ê un-tián lâi kian-kò͘; m̄-thang khò hiah-ê tsia̍h-mi̍h kui-kú, in-uī tsun-siú tsia̍h-mi̍h kui-kú ê lâng pīng bô tit-tio̍h lī-ik.
English: Don't be carried away by various and strange teachings, for it is good that the heart be established by grace, not by food, through which those who were so occupied were not benefited.

Tailo: M̄-sī tshing-ho͘ Guá ' Tsú ah, Tsú ah'ê lâng lóng ē-tàng ji̍p-khì thian-kok; kan-taⁿ si̍t-hiān Guá ê Thiⁿ-pē tsí-ì ê lâng, tsiah ē-tàng ji̍p-.khì.
English: Not everyone who says to me, Lord, Lord,' will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven; but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

Tailo: M̄-kam īng tshê-á kuán-kà kiáⁿ-jî ê lâng si̍t-tsāi bô teh thiàⁿ kiáⁿ; nā-sī thiàⁿ kiánn, tsiū ē tsiàu-sî tsik-tok.
English: One who spares the rod hates his son, But one who loves him is careful to discipline him.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tsiū mn̄g Iésu kóng, Guán í-king pàng-sak it-tshè lâi tuè Lí, án-ne guán ē tit-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Then Peter answered, Behold, we have left everything, and followed you. What then will we have?

Tailo: Iôtah ông E-hō͘-iá-kin siū lia̍h liáu-āu tē-saⁿ-tsa̍p tshit nî, Babúlông ông E-bil-me-lo-tak guân nî, tsa̍p-jī-gue̍h jī-tsa̍p tshit, kí-khí Iôtah ông E-hō͘-iá-kin, pàng i tshut kaⁿ;
English: It happened in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, that Evilmerodach king of Babylon, in the year that he began to reign, did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;

Tailo: Ū kuí-nā-ê bûn-tô͘ hō͘-siong kóng, I kā lán kóng, ' Koh bô guā kú, lín tsiū bē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, koh-tsài bô guā kú, lín tsiū ē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá. ', koh kóng, ' In-uī guá teh beh tńg-khì Thiⁿ-pē hia. ' Tsiah-ê uē sī siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-sù?
English: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, What is this that he says to us, A little while, and you won't see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;' and, Because I go to the Father?'

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê sī Iésu só͘ thiàⁿ ê, i tsē tī Iésu ê sin piⁿ.
English: One of his disciples, whom Jesus loved, was at the table, leaning against Jesus' breast.

Tailo: Mô͘se bīng-līng in kóng, Muí tshit nî ê lō͘-bué, to̍h-sī tī tháu-pàng ê nî tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê kî, Tuà-pêⁿ-tseh ê sî,
English: Moses commanded them, saying, At the end of every seven years, in the set time of the year of release, in the feast of tents,

Tailo: I ê bah pí gín-á ê bah khah iù-nńg; i ē huê-ho̍k siàu-liân ê ji̍t-tsí.
English: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's; He returns to the days of his youth.

Tailo: Gī lâng tsin tshing-tshó pháiⁿ lâng ê ke, tsai-iáⁿ pháiⁿ lâng ē tshia-tó tì-kàu bia̍t-bô.
English: The Righteous One considers the house of the wicked, And brings the wicked to ruin.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá kah Lí piān-lūn ê sî, Lí sī kong-gī; tsóng-.sī, guá iáu ài kah Lí lí-lūn; pháiⁿ lâng ê lō͘ ná ē hing-thong? Tuā kiânn kuí-tsà ê ná ē tit-tio̍h pîng-an?
English: Righteous are you, Yahweh, when I contend with you; yet would I reason the cause with you: why does the way of the wicked prosper? why are all they at ease who deal very treacherously?

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó; Iâkop ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Yahweh, God of Armies, hear my prayer. Listen, God of Jacob. Selah.

Tailo: Lí só͘ tio̍h hiàn tī tuâⁿ-.ni̍h ê, to̍h-sī bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-á nn̄g tsiah, ta̍k ji̍t tio̍h hiàn.
English: Now this is that which you shall offer on the altar: two lambs a year old day by day continually.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kah tuè i ê lâng tsha-put-to ū la̍k pah, tsiū tuì Keilah tshut-huat, khì in só͘ beh khì ê só͘-tsāi. Ū lâng kā Sàulô kóng, Tabi̍t í-king tuì Keilah tô-tsáu. Sàulô tsiū bô tshut-.khì.
English: Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went wherever they could go. It was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he gave up going there.

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah tuì To-hu-teh, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú tshe i khì thuân bīng-līng ê só͘-tsāi, tò tńg-.lâi, khiā tī Siōngtsú ê tiān ê īⁿ lāi, tuì kûn-tsiòng kóng,
English: Then came Jeremiah from Topheth, where Yahweh had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of Yahweh's house, and said to all the people:

Tailo: Tsheⁿ ē tuì thinn-tíng lak lo̍h-.lâi, thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng ē iô-tāng.
English: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.

Tailo: In tú siūⁿ beh thâi Páulô ê sî, ū siau-sit thuân kàu Lô-má kun-tuī ê iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, kóng tsuân Êlúsalèm teh khí jiáu-luān.
English: As they were trying to kill him, news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ê tuā-hiaⁿ Elíap thiaⁿ-tio̍h i kah lâng teh kóng uē, Elíap tuì Tabi̍t siū-khì, kóng, Lí ná ē lo̍h-lâi tsia? Hit kuí tsiah iûⁿ tī khòng-iá-.ni̍h, lí pàng kau hō͘ siáⁿ lâng? Guá tsai lí kiau-ngō͘ kah lí sim-lāi ê pháiⁿ, lí lo̍h-lâi tsí-put-kò sī beh khuànn kau-tsiàn!
English: Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab's anger was kindled against David, and he said, Why are you come down? and with whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride, and the naughtiness of your heart; for you have come down that you might see the battle.

Tailo: Kî-tiong ū Hu-mé-nái kah A-li̍k-san-toh; guá í-king kā in kau hō͘ Satán, hō͘ in siū kíng-kài, bē koh huí-pòng, siat-to̍k Siōngtè.
English: of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I delivered to Satan, that they might be taught not to blaspheme.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ Só͘lômóng iáu-koh sè-hàn koh nńg-tsiáⁿ, beh kā Siōngtsú khí ê tiān tio̍h tsin suí kàu-ki̍k, hō͘ I ê miâ-siaⁿ îng-kng kàu tī bān-kok, só͘-í, guá taⁿ tio̍h kā i tsún-pī. Tabi̍t tsiū tī iáu-buē sí ê tsìn-tsîng, tsún-pī tsin tsē tsâi-liāu.
English: David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be built for Yahweh must be exceedingly magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.

Tailo: Tsuē-ok tī i ê tshuì suî-jiân tinn, suî-jiân i khǹg tī i ê tsi̍h hē;
English: Though wickedness is sweet in his mouth, Though he hide it under his tongue,

Tailo: I siū khuànn-khin, hō͘ lâng pàng-sak, i siū tsin tsē thòng-khó͘, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tú-tio̍h iu-būn; i siū khuànn-khin, tshin-tshiūnn lâng am bīn m̄-khuàⁿ i; lán mā bô tsun-tiōng i.
English: He was despised, and rejected by men; a man of suffering, and acquainted with disease: and as one from whom men hide their face he was despised; and we didn't respect him.

Tailo: I tuì hia suá kàu Bethel tang pîng ê suaⁿ, tī hia tah pò͘-pêⁿ; sai pîng sī Bethel, tang pîng sī Ai siânn. I tī hia uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, kiû-kiò Siōngtsú ê miâ.
English: He left from there to the mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to Yahweh and called on the name of Yahweh.

Tailo: I tī tsit niá tiùⁿ tsò gō͘-tsa̍p-ê liú-phàn, koh tī tē-jī niá tiùⁿ sio-liân ê piⁿ-á, mā tsò gō͘-tsa̍p-ê liú-phàn, liú-phàn lóng sī nn̄g-ê nn̄g-ê sio-tuì.
English: He made fifty loops in the one curtain, and he made fifty loops in the edge of the curtain that was in the second coupling. The loops were opposite one to another.

Tailo: M̄-thang uàn-hūn Etóm lâng, in-uī i sī lí ê hiann-tī. M̄-thang uàn-hūn Aigi̍p lâng, in-uī lín bat tshut-guā tī hia.
English: You shall not abhor an Edomite; for he is your brother: you shall not abhor an Egyptian, because you lived as a foreigner in his land.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê tuā-tsè-si ê lô͘-po̍k, sī hō͘ Piattò͘ siah hīnn-á hit-ê lâng ê tshin-tsiâⁿ, kóng, Guá kám m̄ sī ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí kah I tī hn̂g lāi?
English: One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, said, Didn't I see you in the garden with him?

Tailo: Atám ê tē tshit tāi sun Ê-no͘k ī-giân tsiah-ê lâng kóng, Lí khuàⁿ! Siōngtè ē tshuā tshing-tshing bān-bān ê sìng thiⁿ-sài lâi,
English: About these also Enoch, the seventh from Adam, prophesied, saying, Behold, the Lord came with ten thousands of his holy ones,

Tailo: tng thàng ke-lō͘ ê mn̂g kuainn-.leh, e bō ê siann sè-sè; tng tsiáu-á tsi̍t-ē háu, lâng tsiū khí-.lâi. Tshiùⁿ kua ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á ê siann mā lóng kàng kē ê sî;
English: And the doors shall be shut in the street; When the sound of the grinding is low, And one shall rise up at the voice of a bird, And all the daughters of music shall be brought low;

Tailo: Lí hō͘ keh-piah kok In-uī guán lâi sio-tseⁿ, guán ê tuì-ti̍k tsò-hué teh tshiò guán.
English: You make us a source of contention to our neighbors. Our enemies laugh among themselves.

Tailo: Só͘-í, sî-ki iáu-buē kàu, lín m̄-thang phue-phîng lâng. Tán kàu Tsú tsài-lîm ê sî, I ē īng kng tsiò o͘-àm ún-ba̍t ê pì-bi̍t, kā ún-tsông tī sim-lāi ê kè-bô͘ hián-lō͘ tshut-.lâi. Hit sî, ta̍k lâng ē tuì Siōngtè tit-tio̍h I ê o-ló.
English: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and reveal the counsels of the hearts. Then each man will get his praise from God.

Tailo: Ông, tsì-kuân Siōngtè bat kā kok-uī, tuā-kuân, îng-iāu kah ui-hong, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê lāu-pē — Nepkatnetsal;
English: You king, the Most High God gave Nebuchadnezzar your father the kingdom, and greatness, and glory, and majesty:

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, sím-phuàⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí nā kàu, So͘tóm só͘ siū ê hîng-hua̍t pí hit-ê siâⁿ só͘ siū ê iáu khah hó jím-siū.
English: I tell you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h sǹg Kelsióng kiáⁿ-sun ê tsóng-gia̍h, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k kah ke-kháu,
English: Take a census of the sons of Gershon also, by their fathers' houses, by their families;

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng king-îng ē tit-tio̍h hi-ké ê kang-tsînn; iā gī ê tsíng-tsí ê ē tit-tio̍h si̍t-tsāi ê pò-siúⁿ.
English: Wicked people earn deceitful wages, But one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.

Tailo: Khùn-khó͘ sàn-tshiah ê tshiàⁿ-kang lâng, bô-lūn sī lí ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tshut-guā lâng tuà tī lí ê tē, tī lí ê siâⁿ mn̂g lāi ê, lí m̄-thang kā i khi-hū.
English: You shall not oppress a hired servant who is poor and needy, whether he be of your brothers, or of your foreigners who are in your land within your gates:

Tailo: Kiû Lí tshuā guá tshut kaⁿ, guá tsiū thang o-ló Lí ê miâ; gī lâng ē uî tī guá ê sin piⁿ, in-uī Lí īng un-tián khuán-thāi guá.
English: Bring my soul out of prison, That I may give thanks to your name. The righteous will surround me, For you will be good to me.

Tailo: I ê tiōng-hu khí-.lâi, tshōa tsi̍t-ê lô͘-po̍k kah khan nn̄g tsiah lî khì jiok i, beh īng hó uē kā i an-uì, lâi tshuā i tńg-.lâi. I ji̍p-khì i ê lāu-pē ê tshù, tsa-bó͘ lâng ê lāu-pē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kā i huan-gîng.
English: Her husband arose, and went after her, to speak kindly to her, to bring her again, having his servant with him, and a couple of donkeys: and she brought him into her father's house; and when the father of the young lady saw him, he rejoiced to meet him.

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh tsū-tsi̍p Isulael tiong só͘ kíng ê saⁿ bān lâng.
English: David again gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú tuì I ê tsú-bîn huat-tshut siū-khì, thó-ià I ê sán-gia̍p — Isulael.
English: Therefore Yahweh burned with anger against his people. He abhorred his inheritance.

Tailo: Eliiah kā Ahap kóng, Lí taⁿ thang tsiūⁿ-khì lim-tsia̍h, in-uī ū tuā hō͘ ê siann.
English: Elijah said to Ahab, Get you up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.

Tailo: Tio̍h hō͘ Alông kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ lâi-kàu huē-bō͘ ê mn̂g-kháu, īng tsuí kā in sé sing-khu.
English: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the tent of meeting, and shall wash them with water.

Tailo: sūn-ho̍k Guá ê lu̍t-lē, tsip-siú Guá ê huat-tō͘, tsiàu sîng-si̍t tsò tāi-tsì, tse sī gī lâng, it-tīng ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: has walked in my statutes, and has kept my ordinances, to deal truly; he is just, he shall surely live, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kah Iâkop tsò-hué kàu Aigi̍p ê, tû i ê sim-pū í-guā, kiàn-nā tuì i sing-khu só͘ tshut ê, tsóng-kiōng la̍k-tsa̍p-la̍k lâng.
English: All the souls who came with Jacob into Egypt, who were his direct descendants, besides Jacob's sons' wives, all the souls were sixty-six.

Tailo: Kî-tha ê lâng lia̍h i ê lô͘-po̍k lâi lîng-jio̍k, kā in thâi-sí.
English: and the rest grabbed his servants, and treated them shamefully, and killed them.

Tailo: Koh hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, kā lín sio̍k-tsuē.
English: one male goat, to make atonement for you.

Tailo: Sam-pán siu khí-lâi tsûn tíng liáu-āu, tsiū īng hong-huat khún-pa̍k tsûn-té. In-uī in khióng-kiaⁿ tsûn ē tī Sul-tí-suh ê sua-tsiu khò-tshián, tsiū kā phâng kàng-lo̍h, tshut-tsāi tsûn khì phiau-liû.
English: After they had hoisted it up, they used cables to help reinforce the ship. Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars, they lowered the sea anchor, and so were driven along.

Tailo: Tshiū-nâ lāi tshut-.lâi ê suaⁿ ti kā i tsau-that; khòng-iá ê tsáu-siù lâi kā i tsia̍h.
English: The boar out of the wood ravages it. The wild animals of the field feed on it.

Tailo: Abulahàm tsiū phak teh tshiò, sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, Tsi̍t pah huè ê lâng kám iáu ē seⁿ kiáⁿ? Sala̍h í-king káu-tsa̍p huè ā, kám iáu ē seⁿ kiáⁿ?
English: Then Abraham fell on his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, Will a child be born to him who is one hundred years old? Will Sarah, who is ninety years old, give birth?

Tailo: I sī Siōngtè tsiah-ê kang-tsok ê tē-it; tshòng-tsō i ê ē īng to tshin-kīn i.
English: He is the chief of the ways of God. He who made him gives him his sword.

Tailo: Nā beh kah I piān-lūn, tshing hāng mā bē ìn I tsi̍t hāng.
English: If he is pleased to contend with him, He can't answer him one time in a thousand.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iô-há-neh iáu-buē hō͘ lâng kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ.
English: For John was not yet thrown into prison.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú, in-uī Siōngtsú sī hó; tio̍h tshiùⁿ kua o-ló I ê miâ, in-uī tse sī tsin kî-biāu.
English: Praise Yah, for Yahweh is good. Sing praises to his name, for that is pleasant.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, lán ê liông-sim nā bô kā lán tsik-pī, lán tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, tsiū thang an-jiân tsū-tsāi.
English: Beloved, if our hearts don't condemn us, we have boldness toward God;

Tailo: in nā tī siū lia̍h-.khì ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī tuì-ti̍k lia̍h in khì ê só͘-tsāi, tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng kui-ho̍k Lí, koh ǹg pún-tē, to̍h-sī Lí siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in tsó͘-sian ê tē kah Lí só͘ kíng ê siâⁿ, í-ki̍p guá uī-tio̍h Lí ê miâ só͘ khí ê tiān, lâi tuì Lí kî-tó,
English: if they return to you with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their enemies, who carried them captive, and pray to you toward their land, which you gave to their fathers, the city which you have chosen, and the house which I have built for your name:

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, tse to̍h-sī i ê lō͘ ê khuài-lo̍k, í-āu ē ū pa̍t-ê tuì tē-.ni̍h seⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: Behold, this is the joy of his way: Out of the earth shall others spring.

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah iáu kuainn tī khu-liû-só͘ īⁿ lāi ê sî, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu i, kóng,
English: Now the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah, while he was shut up in the court of the guard, saying,

Tailo: Guá kî-tó ê uē kóng iáu-buē uân, guá khí-thâu tī ī-siōng tiong só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng — Ga-bu-li-el, hōng bīng-līng kuáⁿ-kín pue-.lâi, tsha-put-to tī hiàn ê-hng-tsè ê sî, lâi bong guá.
English: yes, while I was speaking in prayer, the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the vision at the beginning, being caused to fly swiftly, touched me about the time of the evening offering.

Tailo: Guá beh khiā tsiú-keⁿ lâu, khiā tī iâⁿ-tsē kuan-khuàⁿ, khuànn I tuì guá kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē, guá thang īng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē lâi piān-kái tshing-tshó.
English: I will stand at my watch, and set myself on the ramparts, and will look out to see what he will say to me, and what I will answer concerning my complaint.

Tailo: Jiânāu, Iésu the̍h piáⁿ tsiok-siā liáu-āu, peh-khui, the̍h hō͘ in, kóng, Tsit-ê sī guá ê sing-khu, uī-tio̍h lín lâi hiàn ê, lín tio̍h án-ne tsò, lâi kì-liām guá.
English: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it, and gave to them, saying, This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.

Tailo: Lí kám m̄-sī īng lî-pa kā i uî-.leh, koh uî i ê ke kah i sì-kho͘-uî it-tshè só͘-ū ê? I ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê, Lí kā i sù-hok, i ê ka-gia̍p tī tē-.ni̍h mā ke-thinn tsin tsē.
English: Haven't you made a hedge around him, and around his house, and around all that he has, on every side? You have blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land.

Tailo: I tsik-pī hái hō͘ i ta, mā hō͘ tsiah-ê hô lóng bô tsuí. Basiáng kah Kal-mel sue-pāi, Le-ba-nòng ê hue-ba̍k mā sue-pāi.
English: He rebukes the sea, and makes it dry, and dries up all the rivers. Bashan languishes, and Carmel; and the flower of Lebanon languishes.

Tailo: Hit sî, tú-tio̍h un-i̍k sí ê, ū nn̄g-bān sì-tshing lâng.
English: Those who died by the plague were twenty-four thousand.

Tailo: In-uī I kì-liām I sîn-sìng ê ìng-ín, mā kì-liām I ê lô͘-po̍k — Abulahàm.
English: For he remembered his holy word, And Abraham, his servant.

Tailo: Àm-sî, Siōngtsú tshut-hiān tī Só͘lômóng ê bāng tiong, kā i kóng, Guá í-king thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê kî-tó, mā kíng tsit só͘-tsāi tsò kā Guá hiàn tsè ê tiān.
English: Yahweh appeared to Solomon by night, and said to him, I have heard your prayer, and have chosen this place to myself for a house of sacrifice.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán m̄-thang īng pháiⁿ-sim ok-to̍k ê kū kàⁿ-bó, tio̍h īng sûn-tsuân tsin-si̍t ê bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ tsò tsè-mi̍h lâi siú tseh.
English: Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old yeast, neither with the yeast of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì tsiâⁿ-tsò Ia-lô-ba-am ê ke ê tsuē, tì-sú beh tuì tē-tsiūⁿ kā i tsián-tû, kā i bia̍t-tiāu.
English: This thing became sin to the house of Jeroboam, even to cut it off, and to destroy it from off the surface of the earth.

Tailo: Ki-tok tī si̍p-jī-kè tíng tshin-sin tam-tng lán ê tsuē, hō͘ lán thuat-lī tsuē ê sí-bông, kui-ǹg kong-gī lâi ua̍h. Lín tuì I ê siong-hûn tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: who his own self bore our sins in his body on the tree, that we, having died to sins, might live to righteousness; by whose stripes you were healed.

Tailo: Hit tshit-tsa̍p-jī lâng huaⁿ-huaⁿ hí-hí tńg-.lâi, kóng, Tsú ah, guán hōng Lí ê miâ bīng-līng, siâ-sîn mā lóng khut-ho̍k.
English: The seventy returned with joy, saying, Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kui tī Guá lâi tsò sìng, in-uī Guá sī sìng ê Siōngtsú, tuì bān-bîn ê tiong-kan kā lín hun-pia̍t tshut-.lâi, lâi kui tī Guá.
English: You shall be holy to me: for I, Yahweh, am holy, and have set you apart from the peoples, that you should be mine.

Tailo: I ē tsò tuā-jîn-bu̍t, lâng ē tshing-ho͘ I tsì-kuân Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ. Tsú, Siōngtè ē kā I tsó͘-sian Tabi̍t ê ông-uī siúⁿ-sù I.
English: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father, David,

Tailo: In-uī i ê Siōngtsú īng ha̍p-gî ê huat-tō͘ tsí-sī i, koh kà-sī i.
English: For his God instructs him in right judgement, and teaches him.

Tailo: I án-ne kóng, m̄-sī in-uī i kuan-sim sàn-tshiah lâng, sī in-uī i sī tsha̍t, koh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ thau-the̍h i só͘ kuán-lí ê kong-khuáⁿ.
English: Now he said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the money box, used to steal what was put into it.

Tailo: Tabi̍t mn̄g i kóng, Lí ē tshuā guá kàu hit-ê kun-tuī hia á-bē? I ìn kóng, Lí tio̍h kā guá kí Siōngtsú lâi tsiù-tsuā, bē kā guá thâi-sí, mā bē kā guá kau tī guá ê tsú-lâng ê tshiú, guá tsiū ē tshuā lí lo̍h-khì kàu hit-ê kun-tuī hia.
English: David said to him, Will you bring me down to this troop? He said, Swear to me by God, that you will neither kill me, nor deliver me up into the hands of my master, and I will bring you down to this troop.

Tailo: Abulahàm sī tang-sî-tsūn hō͘ Siōngtè khuàⁿ-tsò sī gī lâng? Sī siū kat-lé í-tsîng á-.sī í-āu? Sī siū kat-lé í-tsîng, m̄-sī í-āu.
English: How then was it counted? When he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

Tailo: Ap-hui-a tsí-muē kah guán ê tsiàn-iú A-khip-pò͘, í-ki̍p tī lín tau teh tsū-huē ê kàu-huē.
English: to the beloved Apphia, to Archippus, our fellow soldier, and to the assembly in your house:

Tailo: I siūⁿ-lâi siūⁿ-khì, kóng, ' Guá bô kàu só͘-tsāi thang tún guá ê ngó͘-kok, taⁿ beh án-tsuáⁿ? '
English: He reasoned within himself, saying, What will I do, because I don't have room to store my crops?'

Tailo: Kî-si̍t hiah-ê khuàⁿ khí-lâi khah nńg-tsiáⁿ ê ki-thé, tian-tò koh khah ū pit-iàu.
English: No, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.

Tailo: Isulael mā lâi-kàu Aigi̍p; Iâkop tshut-guā khì tī Hâm ê tē.
English: Israel also came into Egypt. Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

Tailo: In-uī Isulael bē kì-tit tshòng-tsō in ê Tsú, khí king-biō; Iôtah ke khí kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, Guá beh kàng hué tī i ê siâⁿ, sio in ê iâⁿ-pâng.
English: For Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces; And Judah has multiplied fortified cities; But I will send a fire on his cities, And it will devour its fortresses.

Tailo: sī in-uī Isulael lâng kah Iôtah lâng it-tshè ê siâ-ok, to̍h-sī in kah in ê kun-ông, kuì-tso̍k, tsè-si, sian-ti kah Iôtah ê kûn-tsiòng, í-ki̍p tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn só͘ kiâⁿ ê, lâi jiá Guá siū-khì.
English: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, and the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Kng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī hó, ba̍k-tsiu khuàⁿ-tio̍h kng mā sī thang huann-hí.
English: Truly the light is sweet, And a pleasant thing it is for the eyes to see the sun.

Tailo: Hi-lu̍t ông thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì, sim-lāi put-an, tsuân Êlúsalèm ê lâng mā sī án-ne.
English: When Herod the king heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, Guá beh tshe piàⁿ tsiú ê khì i hia, kā i piàⁿ tshut-.lâi, piàⁿ khang i ê khì-kū, phah-phuà i ê tsiú-àng.
English: Therefore, behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that I will send to him those who pour off, and they shall pour him off; and they shall empty his vessels, and break their bottles in pieces.

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Guá lâi-khì kā i i-tī.
English: Jesus said to him, I will come and heal him.

Tailo: Tuì hia, guán lâi-kàu Hui-li̍p-pué, to̍h-sī Ma-ke-tó-niah hit tē-khu ê thâu tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ, mā sī Lô-má ê si̍t-bîn-tē. Guán tī tsit-ê siâⁿ tuà kuí-nā ji̍t.
English: and from there to Philippi, which is a city of Macedonia, the foremost of the district, a Roman colony. We were staying some days in this city.

Tailo: A-la-puh lâng kah Ketal só͘-ū ê líng-siù lóng tsò lí ê ē-puâⁿ sing-lí, īng iûⁿ-ko, kang ê mî-iûⁿ, suaⁿ-iûⁿ, lâi kah lí kau-i̍k.
English: Arabia, and all the princes of Kedar, they were the merchants of your hand; in lambs, and rams, and goats, in these were they your merchants.

Tailo: Tuì Âng-hái kînn tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī Sìn ê khòng-iá.
English: They traveled from the Red Sea, and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.

Tailo: Iá-lî ū tsháu, kám ē tshut siaⁿ? Gû ū tsháu-liāu, kám ē háu?
English: Does the wild donkey bray when he has grass? Or does the ox low over his fodder?

Tailo: Siat-sú in m̄ tuà kun-khì kah lín kuè-.khì, in tsiū tī Ka-nân tē tuì lín tiong-kan tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p.
English: but if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.

Tailo: I ê tuā-kiáⁿ miâ kiò-tsò Iô-el, tē-jī kiáⁿ miâ kiò-tsò Abiiah; in tī Bel-sí-bah tsò sū-su.
English: Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abijah: they were judges in Beersheba.

Tailo: I ê sī-uē pâng tsit pîng saⁿ king, hit pîng saⁿ king; i ê thiāu kah i ê mn̂g-lông lóng tsiàu thâu tsi̍t-ê mn̂g ê pān; tn̂g gō͘-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p gō͘ tiú.
English: The lodges of it were three on this side and three on that side; and the posts of it and the arches of it were after the measure of the first gate: the length of it was fifty cubits, and the breadth twenty-five cubits.

Tailo: Guá kóng liáu, in tsiū bô koh kóng; guá ê uē tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ tih tī in ê tíng-bīn.
English: After my words they didn't speak again; My speech fell on them.

Tailo: Kò͘-kaⁿ ê lâng tshénn khí-.lâi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h kaⁿ-mn̂g khui-khui, siūⁿ kóng huān-lâng lóng tô-tsáu liáu-liáu, tsiū pue̍h to beh tsū-sat.
English: The jailer, being roused out of sleep and seeing the prison doors open, drew his sword and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng siūⁿ kóng ka-kī sī thuân-káng Siōngtè sìn-sit ê lâng á-.sī sio̍k-lîng ê lâng, i ing-kai tio̍h tsai guá teh siá hō͘ lín ê sī Tsú ê bīng-līng.
English: If any man thinks himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him recognize the things which I write to you, that they are the commandment of the Lord.

Tailo: Guān guá khún-kiû ê uē ta̍t-kàu Lí ê bīn-tsîng, kiû Lí tsiàu Lí ê ìng-ín khan kiù guá.
English: Let my supplication come before you. Deliver me according to your word.

Tailo: Iôtah lâi-kàu-uī, suî-sî kiâⁿ uá khì Iésu hia, kiò tsi̍t-siaⁿ Lāu-su , tsiū ti̍t-ti̍t kā I tsim.
English: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said, Rabbi! Rabbi! and kissed him.

Tailo: Guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê thiⁿ-sài khiā tī ji̍t-thâu ê tiong-ng, tuì khong-tiong só͘-ū ê pue-tsiáu tuā-siaⁿ huah, Lâi! Tsò-hué lâi tsham-ka Siōngtè ê tuā iàn-si̍k!
English: I saw an angel standing in the sun. He cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in the sky, Come! Be gathered together to the great supper of God,

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, sîn-lîng kā guá kí-khí, tshuā guá tshut-.khì. Guá tsiū khì, sim-lāi tsin kan-khó͘, sim-sîn kik-lia̍t; Siōngtsú ê tshiú tī guá sin tsiūⁿ tsin ū la̍t.
English: So the Spirit lifted me up, and took me away; and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; and the hand of Yahweh was strong on me.

Tailo: Alông teh beh sí-bông, in-uī i bē-tàng ji̍p-khì Guá siúⁿ-sù Isulael lâng ê tē, in-uī tī Me-lí-bah ê tsuí lín uî-puē Guá ê bīng-līng.
English: Aaron shall be gathered to his people; for he shall not enter into the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you rebelled against my word at the waters of Meribah.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá tī huān-lān tiong kiû Lí lâi kàm-tshat. Guá ê sim-tn̂g kiáu-ká, guá ê sim tī guá ê lāi-bīn luān tshau-tshau, in-uī guá tuā-tuā puē-gi̍k. Tī guā-bīn, to-kiàm hō͘ lâng sí kiáⁿ; tī tshù lāi tshin-tshiūnn ū sí-sit.
English: See, Yahweh; for I am in distress; my heart is troubled; My heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled: Abroad the sword bereaves, at home there is as death.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tshiánn Iésu tsia̍h pn̄g. I tsiū ji̍p-khì Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng ê tshù tsē-toh.
English: One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee's house, and sat at the table.

Tailo: In-uī tì-huī ē ji̍p-khì lí ê sim, tì-sik ē tsò lí ê sim-sîn só͘ huann-hí ê.
English: For wisdom will enter into your heart. Knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.

Tailo: Lí bat ū gō͘-ê ang, taⁿ kah lí tông-ki ê m̄-sī lí ê ang; lí án-ne kóng bô m̄-tio̍h.
English: for you have had five husbands; and he whom you now have is not your husband. This you have said truly.

Tailo: Tê-mē-tu-lí-oh kā hiah-ê sai-hū kah só͘-ū ê tông-gia̍p tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi, kā in kóng, Kok-uī, lín tsai lán sī uá-khò tsit-ê tshiú-gē teh thàn tsîⁿ.
English: whom he gathered together, with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, you know that by this business we have our wealth.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū tsin tuā-tīn lâng tuì Ga-lí-la-iah, Te-ka-po͘-lī, Êlúsalèm, Iô-tá-iah kah Ioltàn hô tuì-huāⁿ-lâi tuè Iésu.
English: Great multitudes from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and from beyond the Jordan followed him.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-sài kā i hiat lo̍h-khì bô-té tshim kheⁿ, kuainn khí-.lâi, koh īng hong-ìn hong khí-.lâi, hō͘ i bē-tàng koh bê-hi̍k lia̍t kok, it-ti̍t kàu tsi̍t tshing nî muá; tsit-ê kî-hān liáu-āu, i it-tīng ē tsiām-sî siū tháu-pàng.
English: and cast him into the abyss, and shut it, and sealed it over him, that he should deceive the nations no more, until the thousand years were finished. After this, he must be freed for a short time.

Tailo: Tuì hiah-ê kim-sè hó-gia̍h ê lâng, lí tio̍h kā in huan-hù, m̄-thang kiau-ngō͘, m̄-thang kā in ê ǹg-bāng hē tī bô tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tsîⁿ-tsâi, tio̍h uá-khò kā bān-mi̍h hong-hong hù-hù hō͘ lán hióng-siū ê Siōngtè.
English: Charge those who are rich in this present world that they not be haughty, nor have their hope set on the uncertainty of riches, but on the living God, who richly provides us with everything to enjoy;

Tailo: Kiû Lí hō͘ guá bîng-pi̍k Lí kà-sī ê lō͘, guá thang tiām-tiām su-sióng Lí ê kî-sū.
English: Let me understand the teaching of your precepts! Then I will meditate on your wondrous works.

Tailo: [tsùn-lâm] Lú-kài tiong siōng suí ê, lí nā m̄-tsai só͘-tsāi, tsò lí tshut-.khì, tuè iûⁿ-kûn ê kha-jiah khì; tshī lí ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á tī bo̍k-tsiá ê pò͘-pênn piⁿ.
English: If you don't know, most beautiful among women, Follow the tracks of the sheep. Graze your young goats beside the shepherds' tents.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ Lí ê tsú-bîn tú-tio̍h kan-lân; Lí hō͘ guán lim hit-ê hō͘ lâng tian-lâi tó-khì ê tsiú.
English: You have shown your people hard things. You have made us drink the wine that makes us stagger.

Tailo: O͘-se tī i ê tsú-lâng gán-tiong khuàⁿ-tsò sī pó-tsio̍h, in siūⁿ kóng bô-lūn kiânn tó tsi̍t hong-hiòng lóng ē thong.
English: A bribe is a precious stone in the eyes of him who gives it; Wherever he turns, he prospers.

Tailo: I ê tsuē-tsōng ê pâi-á siá kóng, Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông .
English: The superscription of his accusation was written over him, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

Tailo: Thong kíng lāi lí ē ū kaⁿ-ná tshiū, tsóng-.sī, bô i ê iû thang buah lí ê sing-khu, in-uī lí ê kaⁿ-ná tshiū bē tiâu lia̍p.
English: You shall have olive trees throughout all your borders, but you shall not anoint yourself with the oil; for your olive shall cast its fruit.

Tailo: Guá taⁿ khiā tī tséⁿ piⁿ, siâⁿ lāi lâng ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á teh tshut-lâi tshiūⁿ tsuí.
English: Behold, I am standing by the spring of water. The daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water.

Tailo: kóng: Lán tio̍h khí-.lâi, khì kong-kik Iôtah, kā i jiáu-luān kong-phuà, koh tī i ê tiong-kan siat-li̍p Tha-bi-el ê kiáⁿ tsò ông.
English: Let's go up against Judah, and tear it apart, and let's divide it among ourselves, and set up a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeel.

Tailo: Lí ē tuì hia khì, kàu Tha-bool ê siōng tshiū hia, ē ū saⁿ-ê lâng tú-tio̍h lí, in sī beh khì Bethel kàu Siōngtè hia, tsi̍t-ê tuà saⁿ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á, tsi̍t-ê tuà saⁿ tè piáⁿ, tsi̍t-ê tuà tsi̍t phuê-tē ê tsiú.
English: Then shall you go on forward from there, and you shall come to the oak of Tabor; and there shall meet you there three men going up to God to Bethel, one carrying three kids, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a bottle of wine:

Tailo: Sâmsóng lo̍h-khì Tim-nah, tī Tim-nah khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á, to̍h-sī Huilīsū lâng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Samson went down to Timnah, and saw a woman in Timnah of the daughters of the Philistines.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, jîn-bîn tshut-khì kàu tshân-.ni̍h, ū lâng kā Amí-me-li̍k kóng;
English: It happened on the next day, that the people went out into the field; and they told Abimelech.

Tailo: Án-ne, tsiah ē-tàng hō͘ guá tī Ki-tok tsài-lîm ê ji̍t ū thang khua-kháu, in-uī guá m̄-sī khang-khang pháu-tsáu, guá só͘-ū ê lô-khó͘ lóng bô óng-huì.
English: holding up the word of life; that I may have something to boast in the day of Christ, that I didn't run in vain nor labor in vain.

Tailo: Lí ê sin-tsâi ná tshin-tshiūnn tsó tshiū, lí ê ling ná tshin-tshiūnn kui pha ê kué-tsí.
English: This, your stature, is like a palm tree, Your breasts like its fruit.

Tailo: Ông tī Êlúsalèm hō͘ kim-gîn ná tshin-tshiūnn tsio̍h-thâu, hō͘ pik-hiuⁿ tshiū ná tshin-tshiūnn pîng-guân ê sng-tsâi tshiū, in-uī ū tsin tsē.
English: The king made silver and gold to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycamore trees that are in the lowland, for abundance.

Tailo: In tsiū án-ne tsò, Alông gia̍h kuái-á, tshun tshiú phah tē-.ni̍h ê thô͘-sua hún, tsiū tī lâng kah tsing-seⁿ ê sing-khu lóng ū sat-bó, tē-.ni̍h ê thô͘-sua hún tī Aigi̍p tsuân tē lóng piàn-tsò sat-bó.
English: They did so; and Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and struck the dust of the earth, and there were lice on man, and on animal; all the dust of the earth became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.

Tailo: In ê hū-ló hiann-tī nā lâi tuì guán kò-sò͘, guán ē tuì in kóng, ' Tshiánn lín tài-liām tio̍h guán, lâi tuì in si un-tián, in-uī tsá-tsîng kau-tsiàn ê sî, bô lâu tsa-bó͘ gín-á hō͘ in ta̍k lâng tsò bó͘. Taⁿ mā m̄-sī lín hō͘ in; nā-sī, lín tsiū ū tsuē. '
English: It shall be, when their fathers or their brothers come to complain to us, that we will say to them, Grant them graciously to us, because we didn't take for each man his wife in battle, neither did you give them to them, else would you now be guilty.

Tailo: Kiû Lí ua̍t kuè-lâi khuànn guá, khó-liân guá, in-uī guá ko͘-tuaⁿ koh khùn-khó͘.
English: Turn to me, and have mercy on me, For I am desolate and afflicted.

Tailo: Guán tī in hia tshī iûⁿ ê sî, in mê-ji̍t tsò guán ê tshiûⁿ-uî.
English: they were a wall to us both by night and by day, all the while we were with them keeping the sheep.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí pó-hō͘ in; pì-iū in íng-uán thuat-lī tsit sè-tāi ê lâng.
English: You will keep them, Yahweh, You will preserve them from this generation forever.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá tshun-tshut tshiú-.ni̍h só͘ gia̍h ê kuái-á bué, lâi tuh-tio̍h bah kah bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, tsiū ū hué tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshut-.lâi, tsuân-pō͘ ê bah kah bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ sio khí-.lâi. Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá tsiū lī-khui khì, bô koh-tsài khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Then the angel of Yahweh put forth the end of the staff that was in his hand, and touched the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and there went up fire out of the rock, and consumed the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and the angel of Yahweh departed out of his sight.

Tailo: Án-ne sī kóng, tuì jio̍k-thé seⁿ ê kiáⁿ bô lóng sǹg sī Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-jî, tsí ū tuì Siōngtè ê ìng-ín seⁿ ê tsiah sǹg-tsò sī Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: That is, it is not the children of the flesh who are children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as a seed.

Tailo: I ū tuì Piattò͘ hián-hiān, koh tuì tsa̍p-jī-ê sù-tô͘ hián-hiān.
English: and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Ioap kah tuè i ê jîn-bîn tsìn-tsîng khì kah Alâm lâng kau-tsiàn, in tsiū tī i ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu.
English: So Joab and the people who were with him drew near to the battle against the Syrians: and they fled before him.

Tailo: Mā tio̍h ìn kóng, ' Guán ê tshiú m̄-bat lâu tsit-ê hueh, guán ê ba̍k-tsiu mā m̄-bat khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: and they shall answer and say, Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it.

Tailo: Iésu tuì i kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t kiù-un lâi-kàu tsit-ê ke, in-uī i mā sī Abulahàm ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: Jesus said to him, Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.

Tailo: Akhàtsuh tsē-uī ê sî jī-tsa̍p huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông tsa̍p-la̍k nî. Bô tshin-tshiūnn i ê tsó͘-sian — Tabi̍t kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê tāi-tsì.
English: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and he didn't do that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, like David his father;

Tailo: ( Tsóng-.sī, bô lâng tshin-tshiūnn Ahap, in-uī i tshut-bē ka-kī, kiânn Siōngtsú khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, sī tuì i ê ông-hō͘ Iétsebel kā i sái-lōng ê.
English: ( But there was none like Ahab, who did sell himself to do that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, whom Jezebel his wife stirred up.

Tailo: Kì-jiân sī án-ne, lín ná ē iáu-teh tshì-thàm Siōngtè, īng lán ê tsó͘-sian kah lán só͘ taⁿ bē-khí ê tàⁿ, hē tī hiah-ê bûn-tô͘ ê king-kah-thâu?
English: Now therefore why do you tempt God, that you should put a yoke on the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng suaⁿ-iûⁿ mn̂g tsit tsa̍p-it pak ê tiùⁿ, tsò huē-bō͘ tíng ê pò͘-pênn.
English: You shall make curtains of goats' hair for a covering over the tent: eleven curtains shall you make them.

Tailo: Lâng nā tik-tsuē i ê tshù-piⁿ, koh ū lâng īng tsi̍t-ê tsiù-tsuā kah i tsiù-tsuā, i nā lâi tsit king tiān, tī Lí ê tuâⁿ tsîng tsiù-tsuā ê sî,
English: If a man sin against his neighbor, and an oath be laid on him to cause him to swear, and he come and swear before your altar in this house;

Tailo: Lí ē tú-tio̍h hiah-ê tāi-tsì, in-uī lí tuè guā-pang lâng lâi kiâⁿ îm-luān, koh in-uī lí tuì in hiah-ê ngó͘-siōng lâi bô tshing-khì.
English: These things shall be done to you, because you have played the prostitute after the nations, and because you are polluted with their idols.

Tailo: Ông tsiū khí-.lâi, tsē tī siâⁿ mn̂g-.ni̍h. Ū lâng kā tsìng lâng kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ông tsē tī siâⁿ mn̂g-.ni̍h. Jîn-bîn tsiū lóng lâi-kàu ông ê bīn-tsîng. Isulael lâng tô-tsáu liáu-āu, ta̍k lâng tńg-khì i ka-kī ê pò͘-pênn.
English: Then the king arose, and sat in the gate. They told to all the people, saying, Behold, the king is sitting in the gate: and all the people came before the king. Now Israel had fled every man to his tent.

Tailo: Hit-ê Lēbī lâng, to̍h-sī hông hāi-sí ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê tiōng-hu, ìn kóng, Guá kah guá ê sè-î khì-kàu Biāniámín ê Gi-be-at hioh mê.
English: The Levite, the husband of the woman who was murdered, answered, I came into Gibeah that belongs to Benjamin, I and my concubine, to lodge.

Tailo: Taⁿ in khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín bô koh kah in kāng-khuán kuè hòng-tōng bô tsiat-tsè ê sing-ua̍h, in tsiū kám-kak kî-kuài, suah kā lín huí-pòng.
English: They think it is strange that you don't run with them into the same excess of riot, blaspheming:

Tailo: Ehulaim ē kóng: Guá kah ngó͘-siōng iáu ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khan-liân? Guá ū kā i ìn, koh kā i khuàⁿ-kò͘. Guá tshin-tshiūnn tsheⁿ-tshuì ê siông tshiū, lí ê kué-tsí tuì guá lâi tit-tio̍h.
English: Ephraim, what have I to do any more with idols? I answer, and will take care of him. I am like a green fir tree; From me your fruit is found.

Tailo: Mak-sá ông Le-mu-el ê lāu-bú só͘ kà-sī ê uē,
English: The words of king Lemuel; the oracle which his mother taught him.

Tailo: Tē-tshit ji̍t tio̍h sé lín ê saⁿ, lín tsiū tshing-khì; tsiah thang ji̍p-khì iâⁿ lāi.
English: You shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean; and afterward you shall come into the camp.

Tailo: Hit gō͘-ê lâng ji̍p-khì Mika ê tshù, the̍h tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng, tsè-si ho̍k, tshù lāi ê ngó͘-siōng kah tsù ê siōng, tsè-si tsiū mn̄g in kóng, Lín teh tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: When these went into Micah's house, and fetched the engraved image, the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image, the priest said to them, What do you?

Tailo: Kiû Lí m̄-thang kì-tit guán tsó͘-sian ê tsuē lâi tuì guán thó; guān Lí ê tsû-pi kín-kín lîm-kàu guán, in-uī guán í-king hām-lo̍h kàu ki̍k pi-bî ê tē-pō͘.
English: Don't hold the iniquities of our forefathers against us. Let your tender mercies speedily meet us, For we are in desperate need.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tshin-tshiūnn Iobuh muá tshuì bú-bān, tshin-tshiūnn teh lim tsuí?
English: What man is like Job, Who drinks scorn like water,

Tailo: Siōngtè ê tì-huī hui-siông tshim-tîm, tì-sik hui-siông hong-hù! I ê phuàⁿ-tuàn oh-tit thui-tshik, I ê tō-lō͘ oh-tit tshuē-.tio̍h!
English: Oh the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God! How unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past tracing out!

Tailo: Ū sìn ê lâng ē-tàng hōng guá ê miâ kuáⁿ kuí, koh ē kóng sin ê giân-gí.
English: These signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new languages;

Tailo: Kan-taⁿ thang kā i phah sì-tsa̍p ē, m̄-thang tshiau-kuè sò͘-gia̍h; nā tshiau-kuè sò͘-gia̍h, kā i phah khah tsē ē, lí ê hiann-tī to̍h-sī kā lí bú-jio̍k.
English: Forty stripes he may give him, he shall not exceed; lest, if he should exceed, and beat him above these with many stripes, then your brother should seem vile to you.

Tailo: M̄-thang thiaⁿ Hitsekia ê uē, in-uī Asiul ông án-ne kóng: Lín tio̍h kah guá hô-hó, tshut-lâi tâu-hâng guá, ta̍k lâng tsiū thang tsia̍h ka-kī ê phû-tô tshiū kah bû-hua-kó tshiū ê kué-tsí, koh lim ka-kī ê tséⁿ-tsuí,
English: Don't listen to Hezekiah, for thus says the king of Assyria, Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and each of you eat from his vine, and each one from his fig tree, and each one of you drink the waters of his own cistern;

Tailo: Guá beh tī tsìng lâng ê bīn-tsîng, tuì Siōngtsú siā guá ê guān.
English: I will pay my vows to Yahweh, Yes, in the presence of all his people,

Tailo: Guá — bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, tsá to̍h tsai-puê lí ê, taⁿ bīng-līng tsai-hō kong-kik lí, sī in-uī Isulael kah Iôtah ke kiâⁿ pháiⁿ, ǹg Baal sio hiuⁿ, jiá Guá siū-khì; ka-kī tsò, tio̍h ka-kī siū pò-ìng.
English: For Yahweh of Armies, who planted you, has pronounced evil against you, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have worked for themselves in provoking me to anger by offering incense to Baal.

Tailo: Lín kan-taⁿ teh khuàⁿ gán-tsiân ê sū. Nā ū lâng jīn-uî ka-kī sī sio̍k Ki-tok, i tio̍h koh siūⁿ khuàⁿ māi, i sio̍k Ki-tok, guán mā sī sio̍k Ki-tok.
English: Do you look at things only as they appear in front of your face? If anyone trusts in himself that he is Christ's, let him consider this again with himself, that, even as he is Christ's, so also we are Christ's.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tshiūⁿ tsuí, tsún-pī siū uî-khùn; tio̍h kian-kò͘ lí ê siâⁿ-pó, tio̍h kàu thô͘-khut ta̍h thô͘, siu-lí tsng-iô.
English: Draw water for the siege. Strengthen your fortresses. Go into the clay, and tread the mortar. Make the brick kiln strong.

Tailo: Tsua̍t-bāng ê lâng nā bô kìng-uì tsuân-lîng ê Tsú, i ê pîng-iú mā tio̍h īng jîn-tsû kā i khuán-thāi.
English: To him who is ready to faint, kindness should be shown from his friend; Even to him who forsakes the fear of the Almighty.

Tailo: Guá kiânn tī kong-gī ê lō͘, kiânn tī kong-pêⁿ ê lō͘,
English: I walk in the way of righteousness, In the midst of the paths of justice;

Tailo: Isulael lâng tī Iôtah lâng ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu, Siōngtè kā in kau tī Iôtah lâng ê tshiú.
English: The children of Israel fled before Judah; and God delivered them into their hand.

Tailo: Iésu ín-tsún in khì. Hiah-ê siâ-sîn tsiū tuì hit-ê lâng tshut-.lâi, ji̍p-khì hiah-ê ti-kûn. Tsha-put-to nn̄g-tshing tsiah ê ti-kûn tsáu-lo̍h suaⁿ-phiânn tsông lo̍h-khì ô͘-.ni̍h, hō͘ ô͘-tsuí im-sí.
English: At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed down the steep bank into the sea, and they were drowned in the sea.

Tailo: Lín uân-tsuân sūn-ho̍k liáu-āu, guán tsiū beh lâi tshú-hua̍t hiah-ê m̄ sūn-ho̍k ê lâng.
English: and being in readiness to avenge all disobedience, when your obedience will be made full.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá tshâ bô i ū huān-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h kai sí ê tsuē. I kì-jiân í-king tuì hông-tè siōng-sò͘, guá tshâi-kuat kā i sàng-khì Lô-má.
English: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lāu sian-ti tuà tī Bethel, i ê kiáⁿ lâi-kàu-uī, īng Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tong-ji̍t tī Bethel só͘ kiâⁿ ê kā i kóng, koh kā i tuì ông só͘ kóng it-tshè ê uē lóng kā lāu-pē kóng.
English: Now there lived an old prophet in Bethel; and one of his sons came and told him all the works that the man of God had done that day in Bethel: the words which he had spoken to the king, them also they told to their father.

Tailo: tī seⁿ liàp-á ê só͘-tsāi koh tsíng pe̍h-pe̍h á-.sī hún-âng sik ê hué-pan, tsiū tio̍h khì hō͘ tsè-si giām.
English: and in the place of the boil there is a white rising, or a bright spot, reddish-white, then it shall be shown to the priest;

Tailo: Kì-jiân ū hiah tsē lâng teh tián sio̍k-sè ê tāi-tsì, guá mā beh khua-kháu tsi̍t ē.
English: Seeing that many boast after the flesh, I will also boast.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá kā lín kóng, m̄-thang tshap tsiah-ê lâng, tshut-tsāi in khì, in-uī in só͘ kè-bô͘ kah só͘ tsò ê nā-sī tshut tī lâng, it-tīng ē sit-pāi;
English: Now I tell you, withdraw from these men, and leave them alone. For if this counsel or this work is of men, it will be overthrown.

Tailo: Thài-kàm tsiū huan-hù thîng tshia. Hui-li̍p-pò͘ kah thài-kàm nn̄g lâng lo̍h tsuí, Hui-li̍p-pò͘ tsiū kā i sé-lé.
English: He commanded the chariot to stand still, and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.

Tailo: Guá beh kā Aigi̍p lâng hun-suànn khì tī lia̍t kok, sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t pang. In tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them through the countries; and they shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá nā kóng beh bē kì-tit guá ê ai-uàn, beh kái guá ê iu-iông tsiâⁿ-tsò huann-hí;
English: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will put off my sad face, and cheer up;'

Tailo: Lín ē kong-phuà ta̍k-ê kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ kah ta̍k-ê suí ê siâⁿ, tshò ta̍k tsâng hó ê tshiū, that tiâu só͘-ū ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ, īng tsio̍h-thâu phah-pháiⁿ só͘-ū hó ê tshân.
English: You shall strike every fortified city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all springs of water, and mar every good piece of land with stones.

Tailo: Tsò lāu-pē ê, lín m̄-thang kik kiáⁿ-jî siū-khì, tio̍h īng Tsú ê kíng-kài kah kà-sī lâi kā in puê-ióng.
English: You fathers, don't provoke your children to wrath, but nurture them in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.

Tailo: Ka-le̍p koh kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ū lâng tuì kuân tē lo̍h-.lâi, koh ū tsi̍t tuī tuì Bí-ok-nî-nî siōng tshiū ê lō͘ khí-.lâi.
English: Gaal spoke again and said, Behold, there come people down by the middle of the land, and one company comes by the way of the oak of Meonenim.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē tsiàu ta̍k lâng ê kong-gī kah tiong-sìn lâi kā i pò-tap, in-uī kin-á-ji̍t Siōngtsú kā lí kau tī guá ê tshiú tiong. Tsóng-.sī, guá m̄-khíng tshun tshiú lâi hāi Siōngtsú só͘ buah iû ê.
English: Yahweh will render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness; because Yahweh delivered you into my hand today, and I wouldn't put forth my hand against Yahweh's anointed.

Tailo: Ga̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun kah Lūbiān ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiū lâi kìnn Mô͘se kah tsè-si Êlīatsal, í-ki̍p huē-tsiòng ê siú-líng, kā in kóng,
English: the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the princes of the congregation, saying,

Tailo: Siōngtè tī Si-nái suaⁿ kah Mô͘se kóng-uē liáu-āu, tsiū kā nn̄g tè iok ê pi hō͘ i, sī Siōngtè īng tsíng-thâu-á siá ê tsio̍h-pi.
English: He gave to Moses, when he finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, the two tablets of the testimony, stone tablets, written with God's finger.

Tailo: koh tuà ông kah i ê bô͘-sū só͘ huann-hí hiàn ê kim-gîn, beh hō͘ Isulael ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê,
English: and to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,

Tailo: Īng khàm pak-lāi ê iû kah pak-lāi só͘-ū ê iû, í-ki̍p nn̄g lia̍p io-tsí kah in só͘-ū ê iû, to̍h-sī uá-kīn io siang pîng ê iû kah kuaⁿ tíng-bīn ê bāng-se, í-ki̍p io-tsí, it-khài the̍h khí-.lâi.
English: and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tuè i tsiūⁿ-.lâi, koh pûn ta̍t-á, tuā-tuā huann-hí, tì-sú tē in-uī in ê siann kàu beh li̍h-.khui.
English: All the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth shook with the sound of them.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā Ioap kah tuè i ê jîn-bîn kóng, Lín tio̍h thiah-li̍h saⁿ, hâ muâ-pò͘, tī Apnel bīn-tsîng thî-khàu. Tabi̍t ông mā tuè tī i ê kuaⁿ-tshâ āu-bīn.
English: David said to Joab, and to all the people who were with him, Tear your clothes, and gird you with sackcloth, and mourn before Abner. King David followed the bier.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h tuì Isulael ê tsú-bîn tshut bī-tshai, siat phì-jū,
English: Son of man, put forth a riddle, and speak a parable to the house of Israel;

Tailo: Αpsalôm só͘ tshiánn hit nn̄g pah lâng kah i tuì Êlúsalèm khì, hiah-ê lâng lóng sī bô-ì-tiong khì ê, m̄-tsai hit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: With Absalom went two hundred men out of Jerusalem, who were invited, and went in their simplicity; and they didn't know anything.

Tailo: Guá ū tsin tsē tāi-tsì beh kā lín kóng, m̄-koh, bô ài īng tsuá kah pit; guá khah ǹg-bāng khì lín hia, tng-bīn tsò-hué kóng, thang hō͘ lán ê huann-hí tshiong-muá.
English: Having many things to write to you, I don't want to do so with paper and ink, but I hope to come to you, and to speak face to face, that our joy may be made full.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng tsū-tsi̍p in ê kun-ping beh kau-tsiàn, tsū-tsi̍p tī sio̍k Iôtah ê So͘koh, tsat iâⁿ tī E-hui-tam-mím, tī So͘koh kah A-tse-kah ê tiong-kan.
English: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle; and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongs to Judah, and encamped between Socoh and Azekah, in Ephesdammim.

Tailo: Lāu-pē kā i kóng, ' Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah guá tsò-hué, guá só͘-ū ê tsâi-sán lóng sī lí ê.
English: He said to him, Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.

Tailo: In ê lāu-pē Iâkop kā in kóng, Lín hō͘ guá sit-lo̍h guá ê kiáⁿ. Iôséhuh sí-.khì, Simiān mā sí-.khì, taⁿ lín koh beh tshuā Biāniámín khì. Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng sī hāi-tio̍h guá.
English: Jacob, their father, said to them, You have bereaved me of my children! Joseph is no more, Simeon is no more, and you want to take Benjamin away. All these things are against me.

Tailo: Ahasuiló͘ ông tsiū kā ông-hō͘ Êsutel kah Iôtah lâng Moltékái kóng, In-uī Hamán beh bô͘-hāi Iôtah lâng, guá í-king kā i ê ka-sán hō͘ Êsutel, lâng mā kā Hamán tiàu tī tshâ-kè tíng.
English: Then the king Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew, See, I have given Esther the house of Haman, and him they have hanged on the gallows, because he laid his hand on the Jews.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū lâng īng pho͘-á kng piàn-suī-.ê lâi, ài beh kng ji̍p-khì hē tī Iésu ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Behold, men brought a paralyzed man on a cot, and they sought to bring him in to lay before Jesus.

Tailo: Ehuahátsuh kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, lâng kā i bâi-tsòng tī Sa-má-lī-a. I ê kiáⁿ Io-a-si suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Jehoahaz slept with his fathers; and they buried him in Samaria: and Joash his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: [tsìng tsa-bó͘ gín-á] Hit-ê khò tī i ê lông-kun, tuì khòng-iá khí-.lâi ê, tse sī siáⁿ lâng? [siàu-lí] Guá tī phông-kó tshiū-ē kiò-tshéⁿ lí, lí ê lāu-bú tī hia king-kuè thòng-khó͘, tī hia king-kuè thòng-khó͘ tsiah seⁿ lí.
English: Who is this who comes up from the wilderness, Leaning on her beloved? Under the apple tree I aroused you. There your mother conceived you. There she was in labor and bore you.

Tailo: In kā lé-mi̍h sàng kàu Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, to̍h-sī la̍k tâi ū jia-khàm ê tshia kah tsa̍p-jī tsiah gû-káng. Muí nn̄g-ê siú-líng tsi̍t tâi tshia, ta̍k-ê siú-líng tsi̍t tsiah gû. In kā tsiah-ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng tuà kàu huē-bō͘ tsîng.
English: and they brought their offering before Yahweh, six covered wagons, and twelve oxen; a wagon for every two of the princes, and for each one an ox: and they presented them before the tabernacle.

Tailo: Hit sî, guá ē sià-bián in ê tsuē, tse sī guá kah in só͘ li̍p ê iok. ( Tsù, ISI 59:20-21; 27:9; ILM 31:33-34 )
English: This is my covenant to them, When I will take away their sins.

Tailo: In ê ka-kuàn an-jiân bô kiann; Siōngtè ê kuái-á mā bô kā in phah.
English: Their houses are safe from fear, Neither is the rod of God upon them.

Tailo: hit sî, lí tio̍h ka-kī kín-sīn, m̄-thang tī in tuì lín ê bīn-tsîng tû-bia̍t liáu-āu, suah hām-lo̍h in ê lô-bāng lâi tuè in, mā m̄-thang thàm-thiaⁿ in ê sîn-bîng ê tāi-tsì, kóng, ' Tsiah-ê kok án-tsuáⁿ ho̍k-sāi in ê sîn-bîng, guá mā beh án-ne kiânn. '
English: take heed to yourself that you not be ensnared to follow them, after that they are destroyed from before you; and that you not inquire after their gods, saying, How do these nations serve their gods? even so will I do likewise.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Mô͘se thang tshin-kīn Siōngtsú, kî-tha m̄-thang tshin-kīn, jîn-bîn mā m̄-thang kah i tsò-hué lâi.
English: Moses alone shall come near to Yahweh, but they shall not come near, neither shall the people go up with him.

Tailo: Tio̍h khǹg lāu lâng m̄-thang ài lim tsiú, tio̍h tuan-tsong siú-kí, koh ū sûn-tsuân ê sìn-gióng, thiàⁿ-sim kah nāi-sim.
English: that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober minded, sound in faith, in love, and in patience:

Tailo: Gī lâng ē sîng-tsiap ìng-ín ê thó͘-tē, íng-uán tuà tī hia.
English: The righteous shall inherit the land, And live in it forever.

Tailo: Tī pe̍h thâu-mn̂g ê lâng bīn-tsîng, lí tio̍h khiā khí-.lâi, mā tio̍h tsun-kìng lāu lâng ê bīn, koh tio̍h kìng-uì lí ê Siōngtsú. Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: You shall rise up before the gray head, and honor the face of an old man, and you shall fear your God. I am Yahweh.

Tailo: In-uī I bat tuì Mô͘se kóng, Guá beh liân-bín guá ài liân-bín ê lâng, guá beh thé-thiap guá ài thé-thiap ê lâng. ( Tsù, CAG 33:19 )
English: For he said to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, só͘-ū íng-uán hiàn ê, to̍h-sī lâng tuì i só͘-ū ê íng-uán hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, bô-lūn sī lâng, á-.sī tsing-seⁿ, á-.sī i sán-gia̍p ê tē, lóng m̄-thang bē, mā m̄-thang sio̍k-huê. I íng-uán hiàn ê sī tsì-sìng ê, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: Notwithstanding, no devoted thing, that a man shall devote to Yahweh of all that he has, whether of man or animal, or of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy to Yahweh.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá koh-ua̍h liáu-āu ē pí lín tāi-sing khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng.
English: But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang tsia̍h tsè-kuè ngó͘-siōng ê mi̍h, m̄-thang tsia̍h ni̍h-sí ê tsing-seⁿ kah hueh, m̄-thang îm-luān. Lín nā bô huān-tio̍h tsiah-ê kài-bīng tsiū hó. Guān lín pîng-an.
English: that you abstain from things sacrificed to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality, from which if you keep yourselves, it will be well with you. Farewell.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t uī tsiáng-kuân-.ê beh tuì Iâkop tshut, i beh tsâu-bia̍t siâⁿ tiong só͘ lâu lo̍h-.lâi ê.
English: Out of Jacob shall one have dominion, Shall destroy the remnant from the city.

Tailo: Ông só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h tshuā in ji̍p-khì ê ji̍t í-king kàu, thài-kàm-tiúⁿ tsiū tshuā in ji̍p-khì kàu Nepkatnetsal ê bīn-tsîng.
English: At the end of the days which the king had appointed for bringing them in, the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.
