Tailo: Guá ê sim-lāi tio̍h-kip, só͘-í, guá ê sim-su pik guá tio̍h ìn.
English: Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me, Even by reason of my haste that is in me.

Tailo: Ahimâtsu tuì ông tuā-siaⁿ huah, Pîng-an à! Tsiū tī ông ê bīn-tsîng phak tī thô͘-kha pài, kóng, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè sī ing-kai tio̍h o-ló ê, in-uī I í-king kā hiah-ê khí tshiú kong-kik guá ê tsú — guá ê ông ê lâng kau hō͘ lí.
English: Ahimaaz called, and said to the king, All is well. He bowed himself before the king with his face to the earth, and said, Blessed be Yahweh your God, who has delivered up the men who lifted up their hand against my lord the king.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí m̄-thang lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g! Guá ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí kuáⁿ-kín lâi pang-tsān guá!
English: God, don't be far from me. My God, hurry to help me.

Tailo: Siōngtè pûn khuì, in tsiū sí-bông; tuì I tuā siū-khì ê hong, in tsiū siau-bia̍t.
English: By the breath of God they perish, By the blast of his anger are they consumed.

Tailo: Kiû Lí khuànn guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ hîng-uî á-bô, kiû Lí tshuā guá kiânn íng-uán ua̍h-miā ê lō͘.
English: See if there is any wicked way in me, And lead me in the everlasting way.

Tailo: Lí ê tsó͘-sian tshit-tsa̍p lâng lo̍h-khì Aigi̍p, taⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè hō͘ lí tshin-tshiūnn thinn-tíng ê tsheⁿ hiah-ni̍h tsē.
English: Your fathers went down into Egypt with seventy persons; and now Yahweh your God has made you as the stars of the sky for multitude.

Tailo: Kā i kau-tài lí, tio̍h hó-hó kā i khuán-thāi, m̄-thang hāi i; i tuì lí kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h, lí tsiū tsiàu án-ne kā i tsò.
English: Take him, and look well to him, and do him no harm; but do to him even as he shall tell you.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê lāu-pē ē tuā khuài-lo̍k; lâng seⁿ-tio̍h tì-huī ê kiáⁿ ē in-uī i lâi huann-hí.
English: The father of the righteous has great joy. Whoever fathers a wise child delights in him.

Tailo: Tī Êlúsalèm ê sian-ti, Guá í-king khuàⁿ-tio̍h khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì; in kiânn kan-îm, tsò tāi-tsì hi-ké, koh tsō͘ pháiⁿ lâng ê tshiú ná ū la̍t, tì-sú bô lâng huê-thâu lī-khui i ê pháiⁿ. In tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, lóng tshin-tshiūnn So͘tóm, tuà tī hia ê jîn-bîn lóng tshin-tshiūnn Ammo͘la̍h.
English: In the prophets of Jerusalem also I have seen a horrible thing: they commit adultery, and walk in lies; and they strengthen the hands of evil-doers, so that none does return from his wickedness: they are all of them become to me as Sodom, and the inhabitants of it as Gomorrah.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h the̍h tsi̍t tè tshâ-pán, tī i ê tíng-bīn siá ' Uī Iôtah kah i ê tâng-phuāⁿ Isulael tso̍k ', koh the̍h tsi̍t tè tshâ-pán, tī i ê tíng-bīn siá ' Uī-tio̍h Iôséhuh, Ehulaim kah i ê tâng-phuāⁿ Isulael tsuân ke ' ê tshâ-pán.
English: You, son of man, take one stick, and write on it, For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions: then take another stick, and write on it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel his companions:

Tailo: Kiû Lí tuì thiⁿ àⁿ lo̍h-lâi khuànn, tuì Lí sìng-kiat îng-kng ê só͘-tsāi khuànn. Lí ê jia̍t-sim kah Lí tuā kuân-lîng-.ê só͘ tsò tī tó-uī? Lí thiàⁿ-thàng ê sim-tn̂g kah liân-bín tuì guá thîng-tsí.
English: Look down from heaven, and see from the habitation of your holiness and of your glory: where are your zeal and your mighty acts? the yearning of your heart and your compassion is restrained toward me.

Tailo: In kóng-khí Lí kok-tō͘ ê îng-kng, tâm-lūn Lí ê tuā kuân-lîng,
English: They will speak of the glory of your kingdom, And talk about your power;

Tailo: Tī Salèm, ū I ê tiùⁿ-pâng; tī Si-óng, ū I tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: His tent is also in Salem; His dwelling place in Zion.

Tailo: Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tshing-khì bô beh khuànn siâ-ok, bô beh khuànn hîng-gi̍k; kiânn kuí-tsà ê, Lí ná ē tiām-tiām khuànn in? Pháiⁿ lâng thun-bia̍t pí i khah kong-gī ê, Lí ná ē tiām-tiām ah?
English: You who have purer eyes than to see evil, and who cannot look on perversity, why do you tolerate those who deal treacherously, and keep silent when the wicked swallows up the man who is more righteous than he,

Tailo: Kì-jiân lín tsit-má hù-jū, tio̍h tsín-tsè sàn-tshiah lâng; thìng-hāu lín sàn-tshiah in hù-jū ê sî, in mā thang kā lín tsín-tsè, án-ne siang-hong lóng ū ki-huē hō͘-siong pang-tsān.
English: but for equality. Your abundance at this present time supplies their lack, that their abundance also may become a supply for your lack; that there may be equality.

Tailo: Lí ê bó͘ tī lí ê tshù lāi tshin-tshiūnn kiat tsin tsē kué-tsí ê phû-tô tshiū; lí ê kiáⁿ-jî tshin-tshiūnn kaⁿ-ná-tsai uî teh kah lí tsò-hué tsē-toh.
English: Your wife will be as a fruitful vine, In the innermost parts of your house; Your children like olive plants, Around your table.

Tailo: Tshù tuì tì-huī lâi khí-tsō, koh tuì tshong-bîng lâi kiàn-li̍p.
English: Through wisdom a house is built; By understanding it is established;

Tailo: Ū hīⁿ-khang ê lâng, lóng tio̍h thiaⁿ Sìng Sîn kā tsiah-ê kàu-huē só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies.

Tailo: Guá sing tī Ta-má-su-ko kah Êlúsalèm, āu-lâi tī Iô-tá-iah tsuân tē, mā tuì guā-pang lâng thuân-tō, khǹg lâng tio̍h hué-kái lâi kui-ǹg Siōngtè, koh tio̍h īng hîng-uî tsìng-bîng in tsin-tsiàⁿ ū hué-kái.
English: but declared first to them of Damascus, at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.

Tailo: Guá ê pē, lí khuàⁿ tsi̍t-.ē, khuànn lí guā-ho̍k ê saⁿ-á-ki tī guá ê tshiú. Guá kuah lí ê guā-ho̍k saⁿ-á-ki, bô thâi lí; tsiū án-ne lí thang khuàⁿ-tshut, tsiū tsai guá ê tshiú bô tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ, bô puē-gi̍k lí. Guá m̄-bat tik-tsuē lí, tsóng-.sī, lí tshin-tshiūnn phah-la̍h teh siàu-siūⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Moreover, my father, behold, yes, see the skirt of your robe in my hand; for in that I cut off the skirt of your robe, and didn't kill you, know you and see that there is neither evil nor disobedience in my hand, and I have not sinned against you, though you hunt after my life to take it.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng ông it-tshè lim ê khì-kū lóng sī kim ê, Le-ba-nòng tshiū-nâ ê tshù só͘-ū ê khì-kū mā sī sûn-kim ê. Só͘lômóng ê nî-kan, lâng khuànn gîn tsò bô siáⁿ-mi̍h kè-ta̍t.
English: All king Solomon's drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: silver was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.

Tailo: E-lí-sa-biat sing-sán ê kî kàu, tsiū seⁿ tsi̍t-ê hāu-seⁿ.
English: Now the time that Elizabeth should give birth was fulfilled, and she brought forth a son.

Tailo: Lēbī tso̍k ê ke līng-guā tuà, in ê tsa-bó͘ lâng mā līng-guā tuà. Simí tso̍k ê ke līng-guā tuà, in ê tsa-bó͘ lâng mā līng-guā tuà.
English: the family of the house of Levi apart, and their wives apart; the family of the Shimeites apart, and their wives apart;

Tailo: I m̄-bián su-sióng it-sing ê nî-ji̍t, in-uī Siōngtè ū tsiàu i sim só͘ ì-ài ê kā i pò-siúⁿ.
English: For he shall not often reflect on the days of his life; because God occupies him with the joy of his heart.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kiò Mô͘se kah Alông, kóng, Tshiánn lín kiû Siōngtsú hō͘ tsiah-ê tshân-kap-á lī-khui guá kah guá ê jîn-bîn, guá tsiū tsún tsiah-ê jîn-bîn thang khì tsè-sū Siōngtsú.
English: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Entreat Yahweh, that he take away the frogs from me, and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may sacrifice to Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê Sìng Sîn tsiū kā guá kí-khí, tshuā guá kàu Siōngtsú ê tiān ǹg tang ê tang-mn̂g. Lí khuàⁿ, tī mn̂g-kháu ū jī-tsa̍p gō͘-ê lâng, guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tiong-kan ū jîn-bîn ê kuì-tso̍k A-tsù-l ê kiáⁿ Ia-tsa-niah kah Benáiah ê kiáⁿ Pelatiah.
English: Moreover the Spirit lifted me up, and brought me to the east gate of Yahweh's house, which looks eastward: and see, at the door of the gate twenty-five men; and I saw in the midst of them Jaazaniah the son of Azzur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people.

Tailo: In-uī guá hō͘ lí tī lia̍t kok tiong tsò bî-sè-.ê, hō͘ lâng khuànn-khin.
English: For, behold, I have made you small among the nations, and despised among men.

Tailo: Kiânn hiàn Siōngtè tiān ê lé, tsiū hiàn gû-káng tsi̍t pah tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng nn̄g pah tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-á sì pah tsiah. Koh tsiàu Isulael tsi-tso̍k ê sò͘-gia̍h, hiàn suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsa̍p-jī tsiah, uī Isulael jîn-bîn tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: They offered at the dedication of this house of God one hundred bulls, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin offering for all Israel, twelve male goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.

Tailo: In-uī hit khuán gī lâng, Guá bô beh hō͘ i siong-sim, lín īng pe̍h-tsha̍t uē hō͘ i siong-sim, jî-tshiánn lín kian-kò͘ pháiⁿ lâng ê tshiú, hō͘ i bô ua̍t thâu lī-khui i ê pháiⁿ lō͘, lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h.
English: Because with lies you have grieved the heart of the righteous, whom I have not made sad; and strengthened the hands of the wicked, that he should not return from his wicked way, and be saved alive:

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Kàu hit ji̍t, ū ì-sù ē hing-khí tī lí ê sim, lí ē tô͘-bô͘ pháiⁿ ê kè-bô͘,
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: It shall happen in that day, that things shall come into your mind, and you shall devise an evil device:

Tailo: Isimael koh thâi-sí tī Mi-su-peh hiah-ê kui-uá Getália̍h só͘-ū ê Iôtah lâng, í-ki̍p tī hia só͘ tú-tio̍h Kal-tí-ah ê kun-ping.
English: Ishmael also killed all the Jews who were with him, to wit, with Gedaliah, at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans who were found there, the men of war.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā lí ê kiáⁿ kóng, ' Í-tsîng guán tī Aigi̍p tsò Huâ-láu ê lô͘-lē, Siōngtsú īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú, tshuā guán tshut Aigi̍p.
English: then you shall tell your son, We were Pharaoh's bondservants in Egypt: and Yahweh brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand;

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Tabi̍t ê sian-kiàn Ga̍t, kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Gad, David's seer, saying,

Tailo: Tabi̍t thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí khí-.lâi ê sî, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu sian-ti Ga̍t, to̍h-sī Tabi̍t ê sian-kiàn, kóng,
English: When David rose up in the morning, the word of Yahweh came to the prophet Gad, David's seer, saying,

Tailo: Him-bō͘ tì-huī ê lâng hō͘ lāu-pē khuài-lo̍k; kah ki-lí kiat-kau ê lâng khui lāu-pē ê tsîⁿ-tsâi.
English: Whoever loves wisdom brings joy to his father; But a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth.

Tailo: Ha-ka-liah ê kiáⁿ Nîhímiah ê kì-lio̍k. Tng jī-tsa̍p nî, Ki-su-liû gue̍h, guá tī Su-san ê ông-kiong.
English: The words of Nehemiah the son of Hacaliah. Now it happened in the month Chislev, in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan the palace,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h thâi hit tsiah iûⁿ, tshú i ê hueh tām-po̍h-á, buah tī Alông tsiànn pîng ê hīnn-á-suê kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ tsiànn pîng ê hīnn-á-suê, koh buah tī in tsiàⁿ tshiú ê tuā-thâu-bú kah tsiàⁿ-kha ê tuā-thâu-bú, koh kā hueh hiù tī tuâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: Then you shall kill the ram, and take some of its blood, and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood on the altar round about.

Tailo: Tsóng-tok koh mn̄g in kóng, Tsit nn̄g-ê lâng lín ài guá pàng tó tsi̍t-ê hō͘ lín? In ìn kóng, Bala̍h-ba!
English: But the governor answered them, Which of the two do you want me to release to you? They said, Barabbas!

Tailo: Guá īng muâ-pò͘ tsò saⁿ-khò͘, tsìng lâng huán-tńg īng guá tsò tshiàu-tâm.
English: When I made sackcloth my clothing, I became a byword to them.

Tailo: Iésu koh īng phì-jū kā in kóng, Lín khuànn bû-hua-kó tshiū kah só͘-ū ê tshiū.
English: He told them a parable. See the fig tree, and all the trees.

Tailo: Lín ka-kī tio̍h kín-sīn, in-uī lâng ē kā lín kau hō͘ gī-huē, lín ē tī huē-tn̂g lāi siū piⁿ-phah. Lín mā ē uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘ khiā tī kuaⁿ-hú kah kun-ông ê bīn-tsîng, lâi tuì in uī guá tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.

Tailo: I pîng-sî kò͘-siú ǹg tang ê mn̂g, sī ông teh tshut-ji̍p ê, in lóng sī Lēbī tso̍k tsiah-ê iâⁿ tiong kò͘-mn̂g ê.
English: who hitherto waited in the king's gate eastward: they were the porters for the camp of the children of Levi.

Tailo: I tshuā in tshut-.lâi, tuà gîn tuà kim; I ê tsi-tso̍k tiong bô kah tsi̍t-ê luán-jio̍k ê lâng.
English: He brought them forth with silver and gold. There was not one feeble person among his tribes.

Tailo: Hit sî, Ia-lô-ba-am tuì Êlúsalèm tshut-.lâi, Sī-lô lâng sian-ti Ahiiah tī lō͘-.ni̍h tú-tio̍h i; hit sî i ū tshīng tsi̍t-niá sin saⁿ. In nn̄g lâng tī tshân-.ni̍h, í-guā bô pa̍t lâng.
English: It happened at that time, when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; now Ahijah had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field.

Tailo: Mn̄g hit-ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Tī tshân-.ni̍h kiâⁿ lâi gîng-tsiap lán ê sī siáⁿ lâng? Lô͘-po̍k kóng, Sī guá ê tsú-lâng. Li-bé-kah tsiū the̍h phè lâi tà bīn.
English: She said to the servant, Who is the man who is walking in the field to meet us? The servant said, It is my master. She took her veil, and covered herself.

Tailo: I tsiū tsí-sī in tsai in ê só͘ tsò, í-ki̍p in só͘ huān ê tāng tsuē.
English: Then he shows them their work, And their transgressions, that they have behaved themselves proudly.

Tailo: I tsîng-ji̍t sio hiuⁿ ho̍k-sāi tsiah-ê Baal, koh īng hīⁿ-kau kah pa̍t tsióng tsng-sik-phín ka-kī táⁿ-pān, tuè i ê lông-kun khì, suah bē kì-tit Guá, in-uī án-ne, Guá beh kā i pān. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: I will visit on her the days of the Baals, To which she burned incense, When she decked herself with her earrings and her jewels, And went after her lovers, And forgot me, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōngtè sù hō͘ lí íng-íng uán-uán ê pó-tsō, sù hō͘ lí ê kok ū tsìng-ti̍t ê kuân-pìng.
English: Your throne, God, is forever and ever. A scepter of equity is the scepter of your kingdom.

Tailo: Guá tī àm-tiong kā lín kóng ê, lín tio̍h tī kng-bîng ê só͘-tsāi kóng tshut-.lâi; àⁿ tī hīⁿ-khang kā lín kóng ê, lín tio̍h tī tshù-bué-tíng suan-iông tshut-.khì.
English: What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear whispered in the ear, proclaim on the housetops.

Tailo: Nā-sī tsiáng-kuân-.ê ê sim-sîn siūⁿ beh kong-kik lí, m̄-thang lī-khui lí ê pún uī, in-uī un-hô ē bián-tit tuā ê kuè-sit.
English: If the spirit of the ruler rises up against you, don't leave your place; for gentleness lays great offenses to rest.

Tailo: Kú-si̍t lâng E-bia̍t-me-li̍k kā I-é-lí-miah kóng, Lí īng tsiah-ê phuà-pò͘ kah kū sann, tsū tī koh-ē-lang, hē tī soh-á tíng-bīn. I-é-lí-miah tsiū tsiàu án-ne khì tsò.
English: Ebedmelech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah, Put now these rags and worn-out garments under your armholes under the cords. Jeremiah did so.

Tailo: In-uī lâng siū ko-sing m̄-sī tuì tang, m̄-sī tuì sai, mā m̄-sī tuì lâm.
English: For neither from the east, nor from the west, Nor yet from the south, comes exaltation.

Tailo: Guá khì kā lín tsún-pī só͘-tsāi liáu-āu, ē koh tńg-lâi tshuā lín khì guá hia. Guá tī tó-uī, lín mā ē tī hia.
English: If I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and will receive you to myself; that where I am, you may be there also.

Tailo: Tō í-king tī sè-kan, sè-kan thong-kuè tō lâi tshòng-tsō, m̄-koh, sè-kan m̄-bat tsit-ê tō.
English: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn't recognize him.

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Alông tsiū phak-lo̍h tī Isulael tsuân huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Mā kám-siā tshuā Isulael lâng tuì hit tiong-kan king-kuè ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Tsìng lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iésu ê kà-sī, tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ.
English: When the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.

Tailo: Lí ê sìn-si̍t tsûn kàu bān tāi; Lí kiàn-li̍p tē, tē tsiū kú-tn̂g tsûn-tsāi.
English: Your faithfulness is to all generations. You have established the earth, and it remains.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Tsetikiah tsē-uī ê tē-sì nî tńg-khì Babúlông ê sî, Maaseiah ê sun — Nêléiù ê kiáⁿ Selaiah kah ông tsò-hué khì.
English: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Now Seraiah was chief chamberlain.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín iū-koh hō͘-hué, siat-to̍k Guá ê miâ, ta̍k lâng hō͘ só͘ tháu-pàng tit-tio̍h tsū-iû ê lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī tò tńg-.lâi, bián-kióng in iû-guân tsò lín ê lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī.
English: but you turned and profaned my name, and caused every man his servant, and every man his handmaid, whom you had let go free at their pleasure, to return; and you brought them into subjection, to be to you for servants and for handmaids.

Tailo: Guá tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê ji̍t, in lâi pik-hāi guá; tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú sī guá só͘ uá-khò ê.
English: They came on me in the day of my calamity; But Yahweh was my stay.

Tailo: Kóng, Guá ê Tsú, tshiánn uat-lâi lô͘-po̍k ê tshù hioh mê, sé kha; bîn-á tsá-khí khí-.lâi, tsiah kiânn lín ê lō͘. In kóng, M̄-bián, guán beh tī tuā ke-lō͘ kuè-mê.
English: and he said, See now, my lords, please turn aside into your servant's house, stay all night, wash your feet, and you will rise up early, and go on your way. They said, No, but we will stay in the street all night.

Tailo: Bô-lūn lâm-lí lín lóng tio̍h hō͘ in tshut-.khì, to̍h-sī tshut-khì kàu iâⁿ guā, bián-tit uè lah-sap in ê iâⁿ-pâng, in-uī Guá tuà tī in ê tiong-kan.
English: Both male and female shall you put out, outside of the camp shall you put them; that they not defile their camp, in the midst of which I dwell.

Tailo: Hit-ê tē í-king hō͘ Siōngtsú khah iâⁿ, jiân-āu lín thang tńg-.lâi; tī Siōngtsú kah Isulael ê bīn-tsîng, lín tsiū bô tsuē, tsit-ê tē ē tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng hō͘ lín tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: and the land is subdued before Yahweh; then afterward you shall return, and be guiltless towards Yahweh, and towards Israel; and this land shall be to you for a possession before Yahweh.

Tailo: Tio̍h hō͘ lí ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ tit-tio̍h hok-khì; tio̍h huaⁿ-hí lí siàu-liân ê sî só͘ tshuā ê bó͘.
English: Let your spring be blessed. Rejoice in the wife of your youth.

Tailo: In tsiū khì, īng hong-tiâu kā hit lia̍p tsio̍h-thâu hong khí-.lâi, lâu uē-ping tiàm hia kò͘-siú.
English: So they went with the guard and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú uī-tio̍h Abulahàm ê bó͘ Sala̍h ê iân-kò͘, í-king hō͘ Amí-me-li̍k tshù lāi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng bē-tàng seⁿ kiáⁿ.
English: For Yahweh had closed up tight all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.

Tailo: In-uī Iobuh ū kóng, guá sī kong-gī, Siōngtè tua̍t guá ê tsìng-lí;
English: For Job has said, I am righteous, God has taken away my right:

Tailo: Kah lín hiah-ê Ti̍k-pia̍t sù-tô͘ pí khí-.lâi, guá siūⁿ guá tsi̍t-sut-á to bô khah su.
English: For I reckon that I am not at all behind the very best apostles.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tiuⁿ-tî, in-uī lín m̄-tsai lín ê tsú-lâng tang-sî ē tńg-.lâi, á-.sī beh àm-á, á-.sī puàⁿ-mê, á-.sī ke thî ê sî, á-.sī thiⁿ-kng ji̍t tshut ê sî.
English: Watch therefore, for you don't know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;

Tailo: Tshám ah! Hit-ê ji̍t sī tuā, bô thang pí-phīng; sī Iâkop tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê kî-ji̍t; tsóng-.sī, i ē tit-tio̍h kiù lâi thuat-tshut.
English: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob's trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê tshuì lóng ē suan-pò͘ sîng-jīn Iésu Ki-tok sī Tsú , lâi kui îng-kng hō͘ Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè.
English: and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

Tailo: Lán tsai Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-jî bē kè-sio̍k huān tsuē, in-uī ū Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ teh kā i pó-siú, hit-ê Mô͘-kuí kha̍p i bē-tio̍h.
English: We know that whoever is born of God doesn't sin, but he who was born of God keeps himself, and the evil one doesn't touch him.

Tailo: Guá tsin-tsiàⁿ tsai-iáⁿ sī án-ne; in-uī lâng tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, ná ē sǹg-tsò sī gī?
English: Truly I know that it is so, But how can man be just with God?

Tailo: Tsha-put-to puàⁿ-mê ê sî, Páulô kah Sela̍h kî-tó gîm-si, o-ló Siōngtè, kî-tha ê huān-lâng lóng tsù-ì teh thiaⁿ.
English: But about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.

Tailo: I kóng, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè sī ing-kai o-ló ê, in-uī I tshin-tshuì tuì guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t ìng-ín ê, mā tshin-tshiú kā i ìng-giām. I kóng,
English: He said, Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David your father, and has with his hand fulfilled it, saying,

Tailo: Tio̍h kā Siōngtsú ê miâ só͘ ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê îng-kng kui hō͘ I, īng sìng-kiat ê táⁿ-pān lâi kìng-pài Siōngtsú.
English: Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due to his name. Worship Yahweh in holy array.

Tailo: Tī Ehulaim, Biāniámín kah Mánáse ê bīn-tsîng, kiû Lí si-tián Lí ê kuân-lîng lâi kiù guán.
English: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up your might! Come to save us!

Tailo: ( Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) Guá bat nāi-sim thìng-hāu Siōngtsú; I ànn-lo̍h thiaⁿ guá ê kiû-kiò.
English: I waited patiently for Yahweh. He turned to me, and heard my cry.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā hian-khui ê khì-kū, to̍h-sī kuà bô khàm ba̍t ê, mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Every open vessel, which has no covering bound on it, is unclean.

Tailo: Hō͘ hái kah tshim-ian ê tsuí ta-.khì, hō͘ hái tshim ê só͘-tsāi piàn-tsò lō͘, hō͘ siū sio̍k ê jîn-bîn king-kuè ê, kám m̄-sī lí?
English: Isn't it you who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep; who made the depths of the sea a way for the redeemed to pass over?

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng bat tsiūⁿ thiⁿ koh lo̍h-.lâi? Siáⁿ lâng bat kā hong tsū-tsi̍p tī tshiú tiong? Siáⁿ lâng bat kā tsuí pau tī saⁿ-á lāi? Siáⁿ lâng bat tiāⁿ-tio̍h tē ê sì-ki̍k? I ê miâ kiò-tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h, I kiáⁿ ê miâ kiò-tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h, lí kám tsai?
English: Who has ascended up into heaven, and descended? Who has gathered the wind in his fists? Who has bound the waters in his garment? Who has established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and what is his son's name, if you know?

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tsè-tsō sîn-pu̍t, tsù-tsō bô lī-ik ê ngó͘-siōng?
English: Who has fashioned a god, or molten an image that is profitable for nothing?

Tailo: Sàulô tsiū khí-.lâi, tshuā Isulael tiong kíng-suán ê ping saⁿ tshing, lo̍h-khì kàu Ji-hu ê khòng-iá, beh tī Ji-hu ê khòng-iá tshuē Tabi̍t.
English: Then Saul arose, and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.

Tailo: Tsit sè-kan ê sîn-bîng hō͘ hiah-ê m̄-sìn ê lâng ê sim-sîn tsheⁿ-mê, bē-tàng khuànn-kìnn hok-im ê kng; tsit-ê hok-im teh kiàn-tsìng Ki-tok ê îng-kng, Ki-tok sī Siōngtè ê hîng-siōng.
English: in whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelieving, that the light of the Good News of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should not dawn on them.

Tailo: Siōngtsú uī-tio̍h lín ê iân-kò͘ mā siū-khì guá, kóng, ' Lí mā bē-tàng ji̍p-khì hit-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Also Yahweh was angry with me for your sakes, saying, You also shall not go in there:

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Asah ông tshuā Iôtah kûn-tsiòng uá-.lâi, in tsiū puaⁿ-suá Basiah só͘ īng lâi beh khí La̍h-má siâⁿ ê tsio̍h-thâu kah tshâ, īng lâi khí Ge-bah siâⁿ kah Mi-su-peh siâⁿ.
English: Then Asa the king took all Judah; and they carried away the stones of Ramah, and the timber of it, with which Baasha had built; and he built therewith Geba and Mizpah.

Tailo: I án-ne kóng sī in-uī Iésu bat tuì i kóng, Siâ-sîn, tio̍h tuì hit-ê lâng tshut-.khì!
English: For he said to him, Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Tsuân tē it-tīng pha-hng, tsóng-.sī, Guá bô beh huí-bia̍t kàu tsīn.
English: For thus says Yahweh, The whole land shall be a desolation; yet will I not make a full end.

Tailo: Elī ê sim-pū — Hui-ne-hah ê bó͘, huâi-īn beh kàu sán-kî, i thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê kuī hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-.khì, ta-kuaⁿ kah tiōng-hu lóng sí ê siau-sit, tsiū àⁿ lo̍h-lâi seⁿ kiáⁿ, in-uī tuā thàng-thiàⁿ hut-jiân kàu.
English: His daughter-in-law, Phinehas' wife, was with child, near to be delivered: and when she heard the news that the ark of God was taken, and that her father-in-law and her husband were dead, she bowed herself and brought forth; for her pains came on her.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h huat bīng-līng hō͘ hiah-ê lâng thîng kang, bô koh khí tsit-ê siâⁿ, thìng-hāu guá kàng tsí.
English: Make you now a decree to cause these men to cease, and that this city not be built, until a decree shall be made by me.

Tailo: Mô͘ap tú-tio̍h huí-bia̍t, i ê gín-á teh háu ê siann hō͘ lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.

Tailo: I tshe lô͘-po̍k khì kiò só͘ iau-tshiáⁿ ê lâng lâi hù hun-iàn, m̄-koh, in m̄ lâi.
English: and sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the marriage feast, but they would not come.

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn, lí tio̍h tsing-sîn khí-.lâi! Khîm, sik, lín tio̍h tsing-sîn khí-.lâi! Guá pún-sin beh tsin tsá to̍h tsing-sîn khí-.lâi.
English: Wake up, my glory! Wake up, psaltery and harp! I will wake up the dawn.

Tailo: I î-suá suaⁿ, suaⁿ mā m̄-tsai; I siū-khì tiong, hō͘ suaⁿ pang lo̍h-.khì.
English: Who removes the mountains, and they don't know it, When he overturns them in his anger

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú, kah tshun-tshut ê tshiú-kut, kah tuā koh thang kiaⁿ ê tāi-tsì, kah sîn-jiah, kî-sū, tshuā guán tshut Aigi̍p,
English: and Yahweh brought us forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with great terror, and with signs, and with wonders;

Tailo: Lí ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí ê kiáⁿ-kiáⁿ sun-sun! Guān pîng-an kui tī Isulael!
English: Yes, may you see your children's children. Peace be upon Israel.

Tailo: Lí tsiū ē bîng-pi̍k kong-gī ê phuàⁿ-tuàn, kiânn tsìng-ti̍t kah só͘-ū ê hó lō͘.
English: Then you will understand righteousness and justice, Equity and every good path.

Tailo: Lín só͘ tsai ê, guá mā tsai; guá bô pí lín khah su.
English: What you know, I know also. I am not inferior to you.

Tailo: Lí beh tsia̍h, tsóng-.sī, tsia̍h bē pá; lí ê khang-hi ē tī lí lāi-bīn. Lí ē puaⁿ-suá, tsóng-.sī, an-jiân tuà mi̍h-kiāⁿ khì; lí só͘ tuà-.khì ê, Guá lóng beh kau hō͘ to-kiàm.
English: You shall eat, but not be satisfied. Your humiliation will be in your midst. You will store up, but not save; And that which you save I will give up to the sword.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā guá kóng, In-uī lí ê tsuē-ok, Guá beh tī lí ê sì-kho͘-uî, hō͘ lí ê tsâi-bu̍t, pó-bu̍t pe̍h-pe̍h hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: Your substance and your treasures will I give for a spoil without price, and that for all your sins, even in all your borders.

Tailo: In lâi-kàu O͘-huil, tuì hia tit-tio̍h sì-pah jī-tsa̍p tha-lan-t ê kim, ūn lâi-kàu Só͘lômóng ông hia.
English: They came to Ophir, and fetched from there gold, four hundred and twenty talents, and brought it to king Solomon.

Tailo: Lí it-tīng tio̍h siat-li̍p Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ kíng-suán ê lâng tsò ông, tsò lí ê thâu. Tio̍h tuì lí ê hiann-tī tiong siat-li̍p tsi̍t-ê lâng tsò ông, tsò lí ê thâu; guā-kok lâng, m̄-sī lí ê hiann-tī ê, lí m̄-thang siat-li̍p i tsò lí ê thâu.
English: you shall surely set him king over you, whom Yahweh your God shall choose: one from among your brothers shall you set king over you; you may not put a foreigner over you, who is not your brother.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h tsún-pī tsi̍t tâi sin ê tshia kah nn̄g tsiah ū ling ê gû-bó, m̄-bat kuà taⁿ ê, kā tsiah-ê gû pa̍k tī tshia-.ni̍h, mā hō͘ gû-á kiáⁿ lī-khui i, tńg-khì in tshù.
English: Now therefore take and prepare yourselves a new cart, and two milk cows, on which there has come no yoke; and tie the cows to the cart, and bring their calves home from them;

Tailo: Iâkop tsiū uī-tio̍h La̍h-khel kā i tsò-kang tshit nî. In-uī tshim-tshim ài i, Iâkop kā tshit nî khuàⁿ-tsò kuí-ji̍t-á.
English: Jacob served seven years for Rachel. They seemed to him but a few days, for the love he had for her.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, hū-jîn-lâng só͘ seⁿ ê kiánn bô tsi̍t-ê pí Iô-há-neh khah uí-tāi; tsóng-.sī, tī Siōngtè kok-tō͘ lāi siōng bî-sè ê iáu pí i khah uí-tāi.
English: For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer, yet he who is least in the Kingdom of God is greater than he.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, in-uī i hiàn lí ê Siōngtè ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, lí tio̍h khuànn i tsò sìng, in-uī hō͘ lín tsiânn-sìng ê Siōngtsú, to̍h-sī sìng ê.
English: You shall sanctify him therefore; for he offers the bread of your God: he shall be holy to you: for I Yahweh, who sanctify you, am holy.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê Sìng Sîn tuā-tuā lîm-kàu Sâmsóng, i tsiū lo̍h-khì kàu A-si-ke-lông, kā in tiong-kan thâi-sí saⁿ-tsa̍p lâng, kā in tshiúⁿ, kā hiah-ê saⁿ hō͘ tshai-tio̍h ê lâng. Sâmsóng tuā siū-khì, tsiū tsiūⁿ-khì in lāu-pē ê ke.
English: The Spirit of Yahweh came mightily on him, and he went down to Ashkelon, and struck thirty men of them, and took their spoil, and gave the changes of clothing to those who declared the riddle. His anger was kindled, and he went up to his father's house.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, tsiàu guán ê hīⁿ-khang só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê, bô tsi̍t-ê tshin-tshiūnn Lí, Lí í-guā bô pa̍t-ê tsin-sîn.
English: Yahweh, there is none like you, neither is there any God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

Tailo: Babúlông hut-jiân siū tshia-tó, huí-huāi; tio̍h uī i thî-khàu, the̍h jú-hiuⁿ lâi tsí i ê thàng-thiàⁿ, kiám-tshái iáu ē i-.tit.
English: Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed: wail for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.

Tailo: I tshuā guá ji̍p-khì iàn-si̍k ê só͘-tsāi, īng thiàⁿ tsò kî-á tī guá ê tíng-bīn.
English: He brought me to the banquet hall. His banner over me is love.

Tailo: Iôtah tī Isulael ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su, ta̍k lâng tsáu tńg-khì in ê pò͘-pênn.
English: Judah was put to the worse before Israel; and they fled every man to his tent.

Tailo: Eliiah ìn kóng, Guá uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú — bān-kun ê Siōngtè tuā jia̍t-sim, in-uī Isulael lâng khì-sak Lí ê iok, huí-huāi Lí hiah-ê tuâⁿ, īng to thâi Lí hiah-ê sian-ti, tsí ū tshun guá tsi̍t-ê lâng, in iáu koh teh siàu-siūⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā, beh kā guá thâi.
English: He said, I have been very jealous for Yahweh, the God of Armies; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and slain your prophets with the sword: and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.

Tailo: Huān-lān khùn-khó͘ hō͘ i kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, koh iâⁿ-kuè i; tshin-tshiūnn kun-ông tsún-pī tshut-tīn.
English: Distress and anguish make him afraid; They prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

Tailo: M̄-koh, I uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê miâ kā in tsín-kiù, lâi hián-bîng I ê tuā kuân-lîng.
English: Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake, That he might make his mighty power known.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Lūbiān lâng, Ga̍t lâng, Mánáse puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k ê lâng, tuì Ka-nân tē ê Sī-lô tshut-huat, lī-khui Isulael lâng, beh tńg-khì in tit-tio̍h Gilia̍t tē, to̍h-sī tsiàu Siōngtsú thok Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng ê, tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē.
English: The children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh returned, and departed from the children of Israel out of Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan, to go to the land of Gilead, to the land of their possession, which they owned, according to the commandment of Yahweh by Moses.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Utsà siū-khì, Siōngtsú tī hia in-uī i ê tshò-gō͘ lâi kā i phah, i tsiū sí tī hia, tī Siōngtsú ê kuī piⁿ.
English: The anger of Yahweh was kindled against Uzzah; and God struck him there for his error; and there he died by the ark of God.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng teh thìng-hāu Lí, thang tsiàu-sî hō͘ in tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: These all wait for you, That you may give them their food in due season.

Tailo: I kám ē īng tsin tsē uē kiû lí? Kám ē tuì lí kóng un-jiû ê uē?
English: Will he make many petitions to you? Or will he speak soft words to you?

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Asiul ông Senahkhelip kah i ê kun-tuī kong-kik La̍hkisih ê sî, tsiū tshe i ê lô͘-po̍k kàu Êlúsalèm kìnn Iôtah ông Hitsekia kah só͘-ū tī Êlúsalèm ê Iôtah lâng, kóng,
English: After this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem, ( now he was before Lachish, and all his power with him ) , to Hezekiah king of Judah, and to all Judah who were at Jerusalem, saying,

Tailo: Iôtah tsi-tso̍k tsiàu tsong-tso̍k liam-khau só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tē, sī tī ki̍k lâm pîng, kàu Etóm ê kau-kài, ǹg lâm ti̍t-kàu Tsîn ê khòng-iá.
English: The lot for the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families was to the border of Edom, even to the wilderness of Zin southward, at the uttermost part of the south.

Tailo: Sìng Sîn suî-sî tshui-pik Iésu khì khòng-iá.
English: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.

Tailo: Uá-kīn i tsat iâⁿ ê sī Itsakal ê tsi-tso̍k, ū Tsau-al ê kiáⁿ Nathanel tsò Itsakal lâng ê siú-líng.
English: Those who encamp next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar: and the prince of the children of Issachar shall be Nethanel the son of Zuar.

Tailo: Guán luán-jio̍k, lín ióng-tsòng, guán tsiū huann-hí; guán só͘ kî-kiû ê to̍h-sī hō͘ lín ē-tàng tsiâⁿ-tsò uân-tsuân.
English: For we rejoice when we are weak and you are strong. And this we also pray for, even your perfecting.

Tailo: Isulael ông kā Iô-sa-huat kóng, Guá beh kái-tsong tsiūⁿ-tīn, lí thang tshīng ông-ho̍k. Isulael ông tsiū kái-tsong, in tsiū tsiūⁿ-tīn.
English: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and go into the battle; but put you on your robes. So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went into the battle.

Tailo: Hit khuán lâng sī ké sù-tô͘, in tsò tāi-tsì kan-tsà, ké-tsò sī Ki-tok ê sù-tô͘.
English: For such men are false apostles, deceitful workers, masquerading as Christ's apostles.

Tailo: Hit-ê Huilīsū lâng gia̍h thâu khí-lâi khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Tabi̍t, tsiū khuànn-khin i, in-uī i tsió huè, sik-tì tshiah, bīn-māu hó khuànn.
English: When the Philistine looked about, and saw David, he disdained him; for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and withal of a fair face.

Tailo: Jiânāu guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h sì-ê thiⁿ-sài khiā tī tē ê sì-kak-thâu, kā tē sì-bīn ê hong tòng teh, hō͘ hong bē tshue-lâi tē, hái kah it-tshè ê tshiū-ba̍k.
English: After this, I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, so that no wind would blow on the earth, or on the sea, or on any tree.

Tailo: Thiⁿ tshin-tshiūnn teh kńg tsheh án-ne siau-sit-.khì, suaⁿ kah hái-tó lóng iô-tsuah, lī-khui guân uī.
English: The sky was removed like a scroll when it is rolled up. Every mountain and island were moved out of their places.

Tailo: M̄-thang tshong-pōng tshut-khì kah lâng uan-ke, bián-tit kàu bué hō͘ lí ê tshù-piⁿ lîng-jio̍k ê sî, lí m̄-tsai beh án-tsuáⁿ tsò.
English: Don't be hasty in bringing charges to court. What will you do in the end when your neighbor shames you?

Tailo: I ū saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê kiáⁿ, koh saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kè kuè tī guā-kháu, mā tuì guā-kháu kā i ê kiáⁿ tshuā saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê sim-pū. I tsò Isulael ê sū-su tshit nî.
English: He had thirty sons; and thirty daughters he sent abroad, and thirty daughters he brought in from abroad for his sons. He judged Israel seven years.

Tailo: The̍h tsi̍t-ê la̍p-suè ê gîn-pè lâi hō͘ guá khuànn. In tsiū the̍h tsi̍t-ê gîn-pè hō͘ Iésu khuànn.
English: Show me the tax money. They brought to him a denarius.

Tailo: Hitsekia khuàⁿ-tio̍h Senahkhelip í-king lâi, tiāⁿ-tio̍h ì-sù beh kong-kik Êlúsalèm,
English: When Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib was come, and that he was purposed to fight against Jerusalem,

Tailo: Lán tsiah-ê sìn ê lâng, ē-tàng tsìn-ji̍p Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù ê an-hioh. Tsiàu I só͘ kóng, guá tsiū tī siū-khì tiong tsiù-tsuā kóng, In tsua̍t-tuì bē-tàng tsìn-ji̍p guá ê an-hioh. ( tsù, SPh 95:11 ) kî-si̍t Siōngtè tī tshòng-tsō ú-tiū ê sî, I ê kang-tsok í-king uân-sîng.
English: For we who have believed do enter into that rest, even as he has said, As I swore in my wrath, they will not enter into my rest; although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

Tailo: Í-tsîng bô lu̍t-huat, guá mā teh ua̍h, kài-bīng tsi̍t ē lo̍h-.lâi, tsuē tsiū ua̍h khí-.lâi, guá suah sí-.khì.
English: I was alive apart from the law once, but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.

Tailo: Guá tuì i kóng, Lí tio̍h kah guá ka-kī tuà tsē-tsē ji̍t, m̄-thang khì kiâⁿ kan-îm, mā m̄-thang tuè pa̍t lâng khì, guá mā ē án-ne tuì-thāi lí.
English: I said to her, You shall stay with me many days. You shall not play the prostitute, and you shall not be with any other man. I will also be so toward you.

Tailo: Iobuh ìn kóng:
English: Then Job answered,

Tailo: Lín kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè hián-bîng I ê îng-kng kah I ê tsì-tuā hō͘ guán khuànn, guán koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h I ê siann-im tuì hué tiong tshut-.lâi. Kin-á-ji̍t, guán mā tsai-iáⁿ Siōngtsú kah lâng kóng-uē, lâng iáu ē ua̍h.
English: and you said, Behold, Yahweh our God has shown us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire: we have seen this day that God does speak with man, and he lives.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, Lí só͘ ìng-ín Lí ê lô͘-po̍k — guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t, kóng, ' Lí ê kiáⁿ-sun nā kín-sīn in ê só͘ tsò, kiânn Guá ê lu̍t-huat, tshin-tshiūnn lí kiânn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, to̍h-sī sio̍k tī lí ê, ē tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng tsē Isulael ê kok-uī íng bô tn̄g. ' Taⁿ kiû Lí kā i ìng-giām.
English: Now therefore, Yahweh, the God of Israel, keep with your servant David my father that which you have promised him, saying, There shall not fail you a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only your children take heed to their way, to walk in my law as you have walked before me.

Tailo: Tô͘-bô͘ pháiⁿ tāi ê lâng sim tsûn kuí-tsà; khǹg lâng hô-hó ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h huann-hí.
English: Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil, But joy comes to the promoters of peace.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh kā in ê bó͘ hō͘ pa̍t lâng, kā in ê tshân-hn̂g hō͘ pa̍t lâng lâi sîng-tsiap tsò sán-gia̍p; in-uī in tuì siōng sè kàu siōng tuā ê lóng it-bī tham-sim, tuì sian-ti kàu tsè-si lóng kiânn kan-tsà.
English: Therefore will I give their wives to others, and their fields to those who shall possess them: for everyone from the least even to the greatest is given to covetousness; from the prophet even to the priest every one deals falsely.

Tailo: Lô-pa khì tsiàm Ke-na̍t kah Ke-na̍t tsiah-ê tsng-thâu, tsiū tsiàu ka-kī ê miâ kā i tshing-tsò Lô-pa.
English: Nobah went and took Kenath, and the villages of it, and called it Nobah, after his own name.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ i ê to-kiàm uan-khiau bē-tàng īng, hō͘ i tī kau-tsiàn ê sî khiā bē-tiâu.
English: Yes, you turn back the edge of his sword, And haven't supported him in battle.

Tailo: Iésu tuā-siaⁿ kiò, kóng, Thiⁿ-pē ah, guá ê lîng-hûn kau-thok Lí. kóng suah tsiū tn̄g-khuì.
English: Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said, Father, into your hands I commit my spirit! Having said this, he breathed his last.

Tailo: Tsit khuán ê uē ē tshin-tshiūⁿ to̍k-tshng seⁿ-thuàⁿ; Hu-mé-nái kah Hui-lé-toh to̍h sī tsit khuán lâng.
English: and their word will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng nā ing-kai siū phah, sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ tio̍h hō͘ i phak tī tē-.ni̍h, tī i ê bīn-tsîng, tsiàu i ê tsuē, tsiàu siàu-gia̍h kā i phah.
English: and it shall be, if the wicked man be worthy to be beaten, that the judge shall cause him to lie down, and to be beaten before his face, according to his wickedness, by number.

Tailo: Nó͘ah in-uī ū sìn-sim, tuì iáu-buē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì í-king thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtè ê bi̍k-sī, tsiū tsûn kìng-uì ê sim lâi tsún-pī tsi̍t tâi tuā tsûn thang kiù i ê tsuân ke; i tsiū án-ne lâi tīng sè-kan lâng ê tsuē, ka-kī mā tuì Siōngtè niá-siū in-uī tsit-ê sìn-sim lâi tit-tio̍h tshing-gī.
English: By faith, Noah, being warned about things not yet seen, moved with godly fear, prepared an ark for the saving of his house, through which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lia̍t ông tsū-tsi̍p, in tsò-hué tuì hia king-kuè.
English: For, behold, the kings assembled themselves, They passed by together.

Tailo: Guān siúⁿ-sù pîng-an ê Tsú tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ īng ta̍k tsióng hong-huat tshin-sin siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín pîng-an. Guān Tsú kah lín tāi-ke tông-tsāi!
English: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways. The Lord be with you all.

Tailo: Abulahàm siūⁿ kóng, Siōngtè ē-tàng hō͘ Ísak tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, só͘-í mā ē īng-tit kóng, Ísak sī sí-liáu koh tò tńg-.lâi.
English: accounting that God is able to raise up even from the dead. Figuratively speaking, he also did receive him back from the dead.

Tailo: Jiânāu, hiah-ê khì bé iû ê tsāi-sik-lí mā lâi-kàu-uī, kóng, ' Sin-seⁿ ah, sin-seⁿ ah, tshiánn kā guán khui mn̂g. '
English: Afterward the other virgins also came, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.'

Tailo: I tī ta̍k-ê huē-tn̂g kà-sī lâng, siū kûn-tsiòng ê o-ló.
English: He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.

Tailo: Jiânāu I tsiū kā hiah-ê tsē tī I sì-kho͘-uî ê lâng khuànn tsi̍t liàn, kóng, Lín tsiah-ê to̍h-sī guá ê lāu-bú kah guá ê hiann-tī.
English: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, Behold, my mother and my brothers!

Tailo: Taⁿ tsiah-ê tshè-luî kah pha̍uh í-king kàu-gia̍h à, kiû lín tuì Siōngtsú kî-tó, guá tsiū tsún lín lī-khui, m̄-bián koh tuà tsia.
English: Pray to Yahweh; for there has been enough of mighty thunderings and hail. I will let you go, and you shall stay no longer.

Tailo: Isulael tso̍k kiânn bê-lō͘ lī-khui Guá ê sî, tsè-si Lēbī lâng Tsa-tok ê kiáⁿ-sun, iû-guân kò͘-siú Guá ê sìng-só͘, in ē tshin-kīn Guá, kā Guá ho̍k-sāi, koh khiā tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, īng iû kah hueh hiàn hō͘ Guá. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: But the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok, who kept the charge of my sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from me, they shall come near to me to minister to me; and they shall stand before me to offer to me the fat and the blood, says the Lord Yahweh:

Tailo: Gia̍h tshit ki kó͘-tshue hit tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài, tsún-pī hó-sè beh pûn.
English: The seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.

Tailo: Guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē tsiū tsē-.leh, thî-khàu pi-ai kuí-nā ji̍t, tī thinn-tíng ê Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, kóng,
English: It happened, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned certain days; and I fasted and prayed before the God of heaven,

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Kóng-tio̍h tsit-ê só͘-tsāi, lín ū kóng: Sī pha-hng, bô lâng, bô tsing-seⁿ ê só͘-tsāi, tsóng-.sī, tī tsit só͘-tsāi í-ki̍p pha-hng, bô lâng, bô jîn-ian, bô tsing-seⁿ ê Iôtah tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah Êlúsalèm ê ke-lō͘,
English: Thus says Yahweh: Yet again there shall be heard in this place, about which you say, It is waste, without man and without animal, even in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, that are desolate, without man and without inhabitant and without animal,

Tailo: Lán kin-á-ji̍t tī tsia só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì, sī ta̍k lâng tsiàu án-ne kiânn ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò sī tio̍h ê, lín tsiong-lâi m̄-thang án-ne kiânn.
English: You shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatever is right in his own eyes;

Tailo: Lí tshe lí ê lô͘-po̍k lâi bú-bān Siōngtsú kóng: Guá tuà tsin tsē tsiàn-tshia tsiūⁿ-kàu suaⁿ kuân ê só͘-tsāi, kàu Le-ba-nòng ki̍k tshim ê só͘-tsāi; guá beh tshò hit-tsâng kuân-tuā ê pik-hiuⁿ tshâ kah siōng hó ê siông tshiū. Guá beh tsiūⁿ-kàu ki̍k kuân ê só͘-tsāi kah hiah-ê puî tē ê tshiū-nâ.
English: By your servants, have you defied the Lord, and have said, With the multitude of my chariots I have come up to the height of the mountains, to the innermost parts of Lebanon. I will cut down its tall cedars and its choice fir trees. I will enter into its farthest height, the forest of its fruitful field.

Tailo: In-uī lán nā kah Ki-tok Iésu kiat-liân, ū siū kat-lé á-.sī bô siū kat-lé lóng bô iàu-kín, iàu-kín ê sī tuì thiàⁿ-sim piáu-hiān tshut-.lâi ê sìn-sim.
English: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision amounts to anything, nor uncircumcision, but faith working through love.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Lí nā kuī lo̍h-lâi pài guá, tsiah-ê it-tshè lóng beh hō͘ Lí.
English: If you therefore will worship before me, it will all be yours.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá sī khùn-khó͘ sàn-tshiah, Tsú iáu-koh siàu-liām guá; Lí teh pang-tsān guá koh tsín-kiù guá. Guá ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí m̄-thang iân-tshiân!
English: But I am poor and needy; May the Lord think about me. You are my help and my deliverer. Don't delay, my God.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng khuànn ián bē iâⁿ i, tsiū siàn Iâkop ê tuā-thuí-khū; sio-ián ê sî, Iâkop ê tuā-thuí-khū tsuāiⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: When he saw that he didn't prevail against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh, and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was strained, as he wrestled.

Tailo: Guá bat tshing lí ê miâ tsò ' tsheⁿ-tshuì ê kaⁿ-ná tshiū', hó khuànn, mā kiat hó kué-tsí; taⁿ Guá beh īng huā-huā jióng ê siann, khí hué tī i ê tíng-bīn, ki-ue mā siū at-tn̄g.
English: Yahweh called your name, A green olive tree, beautiful with goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he has kindled fire on it, and the branches of it are broken.

Tailo: Tng i teh sio hiuⁿ ê sî, huē-tsiòng kui tuā-tīn tī guā-bīn teh kî-tó.
English: The whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê Sìng Sîn tuā-tuā lîm-kàu Sâmsóng, i ê tshiú bô ke-si, mā kā i thiah-li̍h, tshin-tshiūnn thiah-li̍h suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á án-ne. I mā bô kā i ê pē-bú kóng i só͘ kiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: The Spirit of Yahweh came mightily on him, and he tore him as he would have torn a kid; and he had nothing in his hand: but he didn't tell his father or his mother what he had done.

Tailo: Ionáthan kah Tabi̍t nn̄g lâng kiat iok, in-uī i thiàⁿ Tabi̍t tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul.

Tailo: Ho-lóng kah i ê kau-iá, Te-bil kah i ê kau-iá,
English: and Holon with its suburbs, and Debir with its suburbs,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu Pe-thó-el ê kiáⁿ Iô-el:
English: The Word of Yahweh that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel.

Tailo: sī tuì Al-nông suaⁿ-kok piⁿ ê A-ló-el kah suaⁿ-kok tiong ê siâⁿ, í-ki̍p Me-tí-ba ê tsuân pîng-guân, it-ti̍t kàu Ti-bóng,
English: from Aroer, that is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the city that is in the middle of the valley, and all the plain of Medeba to Dibon;

Tailo: Jiânāu tuì thinn-tíng kàng-lo̍h tuā-lia̍p pha̍uh, ta̍k-lia̍p ê tāng-liōng lóng ū kuí-nā-tsa̍p kong-kin. Lâng uī-tio̍h pha̍uh ê tsai-hō, tsiū siat-to̍k Siōngtè, in-uī hit-ê tsai-hō hui-siông giâm-tiōng.
English: Great hailstones, about the weight of a talent, came down out of the sky on people. People blasphemed God because of the plague of the hail, for this plague is exceedingly severe.

Tailo: I kah i ê lô͘-po̍k thàu-mê hun tuī, kā in kong-kik; it-ti̍t jiok kàu Ta-má-su-ko tò pîng ê Hôpa,
English: He divided himself against them by night, he and his servants, and struck them, and pursued them to Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.

Tailo: Babúlông ông tī Tsetikiah ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, thâi-sí i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, koh tī Lip-la̍h thâi-sí Iôtah só͘-ū ê kuì-tso̍k.
English: The king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes: he killed also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.

Tailo: Tuì guân-khí-thâu, tsit-ê tō tsiū kah Siōngtè tông-tsāi.
English: The same was in the beginning with God.

Tailo: Gîtióng tuì i kóng, Guá ê tsú ah, nā Siōngtsú kah guán tông-tsāi, guán án-tsuáⁿ tú-tio̍h tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì? Guán ê tsó͘-sian só͘ kā guán kóng Siōngtsú hiah-ê kî-sū tī tó-uī? In kóng, ' I kám bô tshuā guán tuì Aigi̍p tshut-.lâi? ' Taⁿ Siōngtsú pàng-sak guán, kā guán kau tī Mítiân lâng ê tshiú tiong.
English: Gideon said to him, Oh, my lord, if Yahweh is with us, why then has all this happened to us? and where are all his wondrous works which our fathers told us of, saying, Did not Yahweh bring us up from Egypt? but now Yahweh has cast us off, and delivered us into the hand of Midian.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng kah king-ha̍k kàu-su nga̍uh-nga̍uh-liām, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsiap-la̍p tsuē-jîn koh kah in tsò-hué tsia̍h pn̄g!
English: The Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.

Tailo: Lín bô tsia̍h piáⁿ, mā bô lim tshing-tsiú, kāu tsiú, tse sī beh hō͘ lín tsai-iáⁿ Siōngtsú to̍h-sī lín ê Siōngtè.
English: You have not eaten bread, neither have you drunk wine or strong drink; that you may know that I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Lí tsi̍t ē pûn-hong, hái tsiū kā in khàm ba̍t; in tshin-tshiūnn iân tîm tī tuā-tsuí tiong.
English: You blew with your wind. The sea covered them. They sank like lead in the mighty waters.

Tailo: Lí ê sing-khu só͘ seⁿ ê, lí ê thó͘-tē só͘ tshut ê, lí ê tsing-seⁿ só͘ tshut ê, í-ki̍p gû ê gû-á kiáⁿ, iûⁿ ê iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ, lóng ē tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Blessed shall be the fruit of your body, and the fruit of your ground, and the fruit of your animals, the increase of your livestock, and the young of your flock.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came again to me, saying,

Tailo: In koh kóng, Lâi! Lán tio̍h khí siâⁿ kah thah, thah-tíng tú thiⁿ, uī lán li̍p tsi̍t-ê miâ, bián-tit lán sì-suàⁿ tī tsuân tē.
English: They said, Come, let's build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let's make ourselves a name, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth.

Tailo: Kiû lí ín-tsún, lán thang tī tshiûⁿ tíng khí tsi̍t king sè-king pâng, tī hia kā i an-tì bîn-tshn̂g, toh, í kah ting-tâi, hō͘ i lâi lán tsia, thang ji̍p-khì hioh-khùn.
English: Let us make, Please, a little chamber on the wall; and let us set for him there a bed, and a table, and a seat, and a lamp stand: and it shall be, when he comes to us, that he shall turn in there.

Tailo: I tsò tāi-tsì tuā kàu bē tshik-to̍k tit, kiânn kî-sū sǹg bē-liáu.
English: Who does great things past finding out, Yes, marvelous things without number.

Tailo: In só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê sī hi-ké, sī pe̍h-tsha̍t ê tsiam-pok. In kóng tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê, kî-si̍t Siōngtsú bô tshe in tsò sian-ti, in iáu teh ǹg-bāng hit-ê uē ē ìng-giām.
English: They have seen falsehood and lying divination, who say, Yahweh says; but Yahweh has not sent them: and they have made men to hope that the word would be confirmed.

Tailo: hō͘ lán ê sim kui-ǹg I, lâi kiâⁿ I it-tshè ê tō-lō͘, siú I só͘ bīng-līng lán ê tsó͘-sian ê kài-bīng, lu̍t-lē, huat-tō͘.
English: that he may incline our hearts to him, to walk in all his ways, and to keep his commandments, and his statutes, and his ordinances, which he commanded our fathers.

Tailo: Tshit ji̍t tio̍h hiàn hué-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú, tē-tshit ji̍t sī sìng-huē, lóng m̄-thang tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h khó͘-kang.
English: But you shall offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh seven days. In the seventh day is a holy convocation: you shall do no regular work.'

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lu̍t-huat ū kì-tsài siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí tha̍k-liáu án-tsuáⁿ?
English: He said to him, What is written in the law? How do you read it?

Tailo: Tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng gâu jióng, bô siū iok-sok; i ê kha bô tuà tī tshù.
English: She is loud and defiant. Her feet don't stay in her house.

Tailo: I koh siúⁿ-sù hok-khì hō͘ in, hō͘ in seⁿ-thuàⁿ tsin tsē, mā hō͘ in ê tsing-seⁿ bô kiám-tsió.
English: He blesses them also, so that they are multiplied greatly. He doesn't allow their livestock to decrease.

Tailo: Hit-ê kài tuì hia khì-kàu Lùtsuh, kàu Lùtsuh lâm pîng ê piⁿ-á ( Lùtsuh to̍h-sī Bethel ) , i ê kài koh lo̍h-khì kàu A-tha-lio̍k-a-ta̍t, uá-kīn ē-bīn ê Bia̍t-ho-lông lâm pîng ê suaⁿ;
English: The border passed along from there to Luz, to the side of Luz ( the same is Bethel ) , southward; and the border went down to Ataroth Addar, by the mountain that lies on the south of Beth Horon the lower.

Tailo: Tī hit ji̍t, lín ē kóng: Tio̍h kám-siā Siōngtsú, kiû-kiò I ê miâ, kā I só͘ kiâⁿ ê tī lia̍t pang tiong suan-iông, kóng-khí I ê miâ í-king siū tsun-tsò kuân.
English: In that day you will say, Give thanks to Yahweh! Call on his name. Declare his doings among the peoples. Proclaim that his name is exalted!

Tailo: Lí ê tsó͘-sian ê pháiⁿ, Iôtah lia̍t ông ê pháiⁿ, in ê hō͘-hui ê pháiⁿ, lín ka-kī ê pháiⁿ, lín ê bó͘ ê pháiⁿ, to̍h-sī tī Iôtah tē, Êlúsalèm ke-lō͘ só͘ kiâⁿ ê, lín kám bē kì-.tit?
English: Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, and the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their wives, and your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives which they committed in the land of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem?

Tailo: Tshî-siú tì-huī ê lâng tuì i lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā, khîⁿ-tiâu i ê lâng lóng ū hok-khì.
English: She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her. Happy is everyone who retains her.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, guán ê lāu-pē kah a-kong siū to thâi, guán ê kiáⁿ-jî kah guán ê bó͘ mā hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì.
English: For, behold, our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons and our daughters and our wives are in captivity for this.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì sian-ti án-ne kóng, ' Siōngtsú ìn lí siáⁿ-mi̍h? Siōngtsú kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? '
English: Thus shall you say to the prophet, What has Yahweh answered you? and, What has Yahweh spoken?

Tailo: Kiàn-nā īng pak-tó͘ kiânn ê kah īng sì-kha kiânn ê, á-.sī ū tsin tsē kha ê, to̍h-sī só͘-ū tī tē-tsiūⁿ pê ê, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h, in-uī he sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h.
English: Whatever goes on its belly, and whatever goes on all fours, or whatever has many feet, even all creeping things that creep on the earth, them you shall not eat; for they are an abomination.

Tailo: Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ Ioap tsai-iáⁿ ông ê sim ì-hiòng Αpsalôm,
English: Now Joab the son of Zeruiah perceived that the king's heart was toward Absalom.

Tailo: Uī tshing-bān lâng tsûn tsû-ài, sià-bián tsuē-kò, kuè-sit kah tsuē-ok, tsua̍t-tuì bô lia̍h ū tsuē ê tsò bô tsuē, ē kui-kiū i ê tsuē, tuì pē kàu kiáⁿ, kàu sun, kàu saⁿ-sì tāi.
English: keeping loving kindness for thousands, forgiving iniquity and disobedience and sin; and that will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, and on the children's children, on the third and on the fourth generation.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê an-uì kah I un-hô khǹg lí ê uē, lí kám khuàⁿ-tsò sī sió-khuá?
English: Are the consolations of God too small for you, Even the word that is gentle toward you?

Tailo: Si-phian Tē-gō͘ Kuàn ( 107~150 phiⁿ ) Lín tio̍h kám-siā Siōngtsú, in-uī I sī hó; in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi!
English: Give thanks to Yahweh, For he is good, For his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tsit khuán ê tāi-tsì, siáⁿ lâng bat thiaⁿ-.tio̍h? Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì siáⁿ lâng bat khuàⁿ-.tio̍h? Kok kám ē tsi̍t ji̍t to̍h lâi kiàn-li̍p? Jîn-bîn kám ē tsi̍t-sî-á to̍h lâi tshut-sì? Tsóng-.sī, Si-óng tsi̍t-ē tú-tio̍h seⁿ kiáⁿ ê kan-khó͘ tsiū seⁿ kiáⁿ-jî.
English: Who has heard such a thing? who has seen such things? Shall a land be born in one day? shall a nation be brought forth at once? for as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Mô͘se tsun-thàn i ê tiūⁿ-lâng ê uē, lóng tsiàu i só͘ kóng ê khì kiâⁿ.
English: So Moses listened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-sài tuì i kóng, Tsa-kha-lī-a, m̄-bián kiaⁿ, in-uī Siōngtè í-king thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê kî-tó. Lí ê bó͘ E-lí-sa-biat beh seⁿ kiáⁿ, lí tio̍h kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Iô-há-neh.
English: But the angel said to him, Don't be afraid, Zacharias, because your request has been heard, and your wife, Elizabeth, will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.

Tailo: A-siang kah i ê kau-iá, Bia̍t-si-mé-si kah i ê kau-iá.
English: and Ashan with its suburbs, and Beth Shemesh with its suburbs;

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè ah, guān Lí ànn-lo̍h siàu-liām Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê kî-tó kah khún-kiû, lâi thiaⁿ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng só͘ kî-tó kah kiû-kiò.
English: Yet have you respect to the prayer of your servant, and to his supplication, Yahweh my God, to listen to the cry and to the prayer which your servant prays before you;

Tailo: Iosiúah kā tsiah-ê uē lóng siá tī Siōngtè lu̍t-huat ê tsheh, koh tī hia khiā tsi̍t tè tuā tsio̍h-thâu, to̍h-sī tī Siōngtsú sìng-só͘ ê piⁿ-á ê siōng tshiū kha.
English: Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God; and he took a great stone, and set it up there under the oak that was by the sanctuary of Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí tuì Lí ê lô͘-po̍k — guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t só͘ ìng-ín ê, Lí ū siú iok. Lí tshin-tshuì kóng ê, ū tshin-tshiú kā i ìng-giām, tú tsiàu kin-á-ji̍t ê khuán.
English: who have kept with your servant David my father that which you did promise him: yes, you spoke with your mouth, and have fulfilled it with your hand, as it is this day.

Tailo: Uá-khò Sìng Sîn ê pang-tsān, lín mā tsò-hué siū khí-tsō, lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò Siōngtè só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: in whom you also are built together for a habitation of God in the Spirit.

Tailo: Guá kā tsiah-ê kuì-tso̍k, kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ kah kî-tha ê jîn-bîn kóng, Tsit-ê kang tsin khuah-tuā, lán tī siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tíng hun-khui, sio-lī put-tsí hn̄g.
English: I said to the nobles, and to the rulers and to the rest of the people, The work is great and large, and we are separated on the wall, one far from another:

Tailo: Taⁿ lí ê lú-pī só͘ tuà-lâi hō͘ guá ê tsú ê lé-mi̍h, thang hō͘ kin-tuè guá ê tsú ê siàu-liân lâng.
English: Now this present which your servant has brought to my lord, let it be given to the young men who follow my lord.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsò Isulael ông kiōng sì-tsa̍p nî; tī Hebúlông tsò ông tshit nî, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông saⁿ-tsa̍p saⁿ nî.
English: The days that David reigned over Israel were forty years; seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty-three years reigned he in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hit-ê ngē-ngē beh tsò hit-ê tāi-tsì ê lâng, bô-lūn sī pún-tē-lâng á-.sī kià-kha ê, i siat-to̍k Siōngtsú, tio̍h tuì i ê jîn-bîn tiong kā i tsián-tû.
English: But the soul who does anything with a high hand, whether he is native-born or a foreigner, the same blasphemes Yahweh; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

Tailo: Iâkop kā i kóng, Guá ho̍k-sāi lí án-tsuáⁿ, lí ê tsing-seⁿ tī guá ê tshiú-thâu án-tsuáⁿ, lí lóng tsai.
English: He said to him, You know how I have served you, and how your livestock have fared with me.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú sī kong-gī, I ì-ài kong-gī; tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng ē kìⁿ-tio̍h I ê bīn.
English: For Yahweh is righteous. He loves righteousness. The upright shall see his face.

Tailo: In khì-kàu tsi̍t-ê kiò-tsò Na-tsa-lia̍t ê siâⁿ, tsiū tī hia tuà. Tse sī beh ìng-giām tsá-tsîng Siōngtè kau-tài sian-ti só͘ kóng ê uē, I beh kiò-tsò Na-tsa-lia̍t lâng.
English: and came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets: He will be called a Nazarene.

Tailo: I beh tsín-kiù lán thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k kah só͘-ū uàn-hūn lán ê lâng ê tshiú,
English: Salvation from our enemies, and from the hand of all who hate us;

Tailo: Elísiah kā i kóng, Hit-ê lâng lo̍h-tshia tò tńg-lâi kā lí gîng-tsiap ê sî, guá ê sim kám bô kah lí khì? Tse kám sī tsiap-siū gîn, tsiap-siū saⁿ-khò͘, kaⁿ-ná hn̂g, phû-tô hn̂g, gû, iûⁿ, lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī ê sî?
English: He said to him, Didn't my heart go with you, when the man turned from his chariot to meet you? Is it a time to receive money, and to receive garments, and olive groves and vineyards, and sheep and oxen, and male servants and female servants?

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ū tsi̍t-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tú-tio̍h i, sī ki-lí ê táⁿ-pān, ū káu-kuài ê sim-su.
English: Behold, there a woman met him with the attire of a prostitute, And with crafty intent.

Tailo: M̄-thang ū lâng kah lí tsò-hué lâi, piàn-suaⁿ lóng m̄-thang khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū lâng, tī suaⁿ-kha mā m̄-thang hō͘ gû-kûn, iûⁿ-kûn tsia̍h tsháu.
English: No one shall come up with you; neither let anyone be seen throughout all the mountain; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mountain.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí tīng in ê tsuē! Hō͘ in hām-lo̍h tī ka-kī ê kè-bô͘; in ê tsuē-kò tsin tsē, guān Lí kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, in-uī in puē-puān Lí.
English: Hold them guilty, God. Let them fall by their own counsels; Thrust them out in the multitude of their transgressions, For they have rebelled against you.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu tuì in kóng, Guá mā tio̍h khì pa̍t-ê siâⁿ-tshī thuân Siōngtè kok-tō͘ ê hok-im, in-uī tse sī Siōngtè tshe-phài guá lâi ê bo̍k-tik.
English: But he said to them, I must preach the good news of the Kingdom of God to the other cities also. For this reason I have been sent.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsip-siú, thiaⁿ-thàn guá bīng-līng lí it-tshè ê uē, kiânn Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó koh tio̍h ê tāi-tsì. Án-ne, lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-sun tsiū ē-tàng íng-uán tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Observe and hear all these words which I command you, that it may go well with you, and with your children after you forever, when you do that which is good and right in the eyes of Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Samuel ìn kóng, Uī-tio̍h pîng-an, guá sī beh tsè-hiàn Siōngtsú. Lín tio̍h tshing-khì ka-kī, lâi kah guá hù tsè-sū. Samuel tsiū hō͘ I-é-sái kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ tshing-khì, kiò in lâi hù tsè-sū.
English: He said, Peaceably; I am come to sacrifice to Yahweh: sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. He sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-tuā-tīn lâng teh tuè Iésu, kî-tiong ū tsi̍t-kuá hū-jîn-lâng uī I pi-siong thî-khàu.
English: A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him.

Tailo: Kìng-uì Siōngtsú ê lâng bô-lūn tuā-sè, I lóng ē sù hok-khì hō͘ in.
English: He will bless those who fear Yahweh, Both small and great.

Tailo: I mn̄g kóng, Tsú ah, Lí sī siáⁿ lâng? Hit-ê siann kóng, Guá to̍h sī lí só͘ pik-hāi ê Iésu.
English: He said, Who are you, Lord? The Lord said, I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng hîng hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè ê kim-uân, to̍h-sī tsiah-ê, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h Asito͘t, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h Ga-jah, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h A-si-ke-lông, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h Gat, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h Ik-lóng.
English: These are the golden tumors which the Philistines returned for a trespass offering to Yahweh: for Ashdod one, for Gaza one, for Ashkelon one, for Gath one, for Ekron one;

Tailo: Tiōng-hu kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t m̄-sī gue̍h ê tshe-it, mā m̄-sī an-hioh, lí án-tsuáⁿ beh khì i hia? Tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Pîng-an.
English: He said, Why will you go to him today? it is neither new moon nor Sabbath. She said, It shall be well.

Tailo: In ji̍p-khì beh hiàn tsè-sū sio-tsè. E-hú tāi-sing an-tì peh-tsa̍p lâng tī guā-bīn, kóng, Guá kā tsiah-ê lâng kau tī lín ê tshiú, nā ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tsáu-.khì, pàng i tsáu ê lâng, i ê miā tio̍h puê miā!
English: They went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now Jehu had appointed him eighty men outside, and said, If any of the men whom I bring into your hands escape, he who lets him go, his life shall be for the life of him.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí kiù guá thuat-lī guá ê tuì-ti̍k! Hō͘ guá tsáu-khì bih tī Lí hia.
English: Deliver me, Yahweh, from my enemies. I flee to you to hide me.

Tailo: Nā gín-á bô kah guá tsò-hué khì, guán ná ē-tàng tńg-khì kìnn guán ê lāu-pē? Khióng-kiaⁿ guán ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h guán lāu-pē só͘ beh tú-.tio̍h ê tsai-hō.
English: For how will I go up to my father, if the boy isn't with me?lest I see the evil that will come on my father.

Tailo: I nā bô hiann-tī, tsiū tio̍h kā i ê sán-gia̍p hō͘ i ê lāu-pē ê hiann-tī.
English: If he have no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father's brothers.

Tailo: Guān lín tuì lán ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè kah Tsú Iésu Ki-tok, tit-tio̍h un-tián kah pîng-an.
English: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Tailo: Án-ne, in beh kā Guá ê miâ hē tī Isulael lâng ê tíng-bīn, Guá mā beh sù-hok hō͘ in.
English: So they shall put my name on the children of Israel; and I will bless them.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē īng siau-sán, jia̍t-pēⁿ, huat-iām, to̍k-jia̍t, to-kiàm, ko͘-tâ, hiú-nuā lâi kā lí kong-kik, tsiah-ê lóng ē kā lí jiok, it-ti̍t kàu lí bia̍t-bông.
English: Yahweh will strike you with consumption, and with fever, and with inflammation, and with fiery heat, and with the sword, and with blasting, and with mildew; and they shall pursue you until you perish.

Tailo: Siat-sú i tī hí-nî í-āu kā tē hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tuì hit sî kàu hí-nî só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê nî-gia̍h lâi sǹg i ê kè-tsînn, mā tio̍h tuì lí só͘ kó͘ ê, lâi kā i kiám-tsió.
English: But if he dedicates his field after the Jubilee, then the priest shall reckon to him the money according to the years that remain to the Year of Jubilee; and an abatement shall be made from your valuation.

Tailo: Guá tsiū beh án-ne kā lín khuán-thāi, Guá tiāⁿ-tio̍h beh hō͘ lín kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, siau-sán, jia̍t-pēⁿ, ba̍k-tsiu phah-pháiⁿ, sim iu-siong. Lín ē khang-khang iā tsíng, in-uī lín ê tuì-ti̍k ē kā tsíng-tsí tsia̍h tiāu.
English: I also will do this to you: I will appoint terror over you, even consumption and fever, that shall consume the eyes, and make the soul to pine away; and you will sow your seed in vain, for your enemies will eat it.

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to koh ìn kóng, Án-ne, lín kiò-tsò Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông hit uī, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kā I pān?
English: Pilate again asked them, What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h khak-si̍t tsai, lín tī só͘ beh khì kià-kha ê tē, ē tuì to-kiàm, tuì ki-hng, tuì un-i̍k lâi sí.
English: Now therefore know certainly that you shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place where you desire to go to sojourn there.

Tailo: koh īng sûn-kim tsò tsián-to, puânn, sî kah hué-tiáⁿ. Kóng-tio̍h tshù ê mn̂g-lō͘, i ê lāi-bīn ê tsì-sìng-só͘ ê mn̂g kah tshù ê mn̂g, to̍h-sī tiān ê mn̂g, lóng sī kim ê.
English: and the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and the fire pans, of pure gold: and as for the entry of the house, the inner doors of it for the most holy place, and the doors of the house, to wit, of the temple, were of gold.

Tailo: Iésu mn̄g i kóng, Lí hō-tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h miâ? Hit-ê lâng ìn kóng, Guá ê miâ kiò-tsò ' Kun-thuân', in-uī guán sī kui tuā-tīn ê kuí.
English: He asked him, What is your name? He said to him, My name is Legion, for we are many.

Tailo: Iésu tuì in kóng, Lâng ná ē kóng Ki-tok sī Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun?
English: He said to them, Why do they say that the Christ is David's son?

Tailo: Ông nā lia̍h-tsò hó, tsiū tshut jū-tsí siá tī Phelsiah kah Ma-tái ê lu̍t-lē tiong, hō͘ i bē kái-uāⁿ tit, m̄-tsún Ua-si-thih koh kàu Ahasuiló͘ ông ê bīn-tsîng, ông mā tio̍h kā ông-hō͘ ê uī siúⁿ-sù hō͘ pí i khah hó ê lâng.
English: If it please the king, let there go forth a royal commandment from him, and let it be written among the laws of the Persians and the Medes, that it not be altered, that Vashti come no more before king Ahasuerus; and let the king give her royal estate to another who is better than she.

Tailo: Tsetikiah tuì I-é-lí-miah kóng, M̄-thang hō͘ lâng tsai tsiah-ê uē, lí tsiū bē sí.
English: Then said Zedekiah to Jeremiah, Let no man know of these words, and you shall not die.

Tailo: Taⁿ in ê tsuē-kò ná huān ná tsē, īng in ê gîn uī ka-kī tsng pu̍t, in tsiàu in ê kî-khiáu lâi tsō ngó͘-siōng, lóng sī sai-hū só͘ tsò ê. In gī-lūn kóng, hiàn tsè ê lâng tio̍h kah gû-á tsim-tshuì.
English: Now they sin more and more, And have made themselves molten images of their silver, Even idols according to their own understanding, All of them the work of the craftsmen. They say of them, They offer human sacrifice and kiss the calves.

Tailo: Koh kóng, Alâm lâng nā pí guá khah kiông, lí tio̍h lâi pang-tsān guá; Ammóng lâng nā pí lí khah kiông, guá tsiū khì pang-tsān lí.
English: He said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the children of Ammon be too strong for you, then I will help you.

Tailo: Koh īng hit-ê iû hiù tuâⁿ tíng tshit pái, mā buah tuâⁿ kah i só͘-ū ê khì-kū í-ki̍p sé-tn̄g ê phûn kah i ê tsō, kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: He sprinkled it on the altar seven times, and anointed the altar and all its vessels, and the basin and its base, to sanctify them.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê hái iô-tsuah, hái-íng huā-huā háu, bān-bîn suan-hua, Lí hō͘ in lóng pîng-tsīng.
English: Who stills the roaring of the seas, The roaring of their waves, And the turmoil of the nations.

Tailo: Huē-bō͘ í-ki̍p tiâⁿ lāi sì-kho͘-uî só͘ tìng ê ting, lóng sī tâng ê.
English: All the pins of the tent, and around the court, were of brass.

Tailo: Koh khùn tsi̍t-sî-á, koh bîn tsi̍t-sî-á, koh theⁿ tsi̍t-sî-á,
English: A little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to sleep;

Tailo: Só͘lômóng ê Tsim-giân, tì-huī ê kiáⁿ hō͘ lāu-pē huann-hí; gû-gōng ê kiáⁿ hō͘ lāu-bú iu-būn.
English: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes a glad father; But a foolish son brings grief to his mother.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê uē si̍t-tsāi kóng liáu tsin tio̍h. Guá ài lí ti̍k-pia̍t kiông-tiāu tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, thang hō͘ sìn Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tsuan-sim tsò hó sū. Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng sī hó, koh tuì lâng ū lī-ik.
English: This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men;

Tailo: Iôséhuh ê kiáⁿ-sun tuì Iosiúah kóng, Siōngtsú pîng-sî sù-hok guán, guán tsiū tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā tso̍k, lí án-tsuáⁿ kan-taⁿ īng tsi̍t khau ê hūn-gia̍h hō͘ guán tsò sán-gia̍p?
English: The children of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, Why have you given me but one lot and one part for an inheritance, seeing I am a great people, because hitherto Yahweh has blessed me?

Tailo: In-uī ū kì-tsài, jio̍k-thé lóng tshin-tshiūnn tsháu, in ê îng-kng lóng tshin-tshiūnn iá-hue; tsháu ē ta, hue ē siā.
English: For, All flesh is like grass, And all of man's glory like the flower in the grass. The grass withers, and its flower falls;

Tailo: Sai nā bô kā-tio̍h mi̍h, kám ē tī tshiū-nâ lāi háu? Sè tsiah ióng-bíng ê sai nā bô tit-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h, kám ē tuì hia̍t lāi tshut siaⁿ?
English: Will a lion roar in the thicket, When he has no prey? Does a young lion cry out of his den, If he has caught nothing?

Tailo: Ki-lō͘-ping tsit pîng ê si̍t gō͘ tiú, hit pîng ê si̍t gō͘ tiú; tuì tsit pîng ê si̍t-bué kàu hit pîng ê si̍t-bué, kiōng tsa̍p tiú.
English: Five cubits was the one wing of the cherub, and five cubits the other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing to the uttermost part of the other were ten cubits.

Tailo: Lia̍t-pang ê sù-tsiá tshin-tshiūnn tsin tsē tsuí teh tsáu-tsông; tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú kā in huah, in tsiū tsáu hn̄g-hn̄g, koh siū jiok, tshin-tshiūnn tī suaⁿ tíng hō͘ hong teh tshue ê tsho͘-khng, koh tshin-tshiūnn tuā hong thâu-tsîng teh kńg ê mi̍h.
English: The nations will rush like the rushing of many waters: but he will rebuke them, and they will flee far off, and will be chased like the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and like the whirling dust before the storm.

Tailo: In tsiàu tē-kài pun tē tsò sán-gia̍p í-king uân-sîng, Isulael lâng tsiū tī in tiong-kan kā tē hō͘ Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: So they made an end of distributing the land for inheritance by the borders of it; and the children of Israel gave an inheritance to Joshua the son of Nun in the midst of them:

Tailo: Tsit-ê lâng lī-khui Iôtah Bia̍tléhèm, beh tshuē tsi̍t-ê thang tuà ê só͘-tsāi. Kiâⁿ- lō͘ ê sî, lâi-kàu Ehulaim ê suaⁿ-tē, Mika ê tshù.
English: The man departed out of the city, out of Bethlehem Judah, to sojourn where he could find a place, and he came to the hill country of Ephraim to the house of Micah, as he traveled.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Tsetikiah tē-tsa̍p nî, to̍h-sī Nepkatnetsal tsa̍p-peh nî, ū Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah.
English: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.

Tailo: Ū Iâkop ê Siōngtè tsò i ê pang-tsān ê lâng ū hok-khì! Gióng-bōng i ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ê lâng ū hok-khì!
English: Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, Whose hope is in Yahweh, his God:

Tailo: I ê bûn-tô͘ mn̄g kóng, Lāu-su, tsit-ê lâng tshut-sì to̍h tsheⁿ-mê, sī siáⁿ lâng huān tsuē? Sī i pún-sin á-.sī i ê pē-bú?
English: His disciples asked him, Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?

Tailo: In tsiū tuì pò͘-pêⁿ lāi the̍h tshut-.lâi, tuà kàu Iosiúah kah Isulael jîn-bîn hia, hē tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: They took them from the midst of the tent, and brought them to Joshua, and to all the children of Israel; and they laid them down before Yahweh.

Tailo: M̄-thang hō͘ in tuà tī lí ê thó͘-tē, khióng-kiaⁿ in ē hō͘ lí tik-tsuē Guá. Lí nā ho̍k-sāi in ê sîn-bîng, tse ē tsiâⁿ-tsò lí ê lô-bāng.
English: They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against me, for if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.

Tailo: Amáli̍k lâng kah Ka-nân lâng tuà tī suaⁿ-kok tiong, bîn-á-tsài lín tio̍h ua̍t tò-tńg, tuì Âng-hái ê lō͘ khì khòng-iá.
English: Now the Amalekite and the Canaanite dwell in the valley: tomorrow turn you, and get you into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.

Tailo: Uē kóng suah, suî-sî tuì i ê ba̍k-tsiu ū tshin-tshiūnn hî-lân ê mi̍h lak lo̍h-.lâi, i tsiū koh ū khuànn-kìnn, khí-lâi niá siū sé-lé.
English: Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he received his sight. He arose and was baptized.

Tailo: Guá beh kiû-kiò Siōngtsú, I sī ing-kai o-ló ê, án-ne guá ē tit-tio̍h kiù, thuat-lī guá ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: I will call on Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised: So shall I be saved from my enemies.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hiah-ê lâng khuán-thāi guán tsin hó, guán tī tshân-iá kah in óng-lâi ê sî, lóng bô siū siong-hāi, mā bô sit-lo̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: But the men were very good to us, and we were not hurt, neither missed we anything, as long as we went with them, when we were in the fields:

Tailo: Ioap īng sǹg jîn-bîn ê sò͘-gia̍h thîng-pò hō͘ ông tsai. Gia̍h to ê ióng-sū, Isulael lâng ū peh-tsa̍p bān, Iôtah lâng ū gō͘-tsa̍p bān.
English: Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people to the king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men who drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.

Tailo: Guān ông ē thè khùn-khó͘ ê jîn-bîn sin-uan, ē kiù sàn-tshiah lâng, ē kā pō-gio̍k ê lâng teh tshuì.
English: He will judge the poor of the people. He will save the children of the needy, And will break the oppressor in pieces.

Tailo: Tī in thâu-khak tíng ê kiong-tshong tíng-bīn ū pó-tsō ê hîng-siōng, tshin-tshiūnn nâ-sik ê pó-tsio̍h; tī pó-tsō hîng-siōng ê tíng-bīn ū hîng-siōng tshin-tshiūnn lâng ê khuán-sit.
English: Above the expanse that was over their heads was the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone; and on the likeness of the throne was a likeness as the appearance of a man on it above.

Tailo: Jiânāu, hit-tuī Lô-má ping kah iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, í-ki̍p Iô-tá-iah lâng ê kíng-uē lâi lia̍h Iésu, kā I pa̍k khí-.lâi.
English: So the detachment, the commanding officer, and the officers of the Jews, seized Jesus and bound him,

Tailo: Koh tuì Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng té bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ ê khing, the̍h-tshut tsi̍t tè bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè iû-piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè po̍h piáⁿ, lóng hē tī iû kah tsiànn-thuí tíng-bīn.
English: and out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before Yahweh, he took one unleavened cake, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat, and on the right thigh.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí suî-jiân luân-bō͘ lí ê lāu-pē ê ke, put-tik-put tio̍h khì, án-tsuáⁿ tio̍h thau-the̍h guá ê sîn-bîng?
English: Now, you want to be gone, because you greatly longed for your father's house, but why have you stolen my gods?

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h in ê bīn ê hîng-siōng, to̍h-sī guá tsá-tsîng tī Ke-bal hô piⁿ só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê bīn; in ê khuán-sit, in ê sing-khu, lóng sī án-ne, lóng ta̍k-ê ti̍t-ti̍t kiâⁿ-.khì.
English: As for the likeness of their faces, they were the faces which I saw by the river Chebar, their appearances and themselves; they went every one straight forward.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh ê bûn-tô͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū lâi siu i ê sin-si, kā i bâi-tsòng tī bōng-.ni̍h.
English: When his disciples heard this, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

Tailo: Siōngtè kám ē bē kì-tit si un? Kám ē in-uī siū-khì suah that-ba̍t I ê tsû-pi? [Sè-la̍h]
English: Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has he, in anger, withheld his compassion? Selah.

Tailo: Só͘-ū tsò hó sū ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h îng-kng, tsun-kuì kah pîng-an, Iô-tá-iah lâng ē sing tit-tio̍h, āu-lâi tsiah suà-kàu Hi-la̍h lâng.
English: But glory and honor and peace to every man who works good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, jîn-bîn thâi-sí hiah-ê puē-puān Ammóng ông ê lâng, jîn-bîn tsiū siat-li̍p i ê kiáⁿ Io-si-iah suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: But the people of the land killed all those who had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his place.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê îng-kng it-tīng hián-hiān; só͘-ū ū hia̍t-khì ê ē lóng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h. In-uī tse sī Siōngtsú tshin-tshuì kóng ê.
English: The glory of Yahweh shall be revealed, And all flesh shall see it together; For the mouth of Yahweh has spoken it.

Tailo: Lín mā m̄-thang sio khik-khui, tsóng-.sī, tio̍h kìng-uì lín ê Siōngtè, in-uī Guá sī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè.
English: You shall not wrong one another; but you shall fear your God: for I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Tī ông ta̍k síng kî-î ê Iôtah lâng mā lóng tsū-tsi̍p, khí-lâi pó-hō͘ ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā, thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k, hióng-siū pîng-an, thâi-sí uàn-hūn in ê lâng tshit-bān gō͘-tshing, tsóng-.sī, bô tshiúⁿ in ê tsâi-bu̍t.
English: The other Jews who were in the king's provinces gathered themselves together, and stood for their lives, and had rest from their enemies, and killed of those who hated them seventy-five thousand; but they didn't lay their hand on the spoil.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú ê tāi-tsì lóng tsún-pī hó-sè, mā siú Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh, mā hiàn sio-tsè tī Siōngtsú ê tuâⁿ, tsiàu Io-si-iah ông só͘ bīng-līng ê.
English: So all the service of Yahweh was prepared the same day, to keep the Passover, and to offer burnt offerings on the altar of Yahweh, according to the commandment of king Josiah.

Tailo: Hit sî, Thamal tshīng tshái-sik ê saⁿ, in-uī ông ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, iáu-buē tshut-kè ê, lóng tshīng tsit khuán saⁿ. Amnon ê lô͘-po̍k tsiū khan i tshut-.khì, tshut-khì liáu-āu, mn̂g tsiū tshuàⁿ khí-.lâi.
English: She had a garment of various colors on her; for with such robes were the king's daughters who were virgins dressed. Then his servant brought her out, and bolted the door after her.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng mn̄g kóng, ' Lín tháu lî-á beh tshòng siáⁿ? Lín tio̍h kóng, ' Tsú teh su-iàu. '
English: If anyone asks you, Why are you untying it?' say to him: The Lord needs it.'

Tailo: Iésu khuàⁿ-tio̍h nn̄g tsiah tsûn tī ô͘-piⁿ, lia̍h-hî lâng lī-khui tsûn teh sé-bāng.
English: He saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them, and were washing their nets.
