Tailo: Hō͘ lín ē-hiáu hun-pia̍t hit-ê siōng hó ê tāi-tsì. Án-ne, tī Ki-tok tsài-lîm ê ji̍t, lín tsiah ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sûn-tsuân koh bô thang hiâm ê lâng.
English: so that you may approve the things that are excellent; that you may be sincere and without offense to the day of Christ;

Tailo: Siâ-sîn lī-khui hū-sin ê lâng, tsiū tī bô tsuí ê tē-khu beh tshuē tsi̍t-ê hioh-khùn ê só͘-tsāi, m̄-koh, lóng tshuē bô.
English: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passes through waterless places, seeking rest, and doesn't find it.

Tailo: Ông tsiū tsiūⁿ-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān, Iôtah kûn-tsiòng kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn, í-ki̍p tsè-si Lēbī kah tsìng lâng, bô-lūn tuā-sè, lóng kah i tsò-hué khì. Ông tsiū kā Siōngtsú tiān lāi ngó͘-jiân tit-tio̍h ê iok ê tsheh, só͘-ū ê uē lóng tha̍k hō͘ in thiaⁿ.
English: The king went up to the house of Yahweh, and all the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and the priests, and the Levites, and all the people, both great and small: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant that was found in the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá tuì tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan kā lín tshuā tshut-.lâi, tuì lín sì-suàⁿ khì ê lia̍t kok tiong kā lín tsū-tsi̍p. Hit sî, Guá beh tsiap-la̍p lín tshin-tshiūnn phang-hiuⁿ; Guá beh tī lín tit-tio̍h hián-bîng tsiânn-tsò sìng, hō͘ guā-pang lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: As a sweet savor will I accept you, when I bring you out from the peoples, and gather you out of the countries in which you have been scattered; and I will be sanctified in you in the sight of the nations.

Tailo: Lín kám ē uī Siōngtè lâi kóng put-gī ê uē? Kám ē uī I kóng kuí-tsà ê uē?
English: Will you speak unrighteously for God, And talk deceitfully for him?

Tailo: Guá tsit-má īng tiúⁿ-ló ê sin-hūn, khó͘-khǹg lín tiong-kan ê tiúⁿ-ló; guá koh sī Ki-tok siū khó͘ ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn, mā beh hun-hióng teh beh hián-hiān ê îng-kng.
English: I exhort the elders among you, as a fellow elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and who will also share in the glory that will be revealed.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsiú-khut tī siâⁿ guā hō͘ lâng thún-ta̍h, tsiū ū hueh tuì tsiú-khut lâu tshut-.lâi, kuân tāi-iok nn̄g kong-tshioh, tn̂g tsha-put-to ū saⁿ-pah kong-lí.
English: The winepress was trodden outside of the city, and blood came out from the winepress, even to the bridles of the horses, as far as one thousand six hundred stadia.

Tailo: Hái-té tsiū tshut-hiān, tāi-tē ê kin-ki mā lō͘-hiān, sī in-uī Siōngtsú ê tsik-pī, mā in-uī I ê phīⁿ-khang pûn tshut ê khuì.
English: Then the channels of the sea appeared, The foundations of the world were laid bare, By the rebuke of Yahweh, At the blast of the breath of his nostrils.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khuànn Si-óng, lán siú sìng-tseh ê siâⁿ; lí ê ba̍k-tsiu ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Êlúsalèm tsò an-tsīng ê tshù-the̍h, tsò bô î-suá ê pò͘-pênn; i ê khit íng bô pue̍h-tshut, i ê soh lóng bô tn̄g.
English: Look at Zion, the city of our appointed festivals. Your eyes will see Jerusalem, a quiet habitation, A tent that won't be removed. Its stakes will never be plucked up, Nor will any of its cords be broken.

Tailo: Siōngtè īng gue̍h-niû lâi tiāⁿ-tio̍h sî-tseh; ji̍t-thâu mā tsai thang lo̍h suaⁿ.
English: He appointed the moon for seasons. The sun knows when to set.

Tailo: Ū lâng î-suá tē-kài, tshiúⁿ-tua̍t kui kûn ê tsing-seⁿ lâi tshī.
English: There are people who remove the landmarks. They violently take away flocks, and feed them.

Tailo: Lí ing-kai tio̍h kā guá ê gîn-pè kià tī tsîⁿ-tiàm, guá tńg-.lâi ê sî thang niá pún-tsînn kah lī-sik lâi hîng guá.
English: You ought therefore to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back my own with interest.

Tailo: Lín tsò lāu-pē ê lâng, ka-kī ê kiáⁿ lâi thó piáⁿ, lí kám ē the̍h tsio̍h-thâu hō͘ i? Á-sī lâi thó hî, lí kám ē kā tsuâ tsún-tsò hî hō͘ i?
English: Which of you fathers, if your son asks for bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, he won't give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?

Tailo: Iésu Ki-tok tsun-tsiàu Siōngtè ê tsí-ì, tsí-iàu tsi̍t pái hiàn ka-kī ê sing-khu, tsiū kàu-gia̍h hō͘ lán tit-tio̍h sìng-huà lâi kui-ǹg Siōngtè.
English: by which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

Tailo: guá mā án-ne it-tīng ē king-kuè tsin tsē khang-hi ê gue̍h, koh ū ià-siān ê mê-sî kā guá tiāⁿ-tio̍h.
English: So am I made to possess months of misery, Wearisome nights are appointed to me.

Tailo: Lín kin-á-ji̍t tio̍h tsai, in-uī guá m̄-sī kah lín ê kiáⁿ-jî kóng, in m̄-tsai, mā bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè ê kàu-tō kah ui-giâm, tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú kah tshun-tshut ê tshiú-kut,
English: Know you this day: for I don't speak with your children who have not known, and who have not seen the chastisement of Yahweh your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his outstretched arm,

Tailo: Hái piⁿ ê tē ē piàn-tsò tsháu-tiûⁿ, ū bo̍k-tsiá ê tsháu-liâu, ū iûⁿ-kûn ê tiâu.
English: The sea coast will be pastures, with cottages for shepherds and folds for flocks.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ iáu-buē huì-tû, jî-tshiánn jîn-bîn mā iáu-buē tiāⁿ-tio̍h sim-ì beh kui-ǹg in tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè.
English: However the high places were not taken away; neither as yet had the people set their hearts to the God of their fathers.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tsiah-ê bú-bān ê lâng, to̍h-sī kuán-hat tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn ê lâng, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú ê uē.
English: Therefore hear the word of Yahweh, you scoffers, that rule this people in Jerusalem:

Tailo: In-uī I kà-sī lâng tsin ū kuân-ui kah in ê king-ha̍k kàu-su bô kāng-khuán.
English: for he taught them with authority, and not like the scribes.

Tailo: Tsit-ê Iésu Ki-tok sī tuì tsuí kah hueh lâi ê; m̄-sī kan-taⁿ īng tsuí, sī īng tsuí kah hueh.
English: This is he who came by water and blood, Jesus Christ; not with the water only, but with the water and the blood. It is the Spirit who testifies, because the Spirit is the truth.

Tailo: Tsè-si, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ tsit-ê uē! Isulael ê tsú-bîn, lín tio̍h tsù-ì! Ông-tshin, lín tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ! In-uī sím-phuàⁿ kuan-hē tī lín, in-uī lín tsò ua̍h-tauh tī Mi-su-peh, tsò lô-bāng tiuⁿ tī Tha-bool suaⁿ.
English: Listen to this, you priests! Listen, house of Israel, And give ear, house of the king! For the judgment is against you; For you have been a snare at Mizpah, And a net spread on Tabor.

Tailo: Guá ê pîng-iú, guá kā lín kóng, hāi-sí lín ê sing-khu liáu-āu bē-tàng koh tuì lín tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h ê lâng, lín m̄-bián kiaⁿ in.
English: I tell you, my friends, don't be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ē ū só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng lâu-.leh, to̍h-sī siū lia̍h tshut-.lâi ê kiáⁿ-jî; lí khuàⁿ, in ē tshut-lâi-kàu lín tsia, lín ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê só͘ kiâⁿ, só͘ tsò, kóng-tio̍h Guá só͘ kàng-lo̍h tī Êlúsalèm ê tsai-hō, to̍h-sī Guá it-tshè kàng-lo̍h tī in tíng-bīn ê, lín tsiū ē tit-tio̍h an-uì.
English: Yet, behold, therein shall be left a remnant that shall be carried forth, both sons and daughters: behold, they shall come forth to you, and you shall see their way and their doings; and you shall be comforted concerning the evil that I have brought on Jerusalem, even concerning all that I have brought on it.

Tailo: Guá an-jiân ê sî, I kā guá at-tn̄g, lia̍p guá ê ām-kún, kā guá siak kah tshuì-tshuì; koh tshāi guá tsò I ê tsìnn-pà.
English: I was at ease, and he broke me apart. Yes, he has taken me by the neck, and dashed me to pieces. He has also set me up for his target.

Tailo: Hit sî, thiⁿ-tē kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê ē in-uī Babúlông sit-pāi lâi huann-hí, in-uī kiânn huí-bia̍t ê ē tuì pak-hong lâi-kàu i hia. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Then the heavens and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for joy over Babylon; for the destroyers shall come to her from the north, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tiâu-hô kah tsit-ê kāng-khuán, á-.sī īng i buah tī guā-lâng ê sing-khu ê, Guá beh kā i tuì jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan tsián-tû. '
English: Whoever compounds any like it, or whoever puts any of it on a stranger, he shall be cut off from his people.'

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ gín-á tshut-khì mn̄g i ê lāu-bú, kóng, Guá tio̍h kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lāu-bú ìn kóng, Kiânn sé-lé Iô-há-neh ê thâu-khak.
English: She went out, and said to her mother, What shall I ask? She said, The head of John the Baptizer.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in kóng, M̄-thang tī tseh-kî tiong-kan hē tshiú, khióng-kiaⁿ jîn-bîn ē khí pō-tōng.
English: But they said, Not during the feast, lest a riot occur among the people.

Tailo: Guá khuànn hiah-ê tuā suaⁿ, lí khuàⁿ, in lóng tín-tāng, sió suaⁿ mā lóng iô lâi iô-khì.
English: I saw the mountains, and behold, they trembled, and all the hills moved back and forth.

Tailo: In-uī lín ū jīn-bat Siōngtè kah lán ê Tsú Iésu, guān lín tit-tio̍h hong-hong hù-hù ê un-tián kah pîng-an!
English: Grace to you and peace be multiplied in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord,

Tailo: In kóng, Lí ū kiù guán ê sèⁿ-miā, guān guán tī guá ê tsú ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, guán beh tsò Huâ-láu ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: They said, You have saved our lives! Let us find favor in the sight of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh's servants.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí tsit-ê kiáⁿ, kau-puê tshiong-ki, kā lí pun hō͘ i ê tsâi-sán tsuân-pō͘ khai liáu-liáu. I tsi̍t ē tńg-.lâi, lí tsiū uī-tio̍h i thâi puî ê gû-á kiáⁿ. '
English: But when this, your son, came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.'

Tailo: Iésu huan-hù tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ liáu-āu, tsiū lī-khui hia, khì hù-kīn ê siâⁿ kà-sī lâng kah thuân hok-im.
English: It happened that when Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.

Tailo: hiuⁿ-tuâⁿ kah i ê kǹg, buah iû ê kah hiuⁿ ê phang-hiuⁿ, í-ki̍p huē-bō͘ mn̂g ê mn̂g-lî,
English: and the altar of incense with its poles, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door, at the door of the tent;

Tailo: Guá beh khì tó-uī, lín tsai hit tiâu lō͘.
English: Where I go, you know, and you know the way.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h tuì Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ lâi suan-pò͘, kóng: Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ, tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú ê uē.
English: You, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel, and say, You mountains of Israel, hear the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: Asiul ông Salgóng tshe Thalthàn kàu Asito͘t hit nî, Thalthàn tsiū kong-phuà Asito͘t, kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it;

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Tio̍h hō͘ gín-á tāi-sing tsia̍h pá, in-uī the̍h gín-á ê piáⁿ hiat hō͘ káu tsia̍h sī m̄-hó.
English: But Jesus said to her, Let the children be filled first, for it is not appropriate to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs.

Tailo: Io-lâm tsē-uī ê sî, saⁿ-tsa̍p-jī huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông king-kuè peh nî.
English: Thirty-two years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Siōngtè ē kā guá hiat lo̍h-khì kau té, guá ê saⁿ mā ē thó-ià guá.
English: Yet you will plunge me in the ditch. My own clothes shall abhor me.

Tailo: Kok lāi ê jîn-bîn lóng huann-hí, tsuân siânn lóng an-tsīng. In tī ông-kiong hia, īng to thâi-sí Athalíiah.
English: So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet. Athaliah they had slain with the sword at the king's house.

Tailo: Tsi̍t-kuá tuì Kai-sa-lī-a lâi ê sìn-tô͘ kah guán tsò-hué khì, in tshuā guán khì tuà tsi̍t-ê Ku-pu-liò lâng Ná-sun in tau; i sī tsá-kî ê sìn-tô͘.
English: Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us, bringing one Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we would stay.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ tsiū tshut-khì thuân-tō, kóng lâng tio̍h hué-kái.
English: They went out and preached that people should repent.

Tailo: ( Asah kà-sī ê si. ) Guá ê tsú-bîn, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ guá ê kà-sī, àn hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: Hear my law, my people. Turn your ears to the words of my mouth.

Tailo: Lâng tsiū īng bé tsài i ê sin-si lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm, kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsòng tsò-hué tī Tabi̍t ê siâⁿ.
English: They brought him on horses; and he was buried at Jerusalem with his fathers in the city of David.

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm khì Sīkhiàm, in-uī Isulael jîn-bîn lâi-kàu Sīkhiàm, beh kā i siat-li̍p tsò ông.
English: Rehoboam went to Shechem: for all Israel were come to Shechem to make him king.

Tailo: Ū hīⁿ-khang ê lâng tio̍h thiaⁿ.
English: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.

Tailo: Guá beh pàng hué tī Aigi̍p, Sìn ē tú-tio̍h tuā thòng-khó͘; Nô͘ ē tú-tio̍h kong-phuà, Nó͘-hu ē tng-thâu pe̍h-ji̍t tú-tio̍h tuì-ti̍k.
English: I will set a fire in Egypt: Sin shall be in great anguish, and No shall be broken up; and Memphis shall have adversaries in the daytime.

Tailo: M̄-koh, tsiah-ê lâng tshin-tshiūnn bô lîng-sìng ê tōng-bu̍t, sing-sîng tio̍h hō͘ lâng lia̍h-khì thâi. In huí-pòng ka-kī m̄-tsai ê tāi-tsì. In ē kah tōng-bu̍t kāng-khuán siū huí-bia̍t, siū-tio̍h ka-kī put gī-hîng uī ê pò-ìng.
English: But these, as unreasoning creatures, born natural animals to be taken and destroyed, speaking evil in matters about which they are ignorant, will in their destroying surely be destroyed,

Tailo: lóng kau tī Gi-bóng lâng ê tshiú tiong, in tsiū kā in tiàu tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng. Tsit tshit-ê lâng lóng tsò tsi̍t-ē tó lo̍h-.lâi, lóng sí tī khí-thâu siu-kuah ê sî, to̍h-sī khí-thâu kuah tuā-be̍h ê sî.
English: He delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the mountain before Yahweh, and they fell all seven together. They were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, at the beginning of barley harvest.

Tailo: Guá tok-tsik lín ê kiáⁿ-jî, sī khang-khang bô lō͘-īng, in bô siū kíng-kài. Lín ê to, tshin-tshiūnn bíng sai thun-kā lín ê sian-ti.
English: In vain have I struck your children; they received no correction: your own sword has devoured your prophets, like a destroying lion.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā huān-tio̍h ē-sin lâu-lâng ê, i só͘ tó ê tshn̂g lóng sī bô tshing-khì, i só͘ tsē ê mi̍h, mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Every bed whereon he who has the discharge lies shall be unclean; and everything he sits on shall be unclean.

Tailo: Lán nā tsun-siú Siōngtè ê kài-bīng, tsiū án-ne ē-tàng khak-sìn lán bat Siōngtè.
English: This is how we know that we know him: if we keep his commandments.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ bē bîng-pi̍k tsit kù uē ê ì-sù, koh m̄-káⁿ mn̄g I.
English: But they didn't understand the saying, and were afraid to ask him.

Tailo: Koh the̍h pak-lāi só͘-ū ê iû kah kuaⁿ-.ni̍h ê bāng-se, í-ki̍p nn̄g lia̍p io-tsí kah in só͘-ū ê iû, Mô͘se lóng tī tuâⁿ tíng sio hiah-ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ.
English: He took all the fat that was on the innards, and the cover of the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat; and Moses burned it on the altar.

Tailo: Guá sī lāu-pē ê kiáⁿ, tī lāu-bú ê bīn-tsîng tsò i siōng thiàⁿ ê iù-siù kiáⁿ.
English: For I was a son to my father, Tender and an only child in the sight of my mother.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōngtsú uī-tio̍h I ê tē lâi jia̍t-sim, liân-bín I ê tsú-bîn.
English: Then Yahweh was jealous for his land, And had pity on his people.

Tailo: King-kuè tshit ji̍t, in beh uī tuâⁿ sio̍k-tsuē, hō͘ i tshing-khì; án-ne kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: Seven days shall they make atonement for the altar and purify it; so shall they consecrate it.

Tailo: Ha-ta̍t tī Aigi̍p thiaⁿ-tio̍h Tabi̍t kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsò-hué khùn, kun-tiúⁿ Ioap mā í-king sí. Ha-ta̍t tsiū tuì Huâ-láu kóng, Tshiánn iông-ín guá-.khì, hō͘ guá tńg-khì guá ê pún-kok.
English: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the army was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to my own country.

Tailo: Lín kám bē kì-tit guá hō͘ sì-tshing lâng tsia̍h tshit tè piáⁿ, tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lín ū khioh kuí nâ?
English: Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you took up?

Tailo: I ê kun-ping tsò tsi̍t-hué lâi, tsō in ê lō͘ lâi kong-kik guá, tsat iâⁿ tī guá ê pò͘-pênn ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: His troops come on together, Build a siege ramp against me, And encamp around my tent.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá beh īng kám-un ê siann hiàn tsè hō͘ Lí, siā guá só͘ hē ê guān, tsín-kiù tshut tī Siōngtsú.
English: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation belongs to Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng ē tī tuì-ti̍k ê tē, in-uī ka-kī ê tsuē lâi siau-bia̍t, mā ē in-uī tsó͘-sian ê tsuē kah in kāng-khuán siau-bia̍t.
English: Those of you who are left will pine away in their iniquity in your enemies' lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers shall they pine away with them.

Tailo: Sâmsóng kā khan i ê tshiú ê gín-á kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí hō͘ guá bong-tio̍h thuh tshù ê thiāu, hō͘ guá thang uá-khò in.
English: and Samson said to the boy who held him by the hand, Allow me that I may feel the pillars whereupon the house rests, that I may lean on them.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuà tī siâⁿ-pó, só͘-í, in kā i kiò-tsò Tabi̍t ê siâⁿ.
English: David lived in the stronghold; therefore they called it the city of David.

Tailo: Siōngtè ē tī lia̍t kok tiong lâi sím-phuàⁿ, uī-tio̍h tsin tsē jîn-bîn lâi kái-kuat. In ē kā in ê to phah-tsò lê-thâu, kā in ê tshiuⁿ phah-tsò liâm-á. Tsit kok bô gia̍h to kong-kik hit kok, in mā bô koh ha̍k-si̍p kau-tsiàn.
English: He will judge between the nations, And will decide concerning many peoples; And they shall beat their swords into plowshares, And their spears into pruning hooks. Nation shall not lift up sword against nation, Neither shall they learn war any more.

Tailo: Iôséhuh huan-hù kuán-ke kóng, Kā bí-niûⁿ ji̍p muá tsiah-ê lâng ê pò͘-tē, tsīn in só͘ ū-huat-tō͘ tuà ê, koh kā ta̍k lâng ê gîn lok tī i ê pò͘-tē kháu.
English: He commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man's money in his sack's mouth.

Tailo: Suî-jiân thiⁿ-sài ê khuì-la̍t kah kuân-lîng pí hiah-ê ké kàu-su khah tuā, i mā bô tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng īng huí-pòng ê ē kā in khòng-kò.
English: whereas angels, though greater in might and power, don't bring a railing judgment against them before the Lord.

Tailo: Lâng bô-lūn īng siáⁿ-mi̍h hong-huat, lóng m̄-thang hō͘ i phiàn-.khì, in-uī hit ji̍t beh kàu tsìn-tsîng, it-tīng sing ū puē-kàu ê tāi-tsì huat-sing, mā ū put-huat ê lâng, to̍h-sī tsù-tiāⁿ bia̍t-bông ê lâng ē tshut-hiān.
English: Let no one deceive you in any way. For it will not be, unless the departure comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of destruction,

Tailo: ( Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) Tsiah-ê thiⁿ kóng-khí Siōngtè ê îng-kng, kiong-tshong suan-iông I ê tsok-uî.
English: The heavens declare the glory of God. The expanse shows his handiwork.

Tailo: Siōngtè bîng-pi̍k tì-huī ê lō͘, mā tsai i ê só͘-tsāi.
English: God understands its way, And he knows its place.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng bat īng tshiú-sim niû tsiah-ê tsuí, īng tshiú-hó͘-kháu niû kiong-tshong, īng táu té tāi-tē ê thô͘-sua hún, īng tshìn-á lâi tshìn suaⁿ-niá, īng thian-phîng lâi tshìn suaⁿ-thâu?
English: Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, And marked off the sky with his span, And calculated the dust of the earth in a measure, And weighed the mountains in scales, And the hills in a balance?

Tailo: Hit-ê hué kàng lo̍h-.lâi, koh ū Siōngtsú ê îng-kng tī tiān-.ni̍h ê sî, Isulael jîn-bîn khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tī pho͘ tsio̍h ê só͘-tsāi, phak lo̍h tē kìng-pài, kám-siā Siōngtsú, kóng, In-uī I sī hó, I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tī-.leh!
English: All the children of Israel looked on, when the fire came down, and the glory of Yahweh was on the house; and they bowed themselves with their faces to the ground on the pavement, and worshiped, and gave thanks to Yahweh, saying, For he is good; for his loving kindness endures for ever.

Tailo: Lín bô-lūn ji̍p-khì siáⁿ-mi̍h siâⁿ, lâng nā tsiap-la̍p lín, tio̍h tsia̍h in só͘ pâi tī lín bīn-tsîng ê mi̍h.
English: Into whatever city you enter, and they receive you, eat the things that are set before you.

Tailo: Taⁿ Guá lo̍h-lâi beh kiù in thuat-lī Aigi̍p lâng ê tshiú, tshuā in tshut hit-ê só͘-tsāi, kàu puî suí koh khui-khuah ê tē, kàu lâu ling kah bi̍t ê tē, to̍h-sī Ka-nân, Hiat, Amô͘lī, Pe-lí-ji, Hi-bī, I-é-bú-suh, hiah-ê tso̍k ê só͘-tsāi.
English: I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up out of that land to a good and large land, to a land flowing with milk and honey; to the place of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.

Tailo: In-uī in taⁿ ē kóng, Guán bô ông, in-uī guán bô kìng-uì Siōngtsú. Ông ē thè guán tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Surely now they will say, We have no king; for we don't fear Yahweh; And the king, what can he do for us?

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá ē hō͘ lí kui lí ê tsó͘-sian, lí ē pîng-an kui bōng; Guá só͘ beh kàng-lo̍h tī tsit só͘-tsāi it-tshè ê tsai-hō, lí ê ba̍k-tsiu it-tīng khuànn bē-tio̍h. ' In tsiū tò tńg-khì huê-hok ông.
English: Therefore, behold, I will gather you to your fathers, and you shall be gathered to your grave in peace, neither shall your eyes see all the evil which I will bring on this place. They brought the king word again.

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah tuì in kóng, lín tio̍h án-ne kā Tsetikiah kóng,
English: Then said Jeremiah to them, Thus shall you tell Zedekiah:

Tailo: Guá tsū siàu-liân to̍h siū khó͘, hiám-hiám-á sí-.khì; guá siū-tio̍h Lí ê khióng-pò͘ tsik-hua̍t, tì-kàu sim hun-luān.
English: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up. While I suffer your terrors, I am distracted.

Tailo: Lín kiù-kìng beh kā siáⁿ lâng the̍h-lâi pí-phīng Siōngtè? Īng siáⁿ-mi̍h hîng-siōng kah Siōngtè pí-phīng?
English: To whom then will you liken God? Or what likeness will you compare to him?

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, taⁿ guá ê kiàn-tsìng tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h, guá pó-jīn ê lâng tī tíng-bīn.
English: Even now, behold, my witness is in heaven. He who vouches for me is on high.

Tailo: In ta̍k-ê ti̍t-ti̍t kiânn tsìn-tsîng; sîn-lîng beh khì tó-uī, in tsiū khì hia; kiânn ê sî, sing-khu m̄-bián ua̍t.
English: Each one went straight forward: where the spirit was to go, they went; they didn't turn when they went.

Tailo: Nā ū tshò-gō͘ kiânn, huē-tsiòng mā m̄-tsai, āu-lâi huē-tsiòng tio̍h hiàn tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á tsò sio-tsè, mā tsiàu huat-tō͘ īng i ê sò͘-tsè kah kuàn-tiān ê tsè, tsò-hué tsò phang-phang ê tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, koh tio̍h hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē ê tsè.
English: then it shall be, if it be done unwittingly, without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bull for a burnt offering, for a sweet savor to Yahweh, with the meal offering of it, and the drink offering of it, according to the ordinance, and one male goat for a sin offering.

Tailo: Alông tio̍h tsi̍t nî tsi̍t pái tī tuâⁿ tíng ê kak sio̍k-tsuē, i tsi̍t nî tsi̍t pái tio̍h īng sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê hueh tī tuâⁿ tíng sio̍k-tsuē, ta̍k sè-tāi tio̍h án-ne tsò. Tsit-ê tuâⁿ tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tsò tsì-sìng.
English: Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once in the year; with the blood of the sin offering of atonement once in the year he shall make atonement for it throughout your generations. It is most holy to Yahweh.

Tailo: Guān guá ê kî-tó ta̍t-kàu Lí ê bīn-tsîng; kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ guá ê kî-kiû!
English: Let my prayer enter into your presence. Turn your ear to my cry.

Tailo: In-uī tshin-tshiūnn sih-nà tuì tang pîng teh sih, tsiò kàu sai pîng, Jîn-tsú ê tsài-lîm mā ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne.
English: For as the lightning comes forth from the east, and is seen even to the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

Tailo: Tio̍h hàu-kìng pē-bú, ( tsù, CAG 20:12-16; SBK 5:16-20 ) tio̍h thiàⁿ tshù-piⁿ tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī. ( Tsù, LBK 19:18 )
English: Honor your father and mother.' And, You shall love your neighbor as yourself.'

Tailo: Tsit-ê sī ai-ko, lâng ē īng tsit-ê lâi ai-khàu, lia̍t kok tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á ē īng án-ne lâi ai-khàu, in uī-tio̍h Aigi̍p kah i ê jîn-bîn, mā ē īng tsit-ê lâi ai-khàu. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: This is the lamentation with which they shall lament; the daughters of the nations shall lament therewith; over Egypt, and over all her multitude, shall they lament therewith, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Tio̍h lī-khui pháiⁿ lâi tsò hó sū, tsuan-sim tui-kiû hô-pîng.
English: Let him turn away from evil, and do good. Let him seek peace, and pursue it.

Tailo: Tī hit ji̍t, tshit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ē khînn tsi̍t-ê tsa-po͘ lâng, kóng, Guán tsia̍h ka-kī ê bí-niûⁿ, tshīng ka-kī ê saⁿ-khò͘, to̍k-to̍k kiû lí tsún guán kui tī lí ê miâ, lâi tû-khì guán ê kiàn-siàu.
English: Seven women shall take hold of one man in that day, saying, We will eat our own bread, and wear our own clothing: only let us be called by your name. Take away our reproach.

Tailo: M̄-koh, kóng-kàu Isulael lâng, Isáiah kóng, guá kui ji̍t tshun khui siang tshiú teh thìng-hāu m̄ sūn-ho̍k koh puē-gi̍k ê tsú-bîn. ( Tsù, ISI 65:2 )
English: But as to Israel he says, All day long I stretched out my hands to a disobedient and contrary people.

Tailo: Kā iûⁿ tshiat tsi̍t tè tsi̍t tè, Mô͘se kā thâu kah bah-tè, í-ki̍p iû lóng sio.
English: He cut the ram into its pieces; and Moses burned the head, and the pieces, and the fat.

Tailo: Tio̍h pi-siong, thî-khàu lâu ba̍k-sái, kā lín ê tshiò-bīn piàn-tsò ai-siong, huann-hí piàn-tsò iu-tshiû.
English: Lament, mourn, and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to gloom.

Tailo: Iôtah kûn-tsiòng ìn Isulael lâng, kóng, In-uī ông kah guán sī tâng-tsong, lín án-tsuáⁿ in-uī tsit-ê tāi-tsì siū-khì? Guán kám bat tsia̍h-tio̍h ông siáⁿ-mi̍h? Ông kám bat īng siáⁿ-mi̍h sàng guán?
English: All the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, Because the king is a close relative to us: why then are you angry for this matter? have we eaten at all at the king's cost? or has he given us any gift?

Tailo: In tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huann-hí lâi huah, īng kó͘-tshue, īng sàu-kak lâi tuì Siōngtsú tsiù-tsuā.
English: They swore to Yahweh with a loud voice, and with shouting, and with trumpets, and with cornets.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá í-tsîng khì lín hia, pīng bô īng suí ê giân-sû á-.sī tì-huī lâi tuì lín thuân Siōngtè ê ò-pì.
English: When I came to you, brothers, I didn't come with excellence of speech or of wisdom, proclaiming to you the testimony of God.

Tailo: Lâng nā huān-tio̍h ing-kai sí ê tsuē, siū pān tsuē sí, lí nā kā i tiàu tī tshâ-.ni̍h,
English: If a man have committed a sin worthy of death, and he be put to death, and you hang him on a tree;

Tailo: Iésu tsiū tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Sî-ji̍t teh beh kàu, lín tsin ài khuàⁿ-tio̍h Jîn-tsú lâi-lîm ê hit ji̍t, lín mā khuànn bē-tio̍h.
English: He said to the disciples, The days will come, when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

Tailo: Kì-jiân Siōngtè hō͘ lán tsìn-ji̍p I ê an-hioh ê ìng-ín iáu tī-.leh, lán tio̍h ū kìng-uì ê sim, tsiah bián-tit lín tiong-kan kiám-tshái ū lâng siūⁿ kóng tit bē-tio̍h tsit-ê ìng-ín.
English: Let us fear therefore, lest perhaps a promise being left of entering into his rest, anyone of you should seem to have come short of it.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng kā lín kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h, lín tio̍h kóng, ' Tsú beh sú-iōng i. ' Hit-ê lâng suî-sî ē hō͘ lín khan-.lâi.
English: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, The Lord needs them,' and immediately he will send them.

Tailo: Siàu-liân lâng kng tsio̍h-bō, gín-á taⁿ tshâ, tì-sú pua̍h-tó.
English: The young men bare the mill; The children stumbled under the wood.

Tailo: tsit uī tsè-si m̄-sī kin-kì lâng ê kui-tsik á-.sī tiâu-lē lâi siat-li̍p, sī tsiàu bē huí-huāi ê ua̍h-miā ê kuân-lîng.
English: who has been made, not after the law of a fleshly commandment, but after the power of an endless life:

Tailo: I koh tshuā guá tuì pak mn̂g lâi-kàu tiān ê thâu-tsîng. Guá tsiū khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê îng-kng tshiong-muá Siōngtsú ê tiān, guá tsiū phak lo̍h tē.
English: Then he brought me by the way of the north gate before the house; and I looked, and behold, the glory of Yahweh filled the house of Yahweh: and I fell on my face.

Tailo: In-uī ū ping-tè tsiū lô, ū seh khǹg tī hit lāi-bīn;
English: Which are black by reason of the ice, in which the snow hides itself:

Tailo: Iésu kah sù-tô͘ tsia̍h àm-tǹg ê sî, Mô͘-kuí kā tshut-bē Iésu ê ì-sù hē tī Ka-lio̍k lâng Símòng ê kiáⁿ Iôtah ê sim.
English: After supper, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray him,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē hō͘ un-i̍k kā lí tîⁿ tiâu-.leh, kàu I tī lí só͘ ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap ê tē kā lí bia̍t-bông.
English: Yahweh will make the pestilence cleave to you, until he has consumed you from off the land, where you go in to possess it.

Tailo: Taⁿ tī lí tsit-ê tó-huāi ê ji̍t, tsìng tó-sū ē phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah; hái tiong tsiah-ê tó-sū khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí sí-.khì, tsiū lóng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: Now shall the islands tremble in the day of your fall; yes, the islands that are in the sea shall be dismayed at your departure.

Tailo: Lín mā tio̍h kóng, ' Lí ê lô͘-po̍k Iâkop tī guán ê āu-bīn. ' In-uī Iâkop ka-kī siūⁿ kóng, Guá īng tī guá thâu-tsîng khì ê lé-mi̍h lâi kái i ê hūn, jiân-āu guá kìⁿ-tio̍h i ê bīn ê sî, kiám-tshái i ē tsiap-la̍p guá.
English: You shall say, Not only that, but behold, your servant, Jacob, is behind us.' For, he said, I will appease him with the present that goes before me, and afterward I will see his face. Perhaps he will accept me.

Tailo: Lí tshut-khì kah tuì-ti̍k kau-tsiàn ê sî, khuàⁿ-tio̍h bé, tshia, í-ki̍p jîn-bîn pí lí khah tsē ê, m̄-bián kiaⁿ in, in-uī tshuā lí tshut Aigi̍p tē ê Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: When you go forth to battle against your enemies, and see horses, and chariots, and a people more than you, you shall not be afraid of them; for Yahweh your God is with you, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu tī tsûn-bué tó tī tsím-thâu teh khùn. Bûn-tô͘ kā I kiò-tshéⁿ, kóng, Lāu-su, guán teh beh bô miā lò͘, Lí kám bô teh iàu-kín?
English: He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up, and told him, Teacher, don't you care that we are dying?

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Sî-kan kah ji̍t-kî sī Thiⁿ-pē ka-kī ê kuân-pìng só͘ kuat-tīng ê, m̄-sī lín ē-tàng tsai ê.
English: He said to them, It isn't for you to know times or seasons which the Father has set within His own authority.

Tailo: Lí bô īng gîn uī Guá bé tshiong-pô͘, mā bô īng tsè-mi̍h ê iû hō͘ Guá pá-tsiok; tian-tò hō͘ Guá in-uī lí ê tsuē-ok lô-khó͘, hō͘ Guá in-uī lí ê tsuē-kò ià-siān.
English: You have bought me no sweet cane with money, neither have you filled me with the fat of your sacrifices; but you have burdened me with your sins, you have wearied me with your iniquities.

Tailo: Nn̄g lâng ìn i kóng, Lí nā bô lāu-sia̍p guán tsit-ê tāi-tsì, guán kam-guān īng guán ê sèⁿ-miā thè lín, kàu Siōngtsú kā tsit-ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ guán ê sî, guán ē īng tsû-ài sîng-si̍t khuán-thāi lí.
English: The men said to her, Our life for yours, if you don't utter this our business; and it shall be, when Yahweh gives us the land, that we will deal kindly and truly with you.

Tailo: Mô͘se kóng, Kiû Lí hō͘ guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí ê îng-kng.
English: He said, Please show me your glory.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù I ê tuā-kuân, tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, tsiah-ê kok, tsiah-ê khiuⁿ-kháu ê lâng lóng tī i ê bīn-tsîng kiaⁿ kah phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah. I suî-ì hō͘ lâng sí, suî-ì hō͘ lâng ua̍h, suî-ì kā lâng ko-sing, suî-ì kā lâng kàng kē.
English: and because of the greatness that he gave him, all the peoples, nations, and languages trembled and feared before him: whom he would he killed, and whom he would he kept alive; and whom he would he raised up, and whom he would he put down.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Mô͘se sàng i ê tiūⁿ-lâng tshut-huat, E-thu-ló tsiū tńg-khì i ê kò͘-hiong.
English: Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went his way into his own land.

Tailo: Tì-sik kong-gī, koh kā Guá ê kà-sī tsûn tī sim-lāi ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h thiaⁿ Guá ê uē: M̄-bián kiaⁿ lâng ê khau-sé, mā m̄-thang in-uī lâng ê huí-pòng lâi kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: Listen to me, you who know righteousness, the people in whose heart is my law; don't you fear the reproach of men, neither be you dismayed at their insults.

Tailo: Hui-li̍p-pò͘ tsiū tsáu-uá-.khì, thiaⁿ-tio̍h i teh tha̍k Isáiah sian-ti ê tsheh, tsiū mn̄g i kóng, Lí teh tha̍k ê, lí ū liáu-kái bô?
English: Philip ran to him, and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said, Do you understand what you are reading?

Tailo: i tsiū lo̍h-khì ông-kiong, ji̍p-khì su-kì ê pâng. Lí khuàⁿ, tsìng kuì-tso̍k lóng tsē tī hia, to̍h-sī su-kì Elísiamah, Simáiah ê kiáⁿ Te-la-iah, Akbol ê kiáⁿ Elnáthan, Siahuánn ê kiáⁿ Gemáliah, Hananiah ê kiáⁿ Tsetikiah kah só͘-ū ê kuì-tso̍k.
English: he went down into the king's house, into the scribe's chamber: and behold, all the princes were sitting there, to wit, Elishama the scribe, and Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, and Elnathan the son of Achbor, and Gemariah the son of Shaphan, and Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.

Tailo: Alông ji̍p-khì sìng-só͘ ê sî, tio̍h kā phuàⁿ-kuat ê pó͘-kuà só͘ khik Isulael ê kiáⁿ ê miâ, tuà tī i ê hing tsîng, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsò kì-liām.
English: Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment on his heart, when he goes in to the holy place, for a memorial before Yahweh continually.

Tailo: I pí saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê ióng-sū khah kia̍t-tshut, tsóng-.sī, bē pí-tit tsîng saⁿ-ê ióng-sū. Tabi̍t siat-li̍p i tsò sī-uē-tiúⁿ.
English: Behold, he was more honorable than the thirty, but he didn't attain to the first three: and David set him over his guard.

Tailo: Mā guān in hiàn kám-siā ê tsè, tshut huann-hí ê siann kóng-khí I ê só͘ tsò.
English: Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving, And declare his works with singing.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kíng-síng, tī sìn-gióng siōng khiā ho͘ tsāi, tio̍h ióng-kám, kian-kiông.
English: Watch! Stand firm in the faith! Be courageous! Be strong!

Tailo: Tio̍h tsiàu Guá tī suaⁿ tíng kā lí tsí-sī ê khuán-sit lâi khí huē-bō͘.
English: You shall set up the tent according to the way that it was shown to you on the mountain.

Tailo: In tuì Aigi̍p tuà tńg-.lâi ê ngó͘-kok í-king tsia̍h-liáu, in lāu-pē kā in kóng, Lín koh khì kā lán tia̍h tām-po̍h-á bí-niûⁿ tńg-.lâi.
English: It happened, when they had eaten up the grain which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said to them, Go again, buy us a little more food.

Tailo: Mô͘se ê tiūⁿ-lâng — Mítiân ê tsè-si E-thu-ló, thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtè uī Mô͘se kah I ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú tshuā Isulael lâng tshut Aigi̍p ê tāi-tsì.
English: Now Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses' father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, how that Yahweh had brought Israel out of Egypt.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, lín nā ū sìn-sim bô giâu-gî, m̄-nā ē-tàng tsò guá tuì tsit tsâng bû-hua-kó tshiū só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì, sīm-tsì bīng-līng tsit tsō suaⁿ kóng, ' Tio̍h suá khì thiām hái. mā ē si̍t-hiān.
English: Jesus answered them, Most assuredly I tell you, if you have faith, and don't doubt, you will not only do what is done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, Be taken up and cast into the sea,' it would be done.

Tailo: Lí tuì Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, tio̍h tsò uân-tsuân ê lâng.
English: You shall be perfect with Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Moltékái tsai hit-ê tāi-tsì, tsiū kā ông-hō͘ Êsutel kóng. Êsutel tsiū īng Moltékái ê miâ kā hit-ê tāi-tsì kóng hō͘ ông tsai;
English: The thing became known to Mordecai, who shown it to Esther the queen; and Esther told the king of it in Mordecai's name.

Tailo: Siōngtsú hō͘ jîn-bîn tī Aigi̍p lâng ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, tsiàu in só͘ thó-.ê hō͘ in. Tsiū án-ne, in khì tshiúⁿ Aigi̍p lâng.
English: Yahweh gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they let them have what they asked. They despoiled the Egyptians.

Tailo: In suah tuì Iésu khí huán-kám, m̄-koh, Iésu kā in kóng, Sian-ti tī ka-kī ê kò͘-hiong kah ka-tîng í-guā, khì-kàu tó-uī lóng ē siū tsun-tiōng.
English: They were offended by him. But Jesus said to them, A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and in his own house.

Tailo: Kā hiah-ê iûⁿ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ guá ê Thiⁿ-pē, pí it-tshè lóng khah uí-tāi, bô lâng ē-tàng kā in tuì Thiⁿ-pē ê tshiú tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of my Father's hand.

Tailo: Hui-su-to͘ tuà hia tsiâⁿ tsa̍p kang, tsiū tńg-khì Kai-sa-lī-a. Keh tńg kang khui-tîng, i bīng-līng lâng khì tuà Páulô lâi.
English: When he had stayed among them more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea, and on the next day he sat on the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought.

Tailo: Guá ê hiann-tī kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò kuè-lō͘ lâng; guá ê tông-pau kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò guā-kok lâng.
English: I have become a stranger to my brothers, An alien to my mother's children.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se sí liáu-āu, Siōngtsú huan-hù Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah, to̍h-sī kin-tuè Mô͘se ê, kóng,
English: Now it happened after the death of Moses the servant of Yahweh, that Yahweh spoke to Joshua the son of Nun, Moses' minister, saying,

Tailo: Tng Isulael kiânn bê-lō͘ ê sî, ū Lēbī lâng lī-khui Guá hn̄g-hn̄g, to̍h-sī kiânn bê-lō͘ lī-khui Guá khì tuè in ê ngó͘-siōng, in tio̍h tam-tng in ê tsuē-kò.
English: But the Levites who went far from me, when Israel went astray, who went astray from me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.

Tailo: Hiah-ê siū lia̍h-.khì koh tńg-.lâi ê huē-tsiòng tsiū tah tsháu-liâu-á, tsē tī tsháu-liâu-á lāi-bīn. In-uī tuì Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah ê sî kàu tsit ji̍t, Isulael lâng m̄-bat án-ne kiânn. Tsiū án-ne, in tuā-tuā huann-hí.
English: All the assembly of those who were come again out of the captivity made booths, and lived in the booths; for since the days of Jeshua the son of Nun to that day the children of Israel had not done so. There was very great gladness.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah, saying,

Tailo: Hit-ê bīng-līng kng tio̍h tuì o͘-àm tsiò tshut-.lâi ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī īng kng tsiò tī lán ê sim-lāi ê Siōngtè, I hō͘ lán jīn-bat tsiò tī Iésu Ki-tok ê bīn hit-ê îng-kng.
English: seeing it is God who said, Light will shine out of darkness, who has shone in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

Tailo: Án-ne sī beh hō͘ tsìng lâng lóng tsun-kìng Kiáⁿ ná tshin-tshiūnn tsun-kìng Thiⁿ-pē; bô tsun-kìng Kiáⁿ ê lâng, to̍h-sī bô tsun-kìng tshe-phài I lâi ê Thiⁿ-pē.
English: that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He who doesn't honor the Son doesn't honor the Father who sent him.

Tailo: Lí ná ē in-uī lí ê siong lâi tuā-siaⁿ huah? Lí ê thòng-khó͘ bē i-tit. In-uī lí ê tsuē-kò tsin tāng, tsuē-ok tsin tsē, só͘-í Guá īng tsiah-ê khuán-thāi lí.
English: Why cry you for your hurt? your pain is incurable: for the greatness of your iniquity, because your sins were increased, I have done these things to you.

Tailo: Guá tsiū kî-tó, Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí tì-ì lâi kuan-sim guá, mā tio̍h thiaⁿ hiah-ê kah guá tsing-piān ê lâng ê uē.
English: Give heed to me, Yahweh, and listen to the voice of those who contend with me.

Tailo: i tsiū tio̍h sǹg bē-tshut tē ê nî-hān, kā só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê hîng hit-ê bé-tsú, pún-sin tsiū thang huê-ho̍k i ê sán-gia̍p.
English: then let him reckon the years since the sale of it, and restore the surplus to the man to whom he sold it; and he shall return to his property.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā tsit-ê siâⁿ kau hō͘ Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tshiú kah Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal ê tshiú, i ē kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh: Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it:

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, guá thàu-mê iân khe tsiūⁿ-.khì, kuan-tshat siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, koh ua̍t tńg-sin, tuì suaⁿ-kok ê mn̂g ji̍p-.khì, tsiah tńg-.lâi.
English: Then went I up in the night by the brook, and viewed the wall; and I turned back, and entered by the valley gate, and so returned.

Tailo: Lí bô huâi-īn bô seⁿ kiáⁿ ê, tio̍h tshiùⁿ kua; lí m̄-bat king-kuè seⁿ kiáⁿ ê kan-khó͘, tio̍h tshut siaⁿ tshiùⁿ kua, tshut huann-hí ê siann; in-uī ka-kī tuà ê tsa-bó͘ lâng pí ū tiōng-hu ê seⁿ khah tsē kiáⁿ. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Sing, barren, you who didn't bear; break forth into singing, and cry aloud, you who did not travail with child: for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí, tī suaⁿ tíng ū luî tân, ū sih-nà kah ba̍t hûn, sàu-kak ê siann koh tsin tuā, iâⁿ lāi ê jîn-bîn lóng phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: It happened on the third day, when it was morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud on the mountain, and the sound of an exceedingly loud trumpet; and all the people who were in the camp trembled.

Tailo: Īng kim ê khì-kū hō͘ lâng lim, khì-kū tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-khuán; ông ê tsiú tsin tsē, hián-sī ông ê hù-tsiok.
English: They gave them drink in vessels of gold ( the vessels being diverse one from another ) , and royal wine in abundance, according to the bounty of the king.

Tailo: Lín nā tuì Tsú ū kian-kò͘ ê sìn-sim, guán tsiū kám-kak ū tsin-tsiàⁿ teh ua̍h.
English: For now we live, if you stand fast in the Lord.

Tailo: Koh kah Huilīsū lâng kau-tsiàn, hit sî, Iail ê kiáⁿ Elhanan thâi-sí Gat lâng, Golīat ê hiann-tī Lamih. Tsit-ê lâng ê tshiuⁿ-pèⁿ tuā kah tshin-tshiūnn pò͘-ki ê ti̍k-sim.
English: There was again war with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.

Tailo: Hit lāi-bīn ū tē-bīn ta̍k tsióng ê tsáu-siù, thâng-thuā kah khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu.
English: in which were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, reptiles, and birds of the sky.

Tailo: Thinn tíng ê tsìng tsheⁿ-sîn lóng bô huat-tshut kng, ji̍t-thâu tú-á tshut-.lâi tsiū piàn o͘-àm, gue̍h mā bô huat-tshut i ê kng.
English: For the stars of the sky and its constellations will not give their light. The sun will be darkened in its going forth, and the moon will not cause its light to shine.

Tailo: Guán tsa̍p-jī tsi-tso̍k ê tông-pau mê-ji̍t jia̍t-sim kìng-pài, mā sī teh kî-thāi ē-tàng ta̍t-sîng tsit-ê ǹg-bāng. Ông, guá uī-tio̍h tsit-ê ǹg-bāng, tsiah hō͘ Iô-tá-iah lâng khòng-kò.
English: which our twelve tribes, earnestly serving night and day, hope to attain. Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa!

Tailo: Kiû Lí thiaⁿ guán, īng tsiàⁿ tshiú lâi khan-kiù guán, thang hō͘ Lí só͘ thiàⁿ ê lâng tit-kiù.
English: That your beloved may be delivered, Save with your right hand, and answer us.

Tailo: In tuì Lí ai-kiû, tsiū tit-tio̍h tsín-kiù; in uá-khò Lí, Lí tsiū bô hō͘ in kiàn-siàu.
English: They cried to you, and were delivered. They trusted in you, and were not disappointed.

Tailo: Hīnn-á nā kóng, Guá m̄-sī ba̍k-tsiu, só͘-í, bô sio̍k sing-khu. Hīnn-á bē in-uī án-ne tsiū bô sio̍k sing-khu.
English: If the ear would say, Because I'm not the eye, I'm not part of the body, it's not therefore not part of the body.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Sàulô ê hui Aiah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Li-tsu-bah só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì kā Tabi̍t kóng.
English: It was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú ê tuā siū-khì, it-tīng bô lâng tuà tī hia, ē tsuân-jiân pha-hng; kiàn-nā king-kuè Babúlông ê ē tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, mā ē in-uī i só͘ tú-tio̍h tsiah-ê tsai-hō, lâi kā i thí-tshiò.
English: Because of the wrath of Yahweh she shall not be inhabited, but she shall be wholly desolate: everyone who goes by Babylon shall be astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.

Tailo: Hō͘ āu-tāi, to̍h-sī teh beh tshut-sì ê kiáⁿ-sun tsai; jiân-āu koh thuân hō͘ in ê kiáⁿ-kiáⁿ sun-sun,
English: That the generation to come might know, even the children who should be born; Who should arise and tell their children,

Tailo: I khiā nn̄g ki thiāu tī tiān ê mn̂g-lông, khiā tī tsiànn pîng ê thiāu miâ kiò-tsò Iá-kin, khiā tī tò pîng ê miâ kiò-tsò Bôohtsuh.
English: He set up the pillars at the porch of the temple: and he set up the right pillar, and called the name of it Jachin; and he set up the left pillar, and called the name of it Boaz.

Tailo: Kàu tsit sî, guán iáu-koh teh iau, tshuì-ta, thǹg-pak-theh, hō͘ lâng phah, sì-kè teh liû-lōng.
English: Even to this present hour we hunger, thirst, are naked, are beaten, and have no certain dwelling place.

Tailo: I hō͘ bān-bîn khut-ho̍k tī guán ê ē-bīn, mā hō͘ lia̍t pang khut-ho̍k tī guán ê kha tsîng.
English: He subdues nations under us, And peoples under our feet.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuì Hebúlông lâi liáu-āu, tuì Êlúsalèm koh li̍p hō͘-hui, Tabi̍t koh seⁿ kiáⁿ-jî.
English: David took him more concubines and wives out of Jerusalem, after he was come from Hebron; and there were yet sons and daughters born to David.

Tailo: Koh keh tńg kang, thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h tāi-kún pua̍h-tó tī Siōngtsú ê kuī tsîng, bīn phak tī thô͘-kha, jî-tshiánn tāi-kún ê thâu kah nn̄g ki tshiú-tsiúⁿ lóng áu-tn̄g tī hō͘-tīng tíng, tsí ū tshun tāi-kún tó pêⁿ-pêⁿ ê sing-khu.
English: When they arose early on the next day morning, behold, Dagon was fallen on his face to the ground before the ark of Yahweh; and the head of Dagon and both the palms of his hands lay cut off on the threshold; only the stump of Dagon was left to him.

Tailo: In-uī in bē-tàng jím-siū hit-ê bīng-līng án-ne kóng, Liân tsáu-siù nā kha̍p-tio̍h suaⁿ, mā tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm-sí. ( tsù, CAG 19:12-13 )
English: for they could not stand that which was commanded, If even an animal touches the mountain, it shall be stoned ;

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu lâu ba̍k-sái, bô thîng bô suah,
English: My eye pours down, and doesn't cease, without any intermission,

Tailo: I nā kóng, hó à, lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsiū ū pîng-an; i nā siū-khì, tsiū tsai i kuat-ì beh hāi guá.
English: If he says, It is well;' your servant shall have peace: but if he be angry, then know that evil is determined by him.

Tailo: Guá bô beh huat-tshut guá bíng-lia̍t ê siū-khì, mā bô koh huí-bia̍t Ehulaim. In-uī guá sī Siōngtè, m̄-sī sè-kan lâng, sī tī lín tiong-kan ê sìng ê; guá bô beh tī siū-khì tiong lîm-kàu lín.
English: I will not execute the fierceness of my anger. I will not return to destroy Ephraim: For I am God, and not man; the Holy One in the midst of you; And I will not come in wrath.

Tailo: Taⁿ guán tsai Lí ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì lóng tsai, m̄-bián lâng kā Lí mn̄g. In-uī án-ne, guán sìn Lí sī tuì Siōngtè hia lâi ê.
English: Now we know that you know all things, and don't need for anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came forth from God.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsū-su, puē-gi̍k tsin-lí, koh tian-tò tńg-khì sūn-tsiông put-gī ê lâng, Siōngtè ē īng siū-khì kah hîng-hua̍t, lâi kā in pò-ìng.
English: but to those who are self-seeking, and don't obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, will be wrath and indignation,

Tailo: In huâi-īn tsân-hāi, seⁿ-tshut tsuē-gia̍t, pak-tó͘ lāi só͘ tsún-pī ê lóng sī kuí-tsà.
English: They conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity. Their heart prepares deceit.

Tailo: ( Khóla̍h kiáⁿ-sun kà-sī ê si, koh sī ài-bō͘ ê kua; kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; tiāu īng Pik-ha̍p-hue . ) Guá ê sim tshìng-tshut bí-hó ê uē, guá kóng-khí guá uī-tio̍h ông só͘ tsò ê si, guá ê tsi̍h tshin-tshiūnn láu-liān tsok-ka ê pit.
English: My heart overflows with a noble theme. I recite my verses for the king. My tongue is like the pen of a skillful writer.

Tailo: Hit sî, Mô͘ap ông Tsip-pol ê kiáⁿ Baal khí-lâi kah Isulael kau-tsiàn, in tshe lâng khì kiò Bohol ê kiáⁿ Palân lâi kā lín tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Then Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, arose and fought against Israel: and he sent and called Balaam the son of Beor to curse you;

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá khó͘-khǹg lín tio̍h hō͘ i tsai-iáⁿ lín khak-si̍t ū teh thiàⁿ i.
English: Therefore I beg you to confirm your love toward him.

Tailo: Kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá tuì guá kóng, Lí tio̍h tshut siaⁿ kóng, bān-kun ê Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Uī-tio̍h Êlúsalèm kah uī-tio̍h Si-óng, Guá jia̍t-sim kàu-ki̍k.
English: So the angel who talked with me said to me, Proclaim, saying, Thus says Yahweh of Armies: I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.

Tailo: Páulô án-ne kóng suah, Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng kah Sat-to-kai phài ê lâng tsiū khí tsing-lūn, gī-huē mā hun-lia̍t.
English: When he had said this, an argument arose between the Pharisees and Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.

Tailo: Baal tsiū tshuā Palân kàu hit-ê khuànn lo̍h-.khì, ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h khòng-iá ê Pau-al ê suaⁿ tíng.
English: Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, that looks down on the desert.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Isulael lâng tī ing-kai hiàn ê mi̍h ū huān tsuē; in-uī Iôtah ê tsi-tso̍k tiong, Tsa-la̍h ê kan-á-sun, Tsap-tí ê sun, Kal-mih ê kiáⁿ Akan the̍h ing-kai hiàn ê mi̍h; Siōngtsú tsiū siū-khì Isulael lâng.
English: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the devoted thing; for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the devoted thing: and the anger of Yahweh was kindled against the children of Israel.

Tailo: Lín tsí ū khut-sin tī siū lia̍h ê lâng ê ē-bīn, tó tī siū thâi ê lâng ê ē-bīn. Suî-jiân án-ne, Siōngtsú ê siū-khì iáu-buē siau, I ê tshiú iû-guân tshun-.leh.
English: They will only bow down under the prisoners, And will fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, But his hand is stretched out still.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lâng tuì guá kóng: Siōngtsú ê uē tī tó-uī? Taⁿ tio̍h hō͘ I ê uē lâi si̍t-hiān!
English: Behold, they tell me, Where is the word of Yahweh? let it come now.

Tailo: Iésu tsai-iáⁿ in ê ì-sù, tsiū kā in kóng, Lín sī án-tsuáⁿ teh gī-lūn bô tuà piáⁿ ê tāi-tsì? Lín kám iáu-koh bē liáu-kái, bē bîng-pi̍k? Lín ê sim ná ē hiah-ni̍h tūn?
English: Jesus, perceiving it, said to them, Why do you reason that it's because you have no bread? Don't you perceive yet, neither understand? Is your heart still hardened?

Tailo: I kā guá kóng, Lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, lí khuàⁿ, ū tsi̍t-ê ting-tâi, sī kui ki īng kim tsò ê, tíng-bīn ū tsi̍t-ê iû kuī, ting-tâi tíng ū tshit tsuáⁿ ting, tíng-bīn ê ting-tsuáⁿ ū tshit ki kóng.
English: He said to me, What do you see? I said, I have seen, and behold, a lampstand all of gold, with its bowl on the top of it, and its seven lamps thereon; there are seven pipes to each of the lamps, which are on the top of it;

Tailo: Lín sī tuì thiⁿ-sài niá-siū Siōngtè ê lu̍t-huat, kìng-jiân bô teh tsun-siú!
English: You received the law as it was ordained by angels, and didn't keep it!

Tailo: Kìng-uì Siōngtsú ê tō-lí sī tshing-khì, íng-uán tsûn-tsāi; Siōngtsú ê phuàⁿ-tuàn tsin-si̍t, it-tshè lóng sī kong-gī.
English: The fear of Yahweh is clean, enduring forever. Yahweh's ordinances are true, and righteous altogether.

Tailo: Tī só͘ thâi-sí ê lâng ê tiong-kan, mā thâi-sí Mítiân tsiah-ê ông, to̍h-sī E-mih, Le-kém, Tsu-ul, Huul, Lī-pa ê Mítiân gō͘-ê ông, koh īng to thâi-sí Bohol ê kiáⁿ Palân.
English: They killed the kings of Midian with the rest of their slain: Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian: Balaam also the son of Beor they killed with the sword.

Tailo: Sán-pô in-uī kìng-uì Siōngtè, Siōngtè tsiū hō͘ in sîng-ka.
English: It happened, because the midwives feared God, that he gave them families.

Tailo: Tsè-si kā in kóng, Lín thang pîng-an khì, lín só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘ sī tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: The priest said to them, Go in peace: before Yahweh is your way wherein you go.

Tailo: In āu-lâi tshe kuí-nā-ê Hua-lí-sái phài kah He-lo̍t tóng ê lâng lâi Iésu hia, ài beh tshńg I só͘ kóng ê uē-phāng, thang lâi kā I hām-hāi.
English: They sent some of the Pharisees and of the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words.

Tailo: Phah-sí tsing-seⁿ ê, tio̍h puê-sióng, īng miā puê miā.
English: He who strikes a animal mortally shall make it good, life for life.

Tailo: Guā-pang lâng, to̍h-sī lia̍t pang tiong kiông-pō ê, kā i tshò-tn̄g hiat-ka̍k. I ê ue ka-la̍uh tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h kah só͘-ū ê suaⁿ-kok tiong; i ê ki tn̄g tī hit só͘-tsāi ê hô piⁿ. Tē tsiūⁿ ê tsìng lâng í-king lo̍h-.khì, lī-khui i ê ìm-ńg.
English: Strangers, the terrible of the nations, have cut him off, and have left him: on the mountains and in all the valleys his branches are fallen, and his boughs are broken by all the watercourses of the land; and all the peoples of the earth are gone down from his shadow, and have left him.

Tailo: I ê thâu-hia̍h siá tsi̍t-ê ū ún-ba̍t ì-sù ê miâ, to̍h-sī Tuā Babúlông, tē-tsiūⁿ ê îm-hū kah khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h ê lāu-bú.
English: And on her forehead a name was written, MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF THE PROSTITUTES AND OF THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH.

Tailo: Guá nā huān tsuē, Lí tsiū tsù-ì guá, mā bô beh lia̍h guá tsò bô tsuē.
English: If I sin, then you mark me. You will not acquit me from my iniquity.

Tailo: Guá kā Guá ê uē hē tī lí ê tshuì, īng Guá ê tshiú ê iánn jia-khàm lí, Guá khai-thian pi̍t-tē, koh tuì Si-óng kóng: Lí sī Guá ê tsú-bîn.
English: I have put my words in your mouth, and have covered you in the shadow of my hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundations of the earth, and tell Zion, You are my people.

Tailo: Uàn-hūn lâng ê, i tshuì kóng phô͘-tháⁿ ê uē, tsóng-.sī, sim-lāi khǹg kuí-tsà.
English: A malicious man disguises himself with his lips, But he harbors evil in his heart.

Tailo: Lí bat īng Lí ê tshiú sio̍k-huê Lí ê tsú-bîn, to̍h-sī Iâkop kah Iôséhuh ê kiáⁿ-sun. [Sè-la̍h]
English: You have redeemed your people with your arm, The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h siông-sè khuànn hit-ê uân-tsuân koh tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng, in-uī hô-pîng ê lâng ū hó ê kiat-kio̍k.
English: Mark the perfect man, and see the upright, For there is a future for the man of peace.

Tailo: Kóng-uē ha̍p-gî, ná tshin-tshiūnn kim phông-kó hē tī gîn nâ-á lāi.
English: A word fitly spoken Is like apples of gold in settings of silver.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng tsū-tsi̍p tsiàn-tshia kah bé-ping, ū tsiàn-tshia tsi̍t-tshing sì-pah tâi, bé-ping tsi̍t-bān nn̄g-tshing miâ, an-tì tī tún tshia ê siâⁿ, mā kah ông tī Êlúsalèm.
English: Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had one thousand four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, that he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.

Tailo: Guá siá phue hō͘ só͘-ū tuà tī Lô-má, Siōngtè só͘ thiàⁿ, siū kíng-tiàu tsò I ê sìn-tô͘ ê lâng. Guān lán ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè kah Tsú Iésu Ki-tok, sù lìn un-tián kah pîng-an!
English: to all who are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Tailo: Siū-siong ê lô͘-tik, I bô beh at-tn̄g; beh hua ê ting-hué, I mā bô beh pûn-sit, it-ti̍t kàu I hō͘ kong-gī tik-sìng.
English: He won't break a bruised reed. He won't quench a smoking flax, Until he leads justice to victory.

Tailo: Tuì taⁿ í-āu, tsi̍t ke gō͘ lâng ē uan-ke, saⁿ-ê kah nn̄g-ê uan-ke, nn̄g-ê kah saⁿ-ê uan-ke.
English: For from now on, there will be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.

Tailo: Isulael ê tsìng kiáⁿ ta̍k-ê tshuā i ê ka-kuàn kah Iâkop tsò-hué lâi-kàu Aigi̍p, in ê miâ kì tī ē-té:
English: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt ( every man and his household came with Jacob ) :

Tailo: Hit sî, Iésu kóng, Thiⁿ-pē ah, thiⁿ-tē ê Tsú, guá kám-siā Lí, in-uī Lí kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, tuì tì-huī tshong-bîng ê lâng am-khàm khí-.lâi, khiok ū tuì sè-hàn gín-á khé-sī.
English: At that time, Jesus answered, I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.

Tailo: Lâng ē kā in tshing-tsò Sìng ê tsú-bîn , kā in kiò-tsò Siōngtsú só͘ sio̍k-huê ê; lí mā ē hông kiò-tsò Tshuē-tio̍h ê, bô siū pàng-sak ê siâⁿ .
English: They shall call them The holy people, The redeemed of Yahweh: and you shall be called Sought out, A city not forsaken.

Tailo: Êsutel kóng, Tuì-ti̍k to̍h-sī tsit-ê pháiⁿ lâng Hamán. Hamán tī ông kah ông-hō͘ ê bīn-tsîng tsiū tsin kiaⁿ.
English: Esther said, An adversary and an enemy, even this wicked Haman. Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Eh! Eh! Lín tio̍h tuì pak-hong ê tē tô-tsáu, in-uī Guá í-king kā lín sì-suàⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h sì-bīn ê hong. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Come! Come! Flee from the land of the north,' says Yahweh; for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the sky,' says Yahweh.

Tailo: In thiaⁿ He-lo̍t ê uē tsiū tshut-huat. In tī tang-hong khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê hit lia̍p tsheⁿ, hut-jiân tuà thâu-tsîng teh kā in tshuā-lō͘, lâi-kàu hit-ê enn-á ê só͘-tsāi, tsiū thîng tuà hit tíng-bīn.
English: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.

Tailo: Īng muâ-phiàn tit-tio̍h ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, lâng lia̍h-tsò sī tsu-bī; tsóng-.sī, āu-lâi i ē muá tshuì tsuân sua.
English: Fraudulent food is sweet to a man, But afterwards his mouth is filled with gravel.

Tailo: I īng pik-hiuⁿ tshâ pán khí tsò tiān ê lāi tshiûⁿ; tuì tiān ê thô͘-kha kàu êⁿ-á, lóng īng tshâ kā i khàm, koh īng siông tshiū pán pho͘ tiān ê thô͘-kha.
English: He built the walls of the house within with boards of cedar: from the floor of the house to the walls of the ceiling, he covered them on the inside with wood; and he covered the floor of the house with boards of fir.

Tailo: Tong-sî, guá bīng-līng lín ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ kóng, ' Lín tī lín hiann-tī tiong sím-phuàⁿ, nā ū lâng kah i ê hiaⁿ-tī, á-.sī kah in tiong-kan ê tshut-guā lâng ū sio-kò, tio̍h tsiàu kong-tō lâi phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear the causes between your brothers, and judge righteously between a man and his brother, and the foreigner who is living with him.

Tailo: Tsa̍k-khai khiā-.leh, tuì Tsú kóng, Tsú ah, guá beh kā guá só͘-ū tsâi-sán ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ, the̍h-lâi tsín-tsè sàn-tshiah lâng; guá nā bat pián siáⁿ lâng ê tsînn, guá beh sì puē puê i.
English: Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. If I have wrongfully exacted anything of anyone, I restore four times as much.

Tailo: Lâng-lâng tuì tshù-piⁿ kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t; īng phô͘-tháⁿ ê tshuì-tûn kah nn̄g khuán ê sim lâi kóng-uē.
English: Everyone lies to his neighbor. They speak with flattering lips, and with a double heart.

Tailo: Tsò tiúⁿ-ló tio̍h hîng-uî tuan-tsiàⁿ, kan-taⁿ tsi̍t-ê bó͘, kiáⁿ-jî lóng sī sìn-tô͘, bô lâng khòng-kò in hòng-tōng á-.sī bô siú huat-tō͘.
English: if anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior.

Tailo: Iésu ji̍p-khì tshù lāi, tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tsiū kiâⁿ uá khì. Iésu mn̄g in kóng, Lín kám siong-sìn guá ē-tàng tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì? In ìn kóng, Tsú ah, Lí ē.
English: When he had come into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them, Do you believe that I am able to do this? They told him, Yes, Lord.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, in ap-tsè Lí ê tsú-bîn, khó͘-to̍k Lí ê sán-gia̍p — Isulael.
English: They break your people in pieces, Yahweh, And afflict your heritage.

Tailo: Lí bô ing-kai khiā tī siang-tshe lō͘, tsa̍h in tiong-kan tô-tsáu ê lâng; in tú-tio̍h tsai-lān ê ji̍t, lí bô ing-kai kā in tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng kau-hù tuì-ti̍k.
English: Don't stand in the crossroads to cut off those of his who escape. Don't deliver up those of his who remain in the day of distress.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in bô tsun-thàn, Mánáse ín-iú in kiâⁿ pháiⁿ, pí Siōngtsú tī Isulael lâng ê bīn-tsîng só͘ bia̍t ê lia̍t kok koh khah siong-tiōng.
English: But they didn't listen: and Manasseh seduced them to do that which is evil more than did the nations whom Yahweh destroyed before the children of Israel.

Tailo: In ê tshuì thò͘-tshut pháiⁿ uē, tshuì-tûn ū to; in siūⁿ kóng, siáⁿ lâng ū thiaⁿ-.tio̍h?
English: Behold, they spew with their mouth. Swords are in their lips, For, they say, who hears us?

Tailo: Ísak tuì hia tńg-khì Bel-sí-bah.
English: He went up from there to Beersheba.

Tailo: Koh niû mn̂g ê lông, khuah peh tiú, i ê thiāu nn̄g tiú; hit-ê mn̂g ê mn̂g-lông sī ǹg tshù.
English: Then measured he the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and the posts of it, two cubits; and the porch of the gate was toward the house.

Tailo: ( Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) Tsiàu-kò͘ sàn-tshiah lâng ê lâng ū hok-khì! Tng huān-lān ê ji̍t, Siōngtsú ē kiù i.
English: Blessed is he who considers the poor: Yahweh will deliver him in the day of evil.

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Alông ji̍p-khì kìnn Huâ-láu, tsiū tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù ê khì tsò. Alông kā i ê kuái-á hiat tī Huâ-láu kah i ê jîn-sîn bīn-tsîng, kuái-á tsiū piàn-tsò tsuâ.
English: Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh, and they did so, as Yahweh had commanded: and Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it became a serpent.

Tailo: Guá í-king tāi-sing kā lín kóng à.
English: Behold, I have told you beforehand.

Tailo: Iobuh ìn kóng:
English: Then Job answered,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu kám m̄-sī ǹg sîng-si̍t? Lí kā in phah, in mā bô iu-siong; Lí kā in huí-bia̍t, in mā m̄-khíng siū kàu-tok. In hō͘ in ê bīn pí tsio̍h khah tīng, m̄-khíng huê-thâu.
English: O Yahweh, don't your eyes look on truth? you have stricken them, but they were not grieved; you have consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.

Tailo: In-uī Jîn-tsú sī beh lâi tshuē sit-bê ê lâng, lâi kā i kiù.
English: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú ê tsi-tso̍k, tsiàu Isulael tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē, khì hia beh o-ló Siōngtsú ê miâ.
English: Where the tribes go up, even Yah's tribes, According to an ordinance for Israel, To give thanks to the name of Yahweh.

Tailo: Akisi kā i ê jîn-sîn kóng, Lín khuànn, tsit-ê lâng sī tian-kông, ná ē tuà i lâi guá tsia?
English: Then said Achish to his servants, Look, you see the man is mad; why then have you brought him to me?

Tailo: Lán í-king ū tsi̍t uī tuā-tsè-si teh tī-lí Siōngtè ê ke.
English: and having a great priest over the house of God,

Tailo: Iôséhuh tuì i ê hiann-tī kóng, Guá teh beh sí à, tsóng-.sī, Siōngtè it-tīng ē khuàⁿ-kò͘ lín, tshuā lín tuì tsit só͘-tsāi tsiūⁿ-.khì, kàu I tsiù-tsuā ìng-ín hō͘ Abulahàm, Ísak, Iâkop ê tē.
English: Joseph said to his brothers, I am dying, but God will surely visit you, and bring you up out of this land to the land which he swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h suan-pò͘, hō͘ i tsìn-tsîng lâi, hō͘ in tāi-ke tsham-siông; siáⁿ lâng tuì kó͘-tsá to̍h tsí-bîng tsit-ê? Siáⁿ lâng tuì tsá-tsîng to̍h suan-pò͘ tsit-ê? Kám m̄-sī Guá — Siōngtsú? Guá í-guā bô koh ū tsin-sîn; Guá sī kong-gī ê Siōngtè, koh sī Kiù-tsú; Guá í-guā bô pa̍t-ê.
English: Declare you, and bring it forth; yes, let them take counsel together: who has shown this from ancient time? who has declared it of old? Haven't I, Yahweh? and there is no God else besides me, a just God and a Savior; there is no one besides me.

Tailo: to̍h-sī tī tsit tē-hng in só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê kiáⁿ-sun, Isulael lâng bē-tàng kā in tsuân-pō͘ siau-bia̍t ê, Só͘lômóng phài in tsò khó͘-kang, ti̍t-kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: their children who were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel were not able utterly to destroy, of them did Solomon raise a levy of bondservants to this day.

Tailo: Guá nā án-ne tsò, king-tián só͘ kì-tsài it-tīng ē huat-sing ê tsit-ê tāi-tsì ná ē ìng-giām?
English: How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that it must be so?

Tailo: In tsiū lia̍h Iésu, kā I ah-khì tuā-tsè-si ê kong-kuán. Piattò͘ lī hn̄g-hn̄g teh tuè Iésu.
English: They seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest's house. But Peter followed from a distance.

Tailo: Iésu tsē tī hōng-hiàn-siuⁿ ê tuì-bīn teh khuàⁿ tsìng lâng hiat tsînn lo̍h-.khì, ū tsin tsē hó-gia̍h lâng hiat tsin tsē tsînn.
English: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.

Tailo: Lín tsiū tio̍h kóng, ' Tse sī Siōngtsú Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê tsè, tng Isulael lâng tī Aigi̍p ê sî, Siōngtsú phah-sí Aigi̍p lâng, puâⁿ-kuè Isulael lâng ê tshù, kiù lán tāi-ke. ' Tsiū án-ne, jîn-bîn ànn thâu kìng-pài.
English: that you shall say, It is the sacrifice of Yahweh's Passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he struck the Egyptians, and spared our houses.' The people bowed their heads and worshiped.

Tailo: Ē hō͘ lâng tit-tio̍h kà-sī, lâi īng tì-huī pān tāi-tsì, ē hō͘ lâng ū kong-gī, kong-pêⁿ kah tsìng-ti̍t.
English: To receive instruction in wise dealing, In righteousness, justice, and equity;

Tailo: I kóng, Siōngtsú tuì Si-nái lâi, uī-tio̍h in tuì Seil khí-.lâi; tuì Palân ê suaⁿ tsiò-tshut kng, tuì bān-bān sìng ê hia lâi, tuì I ê tsiàⁿ tshiú uī-tio̍h in huat-tshut lia̍t-hué ê lu̍t-huat.
English: He said, Yahweh came from Sinai, Rose from Seir to them; He shined forth from Mount Paran, He came from the ten thousands of holy ones: At his right hand was a fiery law for them.

Tailo: Lí ê suí iâⁿ-kuè siáⁿ lâng? Lí tio̍h lo̍h-khì kah bô siū kat-lé ê lâng tsò-hué tó-.leh!
English: Whom do you pass in beauty? Go down, and be laid with the uncircumcised.

Tailo: Lí khí-.lâi, hō͘ jîn-bîn tshing-khì, kā in kóng, ' Lín tio̍h ka-kī tshing-khì, tsún-pī bîn-á-tsài, in-uī Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Isulael, lín iáu-buē kau tshut hit-ê mi̍h, tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng lín tsiū ē khiā bē-tiâu. '
English: Up, sanctify the people, and say, Sanctify yourselves against tomorrow: for thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, There is a devoted thing in the midst of you, Israel; you can not stand before your enemies, until you take away the devoted thing from among you.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí ê kà-sī tio̍h hû-ha̍p kiān-tsuân ê kàu-gī.
English: But say the things which fit sound doctrine,

Tailo: Ū tsin tsē kok ē khì, kóng: Lâi, lán lâi tsiūⁿ Siōngtsú ê suaⁿ, kàu Iâkop ê Siōngtè ê tiān. I beh īng I ê tō-lō͘ kà-sī lán, lán mā beh kiâⁿ I ê lō͘. In-uī lu̍t-huat ē tuì Si-óng tshut, Siōngtsú ê uē ē tuì Êlúsalèm thuân-pò.
English: Many nations will go and say, Come, and let us go up to the mountain of Yahweh, And to the house of the God of Jacob; And he will teach us of his ways, And we will walk in his paths. For out of Zion will go forth the law, And the word of Yahweh from Jerusalem;

Tailo: Kiâⁿ kīn I-é-bú-suh ê sî, ji̍t í-king beh lo̍h suaⁿ, lô͘-po̍k kā tsú-lâng kóng, Lâi, lán put-jû uat ji̍p-khì I-é-bú-suh lâng tsit-ê siâⁿ, tī hia hioh mê.
English: When they were by Jebus, the day was far spent; and the servant said to his master, Please come and let us turn aside into this city of the Jebusites, and lodge in it.

Tailo: Kah in li̍p-iok liáu-āu kuè saⁿ ji̍t, tsiah thiaⁿ-tio̍h in sī kīn-kīn, tiàm tī in tiong-kan ê.
English: It happened at the end of three days after they had made a covenant with them, that they heard that they were their neighbors, and that they lived among them.

Tailo: Uē-ping siu-tio̍h hiah-ê gîn-á, tsiū tsiàu in só͘ huan-hù ê khì tsò. Kàu kin-á-ji̍t, tsit-ê tāi-tsì iáu tī Iô-tá-iah lâng tiong-kan teh liû-thuân.
English: So they took the money and did as they were told. This saying was spread abroad among the Jews, and continues until this day.

Tailo: kóng, Só͘-ū gōng-ti̍t ê lâng tio̍h uat-lâi tsia. Koh kā bû-ti ê lâng kóng,
English: Whoever is simple, let him turn in here. As for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,

Tailo: Hó lâng lâu sán-gia̍p hō͘ kiáⁿ-sun; pháiⁿ lâng só͘ tsik-tsū ê tsîⁿ-tsâi ē kui gī lâng.
English: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children's children, But the wealth of the sinner is stored for the righteous.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng bat sàng lé-mi̍h hō͘ Siōngtè lâi tit-tio̍h pò-tap? ( tsù, IPK 41:11 )
English: Or who has first given to him, And it will be repaid to him again?

Tailo: Taⁿ m̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn lín ê tsó͘-sian án-ne ngē ām-kún, tio̍h hiàn ka-kī hō͘ Siōngtsú, ji̍p-khì I ê sìng-só͘, to̍h-sī I íng-uán hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê, koh tio̍h ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, thang hō͘ I ê tuā siū-khì ua̍t-tńg lī-khui lín.
English: Now don't you be stiff-necked, as your fathers were; but yield yourselves to Yahweh, and enter into his sanctuary, which he has sanctified forever, and serve Yahweh your God, that his fierce anger may turn away from you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê îng-kng tuì siâⁿ tiong tsiūⁿ-.khì, hioh tī siâⁿ guā tang pîng ê suaⁿ.
English: The glory of Yahweh went up from the midst of the city, and stood on the mountain which is on the east side of the city.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Guá án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ tsit-ê tuā ê tsai-hō lîm-kàu tī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, Guá mā beh án-ne hō͘ Guá só͘ ìng-ín in it-tshè ê hok-khì lîm-kàu in.
English: For thus says Yahweh: Like as I have brought all this great evil on this people, so will I bring on them all the good that I have promised them.

Tailo: Esáu kóng, I ê miâ kiò-tsò Iâkop, kám bô tsin ha̍h? I khi-phiàn guá nn̄g pái. Tsîng tshiúⁿ guá tuā-kiáⁿ ê miâ-hūn, lí khuàⁿ, taⁿ i koh tshiúⁿ guá ê hok-hūn. I koh kóng, Lí kám bô lâu tsi̍t hūn tsiok-hok hō͘ guá?
English: He said, Isn't he rightly named Jacob? For he has supplanted me these two times. He took away my birthright. See, now he has taken away my blessing. He said, Haven't you reserved a blessing for me?

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Guá nā kóng m̄-tio̍h, lí thang kā guá tsí-tsìng; guá nā bô kóng m̄-tio̍h, lí ná ē kā guá phah?
English: Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, testify of the evil; but if well, why do you beat me?

Tailo: I niû i ê tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú, tī tiān ê tsîng-bīn; i tuì guá kóng, Tse sī tsì-sìng-só͘.
English: He measured the length of it, twenty cubits, and the breadth, twenty cubits, before the temple: and he said to me, This is the most holy place.

Tailo: Tsua̍t-tuì m̄-thang! Lán í-king kah tsuē-ok tuān-tsua̍t kuan-hē, kám thang kè-sio̍k tī tsuē-ok tiong sing-ua̍h?
English: May it never be! We who died to sin, how could we live in it any longer?

Tailo: Koh tio̍h īng tsín-kiù tsò thâu-khue, īng Sìng Sîn — to̍h-sī Siōngtè ê uē tsò kiàm.
English: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the spoken word of God;

Tailo: Suaⁿ-.ni̍h ū tsin tsē lâng ê siann, tshin-tshiūnn kui tuā-tīn ê jîn-bîn, ū tsin tsē kok ê jîn-bîn tsū-tsi̍p teh huā-huā háu ê siann. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú tiám-tsê kun-tuī teh beh kau-tsiàn.
English: The noise of a multitude is in the mountains, as of a great people; the noise of an uproar of the kingdoms of the nations gathered together! Yahweh of Armies is mustering the army for the battle.

Tailo: I tshuā guá lâi-kàu lāi-īⁿ, ǹg tang; i niû hit-ê mn̂g, tsiàu í-tsîng ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: He brought me into the inner court toward the east: and he measured the gate according to these measures;

Tailo: Lí ē an-ún, in-uī iú-só͘ ǹg-bāng; lí beh sì-kè sûn-khuàⁿ, tsiū thang an-sim khùn.
English: You shall be secure, because there is hope; Yes, you shall search, and shall take your rest in safety.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú thiaⁿ sàn-tshiah lâng ê kî-kiû, bô khuànn-khin uī-tio̍h I siū kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ ê lâng.
English: For Yahweh hears the needy, And doesn't despise his captive people.

Tailo: Tshù-piⁿ keh-piah kah tshin-tsiâⁿ, thiaⁿ-tio̍h Tsú tuì i ū tuā liân-bín, tsiū kah i tsò-hué huann-hí.
English: Her neighbors and her relatives heard that the Lord had magnified his mercy towards her, and they rejoiced with her.

Tailo: Tang pîng ê tē-kài, to̍h-sī Iâm-hái, kàu Ioltàn hô kháu. Pak-pîng ê tē-kài, sī tuì Ioltàn hô kháu ê hái-uan khí,
English: The east border was the Salt Sea, even to the end of the Jordan. The border of the north quarter was from the bay of the sea at the end of the Jordan;

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lâng kah lán hô-hó, put-jû tsún in tī tsit-ê tē tuà, tsò sing-lí; koh-tsài kóng, tsit-ê tē mā khui-khuah, ē iông-ín tit in. Lán thang tshuā in ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, mā thang kā lán ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kè hō͘ in.
English: These men are peaceful with us. Therefore let them live in the land and trade in it. For behold, the land is large enough for them. Let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tshiàⁿ saⁿ-bān nn̄g-tshing tâi ê tsiàn-tshia kah Mákah ông í-ki̍p i ê jîn-bîn; in tsiū lâi tsat iâⁿ tī Me-tí-ba ê thâu-tsîng. Ammóng lâng mā tuì in hiah-ê siâⁿ tshut-.lâi, tsū-tsi̍p beh lâi kau-tsiàn.
English: So they hired them thirty-two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba. The children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú tuì tsit tsióng sian-ti kóng, Lín ē tú-tio̍h àm-mê, tì-sú khuànn bē-tio̍h ī-siōng, koh ē tú-tio̍h o͘-àm, tì-sú bē tsiam-pok. Hiah-ê sian-ti ē tú-tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn ji̍t lo̍h, mā ē tú-tio̍h ji̍t-sî piàn o͘-àm.
English: Therefore night is over you, with no vision, And it is dark to you, that you may not divine; And the sun will go down on the prophets, And the day will be black over them.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì sī beh ìng-giām Siōngtè thok sian-ti só͘ kóng ê uē,
English: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying,

Tailo: Lín ê saⁿ tio̍h tshīng hó-sè, lín ê ting tio̍h tiám ho͘ to̍h.
English: Let your waist be girded and your lamps burning.

Tailo: Lâng ê phuê-bah nā hō͘ hué sio-.tio̍h, sio-.tio̍h ê só͘-tsāi ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshiah-bah, tsiâⁿ-tsò hué-pan á-.sī hún-âng, á-.sī só͘-ū pe̍h.
English: Or when the body has a burn from fire on its skin, and the raw flesh of the burn becomes a bright spot, reddish-white, or white,

Tailo: Ū tsai-hō ah! Hō͘ lâng lâu hueh ê siâⁿ, ū kuí-tsà kiông-pō muá-muá, tshiúⁿ-kiap bô suah.
English: Woe to the bloody city! It is all full of lies and robbery. The prey doesn't depart.

Tailo: Tsiū tshe lâng tshiánn Huilīsū hiah-ê siú-líng lâi tsū-tsi̍p tī in hia, kóng, Isulael Siōngtsú ê kuī, lán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ siat-huat? In ìn kóng, Τhang kā Isulael Siōngtè ê kuī ūn khì Gat. In tsiū kā Isulael Siōngtè ê kuī ūn khì hia.
English: They sent therefore and gathered all the lords of the Philistines to them, and said, What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel? They answered, Let the ark of the God of Israel be carried about to Gath. They carried the ark of the God of Israel there.

Tailo: Kám thang īng pháiⁿ pò hó? In-uī in khui hām-kheⁿ beh hāi guá ê sèⁿ-miā. Kiû Lí ē kì-tit guá tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng thè in kiû hok-khì, hō͘ Lí ê tuā siū-khì tuì in ua̍t tò-tńg.
English: Shall evil be recompensed for good? for they have dug a pit for my soul. Remember how I stood before you to speak good for them, to turn away your wrath from them.

Tailo: I tsiū pua̍h-tó tī thô͘-kha, thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū siaⁿ tuì i kóng, Sàulô, Sàulô, lí ná ē beh pik-hāi guá?
English: He fell on the earth, and heard a voice saying to him, Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?

Tailo: Iésu bīng-līng guán thuân hok-im hō͘ só͘-ū ê lâng, tsìng-si̍t I sī Siōngtè só͘ jīm-bīng lâi tsò ua̍h-lâng kah sí-lâng ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ.
English: He charged us to preach to the people and to testify that this is he who is appointed by God as the Judge of the living and the dead.

Tailo: Tuà tsit-ê siâⁿ ê jîn-bîn ē khì-kàu hit-ê siâⁿ, kóng, ' Lán tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín lâi-khì kiû Siōngtsú ê un, lâi-khì tshuē bān-kun ê Siōngtsú; nā-sī guá, guá mā beh khì. '
English: and the inhabitants of one shall go to another, saying, Let us go speedily to entreat the favor of Yahweh, and to seek Yahweh of Armies. I will go also.'

Tailo: Iésu koh kóng, Guá beh sìn-khò Siōngtè. ( tsù, ISI 8:17 LXX ) iū-koh kóng, Lí khuàⁿ! Guá kah Siōngtè só͘ hō͘ guá ê kiáⁿ-jî lóng tī tsia. ( tsù, ISI 8:18 )
English: Again, I will put my trust in him. Again, Behold, here am I and the children whom God has given me.

Tailo: Guá ê tsuē-kò kah kuè-sit ū guā tsē? Kiû Lí hō͘ guá tsai guá ê kuè-sit kah guá ê tsuē-kò.
English: How many are my iniquities and sins? Make me know my disobedience and my sin.

Tailo: ē kā guá ê lāu-pē, lāu-bú, guá ê hiann-tī, tsí-muē kah it-tshè sio̍k in só͘-ū ê, tsín-kiù guán ê sèⁿ-miā, hō͘ guán thang bián sí.
English: and that you will save alive my father, and my mother, and my brothers, and my sisters, and all that they have, and will deliver our lives from death.

Tailo: Kàu hit ji̍t, lâng ē īng sio̍k-gí kā lín phue-phîng, koh ē īng tshiⁿ-tshám ê ai-ko lâi ai-siong: Guán lóng sue-pāi! I piàn-uāⁿ guá ê jîn-bîn ê hūn-gia̍h, i ē kā i î-suá lī-khui guá kàu án-tsuáⁿ? I kā guán ê tshân-tē pun hō͘ puē-gi̍k ê lâng.
English: In that day they will take up a parable against you, And lament with a doleful lamentation, saying, We are utterly ruined! My people's possession is divided up. Indeed he takes it from me and assigns our fields to traitors!'

Tailo: Guá tsit khuán ê gû-gōng kah bû-ti, tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng ná tshin-tshiūnn tsing-seⁿ.
English: I was so senseless and ignorant. I was a brute beast before you.

Tailo: tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng kàu gō͘-tsa̍p huè, kiàn-nā ji̍p-lâi tng-tsit tī huē-bō͘ lāi tsò-kang ê,
English: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service, for work in the Tent of Meeting,

Tailo: I ê pē-bú tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì. Iésu bīng-līng in m̄-thang kā só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì kā lâng kóng.
English: Her parents were amazed, but he charged them to tell no one what had been done.

Tailo: Guān Lí tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ si tsû-ài hō͘ bat Lí ê lâng; tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ siúⁿ-sù Lí ê kong-gī hō͘ sim-lāi tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng.
English: Oh continue your loving kindness to those who know you, Your righteousness to the upright in heart.

Tailo: In tuì Aigi̍p bé-.lâi ê tshia, muí tâi kè-ta̍t gîn la̍k pah si-khel, bé muí tsi̍t tsiah kè-ta̍t tsi̍t-pah gō͘-tsa̍p si-khel. Hiat lâng tsiah-ê ông kah Alâm tsiah-ê ông, lóng tuì in king-tshiú tsiàu án-ne tuà tshut-.lâi.
English: They brought up and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred pieces of silver, and a horse for one hundred fifty: and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of Syria, did they bring them out by their means.

Tailo: huē-tsiòng tsiū tio̍h tsiàu hiah-ê huat-tō͘, tī phah-sí-lâng ê kah pò-siû-.ê ê tiong-kan kā i sím-phuàⁿ.
English: then the congregation shall judge between the striker and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances;

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē tsin iu-būn, in-uī i tsin hó-gia̍h.
English: But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich.

Tailo: In-uī guán suî-jiân tuà tī tsit sè-kan teh sing-ua̍h, pīng bô tsiàu sio̍k-sè ê tōng-ki teh hùn-tàu.
English: For though we walk in the flesh, we don't wage war according to the flesh;

Tailo: Lín khak-si̍t tsai, îm-luān, ù-uè á-.sī tham-luân ( Tse sī tsi̍t tsióng ngó͘-siōng tsông-pài ) ê lâng, lóng bē-tàng tsiâⁿ-tsò Ki-tok kah Siōngtè kok-tō͘ ê tsú-bîn.
English: Know this for sure, that no sexually immoral person, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the Kingdom of Christ and God.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng, Hô-lī lâng mā tuà tī Seil, tsóng-.sī, Esáu ê kiáⁿ-sun suà-tsiap i, in tī in ê bīn-tsîng kā in tsâu-bia̍t, lâi tuà tī in ê só͘-tsāi, tshin-tshiūnn Isulael tī Siōngtsú siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē só͘ kiâⁿ ê. )
English: The Horites also lived in Seir before, but the children of Esau succeeded them; and they destroyed them from before them, and lived in their place; as Israel did to the land of his possession, which Yahweh gave to them. )
