Tailo: In tshiúⁿ in ê iûⁿ-kûn, gû-kûn kah lî-á, í-ki̍p siâⁿ lāi kah tshân-.ni̍h só͘-ū ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ.
English: They took their flocks, their herds, their donkeys, that which was in the city, that which was in the field,

Tailo: Lí lim tsuí mā tio̍h tsiàu niû, ta̍k ji̍t tsi̍t hin ê la̍k-hūn tsi-it, tsiàu-sî lâi lim.
English: You shall drink water by measure, the sixth part of a hin: from time to time shall you drink.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Lín lâi, lán lâi tsò-hué piān-lūn! Lín ê tsuē suî-jiân tshin-tshiūnn tsu-âng, i ē piàn-tsò pe̍h kah tshin-tshiūnn seh; suî-jiân âng tshin-tshiūnn ian-tsi, ē piàn-tsò pe̍h kah tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ-mn̂g.
English: Come now, and let us reason together, says Yahweh: Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow. Though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hit-ê siann tē-jī pái tuì thiⁿ ìn kóng, ' Siōngtè só͘ hō͘ i tshing-khì ê, lí m̄-thang lia̍h-tsò lah-sap. '
English: But a voice answered me the second time out of heaven, What God has cleansed, don't you call unclean.'

Tailo: I tsia̍h tn̂g huè-siū, nî-huè, hó-gia̍h kah îng-kng lóng buán-tsiok tsiū kuè-sin. I ê kiáⁿ Só͘lômóng suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: He died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor: and Solomon his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Asah kā i ê lāu-pē kah i pún-sin só͘ hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê kim-gîn kah khì-kū, lóng tuà ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān.
English: He brought into the house of God the things that his father had dedicated, and that he himself had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.

Tailo: In tī in ê pún-kok, tī Lí siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in tuā hok-khì kah Lí tī in bīn-tsîng só͘ siúⁿ-sù khuah-tuā koh puî koh suí ê tē, in bô ho̍k-sāi Lí, mā bô ua̍t tńg-sin lâi lī-khui in ê pháiⁿ hîng-uî.
English: For they have not served you in their kingdom, and in your great goodness that you gave them, and in the large and fat land which you gave before them, neither turned they from their wicked works.

Tailo: I tsiū tńg-khì Baal hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i khiā tī sio-tsè ê piⁿ-á, Mô͘ap ê siú-líng mā kah i tī hia. Baal mn̄g i kóng, Siōngtsú kám ū kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē?
English: He came to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. Balak said to him, What has Yahweh spoken?

Tailo: Ehuahátsuh tsē-uī ê sî, jī-tsa̍p saⁿ huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông saⁿ gue̍h-ji̍t. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Hamutal, sī Lipnah lâng I-é-lí-miah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

Tailo: I sī tshin-tshiūnn kànn-bó, hū-jîn-lâng the̍h-khì hē tī saⁿ lâng hūn ê mī-hún ( Tsù, tshòng 18:16 ) lāi tshiau-tshiau lè, tsuè-āu lóng huat khí-.lâi.
English: It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.

Tailo: In-uī guá uá-khò Lí, ē-tàng kong-phuà tuì-ti̍k; uá-khò guá ê Siōngtè, ē-tàng thiàu kuè tshiûⁿ.
English: For by you, I advance through a troop. By my God, I leap over a wall.

Tailo: tsiū hiàn tsè hō͘ i ê bāng-á, sio hiuⁿ hō͘ i ê tuā bāng, in-uī in tuì tsiah-ê tit-tio̍h puî koh suí ê hūn-gia̍h kah tshiong-tsiok ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: Therefore he sacrifices to his net, and burns incense to his dragnet, because by them his life is luxurious, and his food is good.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng í-king ū bâi-ho̍k lâng tī i ê lāi-pâng, tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Sâmsóng, Huilīsū lâng lâi beh lia̍h lí. Sâmsóng tsiū tshuah-tn̄g tîn-á, tshin-tshiūnn tshuah-tn̄g king-kuè hué ê muâ-si, án-ne, lâng iû-guân m̄-tsai i ê tuā khuì-la̍t.
English: Now she had an ambush waiting in the inner chamber. She said to him, The Philistines are on you, Samson! He broke the cords, as a string of tow is broken when it touches the fire. So his strength was not known.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê tshiú gia̍h kuân, in iû-guân m̄-khuàⁿ; in ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí uī-tio̍h jîn-bîn ê jia̍t-sim lâi kiàn-siàu, koh ū hué sio-bia̍t Lí ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: Yahweh, your hand is lifted up, yet they don't see; but they will see your zeal for the people, and be disappointed. Yes, fire will consume your adversaries.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu ìn kóng, Thiaⁿ Siōngtè ê tō-lí lâi tsun-siú ê lâng koh khah ū hok-khì!
English: But he said, On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.

Tailo: Lēbī tsi-tso̍k sì-tshing la̍k-pah lâng.
English: Of the children of Levi four thousand and six hundred.

Tailo: Lo-t, O͘-nó͘, kang-tshiūⁿ ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Lod, and Ono, the valley of craftsmen.

Tailo: Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué lâi-kàu tsi̍t-ê kiò Gia̍t-se-má-neh ê só͘-tsāi. Iésu kā bûn-tô͘ kóng, Lín tsē tuà tsia thìng-hāu, guá beh khì kî-tó.
English: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, Sit here, while I pray.

Tailo: In-uī ū tsi̍t tso̍k tsiūⁿ-lâi guá ê tē, kiông-bíng koh sǹg bē-liáu; i ê khí tshin-tshiūnn sai ê khí, i ê gê tshin-tshiūnn bó-sai ê gê.
English: For a nation has come up on my land, strong, and without number. His teeth are the teeth of a lion, And he has the fangs of a lioness.

Tailo: I kā hái hun-khui hō͘ in kuè-.khì, koh hō͘ tsuí tshin-tshiūnn thô͘-piah khiā khí-.lâi.
English: He split the sea, and caused them to pass through; He made the waters stand as a heap.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā lí só͘ bat khì ê só͘-tsāi, Guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah lí tông-tsāi, tī lí ê bīn-tsîng tsâu-bia̍t lí só͘-ū ê tuì-ti̍k; Guá beh hō͘ lí tuā tshut-miâ, tshin-tshiūnn tē-tsiūⁿ tsiah-ê uí-jîn ê miâ-siaⁿ.
English: and I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have cut off all your enemies from before you; and I will make you a name, like the name of the great ones who are in the earth.

Tailo: koh kā Guá ê tsú-bîn tsò khau lâi liam, īng gín-á khì uāⁿ ki-lí, bē tsa-bó͘ gín-á khì bé tsiú lâi lim.
English: And have cast lots for my people, And have given a boy for a prostitute, And sold a girl for wine, that they may drink.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Siōngtè kā hit-ê lâng hē tī Etiân hn̂g, lâi tsìng-tsoh kah kò͘-siú.
English: Yahweh God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

Tailo: Tsit-ê kuai-phiah uan-khiau ê sè-tāi ka-kī pāi-huāi; m̄-sī I ê kiáⁿ, sī in ê pē-pīng.
English: They have dealt corruptly with him, they are not his children, it is their blemish; They are a perverse and crooked generation.

Tailo: mā īng hó uē kā i an-uì, hō͘ i ê uī pí kî-tha tsiah-ê ông ê uī khah kuân, to̍h-sī kah i tsò-hué tī Babúlông ê hiah-ê ông.
English: and he spoke kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon,

Tailo: Gín-á m̄-thang bô kā i kàu-tok; lí īng tshê-á kā i phah, bē tì-kàu sí.
English: Don't withhold correction from a child. If you punish him with the rod, he will not die.

Tailo: Sûn-lô tsuân tē ê lâng ē king-kuè hia, nā ū lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h lâng ê kut-hâi, tsiū tī hia li̍p tsi̍t-ê kì-hō, thìng-hāu bâi-tsòng ê lâng kā i bâi-tsòng tī Ha-mong-gok ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Those who pass through the land shall pass through; and when any sees a man's bone, then shall he set up a sign by it, until the undertakers have buried it in the valley of Hamon Gog.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng tsit-ê phì-jū, in m̄-tsai I teh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they didn't understand what he was telling them.

Tailo: I tuì tíng-bīn kàng-lo̍h hué, ji̍p guá ê kut lâi kā guá tsè-ho̍k; I tiuⁿ lô-bāng lâi tîⁿ-puàⁿ guá ê kha, hō͘ guá ua̍t tò-tńg; I hō͘ guá kui ji̍t hi-bî, hūn-.khì.
English: From on high has he sent fire into my bones, and it prevails against them; He has spread a net for my feet, he has turned me back: He has made me desolate and faint all the day.

Tailo: Iésu khuàⁿ-tio̍h i teh thî-khàu kah i tsò-hué lâi ê Iô-tá-iah lâng mā teh thî-khàu, tsiū tsin tsheh-sim, thó͘ tsi̍t ē tuā khuì,
English: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews weeping who came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,

Tailo: Lín ná ē hō͘ guán tshut Aigi̍p, tshuā guán kàu tsit-ê pháiⁿ só͘-tsāi? Bô só͘-tsāi thang iā tsíng, mā bô bû-hua-kó, bô phû-tô, bô sia̍h-liû, koh bô tsuí thang lim.
English: Why have you made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in to this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí khí-lâi tńg-khì lí ê ke, lí ê kha tsi̍t ē ta̍h ji̍p siâⁿ, lí ê kiáⁿ tsiū ē sí.
English: Arise you therefore, get you to your house: and when your feet enter into the city, the child shall die.

Tailo: Guá hō͘ lín á-.sī hō͘ pa̍t lâng phue-phîng, lóng kā i khuàⁿ-tsò sī sió-khuá tāi-tsì; liân guá mā bô phue-phîng ka-kī.
English: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you, or by man's judgment. Yes, I don't judge my own self.

Tailo: Hit-ê jîn-bîn tuā koh lò, sī Alap ê tso̍k, lín só͘ tsai ê, mā bat thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū lâng teh kí in kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng tī Alap tso̍k ê bīn-tsîng khiā ē tiâu? '
English: a people great and tall, the sons of the Anakim, whom you know, and of whom you have heard say, Who can stand before the sons of Anak?

Tailo: In tsiū tshuā Taniel lâi-kàu ông ê bīn-tsîng. Ông mn̄g Taniel kóng, Lí sī siū lia̍h ê Iôtah lâng tiong-kan ê Taniel, to̍h-sī guá ê lāu-pē tsò ông ê sî, tuì Iôtah kā lí lia̍h-.lâi ê, sī-.bô?
English: Then was Daniel brought in before the king. The king spoke and said to Daniel, Are you that Daniel, who are of the children of the captivity of Judah, whom the king my father brought out of Judah?

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá ì-ài Lí só͘ tuà ê tshù, í-ki̍p Lí ê îng-kng lîm-kàu ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Yahweh, I love the habitation of your house, The place where your glory dwells.

Tailo: I tī hûn-thiāu ê tiong-kan tuì in kóng uē; in tsun-siú I kiàn-tsìng ê uē kah I só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê lu̍t-huat.
English: He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud. They kept his testimonies, The statute that he gave them.

Tailo: Hit sî, tī siū lia̍h ê lâng ê tiong-kan, nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū bí-lí, lí mā luân-bō͘ i, beh tshuā i tsò bó͘,
English: and see among the captives a beautiful woman, and you have a desire to her, and would take her to you as wife;

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá in-uī uan-óng lâi tuā-siaⁿ huah, mā bô tit-tio̍h thiaⁿ, guá âu-kiò mā bô tit-tio̍h kong-tuàn.
English: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry for help, but there is no justice.

Tailo: I kì-liām I ê iok it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán; I só͘ ìng-ín ê uē it-ti̍t kàu bān-sè-tāi;
English: He has remembered his covenant forever, The word which he commanded to a thousand generations,

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Siōng iàu-kín ê sī, Isulael lâng, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ! Tsú — lán ê Siōngtè sī to̍k-it ê Tsú.
English: Jesus answered, The greatest is, Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Uī-tio̍h Isulael lâng huān tsuē kàu tē-saⁿ pái, mā kàu tē-sì pái, Guá bô beh bián-tû i ê hîng-hua̍t; in-uī in tshut-bē gī lâng lâi tit-tio̍h gîn, tshut-bē sàn-tshiah lâng lâi tit-tio̍h tsi̍t siang ê.
English: Thus says Yahweh: For three transgressions of Israel, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; Because they have sold the righteous for silver, And the needy for a pair of shoes;

Tailo: In-uī ū siū á-.sī bô siū kat-lé lóng bô iàu-kín, siōng iàu-kín ê sī tsun-siú Siōngtè ê kài-bīng.
English: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.

Tailo: Tī tshiū-nâ lāi tshin-tshiūnn lî teh háu; tī tshì-phè kha teh tshun-ûn.
English: Among the bushes they bray; And under the nettles they are gathered together.

Tailo: Kî-tha tsa̍p-ê bûn-tô͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tuì Iâkop kah Iô-há-neh siū-khì.
English: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John.

Tailo: Só͘-ū uàn-hūn guá ê lâng tsi-bú tsi-tsū teh gī-lūn guá; in kè-bô͘ beh hāi guá.
English: All who hate me whisper together against me. They imagine the worst for me.

Tailo: Koh ū tsa̍p-jī tsiah sai khiā tī la̍k tsàn kiā-á ê tsit pîng kah hit pîng, tī pa̍t kok lóng bô tsè-tsō tshin-tshiūnn án-ne ê.
English: Twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other on the six steps: there was nothing like it made in any kingdom.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá uá-khò Lí ê tsû-ài; guá ê sim in-uī Lí ê tsín-kiù lâi khuài-lo̍k.
English: But I trust in your loving kindness. My heart rejoices in your salvation.

Tailo: Nā tsi̍t nî muá bô sio̍k-huê tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi ê tshù, tsiū tiāⁿ-tio̍h íng-uán kui bé-tsú kàu bān-sè-tāi, tī hí-nî mā m̄-bián hîng bē-tsú.
English: If it isn't redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be made sure in perpetuity to him who bought it, throughout his generations. It shall not be released in the Jubilee.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ gín-á siàu-liân iáu tī lāu-pē ê ke ê sî, nā tuì Siōngtsú hē guān, īng iok lâi ka-kī iok-sok;
English: Also when a woman vows a vow to Yahweh, and binds herself by a bond, being in her father's house, in her youth,

Tailo: Iobuh koh suà-tsiap thê-khí i ê giân-lūn, kóng:
English: Job again took up his parable, and said,

Tailo: Só͘lômóng kî-tó liáu-āu, tsiū ū hué tuì thiⁿ kàng lo̍h-.lâi, tsuân-pō͘ sio sio-tsè kah pa̍t tsióng ê tsè. Siōngtsú ê îng-kng tshiong-muá tiān,
English: Now when Solomon had made an end of praying, the fire came down from heaven, and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices; and the glory of Yahweh filled the house.

Tailo: Guān i it-sing ê ji̍t-tsí sok-té! Guān pa̍t lâng lâi tāi-thè i ê tsit uī!
English: Let his days be few. Let another take his office.

Tailo: Guá bô tsē tī iàn-lo̍k ê lâng ê huē tiong lâi khuài-lo̍k; guá in-uī Lí ê kám-tōng, ka-kī tiām-tiām tsē, in-uī Lí hō͘ siū-khì tshiong-muá guá.
English: I didn't sit in the assembly of those who make merry, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of your hand; for you have filled me with indignation.

Tailo: In suî-jiân bat Siōngtè, khiok bô tsun-tiōng I, mā bô kā I kám-siā. In ê sim-su piàn-tsò gû-gōng, bē lí-kái ê sim-su tshiong-muá o͘-àm.
English: Because, knowing God, they didn't glorify him as God, neither gave thanks, but became vain in their reasoning, and their senseless heart was darkened.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng lîm-kàu guán, guán bô bē kì-tit Lí, mā bô ké-iáⁿ siú Lí ê iok.
English: All this has come on us, Yet have we not forgotten you, Neither have we been false to your covenant.

Tailo: Piattò͘ kah Iô-há-neh tuì kûn-tsiòng teh kóng uē ê sî, tsiah-ê tsè-si kah sìng-tiān ê siú-uē-tiúⁿ, í-ki̍p Sat-to-kai phài ê lâng hut-jiân lâi-kàu-uī.
English: As they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Lí ū tuì Lí siū buah-iû ê siū-khì, kā i ià-siān, kā i khì-sak.
English: But you have rejected and spurned. You have been angry with your anointed.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā gû-kûn, iûⁿ-kûn, thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê, kang ê, lí tio̍h hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè. Gû-kûn thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê m̄-thang hō͘ i tsò-kang; iûⁿ-kûn thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê m̄-thang tsián i ê mn̂g.
English: All the firstborn males that are born of your herd and of your flock you shall sanctify to Yahweh your God: you shall do no work with the firstborn of your herd, nor shear the firstborn of your flock.

Tailo: Hûn tī huē-bō͘ tíng thîng tsin tsē ji̍t, Isulael lâng tsiū siú Siōngtsú só͘ kau-tài ê, bô tshut-huat.
English: When the cloud stayed on the tabernacle many days, then the children of Israel kept the charge of Yahweh, and didn't travel.

Tailo: Lí īng ba̍k-sái tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h hō͘ in tsia̍h, koh īng tsin tsē ba̍k-sái hō͘ in lim.
English: You have fed them with the bread of tears, And given them tears to drink in large measure.

Tailo: Tuì ke-lō͘ tńg-lâi nā bô sé-tshiú, mā bô tsia̍h pn̄g. In koh tsun-siú kî-tha tsin tsē hāng thuân-thóng, tshin-tshiūnn sé pue-á, kuàn-á kah tâng-khì.
English: They don't eat when they come from the marketplace, unless they bathe themselves, and there are many other things, which they have received to hold to: washings of cups, pitchers, bronze vessels, and couches. )

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, guá tsiah tshiánn lín lâi kìⁿ-bīn, tsò-hué thó-lūn. Guá sī uī-tio̍h Isulael só͘ ǹg-bāng ê hit uī, tsiah siū tsit-ê thih-liān-á khún-pa̍k.
English: For this cause therefore I asked to see you and to speak with you. For because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h kui-ǹg lí ê Siōngtè, tsip-siú thiàⁿ-sim, kong-pêⁿ, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ thìng-hāu lí ê Siōngtè.
English: Therefore turn to your God. Keep kindness and justice, And wait continually for your God.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Mal-tha ū tsi̍t-ê tsí-muē, kiò-tsò Mâlíah, tsē tī Tsú ê kha tsîng teh thiaⁿ I ê kà-sī.
English: She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus' feet, and heard his word.

Tailo: Lia̍t kok tuā siū-khì, Lí mā tuā siū-khì. Sí-lâng siū sím-phuàⁿ ê sî-kî kàu à. Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, to̍h-sī hiah-ê sian-ti kah tsìng sìn-tô͘ í-ki̍p kìng-uì Lí ê miâ ê, bô-lūn tuā-sè, Lí pò-siúⁿ in ê sî-kî kàu à. Hiah-ê pāi-huāi tāi-tē ê lâng siū Lí huí-bia̍t ê sî-kî kàu à.
English: The nations were angry, and your wrath came, as did the time for the dead to be judged, and to give your bondservants the prophets, their reward, as well as to the saints, and those who fear your name, to the small and the great; and to destroy those who destroy the earth.

Tailo: Ki-tok sī lán ê ua̍h-miā, I hián-hiān ê sî, lín mā ē kah I tsò-hué hián-hiān, lâi hun-hióng I ê îng-iāu.
English: When Christ, our life, is revealed, then you will also be revealed with him in glory.

Tailo: Biāniámín sī hiong-bíng ê tshâi-lông; tsá-khí sî, tsia̍h i só͘ lia̍h-tio̍h-.ê, ê-hng sî, pun i só͘ tshiúⁿ-tio̍h-.ê.
English: Benjamin is a ravenous wolf. In the morning he will devour the prey. At evening he will divide the spoil.

Tailo: Lí koh siat Lí ê kiàn-tsìng lâi kong-kik guá, tī guá ê sin tsiūⁿ ke-thinn Lí ê siū-khì; kun-ping tsi̍t tuī kuè tsi̍t tuī, beh lâi kong-kik guá.
English: You renew your witnesses against me, And increase your indignation on me. Changes and warfare are with me.

Tailo: I phah-thè I ê tuì-ti̍k, hō͘ in íng-uán siū lîng-jio̍k;
English: He struck his adversaries backward. He put them to a perpetual reproach.

Tailo: Sū-si̍t siōng, ū lâng thuân Ki-tok ê hok-im, sī tshut tī uàn-tò͘ kah ài uan-ke ê sim-lí, ū lâng sī tshut tī sîng-ì.
English: Some indeed preach Christ even out of envy and strife, and some also out of good will.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng Iâkop tsáu kàu Alâm tē, Isulael in-uī beh tit-tio̍h bó͘ lâi ho̍k-sāi lâng, mā in-uī beh tit-tio̍h bó͘ lâi tshī iûⁿ.
English: Jacob fled into the country of Aram, And Israel served to get a wife, And for a wife he tended flocks and herds.

Tailo: M̄-thang pîn-tuāⁿ, tio̍h o̍h hiah-ê tuì sìn kah thun-lún lâi sîng-tsiap Siōngtè ìng-ín ê lâng.
English: that you won't be sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherited the promises.

Tailo: Jím-nāi seⁿ-tshut láu-liān, láu-liān seⁿ-tshut ǹg-bāng;
English: and perseverance, proven character; and proven character, hope:

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, Guá beh hō͘ Isulael ê tsú-bîn kah Iôtah ke, lâng kah tsing-seⁿ lóng thuân tsíng.
English: Behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of animal.

Tailo: Guá ài hô-pîng, tsóng-.sī, guá khui tshuì, in tsiū huah beh tsing-tsiàn.
English: I am for peace, But when I speak, they are for war.

Tailo: In-uī king-tián ū kì-tsài, só͘-ū kiû-kiò Tsú ê miâ ê lâng, lóng ē tit-tio̍h tsín-kiù. ( Tsù, IES 2:32 )
English: For, Whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.

Tailo: Le-ba-nòng ê îng-kng, to̍h-sī siông tshiū, sam tshiū, n̂g-iông tshiū, lóng beh tsò-hué kui lí, uī-tio̍h beh táⁿ-pān Guá ê sìng-só͘; Guá mā beh hō͘ guá kha-ta̍h ê só͘-tsāi tit-tio̍h îng-kng.
English: The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, the fir tree, the pine, and the box tree together, to beautify the place of my sanctuary; and I will make the place of my feet glorious.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lín ê tseh-kî piàn-tsò pi-ai, kua-khik lóng piàn-tsò ai-ko, beh hō͘ tsìng lâng io hâ muâ-pò͘, thâu-khak bô puàⁿ-ki mn̂g, koh hō͘ i pi-ai tshin-tshiūnn to̍k-seⁿ kiáⁿ sí-.khì, kàu bué tshin-tshiūnn thòng-khó͘ ê ji̍t-tsí.
English: I will turn your feasts into mourning, And all your songs into lamentation; And I will make you wear sackcloth on all your bodies, And baldness on every head. I will make it like the mourning for an only son, And the end of it like a bitter day.

Tailo: Bē ài put-gī, tsí ū ài tsin-lí.
English: doesn't rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth;

Tailo: Tha̍k tsit pún tsheh kah thiaⁿ hiah-ê ī-giân, koh tsun-siú kî-tiong só͘ kì-tsài ê lâng tsin ū hok-khì, in-uī ìng-giām tsiah-ê tāi-tsì ê ji̍t-kî teh beh kàu à.
English: Blessed is he who reads and those who hear the words of the prophecy, and keep the things that are written in it, for the time is at hand.

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng bô kā tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê I-é-bú-suh lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì. I-é-bú-suh lâng iû-guân tī Êlúsalèm kah Biāniámín lâng tsò-hué tuà, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: The children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites who inhabited Jerusalem; but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem to this day.

Tailo: mā bô khí tshù lâi hō͘ ka-kī tuà, mā bô ū phû-tô hn̂g, bô ū tshân-hn̂g, bô ū tsíng-tsí.
English: nor to build houses for us to dwell in; neither have we vineyard, nor field, nor seed:

Tailo: Le-má-liah ê kiáⁿ Pekah tsa̍p-tshit nî, Iôtah ông Iô-thàm ê kiáⁿ Akhàtsuh tsē-uī.
English: In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, tī lí ê tiong-kan, lāu-pē ē thâi kiáⁿ lâi tsia̍h, kiáⁿ mā ē thâi lāu-pē lâi tsia̍h. Guá beh tī lín tiong-kan kā lín sím-phuàⁿ, Guá beh kā lí só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn lóng kā in sì-suàⁿ tī sì-hng.
English: Therefore the fathers shall eat the sons in the midst of you, and the sons shall eat their fathers; and I will execute judgments on you; and the whole remnant of you will I scatter to all the winds.

Tailo: Kóng khí-lâi tsin kiàn-siàu, guán kuè-khì m̄-káⁿ tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì. Tsóng-.sī, nā ū lâng káⁿ khua-kháu siáⁿ-mi̍h, tsún-tsò sī tsi̍t-ê gōng lâng teh kóng uē, guá mā káⁿ.
English: I speak by way of disparagement, as though we had been weak. Yet however any is bold ( I speak in foolishness ) , I am bold also.

Tailo: Iô-thàm tsē-uī ê sî jī-tsa̍p gō͘ huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông king-kuè tsa̍p-la̍k nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò E-lu-siah, sī Tsa-tok ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Jerushah the daughter of Zadok.

Tailo: Lí í-king muá tsiah-ê ji̍t, tio̍h koh khi tsiànn pîng tó-.leh, tam-tng Iôtah ê tsú-bîn ê tsuē-kò, Guá kā lí hān sì-tsa̍p kang, tsi̍t ji̍t tú tsi̍t nî.
English: Again, when you have accomplished these, you shall lie on your right side, and shall bear the iniquity of the house of Judah: forty days, each day for a year, have I appointed it to you.

Tailo: to̍h-sī O͘-huil ê kim saⁿ tshing tha-lan-t, tuàn-liān ê gîn tshit tshing tha-lan-t, lâi an-tsng tsiah-ê tshù ê tshiûⁿ.
English: even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, with which to overlay the walls of the houses;

Tailo: Hit sî, ông-hō͘ kah ông tsò-hué tsē, ông kā guá kóng, Lí beh kiâⁿ ê lō͘-thîng tio̍h koh guā kú? Tang sî beh tńg-.lâi? Ông huann-hí tshe guá-.khì, guá tsiū kah i tiāⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê kî-hān.
English: The king said to me ( the queen also sitting by him ) , For how long shall your journey be? and when will you return? So it pleased the king to send me; and I set him a time.

Tailo: Iā lo̍h-.khì ê sī pi-tsiān ê, koh-ua̍h ê sī îng-kng ê; tâi lo̍h-.khì ê sī nńg-tsiáⁿ ê, koh-ua̍h ê sī ióng-tsòng ê;
English: It is sown in dishonor; it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness; it is raised in power.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tham tsâi-lī ê, in ê lō͘ sī án-ne, to̍h-sī hāi-tio̍h in ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain. It takes away the life of its owners.

Tailo: tséⁿ ê tsú-lâng tio̍h puê, mā tio̍h the̍h-tsîⁿ hō͘ i ê tsú-lâng, sí ê tsing-seⁿ kui i ka-kī.
English: the owner of the pit shall make it good. He shall give money to its owner, and the dead animal shall be his.

Tailo: In koh in-uī pō-gio̍k, huān-lān, iu-khó͘, jîn-kháu tsiū kiám-tsió koh hō͘ lâng khuànn-khin.
English: Again, they are diminished and bowed down Through oppression, trouble, and sorrow.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kí ka-kī lâi tsiù-tsuā kóng: Guá thó-ià Iâkop ê îng-huâ, uàn-hūn i ê kiong-tiān; in-uī án-ne, Guá beh kā siâⁿ kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê lóng kau-hù hō͘ tuì-ti̍k.
English: The Lord Yahweh has sworn by himself, says Yahweh, the God of Armies: I abhor the pride of Jacob, And detest his fortresses. Therefore I will deliver up the city with all that is in it.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tsit-ê ài phue-phuàⁿ pa̍t lâng ê, bô-lūn lí sī siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng, lóng bē-tàng piān-kái. In-uī lí phue-phuàⁿ pa̍t lâng tsò ê tāi-tsì, ka-kī mā ta̍k hāng lóng teh tsò, án-ne, lí phue-phuàⁿ pa̍t lâng, to̍h-sī teh tīng ka-kī ê tsuē.
English: Therefore you are without excuse, O man, whoever you are who judge. For in that which you judge another, you condemn yourself. For you who judge practice the same things.

Tailo: Tio̍h uá-khò Siōngtsú kah I ê kuân-lîng, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsáu-tshuē lâi kìnn I ê bīn.
English: Seek Yahweh and his strength. Seek his face forever more.

Tailo: I só͘ khua-kháu ê sī i ióng-tsòng ê lân; ha̍p-uá tsiū tshin-tshiūnn hong ba̍t-ba̍t,
English: Strong scales are his pride, Shut up together with a close seal.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, jîn-bîn tiong-kan tsha-put-to saⁿ tshing lâng khì hia, kìng-jiân tī Ai siânn ê lâng ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu.
English: So there went up there of the people about three thousand men: and they fled before the men of Ai.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, Lí sī guá ê ông; kiû Lí tshut bīng-līng lâi tsín-kiù Iâkop.
English: You are my King, God. Command victories for Jacob!

Tailo: Sî í-king àm, hit ji̍t koh sī tsún-pī Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê ji̍t, to̍h-sī An-hioh-ji̍t ê tsîng tsi̍t ji̍t.
English: When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lín siū bē, bô the̍h lâng ê tsînn, tit-tio̍h sio̍k-huê, mā bô īng tsînn.
English: For thus says Yahweh, You were sold for nothing; and you shall be redeemed without money.

Tailo: Huâ-láu khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsai-hō ū khah kiám khin, tsiū koh ngē i ê sim, m̄-thiaⁿ in ê uē, tú-tú tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê.
English: But when Pharaoh saw that there was a respite, he hardened his heart, and didn't listen to them, as Yahweh had spoken.

Tailo: Kàu hit ji̍t, lâng ē kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, I sī guán ê Siōngtsú, guán pîng-sî thìng-hāu I, I beh tsín-kiù guán. Tse sī Siōngtsú, guán pîng-sî thìng-hāu I, guán beh in-uī I ê kiù-un lâi huann-hí khuài-lo̍k.
English: It shall be said in that day, Behold, this is our God! We have waited for him, and he will save us! This is Yahweh! We have waited for him. We will be glad and rejoice in his salvation!

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng tsi̍t-ē sí, i ê ǹg-bāng ē bô-.khì; tsuē-jîn só͘ him-bō͘ ê mā ē siau-sit-.khì.
English: When a wicked man dies, hope perishes, And expectation of power comes to nothing.

Tailo: Siōngtè sī sìn-si̍t ê, guán tuì lín tap-ìng ê uē mā m̄-sī liâm-piⁿ Sī , koh liâm-piⁿ M̄-sī .
English: But as God is faithful, our word toward you was not Yes and no.

Tailo: Guá hō͘ i ū ki-huē thang hué-kái, m̄-koh, i bô beh hué-kái, koh kè-sio̍k i ê îm-luān.
English: I gave her time to repent, but she refuses to repent of her sexual immorality.

Tailo: Tāi-ke tsia̍h pá, kā be̍h-á hiat-lo̍h hái, thang hō͘ tsûn khah khin.
English: When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.

Tailo: Tī tuā tô͘-sat ê sî, tī tsiú-keⁿ lâu tó-huāi ê ji̍t-tsí, ta̍k-ê kuân suaⁿ tuā niá ē ū hô tsuí khe lâu.
English: There shall be brooks and streams of water on every lofty mountain and on every high hill in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.

Tailo: In án-ne sì pái tshe lâng lâi kìnn guá, guá lóng án-ne kā in ìn.
English: They sent to me four times after this sort; and I answered them after the same manner.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: Moreover the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Lán ná ē lóng thiaⁿ-tio̍h in tsiàu lán tāi-ke tshut-sì to̍h teh kóng ê gí-giân teh kóng uē?
English: How do we hear, everyone in our own native language?

Tailo: Guá ta̍k pái siūⁿ-tio̍h lín ê sî, tsiū kám-siā guá ê Siōngtè.
English: I thank my God whenever I remember you,

Tailo: Iôséhuh īng bí-niûⁿ hōng-ióng i ê lāu-pē kah i ê hiann-tī, í-ki̍p i ê lāu-pē tsuân ke, lóng tsiàu in ê lâng-gia̍h lâi kā in kiong-kip.
English: Joseph nourished his father, his brothers, and all of his father's household, with bread, according to their families.

Tailo: Tshuā sù-tô͘ ji̍p-lâi liáu-āu, tsiū hō͘ in khiā tī gī-huē ê bīn-tsîng, tuā-tsè-si mn̄g in kóng,
English: When they had brought them, they set them before the council. The high priest questioned them,

Tailo: Piattò͘ phah guā-kháu mn̂g ê sî, ū tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Lô-tāi ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á tshut-lâi thiaⁿ khuànn sī siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng.
English: When Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a maid named Rhoda came to answer.

Tailo: Samuel kā I-é-sái kóng, Lí ê kiáⁿ kám lóng tī tsia? I-é-sái ìn kóng, Iáu ū tsi̍t-ê suah-bué ê, taⁿ teh tshī iûⁿ. Samuel kā I-é-sái kóng, Lí tio̍h tshe lâng khì tshuā i lâi, in-uī i iáu-buē lâi, lán bô beh tsē-toh.
English: Samuel said to Jesse, Are here all your children? He said, There remains yet the youngest, and behold, he is keeping the sheep. Samuel said to Jesse, Send and get him; for we will not sit down until he come here.

Tailo: M̄-koh, I kí-khí sàn-tshiah lâng, hō͘ in thuat-lī khó͘-lān, hō͘ i ê ka-tso̍k hing-ōng tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ-kûn.
English: Yet he lifts the needy out of their affliction, And increases their families like a flock.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng lóng ìn kóng, Tsit-ê lâng ê hueh-tsè, iû guán kah guán ê kiáⁿ-sun lâi tam-tng.
English: All the people answered, May his blood be on us, and on our children!

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, In-uī guá kā lí kóng, guá ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí tī bû-hua-kó tshiū kha, lí tsiū sìn guá, sī-.bô? Lí ē khuànn-kìnn pí tse koh khah tuā ê tāi-tsì.
English: Jesus answered him, Because I told you, I saw you underneath the fig tree,' do you believe? You will see greater things than these!

Tailo: In kàu taⁿ iáu bô ka-kī khiam-pi, bô kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, bô tsun-thàn Guá tī lín ê bīn-tsîng kah lín ê tsó͘-sian ê bīn-tsîng só͘ siat-li̍p Guá ê huat-tō͘ kah lu̍t-lē.
English: They are not humbled even to this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, nor in my statutes, that I set before you and before your fathers.

Tailo: guá nā tshin-tshiūⁿ Atám jia-khàm guá ê kuè-sit, kā guá ê tsuē-gia̍t khǹg tī guá ê hing tsîng;
English: If like Adam I have covered my transgressions, By hiding my iniquity in my heart,

Tailo: Beh kàu hia̍t piⁿ ê sî, ông tshut ai-siong ê siann kiò Taniel, tuì i kóng, Íng-ua̍h Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k — Taniel, lí ê Siōngtè, lí só͘ tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ teh ho̍k-sāi ê, kám ē kiù lí thuat-lī hiah-ê sai?
English: When he came near to the den to Daniel, he cried with a lamentable voice; the king spoke and said to Daniel, Daniel, servant of the living God, is your God, whom you serve continually, able to deliver you from the lions?

Tailo: Tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, uī-tio̍h Lí ê iân-kò͘, guán kui ji̍t bīn-tuì sí-bông ê ui-hia̍p. Guán hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò teh beh hō͘ lâng thâi ê iûⁿ. ( tsù, SPh 44:22 )
English: Even as it is written, For your sake we are killed all day long. We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

Tailo: Guān Isulael kóng: I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.!
English: Let Israel now say That his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: In thiaⁿ-tio̍h án-ne tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ, tsiū lī-khui Iésu.
English: When they heard it, they marveled, and left him, and went away.

Tailo: Kiû Lí ta̍k ji̍t tsiàu-sî sù guán tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: Give us day by day our daily bread.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng, To-kiàm, tio̍h khí-lâi kong-kik Guá ê bo̍k-tsiá, mā kong-kik hit-ê kah Guá tsò tâng-phuāⁿ ê lâng. Phah bo̍k-tsiá, iûⁿ-kûn tsiū sì-suàⁿ; hiah-ê bî-sè-.ê, Guá beh ua̍t-tńg tshiú lâi kā in phah.
English: Awake, sword, against my shepherd, And against the man who is close to me, says Yahweh of Armies. Strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered; And I will turn my hand against the little ones.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá suî-jiân ū siá hit-tiuⁿ phue hō͘ lín, m̄-koh m̄-sī uī-tio̍h kā lâng khik-khui, á-.sī hō͘ lâng khik-khui ê lâng siá ê, sī beh hō͘ lín tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng bîng-pi̍k guán tuì lín ê jia̍t-sîng ū guā tshim.
English: So although I wrote to you, I wrote not for his cause that did the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered the wrong, but that your earnest care for us might be revealed in you in the sight of God.

Tailo: Tio̍h suah siū-khì, lī-khui tuā siū-khì; m̄-thang put-pîng, khióng-kiaⁿ ē in-uī án-ne lâi tsò pháiⁿ.
English: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath. Don't fret, it leads only to evildoing.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū tshuā i tshut-khì guā-bīn, kóng, Lí khuàⁿ thiⁿ, sǹg hiah-ê tsheⁿ, lí sǹg ē liáu á-bē? Koh tuì i kóng, Lí ê kiáⁿ-sun mā ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne.
English: Yahweh brought him outside, and said, Look now toward the sky, and count the stars, if you are able to count them. He said to Abram, So shall your seed be.

Tailo: Tsú ah, in-uī Lí sī hó, huann-hí sià-bián lâng, ū hong-sīng ê tsû-ài siúⁿ-sù hō͘ só͘-ū kiû-kiò Lí ê lâng.
English: For you, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive; Abundant in loving kindness to all those who call on you.

Tailo: Iôtah kok kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, i só͘ kiâⁿ ê tsuē kik-tōng I thòng-hūn, pí in tsó͘-sian só͘ tsò ê koh khah pháiⁿ.
English: Judah did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins which they committed, above all that their fathers had done.

Tailo: Lâng ê kiàn-tsìng lán to teh tsiap-siū, Siōngtè ê kiàn-tsìng tong-jiân koh khah ū hāu-li̍k, in-uī tsit-ê sī Siōngtè uī-tio̍h I ê Kiáⁿ só͘ tsò ê kiàn-tsìng.
English: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater; for this is God's testimony which he has testified concerning his Son.

Tailo: Lín nā tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè ê kài-bīng, guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lín ê to̍h-sī tsiok-hok.
English: the blessing, if you shall listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God, which I command you this day;

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h bīn ǹg Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ, lâi tuì in suan-pò͘,
English: Son of man, set your face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy to them,

Tailo: Siōngtsú kiânn kong-gī, uī-tio̍h só͘-ū siū uan-óng ê lâng sin-uan.
English: Yahweh executes righteous acts, And justice for all who are oppressed.

Tailo: Mā tio̍h tuì jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan kíng ū tsâi-lîng ê lâng, to̍h-sī kìng-uì Siōngtè, sîng-si̍t bô lām-sám, uàn-hūn put-gī ê tsînn hit khuán lâng, siat-li̍p in tsò jîn-bîn ê sī-tuā, ū ê kuán tsi̍t tshing lâng, ū ê kuán tsi̍t pah lâng, ū ê kuán gō͘-tsa̍p lâng, ū ê kuán tsa̍p lâng,
English: Moreover you shall provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God: men of truth, hating unjust gain; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.

Tailo: ' Kiàn-nā lâng tsè-tsō ngó͘-siōng, khik ê á-.sī tsù ê, Siōngtsú só͘ thó-ià ê, to̍h-sī sai-hū ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê, tshāi tī thau-thau-á ê só͘-tsāi, hit-ê lâng tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! ' Jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h ìn kóng, ' A-men! '
English: Cursed be the man who makes an engraved or molten image, an abomination to Yahweh, the work of the hands of the craftsman, and sets it up in secret. All the people shall answer and say, Amen.

Tailo: Kiû Lí hō͘ in ê líng-siù tshin-tshiūnn O͘liab kah Je-eb, hō͘ in ê kun-tiúⁿ lóng tshin-tshiūnn Sebah kah Tsal-mú-nah.
English: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb; Yes, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna;

Tailo: Páulô kiò tsi̍t-ê liân-tiúⁿ lâi, kóng, Tshiánn tshuā tsit-ê siàu-liân lâng khì kìⁿ iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, in-uī i ū tāi-tsì beh pò i tsai.
English: Paul summoned one of the centurions, and said, Bring this young man to the commanding officer, for he has something to tell him.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bong-tio̍h hiah-ê mi̍h ê tsiū bô tshing-khì, tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ, ka-kī tī tsuí-.ni̍h sé, bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: Whoever touches these things shall be unclean, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kīn-uá ê sî, Isulael lâng gia̍h thâu khuàⁿ-tio̍h Aigi̍p lâng jiok uá-.lâi, tsiū tsin kiaⁿ, tuā-siaⁿ âu-kiò Siōngtsú.
English: When Pharaoh drew near, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians were marching after them; and they were very afraid. The children of Israel cried out to Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsì-tshin ê kóng, Guá bē-tàng sio̍k i, khióng-kiaⁿ ē gāi-tio̍h guá ka-kī ê sán-gia̍p. Guá sio̍k gia̍p ê kuân, lí thang tsò lí the̍h-.khì, in-uī guá bē-tàng kā i sio̍k-huê.
English: The near kinsman said, I can't redeem it for myself, lest I mar my own inheritance: take my right of redemption on you; for I can't redeem it.

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t ki sin ê lî ê tshuì-phué kut, tsiū tshun tshiú kā i khioh khí-.lâi, īng lâi phah-sí tsi̍t tshing lâng.
English: He found a fresh jawbone of a donkey, and put forth his hand, and took it, and struck a thousand men therewith.

Tailo: Hit sî, Ahitohuel só͘ kè-uē ê, tshin-tshiūnn lâng teh mn̄g Siōngtsú ê uē; Ahitohuel tuì Tabi̍t á-.sī tuì Αpsalôm só͘ kè-uē ê, lóng sī án-ne.
English: The counsel of Ahithophel, which he gave in those days, was as if a man inquired at the oracle of God: so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tiong ê ta̍k tso̍k, lín tio̍h kā kuân-lîng îng-kng, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú!
English: Ascribe to Yahweh, you relatives of the peoples, Ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength;

Tailo: In khì thâi lâng ê sî, tshun guá tī hia; guá tsiū phak tī thô͘-kha, tuā-siaⁿ huah, Hāiⁿ ah, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú ah, Lí kā tuā siū-khì piànn tī Êlúsalèm, kám sī beh kā Isulael lâng tsuân-pō͘ bia̍t-bông?
English: It happened, while they were smiting, and I was left, that I fell on my face, and cried, and said, Ah Lord Yahweh! will you destroy all the residue of Israel in your pouring out of your wrath on Jerusalem?

Tailo: Lí siat-li̍p i lâi kuán-lí Lí só͘ tshòng-tsō ê, kā bān-mi̍h hē tī i ê kha tsîng;
English: You make him ruler over the works of your hands. You have put all things under his feet:

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí kah tuè lí ê lâng tio̍h thàu-mê khí-.lâi, bâi-ho̍k tī tshân-.ni̍h.
English: Now therefore, up by night, you and the people who are with you, and lie in wait in the field:

Tailo: Tshìn-tshìn tshái-tshái tsò Siōngtsú ê kang ê tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘; kìm-tsí i ê to bak-tio̍h hueh ê mā tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Cursed be he who does the work of Yahweh negligently; and cursed be he who keeps back his sword from blood.

Tailo: I kám ē īng bô lī-ik ê uē kah bô lō͘-īng ê uē lâi piān-lūn?
English: Should he reason with unprofitable talk, Or with speeches with which he can do no good?

Tailo: hō͘ guá an-jiân tńg-lâi guá ê pē ê tshù, án-ne, Siōngtsú it-tīng tsiâⁿ-tsò guá ê Siōngtè,
English: so that I come again to my father's house in peace, and Yahweh will be my God,

Tailo: Guá siàu-liām Siōngtè, tsiū iu-būn; guá tiām-tiām siūⁿ, sim-sîn suah hūn-.khì. [Sè-la̍h]
English: I remember God, and I groan. I complain, and my spirit is overwhelmed. Selah.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê suaⁿ iáu-buē seⁿ-tshut, tē kah sè-kài Lí iáu-buē tsō-sîng, tuì íng-uán kàu íng-uán, Lí sī Siōngtè!
English: Before the mountains were brought forth, Or ever you had formed the earth and the world, Even from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.

Tailo: Guá tuì Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè kî-tó, jīn tsuē, kóng, Tsú — tsì-tuā thang kiaⁿ-uì ê Siōngtè ah, to̍h-sī siú iok si un hō͘ kiàn-nā thiàⁿ I, kín-siú I kài-bīng ê lâng ê.
English: I prayed to Yahweh my God, and made confession, and said, Oh, Lord, the great and dreadful God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with those who love him and keep his commandments,

Tailo: ( Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; tiāu īng Tsá-khí sî ê lo̍k-bú. ) Guá ê Siōngtè, guá ê Siōngtè, Lí ná ē pàng-sak guá? Ná ē lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g, m̄ kiù guá, bô beh thiaⁿ guá ê âu-kiò?
English: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from helping me, and from the words of my groaning?

Tailo: Tsuân huē-tsiòng lóng kóng, thang án-ne kiânn, tsìng lâng lóng kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì khuàⁿ-tsò sī hó.
English: All the assembly said that they would do so; for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.

Tailo: I tuì in kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín lāu-pē kìⁿ-tio̍h guá ê sî, bô tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng ê bīn-sik; tsóng-.sī, guá ê pē ê Siōngtè sî-siông kah guá tông-tsāi.
English: and said to them, I see the expression on your father's face, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.

Tailo: Siōngtè m̄-sī tiàu lán lâi kuè ù-uè ê sing-ua̍h, sī tiàu lán lâi kuè sìng-kiat ê sing-ua̍h.
English: For God called us not for uncleanness, but in sanctification.

Tailo: Hit sî, La̍hban khì tsián iûⁿ-mn̂g, La̍h-khel tsiū thau-the̍h in lāu-pē tshù lāi ê ngó͘-siōng.
English: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep: and Rachel stole the teraphim that were her father's.

Tailo: Tsè-si tshuā ông ê kiáⁿ tshut-.lâi, kā i tì bián-liû, kā lu̍t-huat ê tsheh hō͘ i, īng iû kā i buah lâi siat-li̍p i tsò ông; in tsiū phah pho̍k-á kóng, Guān ông bān-suè!
English: Then he brought out the king's son, and put the crown on him, and gave him the testimony; and they made him king, and anointed him; and they clapped their hands, and said, Long live the king.

Tailo: In-uī huí-pòng guá ê m̄-sī tuì-ti̍k, siat-sú sī, tsiū iáu ē-tàng jím-tit; tsū-ko kong-kik guá ê m̄-sī uàn-hūn guá ê lâng, siat-sú sī, tsiū ē-tàng siám-phiah.
English: For it was not an enemy who insulted me, Then I could have endured it. Neither was it he who hated me who raised himself up against me, Then I would have hid myself from him.

Tailo: Lí ē tsai-tsìng phû-tô hn̂g lâi kā i siu-tsíng, tsóng-.sī, bô thang lim tsiú, bô thang bán kué-tsí, in-uī thâng ē kā in tsia̍h tiāu.
English: You shall plant vineyards and dress them, but you shall neither drink of the wine, nor gather the grapes; for the worm shall eat them.

Tailo: Hitsekia kah hiah-ê siú-líng lâi khuànn hiah-ê tui, tsiū o-ló Siōngtsú ū tsiok-hok I ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng.
English: When Hezekiah and the princes came and saw the heaps, they blessed Yahweh, and his people Israel.

Tailo: Siōngtsú it-tshè ê tsok-uî lóng sī kong-gī; I it-tshè ê só͘ tsò lóng ū tsû-ài.
English: Yahweh is righteous in all his ways, And gracious in all his works.

Tailo: Lí ê ke só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng lóng ē lâi kā i kuī-pài, kiû tsi̍t-ê gîn, tsi̍t-ê piáⁿ, kóng: Kiû lí hō͘ guá tng tsè-si-tsit ê tsi̍t-ê, hō͘ guá thang tit-tio̍h tām-po̍h piáⁿ lâi tsia̍h. '
English: It shall happen, that everyone who is left in your house shall come and bow down to him for a piece of silver and a loaf of bread, and shall say, Please put me into one of the priests' offices, that I may eat a morsel of bread.

Tailo: I īng tâng tsò tsa̍p-ê tsō, muí tsō tn̂g sì tiú, khuah sì tiú, kuân saⁿ tiú.
English: He made the ten bases of brass; four cubits was the length of one base, and four cubits the breadth of it, and three cubits the height of it.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k beh hō͘ sè-kan tsai-iáⁿ guá ū thiàⁿ Thiⁿ-pē, mā ū tsiàu Thiⁿ-pē ê bīng-līng khì tsò. Khí-.lâi, lán lâi-.khì!
English: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let us go from here.

Tailo: I ê tshiū-nâ kah puî tē ê îng-kng, tuì sîn-hûn kàu jio̍k-thé lóng kā i sio bia̍t-tiāu, sè-bīn tshin-tshiūnn phuà-pēⁿ ê lâng tsiām-tsiām sue-pāi.
English: He will consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body. It will be as when a standard bearer faints.

Tailo: Isáiah tuì Hitsekia kóng, Lí tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú ê uē,
English: Isaiah said to Hezekiah, Hear the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsiū mn̄g Siōngtsú kóng, Guá thang khì phah hiah-ê Huilīsū lâng á m̄-thang? Siōngtsú kā Tabi̍t kóng, Lí thang khì phah Huilīsū lâng, kiù Keilah.
English: Therefore David inquired of Yahweh, saying, Shall I go and strike these Philistines? Yahweh said to David, Go, and strike the Philistines, and save Keilah.

Tailo: Guá kah hiah-ê uàn-hūn hô-pîng ê lâng, kú-kú tsò-hué tuà.
English: My soul has had her dwelling too long With him who hates peace.

Tailo: In tsiū kóng, Guán m̄-lim tsiú, in-uī guán ê sian-tsó͘ — Le-kap ê kiáⁿ Io-Nátap bat huan-hù guán kóng, ' Lín kah lín ê kiáⁿ-sun íng-uán m̄-thang lim tsiú,
English: But they said, We will drink no wine; for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, saying, You shall drink no wine, neither you, nor your sons, forever:

Tailo: Lí bat tī Etiân — Siōngtè ê hn̂g lāi, īng ta̍k tsióng ê pó-tsio̍h tsò lí ê táⁿ-pān, to̍h-sī âng-pó-tsio̍h, n̂g-gi̍k kah kim-kong-tsio̍h, tsheⁿ-gi̍k, âng bé-ló, í-ki̍p phik-gi̍k, lâm-gi̍k, li̍k-pó-tsio̍h, tshiah-gi̍k kah n̂g-kim; kó͘ kah siau koh sī tī lí hia tsè-tsō, tng lí siū tsō ê ji̍t, lí to̍h lóng tsê-pī.
English: You were in Eden, the garden of God; every precious stone adorned you: ruby, topaz, emerald, chrysolite, onyx, jasper, sapphire , turquoise, and beryl. Gold work of tambourines and of pipes was in you. In the day that you were created they were prepared.

Tailo: Guán tshut-lâi beh lâi lín tsia ê ji̍t, tuì tshù lāi tuà-tshut tsiah-ê piáⁿ tsò lō͘ tiong ê lō͘-īng, hit sî iáu sio-sio; lí khuàⁿ, taⁿ í-king lóng ta koh tshàu-phú à.
English: This our bread we took hot for our provision out of our houses on the day we came forth to go to you; but now, behold, it is dry, and is become moldy:

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á, tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsi̍t tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò sio-tsè;
English: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

Tailo: In-uī tī hit só͘-tsāi, sàn-tshiah lâng íng-íng bē tn̄g; só͘-í, guá bīng-līng lí kóng, ' Tī lí ê kíng lāi, it-tīng tio̍h tuì lí ê hiann-tī, sàn-tshiah ê, khiàm-khueh-.ê, lâi khui lí ê tshiú. '
English: For the poor will never cease out of the land: therefore I command you, saying, You shall surely open your hand to your brother, to your needy, and to your poor, in your land.

Tailo: Guá tsuân-sim tsuân-ì teh ho̍k-sāi Siōngtè, suan-iông kuan-hē I ê Kiáⁿ ê hok-im. Siōngtè ē thè guá tsò-tsìng, guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī kî-tó tiong siàu-liām lín,
English: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the Good News of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you always in my prayers,

Tailo: Guá tshim-sìn hit uī khai-sí tī lín tiong-kan tsò bí-hó kang-tsok ê Siōngtè, ē tī Iésu Ki-tok tsài-lîm ê ji̍t kā i uân-sîng.
English: being confident of this very thing, that he who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ.

Tailo: Guá ê Thiⁿ-pē í-king kā it-tshè lóng kau-hù guá. Thiⁿ-pē í-guā bô tsi̍t-ê bat Kiáⁿ sī siáⁿ lâng; Kiáⁿ kah Kiáⁿ só͘ ài beh khé-sī ê lâng í-guā, mā bô tsi̍t-ê bat Thiⁿ-pē sī siáⁿ lâng.
English: Turning to the disciples, he said, All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father, and who the Father is, except the Son, and he to whomever the Son desires to reveal him.

Tailo: Só͘-í, nā ū lâng kā lín kóng, ' Lín khuànn, Ki-tok tī khòng-iá. ', lín m̄-thang tshut-.khì; á-.sī kóng, ' Lín khuànn, Ki-tok tī pâng-king lāi. ', lín mā m̄-thang siong-sìn.
English: If therefore they tell you, Behold, he is in the wilderness,' don't go out; Behold, he is in the inner chambers,' don't believe it.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Iôtah ê kûn-tsiòng kā ngó͘-kok, sin tsiú kah iû ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it, tuà-lâi ji̍p khò͘-pâng.
English: Then brought all Judah the tithe of the grain and the new wine and the oil to the treasuries.

Tailo: King-kuè hiah-ê sî, lâng lâi-kàu ngó͘-kok tui, siūⁿ beh tit-tio̍h jī-tsa̍p táu, tsí ū tsa̍p táu. Ū lâng lâi-kàu tsiú-khut, siūⁿ beh tit-tio̍h gō͘-tsa̍p àng, tsí ū tit-tio̍h jī-tsa̍p àng.
English: Through all that time, when one came to a heap of twenty measures, there were only ten. When one came to the wine vat to draw out fifty, there were only twenty.

Tailo: Guá uī ka-kī khui tsuí-tî, lâi kuàn-ak puê-ióng sing-tióng ê tshiū-nâ.
English: I made myself pools of water, to water from it the forest where trees were reared.

Tailo: In kóng, Bô iáⁿ, lí tio̍h kā guán kóng. E-hú ìn kóng, I án-ne, án-ne kā guá kóng. I kóng, ' Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Guá īng iû kā lí buah hō͘ lí tsò Isulael ê ông. '
English: They said, It is false; tell us now. He said, Thus and thus spoke he to me, saying, Thus says Yahweh, I have anointed you king over Israel.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē hō͘ tshing-khì ê tuì bô tshing-khì ê tshut-.lâi? Bô tsi̍t-ê ē.
English: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? Not one.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tī tshù tíng pài thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng ê kah hiah-ê kìng-pài ê, kí Siōngtsú lâi tsiù-tsuā kah kí Malkam ( Tsù, Ammóng lâng ê sîn-bîng ) lâi tsiù-tsuā ê,
English: those who worship the army of the sky on the housetops, those who worship and swear by Yahweh and also swear by Malcam,

Tailo: In khì ê sî, Guá beh kā Guá ê bāng pha tī in ê tíng-bīn; Guá beh hō͘ i tuī-lo̍h, tshin-tshiūnn khong-tiong ê tsiáu. Guá beh tsiàu in ê huē-tsiòng só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h ê lâi kā in khián-tsik.
English: When they go, I will spread my net on them. I will bring them down like the birds of the sky. I will chastise them, as their congregation has heard.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, Lí ū ìng-ín Lí ê lô͘-po̍k — guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t kóng, ' Lí ê kiáⁿ-sun nā kín-sīn in ê só͘ tsò, kiânn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn lí kiânn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, tsiū sio̍k tī lí ê beh tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng tsē Isulael ê kok-uī íng bô tn̄g', taⁿ kiû Lí kā i ìng-giām.
English: Now therefore, Yahweh, the God of Israel, keep with your servant David my father that which you have promised him, saying, There shall not fail you a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only your children take heed to their way, to walk before me as you have walked before me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kah Alông kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng nā tī tiōng-hu ê tshù hē guān á-.sī tsiù-tsuā, īng iok lâi iok-sok ka-kī,
English: If she vowed in her husband's house, or bound her soul by a bond with an oath,

Tailo: ( Huē-tsiòng hit tsi̍t-puàⁿ ū iûⁿ saⁿ-tsa̍p saⁿ bān tshit-tshing gō͘-pah tsiah,
English: ( now the congregation's half was three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,

Tailo: ' Lí tsē lo̍h-.khì, lí tshut-.khì, lí ji̍p-.lâi, lí tuì guá ê tuā siū-khì, guá lóng tsai.
English: But I know your sitting down, your going out, your coming in, and your raging against me.

Tailo: In-uī in hut-jiân khí tsai-lān, siáⁿ lâng ē tsai sī Siōngtè kah kun-ông teh kā in hîng-hua̍t?
English: For their calamity will rise suddenly; The destruction from them bothwho knows?

Tailo: Kelsióng ê kiáⁿ-sun king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu kah tsong-tso̍k,
English: Those who were numbered of the sons of Gershon, their families, and by their fathers' houses,

Tailo: Guá ê lông-kun, lâi, lán lâi-khì suaⁿ-tiûⁿ, lán lâi-khì tsng-thâu hioh mê.
English: Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field. Let us lodge in the villages.

Tailo: Ta̍k lâng tio̍h pó-tshî siū-tiàu hit sî ê sin-hūn.
English: Let each man stay in that calling in which he was called.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Mô͘se ji̍p-khì huat-kuī ê pò͘-pênn; lí khuàⁿ, sio̍k Lēbī ê ke, Alông ê kuái-á, í-king puh-gê, seⁿ hue-m̂, khui hue, kiat-tsiâⁿ hīng-jîn.
English: It happened on the next day, that Moses went into the tent of the testimony; and behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi was budded, and put forth buds, and produced blossoms, and bore ripe almonds.

Tailo: Sio̍k Ahap ê ke, tī E-tsu-le-el só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng kah i ê tāi-sîn, tshin-bi̍t ê pîng-iú, tsè-si, E-hú tsuân-pō͘ kā in thâi-sí, bô lâu kah puàⁿ-ê.
English: So Jehu struck all that remained of the house of Ahab in Jezreel, and all his great men, and his familiar friends, and his priests, until he left him none remaining.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū án-ne kā tshia kah gû siu khí-.lâi, kau hō͘ Lēbī lâng.
English: Moses took the wagons and the oxen, and gave them to the Levites.

Tailo: I pún-sin tuì kīn Gilgal phah tsio̍h-siōng ê só͘-tsāi ua̍t tò tńg-.lâi, kóng, Ông, guá ū pì-bi̍t ê tāi-tsì beh kā lí kóng. Ông kóng, Siok-tsīng! Khiā tī i sin piⁿ ê lâng tsiū lóng thè tshut-.khì.
English: But he himself turned back from the quarries that were by Gilgal, and said, I have a secret errand to you, king. He said, Keep silence. All who stood by him went out from him.

Tailo: Lí phâng khì lín lāu-pē hia, hō͘ i tsia̍h, hō͘ i tī buē sí tsìn-tsîng kā lí tsiok-hok.
English: You shall bring it to your father, that he may eat, so that he may bless you before his death.

Tailo: Hamán tuì Ahasuiló͘ ông kóng, Ū tsi̍t tso̍k ê jîn-bîn, suàⁿ-khui tī lí ê kok ta̍k síng ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan, in ê lu̍t-lē kah bān-bîn ê lu̍t-lē khah bô kāng, in mā bô siú ông ê lu̍t-lē, só͘-í, nā iông-ín in, tuì ông si̍t-tsāi put-lī.
English: Haman said to king Ahasuerus, There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the peoples in all the provinces of your kingdom; and their laws are diverse from those of every people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the king's profit to allow them.

Tailo: In sing kuân, tsi̍t-sî-á tsiū sí-.khì; in kàng kē hō͘ lâng siu-khioh, tshin-tshiūnn kûn-tsiòng, koh tshin-tshiūnn be̍h-suī siū kuah khí-.lâi.
English: They are exalted; yet a little while, and they are gone. Yes, they are brought low, they are taken out of the way as all others, And are cut off as the tops of the ears of grain.

Tailo: Lín só͘ tit-tio̍h it-tshè ê lé-mi̍h, tio̍h tuì hit tiong-kan, kā siōng hó ê, to̍h-sī hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê hūn-gia̍h, hiàn hiah-ê kí-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: Out of all your gifts you shall offer every wave offering of Yahweh, of all the best of it, even the holy part of it out of it.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, tio̍h tī huē-bō͘ kah in ê hiann-tī tsò-hué sū-hāu, siú só͘ kau-tài ê, bô koh tsò-kang; kuan-hē só͘ kau-tài Lēbī lâng ê, lí tio̍h tuì in án-ne kiânn.
English: but shall minister with their brothers in the Tent of Meeting, to keep the charge, and shall do no service. Thus shall you do to the Levites concerning their duties.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtè kā tuì-ti̍k kau tī lí ê tshiú, ing-kai o-ló I. Abúlâm kā só͘-ū só͘ tit-tio̍h ê, tsa̍p hūn the̍h tsi̍t hūn hō͘ Malkitsetik.
English: and blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand. Abram gave him a tenth of all.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tī Io̍p-pe kah tsi̍t-ê tsè-phuê sai-hū Símòng tsò-hué tuà tsin tsē ji̍t.
English: It happened, that he stayed many days in Joppa with one Simon, a tanner.

Tailo: In ū thun lo̍h-pak, m̄-koh, khuàⁿ bē-tshut ū thun lo̍h-.khì, in-uī hit-ê khiap-sì ê khuán iû-guân kah í-tsîng kāng-khuán. Jiânāu, guá tsiū tshéⁿ.
English: and when they had eaten them up, it couldn't be known that they had eaten them, but they were still ugly, as at the beginning. So I awoke.

Tailo: Guá ê bīn tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ǹg tsit-ê siâⁿ, beh kàng tsai-hō, m̄ kàng hok-khì; tsit-ê siâⁿ beh kau tī Babúlông ông ê tshiú, i ē īng hué kā i sio.
English: For I have set my face on this city for evil, and not for good, says Yahweh: it shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.

Tailo: guán ê tsó͘-sian lo̍h-khì Aigi̍p, guán tuà tī Aigi̍p tsin kú; Aigi̍p lâng pháiⁿ khuán-thāi guán kah guán ê tsó͘-sian.
English: how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we lived in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians dealt ill with us, and our fathers:

Tailo: Guán m̄-káⁿ kah hiah-ê tián hong-sîn ê lâng pí-phīng. In īng ka-kī phue-phîng ka-kī, mā īng ka-kī pí-phīng ka-kī, si̍t-tsāi bô tì-huī.
English: For we are not bold to number or compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves. But they themselves, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves, are without understanding.

Tailo: Guá ê sè-kiáⁿ, guá siá tsiah-ê hō͘ lín, sī beh hō͘ lín bô huān tsuē; nā ū lâng huān tsuē, tī Thiⁿ-pē ê bīn-tsîng, lán ū gī lâng Iésu Ki-tok uī lán piān-hō͘.
English: My little children, I write these things to you so that you may not sin. If anyone sins, we have a Counselor with the Father, Jesus Christ, the righteous.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang kí Guá ê miâ lâm-sám tsiù-tsuā, lâi siat-to̍k lí ê Siōngtsú ê miâ. Guá to̍h-sī Siōngtsú.
English: You shall not swear by my name falsely, and profane the name of your God. I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Hitsekia tuì Isáiah kóng, Lí só͘ thuân Siōngtsú ê uē sī hó. Koh kóng, In-uī tī guá nî-ji̍t ê tiong-kan ē ū thài-pîng kah kian-kò͘.
English: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, Yahweh's word which you have spoken is good. He said moreover, For there will be peace and truth in my days.

Tailo: Guá kah guá só͘ tshuā ê tsìng lâng beh kīn-uá siâⁿ, in tshin-tshiūnn thâu tsi̍t pái tshut-lâi kong-kik guán, hit sî guán tsiū beh tī in ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu.
English: and I, and all the people who are with me, will approach to the city. It shall happen, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them;

Tailo: Koh khah tsē ê tsuí mā bē-tàng siau-bia̍t ài-tsîng; tuā-tsuí mā bē-tàng kā i im-ba̍t. Nā ū lâng beh īng tshù lāi tsuân-pō͘ ê sán-gia̍p lâi uāⁿ ài-tsîng, i tik-khak ē hō͘ lâng biáu-sī.
English: Many waters can't quench love, Neither can floods drown it. If a man would give all the wealth of his house for love, He would be utterly scorned. Friends

Tailo: Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, lín lóng tio̍h thiaⁿ! Tē kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê mā tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ! Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú to̍h-sī tuì I ê sìng-tiān tshut-.lâi ê Tsú, beh lâi kiàn-tsìng lín ê m̄-tio̍h.
English: Hear, you peoples, all of you. Listen, O earth, and all that is therein: And let the Lord Yahweh be witness against you, The Lord from his holy temple.

Tailo: tsè-si tio̍h koh ji̍p-khì giām, tsìng-thâu nā thuàⁿ tī hit king tshù, hit king tshù sī jiám-tio̍h ok ê thái-ko, sī bô tshing-khì.
English: then the priest shall come in and look; and behold, if the plague has spread in the house, it is a destructive mildew in the house. It is unclean.

Tailo: I tsí ū tsi̍t pái tsìn-ji̍p tsì-sìng-só͘, m̄-sī īng iûⁿ kah gû-á ê hueh, sī īng ka-kī ê hueh, tsi̍t pái to̍h uī-tio̍h lán jîn-luī uân-sîng íng-uán ê kiù-sio̍k.
English: nor yet through the blood of goats and calves, but through his own blood, entered in once for all into the Holy Place, having obtained eternal redemption.

Tailo: I tsiū tńg-khì Baal hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i kah Mô͘ap ê siú-líng lóng khiā tī i sio-tsè ê piⁿ-á.
English: He returned to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, he, and all the princes of Moab.

Tailo: khì ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng lâi kā i kìng-pài, á-.sī ji̍t, á-.sī gue̍h, á-.sī thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng, sī guá só͘ m̄-bat bīng-līng ê;
English: and has gone and served other gods, and worshiped them, or the sun, or the moon, or any of the army of the sky, which I have not commanded;

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú sī uí-tāi-.ê Siōngtè, sī iâⁿ-kuè só͘-ū sîn-bîng ê tuā kun-ông.
English: For Yahweh is a great God, A great King above all gods.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm ah, Êlúsalèm ah, lí thâi-sí sian-ti, īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm-sí Siōngtè tshe-phài kàu tī lín tsia ê sù-tsiá. Guá guā tsē pái ài tsū-tsi̍p lí ê kiáⁿ-jî, tshin-tshiūnn ke-bó tsū-tsi̍p i ê ke-á-kiáⁿ tī si̍t-ē, m̄-koh, lín bô ài.
English: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, like a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you refused!

Tailo: Iâkop koh huan-hù tē-jī kûn, tē-sann kûn kah só͘-ū kuáⁿ kui kûn tsing-seⁿ ê lâng kóng, Lín tú-tio̍h Esáu ê sî, mā tio̍h tsiàu án-ne kā i kóng.
English: He commanded also the second, and the third, and all that followed the herds, saying, This is how you shall speak to Esau, when you find him.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h i ê bó͘ tuì i só͘ kóng ê uē, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tshin-tshiūnn án-ne khuán-thāi guá. I tsiū siū-khì.
English: It happened, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spoke to him, saying, This is what your servant did to me, that his wrath was kindled.

Tailo: Koh īng buah ê iû tò tī Alông ê thâu-khak tíng, lâi kā i buah, kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: He poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron's head, and anointed him, to sanctify him.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh só͘ tshe ê lâng tńg-.khì liáu-āu, Iésu tsiah thê-khí Iô-há-neh ê tāi-tsì, tuì kûn-tsiòng kóng, Lín tsîng tshut-khì khòng-iá, sī beh khuànn siáⁿ-mi̍h? Kám sī lô͘-tik hō͘ hong teh tshue tín-tāng?
English: When John's messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John, What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

Tailo: Só͘-ū ài beh kah Ki-tok Iésu kiat-liân lâi kuè kìng-khiân sing-ua̍h ê lâng, lóng ē siū pik-hāi.
English: Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.

Tailo: Páulô tsù-ba̍k khuànn gī-huē ê lâng, kóng, Kok-uī hiann-tī, guá pîng-sî tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng uân-tsuân tsiàu tshing-pe̍h ê liông-sim teh kiâⁿ ta̍h, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: Paul, looking steadfastly at the council, said, Brothers, I have lived before God in all good conscience until this day.

Tailo: huí in ê siâⁿ, ta̍k lâng hiat tsio̍h-thâu lâi thūn-muá só͘-ū hó ê tē, that tiâu só͘-ū ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ, tshò in ta̍k tsâng hó ê tshiū, tsí ū tshun Kel-ha-la-siat ê tsio̍h-tshiûⁿ; hìⁿ tsio̍h-thâu ê tuì sì-kho͘-uî lâi kā i kong-kik.
English: They beat down the cities; and on every good piece of land they cast every man his stone, and filled it; and they stopped all the springs of water, and felled all the good trees, until in Kir Hareseth only they left the stones of it; however the men armed with slings went about it, and struck it.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng huâi-īn beh seⁿ ê sî, tsiū kiáu-ká, tī thòng-khó͘ ê sî, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah. Siōngtsú ah, guán tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng mā sī án-ne.
English: Like as a woman with child, who draws near the time of her delivery, is in pain and cries out in her pangs; so we have been before you, Yahweh.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè tsiàu kong-gī teh sím-phuàⁿ, I ē īng tsai-lān pò-ìng hiah-ê hō͘ lín tú-tio̍h tsai-lān ê lâng,
English: Since it is a righteous thing with God to repay affliction to those who afflict you,

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h khiā-.leh, lâi khuànn Siōngtsú tī lín ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng só͘ beh kiâⁿ ê tuā sū.
English: Now therefore stand still and see this great thing, which Yahweh will do before your eyes.

Tailo: Iôtah tuì tsiah-ê hiann-tī kóng, Lán thâi-sí lán ê sió-tī, ún-ba̍t i ê hueh, ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik?
English: Judah said to his brothers, What profit is it if we kill our brother and conceal his blood?

Tailo: Bô lō͘-īng ê bo̍k-tsiá, khì-sak iûⁿ-kûn ê ū tsai-hō ah! To ē lîm-kàu i ê tshiú kah i ê tsiànn ba̍k. I ê tshiú ē tsuân-pō͘ ko͘-tâ-.khì, i ê tsiànn ba̍k ē o͘-o͘ àm-àm.
English: Woe to the worthless shepherd who leaves the flock! The sword will be on his arm, and on his right eye. His arm will be completely withered, and his right eye will be totally blinded!

Tailo: In-uī Iésu ka-kī bat kóng, Sian-ti tī ka-kī ê kò͘-hiong bē siū tsun-tiōng.
English: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h hit tsa̍p-sì tsiah iûⁿ-á, ta̍k tsiah iûⁿ-á hiàn tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it e-huat.
English: and a tenth part for every lamb of the fourteen lambs;

Tailo: In-uī in pik-hāi Lí só͘ phah ê lâng; in ke-thinn Lí só͘ phah-siong ê lâng ê iu-khó͘.
English: For they persecute him whom you have wounded. They tell of the sorrow of those whom you have hurt.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá ài tsa-po͘ lâng bô-lūn tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi, lóng bô siū-khì, mā bô giâu-gî, gia̍h-khí sîn-sìng ê siang tshiú lâi kî-tó.
English: I desire therefore that the men in every place pray, lifting up holy hands without wrath and doubting.

Tailo: Koh bô guā kú, sè-kan bē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, to̍k-to̍k lín ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, in-uī guá ua̍h-.leh, lín mā ē ua̍h-.leh.
English: Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.

Tailo: Tī piⁿ-á teh khiā ê tsi̍t-ê lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, I teh kiò Eliiah.
English: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he is calling Elijah.

Tailo: Sai-á-thûn háu beh jiàu mi̍h tsia̍h, tuì Siōngtè thó in ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: The young lions roar after their prey, And seek their food from God.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, ū tshut hó tsiú ê phû-tô hn̂g, lín tio̍h kí tsit-ê hn̂g tshiùⁿ kua, kóng,
English: In that day, sing to her, A pleasant vineyard!

Tailo: Tsit-ê Isulael jîn-bîn ê Siōngtè kíng-suán lán ê tsó͘-sian, tī in kià-kha Aigi̍p ê sî, hō͘ in tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā ê bîn-tso̍k, koh īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú tshuā in tshut Aigi̍p,
English: The God of this people chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they stayed as aliens in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm, he led them out of it.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū tsiūⁿ tsûn khì kah in tsò-hué, hong tsiū tiām-khì. Bûn-tô͘ put-tsí-á tio̍h-kiaⁿ, suah gāng-.khì.
English: He got into the boat with them; and the wind ceased, and they were very amazed among themselves, and marveled;

Tailo: Án-ne, lín ta̍k lâng nā bô tsin-sim sià-bián lín ê hiann-tī, guá ê Thiⁿ-pē mā bô beh án-ne kā lín khuán-thāi.
English: So my heavenly Father will also do to you, if you don't each forgive your brother from your hearts for his misdeeds.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng, guá beh khí-lâi kā in kong-kik, beh tuì Babúlông tû-bia̍t i ê miâ kah só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng, í-ki̍p i ê kiáⁿ-sun. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: I will rise up against them, says Yahweh of Armies, and cut off from Babylon name and remnant, and son and son's son, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Iésu kóng, Tik-khak ū lâng bong-tio̍h guá, in-uī guá tsai ū kuân-lîng tuì guá sing-khu tshut-.khì.
English: But Jesus said, Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.

Tailo: Tsá-khí sî, o͘-a kā i tuà piáⁿ kah bah lâi; ê-hng sî mā tuà piáⁿ kah bah lâi, i lim khe-.ni̍h ê tsuí.
English: The ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morning, and bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook.

Tailo: Hiah-ê thái-ko ê lâi-kàu iâⁿ ê piⁿ-kak, ji̍p-khì tsi̍t-ê pò͘-pênn, mā tsia̍h mā lim; tuì hia the̍h kim-gîn kah saⁿ-khò͘ khì siu-tsông, koh lâi, koh ji̍p-khì tsi̍t-ê pò͘-pênn, tuì hia the̍h-tshut tsâi-bu̍t khì siu-tsông.
English: When these lepers came to the outermost part of the camp, they went into one tent, and ate and drink, and carried there silver, and gold, and clothing, and went and hid it; and they came back, and entered into another tent, and carried there also, and went and hid it.

Tailo: I tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng sī tsi̍t-ê phah-la̍h ê ing-hiông, só͘-í, lâng kóng, Tshin-tshiūnn Nimlo͘t tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, sī tsi̍t-ê phah-la̍h ê ing-hiông.
English: He was a mighty hunter before Yahweh. Therefore it is said, Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before Yahweh.

Tailo: I ê khuì-la̍t ē sue-bî, tsai-eh tī i ê sin piⁿ suî-sî piān-piān.
English: His strength shall be famished, Calamity shall be ready at his side.

Tailo: Lâng ē tsiàu i ê tì-huī tit-tio̍h o-ló; sim-lāi o͘-pe̍h siūⁿ ê lâng ē siū biáu-sī.
English: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom, But he who has a warped mind shall be despised.

Tailo: Ko-lîn-to ê pîng-iú, guán ê sim-hing í-king phah-khui, khui tshuì teh tuì lín kóng uē.
English: Our mouth is open to you, Corinthians. Our heart is enlarged.

Tailo: Iésu lâi-kàu Sa-má-lī-a tsi̍t-ê kiò-tsò Su-khal ê siâⁿ, tsit-ê siâⁿ uá-kīn Iâkop hō͘ i ê kiáⁿ Iôséhuh ê hit tè tē; tī hia ū Iâkop ê tsuí-tséⁿ.
English: So he came to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son, Joseph.

Tailo: Ū ê ka-la̍uh tī tshì-á lāi, tshì-á pêⁿ-pêⁿ tuā-tsâng khí-.lâi, suah hō͘ tshì-á hip-.sí.
English: Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.

Tailo: In tshuē-tio̍h hûn-bōng tsiū khuài-lo̍k, huann-hí kàu bē kò͘-tit.
English: Who rejoice exceedingly, Are glad, when they can find the grave?

Tailo: Ông tshe lâng khì kā i tháu-khui, to̍h-sī tī-lí jîn-bîn ê Huâ-láu kā i tháu-pàng.
English: The king sent and freed him; Even the ruler of peoples, and let him go free.

Tailo: Guá kí ka-kī lâi tsiù-tsuā, Guá ê tshuì tsiàu kong-gī kóng-tshut tsit-ê uē, tsua̍t-tuì bô koh siu tò-tńg, tsìng lâng ê kha-thâu-u ē ǹg Guá lâi kuī-pài, tsìng lâng ê tshuì ē tsí Guá lâi tsiù-tsuā.
English: By myself have I sworn, the word is gone forth from my mouth in righteousness, and shall not return, that to me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear.

Tailo: Etsula̍h, tsiàu lí ê Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tì-huī, siat-li̍p sū-su kah sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ, lâi tī-lí hô guā ê jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī só͘-ū bat lí ê Siōngtè ê lu̍t-huat ê, nā-sī hiah-ê m̄-bat ê, lí tio̍h kā in kà-sī.
English: You, Ezra, after the wisdom of your God who is in your hand, appoint magistrates and judges, who may judge all the people who are beyond the River, all such as know the laws of your God; and teach you him who doesn't know them.

Tailo: tsha̍t nā lia̍h bô tio̍h, hit-ê ke-tsú tio̍h kàu kìng-pài Siōngtsú ê só͘-tsāi, piáu-bîng khuànn i ū the̍h tshù-piⁿ ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ á-bô.
English: If the thief isn't found, then the master of the house shall come near to God, to find out if he hasn't put his hand to his neighbor's goods.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ìn tsè-si Ahiméli̍k kóng, Ông bīng-līng guá tsi̍t kiāⁿ sū, koh kā guá kóng, ' Guá só͘ tshe lí ê tāi-tsì kah guá só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, lóng m̄-thang hō͘ lâng tsai. ' Guá í-king phài siàu-liân lâng tī bó͘ só͘-tsāi thìng-hāu guá.
English: David said to Ahimelech the priest, The king has commanded me a business, and has said to me, Let no man know anything of the business about which I send you, and what I have commanded you: and I have appointed the young men to such and such a place.

Tailo: Io-ho-iá-tah koh tsiàu Tabi̍t tsá-ji̍t só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê, siat-li̍p tsè-si Lēbī lâng tam-tng Siōngtsú tiān ê tsit, tsá-tsîng Tabi̍t īng tsit-ê pan-lia̍t phài tī Siōngtsú ê tiān, hō͘ in huann-hí tshiùⁿ kua, hiàn Siōngtsú ê sio-tsè, tsiàu só͘ kì-tsài tī Mô͘se ê lu̍t-huat ê.
English: Jehoiada appointed the officers of the house of Yahweh under the hand of the priests the Levites, whom David had distributed in the house of Yahweh, to offer the burnt offerings of Yahweh, as it is written in the law of Moses, with rejoicing and with singing, according to the order of David.

Tailo: Guá ê jîn-bîn īng Guá ê miâ lâi tshing ê, nā ka-kī khiam-pi kî-tó, kiû kìnn Guá ê bīn, ua̍t-tńg lī-khui in ê pháiⁿ lō͘, Guá ē tuì thiⁿ thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó, sià-bián in ê tsuē, i-tī in ê tē.
English: if my people, who are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.

Tailo: Án-ne, lí ê kng ē huat-tshut, tshin-tshiūnn thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí ê kng, lí ê siong ē tsin kín tit-tio̍h i hó. Lí ê kong-gī beh kiâⁿ tī lí ê thâu-tsîng; Siōngtsú ê îng-kng beh tsò lí āu-bīn ê pó-hō͘.
English: Then shall your light break forth as the morning, and your healing shall spring forth speedily; and your righteousness shall go before you; the glory of Yahweh shall be your rear guard.

Tailo: Lâng tsiū īng bé tsài i ê sin-si tńg-lâi kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng bâi-tsòng tī Iôtah ê siâⁿ.
English: They brought him on horses, and buried him with his fathers in the city of Judah.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Iôtah ông tshe lín lâi Guá tsia mn̄g Guá, lín tio̍h án-ne kā i kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, hiah-ê tshut-lâi beh pang-tsān lín ê Huâ-láu ê kun-ping ē tò tńg-khì Aigi̍p pún-kok.
English: Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Thus shall you tell the king of Judah, who sent you to me to inquire of me: Behold, Pharaoh's army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land.

Tailo: Mê-nî nā kiat kué-tsí to̍h hó, nā bô, tsiah kā i tshò khí-.lâi. '
English: If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.'

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lín só͘ hē tī tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi ê sí-lâng to̍h-sī bah, tsit-ê siâⁿ to̍h-sī tiánn; tsóng-.sī, lín ē tuì hit tiong-kan hông kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Your slain whom you have laid in the midst of it, they are the flesh, and this city is the caldron; but you shall be brought forth out of the midst of it.

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng sí-.khì ê ū tsi̍t-bān peh-tshing, tsiah-ê lóng sī ióng-sū, kî-tha ê lâng ua̍t tńg-sin tô-tsáu khì khòng-iá, kàu Lim-móng ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ.
English: There fell of Benjamin eighteen thousand men; all these were men of valor.

Tailo: In hō͘ guá kah lín ê sim-sîn tit-tio̍h kó͘-bú. Lín tio̍h tsun-tiōng tsit khuán lâng.
English: For they refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge those who are like that.

Tailo: ū gō͘-bān sì-tshing sì-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Issachar, were fifty-four thousand four hundred.

Tailo: Asiul bē-tàng kiù guán, guán bô koh khiâ bé, mā bô koh tuì guán ê tshiú só͘ tsō ê kóng: Lí sī guán ê sîn-bîng, in-uī ko͘-jî tuì lí tit-tio̍h liân-bín.
English: Assyria can't save us. We won't ride on horses; Neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, Our gods!' For in you the fatherless finds mercy.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsò ông, I īng ui-giâm tsò saⁿ-tshīng, īng khuì-la̍t tsò tuà hâ, sè-kài tsiū kian-kò͘ bē iô-tāng.
English: Yahweh reigns! He is clothed with majesty! Yahweh is armed with strength. The world also is established. It can't be moved.

Tailo: Mn̂g-kháu khuah tsa̍p tiú. Mn̂g ê siang pîng piⁿ, tsit pîng gō͘ tiú, hit pîng gō͘ tiú. I niû i ê tn̂g sì-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú.
English: The breadth of the entrance was ten cubits; and the sides of the entrance were five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side: and he measured the length of it, forty cubits, and the breadth, twenty cubits.

Tailo: Piattò͘ siūⁿ-tio̍h, tsiū kā Iésu kóng, Lāu-su, Lí khuànn, Lí só͘ tsiù-tsó͘ ê hit-tsâng bû-hua-kó tshiū í-king 枯 ta-.khì à.
English: Peter, remembering, said to him, Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.

Tailo: Guān i ê kiáⁿ-jî sì-kè khì kiû 乞, tuì in pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi tshut-lâi thó-tsia̍h!
English: Let his children be wandering beggars. Let them be sought from their ruins.

Tailo: Lí Sìng ê tsú-bîn put-kò sī tsiām-sî tit-tio̍h tsit-ê sán-gia̍p; guán ê tuì-ti̍k í-king thún-ta̍h Lí ê sìng-só͘.
English: Your holy people possessed it but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down your sanctuary.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē kiânn tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, I ē kah lí tông-tsāi, I bē lī-khui lí, mā bē pàng-sak lí. M̄-bián kiaⁿ, mā m̄-thang lún.
English: Yahweh, he it is who does go before you; he will be with you, he will not fail you, neither forsake you: don't be afraid, neither be dismayed.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuì Siōngtè kóng, Huan-hù tiám-sǹg jîn-bîn ê kám m̄-sī guá? Guá huān tsuē kiânn tuā pháiⁿ, tsóng-.sī, tsiah-ê iûⁿ-kûn kám ū tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Kiû Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè, tshun tshiú tī guá kah guá ê pē ê ke, m̄-thang kong-kik Lí ê tsú-bîn, kàng un-i̍k hō͘ in.
English: David said to God, Isn't it I who commanded the people to be numbered? It is even I who have sinned and done very wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? Please let your hand, O Yahweh my God, be against me, and against my father's house; but not against your people, that they should be plagued.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tio̍h phài Lēbī lâng kuán-lí tsìng-kì ê huē-bō͘ kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê khì-kū, í-ki̍p it-tshè sio̍k tī hit lāi-bīn ê, in tio̍h kng huē-bō͘ kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê khì-kū, mā tio̍h sū-hāu huē-bō͘, tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî tsat iâⁿ.
English: but appoint the Levites over the Tabernacle of the Testimony, and over all its furnishings, and over all that belongs to it. They shall carry the tabernacle, and all its furnishings; and they shall take care of it, and shall encamp around it.

Tailo: Iok-tan seⁿ A-mô͘-tat, Sia-leh, Ha-tsal-ma-bet, I-é-la̍h,
English: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

Tailo: Iôtah kûn-tsiòng kah in ê sè-hàn gín-á, in ê bó͘, in ê kiáⁿ-jî, lóng khiā tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: All Judah stood before Yahweh, with their little ones, their wives, and their children.

Tailo: Thâu tsi̍t ji̍t tio̍h bán hó-tshiū ê kué-tsí kah tsó tshiū ê ki, í-ki̍p ām-tshiū ê ue kah hô piⁿ ê liú-ki, tī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng huann-hí tshit ji̍t.
English: You shall take on the first day the fruit of goodly trees, branches of palm trees, and boughs of thick trees, and willows of the brook; and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God seven days.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm lâng, lín tio̍h gia̍h thâu khuànn, tuì pak-hong lâi ê lâng! Tsá-tsîng só͘ hō͘ lí ê iûⁿ-kûn, to̍h-sī lí suí ê iûⁿ-kûn, taⁿ tī tó-uī?
English: Lift up your eyes, and see those who come from the north: where is the flock that was given you, your beautiful flock?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kìng-uì Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, ho̍k-sāi I, kí I ê miâ lâi tsiù-tsuā.
English: You shall fear Yahweh your God; and him shall you serve, and shall swear by his name.

Tailo: Tio̍h tuì Êlúsalèm kóng hó uē, koh pò i tsai, i ê kau-tsiàn í-king tsīn, i ê tsuē-kò í-king sià; i uī-tio̍h i it-tshè ê tsuē, tuì Siōngtsú ê tshiú ka-puē siū hîng-hua̍t.
English: Speak comfortably to Jerusalem; and call out to her that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned, that she has received of Yahweh's hand double for all her sins.

Tailo: Páulô kā in huāⁿ-tshiú, Sìng Sîn tsiū lîm-kàu tī in sin tsiūⁿ, in suî-sî kóng kńg-tsi̍h-uē, koh suan-káng Siōngtè ê sìn-sit.
English: When Paul had laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they spoke with other languages and prophesied.

Tailo: Lín tsiū thang tuì in kóng, ' Sī in-uī í-tsîng Ioltàn hô ê tsuí, tī Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī tsîng tsia̍t-tn̄g; iok-kuī kuè Ioltàn hô ê sî, Ioltàn hô ê tsuí tsia̍t-tn̄g. Tsiah-ê tsio̍h-thâu beh tsiâⁿ-tsò Isulael lâng íng-uán ê kì-liām. '
English: then you shall tell them, Because the waters of the Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh; when it passed over the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off: and these stones shall be for a memorial to the children of Israel forever.

Tailo: M̄-thang tsia̍h hueh, tio̍h piàⁿ tī tē-.ni̍h, tshin-tshiūnn teh piàⁿ tsuí.
English: You shall not eat it; you shall pour it out on the earth as water.

Tailo: Hitsekia ông kah hiah-ê siú-líng, koh bīng-līng Lēbī lâng īng Tabi̍t kah sian-kiàn Asah ê si lâi o-ló Siōngtsú, in tsiū huann-hí, gîm-si o-ló, ànn thâu kìng-pài.
English: Moreover Hezekiah the king and the princes commanded the Levites to sing praises to Yahweh with the words of David, and of Asaph the seer. They sang praises with gladness, and they bowed their heads and worshiped.

Tailo: Muí pak tiùⁿ tio̍h tn̂g saⁿ-tsa̍p tiú, khuah sì tiú; tsa̍p-it pak tiùⁿ lóng tio̍h sio-siâng ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: the eleven curtains shall have one measure.

Tailo: Lí ài pháiⁿ iâⁿ-kuè ài hó, ài pe̍h-tsha̍t iâⁿ-kuè ài kóng gī-lí. [Sè-la̍h]
English: You love evil more than good, Lying rather than speaking the truth. Selah.

Tailo: Án-ne, ì-hiòng jio̍k-thé sī kah Siōngtè tuì-ti̍k; in-uī bô sūn-ho̍k Siōngtè ê lu̍t-huat, kî-si̍t mā bô huat-tō͘ sūn-ho̍k.
