English: because the mind of the flesh is hostile towards God; for it is not subject to God's law, neither indeed can it be.

Tailo: Tsè-si Tsa-tok kah Abiathal kám bô kah lí tī hia? Lí tuì ông-kiong lāi só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h ê, tsiū tio̍h kā Tsa-tok tsè-si kah Abiathal kóng.
English: Don't you have Zadok and Abiathar the priests there with you? therefore it shall be, that whatever thing you shall hear out of the king's house, you shall tell it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.

Tailo: Īng bō-á tì tī i ê thâu-khak, tī bō-á ê thâu-tsîng tíng-bīn tiò kim-pâi, to̍h-sī sìng ê bián-liû, lóng sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê.
English: He set the turban on his head; and on the turban, in front, he set the golden plate, the holy crown; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Tshuē-tio̍h liáu-āu tsiū kā I kóng, Tsìng lâng lóng teh tshuē Lí.
English: and they found him, and told him, Everyone is looking for you.

Tailo: M̄-koh, in tuā-siaⁿ huah, Kā I tìng si̍p-jī-kè! Kā I tìng si̍p-jī-kè!
English: but they shouted, saying, Crucify! Crucify him!

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Êlúsalèm lâng, siáⁿ lâng khó-liân lí? Siáⁿ lâng uī lí pi-siong? Siáⁿ lâng ua̍t tńg-sin lâi kā lí tshíng-an?
English: For who will have pity on you, Jerusalem? or who will bemoan you? or who will turn aside to ask of your welfare?

Tailo: I koh īng kim an hiah-ê ki-lō͘-ping.
English: He overlaid the cherubim with gold.

Tailo: I tī lāu-jia̍t ê ke-lō͘ thâu tuā-siaⁿ teh kiò, tī siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, tī siâⁿ lāi, kóng-tshut i ê uē,
English: She calls at the head of noisy places. At the entrance of the city gates, she utters her words:

Tailo: I koh lâi kā tē-jī kiánn kóng kāng-khuán ê uē. Tē-jī kiánn ìn kóng, ' A-pa, guá beh khì. 'M̄-koh, āu-lâi i bô-.khì.
English: He came to the second, and said the same thing. He answered, I go, sir,' but he didn't go.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Isulael tiong bô koh hing-khí sian-ti tshin-tshiūnn Mô͘se, i sī Siōngtsú bīn tuì bīn só͘ bat ê.
English: There has not arisen a prophet since in Israel like Moses, whom Yahweh knew face to face,

Tailo: Mā tio̍h hó khuán-thāi tshut-guā lâng, gâu tsò hó sū, siú-kí, kong-gī, sìng-kiat, tsiat-tsè.
English: but given to hospitality, as a lover of good, sober minded, fair, holy, self-controlled;

Tailo: Tsò lô͘-po̍k ê lâng tio̍h ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì sūn-ho̍k hiah-ê sè-tsiūⁿ ê tsú-lâng. Lín phah-piàⁿ tsò, m̄-sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ in huann-hí, tio̍h sîng-sim sîng-ì lâi tsò, in-uī lín sī kìng-uì Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: Servants, obey in all things those who are your masters according to the flesh, not just when they are looking, as men pleasers, but in singleness of heart, fearing God.

Tailo: In-uī I phah-phuà tâng ê mn̂g, tsám-tn̄g thih ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ.
English: For he has broken the gates of brass, And cut through bars of iron.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, tio̍h thiaⁿ guá, tio̍h thiaⁿ guá! Hō͘ tsit kok ê jîn-bîn tsai Lí — Siōngtsú to̍h-sī Siōngtè, Lí hō͘ in ê sim ua̍t tò-tńg.
English: Hear me, Yahweh, hear me, that this people may know that you, Yahweh, are God, and that you have turned their heart back again.

Tailo: In-uī pháiⁿ lâng ê tshuì kah kan-tsà ê tshuì í-king thí-khui lâi kong-kik guá; in īng pe̍h-tsha̍t ê tsi̍h tuì guá kóng uē.
English: For they have opened the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit against me. They have spoken to me with a lying tongue.

Tailo: Taⁿ kiû lí sià-bián guá ê tsuē, kah guá tńg-.khì, hō͘ guá thang kìng-pài Siōngtsú.
English: Now therefore, please pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí kám ē iáu-koh tuì Guá ê jîn-bîn kiau-ngō͘, m̄-tsún in lī-khui?
English: as you still exalt yourself against my people, that you won't let them go.

Tailo: Līng-guā tī Mánáse kiáⁿ-sun ê sán-gia̍p tiong, ū hun-pia̍t ê siâⁿ; hiah-ê siâⁿ kah i ê tsng-thâu, lóng pun hō͘ Ehulaim lâng.
English: together with the cities which were set apart for the children of Ephraim in the midst of the inheritance of the children of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.

Tailo: M̄-thang lō͘-hiān lí ê hiann-tī ê bó͘ ê ē-sin, he sī lí ê hiann-tī ê ē-sin.
English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother's wife: it is your brother's nakedness.

Tailo: Phó͘-thinn-ē ê kok-uī, kuân-pìng kah lia̍t kok ê ui-kuân lóng kau hō͘ tsì-kuân ê sìng ê tsú-bîn. I ê kok sī íng-uán ê kok, kiàn-nā ū kuân ê lóng ē ho̍k-sāi sūn-ho̍k I.
English: The kingdom and the dominion, and the greatness of the kingdoms under the whole sky, shall be given to the people of the saints of the Most High: his kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions shall serve and obey him.

Tailo: Ebiat ê kiáⁿ Ka-le̍p tshut-.khì, khiā tī siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu. Amí-me-li̍k kah tuè ê lâng tuì bâi-ho̍k ê só͘-tsāi khí-.lâi.
English: Gaal the son of Ebed went out, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city: and Abimelech rose up, and the people who were with him, from the ambush.

Tailo: Lâng nā tik-tsuē i ê tshù-piⁿ, mā ū lâng īng tsi̍t-ê tsiù-tsuā kah i tsiù-tsuā, i nā lâi tsit king tiān, tī Lí ê tuâⁿ tsîng tsiù-tsuā,
English: If a man sin against his neighbor, and an oath is laid on him to cause him to swear, and he comes and swears before your altar in this house;

Tailo: Tī Hebúlông tso̍k tiong-kan, ū Ia-li-iah tsò thâu, to̍h-sī tī Hebúlông tso̍k tiong-kan tsiàu i tsó͘-sian ê sè-hē, tī Tabi̍t tsē-uī ê tē-sì-tsa̍p nî, tī Gilia̍t ê Ia-ji-el, tshuē-tio̍h in tiong-kan kuí-nā-ê tuā ióng-sū.
English: Of the Hebronites was Jerijah the chief, even of the Hebronites, according to their generations by fathers' houses. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valor at Jazer of Gilead.

Tailo: I thǹg-khì kaⁿ lāi só͘ tshīng ê saⁿ, tsi̍t-sì-lâng kah Babúlông ông tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: and changed his prison garments. Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life:

Tailo: Guá siá tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī beh hō͘ lín tsai-iáⁿ, sìn Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ ê lâng ū íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life, and that you may continue to believe in the name of the Son of God.

Tailo: Tsit tsa̍p-ê lâng lóng sī Hametátha ê sun, Iôtah lâng ê tuì-ti̍k Hamán ê kiáⁿ. Tsóng-.sī, bô tshiúⁿ in ê tsâi-bu̍t.
English: the ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Jew's enemy, killed they; but they didn't lay their hand on the spoil.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ sìng-tē ê lâng ē jiá-khí uan-ke; bô khuài siū-khì ê lâng ē hō͘ sio-tseⁿ suah.
English: A wrathful man stirs up contention, But one who is slow to anger appeases strife.

Tailo: ti̍t-ti̍t thìng-hāu Siōngtsú àⁿ lo̍h-lâi khuànn, tuì thiⁿ kā guá kàm-tshat.
English: Until Yahweh look down, and see from heaven.

Tailo: Guán piàⁿ sèⁿ-miā lâi tit-tio̍h bí-niûⁿ, in-uī ū to-kiàm tī khòng-iá.
English: We get our bread at the peril of our lives, Because of the sword of the wilderness.

Tailo: Lí ê ióng-sū ná ē pua̍h-tó? In khiā bē tsāi, in-uī Siōngtsú teh kuáⁿ in.
English: Why are your strong ones swept away? they didn't stand, because Yahweh did drive them.

Tailo: In ìn kóng, Tsú ah, kiû Lí khui guán ê ba̍k-tsiu, hō͘ guán ē khuànn-kìnn.
English: They told him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.

Tailo: īⁿ ê pò͘-uî kah īⁿ mn̂g ê mn̂g-lî, ( īⁿ to̍h-sī uî huē-bō͘ kah tuâⁿ ê ) , soh-á kah só͘ īng ê khì-kū, bô-lūn tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h lō͘-īng ê, in lóng tio̍h pān-lí.
English: and the hangings of the court, and the screen for the door of the gate of the court, which is by the tabernacle and around the altar, and their cords, and all the instruments of their service, and whatever shall be done with them. Therein shall they serve.

Tailo: Tāk-ê ū sì-ê bīn, thâu tsi̍t-ê bīn sī ki-lō͘-ping ê bīn, tē-jī-ê bīn sī lâng ê bīn, tē-saⁿ-ê bīn sī sai ê bīn, tē-sì-ê bīn sī ing ê bīn.
English: Every one had four faces: the first face was the face of the cherub, and the second face was the face of a man, and the third face the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.

Tailo: Lí ná ē hō͘ guá tshut thai? Put-jû hit sî tn̄g-khuì, bô hō͘ lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá.
English: Why, then, have you brought me forth out of the womb? I wish I had given up the spirit, and no eye had seen me.

Tailo: Jua̍h-thinn tsik-tsū bí-niûⁿ ê lâng sī tì-huī ê kiáⁿ; siu-kuah ê sî ài-khùn ê lâng sī pāi-ke ê kiáⁿ.
English: He who gathers in summer is a wise son, But he who sleeps during the harvest is a son who causes shame.

Tailo: I nā-sī tshiûⁿ, guán beh tī i ê tíng-bīn khí gîn thah; i nā-sī mn̂g, guán beh īng pik-hiuⁿ tshâ pán kā i uî khí-.lâi.
English: If she is a wall, We will build on her a turret of silver. If she is a door, We will enclose her with boards of cedar. Beloved

Tailo: Lín tha̍k-liáu tsiū ē bîng-pi̍k guá tuì Ki-tok ò-pì ê liáu-kái.
English: by which, when you read, you can perceive my understanding in the mystery of Christ;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, pháiⁿ lâng bē-tàng ū hok-khì, mā bē-tàng tn̂g huè-siū, ná tshin-tshiūnn iánn tshun tn̂g, in-uī i bô tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng kìng-uì I.
English: But it shall not be well with the wicked, neither shall he lengthen days like a shadow; because he doesn't fear God.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí tio̍h tsia̍h bi̍t, in-uī bi̍t sī hó; tsia̍h bi̍t-pâng só͘ tih ê bi̍t tsiū tsai tinn.
English: My son, eat honey, for it is good; The droppings of the honeycomb, which are sweet to your taste:

Tailo: Pàng tsi̍t tsiah o͘-a tshut-.khì. O͘-a pue-lâi pue khì, it-ti̍t kàu tē-tsiūⁿ ê tsuí ta-.khì.
English: and he sent forth a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from the earth.

Tailo: Gín-á tsiām-tsiām tuā-hàn, tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū tshuā i kàu Huâ-láu ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ hia, tsò i ê kiáⁿ. I kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Mô͘se, kóng, In-uī guá tuì tsuí-.ni̍h kā i kiù khí-.lâi.
English: The child grew, and she brought him to Pharaoh's daughter, and he became her son. She named him Moses, and said, Because I drew him out of the water.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí tio̍h tshe lâng, tsū-tsi̍p Isulael jîn-bîn kah Baal ê sian-ti sì-pah gō͘-tsa̍p lâng, í-ki̍p tī Iétsebel ê toh lim-tsia̍h ê A-si-lah ê sian-ti sì-pah lâng, lóng khì Kal-mel suaⁿ lâi-kàu guá tsia.
English: Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel to Mount Carmel, and the prophets of Baal four hundred fifty, and the prophets of the Asherah four hundred, who eat at Jezebel's table.

Tailo: Guān só͘-ū tsáu-tshuē Lí ê lâng in-uī Lí lâi huann-hí khuài-lo̍k; guān him-bō͘ Lí kiù-un ê lâng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kóng, Tio̍h tsun Siōngtè tsò tuā!
English: Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you. Let those who love your salvation continually say, Let God be exalted!

Tailo: Tsit-ê kng tsiò tī o͘-àm tiong, m̄-koh, o͘-àm m̄ tsiap-la̍p kng.
English: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn't overcome it.

Tailo: tuì in kóng, Lín tuè guá lâi, in-uī Siōngtsú í-king kā lín ê tuì-ti̍k Mô͘ap lâng kau tī lín ê tshiú. In tsiū tuè i lo̍h-.khì, tī Mô͘ap ê tuì-bīn pé-siú Ioltàn hô ê tō͘-thâu, bô iông-ín tsi̍t-ê lâng kuè-.khì.
English: He said to them, Follow after me; for Yahweh has delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand. They went down after him, and took the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites, and didn't allow a man to pass over.

Tailo: I tsiū sǹg hiah-ê síng-tiúⁿ ê siàu-liân lâng, tsóng-kiōng ū nn̄g-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p-jī miâ; āu-lâi i koh sǹg tsìng lâng, to̍h-sī Isulael lâng, tsóng-kiōng ū tshit tshing miâ.
English: Then he mustered the young men of the princes of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty-two: and after them he mustered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand.

Tailo: In kā guá kóng, Hiah-ê siū lia̍h ê tńg-lâi só͘ tshun lâu-.leh ê lâng, tī síng lāi tú-tio̍h tuā huān-lān, siū lîng-jio̍k, jî-tshiánn Êlúsalèm ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ siū thiah-huí, siâⁿ mn̂g hō͘ hué sio-sio-.khì.
English: They said to me, The remnant who are left of the captivity there in the province are in great affliction and reproach: the wall of Jerusalem also is broken down, and the gates of it are burned with fire.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá tuì Palân kóng, Lí kah tsiah-ê lâng khì! Tsóng-.sī, lí tsí ū thang kóng guá só͘ beh tuì lí kóng ê. Palân tsiū kah Baal ê siú-líng tsò-hué khì.
English: The angel of Yahweh said to Balaam, Go with the men; but only the word that I shall speak to you, that you shall speak. So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.

Tailo: Pa-lo-ne-koh kā i kuaiⁿ-kìm tī Hamat tē ê Lip-la̍h, hō͘ i tī Êlúsalèm bô tsò ông, koh hō͘ hit kok tsìn-kòng gîn tsi̍t pah tha-lan-t, kim tsi̍t tha-lan-t.
English: Pharaoh Necoh put him in bonds at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem; and put the land to a tribute of one hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h Tsú ê iân-kò͘, lín tio̍h sūn-ho̍k lâng só͘ siat-li̍p ê tsè-tō͘. Bô-lūn sī tuì tsuè-ko thóng-tī-tsiá ê kun-ông,
English: Therefore subject yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether to the king, as supreme;

Tailo: It-tshè tsiàu in ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu in ê khin-tāng kau hō͘ i, tong-sî mā kì in ê khin-tāng.
English: the whole by number and by weight: and all the weight was written at that time.

Tailo: In thâi kiáⁿ hiàn hō͘ ngó͘-siōng, tng hit ji̍t koh ji̍p-khì Guá ê sìng-só͘, lâi kā i uè lah-sap. Lí khuàⁿ, in tī Guá ê tshù lāi án-ne kiânn.
English: For when they had slain their children to their idols, then they came the same day into my sanctuary to profane it; and behold, thus have they done in the midst of my house.

Tailo: In tuà I-si-bo-siat ê thâu-khak lâi-kàu Hebúlông Tabi̍t hia, kā ông kóng, Lí ê tuì-ti̍k Sàulô bat siàu-siūⁿ lí ê sèⁿ-miā ê, lí khuàⁿ, tse sī i ê kiáⁿ I-si-bo-siat ê thâu-khak. Siōngtsú kin-á-ji̍t, tī Sàulô kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun, uī-tio̍h guá ê tsú — guá ê ông pò-siû.
English: They brought the head of Ishbosheth to David to Hebron, and said to the king, Behold, the head of Ishbosheth, the son of Saul, your enemy, who sought your life; and Yahweh has avenged my lord the king this day of Saul, and of his seed.

Tailo: Ông thè in tsún-pī tsin tsē tsia̍h-mi̍h, in lim-tsia̍h liáu-āu, tsiū kiò in khì; in tsiū tńg-khì in ê tsú-lâng hia. Tsiū án-ne, Alâm ê kun-ping bô koh tshim-huān Isulael ê kíng-kài.
English: He prepared great provision for them; and when they had eaten and drunk, he sent them away, and they went to their master. The bands of Syria came no more into the land of Israel.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng tī i tshò-gō͘ huān tsuē ê sî, tsè-si tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kā i sio̍k-tsuē, i tsiū ē tit-tio̍h sià-bián.
English: The priest shall make atonement for the soul who errs, when he sins unwittingly, before Yahweh, to make atonement for him; and he shall be forgiven.

Tailo: Lu̍t-huat ê tsè-tīng, hō͘ tsuē-kò jú ke-thinn; tsóng-.sī, tsuē-kò jú ke-thinn, Siōngtè ê un-tián mā ē koh khah ke-thinn.
English: The law came in besides, that the trespass might abound; but where sin abounded, grace did abound more exceedingly;

Tailo: Lán nā siūⁿ beh tuì uá-khò Ki-tok lâi kah Siōngtè ū hô-hó ê kuan-hē, m̄-koh iáu-sī hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò kah guā-pang lâng sio-siâng sī tsuē-jîn, án-ne Ki-tok sī tsuē-ok ê tshe-īng, sī-.bô? Tsua̍t-tuì m̄-sī!
English: But if, while we sought to be justified in Christ, we ourselves also were found sinners, is Christ a servant of sin? Certainly not!

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Piattò͘ kah tsa̍p-it-ê sù-tô͘ khiā khí-.lâi, tuā-siaⁿ tuì in kóng, Iô-tá-iah lâng kah só͘-ū tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê lâng, lín tio̍h tsai tsit-ê tāi-tsì, mā tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ guá ê uē.
English: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them, You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn kóng: In tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín lâi, uī lán tshut siaⁿ háu, hō͘ lán ê ba̍k-sái ti̍t-ti̍t lâu, hō͘ lán ê ba̍k-tsiu phuê tshìng-tshut tsuí.
English: and let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out with waters.

Tailo: Gōng lâng ê lô-lo̍k tì-sú hō͘ in ià-siān, in-uī liân ji̍p siâⁿ ê lō͘ i mā m̄-tsai.
English: The labor of fools wearies every one of them; for he doesn't know how to go to the city.

Tailo: Hit mê, Siōngtsú huan-hù Gîtióng kóng, Lí khan lín lāu-pē ê gû-á lâi, to̍h-sī tshit nî ê tē-jī tsiah gû, mā tio̍h thiah-huí lín lāu-pē só͘-ū Baal ê tuâⁿ, kā tuâⁿ piⁿ ê A-si-lah tshò tiāu,
English: It happened the same night, that Yahweh said to him, Take your father's bull, even the second bull seven years old, and throw down the altar of Baal that your father has, and cut down the Asherah that is by it;

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ to-kiàm, hō͘ ki-hng, hō͘ un-i̍k lîm-kàu in tiong-kan, ti̍t-kàu in tī Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in kah in tsó͘-sian ê tē siū tsâu-bia̍t.
English: I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, among them, until they be consumed from off the land that I gave to them and to their fathers.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ i hong-huì, bô koh siu-tsíng, bô koh thû-thuáⁿ; tian-tò huat tshì-á kah tsi̍t-lê; guá mā ē bīng-līng hûn bô lo̍h hō͘ tī i ê tíng-bīn.
English: I will lay it a wasteland. It won't be pruned nor hoed, But it will grow briers and thorns. I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain on it.

Tailo: In tī Iôtah tsiah-ê siâⁿ tiong kah Êlúsalèm ê ke-lō͘ só͘ kiâⁿ ê, lí kám bô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h?
English: Don't you see what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

Tailo: Isulael lâng kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, bē kì-tit Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè, khì ho̍k-sāi tsiah-ê Baal kah A-si-tha-lot.
English: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and forgot Yahweh their God, and served the Baals and the Asheroth.

Tailo: guān Lí tuì thiⁿ, Lí só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi, thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó kah khún-kiû, lâi pó-hō͘ in ê gī, koh sià-bián Lí ê tsú-bîn só͘ tik-tsuē Lí ê.
English: then hear from heaven, even from your dwelling place, their prayer and their petitions, and maintain their cause, and forgive your people who have sinned against you.

Tailo: Lí ê ngó͘-kok, tsiú, iû ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it, á-.sī gû-kûn, iûⁿ-kûn tiong thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê, á-.sī lí hē guān hiàn ê, kam-sim hiàn ê, á-.sī tshiú-.ni̍h ê kí-tsè, lóng m̄-thang tī lí ê mn̂g lāi tsia̍h.
English: You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, or of your new wine, or of your oil, or the firstborn of your herd or of your flock, nor any of your vows which you vow, nor your freewill offerings, nor the wave offering of your hand;

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h kín-sīn, tsiah bián-tit sian-ti só͘ ī-giân ê lîm-kàu lín.
English: Beware therefore, lest that come on you which is spoken in the prophets:

Tailo: Kiû Lí m̄-thang hō͘ siū ap-tsè ê lâng kiàn-siàu tò tńg-.khì; khùn-khó͘ sàn-tshiah ê lâng tio̍h hō͘ in o-ló Lí ê miâ.
English: Don't let the oppressed return ashamed. Let the poor and needy praise your name.

Tailo: I tshin-tshiūnn thang thiàⁿ ê lo̍k-bú, thang huann-hí ê lo̍k-bú; i ê hing tsîng hō͘ lí sî-sî ti tsiok; i ê ài-tsîng hō͘ lí tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ luân-bō͘.
English: A loving doe and a graceful deer Let her breasts satisfy you at all times. Be captivated always with her love.

Tailo: Nabot kā Ahap kóng, Kā guá ê tsó͘-sian só͘ lâu ê sán-gia̍p hō͘ lí, tsit-ê tāi-tsì guān Siōngtsú kìm-tsí guá.
English: Naboth said to Ahab, Yahweh forbid it me, that I should give the inheritance of my fathers to you.

Tailo: Tsiū kā i kóng, M̄-bián kiaⁿ! Guá ê lāu-pē Sàulô ê tshiú tshuē lí bē-tio̍h; lí ē tsò Isulael ông, guá ē tsò lí ê jī-tshiú. Tsit-ê tāi-tsì guá ê pē Sàulô í-king tsai-iáⁿ
English: He said to him, Don't be afraid; for the hand of Saul my father shall not find you; and you shall be king over Israel, and I shall be next to you; and that also Saul my father knows.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Lí hò͘ⁿ îm-luān kah khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, lí í-king tam-tng à.
English: You have borne your lewdness and your abominations, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá koh mn̄g i kóng, ' Lí sī siáⁿ lâng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ? ' I ìn kóng, ' Guá sī Milkah tuì Na-khool só͘ seⁿ ê kiáⁿ — Bethuel ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ. ' Guá tsiū kā kim-khuân khuà tī i ê phīⁿ, kā tshiú-khuân khuà tī i ê tshiú.
English: I asked her, and said, Whose daughter are you?' She said, The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him.' I put the ring on her nose, and the bracelets on her hands.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h siú Guá it-tshè ê lu̍t-lē kah Guá só͘-ū ê huat-tō͘ lâi kiâⁿ, bián-tit Guá só͘ tshuā lín khì tuà ê tē kā lín thò͘ tshut-.khì.
English: You shall therefore keep all my statutes, and all my ordinances, and do them; that the land, where I am bringing you to dwell, may not vomit you out.

Tailo: Abulahàm kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ, Siōngtè ē ka-kī tsún-pī sio-tsè ê iûⁿ-á. Nn̄g lâng koh tsò-hué kiânn.
English: Abraham said, God will provide himself the lamb for a burnt offering, my son. So they both went together.

Tailo: Lín ài lâng án-tsuáⁿ tuì-thāi lín, mā tio̍h án-ne tuì-thāi lâng.
English: As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.

Tailo: La̍h-khel sí, bâi-tsòng tī khì Ehula̍t ê lō͘; Ehula̍t to̍h-sī Bia̍tléhèm.
English: Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath ( the same is Bethlehem ) .

Tailo: Koh tī khòng-iá khí tsiú-keⁿ lâu, koh tī kē ê tē kah pîng-guân khui tsin tsē kó͘-tséⁿ, in-uī i ū tsin tsē tsing-seⁿ; tī suaⁿ-tē kah hó ê tshân, i koh ū tsoh-sit lâng kah liāu-lí phû-tô hn̂g ê, in-uī i huann-hí tsìng-tsoh ê tāi-tsì.
English: He built towers in the wilderness, and hewed out many cisterns, for he had much livestock; in the lowland also, and in the plain: and he had farmers and vineyard keepers in the mountains and in the fruitful fields; for he loved farming.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsò-hué khùn, bâi-tsòng tī i ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t ê siâⁿ. I ê kiáⁿ Lô-bo-àm suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Tio̍h uá-khò lán ê kiù Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê un-tián, lâi hō͘ lán tuì I ê jīn-bat kè-sio̍k tsìn-pō͘. Guān îng-kng kui hō͘ I, tuì tsit-má ti̍t-kàu íng-uán! A-men!
English: But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be the glory both now and forever. Amen.

Tailo: Taⁿ guán tsia ū hiann-tī tshit lâng. Tuā-hiaⁿ tshuā bó͘ liáu tsiū sí-.khì, bô kiáⁿ, kā i e bó͘ pàng hō͘ i ê sió-tī.
English: Now there were with us seven brothers. The first married and died, and having no seed left his wife to his brother.

Tailo: Lín tiām-tiām, m̄-thang tshap guá, tshut-tsāi guá kóng, tsiū bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h tsò i lâi.
English: Be silent, leave me alone, that I may speak. Let come on me what will.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Kenî ē tì-kàu sue-bî, ti̍t-kàu hō͘ Asiul kā lí lia̍h-.khì.
English: Nevertheless Kain shall be wasted, Until Asshur shall carry you away captive.

Tailo: In-uī Guá kā lí khuàⁿ-tsò sī pó-puè, tòng-tsò sī tsun-kuì, koh in-uī Guá thiàⁿ lí, só͘-í, Guá hō͘ lâng tāi-thè lí, hō͘ lia̍t kok ê jîn-bîn tāi-thè lí ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Since you have been precious in my sight, and honorable, and I have loved you; therefore will I give men in your place, and peoples instead of your life.

Tailo: M̄-bián, guá ê tsú, tshiánn thiaⁿ guá kóng. Guá beh sàng lí hit khu tshân, liân hit lāi-bīn ê hia̍t mā hō͘ lí, tī guá tông tso̍k ê lâng ê bīn-tsîng, guá beh hō͘ lí thang khì bâi-tsòng lí ê sí-lâng.
English: No, my lord, hear me. I give you the field, and I give you the cave that is in it. In the presence of the children of my people I give it to you. Bury your dead.

Tailo: In it-tīng ē ū sán-gia̍p, Guá sī in ê sán-gia̍p. M̄-thang tī Isulael tiong hō͘ in ki-gia̍p, Guá sī in ê ki-gia̍p.
English: They shall have an inheritance: I am their inheritance; and you shall give them no possession in Israel; I am their possession.

Tailo: I ìn in kóng, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng, ' Lín khì huê-hok hit-ê tshe lín lâi kìnn guá ê lâng kóng,
English: She said to them, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: Tell you the man who sent you to me,

Tailo: Lín nā tsù-ì tsun-thàn guá ê kài-bīng, to̍h-sī guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lín ê, thiàⁿ Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng ho̍k-sāi I,
English: It shall happen, if you shall listen diligently to my commandments which I command you this day, to love Yahweh your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,

Tailo: Iôséhuh kóng, Nā-sī gîn īng liáu, lín thang khan lín ê tsing-seⁿ lâi, guá uī-tio̍h lín ê tsing-seⁿ beh hō͘ lín bí-niûⁿ.
English: Joseph said, Give me your livestock; and I will give you food for your livestock, if your money is gone.

Tailo: In tuì suaⁿ-niá kah suaⁿ-giâm huah, Tó lo̍h-lâi kā guán khàm-.leh, hō͘ guán thang siám-phiah hit uī tsē tī pó-tsō ê bīn kah iûⁿ-ko ê siū-khì.
English: They told the mountains and the rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of him who sits on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb,

Tailo: Hit-ê sueh-ho̍k lín án-ne tsò ê, tong-jiân m̄-sī hit uī ho͘-tiàu lín ê Siōngtè.
English: This persuasion is not from him who calls you.

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ lī-khui gī-huē, muá-sim huann-hí, tse sī in-uī in hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò ē kham-tit uī-tio̍h Tsú ê miâ siū lîng-jio̍k.
English: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus' name.

Tailo: Le-ba-nòng bô kàu-gia̍h thang tsò hué-tshâ, kî-tiong ê tsáu-siù bô kàu-gia̍h tsò sio-tsè.
English: Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, Nor its animals sufficient for a burnt offering.

Tailo: I siá hō͘ lín ê lu̍t-lē, lé-gî, lu̍t-huat kah kài-bīng, lín ing-kai íng-uán tsip-siú tsun-thàn, m̄-thang kìng-uì pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng.
English: and the statutes and the ordinances, and the law and the commandment, which he wrote for you, you shall observe to do forevermore; and you shall not fear other gods:

Tailo: Lāu-pē án-tsuáⁿ liân-bín i ê kiáⁿ-jî, Siōngtsú liân-bín kìng-uì I ê lâng mā sī án-ne!
English: Like a father has compassion on his children, So Yahweh has compassion on those who fear him.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú! In-uī tshiùⁿ kua o-ló lán ê Siōngtsú sī tsin hó; o-ló I sī ha̍p-gî ê.
English: Praise Yah, For it is good to sing praises to our God; For it is pleasant and fitting to praise him.

Tailo: Siōngtsú beh tsò ông, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán.
English: Yahweh shall reign forever and ever.

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Lí tńg-.khì, lí ê sìn-sim í-king hō͘ lí tit-tio̍h i hó. Tsheⁿ-mê ê suî-sî koh ē khuànn-kìnn, tsiū tuè Iésu khì.
English: Jesus said to him, Go your way. Your faith has made you well. Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú teh beh lâi ā, I beh lâi sím-phuàⁿ tsuân tē. I beh tsiàu kong-gī sím-phuàⁿ sè-kài, tsiàu I ê sìn-si̍t sím-phuàⁿ bān-bîn.
English: Before Yahweh; for he comes, For he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness, The peoples with his truth.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē-hiáu kóng-khí Siōngtsú ê tuā kuân-lîng? Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng kóng-tshut I it-tshè ê miâ-siaⁿ?
English: Who can utter the mighty acts of Yahweh, Or fully declare all his praise?

Tailo: In ê hiann-tī, tī Itsakal hiah-ê ke lóng sī tuā ióng-sū, tsiàu in ê sè-hē lâi sǹg, kiōng peh-bān tshit-tshing lâng.
English: Their brothers among all the families of Issachar, mighty men of valor, reckoned in all by genealogy, were eighty-seven thousand.

Tailo: Iâkop lâi-kàu in lāu-pē hia, kóng, Guá ê a-pa. I kóng, Guá tī tsia. Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: He came to his father, and said, My father? He said, Here I am. Who are you, my son?

Tailo: In nn̄g lâng tī ta̍k-ê kàu-hē kā in siat-li̍p tiúⁿ-ló, kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, kā in kau-thok tī in só͘ sìn ê Tsú.
English: When they had appointed elders for them in every assembly, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they had believed.

Tailo: Tsè-si Alông ê sun, Êlīatsal ê kiáⁿ Hui-ne-hah hō͘ Guá só͘ huat ê siū-khì tī Isulael lâng suah-.khì, in-uī i tī in tiong-kan, īng Guá ê tsi̍t-tò͘ tsò tsi̍t-tò͘, hō͘ Guá tī tsi̍t-tò͘ tiong bô kā in bia̍t-bông.
English: Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, in that he was jealous with my jealousy among them, so that I didn't consume the children of Israel in my jealousy.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Isulael tsò gín-á ê sî, Guá to̍h thiàⁿ i, jî-tshiánn Guá ū tiàu Guá ê kiáⁿ tshut Aigi̍p tē.
English: When Israel was a child, then I loved him, And called my son out of Egypt.

Tailo: Tabi̍t phah-sí hit-ê Huilīsū lâng liáu-āu tò tńg-.lâi, in tńg-.lâi ê sî, hiah-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tuì Isulael ta̍k-ê siâⁿ tshut-.lâi, tshiùⁿ kua, thiàu-bú, īng lin-long-kó͘, īng huann-hí, īng tsàu ga̍k ê khì-kū, lâi gîng-tsiap Sàulô ông.
English: It happened as they came, when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with tambourines, with joy, and with instruments of music.

Tailo: Lūbiān ê kiáⁿ-sun kah Ga̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun, in ê tsing-seⁿ hui-siông tsē; in khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ia-tsel ê tē kah Gilia̍t ê tē, sī thang tshī tsing-seⁿ ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of livestock: and when they saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead, that behold, the place was a place for livestock;

Tailo: Ông, thàu tiong-tàu ê sî, guá tī lō͘ tiong khuàⁿ-tio̍h pí ji̍t-thâu khah kiông ê kng, tuì thinn-tíng tsiò lo̍h-lâi tī guá kah tâng-phuāⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: at noon, O King, I saw on the way a light from the sky, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who traveled with me.

Tailo: Sin-uan pò-ìng tsāi tī Guá, tī in ê kha ta̍h-tian ê sî, in-uī in tú-tio̍h tsai-hō ê ji̍t teh beh kàu, só͘ beh tú-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì ē tsin kín kàu.
English: Vengeance is mine, and recompense, At the time when their foot shall slide: For the day of their calamity is at hand, The things that are to come on them shall make haste.

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, Iésu ji̍p-khì huē-tn̂g kà-sī lâng. Tī hia ū tsi̍t-ê tsiàⁿ tshiú khuê-khì ê lâng.
English: It also happened on another Sabbath that he entered into the synagogue and taught. There was a man there, and his right hand was withered.

Tailo: King-tián kám bô kóng, ' Ki-tok sī Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun, sī tuì Tabi̍t ê kò͘-hiong Bia̍tléhèm siâⁿ tshut? '
English: Hasn't the Scripture said that the Christ comes of the seed of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?

Tailo: Guá só͘ bīng-līng lín ê uē, lín m̄-thang ke-thinn, mā m̄-thang kā i kiám-tsió, thang hō͘ lín tsip-siú Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè ê kài-bīng, to̍h-sī guá só͘ bīng-līng lín ê.
English: You shall not add to the word which I command you, neither shall you diminish from it, that you may keep the commandments of Yahweh your God which I command you.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Mô͘se tshiú sng, in tsiū suá tsi̍t lia̍p tsio̍h-thâu lâi hē tī i ê ē-bīn, i tsē tī tsio̍h-thâu tíng, Alông kah Huul hû i ê tshiú, tsi̍t-ê tī tsit pîng, tsi̍t-ê tī hit pîng, i ê tshiú tsiū an-ún tsū-tsāi, ti̍t-ti̍t kàu ji̍t lo̍h.
English: But Moses' hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat on it. Aaron and Hur held up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side. His hands were steady until sunset.

Tailo: Kok-uī hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá tsin ài lín tsai, guá kuí-nā pái kè-uē beh khì hóng-būn lin, thang tshin-tshiūnn tī kî-tha guā-pang lâng ê tiong-kan kāng-khuán, mā tī lín tiong-kan siu-sîng tsi̍t-kuá kué-tsí; tsóng-.sī, kàu tann iáu ū tsó͘-tòng.
English: Now I don't desire to have you unaware, brothers, that I often planned to come to you, and was hindered so far, that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among the rest of the Gentiles.

Tailo: I īng o͘-àm tsò bih sin ê só͘-tsāi, I īng tsuí kah ba̍t hûn uî khí-lâi tsò tiùⁿ-pâng.
English: He made darkness his hiding place, his pavilion around him, Darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.

Tailo: Suî-jiân in ê siú-líng í-king kàu Tsó-an, in ê sù-tsiá í-king kàu Ha-né-su.
English: For their princes are at Zoan, and their ambassadors have come to Hanes.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kí Iâkop ê îng-huâ lâi tsiù-tsuā kóng: In só͘-ū ê só͘ tsò, Guá íng-uán bô bē kì-.tit.
English: Yahweh has sworn by the pride of Jacob, Surely I will never forget any of their works.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h giām hit-ê tshiah-bah, tsiū tuàn-tīng i sī bô tshing-khì. Tshiah-bah pún-lâi to̍h sī bô tshing-khì, sī thái-ko.
English: The priest shall examine the raw flesh, and pronounce him unclean: the raw flesh is unclean. It is leprosy.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tsiàu Siōngtsú thok Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng ê, kā tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah in ê kau-iá, liam-khau pun hō͘ Lēbī lâng.
English: The children of Israel gave by lot to the Levites these cities with their suburbs, as Yahweh commanded by Moses.

Tailo: In tsiū phak tī tē-.ni̍h, kóng, Siōngtè ah, siúⁿ-sù ua̍h-miā hō͘ kiàn-nā ū jio̍k-thé ê Siōngtè ah, tsi̍t-ê lâng huān tsuē, Lí kám tsiū beh siū-khì tsuân huē-tsiòng?
English: They fell on their faces, and said, God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin, and will you be angry with all the congregation?

Tailo: Tsú-lâng tuì lô͘-po̍k kóng, ' Tshut-khì lō͘-.ni̍h kah lî-pa piⁿ bián-kióng lâng ji̍p-.lâi, thang hō͘ guá ê tshù tsē muá.
English: The lord said to the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.

Tailo: In-uī guá ê uē si̍t-tsāi bô pe̍h-tsha̍t, ū tì-sik tsê-pī ê lâng kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: For truly my words are not false. One who is perfect in knowledge is with you.

Tailo: Lí siū-khì ê sî, ē hō͘ in tshin-tshiūnn tī iām-jua̍h ê hué-lô͘. Siōngtsú ē tī I ê tuā siū-khì tiong kā in thun-bia̍t; hué ē kā in sio-sio-.khì.
English: You will make them as a fiery furnace in the time of your anger. Yahweh will swallow them up in his wrath. The fire shall devour them.

Tailo: Guá bē liáu-kái guá ka-kī ê só͘ tsò, in-uī guá ài tsò ê, bô khì tsò, tian-tò-khì tsò guá só͘ m̄-ài-.ê.
English: For I don't know what I am doing. For I don't practice what I desire to do; but what I hate, that I do.

Tailo: Bô lâng bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtè; lán nā sio-thiànn, Siōngtè tsiū tiàm tī lán lāi-bīn, I ê thiàⁿ tsiū thong-kuè lán uân-tsuân si̍t-hiān.
English: No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God remains in us, and his love has been perfected in us.

Tailo: Hit mê, in hō͘ lāu-pē lim tsiú, tuā tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsiū ji̍p-khì kah lāu-pē tsò-hué khùn; i tang-sî khì khùn, tang-sî khí-.lâi, lāu-pē lóng m̄-tsai.
English: They made their father drink wine that night: and the firstborn went in, and lay with her father. He didn't know when she lay down, nor when she arose.

Tailo: Gín-á ê lāu-pē suî-sî tuā-siaⁿ huah, Guá sìn à; guá ê sìn-sim nā bô kàu, kiû Lí tio̍h pang-tsān guá.
English: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears, I believe. Help my unbelief!

Tailo: Hó-gia̍h tsiū ē ke-thinn tsin tsē pîng-iú, sàn-tshiah tsiū ē hō͘ pîng-iú lī-khui i.
English: Wealth adds many friends, But the poor is separated from his friend.

Tailo: Siōngtè it-tshè ê ìng-ín tsāi tī Iésu Ki-tok lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò Sī , só͘-í, lán thong-kuè I kóng, A-men , lâi îng-kng Siōngtè.
English: For however many are the promises of God, in him is the Yes. Therefore also through him is the Amen, to the glory of God through us.

Tailo: Lán tsiū thang tuà lán ê Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī lâi-kàu lán tsia, in-uī Sàulô ê sî-tsūn, lán bô īng hit-ê iok-kuī lâi mn̄g Siōngtè.
English: and let us bring again the ark of our God to us: for we didn't seek it in the days of Saul.

Tailo: In īng nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu tsò tshiú-kang iù ê saⁿ-khò͘, tī sìng-só͘ tshīng lâi ho̍k-sāi, koh kā Alông tsò sìng-saⁿ, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê.
English: Of the blue, purple, and scarlet, they made finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Guá beh tû-bia̍t lâng kah tsing-seⁿ, tû-bia̍t khong-tiong ê tsiáu kah hái lāi ê hî, í-ki̍p tsó͘-gāi ê tsio̍h-thâu kah pháiⁿ lâng, Guá beh kā lâng tuì tē-tsiūⁿ tsián-tû. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: I will sweep away man and animal. I will sweep away the birds of the sky, the fish of the sea, and the heaps of rubble with the wicked. I will cut off man from the surface of the earth, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng tsiū tshut-khì tí-ti̍k jîn-bîn, tsiū siū ín-iú lī-khui siâⁿ, in tshin-tshiūnn tsîng nn̄g pái tī tshân-.ni̍h khí-tshiú thâi-sí Isulael lâng tsha-put-to saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê; tī tuā lō͘ tíng hiah-ê lō͘, tsi̍t tiâu thàng Bethel, tsi̍t tiâu thàng Gi-be-at.
English: The children of Benjamin went out against the people, and were drawn away from the city; and they began to strike and kill of the people, as at other times, in the highways, of which one goes up to Bethel, and the other to Gibeah, in the field, about thirty men of Israel.

Tailo: I tio̍h pak sio-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ ê phuê, kā i ê bah tshiat-tsò tsi̍t tè tsi̍t tè.
English: He shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into pieces.

Tailo: Khiā tī Iésu ê tuì-bīn ê liân-tiúⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h I án-ne tn̄g-khuì, tsiū kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ.
English: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God!

Tailo: I tio̍h tuì hit tiong-kan the̍h-tshut sò͘-tsè ê mī-hún tsi̍t pé, kah iû, kah sò͘-tsè tiong só͘-ū ê jú-hiuⁿ, tī tuâⁿ tíng sio lâi tsò kì-liām, hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò phang-bī.
English: He shall take from there his handful of the fine flour of the meal offering, and of its oil, and all the frankincense which is on the meal offering, and shall burn it on the altar for a sweet savor, as its memorial, to Yahweh.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h beh kiâⁿ uân guá ê lō͘-thîng, uân-sîng Tsú Iésu kau-tài guá ê jīm-bū, thang tsìng-bîng Siōngtè un-tián ê hok-im, guá uân-tsuân bô sioh ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: But these things don't count; nor do I hold my life dear to myself, so that I may finish my race with joy, and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to fully testify to the Good News of the grace of God.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Sisela̍h kóng, Apílôam ê kiáⁿ Bala̍h í-king khì Tha-bool suaⁿ.
English: They told Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam was gone up to Mount Tabor.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōngtè ê Sìng Sîn lîm-kàu tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah ê kiáⁿ Tsa-kha-lī-a; i tsiū khiā tī jîn-bîn ê tíng-bīn, tuì in kóng, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Lín ná ē huān-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê kài-bīng, tì-sú bē-tàng hing-thong? In-uī lín khì-sak Siōngtsú, Siōngtsú mā khì-sak lín. '
English: The Spirit of God came on Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest; and he stood above the people, and said to them, Thus says God, Why disobey you the commandments of Yahweh, so that you can't prosper? because you have forsaken Yahweh, he has also forsaken you.

Tailo: I nā-sī tuaⁿ-sin lâi, tsiū tuaⁿ-sin lī-khui; i nā-sī ū bó͘, i ê bó͘ tsiū kah i tsò-hué lī-khui.
English: If he comes in by himself, he shall go out by himself. If he is married, then his wife shall go out with him.

Tailo: Ná ē ū lāu-bú ê kha-thâu-u tsiap-la̍p guá? Án-tsuáⁿ ū ling hō͘ guá suh?
English: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breast, that I should suck?

Tailo: Guá tsō in ê tshuì, beh hō͘ in kóng-tshut o-ló ê uē; pîng-an kah hok-khì kui hō͘ hn̄g kah kīn ê lâng, Guá koh beh kā i i hó. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: I create the fruit of the lips: Peace, peace, to him who is far off and to him who is near, says Yahweh; and I will heal him.

Tailo: Guá tiām-tiām bô tshut siaⁿ, liân hó uē mā bô kóng-tshut tshuì. Guá ê iu-būn tsiū ke-thinn.
English: I was mute with silence. I held my peace, even from good. My sorrow was stirred.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Tsiong-lâi ū lia̍t kok ê lâng kah tsin tsē siâⁿ ê jîn-bîn ē lâi-kàu.
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies: Many peoples, and the inhabitants of many cities will yet come;

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú ē khí-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn tī Phe-la-tsim suaⁿ; I ē siū-khì, tshin-tshiūnn tī Gi-bóng ê suaⁿ-kok; thang tsò I ê kang, to̍h-sī hán-tit tsò ê kang; thang tsiânn I ê tāi-tsì, to̍h-sī kî-ī ê tāi-tsì.
English: For Yahweh will rise up as on Mount Perazim. He will be angry as in the valley of Gibeon; that he may do his work, his unusual work, and bring to pass his act, his extraordinary act.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê lô-khó͘ tì-sú ū ua̍h-miā; pháiⁿ lâng só͘ thàn ê tì-sú ū tsuē.
English: The labor of the righteous leads to life. The increase of the wicked leads to sin.

Tailo: Kan-taⁿ ū kuí-nā-ê tuì A-si-a síng lâi ê Iô-tá-iah lâng tī hia. In nā beh kò guá, ing-kai ka-kī lâi lí ê bīn-tsîng kò guá tsiah tio̍h ah.
English: They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè? I tsē tī tsì-kuân ê só͘-tsāi,
English: Who is like Yahweh, our God, Who has his seat on high,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì só͘ siu-sîng ê ngó͘-kok kah tsiú-khut lāi só͘ lâu tshut ê tsiú, the̍h-lâi hiàn, m̄-thang iân-tshiân.
English: You shall not delay to offer from your harvest and from the outflow of your presses. You shall give the firstborn of your sons to me.

Tailo: Tī lín tiong-kan ū lō͘-hiān lāu-pē ê ē-sin, tī lín tiong-kan ū lîng-jio̍k gue̍h-king bô tshing-khì ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê.
English: In you have they uncovered their fathers' nakedness; in you have they humbled her who was unclean in her impurity.

Tailo: Alông tī tuâⁿ tíng tio̍h sio phang-liāu só͘ tsò ê hiuⁿ, ta̍k tsá-khí i tsíng-tùn ting ê sî tio̍h sio hiuⁿ.
English: Aaron shall burn incense of sweet spices on it every morning. When he tends the lamps, he shall burn it.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū kah pē-bú tńg-khì kàu Na-tsa-lia̍t, lâi kā in iú-hàu. I ê lāu-bú kā tsiah-ê uē lóng kì tī sim-lāi.
English: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth. He was subject to them, and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

Tailo: Lí tī tshân-.ni̍h siu-kuah ngó͘-kok, nā bē kì-tit tsi̍t-sok tī tshân-.ni̍h, m̄-thang koh uat-khì the̍h, tio̍h lâu hō͘ tshut-guā lâng kah ko͘-jî, kuáⁿ-hū, án-ne Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ē tī lí ê tshiú só͘ tsò it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, kā lí sù-hok.
English: When you reap your harvest in your field, and have forgot a sheaf in the field, you shall not go again to get it: it shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, and for the widow; that Yahweh your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.

Tailo: Lâng nā tshuā bó͘ suà tshuā bó͘ ê lāu-bú, to̍h-sī ki̍k pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h īng hué kā tsit saⁿ-ê lâng sio sí, bián-tit lín tiong-kan ū tsit khuán ê pháiⁿ hîng-uî.
English: If a man takes a wife and her mother, it is wickedness: they shall be burned with fire, both he and they; that there may be no wickedness among you.

Tailo: Ông tsiū tshe lâng tsū-tsi̍p Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm ê tsìng tiúⁿ-ló.
English: Then the king sent and gathered together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn ua̍h-tauh-á pia̍k tsi̍t ē tsiū lâi-kàu tsuân sè-kài lâng só͘ tuà ê ta̍k só͘-tsāi.
English: For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.

Tailo: M̄-koh, sin-lông ìn kóng, ' Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, guá m̄-bat lín. '
English: But he answered, Most assuredly I tell you, I don't know you.'

Tailo: Lēbī tsiū pàng-sak it-tshè, khí-lâi tuè Iésu.
English: He left everything, and rose up and followed him.

Tailo: Moltékái kì-tsài hiah-ê tāi-tsì, koh siá phue hō͘ Ahasuiló͘ ông ta̍k síng hn̄g-kīn só͘-ū ê Iôtah lâng,
English: Mordecai wrote these things, and sent letters to all the Jews who were in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus, both near and far,

Tailo: Tio̍h bîng-tshat siáⁿ-mi̍h sī Tsú só͘ huann-hí ê tāi-tsì.
English: proving what is well pleasing to the Lord.

Tailo: In-uī lín lóng sī kng-bîng ê lâng, sī ji̍t-sî ê lâng; lán m̄-sī sio̍k tī àm-sî, mā m̄-sī sio̍k tī o͘-àm.
English: You are all children of light, and children of the day. We don't belong to the night, nor to darkness,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tio̍h kā hit tsiah ua̍h-tsiáu pàng tī siâⁿ guā ê suaⁿ-.ni̍h, án-ne kā hit king tshù sio̍k-tsuē, hit king tshù tsiū tshing-khì.
English: but he shall let the living bird go out of the city into the open field. So shall he make atonement for the house; and it shall be clean.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá kah lí í-ki̍p lí ê kang-hô tsò tuì-ti̍k, hō͘ Aigi̍p tē tuì Su-be-neh ê thah, it-ti̍t kàu Kú-si̍t ê kau-kài, tsuân-pō͘ hong-huì, hi-bî.
English: therefore, behold, I am against you, and against your rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt an utter waste and desolation, from the tower of Seveneh even to the border of Ethiopia.

Tailo: nn̄g tsiah gû-káng, gō͘ tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò siā-un-tsè. Tsiah-ê sī Pa-ta-tsul ê kiáⁿ Gâmáliel ê lé-mi̍h.
English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

Tailo: Án-ne, tī tuā-bo̍k-tsiá hián-hiān ê sî, lín tsiah ē tit-tio̍h bē sit-khì kong-tshái ê îng-kuan.
English: When the chief Shepherd is revealed, you will receive the crown of glory that doesn't fade away.

Tailo: Mô͘se guān-ì kah hit-ê lâng tuà, i tsiū kā i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Tsi̍p-pho-la̍h kè hō͘ Mô͘se.
English: Moses was content to dwell with the man. He gave Moses Zipporah, his daughter.

Tailo: Kuán-ke kóng, Taⁿ tsiū tsiàu lín ê uē lâi tsò, tī siáⁿ lâng hia tshiau-.tio̍h, hit-ê lâng tsiū tsò guá ê lô͘-po̍k, kî-tha ê lóng bô tsuē.
English: He said, Now also let it be according to your words: he with whom it is found will be my bondservant; and you will be blameless.

Tailo: Iésu kóng suah, tsiū tuì in pûn-khuì, kóng, Lín niá-siū Sìng Sîn.
English: When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them, Receive the Holy Spirit!

Tailo: Manouah kā i ê bó͘ kóng, Lán it-tīng ē sí, in-uī lán ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú.
English: Manoah said to his wife, We shall surely die, because we have seen God.

Tailo: Tsit ji̍t sī lín tshut-.lâi ê ji̍t, sī tī A-pit-gue̍h tiong-kan.
English: This day you go forth in the month Abib.

Tailo: Lín só͘ tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē, nā bô tshing-khì, tsiū thang kuè-lâi Siōngtsú ê tē ê sán-gia̍p, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú huē-bō͘ só͘ tiàm ê só͘-tsāi, tī guán tiong-kan tit-tio̍h gia̍p. Tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang puē-gi̍k Siōngtsú, mā m̄-thang puē-gi̍k guán, m̄-thang tī Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè ê tuâⁿ í-guā, uī ka-kī koh khí tuâⁿ.
English: However, if the land of your possession be unclean, then pass over to the land of the possession of Yahweh, in which Yahweh's tent dwells, and take possession among us: but don't rebel against Yahweh, nor rebel against us, in building you an altar besides the altar of Yahweh our God.

Tailo: In ê tshù ū kuí-tsà muá-muá, sī tshin-tshiūnn tsiáu-lang lāi ū tsiáu-á muá-muá; só͘-í, in tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā koh hó-gia̍h.
English: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and grew rich.

Tailo: Tsò ting-tâi kah tse it-tshè ê khì-kū, īng sûn-kim tsi̍t tha-lan-t.
English: It shall be made of a talent of pure gold, with all these accessories.

Tailo: Ū tsai-eh ah! Lí tsit-ê tshiúⁿ-tua̍t lâng ê, ka-kī bô siū tshiúⁿ-tua̍t; tsò tāi-tsì kuí-tsà ê, lâng bô īng kuí-tsà khuán-thāi lí. Lí tshiúⁿ-tua̍t tú-á suah, ka-kī ē siū tshiúⁿ-tua̍t; lí kiânn kuí-tsà tú-á suah, lâng ē īng kuí-tsà khuán-thāi lí.
English: Woe to you who destroy, but you weren't destroyed; And who betray, but nobody betrayed you! When you have finished destroying, you will be destroyed; And when you have made an end of betrayal, you will be betrayed.

Tailo: Ū lâng tsi̍t-sì-lâng sim thòng-khó͘, lóng m̄-bat tam-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Another dies in bitterness of soul, And never tastes of good.

Tailo: Tú-hó tī Iésu ê bīn-tsîng ū tsi̍t-ê kó͘-tiòng-pēⁿ ê lâng.
English: Behold, a certain man who had dropsy was in front of him.

Tailo: Bîn-á-tsài tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, īng hué té tī hit lāi-bīn, hē hiuⁿ tī hit tíng-bīn; Siōngtsú só͘ kíng-suán ê lâng, i beh tsò sìng; lín Lēbī ê kiáⁿ-sun tshiàm-kuân!
English: and put fire in them, and put incense on them before Yahweh tomorrow: and it shall be that the man whom Yahweh does choose, he shall be holy: you take too much on you, you sons of Levi.

Tailo: in tuì tsit tso̍k kiâⁿ kàu hit tso̍k, tuì tsit kok kiâⁿ kàu pa̍t-ê jîn-bîn.
English: They went about from nation to nation, From one kingdom to another people.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k pak-lāi kah thuí, tio̍h īng tsuí sé tshing-khì, tsè-si tio̍h kā tsuân-pō͘ lóng hiàn, sio tī tuâⁿ tíng. Tse sī sio-tsè, hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè.
English: but the innards and the legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall offer the whole, and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Yahweh.

Tailo: Páulô tsiū ìn kóng, Lín ná ē thî-khàu lâi hō͘ guá ê sim huân? Guá uī-tio̍h Tsú Iésu ê miâ, m̄-nā siū pa̍k, sīm-tsì sí tī Êlúsalèm mā kam-guān.
English: Then Paul answered, What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.

Tailo: Hit-ê siàu-liân lâng tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì, lóng bô iân-tshiân, in-uī i ài Iâkop ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, jî-tshiánn i tī in lāu-pē ê ke siōng tsun-kuì.
English: The young man didn't wait to do this thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter, and he was honored above all the house of his father.

Tailo: Lēbī lâng Kohat kiáⁿ-sun ê tsong-tso̍k, to̍h-sī Kohat kî-tha ê kiáⁿ-sun, liam-khau só͘ tit-tio̍h ê siâⁿ sī tuì Ehulaim tsi-tso̍k tiong-kan pun tshut-.lâi ê.
English: The families of the children of Kohath, the Levites, even the rest of the children of Kohath, they had the cities of their lot out of the tribe of Ephraim.

Tailo: Iôtah, lí ê hiann-tī beh o-ló lí; lí ê tshiú beh tshi̍h tuì-ti̍k ê ām-kún; lí ê lāu-pē ê kiáⁿ beh phak-pài tī lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Judah, your brothers will praise you: Your hand will be on the neck of your enemies; Your father's sons will bow down before you.

Tailo: Guán sī tsa̍p-jī-ê hiann-tī, sī guán lāu-pē ê kiáⁿ; ū tsi̍t-ê sí-.khì, siōng sè-hàn ê hiān-kim kah guán lāu-pē tī Ka-nân tē. '
English: We are twelve brothers, sons of our father; one is no more, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.'

Tailo: Só͘lômóng ông tsò Isulael jîn-bîn ê ông.
English: King Solomon was king over all Israel.

Tailo: Án-ne, Guá beh īng siū-khì kah tuā siū-khì, í-ki̍p giâm-giâm ê tsik-pī, tī lí ê tiong-kan kā lí sím-phuàⁿ. Hit sî, lí tsiū ē tī sì-kho͘-uî ê lia̍t pang tiong, tsiâⁿ-tsò thang lîng-jio̍k, thang khau-sé, thang kàm-kài, thang tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì ê. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: So it shall be a reproach and a taunt, an instruction and an astonishment, to the nations that are round about you, when I shall execute judgments on you in anger and in wrath, and in wrathful rebukes; ( I, Yahweh, have spoken it; )

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsai-iáⁿ Siōngtsú tiāⁿ-tio̍h ē siat-li̍p i tsò Isulael ông, koh uī-tio̍h I ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng lâi hing-khí I ê kok.
English: David perceived that Yahweh had established him king over Israel, and that he had exalted his kingdom for his people Israel's sake.

Tailo: Kā só͘ phah ê nn̄g tiâu liān-á ê siang thâu, liân tī nn̄g-ê tsô, an-tì tī tsè-si ho̍k phi-kian ê thâu-tsîng.
English: The other two ends of the two braided chains you shall put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod in the forepart of it.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn Lí ū tshe-phài guá ji̍p sè-kan, guá mā ū tshe-phài in ji̍p sè-kan.
English: As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world.

Tailo: In-uī ji̍t kīn à, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú ê ji̍t kīn à, to̍h-sī ba̍t hûn ê ji̍t, beh tsò lia̍t kok ê sî-kî.
English: For the day is near, even the day of Yahweh is near; it shall be a day of clouds, a time of the nations.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù Isulael lâng kóng, nā ū tsa-bó͘ lâng huâi-īn seⁿ tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ, i tsiū bô tshing-khì tshit ji̍t kah tī king-kî lāi lah-sap ê ji̍t bô tshing-khì sio-siâng.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, saying, If a woman conceives, and bears a male child, then she shall be unclean seven days; as in the days of her monthly period she shall be unclean.

Tailo: Láu-tuā kah tsun-kuì ê lâng to̍h-sī thâu, īng pe̍h-tsha̍t uē kà-sī lâng ê sian-ti to̍h-sī bué.
English: The elder and the honorable man is the head, And the prophet who teaches lies is the tail.

Tailo: Koh kóng, Kā tsit-ê ai-ko kà-sī Iôtah lâng, tsit-ê ai-ko miâ kiò-tsò Kiong kua , siá tī tsìng-ti̍t lâng si-kua tsi̍p. Kua án-ne siá:
English: ( and he bade them teach the children of Judah the song of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jashar ) :

Tailo: Isulael lâng kiû-kiò Siōngtsú ê sî, Siōngtsú tsiū kā Isulael lâng hing-khí tsi̍t-ê hiàn-sin-tsiá lâi kiù in, to̍h-sī Ka-le̍p ê sió-tī Kenájuh ê kiáⁿ Otniel.
English: When the children of Israel cried to Yahweh, Yahweh raised up a savior to the children of Israel, who saved them, even Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother.

Tailo: Lín lāu-bú sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Sī bó ê sai, phak tī tsiah-ê sai ê tiong-kan, tī sè-tsiah sai ê tiong-kan, iúⁿ-tshī i ê kiáⁿ.
English: and say, What was your mother? A lioness: she couched among lions, in the midst of the young lions she nourished her cubs.

Tailo: In mā ē tshuā tsin tsē lâng khí-lâi kong-kik lí, īng tsio̍h-thâu kā lí tìm-sí, īng to-kiàm tsha̍k-thàu lí,
English: They shall also bring up a company against you, and they shall stone you with stones, and thrust you through with their swords.

Tailo: Hit-ê Huilīsū lâng kā Tabi̍t kóng, Guá kám sī káu, lí tsiah gia̍h kuái-á lâi guá tsia? Huilīsū lâng tsiū kí ka-kī ê sîn-bîng, kā Tabi̍t tsiù-tsó͘.
English: The Philistine said to David, Am I a dog, that you come to me with sticks? The Philistine cursed David by his gods.

Tailo: Hiah-ê bih tī Ehulaim suaⁿ-tē ê Isulael lâng, thiaⁿ-tio̍h Huilīsū lâng tô-tsáu, in tsiū tshut-.lâi, jiok uá-lâi in ê āu-bīn, lâi kau-tsiàn.
English: Likewise all the men of Israel who had hid themselves in the hill country of Ephraim, when they heard that the Philistines fled, even they also followed hard after them in the battle.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lâng kiânn tī lín ê tíng-bīn, to̍h-sī Guá ê tsú-bîn — Isulael. In ē tit-tio̍h lí, lí ē tsò in ê sán-gia̍p; lí mā bô koh hō͘ in tsua̍t-sû.
English: Yes, I will cause men to walk on you, even my people Israel; and they shall possess you, and you shall be their inheritance, and you shall no more henceforth bereave them of children.

Tailo: Tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ tiàu-tsi̍p tsìng bûn-tô͘ lâi, tuì in kóng, Guán kā Siōngtè ê tō-lí pàng hē-.leh., lâi pān-lí ji̍t-siông sing-ua̍h ê phuè-kip, pīng bô sik-ha̍p.
English: The twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples and said, It is not appropriate for us to forsake the word of God and serve tables.

Tailo: Guá koh kā lín kóng, lín tiong-kan nā ū nn̄g lâng tī tē-tsiūⁿ tâng-sim ha̍p-ì lâi kî-kiû, guá ê Thiⁿ-pē it-tīng ē kā in sîng-tsuân.
English: Again, assuredly I tell you, that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah kóng, Bē lah. Kiû lí thiaⁿ guá tuì lí só͘ kóng Siōngtsú ê uē, án-ne lí tsiū ē tit-tio̍h lī-ik, lí ê sèⁿ-miā mā ē pó-tsûn.
English: But Jeremiah said, They shall not deliver you. Obey, I beg you, the voice of Yahweh, in that which I speak to you: so it shall be well with you, and your soul shall live.

Tailo: Guán mê-ji̍t pik-tshiat kî-tó, ài beh kìⁿ-tio̍h lín ê bīn, lâi pó͘-tsiok lín sìn-sim bô kàu-gia̍h ê só͘-tsāi.
English: night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face, and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith?

Tailo: Tsū guá sè-hàn ê sî, tuì-ti̍k tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kā guá khó͘-to̍k, tsóng-.sī, in m̄-bat iâⁿ guá.
English: Many times they have afflicted me from my youth up, Yet they have not prevailed against me.

Tailo: Tiān lāi, Só͘lômóng lóng īng sûn-kim lâi an; āu-tiān ê thâu-tsîng khan kim liān-á, mā īng sûn-kim lâi an.
English: So Solomon overlaid the house within with pure gold: and he drew chains of gold across before the oracle; and he overlaid it with gold.

Tailo: Amátsiah thâi Etóm lâng tò tńg-.lâi, tsiū tuà Seil tso̍k hiah-ê sîn-bîng, li̍p i tsò ka-kī ê sîn-bîng, tī i ê bīn-tsîng kuī-pài, sio hiuⁿ hō͘ i.
English: Now it happened, after that Amaziah was come from the slaughter of the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the children of Seir, and set them up to be his gods, and bowed down himself before them, and burned incense to them.

Tailo: Guān Siōngtè suá I ê kuái-á lī-khui guá, bô īng I ê ui-giâm hō͘ guá kiaⁿ.
English: Let him take his rod away from me, Let his terror not make me afraid:

Tailo: Só͘-í, i tsiū tsáu tsò tsîng, peh khí-lih tsi̍t tsâng sng-tsâi tshiū, beh khuànn Iésu tuì hia king-kuè.
English: He ran on ahead, and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was to pass that way.

Tailo: Asah tsiū kā Siōngtsú sìng-tiān ê kim-khò͘ kah ông-kiong ê kim-khò͘, só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê kim-gîn lóng kau hō͘ i ê lô͘-po̍k. Asah ông tshe in kàu tuà tī Ta-má-su-ko ê Alâm ông Hi-sûn ê sun, Tha-pik-lī-bún ê kiáⁿ Bian ha-tat hia, kóng,
English: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the king's house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants; and king Asa sent them to Ben Hadad, the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who lived at Damascus, saying,

Tailo: In tú-á tshiùⁿ kua o-ló ê sî, Siōngtsú tsiū phài bâi-ho̍k ê ping kong-kik hiah-ê lâi kong-kik Iôtah ê Ammóng, Mô͘ap kah Seil suaⁿ ê lâng, in tsiū siū phah.
English: When they began to sing and to praise, Yahweh set ambushers against the children of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir, who had come against Judah; and they were struck.

Tailo: Iâkop khuàⁿ-tio̍h Aigi̍p ū ngó͘-kok, tsiū kā i hiah-ê kiáⁿ kóng, Lín án-tsuáⁿ teh sio-khuànn?
English: Now Jacob saw that there was grain in Egypt, and Jacob said to his sons, Why do you look at one another?

Tailo: Só͘lômóng mā kā Siōngtsú tiān tsîng īⁿ tiong hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, tī hia hiàn sio-tsè kah siā-un-tsè ê iû, in-uī Só͘lômóng só͘ bat tsō ê tâng-tuâⁿ bô kàu-gia̍h iông-ín hiah-ê sio-tsè, sò͘-tsè kah iû-lâ.
English: Moreover Solomon made the middle of the court holy that was before the house of Yahweh; for there he offered the burnt offerings, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the brazen altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt offering, and the meal offering, and the fat.

Tailo: I kā in ê lông-sán-bu̍t kau hō͘ thâng-thuā, kā in lô-khó͘ tit-tio̍h ê mi̍h kau hō͘ tsháu-me̍h.
English: He gave also their increase to the caterpillar, And their labor to the locust.

Tailo: I tsiū kah in kiânn kan-îm, to̍h-sī kah i só͘ ì-ài ê Asiul lâng; kiàn-nā i só͘ luân-ài ê, tsiū īng in it-tshè ê ngó͘-siōng lâi kā ka-kī uè lah-sap.
English: She bestowed her prostitution on them, the choicest men of Assyria all of them; and on whoever she doted, with all their idols she defiled herself.

Tailo: Àm-sî, Siōngtè tī ī-siōng ê tiong-kan kā Isulael kóng, Iâkop, Iâkop! I kóng, Guá tī tsia.
English: God spoke to Israel in the visions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob! He said, Here I am.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì hn̄g-hn̄g tshú guá ê tì-sik, kā gī kui hō͘ tshòng-tsō guá ê Siōngtè.
English: I will get my knowledge from afar, And will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in bô thiaⁿ Mô͘se ê uē, ū lâng lâu kàu keh kang tsá-khí, tsiū seⁿ thâng huat-tshut tshàu-bī; Mô͘se tuì in siū-khì.
English: Notwithstanding they didn't listen to Moses, but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and became foul: and Moses was angry with them.

Tailo: Siōngtè kā Iâkop kóng, Khí-.lâi! Khì Bethel, tuà tī hia, koh tio̍h tī hia kā Siōngtè khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ; to̍h-sī lí siám-phiah lí ê a-hiaⁿ Esáu ê bīn ê sî, tuì lí tshut-hiān ê hit uī.
English: God said to Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel, and live there. Make there an altar to God, who appeared to you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother.

Tailo: I koh īng siông tshiū tshâ tsò siang pîng ê mn̂g-sìⁿ, tsit pîng mn̂g ê nn̄g sìⁿ ē áu-tit, hit pîng mn̂g ê nn̄g sìⁿ mā ē áu-tit.
English: and two doors of fir wood: the two leaves of the one door were folding, and the two leaves of the other door were folding.

Tailo: Thiaⁿ tio̍h tsiah-ê uē ê bîn-tsiòng, liân thiu-suè ê lâng mā lóng sîng-jīn Siōngtè sī kong-gī, in-uī in lóng ū niá-siū Iô-há-neh ê sé-lé.
English: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John's baptism.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ tuì Bē-tha-niah tshut-.lâi ê sî, Iésu pak-tó͘ iau.
English: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.

Tailo: Ioap ê lâng kah Ke-le-thih lâng, Be-le-thi lâng kah tsìng ióng-sū, lóng tshut-khì tuè Abisai, tuì Êlúsalèm tshut-.khì, jiok Biklih ê kiáⁿ Síbah.
English: There went out after him Joab's men, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men; and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí kā Alông kóng, ' Lí ê tshiú gia̍h kuái-á, tshun tī kang, hô kah tî ê tíng-bīn, hō͘ tshân-kap-á khí-lâi Aigi̍p tē. '
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Tell Aaron, Stretch forth your hand with your rod over the rivers, over the streams, and over the pools, and cause frogs to come up on the land of Egypt.'

Tailo: Lín suî-jiân m̄-bat khuàⁿ-kuè Iésu, mā teh thiàⁿ I; tsit-má suî-jiân bô khuànn-kìnn I, mā iáu-koh teh sìn I. Lín ū īng giân-gí bô huat-tō͘ piáu-ta̍t ê hí-lo̍k,
English: whom not having known you love; in whom, though now you don't see him, yet believing, you rejoice greatly with joy unspeakable and full of glory

Tailo: Tshâi-lông ē tī iâⁿ-pâng háu, suann-káu ē tī i iàn-lo̍k ê kiong-tiān háu. Babúlông tuā tsai-lān ê sî kīn là! I ê ji̍t-tsí í-king bô kú-tn̂g!
English: Wolves will cry in their castles, and jackals in the pleasant palaces. Her time is near to come, and her days will not be prolonged.

Tailo: Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ koh lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm. Iésu tī tiān lāi teh kiâⁿ ê sî, hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ, king-ha̍k kàu-su kah tiúⁿ-ló lâi tshuē Iésu,
English: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him,

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Tsit-ê jîn-bîn khuànn-khin Guá ē kàu tang sî? Guá tī in tiong-kan kiânn tse it-tshè ê sîn-jiah, in iáu-koh m̄-sìn Guá, beh kàu tang-sî?
English: Yahweh said to Moses, How long will this people despise me? and how long will they not believe in me, for all the signs which I have worked among them?

Tailo: Jiânāu mn̄g kûn-tsiòng kóng, An-hioh-ji̍t tsò hó tāi-tsì á-.sī tsò pháiⁿ tāi-tsì; kiù lâng ê sèⁿ-miā á-.sī hāi lâng ê sèⁿ-miā, tó tsi̍t hāng khah ha̍p-huat? In lóng tiām-tiām bô ìn puàⁿ-kù.
English: He said to them, Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill? But they were silent.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ji̍p-khì tuā tsûn ê, lóng sī ū kang ū bó ê jio̍k-thé, tú tsiàu Siōngtè só͘ bīng-līng ê. Siōngtsú tsiū kā in kuainn tī tuā tsûn lāi.
English: Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; and Yahweh shut him in.

Tailo: Lí ê tì-huī thang o-ló, lí pún-sin mā thang o-ló, in-uī lí kin-á-ji̍t tsó͘-tòng guá huān-tio̍h thâi-sí-lâng ê tsuē, bô īng ka-kī ê tshiú pò ka-kī ê siû-ti̍k.
English: and blessed be your discretion, and blessed be you, that have kept me this day from blood guiltiness, and from avenging myself with my own hand.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tshin-tshiūnn tì-huī ê lâng? Siáⁿ lâng tsai sū-tsîng ê khui-thiah? Lâng ê tì-huī hō͘ i ê bīn ū kng, mā hō͘ i kong-kiông ê bīn tit-tio̍h kái-uāⁿ.
English: Who is like the wise man? And who knows the interpretation of a thing? A man's wisdom makes his face shine, and the hardness of his face is changed.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h thò bé-tshia, khiâ bé! Tì thâu-khue khiā khí-.lâi, buâ tshiuⁿ, tshīng tsiàn-kah!
English: Harness the horses, and get up, you horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail.

Tailo: I ê sèⁿ-miā tsiap-kīn tshim kheⁿ; i ê ua̍h-miā kīn tī hiah-ê bia̍t-bông sèⁿ-miā ê.
English: Yes, his soul draws near to the pit, And his life to the destroyers.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē siúⁿ-sù hó mi̍h; lán ê thó͘-tē ē tshut i ê lông-sán-bu̍t.
English: Yes, Yahweh will give that which is good. Our land will yield its increase.

Tailo: I ē thiàⁿ lí, kā lí sù-hok, hō͘ lí hing-ōng, mā ē tī I tuì lí ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tē, kā lí sù-hok lí ê thai só͘ seⁿ ê, lí ê tē só͘ tshut ê kah lí ê ngó͘-kok, lí ê tsiú, lí ê iû, í-ki̍p lí ê gû kah lí ê iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ.
English: and he will love you, and bless you, and multiply you; he will also bless the fruit of your body and the fruit of your ground, your grain and your new wine and your oil, the increase of your livestock and the young of your flock, in the land which he swore to your fathers to give you.

Tailo: Kiáⁿ-jî khioh tshâ, lāu-pē hiâⁿ hué, tsa-bó͘ lâng tshiau mī tsò piáⁿ, hiàn hō͘ thian-hō͘, koh tuì pa̍t tsióng ê sîn-bîng kuàn-tiān, in beh kik Guá siū-khì.
English: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead the dough, to make cakes to the queen of the sky, and to pour out drink offerings to other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.

Tailo: Līng-guā tsi̍t-ê bûn-tô͘, to̍h-sī Símòng Piattò͘ ê sió-tī An-to-le̍h, kā Iésu kóng,
English: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, said to him,

Tailo: Lí bat kòng tshuì go̍k-hî ê thâu-khak, hō͘ khòng-iá ê iá-siù tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: You broke the heads of Leviathan in pieces. You gave him as food to people and desert creatures.

Tailo: Iésu tē-saⁿ pái kā i mn̄g, Iô-há-neh ê kiáⁿ Símòng, lí ū pí tsiah-ê khah thiàⁿ guá bô? Piattò͘ in-uī Iésu tē-saⁿ pái án-ne mn̄g, tsiū tsin iu-būn, kā Iésu kóng, Tsú ah, Lí ta̍k hāng lóng tsai, Lí tsai guá ū thiàⁿ Lí. Iésu kā i kóng, Lí tio̍h iúⁿ-tshī guá hiah-ê iûⁿ.
English: He said to him the third time, Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me? Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, Do you have affection for me? He said to him, Lord, you know everything. You know that I have affection for you. Jesus said to him, Feed my sheep.

Tailo: I tsi̍t ē khuànn, tsiū khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū piáⁿ tī hué-thuàⁿ ê tíng-bīn teh piak, koh ū tsi̍t pân tsuí tī i ê thâu-khak piⁿ, i tsiū tsia̍h tsiū lim, jiân-āu koh tó lo̍h-.khì.
English: He looked, and behold, there was at his head a cake baked on the coals, and a jar of water. He ate and drink, and laid him down again.

Tailo: Sì-kè kóng lâng ê tn̂g-té ê lâng lāu-sia̍p pì-bi̍t; sim sîng-si̍t ê lâng kā tāi-tsì ún-ba̍t.
English: One who brings gossip betrays a confidence, But one who is of a trustworthy spirit is one who keeps a secret.

Tailo: Thê-ô͘, hô-ti ē tit-tio̍h i tsò sán-gia̍p; niau-thâu-ing, o͘-a ē tiàm tī hit tiong-kan. I ē kā hong-huì ê tsún-tsîn, hūn-tūn ê tuī-suàⁿ, khan tī i ê tíng-bīn.
English: But the pelican and the porcupine will possess it. The owl and the raven will dwell in it. He will stretch the line of confusion over it, And the plumb line of emptiness.

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng tsiū huat-sing tsiàn-tsing, Mîkháel tshuā i ê sù-tsiá khì kah liông kau-tsiàn, lîng mā tshuā i ê sù-tsiá khí-lâi ìng-tsiàn.
English: There was war in the sky. Michael and his angels made war on the dragon. The dragon and his angels made war.

Tailo: Uī tsheⁿ-hūn lâng tam-pó, tio̍h the̍h hit lâng ê saⁿ lâi tí-ah; uī ki-lí tsò pó-tsìng, tio̍h ka-kī tam-tng tsik-jīm.
English: Take his garment when he puts up collateral for a stranger; Hold it for a wayward woman!

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Lín tshàu-hīⁿ-lâng ê tio̍h thiaⁿ! Lín tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tio̍h khuànn? Thang hō͘ lín ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Hear, you deaf, And look, you blind, That you may see.

Tailo: Kiám-tshái Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè thiaⁿ-tio̍h Lap-siá-keh ê uē, to̍h-sī i ê tsú Asiul ông tshe i lâi bú-bān íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtsú ê uē, kiám-tshái Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè uī-tio̍h thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, tsiū ē kā i tsik-pī, só͘-í, kiû lí uī-tio̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn tshut siaⁿ kî-tó. '
English: It may be Yahweh your God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master has sent to defy the living God, and will rebuke the words which Yahweh your God has heard. Therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.

Tailo: Tsuí ē kā tsio̍h-thâu buâ tiāu; tuā-tsuí ē kā tē-tsiūⁿ ê thô͘ tshiong tiāu; Lí mā án-ne teh tsua̍t lâng ê ǹg-bāng.
English: The waters wear the stones; The torrents of it wash away the dust of the earth: So you destroy the hope of man.

Tailo: Ki-lō͘-ping tshut-khì ê sî tsiū thí-khui si̍t, tī guá ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tuì thô͘-kha tsiūⁿ-.khì, lián mā tī in ê sin piⁿ, thîng tī Siōngtsú ê tiān tang-mn̂g ê mn̂g-kháu. Tī in ê tíng-bīn, ū Isulael Siōngtè ê îng-kng.
English: The cherubim lifted up their wings, and mounted up from the earth in my sight when they went forth, and the wheels beside them: and they stood at the door of the east gate of Yahweh's house; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.

Tailo: I ē tsiáng-kuân tuì tsit-ê hái kàu hit-ê hái, tuì tuā hô it-ti̍t kàu tē-ki̍k.
English: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, From the River to the ends of the earth.

Tailo: Guá tsiū siūⁿ-khí Tsú só͘ kóng ê uē, ' Iô-há-neh īng tsuí kā lín sé-lé, m̄-koh lín ē niá-siū Sìng Sîn ê sé-lé. '
English: I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit.'

Tailo: Tio̍h khǹg lô͘-po̍k tio̍h sūn-ho̍k tsú-lâng, ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì hō͘ in huann-hí, bô ìn-tshuì ìn-tsi̍h;
English: Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters, and to be well-pleasing in all things; not contradicting;

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Hit tong-sî, lâng ē kā Iôtah lia̍t ông ê kut-hâi, kuì-tso̍k ê kut-hâi, tsè-si ê kut-hâi, sian-ti ê kut-hâi kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn ê kut-hâi, lóng tuì bōng tiong the̍h tshut-.lâi,
English: At that time, says Yahweh, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves;

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā Aigi̍p tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ Babúlông ông — Nepkatnetsal, i ē lia̍h Aigi̍p ê jîn-bîn, tshiúⁿ i só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h, kiap i só͘ kiap ê mi̍h, tse tsiū thang tsò i ê kun-ping ê kang-tsînn.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Behold, I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and he shall carry off her multitude, and take her spoil, and take her prey; and it shall be the wages for his army.

Tailo: Lí ê sing-khu só͘ seⁿ ê, lí ê tē só͘ tshut ê, í-ki̍p gû ê gû-á kiáⁿ, iûⁿ ê iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ, lóng ē siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Cursed shall be the fruit of your body, and the fruit of your ground, the increase of your livestock, and the young of your flock.

Tailo: Lí sī hn̂g tiong ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ, ua̍h-tsuí ê tséⁿ, lí sī tuì Le-ba-nòng lâu lo̍h-.lâi ê khe tsuí.
English: A fountain of gardens, A well of living waters, Flowing streams from Lebanon. Beloved

Tailo: Tī siúⁿ-sù ua̍h-miā hō͘ bān-mi̍h ê Siōngtè kah tuì Pún-tiu Pí-lia̍p-to tsò bí-hó kiàn-tsìng ê Ki-tok Iésu bīn-tsîng, guá huan-hù lí,
English: I charge you before God, who gives life to all things, and before Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate testified the good confession,

Tailo: Gōng lâng ê sim-su ì-liām sī tsuē-ok, bú-bān ê lâng sī lâng só͘ thó-ià.
English: The schemes of folly are sin. The mocker is detested by men.

Tailo: Akhàtsuh kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsò-hué tsòng tī Tabi̍t ê siâⁿ. I ê kiáⁿ Hitsekia suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Ahaz slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, I it-tīng sù-hok tī lí ê bí-niûⁿ kah lí ê tsuí, Guá koh ē tû-khì lín tiong-kan ê phuà-pēⁿ.
English: You shall serve Yahweh your God, and he will bless your bread and your water, and I will take sickness away from your midst.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, I-é-lí-miah koh the̍h tsi̍t pún, kau hō͘ Nêléiù ê kiáⁿ — su-kì Palosih, i tsiū kā I-é-lí-miah só͘ thuân ê uē siá tī hit lāi-bīn, to̍h-sī Iôtah ông E-hō͘-iá-kim só͘ sio-khì hit pún só͘-ū ê uē, līng-guā koh thiⁿ tsin tsē luī-sū ê uē.
English: Then took Jeremiah another scroll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire; and there were added besides to them many like words.

Tailo: Lâi-kàu suaⁿ-.ni̍h ê sî, Gehatsih tuì in ê tshiú tsiap-.lâi, hē tī tshù lāi, tshe in khì, in tsiū khì.
English: When he came to the hill, he took them from their hand, and bestowed them in the house; and he let the men go, and they departed.

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, thong-kuè Siōngtè ê uē kah lâng ê kî-tó, tsiū tsiânn tsò sìng-kiat.
English: For it is sanctified through the word of God and prayer.

Tailo: Tabi̍t uī-tio̍h hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū tshe lâng khì thàm-thiaⁿ, ū lâng kóng, I kám m̄-sī E-li-àm ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, Hiat lâng Ulīa ê bó͘ Batseba?
English: David send and inquired after the woman. One said, Is not this Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?

Tailo: Kám lóng ū i-pēⁿ ê un-sù? Kám lóng ē kóng ta̍k tsióng ê uē-gí? Kám lóng ē huan-i̍k bô kāng ê uē-gí?
English: Do all have gifts of healings? Do all speak with various languages? Do all interpret?

Tailo: Tsiū m̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn tī Me-lí-bah ê sî ngē lín ê sim, m̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn tī khòng-iá ê Mak-sá hit tong-sî.
English: Don't harden your heart, as at Meribah, As in the day of Massah in the wilderness,

Tailo: In hn̄g-hn̄g khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iôséhuh. I iáu-buē kiâⁿ kàu in hia, in tsiū tsò-hué kè-bô͘ beh kā i hāi-sí.
English: They saw him afar off, and before he came near to them, they conspired against him to kill him.

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh mn̄g i, kóng, Tāi-tsì án-tsuáⁿ? Tshiáⁿ lí kā guá kóng. I ìn kóng, Jîn-bîn tuì tsiàn-tīn tô-tsáu, jîn-bîn tsin tsē tó-teh sí-.khì; Sàulô kah i ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan mā sí.
English: David said to him, How went the matter? Please tell me. He answered, The people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.

Tailo: Guá kā in hun-suànn khì tī lia̍t pang, kā in sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t kok ê sî, in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: They shall know that I am Yahweh, when I shall disperse them among the nations, and scatter them through the countries.

Tailo: I tsē-uī ê sî tsa̍p la̍k huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông kiōng gō͘-tsa̍p jī nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò E-kho-li-ah, sī Êlúsalèm lâng.
English: Sixteen years old was Uzziah when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Jechiliah, of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lâng só͘ tsò bē-kàu ê, Siōngtè lóng ē.
English: But he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lín sio̍k tī bô, lín ê só͘ tsò sio̍k tī khang-khang; hit-ê kíng-suán lín ê sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê.
English: Behold, you are of nothing, And your work is of nothing. He who chooses you is an abomination.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h khuànn guá lâi tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, īng tshiú am tshuì.
English: Look at me, and be astonished. Lay your hand on your mouth.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tshiáⁿ lí bīng-līng lâng, tī Le-ba-nòng kā guá tshò pik-hiuⁿ tshâ, guá ê lô͘-po̍k ē kah lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsò-hué tsò, guá mā ē tsiàu kiàn-nā lí só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê, kā lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê kang-tsînn kau hō͘ lí, in-uī lí tsai, tī guán tiong-kan bô lâng tshin-tshiūnn Sitòng lâng hiah gâu tshò tshiū.
English: Now therefore command you that they cut me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with your servants; and I will give you hire for your servants according to all that you shall say: for you know that there is not among us any who knows how to cut timber like the Sidonians.

Tailo: Guá sī lín tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī Abulahàm, Ísak, Iâkop ê Siōngtè. ' ( tsù, CAG 3:6 ) Mô͘se kiaⁿ kah phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, m̄-káⁿ khuànn.
English: I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.' Moses trembled, and dared not look.

Tailo: Tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī kah guá tông-tsāi, I bô pàng guá ka-kī tsi̍t-ê, in-uī guá put-sî teh tsò I só͘ huann-hí ê tāi-tsì.
English: He who sent me is with me. The Father hasn't left me alone, for I always do the things that are pleasing to him.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, Siōngtsú ê uē tī ī-siōng tiong lîm-kàu Abúlâm, kóng, Abúlâm, lí m̄-bián kiaⁿ, Guá sī lí ê tîn-pâi, sī lí ki̍k tuā ê pò-siúⁿ.
English: After these things the word of Yahweh came to Abram in a vision, saying, Don't be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your exceedingly great reward.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì to̍h-sī guá só͘ pâi-lia̍t tī lí ê bīn-tsîng ê tsiok-hok kah tsiù-tsó͘, tsiong-lâi ē kàu tī lí, lí tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ kuáⁿ lí kàu ê lia̍t kok tiong,
English: It shall happen, when all these things are come on you, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before you, and you shall call them to mind among all the nations, where Yahweh your God has driven you,

Tailo: Tī hit tiong-kan nā iáu tshun tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it, mā ē siū thun-bia̍t. Tshin-tshiūnn la̍t tshiū kah siōng tshiū, suî-jiân hông tshò khí-.lâi, tsóng-.sī, tshiū thâu iáu lâu-.leh; án-ne, ū tsit-ê sìng ê kiáⁿ-sun, to̍h-sī hit-ê tshiū thâu iáu lâu-.leh.
English: If there are yet a tenth in it, It also shall in turn be eaten up: As a terebinth, and as an oak, whose stock remains, when they are felled; So the holy seed is its stock.

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h lō͘ piⁿ ū tsi̍t tsâng bû-hua-kó tshiū, tsiū kiâⁿ uá-.khì, tshiū tíng lóng bô kué-tsí, tsí ū hio̍h-á niā-niā. Iésu tuì hit-tsâng tshiū kóng, Tuì tsit-má khí, lí íng-uán bē koh kiat kué-tsí. Hit tsâng bû-hua-kó tshiū suî-sî tsiū ta-.khì.
English: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he came to it, and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to it, Let there be no fruit from you forever! Immediately the fig tree withered away.

Tailo: Báu-tsheⁿ kui tshok, kám sī lí pa̍k ê? Tsham-tsheⁿ ê tuà kám sī lí tháu-khui ê?
English: Can you bind the cluster of the Pleiades, Or loosen the cords of Orion?

Tailo: Tshiùⁿ kua ê lâng tuì Êlúsalèm sì-kho͘-uî ê pîng-guân kah tuì Ne-to-huat ê tsng-thâu lâi tsū-tsi̍p,
English: The sons of the singers gathered themselves together, both out of the plain round about Jerusalem, and from the villages of the Netophathites;

Tailo: Guá m̄-bat kah hi-ké ê lâng tsò-hué tsē, mā bô kah ké-hó ê lâng tàu-tīn.
English: I have not sat with deceitful men, Neither will I go in with hypocrites.

Tailo: Huān-tsuē ê sîn-hûn, i ē sí. Kiáⁿ it-tīng bô tam-tng lāu-pē ê tsuē, lāu-pē mā bô tam-tng kiáⁿ ê tsuē. Gī lâng ê gī ē kui tī i ka-kī; pháiⁿ lâng ê pháiⁿ mā ē kui tī i ka-kī.
English: The soul who sins, he shall die: the son shall not bear the iniquity of the father, neither shall the father bear the iniquity of the son; the righteousness of the righteous shall be on him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be on him.

Tailo: Guān sù jím-nāi kah an-uì ê Siōngtè, hō͘ lín tāi-ke tâng-sim lâi ha̍k-si̍p Ki-tok Iésu ê bô͘-iūⁿ,
English: Now the God of patience and of encouragement grant you to be of the same mind one with another according to Christ Jesus,

Tailo: Siōngtè kóng, Tsuí tio̍h sing-thuàⁿ tsin tsē ū ua̍h-miā ê tōng-bu̍t, tsiáu pue tī tē ê tíng-bīn kah thinn-tíng ê kiong-tshong.
English: God said, Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of sky.

Tailo: I ê siang tshiú tshin-tshiūnn kim-khuân siuⁿ n̂g-gi̍k; i ê sing-khu tshin-tshiūnn tiau-khik ê tshiūⁿ-gê, sì-kho͘-uî siuⁿ nâ-pó-tsio̍h.
