English: His hands are like rings of gold set with beryl. His body is like ivory work overlaid with sapphires.

Tailo: Guán kā Siōngtè ìng-ín lán tsó͘-sian ê hok-im thuân hō͘ lín,
English: We bring you good news of the promise made to the fathers,

Tailo: M̄-thang huí-pòng kuaⁿ-hú, mā m̄-thang mē lí ê jîn-bîn ê sī-tuā.
English: You shall not blaspheme God, nor curse a ruler of your people.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, Hitsekia tiong-si̍t án-ne tsò í-āu, Asiul ông Senahkhelip khí-.lâi, lâi tshim-ji̍p Iôtah, tsat iâⁿ uî-khùn tsiah-ê kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, siūⁿ beh tsing-ho̍k lâi tsò ka-kī ê.
English: After these things, and this faithfulness, Sennacherib king of Assyria came, and entered into Judah, and encamped against the fortified cities, and thought to win them for himself.

Tailo: Hit sî, koh ū tsi̍t tsiah tshiah-sik ê bé tshut-.lâi, khiâ bé ê lâng ū niá-siū kuân-pìng, thang tuì tē-tsiūⁿ tshiúⁿ-tua̍t hô-pîng, hō͘ jîn-luī hō͘-siong sat-hāi; i koh ū niá-siū tsi̍t ki tuā ki kiàm.
English: Another came forth, a red horse. To him who sat on it was given power to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another. There was given to him a great sword.

Tailo: Ting-tâi thiāu ū sì-ê pue, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn hīng-hue, ū i ê ki kah i ê hue.
English: In the lampstand were four cups made like almond blossoms, its buds and its flowers;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tuà tī Gi-bóng ê jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iosiúah tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ kah Ai siânn só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì,
English: But when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and to Ai,

Tailo: Tē tshim ê só͘-tsāi tī I ê tshiú tiong tsiáng-kuán; ki̍k kuân ê suaⁿ-tsiam mā sio̍k tī I.
English: In his hand are the deep places of the earth. The heights of the mountains are also his.

Tailo: Siōngtè ū tsín-kiù gī lâng Lótoh, in-uī i tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ uī-tio̍h siâ-ok îm-luān ê lâng lâi tshim-tshim iu-būn.
English: and delivered righteous Lot, who was very distressed by the lustful life of the wicked

Tailo: Guān jîn-bîn ē kìng-uì Lí nî kú gue̍h tshim, it-ti̍t kàu bān-sè-tāi.
English: They shall fear you while the sun endures; And as long as the moon, throughout all generations.

Tailo: I tuì hit-ê liân-tiúⁿ tsai-iáⁿ Iésu í-king sí-.khì, tsiū ín-tsún kā sin-si kau hō͘ Iôséhuh.
English: When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.

Tailo: Tio̍h tshiùnn si-kua, iô lin-long-kó͘, tuâⁿ hó thiaⁿ ê khîm kah sik.
English: Raise a song, and bring here the tambourine, The pleasant lyre with the harp.

Tailo: In-uī siâ-ok tshin-tshiūnn hué teh to̍h, sio-bia̍t tshì-phè kah tsi̍t-lê, koh to̍h tī ām-ām ê tshiū-nâ, tsiâⁿ-tsò ian-thiāu, tńg-se̍h tshìng tsiûⁿ thiⁿ.
English: For wickedness burns like a fire. It devours the briers and thorns; Yes, it kindles in the thickets of the forest, And they roll upward in a column of smoke.

Tailo: Nā tsa-bó͘ lâng bô hông uè lah-sap, si̍t-tsāi sī tshing-khì, tsiū bián siū tsai-hō, koh ē huâi-īn.
English: If the woman isn't defiled, but is clean; then she shall be free, and shall conceive seed.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h the̍h tām-po̍h-á pó͘ kuè-si̍t tsè ê hueh, buah tī ài tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng tsiànn pîng ê hīnn-á-suê kah tsiàⁿ tshiú ê tuā-thâu-bú, í-ki̍p tsiàⁿ-kha ê tuā-thâu-bú.
English: The priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering, and the priest shall put it on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

Tailo: I ê kuân-pìng tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā, tsóng-.sī, m̄-sī tuì ka-kī ê kuân-pìng; i ē kiânn hui-siông ê huí-bia̍t, mā ē hing-thong, koh tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù lâi kiâⁿ, koh ē huí-bia̍t ū kuân-li̍k ê kah sìng ê tsú-bîn.
English: His power shall be mighty, but not by his own power; and he shall destroy wonderfully, and shall prosper and do his pleasure; and he shall destroy the mighty ones and the holy people.

Tailo: La̍hban kā i kóng, Guá nā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, tshiáⁿ lí kah guá tuà, in-uī guá tshim tsai Siōngtsú sù guá hok-khì, sī in-uī lí ê iân-kò͘.
English: Laban said to him, If now I have found favor in your eyes, stay here, for I have divined that Yahweh has blessed me for your sake.

Tailo: Tsit-ê kiān-tsuân ê kàu-gī sī kin-kì hit uī lán tio̍h o-ló ê Siōngtè só͘ kau-thok hō͘ guá ê îng-kng ê hok-im.
English: according to the Good News of the glory of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.

Tailo: I ē īng tì-huī kà-sī siáⁿ lâng? Ē hō͘ siáⁿ lâng bîng-pi̍k i só͘ thuân ê? Kám sī hit khuán tú-á tn̄g ling, tú-á lī-khui hing tsîng ê?
English: Whom will he teach knowledge? To whom will he explain the message? Those who are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts?

Tailo: nā guá pò͘-pêⁿ lāi ê lâng bô kóng: Siáⁿ lâng ē tshuē-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê bô tsia̍h Siōngtè ê hó mi̍h kàu pá ê?
English: If the men of my tent have not said, Who can find one who has not been filled with his meat?'

Tailo: I tuà i só͘ khioh ê ji̍p siâⁿ, hō͘ i ê ta-ke khuànn, mā kā i tsia̍h pá só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê the̍h tshut-lâi hō͘ ta-ke tsia̍h.
English: She took it up, and went into the city; and her mother-in-law saw what she had gleaned: and she brought forth and gave to her that which she had left after she was sufficed.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh hông lia̍h-khì kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ liáu-āu, Iésu khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng suan-iông Siōngtè ê hok-im,
English: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom of God,

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lí tio̍h tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng, tsīn-ì thiàⁿ Tsú — lí ê Siōngtè.
English: Jesus said to him, You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.'

Tailo: Tsit-ê enn-á tshut-sì í-tsîng, Iôséhuh bô kah i tâng-pâng. Enn-á tshut-sì, Iôséhuh tsiū kā I hō-miâ kiò-tsò Iésu.
English: and didn't know her sexually until she had brought forth her firstborn son. He named him Jesus.

Tailo: Koh mn̄g in ê miâ, beh kì in ê siú-líng ê miâ, thang tsàu hō͘ ông tsai.
English: We asked them their names also, to inform you that we might write the names of the men who were at the head of them.

Tailo: Guá beh jiok guá ê tuì-ti̍k, mā ē jiok-tio̍h in; in iáu-buē bia̍t-bông tsìn-tsîng, guá bô beh tò tńg-.khì.
English: I will pursue my enemies, and overtake them. Neither will I turn again until they are consumed.

Tailo: A-ta̍t gue̍h tsa̍p-saⁿ kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì, tsa̍p-sì an-hioh, īng tsit ji̍t siat iàn-si̍k tsò huann-hí ê ji̍t.
English: This was done on the thirteenth day of the month Adar; and on the fourteenth day of the same they rested, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.

Tailo: Guá tshuā Iôtah hiah-ê siú-líng tsiūⁿ-khì siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tíng, kā o-ló kah kám-siā ê hun-tsò nn̄g tuā tuī. Tsi̍t-tuī tī siâⁿ tíng tuì tsiànn pîng ǹg pùn-sò mn̂g khì.
English: Then I brought up the princes of Judah on the wall, and appointed two great companies who gave thanks and went in procession. One went on the right hand on the wall toward the dung gate;

Tailo: Tsit-ê Malkitsetik sī Sâ-liám ông, mā sī tsì-kuân Siōngtè ê tsè-si. Abulahàm thâi-iâⁿ lia̍t ông tńg-.lâi ê sî, Malkitsetik ū khì kā i gîng-tsiap koh kā i tsiok-hok.
English: For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of God Most High, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him,

Tailo: Iosiúah tuì tsìng lâng kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsit-ê tsio̍h-thâu beh tsò lán ê kiàn-tsìng, in-uī i ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù lán it-tshè ê uē, só͘-í, beh tuì lín tsò kiàn-tsìng, khióng-kiaⁿ lín ē puē-gi̍k lín ê Siōngtè.
English: Joshua said to all the people, Behold, this stone shall be a witness against us; for it has heard all the words of Yahweh which he spoke to us: it shall be therefore a witness against you, lest you deny your God.

Tailo: I hō͘ guá ê khuì-la̍t tī puàⁿ-lō͘ sue-lám, hō͘ guá ê ji̍t-tsí kiám-tsió.
English: He weakened my strength along the course. He shortened my days.

Tailo: ' Siat-sú ū tsai-hō lîm-kàu guán, á-.sī to-kiàm, khián-tsik, á-.sī un-i̍k, ki-hng, tng huān-lān ê sî, guán ē khiā tī tsit king ê thâu-tsîng, tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng khún-kiû Lí, in-uī Lí ê miâ sī tiàm tī tsit king tiān, Lí ē thiaⁿ guán ê kî-kiû lâi tsín-kiù. '
English: If evil come on us, the sword, judgment, or pestilence, or famine, we will stand before this house, and before you, ( for your name is in this house ) , and cry to you in our affliction, and you will hear and save.

Tailo: Guá beh pue khì hn̄g-hn̄g, hioh tī khòng-iá. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Behold, then I would wander far off. I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah.

Tailo: Koh ū lâng hō͘ lâng īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm, īng kì-á kì, īng to thâi-sí. Mā ū lâng tshīng mî-iûⁿ-á-.sī suaⁿ-iûⁿ ê phuê, sì-kè phun-pho, jím-siū sàn-tshiah, huān-lān kah gi̍k-thāi;
English: They were stoned. They were sawn apart. They were tempted. They were slain with the sword. They went around in sheep skins and in goat skins; being destitute, afflicted, ill-treated

Tailo: Hesibóng kah i ê kau-iá, Ia-tsel kah i ê kau-iá.
English: and Heshbon with its suburbs, and Jazer with its suburbs.

Tailo: Liân hiah-ê bô kì tī tsit pún lu̍t-huat ê tsheh ê tsai-hō, pēⁿ-tsìng, Siōngtsú mā ē hō͘ i lóng lîm-kàu tī lí, it-ti̍t kàu lí bia̍t-bông.
English: Also every sickness, and every plague, which is not written in the book of this law, them will Yahweh bring on you, until you are destroyed.

Tailo: Iésu ê lāu-bú huan-hù tshe-īng ê lâng kóng, Lín tio̍h tsiàu I kā lín kóng ê khì tsò.
English: His mother said to the servants, Whatever he says to you, do it.

Tailo: Ehulaim ê kiáⁿ-sun gia̍h bú-khì kah kiong-tsìnn, lîm-tīn ê ji̍t, ua̍t tńg-sin tô-tsáu.
English: The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows, Turned back in the day of battle.

Tailo: I ē hō͘ lāu-pē ê sim ua̍t tńg-lâi ǹg i ê kiáⁿ, kiáⁿ ê sim ua̍t tńg-lâi ǹg i ê lāu-pē, bián-tit Guá lâi tsiù-tsó͘ tsit-ê tē.
English: He will turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the hearts of the children to their fathers, lest I come and strike the earth with a curse.

Tailo: Tng Iôtah ông Io-si-iah ê kiáⁿ E-hō͘-iá-kim tsē-uī sì nî, to̍h-sī Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal guân nî, ū lūn-khí Iôtah jîn-bîn ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah.
English: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah ( the same was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon ) ,

Tailo: Jia-khàm lâng ê kuè-sit ê lâng sī ì-ài thiàⁿ-sim, tāi-tsì tsho̍p-tsho̍p liām ê lâng ē hō͘ tshin-bi̍t ê pîng-iú pìⁿ líng-tām.
English: He who covers an offense promotes love; But he who repeats a matter separates best friends.

Tailo: Etóm tsiah-ê khe ē piàn-tsò tá-má-ka, thô͘-sua hún ē piàn-tsò liû-hông; i ê tē tsiâⁿ-tsò í-king to̍h ê tá-má-ka.
English: Its streams will be turned into pitch, Its dust into sulfur, And its land will become burning pitch.

Tailo: Guán tuì lín kóng kuan-hē lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê tuā kuân-lîng kah tsài-lîm, m̄-sī kin-kì kî-khiáu hi-ké ê thuân-suat, sī guán ū tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h I ê tuā ui-giâm.
English: For we did not follow cunningly devised fables, when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kóng, Siōngtsú sī siáⁿ lâng hō͘ guá tio̍h thiaⁿ I ê uē, tsún Isulael lâng lī-khui? Guá m̄-bat Siōngtsú, mā m̄-tsún Isulael lâng lī-khui.
English: Pharaoh said, Who is Yahweh, that I should listen to his voice to let Israel go? I don't know Yahweh, and moreover I will not let Israel go.

Tailo: Lí beh kā in puà, hong ē kā in tshue-.khì, kńg-lê-á hong ē kā in sàu-.khì. M̄-koh, lí ē in-uī Siōngtsú lâi huann-hí, ē in-uī Isulael ê sìng ê lâi khua-kháu.
English: You will winnow them, And the wind will carry them away, And the whirlwind will scatter them. You will rejoice in Yahweh. You will glory in the Holy One of Israel.

Tailo: Lín kàu tsit só͘-tsāi, Hesibóng ông Sihông kah Basiáng ông O͘k tshut-lâi kah lán kau-tsiàn, lán tsiū kā in kong-kik,
English: When you came to this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, came out against us to battle, and we struck them:

Tailo: Lí tio̍h the̍h ta̍k tsióng ê tsia̍h-mi̍h tsik-tsū teh, thang tsò lí kah in ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: Take with you of all food that is eaten, and gather it to you; and it will be for food for you, and for them.

Tailo: Bô m̄-tio̍h, in-uī in m̄-sìn tsiah hō͘ lâng tsián khí-.lâi, lín sī in-uī ū sìn tsiah khiā ē tiâu. M̄-koh, lín m̄-thang kiau-ngō͘, tian-tò tio̍h kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: True; by their unbelief they were broken off, and you stand by your faith. Don't be conceited, but fear;

Tailo: M̄-koh, lín tsiah-ê hó-gia̍h lâng ē ū tsai-hō! In-uī lín í-king teh hióng-siū an-lo̍k ê sing-ua̍h.
English: But woe to you who are rich! For you have received your consolation.

Tailo: tng kò͘ tshù ê lâng phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, ū la̍t ê lâng so͘-io, e bō ê lâng in-uī lâng tsió tsiū suah-.khì, tuì thang-á khuàⁿ tshut-.khì lóng o͘-àm ê sî;
English: In the day when the keepers of the house shall tremble, And the strong men shall bow themselves, And the grinders cease because they are few, And those who look out of the windows are darkened,

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng o-ló Tê-mē-tu-lí-oh, tsin-lí pún-sin mā uī i tsò-tsìng; guán mā uī i tsò kiàn-tsìng, lí tsai guán ê kiàn-tsìng sī tsin-si̍t.
English: Demetrius has the testimony of all, and of the truth itself; yes, we also testify, and you know that our testimony is true.

Tailo: Ka-la̍uh tī tshì-á lāi ê, sī teh phì-jū lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tō-lí, tsiū khì hō͘ sè-kan ê tshau-huân, tsîⁿ-tsâi kah iàn-lo̍k tsó͘-gāi, tō-lí suah bē sîng-tióng kiat-si̍t.
English: That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā Guá só͘ beh siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê lu̍t-huat hē tī kuī lāi.
English: You shall put the testimony which I shall give you into the ark.

Tailo: I koh tī khòng-iá khí Ta̍t-mool kah tī Hamat só͘ khí hiah-ê kim-khò͘ ê siâⁿ,
English: He built Tadmor in the wilderness, and all the storage cities, which he built in Hamath.

Tailo: Iésu kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu, tsiū lī-khui Ga-lí-la-iah síng khì Ioltàn hô tuì-huāⁿ ê Iô-tá-iah tē.
English: It happened when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee, and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan.

Tailo: Ka-la̍uh tī lō͘ piⁿ ê, sī teh phì-jū lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tō-lí, Mô͘-kuí tsiū lâi tuì in ê sim-lāi kā tō-lí tshiúⁿ-.khì, hō͘ in bē-tàng sìn tō-lí lâi tit-tio̍h kiù.
English: Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.

Tailo: In-uī guá tsun-siú Siōngtsú ê tō-lō͘, m̄-bat tsò pháiⁿ lâi lī-khui guá ê Siōngtè.
English: For I have kept the ways of Yahweh, And have not wickedly departed from my God.

Tailo: Iôtah ê siâⁿ mn̂g pī kong-phuà, hit ji̍t lí tsiū tsa-khuàⁿ kun-tsong-kio̍k ê kun-khì.
English: He took away the covering of Judah; and you looked in that day to the armor in the house of the forest.

Tailo: Ông tsiàu kong-pêⁿ ē hō͘ kok kian-kò͘; ài tsiap-siū o͘-se ê ông tsiū ē kā kok tshia-tó.
English: The king by justice makes the land stable, But he who takes bribes tears it down.

Tailo: bô-lūn sī king, sī huī, sī tē-pò͘ ê, sī iûⁿ-mn̂g ê, sī phuê ê á-.sī phuê tsò ê mi̍h,
English: whether it is in warp, or woof; of linen, or of wool; whether in a skin, or in anything made of skin;

Tailo: Tabi̍t bat kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tī khòng-iá it-tshè só͘-ū ê, guá kā i kò͘-siú, tì-sú sio̍k tī i ê bô sit-lo̍h tsi̍t hāng, si̍t-tsāi sī bô tshái-kang! I īng pháiⁿ pò guá ê hó.
English: Now David had said, Surely in vain have I kept all that this fellow has in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that pertained to him: and he has returned me evil for good.

Tailo: Iâkop hē guān kóng, Siōngtè nā kah guá tông-tsāi, tī guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘ pó-hō͘ guá, koh hō͘ guá ū mi̍h thang tsia̍h, ū saⁿ thang tshīng,
English: Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and clothing to put on,

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtè kā I thê-sing kàu siōng kuân ê tē-uī, siúⁿ-sù I tshiau-ua̍t bān-miâ ê miâ.
English: Therefore God also highly exalted him, and gave to him the name which is above every name;

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì guá kóng, Suî-jiân ū Mô͘se kah Samuel khiā tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, thè in kiû, Guá ê sim mā bô tsiàu-kò͘ tsiah-ê jîn-bîn. Tio̍h kā in kuáⁿ lī-khui Guá ê bīn-tsîng, hō͘ in tshut-.khì.
English: Then said Yahweh to me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind would not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.

Tailo: hō͘ Iôtah ê tsong-tso̍k kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tsiū tshú-tio̍h Tsa-la̍h ê tsong-tso̍k, koh hō͘ Tsa-la̍h tsong-tso̍k ê jîn-ting tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tsiū tshú-tio̍h Tsap-tí;
English: and he brought near the family of Judah; and he took the family of the Zerahites: and he brought near the family of the Zerahites man by man; and Zabdi was taken:

Tailo: In-uī guá kā lín kóng, tsîng só͘ tshiánn hiah-ê lâng bô tsi̍t-ê ē-tàng tsia̍h-tio̍h guá ê iàn-si̍k. '
English: For I tell you that none of those men who were invited will taste of my supper.'

Tailo: Hit sî, tsiah-ê tuā-tsuí it-tīng kā lán tshiong-tsáu, hô tsuí it-tīng kā lán im-sí,
English: Then the waters would have overwhelmed us, The stream would have gone over our soul;

Tailo: Seⁿ tshit-ê kiáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, sue-lám khuì tn̄g; tng-thâu pe̍h-ji̍t, i ê ji̍t-thâu hut-jiân lo̍h, i làu-khuì kiàn-siàu; só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn, Guá beh tī in ê tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng, kā in kau hō͘ to-kiàm. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: She who has borne seven languishes; she has given up the spirit; her sun is gone down while it was yet day; she has been disappointed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, says Yahweh.

Tailo: In mê-ji̍t tī siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tíng kiâⁿ lâi kiâⁿ khì; siâⁿ lāi tshiong-muá hi-ké kah ok-to̍k.
English: Day and night they prowl around on its walls. Malice and abuse are also within her.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, ' Guá bô tshe in, tsóng-.sī, in thok Guá ê miâ suan-pò͘ pe̍h-tsha̍t, tì-sú Guá kā lín kah hiah-ê tuì lín suan-pò͘ ê sian-ti lóng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, tsò-hué bia̍t-bông. '
English: For I have not sent them, says Yahweh, but they prophesy falsely in my name; that I may drive you out, and that you may perish, you, and the prophets who prophesy to you.

Tailo: Mô͘ap ê tsai-hō teh beh kàu, i ê huān-lān tsin kín to̍h kàu.
English: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hurries fast.

Tailo: Tī Ma-óng ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, i ê sán-gia̍p tī Kal-mel, sī tuā hó-gia̍h lâng, ū mî-iûⁿ saⁿ tshing tsiah, suaⁿ-iûⁿ tsi̍t tshing tsiah; i tī Kal-mel tsián iûⁿ-mn̂g.
English: There was a man in Maon, whose possessions were in Carmel; and the man was very great, and he had three thousand sheep, and a thousand goats: and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.

Tailo: Lí ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tuì lí tsioh tsîⁿ á-.sī tsioh tsia̍h-mi̍h, tsioh kiàn-nā ē seⁿ lī-sik ê mi̍h, lí lóng m̄-thang the̍h i ê lī-sik.
English: You shall not lend on interest to your brother; interest of money, interest of food, interest of anything that is lent on interest:

Tailo: Án-ne, Siōngtè pò-ìng Amí-me-li̍k ǹg i ê lāu-pē só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ tāi, to̍h-sī thâi-sí i ê hiann-tī tshit tsa̍p lâng.
English: Thus God requited the wickedness of Abimelech, which he did to his father, in killing his seventy brothers;

Tailo: I piàn-uāⁿ tuì-ti̍k ê sim lâi uàn-hūn I ê tsú-bîn, suà īng kuí-tsà ê kè-bô͘ khuán-thāi I ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: He turned their heart to hate his people, To conspire against his servants.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá kā Manouah kóng, Lí suî-jiân lâu guá, guá m̄-tsia̍h lí ê mi̍h, lí nā tsún-pī sio-tsè, tsiū tio̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú. In-uī Manouah m̄-tsai i sī Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá.
English: The angel of Yahweh said to Manoah, Though you detain me, I won't eat of your bread; and if you will make ready a burnt offering, you must offer it to Yahweh. For Manoah didn't know that he was the angel of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tshiánn lín tńg-.khì, koh tāi-sing tsún-pī, siông-sè tsai, thàm-khuàⁿ i kiâⁿ-ta̍h ê só͘-tsāi, siáⁿ lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h i tī hia, in-uī ū lâng kā guá kóng, i tsin káu-kuài.
English: Please go make yet more sure, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who has seen him there; for it is told me that he deals very subtly.

Tailo: I bat tit-tio̍h Sìng Sîn tsí-sī, tsai-iáⁿ i sí í-tsîng ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Tsú só͘ ìng-ín ê Ki-tok.
English: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord's Christ.

Tailo: [siàu-lí]Hit-ê tuì khòng-iá lâi, hîng-tsōng tshin-tshiūnn hué-ian ê thiāu, īng bu̍t-io̍h kah jú-hiuⁿ, í-ki̍p sing-lí lâng ta̍k tsióng ê phang-hún lâi hō͘ i phang ê, sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: Who is this who comes up from the wilderness like pillars of smoke, Perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, With all spices of the merchant?

Tailo: Babúlông ông thiaⁿ-tio̍h in ê hong-siaⁿ, tshiú tsiū nńg lo̍h-.khì; thòng-khó͘ kā i khîⁿ-tiâu, thàng-thiàⁿ tshin-tshiūnn beh seⁿ kiáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng.
English: The king of Babylon has heard the news of them, and his hands wax feeble: anguish has taken hold of him, and pangs as of a woman in travail.

Tailo: Isulael ông Ehuahátsuh ê kiáⁿ Io-a-si sí liáu-āu, Iôtah ông Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Amátsiah iáu-koh ua̍h tsa̍p-gō͘ nî.
English: Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.

Tailo: Tāi-ke lóng tsia̍h kàu pá liáu-āu, khioh só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê sut-á, té tsa̍p-jī nâ muá-muá.
English: They all ate, and were filled. They took up twelve baskets full of that which remained left over from the broken pieces.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng: Lí kiânn tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, sī pà-sìng îm-hū ê só͘ kiâⁿ, khó-kiàn lí ê sim sī guā luán-jio̍k!
English: How weak is your heart, says the Lord Yahweh, seeing you do all these things, the work of an impudent prostitute;

Tailo: I ua̍t thâu khuànn guá, tsiū kiò guá. Guá ìn kóng, ' Guá tī tsia. '
English: When he looked behind him, he saw me, and called to me. I answered, Here am I.

Tailo: Tī tsi̍t-ê Tsú ê ji̍t, guá hō͘ Sìng Sîn kám-tōng, thiaⁿ-tio̍h tī guá ê āu-bīn ū tshin-tshiūnn kó͘-tshue ê tuā siann-im,
English: I was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, and I heard behind me a loud voice, like a trumpet

Tailo: Apnel ua̍t thâu khuànn, kóng, Asahel, sī lí á m̄-sī? Asahel ìn kóng, Sī guá.
English: Then Abner looked behind him, and said, Is it you, Asahel? He answered, It is I.

Tailo: Koh tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, kā hiuⁿ hē tī hué-.ni̍h, hō͘ hiuⁿ-ian jia-khàm iok-kuī tíng ê si-un-só͘, i tsiah bián-tit sí.
English: and he shall put the incense on the fire before Yahweh, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that is on the testimony, so that he will not die.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tuì bû-hua-kó tshiū lâi ha̍k-si̍p. Tng ki puh-ínn huat-hio̍h ê sî, lín tsiū tsai jua̍h-thinn teh beh kàu à.
English: Now from the fig tree learn this parable. When its branch has now become tender, and puts forth its leaves, you know that the summer is near.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū tshe hué-tsuâ ji̍p-khì jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan kā jîn-bîn, Isulael lâng sí tsin tsē.
English: Yahweh sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and much people of Israel died.

Tailo: In-uī lu̍t-huat ê tsheh ū kì-tsài, Abulahàm ū nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ, tsi̍t-ê sī lú-pī seⁿ ê, tsi̍t-ê sī tsū-iû ê tsa-bó͘ lâng seⁿ ê.
English: For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by the handmaid, and one by the free woman.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, tsi̍t lia̍p be̍h á tsíng-tsí nā bô tsìng lo̍h tē lâi sí, iû-guân sī tsi̍t lia̍p niā-niā. Nā sí, tsiū ē kiat tsin tsē lia̍p be̍h-á.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains by itself alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit.

Tailo: Iôséhuh ke tshe lâng khì thau-khuàⁿ Bethel, hit-ê siâⁿ ê miâ khí-thâu sī kiò-tsò Lùtsuh.
English: The house of Joseph sent to spy out Bethel. ( Now the name of the city before was Luz. )

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h tsit-hāng tāi-tsì, guá bat saⁿ pái khún-kiû Tsú, hō͘ hit ki tshì lī-khui guá.
English: Concerning this thing, I begged the Lord three times that it might depart from me.

Tailo: Á-sī bat ū siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-bîng tshì-kuè án-ne tsò, īng tshì-liān, sîn-jiah, kî-sū, kau-tsiàn kah tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú, tshun-tshut ê tshiú-kut kah tuā koh thang kiaⁿ ê tāi-tsì, uī ka-kī tuì pa̍t kok tiong tshú tsi̍t kok, tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè tī Aigi̍p tī lín ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, uī lín só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê tāi-tsì?
English: Or has God tried to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, according to all that Yahweh your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?

Tailo: koh buah Nimsī ê sun E-hú tsò Isulael ông, koh buah Abel-me-ho-lah lâng Siahuat ê kiáⁿ Elísiah tsò sian-ti, lâi suà-tsiap lí.
English: and Jehu the son of Nimshi shall you anoint to be king over Israel; and Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel Meholah shall you anoint to be prophet in your room.

Tailo: Hok-khì lîm-kàu gī lâng ê thâu-khak; kiông-pō am-khàm pháiⁿ lâng ê tshuì.
English: Blessings are on the head of the righteous, But violence covers the mouth of the wicked.

Tailo: Sio̍k Ahap ê lâng, sí tī siâⁿ lāi ê, káu ē kā i tsia̍h, sí tī tshân-iá ê, khong-tiong ê tsiáu ē kā i tsia̍h. '
English: Him who dies of Ahab in the city the dogs shall eat; and him who dies in the field shall the birds of the sky eat.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā kuân-tuā ê i kā i khuànn-khin; i tī só͘-ū kiau-ngō͘-ê tso̍k-luī tsò ông.
English: He sees everything that is high: He is king over all the sons of pride.

Tailo: I ê kiáⁿ Ísak kah Isimael kā i bâi-tsòng tī Mak-pe-la̍h ê hia̍t, tsit-ê hia̍t tī Mamlē ê thâu-tsîng, Hiat lâng Tso-hal ê kiáⁿ Ehulóng ê tshân tiong,
English: Isaac and Ishmael, his sons, buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre,

Tailo: Ehulaim siū pō-gio̍k, siū sím-phuàⁿ, ap-tsè, in-uī i kam-sim tsun-thàn bīng-līng.
English: Ephraim is oppressed, He is crushed in judgment; Because he is intent in his pursuit of idols.

Tailo: Lán nā sîng-jīn lán ê tsuē, Siōngtè sī tsin-si̍t koh kong-gī, I ē sià-bián lán ê tsuē, sé-tû lán it-tshè ê put-gī.
English: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and righteous to forgive us the sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

Tailo: Guān sìng ê tsú-bîn in-uī só͘ tit-tio̍h ê îng-kng lâi huann-hí! Guān in tī bîn-tshn̂g tíng tshut huann-hí ê siann!
English: Let the saints rejoice in honor. Let them sing for joy on their beds.

Tailo: Lín nā án-ne tsò, tsiū ē tsiâⁿ-tsò Thiⁿ-pē ê kiáⁿ-jî, in-uī I hō͘ ji̍t-thâu tsiò pháiⁿ lâng kah hó lâng, mā uī-tio̍h gī lâng kah put-gī ê lâng lo̍h hō͘.
English: that you may be children of your Father who is in heaven. For he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the just and the unjust.

Tailo: Lâng ē kā guá kah guá ê kiáⁿ tuì Siōngtsú ê sán-gia̍p tsò tsi̍t-ē tû-bia̍t, tsóng-.sī, ông ē thiaⁿ, kiù I ê lú-pī thuat-lī hit-ê lâng ê tshiú.
English: For the king will hear, to deliver his servant out of the hand of the man who would destroy me and my son together out of the inheritance of God.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng thiau-kò͘-ì bē kì-tit tsit-ê sū-si̍t, to̍h-sī tsū tsá tuì Siōngtè ê uē tshòng-tsō thiⁿ, koh tē sī tuì tsuí tshut-.lâi, mā īng tsuí lâi hîng-sîng;
English: For this they willfully forget, that there were heavens from of old, and an earth formed out of water and amid water, by the word of God;

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē īng tì-huī sǹg hûn ê sò͘-gia̍h? Siáⁿ lâng ē piàⁿ thinn ê phûn?
English: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can pour out the bottles of the sky,

Tailo: sio-tsè ê tuâⁿ kah i só͘-ū ê khì-kū, sé-tn̄g ê phûn kah i ê tsō.
English: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin with its base.

Tailo: Án-ne, guá beh mn̄g, Isulael lâng pua̍h-tó, kám lóng peh bē khí-.lâi? Tsua̍t-tuì ē! In-uī in ê huān tsuē, tsín-kiù suah lîm-kàu guā-pang lâng, tian-tò ē kik-khí in ê tsi̍t-tò͘.
English: I ask then, did they stumble that they might fall? May it never be! But by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles, to provoke them to jealousy.

Tailo: Só͘-í, I kóng beh kā in siau-bia̍t; nā m̄-sī ū I só͘ kíng-suán ê Mô͘se khiā tī I ê bīn-tsîng lâi bán-huê I ê siū-khì, I tsá to̍h kā in bia̍t-bông à.
English: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, Had Moses, his chosen, not stood before him in the breach, To turn away his wrath, so that he wouldn't destroy them.

Tailo: Guá ê pîng-iú khau-sé guá, tsóng-.sī, guá ê ba̍k-tsiu ǹg Siōngtè lâu ba̍k-sái.
English: My friends scoff at me. My eyes pour out tears to God,

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, tsun-tuā, lîng-li̍k, îng-kng, tik-sìng kah ui-giâm lóng sī Lí ê; só͘-ū tī thinn-tíng tē-hā ê lóng sī Lí ê. Siōngtsú ah, kok mā sī Lí ê, Lí sī tsì-kuân, tsò bān-iú ê thâu.
English: Yours, Yahweh, is the greatness, the power, the glory, the victory, and the majesty: for all that is in the heavens and in the earth is yours. Yours is the kingdom, Yahweh, and you are exalted as head above all.

Tailo: Īng tsit-ê tâng tsò huē-bō͘ mn̂g ê khū kah tâng-tuâⁿ kah i ê tâng-bāng ê ting-sa kah tuâⁿ só͘-ū ê khì-kū,
English: With this he made the sockets to the door of the tent of meeting, the brazen altar, the brazen grating for it, all the vessels of the altar,

Tailo: Guá ê hún-tsiáu, guá ê sûn-tsuân ê sī to̍k-it ê; i sī in lāu-bú to̍k-seⁿ ê, sī seⁿ i ê só͘ ti̍k-pia̍t thiàⁿ ê. Tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū o-ló i ū hok-khì; ông-hō͘ kah pîn-hui khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, mā o-ló i.
English: My dove, my perfect one, is unique. She is her mother's only daughter. She is the favorite one of her who bore her. The daughters saw her, and called her blessed, The queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê sàn-tshiah ê kuáⁿ-hū lâi hiat nn̄g-ê tâng-tsîⁿ-á, to̍h-sī tsi̍t kak gîn.
English: A poor widow came, and she cast in two small brass coins, which equal a quadrans coin.

Tailo: Kàu tē-sì ji̍t, tī lán Siōngtè ê tiān, tshìn hiah-ê kim-gîn kah khì-kū, kau tī tsè-si Ulīa ê kiáⁿ Melemo͘t ê tshiú. Kah i tsò-hué lâi ê ū Hui-ne-hah ê kiáⁿ Êlīatsal, koh kah in tsò-hué lâi ê, ū Lēbī lâng E-siu-ah ê kiáⁿ Io-tsa-bat kah Binnuí ê kiáⁿ Noatiah.
English: On the fourth day the silver and the gold and the vessels were weighed in the house of our God into the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest; and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah the son of Binnui, the Levite;

Tailo: Lâng nā ài tshut-miâ tsiū bē tiām-tiām-á tsò tāi-tsì. Lí kì-jiân teh tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h khì tsò hō͘ sè-kan lâng khuànn.
English: For no one does anything in secret, and himself seeks to be known openly. If you do these things, reveal yourself to the world.

Tailo: Siōngtsú bô sǹg i tsò ū tsuē, i ê sim bô kan-tsà ê, tsit khuán lâng ū hok-khì.
English: Blessed is the man to whom Yahweh doesn't impute iniquity, In whose spirit there is no deceit.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h siàu-liām tsit-ê tāi-tsì, ka-kī tsò tāi-tiōng-hu; puē-gi̍k ê lâng, tio̍h īng sim lâi siūⁿ.
English: Remember this, and show yourselves men; bring it again to mind, you transgressors.

Tailo: Guá beh tī I tsìng tsú-bîn ê bīn-tsîng, tuì Siōngtsú siā guá ê guān.
English: I will pay my vows to Yahweh, Yes, in the presence of all his people.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hun-pia̍t siān-ok ê tshiū, i ê kué-tsí m̄-thang tsia̍h, in-uī tsia̍h ê ji̍t, lí it-tīng ē sí.
English: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, you shall not eat of it; for in the day that you eat of it you will surely die.

Tailo: Tê-mē-tu-lí-oh kah hiah-ê uá i ê sai-hū nā beh khòng-kò in, ū khui-tîng ê ji̍t-kî, mā ū tsóng-tok, tāi-ke thang tuà hia sio-kò.
English: If therefore Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a matter against anyone, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls. Let them press charges against one another.

Tailo: Koh īng hué sio in só͘ tuà ê tē, hiah-ê siâⁿ kah in só͘-ū ê iâⁿ-pâng.
English: All their cities in the places in which they lived, and all their encampments, they burnt with fire.

Tailo: Hit-ê Huilīsū lâng koh kā Tabi̍t kóng, Lí lâi guá tsia, guá beh kā lí ê bah hō͘ khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu kah tshân-iá ê iá-siù.
English: The Philistine said to David, Come to me, and I will give your flesh to the birds of the sky, and to the animals of the field.

Tailo: Lí ê ke kah lí ê kok ē íng-uán kiàn-li̍p tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, lí ê kok-uī mā ē kian-kò͘ kàu íng-uán. '
English: Your house and your kingdom shall be made sure for ever before you: your throne shall be established forever.

Tailo: Gōng lâng, lín iā lo̍h-.khì ê tsíng-tsí nā bô sí-.khì, kám ē ua̍h khí-.lâi?
English: You foolish one, that which you yourself sow is not made alive unless it dies.

Tailo: Hit sî, guá khún-kiû Siōngtsú kóng:
English: I begged Yahweh at that time, saying,

Tailo: hō͘ in kau hō͘ tsò-kang ê lâng, to̍h-sī kuán-lí Siōngtsú tiān ê, hō͘ in tsuán-kau Siōngtsú tiān lāi tsò-kang ê lâng, thang siu-lí tiān phò-huāi ê só͘-tsāi,
English: and let them deliver it into the hand of the workmen who have the oversight of the house of Yahweh; and let them give it to the workmen who are in the house of Yahweh, to repair the breaches of the house,

Tailo: I thiann-kìnn Iésu tuì Iô-tá-iah síng lâi-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng, tsiū khì kiû I lo̍h-khì Ka-peh-ná-um i-tī i ê kiáⁿ, in-uī i ê kiáⁿ teh beh sí à.
English: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to him, and begged him that he would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.

Tailo: I thiaⁿ-tio̍h guá tshut siaⁿ huah, tsiū kā i ê saⁿ pàng tī guá tsia, tsáu tshut-khì guā-bīn.
English: It happened, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment by me, and ran outside.

Tailo: In khí-lâi Baal-pe-la-tsim, Tabi̍t tī hia kā in phah. Tabi̍t kóng, Siōngtè īng guá ê tshiú tshiong suàⁿ guá ê tuì-ti̍k, tshin-tshiūnn tsuí kā in tshiong suàⁿ. In-uī án-ne tsiū kā hit só͘-tsāi kiò-tsò Baal-pe-la-tsim.
English: So they came up to Baal Perazim, and David struck them there; and David said, God has broken my enemies by my hand, like the breach of waters. Therefore they called the name of that place Baal Perazim.

Tailo: Lín ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h kau-tsiàn kah jiáu-luān ê tāi-tsì, hit sî lín m̄-bián tio̍h-kiaⁿ, in-uī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì it-tīng ē tāi-sing huat-sing, tsóng-.sī, bua̍t-ji̍t bē suî-sî kàu.
English: When you hear of wars and disturbances, don't be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won't come immediately.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū sih-nà, ū hiáng-siaⁿ, ū luî tân kah tuā tē-tāng. Tē tsiūⁿ ū jîn-luī í-lâi, m̄-bat ū tsiah-ni̍h tuā ê tē-tāng.
English: There were lightnings, sounds, and thunders; and there was a great earthquake, such as was not since there were men on the earth, so great an earthquake, so mighty.

Tailo: Hit sî, kui-ê huē-tiûⁿ luān tshau-tshau, tsi̍t-ê lâng huah tsi̍t-khuán, tuā pō͘-hūn ê lâng m̄-tsai in uī siáⁿ-mi̍h teh tsū-tsi̍p.
English: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another, for the assembly was in confusion. Most of them didn't know why they had come together.

Tailo: Guán tiong-kan bô ū phuàⁿ-tuàn ê lâng, thang hō͘ guán siang-hong pí-tshú khut-ho̍k.
English: There is no umpire between us, That might lay his hand on us both.

Tailo: Guān lín ē-tàng thé-giām Ki-tok hit khuán tshiau-ua̍t tì-sik só͘ ē-tàng lí-kái ê thiàⁿ, hō͘ Siōngtè ê uân-siān kā lín uân-tsuân tshiong-muá.
English: and to know Christ's love which surpasses knowledge, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.

Tailo: Tsuí tiong lín só͘ thang tsia̍h ê to̍h-sī tsiah-ê: kiàn-nā tī tsuí-.ni̍h, hái-.ni̍h, hô-.ni̍h, ū si̍t ū lân ê lóng thang tsia̍h.
English: These you may eat of all that are in the waters: whatever has fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, that you may eat.

Tailo: Iésu tsai in ài beh mn̄g I, tsiū kā in kóng, Lín in-uī guá kóng, ' Koh bô guā kú, lín tsiū bē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, koh-tsài bô guā kú, lín tsiū ē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá. ' Teh mn̄g-lâi mn̄g-khì, sī-.bô?
English: Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them, Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, A little while, and you won't see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?'

Tailo: In tī suaⁿ tíng tiô-thiàu tshin-tshiūnn tshia ê siann, koh tshin-tshiūnn hué-iām sio tsháu ê siann, tshin-tshiūnn kiông-bíng ê jîn-bîn pâi tī tsiàn-tīn.
English: Like the noise of chariots on the tops of the mountains do they leap, Like the noise of a flame of fire that devours the stubble, As a strong people set in battle array.

Tailo: Huán-tńg tio̍h in-uī ū hūn tī Ki-tok ê kan-khó͘ lâi huann-hí, hō͘ lín tī I îng-kng hián-hiān ê sî, mā thang huann-hí khuài-lo̍k.
English: But because you are partakers of Christ's sufferings, rejoice; that at the revelation of his glory also you may rejoice with exceeding joy.

Tailo: Siōngtsú lī-khui pháiⁿ lâng hn̄g-hn̄g; tsóng-.sī, I thiaⁿ gī lâng ê kî-tó.
English: Yahweh is far from the wicked, But he hears the prayer of the righteous.

Tailo: Kā i tshīng lāi-saⁿ, hâ tuà, tshīng guā-phàu, tha̍h tsè-si ho̍k, īng kî-khiáu ê kang-hu só͘ tsit tsè-si ho̍k ê tuà kā i hâ, án-ne lâi pa̍k tī i ê sing-khu.
English: He put the coat on him, tied the sash on him, clothed him with the robe, put the ephod on him, and he tied the skillfully woven band of the ephod on him, and fastened it to him with it.

Tailo: I īng kuí-kè lâi tuì-hù lán ê bîn-tso̍k, gi̍k-thāi lán ê tsó͘-sian, bīng-līng in tio̍h kā in ê enn-á tàn tuà guā-bīn, hō͘ in sí.
English: The same took advantage of our race, and mistreated our fathers, and forced them to throw out their babies, so that they wouldn't stay alive.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Guá ê kok-tō͘ m̄-sī sio̍k tsit sè-kan; guá ê kok-tō͘ nā sio̍k tsit sè-kan, guá ê pō͘-hā it-tīng ē uī guá tsing-tsiàn, bián-tit guá siū tshut-bē hō͘ Iô-tá-iah lâng. M̄-koh, taⁿ guá ê kok-tō͘ m̄-sī sio̍k tsia.
English: Jesus answered, My Kingdom is not of this world. If my Kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I wouldn't be delivered to the Jews. But now my Kingdom is not from here.

Tailo: In pûn iûⁿ-kak ê siann thua tn̂g, lín thiaⁿ-tio̍h hō-tâng ê siann, tsìng lâng tio̍h tuā-siaⁿ huah, siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tsiū ē tó kah pêⁿ-pêⁿ, ta̍k lâng lóng tio̍h ti̍t-ti̍t tsìn-tsîng khì.
English: It shall be that when they make a long blast with the ram's horn, and when you hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout; and the wall of the city shall fall down flat, and the people shall go up every man straight before him.

Tailo: Guá īng ka-kī ê tsînn tsò guá ài tsò ê, kám bē tsò-.tit? Guá tuì in khóng-khài, lí suah teh ba̍k-khang-tshiah, sī-.bô? '
English: Isn't it lawful for me to do what I want to with what I own? Or is your eye evil, because I am good?'

Tailo: Sàulô kah i ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan, í-ki̍p tuè in ê lâng, lóng tuà tī Biāniámín ê Ge-bah; tsóng-.sī, Huilīsū lâng tsat iâⁿ tī Mik-mah.
English: Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people who were present with them, abode in Geba of Benjamin: but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsuân-pō͘ kuè Ioltàn hô liáu-āu, Siōngtsú tsiū huan-hù Iosiúah, kóng,
English: It happened, when all the nation were clean passed over the Jordan, that Yahweh spoke to Joshua, saying,

Tailo: In-uī I kàm-tshat in ê só͘ tsò; tī àm-sî kā in tshia-tó, in tsiū bia̍t-bông.
English: Therefore he takes knowledge of their works. He overturns them in the night, so that they are destroyed.

Tailo: I sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, guá it-tīng lóng bē sit-pāi, tāi-tāi lóng bē tú-tio̍h tsai-lān.
English: He says in his heart, I shall not be shaken; For generations I shall have no trouble.

Tailo: In lóng tsia̍h kāng-khuán sio̍k-lîng ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, lóng lim kāng-khuán sio̍k-lîng ê tsuâⁿ-tsuí.
English: and all ate the same spiritual food;

Tailo: Tsò-tsha̍t ê, tham-sim ê, hò͘ⁿ-tsiú ê, huí-pòng ê, tsà-khi ê, lóng bē-tàng tsò Siōngtè kok-tō͘ ê tsú-bîn.
English: nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor slanderers, nor extortioners, will inherit the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: I hō͘ lâng siū khó͘, iu-būn, m̄-sī I só͘ kam-sim tsîng-guān ê.
English: For he does not afflict willingly, nor grieve the children of men.

Tailo: Ia-be-si ê tiúⁿ-ló kā i kóng, Kiû lí khuan-iông guán tshit ji̍t, hō͘ guán tshe lâng khì Isulael ê tsuân kíng; nā bô lâng kiù guán, guán tsiū tshut-lâi tsiū lí.
English: The elders of Jabesh said to him, Give us seven days' respite, that we may send messengers to all the borders of Israel; and then, if there be none to save us, we will come out to you.

Tailo: I bīng-līng ji̍t-thâu, ji̍t-thâu tsiū bô tshut-.lâi, koh kā tsìng tsheⁿ hong ba̍t.
English: Who commands the sun, and it doesn't rise, And seals up the stars;

Tailo: Mā tio̍h kiò lâng khau tshù lāi ê sì-kho͘-uî, só͘ khau khí-.lâi ê hue-thô͘, tio̍h piàⁿ tī siâⁿ guā bô tshing-khì ê só͘-tsāi.
English: and he shall cause the inside of the house to be scraped round about, and they shall pour out the mortar, that they scraped off, outside of the city into an unclean place.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī suaⁿ-iûⁿ ê thâu-khak tíng huāⁿ-tshiú, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tī thâi sio-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ ê só͘-tsāi kā i thâi, tse sī sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: He shall lay his hand on the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they kill the burnt offering before Yahweh. It is a sin offering.

Tailo: Sīm-tsì ū lâng kā pēnn-lâng khǹg tī pho͘-á, kng lâi hē tī ke-lō͘ piⁿ, ǹg-bāng Piattò͘ king-kuè ê sî, ū kuí-ê-á lâng thang hō͘ i ê iánn ìm-tio̍h.
English: They even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on cots and mattresses, so that as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some of them.

Tailo: Guá ê tsó͘-sian só͘ bia̍t-bông hiah-ê kok, in hiah-ê sîn-bîng ê tiong-kan siáⁿ lâng ē kiù i ê kok thuat-lī guá ê tshiú, lín ê Siōngtè kám to̍h ē kiù lín thuat-lī guá ê tshiú?
English: Who was there among all the gods of those nations which my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of my hand, that your God should be able to deliver you out of my hand?

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê tshiú khuà tī Eliiah ê sin tsiūⁿ, i tsiū hâ io, tī Ahap ê thâu-tsîng tsáu-khì-kàu E-tsu-le-el ê siâⁿ mn̂g.
English: and the hand of Yahweh was on Elijah; and he girded up his waist, and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī thái-ko tsìng-thâu ê kui-lē, bô-lūn sī tī iûⁿ-mn̂g saⁿ, tē-pò͘ saⁿ, tī king, tī huī kah phuê tsò ê mi̍h, thang tuàn-tīng tsò tshing-khì á-.sī tuàn-tīng tsò bô tshing-khì.
English: This is the law of the plague of mildew in a garment of wool or linen, either in the warp, or the woof, or in anything of skin, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Kàu tē-tshit ji̍t, in kā Sâmsóng ê bó͘ kóng, Lí tio̍h khì làu lí ê tiōng-hu, hō͘ i kā bī-tshai ê ì-sù kā guán kóng, bián-tit guán īng hué sio lí kah lín lāu-pē ê tshù. Lín tshiánn guán lâi, sī beh tshiúⁿ guán á m̄-sī?
English: It happened on the seventh day, that they said to Samson's wife, Entice your husband, that he may declare to us the riddle, lest we burn you and your father's house with fire: have you called us to impoverish us? is it not so?

Tailo: Siōng iàu-kín ê sī lín tio̍h tsai, m̄-thang suî-piān tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù lâi kái-sueh king-tián tiong sian-ti só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: knowing this first, that no prophecy of Scripture is of private interpretation.

Tailo: Tī tsit-ê tē-ki tíng-bīn, lâng īng kim, gîn, pó-tsio̍h, tshâ, tsháu-á-.sī tiū-kó lâi khí-tsō.
English: But if anyone builds on the foundation with gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay, or stubble;

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, suî-jiân ū tsháu-tshì, tsi̍t-lê tī lí hia, jî-tshiánn lí tiàm tī giat-á thâng ê tiong-kan, lóng m̄-bián kiaⁿ in, mā m̄-bián kiaⁿ in ê uē; in suî-jiân sī puē-gi̍k ê ke, mā m̄-bián kiaⁿ in ê uē, mā m̄-thang in-uī in ê bīn-māu lâi kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: You, son of man, don't be afraid of them, neither be afraid of their words, though briers and thorns are with you, and you do dwell among scorpions: don't be afraid of their words, nor be dismayed at their looks, though they are a rebellious house.

Tailo: Beh khioh hó-gia̍h lâng toh-kha só͘ ka-la̍uh ê tsia̍h-mi̍h lâi tsí-iau, káu mā lâi tsīⁿ i ê kha seⁿ liàp-á ê só͘-tsāi.
English: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man's table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

Tailo: Kì-jiân ū hiah tsē kiàn-tsìng-jîn tshin-tshiūnn hûn kā lán pau-uî-.leh, lán tio̍h pâi-tû it-tshè ê tsó͘-gāi kah it-ti̍t kā lán tîⁿ-puàⁿ ê tsuē, kian-jím pháu-tsáu lán thâu-tsîng ê lō͘-thîng.
English: Therefore let us also, seeing we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, lay aside every weight and the sin which so easily entangles us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

Tailo: Guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lí it-tshè ê kài-bīng, lí nā tsip-siú lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn, thiàⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kiânn I hiah-ê tō-lō͘, tsiū tī tsit saⁿ-ê siâⁿ í-guā, tio̍h koh uī ka-kī ke siat saⁿ-ê siâⁿ.
English: if you shall keep all this commandment to do it, which I command you this day, to love Yahweh your God, and to walk ever in his ways; then shall you add three cities more for you, besides these three:

Tailo: Só͘-í, i ê pē-bú kóng, I í-king tuā-hàn à, lín khì mn̄g i ka-kī.
English: Therefore his parents said, He is of age. Ask him.

Tailo: Hū-jîn lâng kóng, Sin-seⁿ, tshiánn hō͘ guá tsit-ê tsuí, guá tsiah bē koh tshuì-ta, mā bián koh lâi tsiah hn̄g tshiūⁿ tsuí.
English: The woman said to him, Sir, give me this water, so that I don't get thirsty, neither come all the way here to draw.

Tailo: I mā kah kóng Hi-la̍h uē ê Iô-tá-iah lâng kóng-uē piān-lūn; hiah-ê lâng iáu-koh put-sî kè-bô͘ beh kā i thâi.
English: preaching boldly in the name of the Lord. He spoke and disputed against the Hellenists, but they were seeking to kill him.

Tailo: Liân-tiúⁿ tsiū tshuā siàu-liân lâng khì kìⁿ iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, kóng, Hit-ê siū kuaiⁿ ê Páulô kiò guá-.khì, kiû guá tshuā tsit-ê siàu-liân lâng lâi kìnn lí. I ū tāi-tsì beh kā lí pò-kò.
English: So he took him, and brought him to the commanding officer, and said, Paul, the prisoner, summoned me and asked me to bring this young man to you, who has something to tell you.

Tailo: Tāi-ke tshiánn Páulô ke tuà kuí ji̍t, i bô tap-ìng.
English: When they asked him to stay with them a longer time, he declined;

Tailo: Tsa-tok ê kiáⁿ Ahimâtsu kóng, Tsún guá tsáu-khì pò siau-sit hō͘ ông, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú ū án-tsuáⁿ tuì i ê tuì-ti̍k pò-siû.
English: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, Let me now run, and bear the king news, how that Yahweh has avenged him of his enemies.

Tailo: Lín án-ne tsò, sī tik-tsuē lín ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē, siong-tio̍h in nńg-tsiáⁿ ê liông-sim, lín to̍h-sī tik-tsuē Ki-tok.
English: Thus, sinning against the brothers, and wounding their conscience when it is weak, you sin against Christ.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, tsiah-ê lâng í-king kā in ê ngó͘-siōng tsiap-la̍p tī in ê sim, koh hē ē tì-sú huān tsuē ê tsó͘-gāi tī ka-kī ê bīn-tsîng. Guá kám ē hō͘ i mn̄g siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Son of man, these men have taken their idols into their heart, and put the stumbling block of their iniquity before their face: should I be inquired of at all by them?

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tī ba̍t hûn ê tiong-kan lîm-kàu lí, hō͘ jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-tio̍h Guá kah lí teh kóng uē, thang hō͘ in íng-uán siong-sìn lí. Mô͘se tsiū kā jîn-bîn ê uē tuì Siōngtsú kóng.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Behold, I come to you in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with you, and may also believe you forever. Moses told the words of the people to Yahweh.

Tailo: In kā Iôséhuh kóng, Guán ta̍k lâng bāng-kìnn tsi̍t-ê bāng, bô lâng thang kái-bāng. Iôséhuh kā in kóng, Kái-bāng kám m̄-sī tsāi tī Siōngtè? Tshiánn lín kā guá kóng.
English: They said to him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no one who can interpret it. Joseph said to them, Don't interpretations belong to God? Please tell it to me.

Tailo: In tsiū khún-kiû Iésu lī-khui in ê tē-khu.
English: They began to beg him to depart from their region.

Tailo: Guá beh kiâⁿ tī lín tiong-kan, Guá beh tsò lín ê Siōngtè, lín beh tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn.
English: I will walk among you, and will be your God, and you will be my people.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng, tī îng-kng ê liáu-āu, tshe guá kàu hiah-ê tshiúⁿ-lia̍h lín ê lia̍t kok, huān-tio̍h lín ê to̍h-sī huān-tio̍h I ba̍k-tsiu tiong ê tông-tsú.
English: For thus says Yahweh of Armies: For honor he has sent me to the nations which plundered you; for he who touches you touches the apple of his eye.

Tailo: tī hia, Tsa-tok tsè-si kah Náthan sian-ti tio̍h kā i buah iû tsò Isulael ông; lín mā tio̍h pûn sàu-kak, kóng, ' Guān Só͘lômóng ông bān-suè! '
English: and let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel; and blow you the trumpet, and say, Long live king Solomon.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh tuì guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, lí kám beh sím-mn̄g A-hô-la̍h kah A-hô-lí-bah? Lí tio̍h tsí-tshut in só͘ kiâⁿ khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: Yahweh said moreover to me: Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? then declare to them their abominations.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tsit-būn Iésu ê bûn-tô͘ kóng, Lín lāu-su ná ē kah thiu-suè ê í-ki̍p tsuē-jîn tsò-hué tsia̍h pn̄g?
English: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá ài lín tsai, guá só͘ thuân ê hok-im m̄-sī tsiàu lâng ê ì-sù.
English: But I make known to you, brothers, concerning the Good News which was preached by me, that it is not according to man.

Tailo: Piattò͘ iáu teh siūⁿ tsit-ê ī-siōng ê sî, Sìng Sîn kā i kóng, Ū saⁿ-ê lâng lâi beh tshuē lí.
English: While Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him, Behold, three men seek you.

Tailo: Lí tshīng kng-bîng tshin-tshiūnn guā-saⁿ; thí-khui thiⁿ tshin-tshiūnn pò͘-pênn.
English: He covers himself with light as with a garment. He stretches out the heavens like a curtain.

Tailo: Lēbī lâng tio̍h tī hiah-ê gû-káng-á ê thâu-khak tíng huāⁿ-tshiú; lí tio̍h hiàn tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, koh hiàn tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú, lâi kā Lēbī lâng sio̍k-tsuē.
English: The Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, and you shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering to Yahweh, to make atonement for the Levites.

Tailo: Tē-saⁿ ji̍t tio̍h hiàn gû-káng-á tsa̍p-it tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng nn̄g tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-á tsa̍p-sì tsiah, lóng tio̍h bô khuat-tiám ê;
English: On the third day eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

Tailo: Mô͘se kiû-kiò Siōngtsú, Siōngtsú tsí-sī i tsi̍t tsâng tshiū, i tsiū kā hit-tsâng tshiū hiat lo̍h-khì tsuí-.ni̍h, tsuí tsiū piàn kam. Siōngtsú tī hia uī in tīng lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, tī hia kā in tshì-liān.
English: Then he cried to Yahweh. Yahweh showed him a tree, and he threw it into the waters, and the waters were made sweet. There he made a statute and an ordinance for them, and there he tested them;

Tailo: Gōng lâng ê tshiò tshin-tshiūnn tiáⁿ-ē teh sio tshì-á ê siann. Tse mā sī khang-hi.
English: For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool. This also is vanity.

Tailo: Tsè-si lóng bô kóng: Siōngtsú tī tó-uī? Káng-kái lu̍t-huat ê m̄-bat Guá, kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ puē-gi̍k Guá, sian-ti khò Baal lâi ī-giân, koh tsun-thàn bô lī-ik ê tāi-tsì.
English: The priests didn't say, Where is Yahweh? and those who handle the law didn't know me: the rulers also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.

Tailo: Guān kìng-uì Lí ê lâng kui-ǹg guá, in tsiū ē tsai Lí ê kà-sī.
English: Let those who fear you turn to me. They will know your statutes.

Tailo: Nā in ū tsi̍t tsiah pua̍h tī huî-khì lāi, hit lāi-bīn bô-lūn ū siáⁿ-mi̍h mi̍h-kiāⁿ, tsiū bak bô tshing-khì, lín tio̍h kā tsit-ê huî-khì phah-phuà.
English: Every earthen vessel, into which any of them falls, all that is in it shall be unclean, and you shall break it.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ koh khah tio̍h-kiaⁿ, khí gî-būn, kóng, Án-ne siáⁿ lâng tsiah ē-tàng tit-kiù?
English: They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him, Then who can be saved?

Tailo: I ê siú-bōng ê lâng sī tsheⁿ-mê, lóng bô tì-sik, lóng sī é-káu, bē puī ê káu; in kan-taⁿ tó-.leh, bîn-bāng, ài khùn.
English: His watchmen are blind, they are all without knowledge; they are all mute dogs, they can't bark; dreaming, lying down, loving to slumber.

Tailo: Koh guán tiong-kan ê kuí-nā-ê hū-jîn-lâng hō͘ guán tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, in-uī in phah-phú-kng to̍h kàu bōng-tē,
English: Also, certain women of our company amazed us, having arrived early at the tomb;

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, In-uī Mô͘ap kah Seil ū teh kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Iôtah ke kah tsìng kok bô siáⁿ-mi̍h bô kāng',
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: Because Moab and Seir say, Behold, the house of Judah is like all the nations;

Tailo: Sí-bông ê soh-á tîⁿ guá, huí-luī ê tuā-tsuí hō͘ guá kiaⁿ.
English: The cords of death surrounded me. The floods of ungodliness made me afraid.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh kóng, Io-tuà án-tsuáⁿ liân tī lâng ê io, Guá ū hō͘ Isulael tsuân ke kah Iôtah tsuân ke liân tī Guá, mā sī án-ne, Guá beh hō͘ in tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn, tsò Guá ê miâ-siaⁿ, tsò Guá ê o-ló, tsò Guá ê îng-kng; tsóng-.sī, in m̄-khíng thiaⁿ.
English: For as the belt cleaves to the waist of a man, so have I caused to cleave to me the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah, says Yahweh; that they may be to me for a people, and for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory: but they would not hear.

Tailo: Bé in ê kā in thâi, ka-kī lia̍h-tsò bô tsuē; bē in ê kóng, ' Siōngtsú sī ing-kai o-ló ê, in-uī guá hó-gia̍h à. 'In ê bo̍k-tsiá mā bô liân-bín in.
English: Their buyers slaughter them, and go unpunished. Those who sell them say, Blessed be Yahweh, for I am rich;' and their own shepherds don't pity them.

Tailo: Siōngtsú khí-lâi tsing-piān, khiā-teh sím-phuàⁿ hiah-ê jîn-bîn.
English: Yahweh stands up to contend, And stands to judge the peoples.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsit-má Siōngtsú ê uē kóng, Sann nî lāi, tsiàu tn̂g-kang ê nî-hān, Mô͘ap ê îng-kng kah i ê jîn-bîn ē tú-tio̍h lîng-jio̍k; só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng tsin tsió, put kham it kik.
English: But now Yahweh has spoken, saying, Within three years, as a worker bound by contract would count them, the glory of Moab shall be brought into contempt, with all his great multitude; and the remnant will be very small and feeble.

Tailo: Guán tuì Lí só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì hui-siông hú-pāi, bô tsun-siú Lí thok Lí ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng ê kài-bīng, lu̍t-lē, huat-tō͘.
English: we have dealt very corruptly against you, and have not kept the commandments, nor the statutes, nor the ordinances, which you commanded your servant Moses.

Tailo: hit uī tuì sè-kan ê khí-thâu to̍h hián-bîng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng ê.
English: All his works are known to God from eternity.'

Tailo: In-uī Guá — Siōngtsú ài kong-pêⁿ, uàn-hūn put-gī ê tshiúⁿ-kiap; Guá ē tsiàu sîng-si̍t pò-ìng in, mā beh kah in li̍p íng-uán ê iok.
English: For I, Yahweh, love justice, I hate robbery with iniquity; and I will give them their recompense in truth, and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.

Tailo: Guân-kò lóng khiā khí-lâi khòng-kò, só͘ kò ê m̄-sī guá só͘ siūⁿ ê hiah pháiⁿ.
English: Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such things as I supposed;

Tailo: Gī ê hong-bīn, in-uī guá teh beh tńg-khì Thiⁿ-pē hia, lín bē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá;
English: about righteousness, because I am going to my Father, and you won't see me any more;

Tailo: Lîng-khó tuà tī tshù tíng ê kak-thâu, mā m̄-thang kah tsháu-nāu ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsò-hué tuà tī khui-khuah ê tshù.
English: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, Than to share a house with a contentious woman.

Tailo: Lín m̄-sī tsia̍h tsi̍t kang, nn̄g kang, gō͘ kang, tsa̍p kang, jī-tsa̍p kang,
English: You shall not eat one day, nor two days, nor five days, neither ten days, nor twenty days,

Tailo: Thiàⁿ-sioh ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng, ē sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā; tī tsit sè-kan bô tham-luân ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng it-tīng ē pó-siú sèⁿ-miā lâi tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: He who loves his life will lose it. He who hates his life in this world will keep it to eternal life.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Tsiah-ê kài-bīng guá tsū sè-hàn to̍h lóng ū teh tsun-siú.
English: He said, I have observed all these things from my youth up.

Tailo: Kuan-hē lín tī phue lāi-bīn thê-khí ê būn-tê, lâng bô kiat-hun khah hó.
English: Now concerning the things about which you wrote to me: it is good for a man not to touch a woman.

Tailo: In ná kiâⁿ khuì-la̍t ná ke-thinn, ta̍k lâng lâi-kàu Si-óng tiâu-kìnn Siōngtè.
English: They go from strength to strength. Everyone of them appears before God in Zion.

Tailo: Sémh ê sè-hē kì tī ē-té
English: This is the history of the generations of Shem.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī in-uī tsit-ê tsha-pia̍t, Iésu tsiâⁿ-tsò koh khah hó ê iok ê pó-tsìng-jîn.
English: By so much has Jesus become the collateral of a better covenant.

Tailo: Lín ē-tàng īng ē-bīn ê hong-huat, lâi hun-pia̍t hit-ê lîng sī m̄-sī Siōngtè ê Sìng Sîn, kong-khai sîng-jīn Iésu Ki-tok tō tsiânn jio̍k-thé lîm-kàu tsit sè-kan ê hit-ê lîng, to̍h-sī tuì Siōngtè lâi ê Sìng Sîn.
English: By this you know the Spirit of God: every spirit who confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is of God,

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guá ê ji̍t-tsí tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t pa-tsiúⁿ tn̂g; guá it-sing ê nî-huè tsāi Lí khuàⁿ khí-lâi kah-ná-.sī bô. Lâng khiā tī sè-kan tsí-put-kò sī khang-khang. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Behold, you have made my days handbreadths. My lifetime is as nothing before you. Surely every man stands as a breath. Selah.

Tailo: M̄-koh, tsa-bó͘ lâng tī kî-tó á-.sī thuân hok-im ê sî, nā bô tà thâu-kin to̍h-sī teh bú-jio̍k i ka-kī ê thâu, to̍h-sī i ê tiōng-hu, tsit khuán ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kah thâu-mn̂g hō͘ lâng thì khí-.lâi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kāng-khuán.
English: But every woman praying or prophesying with her head unveiled dishonors her head. For it is one and the same thing as if she were shaved.

Tailo: Siōngtè koh kā i kóng, Lí ê miâ sī Iâkop, taⁿ í-āu lí ê miâ bô koh kiò Iâkop, beh kiò-tsò Isulael. I tsiū kiò i ê miâ Isulael.
English: God said to him, Your name is Jacob. Your name shall not be Jacob any more, but your name will be Israel. He named him Israel.

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn phah-la̍h ê teh jiok guán ê kha-pō͘, tì-sú guán m̄-káⁿ kiânn tī guán ê ke-lō͘. Guán ê tsiong-kio̍k teh beh kàu, guán ê ji̍t-tsí í-king muá à; in-uī guán ê tsiong-kio̍k kàu à.
English: They hunt our steps, so that we can't go in our streets: Our end is near, our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.

Tailo: Isulael ông tsiū tiàu tsi̍t-ê kuaⁿ-uân lâi, kóng, Lí khì kiò Im-lah ê kiáⁿ Mikaiah kuáⁿ-kín lâi.
English: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, Get quickly Micaiah the son of Imlah.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k tē-tshit ji̍t, to̍h-sī ǹg Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè lâi siú ê an-hioh. Tsit ji̍t, lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-jî, lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī, tsing-seⁿ, í-ki̍p tuà tī lí tiong-kan ê tshut-guā lâng, só͘-ū ê kang lóng m̄-thang tsò;
English: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to Yahweh your God. You shall not do any work in it, you, nor your son, nor your daughter, your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your livestock, nor your stranger who is within your gates;

Tailo: Lîng-khó tuà tī tshù tíng ê kak-thâu, m̄-thang kah tsháu-nāu ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsò-hué tuà tī khui-khuah ê tshù.
English: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, Than to share a house with a contentious woman.

Tailo: Gī lâng só͘-ū ê suî-jiân tsió-tsió, khiok iâⁿ-kuè tsin tsē pháiⁿ lâng ê hù-jū.
English: Better is a little that the righteous has, Than the abundance of many wicked.

Tailo: Keh kang tsá-khí, E-hú tshut-.lâi, khiā-.leh, kā tsìng lâng kóng, Lín lóng sī kong-gī ê, lí khuàⁿ, guá puē-puān guá ê tsú-lâng, thâi-sí i; tsóng-.sī, thâi-sí tsiah-ê kûn-tsiòng ê sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: It happened in the morning, that he went out, and stood, and said to all the people, You are righteous: behold, I conspired against my master, and killed him; but who struck all these?

Tailo: Bé-tê kho̍k-kho̍k háu, sī in-uī kuáⁿ-kín tsàu, to̍h-sī ū la̍t ê tsáu tsin kín.
English: Then did the horse hoofs stamp By reason of the prancings, the prancings of their strong ones.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k guá beh hō͘ lín tsai, Jîn-tsú tī tē-tsiūⁿ ū sià tsuē ê kuân-pìng. Jiânāu Iésu kā piàn-suī-.ê kóng,
English: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sinshe said to the paralytic

Tailo: Nā bô lâng thang huan-i̍k, in tio̍h tiām-tiām, kan-taⁿ tuì ka-kī kah tuì Siōngtè kóng to̍h hó.
English: But if there is no interpreter, let him keep silent in the assembly, and let him speak to himself, and to God.

Tailo: Siâⁿ-siú Tse-bul thiaⁿ-tio̍h Ebiat ê kiáⁿ Ka-le̍p ê uē, tsiū siū-khì,
English: When Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed, his anger was kindled.

Tailo: Hit só͘-tsāi ū tsi̍t-ê lâng ìn kóng, Hiah-ê lâng ê lāu-pē sī siáⁿ lâng? Tsiū án-ne, ū tsi̍t kù sio̍k-gí kóng, Sàulô kám mā lia̍t tī sian-ti tiong?
English: One of the same place answered, Who is their father? Therefore it became a proverb, Is Saul also among the prophets?

Tailo: Siōngtsú tī bān-kok ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng kā I sìng-tshiú ê tshiú-ńg lu̍t khí-.lâi; tē-ki̍k ê lâng lóng khuàⁿ-tio̍h lán ê Siōngtè ê tsín-kiù.
English: Yahweh has made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú ê miâ tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lâi, I ê siū-khì to̍h khí-.lâi, ba̍t-ba̍t ê ian tshìng kuân. I ê tshuì-tûn tshiong-muá siū-khì, I ê tsi̍h tshin-tshiūnn thun-bia̍t ê hué.
English: Behold, the name of Yahweh comes from far away, burning with his anger, and in thick rising smoke. His lips are full of indignation, and his tongue is as a devouring fire.

Tailo: I ê pak-tó͘ tsia̍h pá ê sî, Siōngtè ē kàng bíng-lia̍t ê siū-khì tī i sin tsiūⁿ; i teh tsia̍h ê sî, ē kàng siū-khì tī i ê tíng-bīn.
English: When he is about to fill his belly, God will cast the fierceness of his wrath on him. It will rain on him while he is eating.

Tailo: Ehuahátsuh kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê kah i ê lîng-li̍k, kám bô lóng kì tī Isulael tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his might, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: Tsi̍t lia̍p kim hâm-lîng, tsi̍t lia̍p sia̍h-liû, tī phâu sì-kho͘-uî ê ē-kha pô͘.
English: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, on the hem of the robe round about.

Tailo: Iésu tshuā hit-ê lâng lī-khui kûn-tsiòng khì piⁿ-á, tsiū īng tsíng-thâu-á tshng ji̍p-khì i siang pîng ê hīⁿ-khang, koh phuì nuā-lâi buah i ê tshuì-tsi̍h.
English: He took him aside from the multitude, privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spat, and touched his tongue.

Tailo: Iésu ua̍t kuè-lâi khuànn i, kā i kóng, Hū-jîn lâng, tsò lí an-sim, lí ê sìn-sim hō͘ lí hó-.khì à. Hū-jîn lâng suî-sî tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said, Daughter, cheer up! Your faith has made you well. And the woman was made well from that hour.

Tailo: Guá tī siâⁿ lāi teh sì-kè kiânn ê sî, khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín teh kìng-pài ê só͘-tsāi, ū tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, tíng-bīn án-ne siá, ' hiàn hō͘ m̄-bat ê sîn. 'Lín teh kìng-pài tsit uī lín m̄-bat ê sîn, tsit-má guá beh lâi pò lín tsai.
English: For as I passed along, and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription: TO AN UNKNOWN GOD.' What therefore you worship in ignorance, this I announce to you.

Tailo: Tuà kàu Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun tsò tsè-si ê hia, i tsiū tuì iù ê mī-hún tiong tshú tsi̍t pé tshut-.lâi kah tām-po̍h-á iû, í-ki̍p só͘-ū ê jú-hiuⁿ, tsè-si tsiū kā i sio tī tuâⁿ tíng tsò kì-liām, sī hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè.
English: He shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests; and he shall take his handful of its fine flour, and of its oil, with all its frankincense; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it on the altar, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì tsiâⁿ-tsò huān tsuē, in-uī jîn-bîn khì Tàn, tī hit tsiah ê thâu-tsîng kìng-pài.
English: This thing became a sin; for the people went to worship before the one, even to Dan.

Tailo: Īng hit-ê tsi̍t-tshing tshit-pah tshit-tsa̍p-gō͘ si-khel ê gîn tsò thiāu ê kau, mā pau thiāu-táu, mā tsò i ê huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ.
English: Of the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them.

Tailo: Kuàn-tiān tio̍h īng tsiú, uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á īng puàⁿ hin, uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-káng īng saⁿ-hūn tsi-it hin, uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-á tsiū īng sì-hūn tsi-it hin; tse sī ta̍k gue̍h ê sio-tsè, tsi̍t nî ê tiong-kan, ta̍k gue̍h tio̍h án-ne.
English: Their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, and the third part of a hin for the ram, and the fourth part of a hin for a lamb: this is the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, bîn-á-tsài tsha-put-to tsit sî, guá ē tshe guá ê sù-tsiá kàu lí hia, tshiau-tshuē lí ê tshù kah lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê tshù, kiàn-nā lí só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê, in ē tshin-tshiú tuà tsáu.
English: but I will send my servants to you tomorrow about this time, and they shall search your house, and the houses of your servants; and it shall be, that whatever is pleasant in your eyes, they shall put it in their hand, and take it away.

Tailo: Lâng uī-tio̍h lí khuàⁿ hi-ké ê ī-siōng, kiânn pe̍h-tsha̍t ê tsiam-pok, kā lí hē tī siū tāng-siong pháiⁿ lâng ê ām-kún. In ê tsuē-ok kuàn-buán, in ê ji̍t-tsí kàu à.
English: while they see for you false visions, while they divine lies to you, to lay you on the necks of the wicked who are deadly wounded, whose day is come in the time of the iniquity of the end.

Tailo: īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì siàu-liân lâng kah tsāi-sik-lí; īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì bo̍k-tsiá kah i ê iûⁿ-kûn; īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì tsoh-tshân lâng kah i ê tsi̍t tuì gû; īng Lí lâi phah-tshuì tsóng-tok kah kuaⁿ-uân.
English: and with you will I break in pieces the shepherd and his flock; and with you will I break in pieces the farmer and his yoke of oxen; and with you will I break in pieces governors and deputies.

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu beh khuànn kok lāi sîng-si̍t ê lâng, hō͘ in kah guá tsò-hué tuà; kiânn tī uân-tsuân ê lō͘ ê lâng ē ho̍k-sāi guá.
English: My eyes will be on the faithful of the land, That they may dwell with me. He who walks in a perfect way, He will serve me.

Tailo: Guá tsin huann-hí khuànn-kìnn lí ê kiáⁿ-jî tiong-kan ū lâng teh tsun-tsiàu Thiⁿ-pē ê kài-bīng, tī tsin-lí tiong sing-ua̍h.
English: I rejoice greatly that I have found some of your children walking in truth, even as we have been commanded by the Father.

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t-ê bûn-tô͘ kā Iésu kóng, Tsú ah, hō͘ guá sing tńg-khì bâi-tsòng guá ê lāu-pē.
English: Another of his disciples said to him, Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.

Tailo: Guá īng ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā kî-kiû Siōngtè tsò kiàn-tsìng. Guá sī uī-tio̍h lín siat-sióng tsiah bô khì Ko-lîn-to.
English: But I call God for a witness to my soul, that I didn't come to Corinth to spare you.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tsiàu Mô͘se ê uē kiânn, tuì Aigi̍p lâng thó gîn-khì, kim-khì kah saⁿ-khò͘.
English: The children of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they asked of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and clothing.

Tailo: I ū thâi tsin tsē gû, puî ê tsing-seⁿ kah iûⁿ, tshiánn ông ê tsìng kiáⁿ kah tsè-si Abiathal, í-ki̍p kun-tiúⁿ Ioap; to̍k-to̍k lí ê lô͘-po̍k Só͘lômóng, i bô tshiánn.
English: and he has slain oxen and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and has called all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the army; but he hasn't called Solomon your servant.

Tailo: Siat-sú lín kóng, ' Guán m̄ tuà tsit só͘-tsāi', án-ne to̍h-sī lín m̄ tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè ê uē,
English: But if you say, We will not dwell in this land; so that you don't obey the voice of Yahweh your God,

Tailo: Tabi̍t an-uì i ê bó͘ Batseba, ji̍p-khì kah i tâng-pâng, i tsiū seⁿ kiáⁿ, tsiū kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Só͘lômóng, Siōngtsú mā thiàⁿ i,
English: David comforted Bathsheba his wife, and went in to her, and lay with her: and she bore a son, and he called his name Solomon. Yahweh loved him;

Tailo: M̄-thang tsiàu gōng lâng ê gōng uē lâi kā i ìn-tap, khióng-kiaⁿ lí ē kah i sio-siâng.
English: Don't answer a fool according to his folly, Lest you also be like him.

Tailo: Isulael ông kah Iôtah ông Iô-sa-huat ta̍k-ê tsē ka-kī ê tsō-uī, tshīng lé-ho̍k, tsē tī Sa-má-lī-a siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu khuah ê só͘-tsāi, tsìng sian-ti ta̍k-ê tī in ê bīn-tsîng kóng ī-giân.
English: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah sat each on his throne, arrayed in their robes, and they were sitting in an open place at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ná ē khì-sak guá? Sī án-tsuáⁿ am Lí ê bīn m̄-khuàⁿ guá?
English: Yahweh, why do you reject my soul? Why do you hide your face from me?

Tailo: Koh īng tuì Sìng Sîn só͘ tit-tio̍h it-tshè ê tô͘-iūⁿ, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú tiān ê īⁿ, sì-kho͘-uî ê pâng, Siōngtsú tiān ê kim-khò͘ kah sìng-mi̍h ê kim-khò͘ tsiah-ê tô͘-iūⁿ lóng kau hō͘ i;
English: and the pattern of all that he had by the Spirit, for the courts of the house of Yahweh, and for all the surrounding rooms, for the treasuries of the house of God, and for the treasuries of the dedicated things;

Tailo: Kuī lāi tsí ū nn̄g tè tsio̍h-pi, to̍h-sī Isulael lâng tshut Aigi̍p tē, Siōngtsú kah in li̍p-iok ê sî, Mô͘se tī Hô-lep suann só͘ hē ê, tse í-guā bô pa̍t hāng mi̍h.
English: There was nothing in the ark save the two tables of stone which Moses put there at Horeb, when Yahweh made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Nn̄g ki ê ē-bīn ū tsi̍t ki kah i sio-liân, koh nn̄g ki ê ē-bīn ū tsi̍t ki kah i sio-liân, koh nn̄g ki ê ē-bīn ū tsi̍t ki kah i sio-liân. Ting-tâi só͘ huat-tshut ê la̍k ki lóng sī án-ne.
English: and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of the lampstand.

Tailo: Guá kah suann-káu tsò hiann-tī, kah tô-tsiáu tsò tâng-phuāⁿ.
English: I am a brother to jackals, And a companion to ostriches.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh tī Sī-lô hián-hiān, in-uī Siōngtsú īng Siōngtsú ê uē tī Sī-lô tuì Samuel hián-bîng.
English: Yahweh appeared again in Shiloh; for Yahweh revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín ê kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ tshin-tshiūnn kông hong sàu-lâi, lín ê tsai-hō tshin-tshiūnn kńg-lê-á hong sàu lâi, huān-lān thòng-khó͘ lîm-kàu tī lín ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: When calamity overtakes you like a storm, When your disaster comes on like a whirlwind; When distress and anguish come on you.

Tailo: I m̄-tsai i ê ngó͘-kok, tsiú kah iû lóng sī Guá hō͘ i ê, ke-thinn i ê gîn kah kim ê mā sī Guá; i īng tsiah-ê khì ho̍k-sāi Baal.
English: For she did not know that I gave her the grain, the new wine, and the oil, And multiplied to her silver and gold, which they used for Baal.

Tailo: Tio̍h kín-sīn, tsiah bián-tit ū lâng sit-lo̍h Siōngtè ê un-tián, mā tsiah bián-tit ū to̍k-tsháu huat khí-.lâi, hō͘ tsin tsē lâng siū ù-jiám.
English: looking carefully lest there be any man who falls short of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby the many be defiled;

Tailo: Guá beh uī-tio̍h i tshî-siú Guá ê tsû-ài kàu íng-uán; Guá kah i só͘ li̍p ê iok it-tīng bē kái-piàn.
English: I will keep my loving kindness for him forevermore. My covenant will stand firm with him.

Tailo: Lín ē tit-tio̍h lín só͘ su-iàu ê tsìng-kì, lâi tsìng-bîng Ki-tok thong-kuè guá lâi teh kóng uē. Ki-tok tuì-thāi lín pīng bē nńg-tsiáⁿ, tian-tò ē tī lín tiong-kan hián-tshut tuā kuân-lîng.
English: seeing that you seek a proof of Christ who speaks in me; who toward you is not weak, but is powerful in you.

Tailo: Tong-sî tī-lí Aigi̍p tē ê sī Iôséhuh, thiò bí-niûⁿ hō͘ hit só͘-tsāi ê tsìng lâng ê mā sī i. Iôséhuh hiah-ê a-hiaⁿ lâi, phak lo̍h tē kā i pài.
English: Joseph was the governor over the land. It was he who sold to all the people of the land. Joseph's brothers came, and bowed themselves down to him with their faces to the earth.

Tailo: Lí khí-lâi khì-kàu Sitòng ê Tsa-le-phat, khì tuà tī hia. Lí khuàⁿ, Guá í-king bīng-līng hit só͘-tsāi ê tsi̍t-ê kuáⁿ-hū kā lí iúⁿ-tshī.
English: Arise, get you to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and dwell there: behold, I have commanded a widow there to sustain you.

Tailo: Tio̍h pá-ak ki-huē, tuì-thāi bī-sìn-tsiá-tio̍h ū tì-huī.
English: Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, redeeming the time.

Tailo: Kàu So͘-hut ê tē, Sàulô kā kin-tuè i ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Lâi, lán tńg lâi-.khì, khióng-kiaⁿ guá ê lāu-pē bô tshau-huân lî-á, tian-tò lâi huân-ló lán.
English: When they had come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him, Come, and let us return, lest my father leave off caring for the donkeys, and be anxious for us.

Tailo: Só͘-í, m̄-thang tsò gōng lâng, tio̍h bîng-pi̍k siáⁿ-mi̍h sī Tsú ê tsí-ì.
English: Therefore don't be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.

Tailo: Amnon kā Thamal kóng, Lí phâng tsia̍h-mi̍h ji̍p-lâi khùn-pâng, guá thang tuì lí ê tshiú tsiap lâi tsia̍h. Thamal tsiū phâng só͘ tsò ê piáⁿ ji̍p-khì khùn-pâng, kàu i ê a-hiaⁿ Amnon hia.
English: Amnon said to Tamar, Bring the food into the chamber, that I may eat from your hand. Tamar took the cakes which she had made, and brought them into the chamber to Amnon her brother.

Tailo: Iôtah, lí ê sîn-bîng ê sò͘-gia̍h kah lí ê siâⁿ ê sò͘-gia̍h pêⁿ-pêⁿ; lí mā uī-tio̍h thang kiàn-siàu ê mi̍h lâi khí tuâⁿ, tsiàu Êlúsalèm tsiah-ê ke-lō͘ ê sò͘-gia̍h, hiah-ê tuâⁿ to̍h-sī tī Baal ê bīn-tsîng sio hiuⁿ ê.
English: For according to the number of your cities are your gods, Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have you set up altars to the shameful thing, even altars to burn incense to Baal.

Tailo: Abulahàm tsiū tī hit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng àⁿ-io,
English: Abraham bowed himself down before the people of the land.

Tailo: Kî-tiong tsin tsē lâng kóng, I hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin teh khí-kông, ná tio̍h thiaⁿ I ê uē?
English: Many of them said, He has a demon, and is insane! Why do you listen to him?

Tailo: Tuā-tsè-si khiā khí-lâi tuì Iésu kóng, Tsiah-ê lâng teh kò Lí siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí ná ē lóng bô beh tap-piān?
English: The high priest stood up, and said to him, Have you no answer? What is this that these testify against you?

Tailo: Guá nā kiû o͘-àm jia-khàm guá, á-.sī sì-kho͘-uî ê kng piàn-tsò àm-mê;
English: If I say, Surely the darkness will overwhelm me; The light around me will be night;

Tailo: La̍k ji̍t lāi tio̍h lô-khó͘ tsò lí it-tshè ê kang.
English: Six days shall you labor, and do all your work;

Tailo: Kàu ê-hng, hún-tsiáu tńg-lâi i hia, tshuì kā tsi̍t hio̍h sin ê kaⁿ-ná hio̍h. Nó͘ah tsiah tsai, tsuí tuì tē-tsiūⁿ thè-.khì à.
English: The dove came back to him at evening, and, behold, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off. So Noah knew that the waters were abated from the earth.

Tailo: kóng, Esáu nā lâi kong-kik tsit tuī, tshun-ê hit-tuī iáu thang tô-tsáu.
English: and he said, If Esau comes to the one company, and strikes it, then the company which is left will escape.

Tailo: tsiū tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ; in-uī Gi-bóng sī tuā siâⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t-ê kiaⁿ-siâⁿ, pí Ai siânn khah tuā, jî-tshiánn siâⁿ lāi ê lâng lóng sī ióng-sū.
English: that they feared greatly, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities, and because it was greater than Ai, and all the men of it were mighty.

Tailo: Tsú tsí ū tsi̍t-ê, Sìng Sîn tsí ū tsi̍t-ê, sé-lé mā tsí ū tsi̍t-ê.
English: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,

Tailo: Kiû Lí thiaⁿ guán ê kiû-kiò, īng tsiàⁿ tshiú khan-kiù guán, thang hō͘ Lí só͘ thiàⁿ ê lâng tit-tio̍h kái-kiù.
English: So that your beloved may be delivered, Save with your right hand, and answer us.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá thìng-hāu Lí; Tsú — guá ê Siōngtè ah, Lí ē thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó.
English: For in you, Yahweh, do I hope. You will answer, Lord my God.

Tailo: Ta̍k tsá-khí mā tio̍h tsún-pī tsò-hué hiàn ê sò͘-tsè, tsi̍t e-huat ê la̍k-hūn tsi-it kah saⁿ-hūn tsi-it hin ê iû tshiau-hô mī-hún. Tsit-ê sò͘-tsè tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, tsò íng-uán tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē.
English: You shall prepare a meal offering with it morning by morning, the sixth part of an ephah, and the third part of a hin of oil, to moisten the fine flour; a meal offering to Yahweh continually by a perpetual ordinance.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, Tsú koh tshe-phài tshit-tsa̍p-jī lâng ( Tsù, guân pán-pún sī Tshit-tsa̍p lâng ) , tsi̍t tuì tsi̍t tuì tshe in tsò tsîng khì I só͘ beh khì ê ta̍k-ê siâⁿ kah ta̍k-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Now after these things, the Lord also appointed seventy others, and sent them two by two ahead of him into every city and place, where he was about to come.

Tailo: Hit nn̄g lâng lâi kìnn Iésu tsiū kóng, Kiânn sé-lé Iô-há-neh tshe guán lâi tshiáⁿ-mn̄g Lí, ' Lí kám sī teh beh lâi ê hit uī? Á-sī guán tio̍h koh thìng-hāu pa̍t lâng? '
English: When the men had come to him, they said, John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?'

Tailo: in-uī in tuì in ê tsó͘-sian tshut Aigi̍p ê ji̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kiânn Guá só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, lâi kik Guá siū-khì.
English: because they have done that which is evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even to this day.

Tailo: In-uī lô͘-po̍k tuà tī Alâm ê Ge-siul ê sî bat hē guān, kóng, ' Siōngtsú nā kó-jiân hō͘ guá koh tńg-lâi Êlúsalèm, guá beh ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú. '
English: For your servant vowed a vow while I abode at Geshur in Syria, saying, If Yahweh shall indeed bring me again to Jerusalem, then I will serve Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì in pìⁿ-bīn; in tuì hué tiong tshut-.lâi, tsóng-.sī, hué ē kā in sio-bia̍t. Guá tuì in pìⁿ-bīn ê sî, lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: I will set my face against them; they shall go forth from the fire, but the fire shall devour them; and you shall know that I am Yahweh, when I set my face against them.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng teh thiaⁿ ê sî, Iésu kā bûn-tô͘ kóng,
English: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah tiúⁿ-ló siàn-tōng kûn-tsiòng, kiò in tio̍h iau-kiû pàng Bala̍h-ba, kā Iésu tshú sí-hîng.
English: Now the chief priests and the elders persuaded the multitudes to ask for Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah thâu-lâng kā I ah-khì hō͘ lâng phuàⁿ sí-hîng, tìng si̍p-jī-kè.
English: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.

Tailo: Amátsiah ông kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn liáu-āu, Atsalíah khí E-lot ê siâⁿ, hō͘ i iû-guân kui Iôtah kok ê kuán-hat.
English: He built Elath, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.

Tailo: Lín thang īng tsit-ê tī lín tiong-kan tsò tsìng-kì. Ji̍t-āu lín ê kiáⁿ-sun nā mn̄g lín kóng, ' Tsiah-ê tsio̍h-thâu, tuì lín lâi kóng ū siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-gī? '
