English: that this may be a sign among you, that when your children ask in time to come, saying, What do you mean by these stones?

Tailo: Tē-gō͘-ê thiⁿ-sài tsi̍t ē pûn, guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t lia̍p tsheⁿ tuì thinn-tíng lak lo̍h tē. Tsit lia̍p tsheⁿ ū niá-siū bô-té tshim kheⁿ ê só-sî.
English: The fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star from the sky which had fallen to the earth. The key to the pit of the abyss was given to him.

Tailo: Guá ē-tàng kā lín tsìng-bîng, in kam-guān tsīn-la̍t hōng-hiàn, sīm-tsì tshiau-kuè in ê li̍k-liōng.
English: For according to their power, I testify, yes and beyond their power, they gave of their own accord,

Tailo: Bô sàng lé kan-taⁿ khua-kháu lé-mi̍h guā hó ê lâng, ná tshin-tshiūnn ū hong ū hûn ā bô lo̍h hō͘.
English: As clouds and wind without rain, So is he who boasts of gifts deceptively.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: Also the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Á tsá-khí sî lín kóng, ' Kin-á-ji̍t ū hong-hō͘, in-uī thiⁿ-sik o͘-àm koh âng. 'Lín ē-hiáu hun-pia̍t thiⁿ-sik, ná ē bē-hiáu hun-pia̍t sî-tāi ê tiāu-thâu?
English: In the morning, It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.' Hypocrites! You know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but you can't discern the signs of the times!

Tailo: Lāu sian-ti tsiū kā i kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kah guá lâi-khì guán tau tsia̍h piáⁿ.
English: Then he said to him, Come home with me, and eat bread.

Tailo: Kám-siā hit uī tsò tuā kî-sū ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: To him who alone does great wonders; For his loving kindness endures forever:

Tailo: Siōngtsú kiù-sio̍k I ê lô͘-po̍k ê sîn-hûn; uá-khò I ê lâng bô kah tsi̍t-ê siū tīng tsuē.
English: Yahweh redeems the soul of his servants. None of those who take refuge in him shall be condemned.

Tailo: Tuì lâm-hong ê tshiū-nâ kóng, tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú ê uē. Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tī lí tiong-kan khí hué, sio lí tiong-kan it-tshè tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tshiū kah ta-.khì ê tshiū, bíng-lia̍t ê hué-iām it-tīng bô sit. Tuì lâm kàu pak, ta̍k bīn lóng siū sio.
English: and tell the forest of the South, Hear the word of Yahweh: Thus says the Lord Yahweh, Behold, I will kindle a fire in you, and it shall devour every green tree in you, and every dry tree: the flaming flame shall not be quenched, and all faces from the south to the north shall be burnt thereby.

Tailo: I tio̍h kā sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê gû-káng-á só͘-ū ê iû lóng the̍h khí-.lâi, khàm pak-lāi ê iû kah pak-lāi só͘-ū ê iû,
English: He shall take all the fat of the bull of the sin offering off of it; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards,

Tailo: Guá bē pàng lín tsò ko͘-tuaⁿ ê lâng, guá ē koh tńg-lâi lín tsia.
English: I will not leave you orphans. I will come to you.

Tailo: Tì-sú Siōngtsú tshian-suá Isulael lī-khui I ê bīn-tsîng, tsiàu I thok I ê lô͘-po̍k tsìng sian-ti só͘ kóng ê. Án-ne Isulael siū lia̍h, lī-khui pún-tē khì-kàu Asiul, ti̍t-kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: until Yahweh removed Israel out of his sight, as he spoke by all his servants the prophets. So Israel was carried away out of their own land to Assyria to this day.

Tailo: Guá tsit-má teh kóng ê m̄-sī Tsú ê ì-sù, sī guá tsò tsi̍t-ê gōng lâng teh khua-kháu.
English: That which I speak, I don't speak according to the Lord, but as in foolishness, in this confidence of boasting.

Tailo: Hit sî, i í-king phah-iâⁿ tuà tī Hesibóng ê Amô͘lī ông Sihông kah tuà tī E-tu-lé kah A-su-tha-lo͘t ê Basiáng ông O͘k.
English: after he had struck Sihon the king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, who lived in Ashtaroth, at Edrei.

Tailo: Thiⁿ buē kng, i tsiū khí-.lâi, uī tshù lāi ê lâng tsún-pī tsia̍h-mi̍h, koh kā ing-kai tsò ê kang hun-phài hō͘ lú-pī.
English: She rises also while it is yet night, Gives food to her household, And portions for her servant girls.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Io-a-si ông jī-tsa̍p saⁿ nî, tsè-si iáu-buē kā tiān phò-huāi ê só͘-tsāi siu-lí hó-sè.
English: But it was so, that in the three and twentieth year of king Jehoash the priests had not repaired the breaches of the house.

Tailo: I teh tha̍k ê hit-tuāⁿ king-tián sī, I tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ hō͘ lâng khan khì thâi, tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ-á tī tsián-mn̂g ê lâng bīn-tsîng bô tshut siaⁿ, lóng bô khui tshuì.
English: Now the passage of the Scripture which he was reading was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter. As a lamb before his shearer is silent, So he doesn't open his mouth.

Tailo: Isulael ông tsiū ut-būn bô huann-hí, tńg-khì Sa-má-lī-a i ê tshù.
English: The king of Israel went to his house sullen and angry, and came to Samaria.

Tailo: Ahap tsiū kiò i ê kuán-ke Obatiah lâi. ( Obatiah put-tsí kìng-uì Siōngtsú,
English: Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. ( Now Obadiah feared Yahweh greatly:

Tailo: Kuè tsin kú, Iôtah ê bó͘ Siú-ua ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ sí. Iôtah siū an-uì liáu-āu, tsiū kah i ê pîng-iú A-tu-lâm lâng Hi-la̍h tsiūⁿ-khì Tim-nah, kàu kā i tsián iûⁿ-mn̂g ê lâng hia.
English: After many days, Shua's daughter, the wife of Judah, died. Judah was comforted, and went up to his sheepshearers to Timnah, he and his friend Hirah, the Adullamite.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Mô͘se ê lu̍t-huat án-tsuáⁿ kui-tīng?
English: He answered, What did Moses command you?

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lí kóng, lí siàu-liân ê sî ka-kī pa̍k khò͘-tuà, suî-piān khì lí ài khì ê só͘-tsāi; to̍k-to̍k kàu nî lāu ê sî, lí tio̍h tshun tshiú hō͘ lâng kā lí pa̍k, kā lí thua kàu lí bô ài khì ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don't want to go.

Tailo: Tī huē-bō͘ tsîng ê tang pîng, to̍h-sī tī pò͘-pênn tsîng ǹg ji̍t tshut ê só͘-tsāi, tsat iâⁿ ê sī Mô͘se kah Alông, í-ki̍p i hiah-ê kiáⁿ. In siú sìng-só͘ ê tsik-jīm, to̍h-sī thè Isulael kiáⁿ-sun ê tsik-jīm. Pa̍t lâng nā kīn uá-.lâi, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: Those who encamp before the tabernacle eastward, in front of the Tent of Meeting toward the sunrise, shall be Moses, and Aaron and his sons, keeping the charge of the sanctuary for the charge of the children of Israel. The stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín tshin-tshiūnn Ísak, sī Siōngtè ìng-ín ê kiáⁿ-jî.
English: Now we, brothers, as Isaac was, are children of promise.

Tailo: Iôséhuh tńg-lâi-kàu tshù, in tsiū kā só͘ tuà-.lâi ê lé-mi̍h the̍h ji̍p-khì tshù lāi sàng hō͘ i, koh phak tī tē-.ni̍h kā i pài.
English: When Joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed themselves down to him to the earth.

Tailo: Siōngtsú sī Siōngtè, I ê kng tsiò guán; tio̍h īng soh-á pa̍k tsè-sū ê tsing-seⁿ, lâi-kàu tuâⁿ-kak.
English: Yahweh is God, and he has given us light. Bind the sacrifice with cords, even to the horns of the altar.

Tailo: In-uī tshuē-tio̍h guá ê lâng tsiū ē tshuē-tio̍h ua̍h-miā, mā ē tuì Siōngtsú tit-tio̍h un-huī.
English: For whoever finds me, finds life, And will obtain favor from Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá pua̍h lo̍h-khì thô͘-kha, thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū siaⁿ tuì guá kóng, ' Sàulô, Sàulô, lí ná ē beh pik-hāi guá? '
English: I fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to me, Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?'

Tailo: I tio̍h uī-tio̍h sìng ê sìng-só͘ sio̍k-tsuē, mā uī-tio̍h huē-bō͘ kah tsè-tuâⁿ sio̍k-tsuē, koh uī-tio̍h só͘-ū ê tsè-si kah tsuân huē-tsiòng ê jîn-bîn sio̍k-tsuē.
English: Then he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary; and he shall make atonement for the Tent of Meeting and for the altar; and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the assembly.

Tailo: Nā-sī tsing-seⁿ, to̍h-sī lâng hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò lé-mi̍h ê, lóng tio̍h hun-pia̍t i tsò sìng.
English: If it is an animal, of which men offer an offering to Yahweh, all that any man gives of such to Yahweh becomes holy.

Tailo: Kiû Lí siúⁿ-sù guá tì-huī kah tshong-bîng, hō͘ guá thang tshut-ji̍p tī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng, in-uī siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng sím-phuàⁿ Lí hiah tuā kok ê jîn-bîn?
English: Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people; for who can judge this your people, that is so great?

Tailo: In-uī in tī hit-ê só͘-tsāi lâu lâng ê hueh, koh in-uī in īng ngó͘-siōng kā i uè lah-sap, só͘-í, Guá piàⁿ-tshut Guá ê siū-khì tī i ê tíng-bīn.
English: Therefore I poured out my wrath on them for the blood which they had poured out on the land, and because they had defiled it with their idols;

Tailo: Mô͘ap kûn-tsiòng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit saⁿ-ê ông khí-.lâi, beh kah in kau-tsiàn, tsiū tsū-tsi̍p kiàn-nā ē gia̍h ke-si ê, bô-lūn ló-iù, lóng khiā tī pian-kài.
English: Now when all the Moabites heard that the kings had come up to fight against them, they gathered themselves together, all who were able to put on armor, and upward, and stood on the border.

Tailo: In tsiū kā Páulô thua kàu A-lí-o suaⁿ ê huat-īⁿ, kā i kóng, Lí teh kóng lūn ê sin ha̍k-suat kám ē-tàng pò guán tsai?
English: They took hold of him, and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new teaching is, which is spoken by you?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, ko-bîng ê lâng kè-uē ko-bîng ê tāi-tsì, mā kú-tn̂g tiàm tī ko-bîng.
English: But the noble devises noble things; And he will continue in noble things.

Tailo: Ông, hit-ê kái-bîng sī án-ne: Ū Tsì-kuân-.ê ê bīng-līng ē kàu tī guá ê ông, guá ê tsú.
English: this is the interpretation, O king, and it is the decree of the Most High, which is come on my lord the king:

Tailo: I tsiū kóng, Lí sī siáⁿ lâng? I ìn kóng, Guá sī lí ê lú-pī Lùthuh; tshiáⁿ lí īng lí ê saⁿ-á-ki lâi khàm lí ê lú-pī, in-uī lí sī guá ê tshin-tso̍k.
English: He said, Who are you? She answered, I am Ruth your handmaid: spread therefore your skirt over your handmaid; for you are a near kinsman.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, m̄-thang án-ne, in-uī guá só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê hong-siaⁿ sī m̄-hó, lín hō͘ Siōngtsú ê tsú-bîn huān tsuē.
English: No, my sons; for it is no good report that I hear: you make Yahweh's people to disobey.

Tailo: Αpsalôm tuà tī Êlúsalèm muá nn̄g nî, lóng bô kìnn ông ê bīn.
English: Absalom lived two full years in Jerusalem; and he didn't see the king's face.

Tailo: Lín só͘ khuànn-kìnn, lín só͘ bat ê tsit-ê pái-kha-.ê, i tuì sìn-khò Iésu ê miâ lâi tit-tio̍h khuì-la̍t. I in-uī sìn-khò Iésu ê miâ tsiū uân-tsuân hó khí-.lâi, lín tāi-ke lóng ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-hāng tāi-tsì.
English: By faith in his name has his name made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

Tailo: Ū lâng tú-á teh bâi-tsòng sí-lâng, hut-jiân khuàⁿ-tio̍h kui tīn lâng, tsiū kā sí-lâng hiat tī Elísiah ê bōng, sí-lâng tsi̍t-ē kha̍p-tio̍h Elísiah ê kut-thâu, tsiū koh-ua̍h khiā khí-.lâi.
English: It happened, as they were burying a man, that behold, they spied a band; and they cast the man into the tomb of Elisha: and as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet.

Tailo: Nā lī-khui, tsiū tio̍h siú to̍k-sin, nā bô, tio̍h koh kah in ang hô-hó; tsa-po͘ lâng mā m̄-thang pàng-sak in bó͘.
English: ( but if she departs, let her remain unmarried, or else be reconciled to her husband ) , and that the husband not leave his wife.

Tailo: Bô-kè-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kah siàu-lí kuan-sim Tsú ê tāi-tsì, sī beh hō͘ i ê sing-khu kah sim-sîn lóng sìng-kiat. M̄-koh, kè-ang ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tshau-huân sè-kan ê tāi-tsì, bo̍k-tik sī beh hō͘ in ang huann-hí.
English: There is also a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit. But she who is married cares about the things of the worldhow she may please her husband.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lí í-king kóng à, m̄-koh, guá kā lín kóng, tuì tann í-āu lín ē khuànn-kìnn Jîn-tsú tsē tī Tsuân-lîng-.ê ê tsiànn pîng, tsē thinn-tíng ê hûn kàng-lîm. ( tsù, TE 7:13 )
English: Jesus said to him, You have said it. Nevertheless, I tell you, henceforth you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of the sky.

Tailo: Piattò͘ siūⁿ-khí Iésu só͘ kóng ê uē, Ke thî tsìn-tsîng, lí ē saⁿ pái m̄ jīn guá. I tsiū tshut-khì guā-bīn tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu.
English: Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said to him, Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times. He went out and wept bitterly.

Tailo: I bat ha̍k-si̍p Tsú ê lō͘, koh jia̍t-sim kā Iésu ê tāi-tsì siông-sè kóng-lâi kà-sī lâng; suî-jiân i kan-taⁿ tsai Iô-há-neh ê sé-lé niā-niā.
English: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus, although he knew only the baptism of John.

Tailo: koh tio̍h tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ kah Êlúsalèm suan-iông kóng, Lín tio̍h tshut-khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tshú kaⁿ-ná tshiū-ki, iá kaⁿ-ná tshiū-ki, pa̍t-á tshiū-ki, tsó tshiū-ki, ām-tshiū ê tshiū-ki, lâi tsiàu só͘ kì-tsài ê tah tsháu-liâu.
English: and that they should publish and proclaim in all their cities, and in Jerusalem, saying, Go forth to the mountain, and get olive branches, and branches of wild olive, and myrtle branches, and palm branches, and branches of thick trees, to make booths, as it is written.

Tailo: Akisi ùn Tabi̍t kóng, Guá tsai lí tī guá ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng sī hó, ná tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá; tsóng-.sī, Huilīsū lâng ê siú-líng kóng, ' Tsit-ê lâng m̄-thang kah lán khì kau-tsiàn. '
English: Achish answered David, I know that you are good in my sight, as an angel of God: notwithstanding the princes of the Philistines have said, He shall not go up with us to the battle.

Tailo: Tī I ê tn̂g-phàu kah kha-thuí ū siá tsi̍t-ê miâ, to̍h-sī Bān-ông ê Ông, bān-tsú ê Tsú .
English: He has on his garment and on his thigh a name written, KING OF KINGS, AND LORD OF LORDS.

Tailo: Koh tsi̍t hāng, guá tio̍h ho̍k-sāi siáⁿ lâng? Kám m̄-sī tī i ê kiáⁿ ê bīn-tsîng? Guá án-tsuáⁿ tī lí ê lāu-pē ê bīn-tsîng ho̍k-sāi, mā ē án-ne tī lí ê bīn-tsîng ho̍k-sāi.
English: Again, whom should I serve? Shouldn't I serve in the presence of his son? as I have served in your father's presence, so will I be in your presence.

Tailo: Lēbī lâng ê thâu-lâng Ke-na-niah sī kuán-lí tshiùⁿ kua ê, koh kà lâng tshiùⁿ kua, in-uī i tsing-thong tsit-ê.
English: Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was over the song: he instructed about the song, because he was skillful.

Tailo: Guá beh kā in kau tī in ê tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú kah siàu-siūⁿ in ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ê tshiú; in ê sin-si ē hō͘ khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê iá-siù tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life; and their dead bodies shall be for food to the birds of the sky, and to the animals of the earth.

Tailo: In bâi-ho̍k beh hāi guá ê sèⁿ-miā; ū hiong-ok ê lâng tsū-tsi̍p lâi beh kong-kik guá. Siōngtsú ah, tse m̄-sī in-uī guá ê kuè-sit, mā m̄-sī in-uī guá ê tsuē-kò.
English: For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul. The mighty gather themselves together against me, Not for my disobedience, nor for my sin, Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê ang-î ê kiáⁿ, kan-hu kah ki-lí ê tsíng-luī, lóng tio̍h tsìn-tsîng lâi.
English: But draw near here, you sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the prostitute.

Tailo: Guá ê lāu-pē — Tabi̍t sim-lāi pún ū ì-sù, beh uī Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè ê miâ khí tiān.
English: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Guá uī i siá Guá ê lu̍t-huat tsiâⁿ-bān tiâu, tsóng-.sī, i kā i khuàⁿ-tsò kah i lóng bô kuan-hē.
English: I wrote for him the many things of my law; But they were regarded as a strange thing.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Tsun-tsiàu tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī ê tsí-ì, koh uân-sîng I ê kang-tsok, to̍h-sī guá ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: Jesus said to them, My food is to do the will of him who sent me, and to accomplish his work.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā kuè-khì kui tī hiah-ê ū tsu-keh ê, jī-tsa̍p huè í-siōng tio̍h kā tsit-ê hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: Everyone who passes over to those who are numbered, from twenty years old and upward, shall give the offering to Yahweh.

Tailo: Ài siū-khì ê lâng khí sio-tseⁿ, tuā siū-khì ê lâng tsin tsē ē tì-sú huān tsuē.
English: An angry man stirs up strife, And a wrathful man abounds in sin.

Tailo: Tē-jī-ê, tē-saⁿ-ê mā lóng tshuā hit-ê hiaⁿ-só.
English: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.

Tailo: Tī tsiah-ê lâng, to̍h-sī thâu-lâng ê tiong-kan, hun-phài kò͘-mn̂g ê pan-lia̍t, tam-tng tsit-bū kah i ê hiann-tī sio-siâng, tī Siōngtsú ê tiān lâi ho̍k-sāi.
English: Of these were the divisions of the doorkeepers, even of the chief men, having offices like their brothers, to minister in the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Isulael tsuân tso̍k lóng ū huān-tio̍h Lí ê lu̍t-huat, kiânn phian-lō͘ bô tsun-thàn Lí ê uē; in-uī án-ne, tsit-ê tsiù-tsó͘ kah Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k — Mô͘se lu̍t-huat tiong só͘ kì ê tsiù-tsuā, lóng piàⁿ tī guán ê sin tsiūⁿ, in-uī guán ū tik-tsuē Lí.
English: Yes, all Israel have transgressed your law, even turning aside, that they should not obey your voice: therefore has the curse been poured out on us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God; for we have sinned against him.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh tuì guá kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to me yet again, saying,

Tailo: Tī Biāniámín ê Gi-be-at, Sàulô siú-bōng ê ping teh khuàⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Huilīsū ê tsìng kun-ping sì-suàⁿ, sì-kè luān-luān tsáu.
English: The watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and behold, the multitude melted away, and they went here and there.

Tailo: Kong-gī pó-hō͘ kiânn tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng; siâ-ok pāi-huāi huān tsuē ê lâng.
English: Righteousness guards the way of integrity, But wickedness overthrows the sinner.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hō͘ lí ê pē-bú huann-hí, tio̍h hō͘ lí ê lāu-bú khuài-lo̍k.
English: Let your father and your mother be glad! Let her who bore you rejoice!

Tailo: A-iá-lông kah i ê kau-iá, Gat-lim-móng kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng sì tsō siâⁿ.
English: Aijalon with its suburbs, Gath Rimmon with its suburbs; four cities.

Tailo: Etsula̍h khiā tī tsìng lâng ê tíng-bīn, tī tsìng lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng hian-khui hit pún tsheh. I tsi̍t-ē hian-khui, tsìng lâng tsiū lóng khiā khí-.lâi.
English: Ezra opened the book in the sight of all the people; ( for he was above all the people; ) and when he opened it, all the people stood up:

Tailo: Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn īng tshuì-tûn tsun-kìng guá, m̄-koh, in ê sim lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g.
English: These people draw near to me with their mouth, And honor me with their lips; But their heart is far from me.

Tailo: Mô͘se khuàⁿ-tio̍h it-tshè ê kang, lí khuàⁿ, in í-king tsò-tsiâⁿ, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù ê, in tsiàu án-ne tsò, Mô͘se tsiū kā in tsiok-hok.
English: Moses saw all the work, and behold, they had done it as Yahweh had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h i uá-kīn kang ê mî-iûⁿ, ǹg i huat tuā siū-khì, tak hit tsiah mî-iûⁿ, phah-tn̄g i nn̄g ki kak. Mî-iûⁿ bô la̍t thang khiā tī i ê bīn-tsîng; i tsiū hō͘ hit tsiah kang mî-iûⁿ tó tī tē-.ni̍h, kā i thún-ta̍h, bô tsi̍t-ê ē-tàng kiù mî-iûⁿ thuat-tshut i ê tshiú.
English: I saw him come close to the ram, and he was moved with anger against him, and struck the ram, and broke his two horns; and there was no power in the ram to stand before him; but he cast him down to the ground, and trampled on him; and there was none who could deliver the ram out of his hand.

Tailo: Nn̄g-ji̍t āu, Iésu lī-khui hia khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng.
English: After the two days he went out from there and went into Galilee.

Tailo: Samuel tsio-tsi̍p jîn-bîn lâi-kàu Mi-su-peh Siōngtsú hia,
English: Samuel called the people together to Yahweh to Mizpah;

Tailo: Kiû Lí tuì thinn-tíng, tuì Lí tuà ê sìng-só͘, àⁿ lo̍h-lâi khuànn, sù-hok Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng kah Lí só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ guán ê tē, tsiàu Lí só͘ tuì guán ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā ê, to̍h-sī lâu ling kah bi̍t ê tē. '
English: Look down from your holy habitation, from heaven, and bless your people Israel, and the ground which you have given us, as you swore to our fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.

Tailo: Tio̍h phah kó͘ thiàu-bú o-ló I! Īng si-hiân ê ga̍k-khì kah pûn-siau o-ló I!
English: Praise him with tambourine and dancing! Praise him with stringed instruments and flute!

Tailo: Lí hiah-ê khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, to̍h-sī tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tshân-.ni̍h kiânn kan-îm, tshut ki-ki háu ê siann, tshiong-ki khuán ê îm-luān, Guá lóng ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h. Êlúsalèm, lí ū tsai-hō à! Lí m̄-khíng tshing-khì, beh kàu tang-sî?
English: I have seen your abominations, even your adulteries, and your neighing, the lewdness of your prostitution, on the hills in the field. Woe to you, Jerusalem! you will not be made clean; how long shall it yet be?

Tailo: Iésu koh mn̄g in kóng, Á lín lè? Lín kóng guá sī siáⁿ lâng? Piattò͘ ìn kóng, Lí sī Ki-tok.
English: He said to them, But who do you say that I am? Peter answered, You are the Christ.

Tailo: Lín kóng-uē ing-kai, ' Sī' tsiū kóng ' Sī', ' M̄-sī' tsiū kóng ' M̄-sī'; kî-tha ke kóng ê, sī tuì hit-ê Mô͘-kuí tshut-.lâi ê.
English: But let your Yes' be Yes' and your No' be no.' Whatever is more than these is of the evil one.

Tailo: I kā lia̍t kok ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in, in tsiū sîng-tsiap hiah-ê jîn-bîn lô-khó͘ só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p;
English: He gave them the lands of the nations. They took the labor of the peoples in possession,

Tailo: Sàulô tshe lâng kàu Tabi̍t ê tshù kò͘-siú i, thìng-hāu thiⁿ-kng beh kā i thâi. Tabi̍t ê bó͘ Mikal tuì i kóng, Lí kim-mê nā bô tô-miā, bîn-á-tsài lí ē siū thâi.
English: Saul sent messengers to David's house, to watch him, and to kill him in the morning: and Michal, David's wife, told him, saying, If you don't save your life tonight, tomorrow you will be slain.

Tailo: Tse sī in-uī i só͘ huān ê tsuē, sī kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê, kiânn Ia-lô-ba-am ê lō͘, tsiàu án-ne kiânn só͘ huān ê tsuē, koh hō͘ Isulael lâng huān tsuē.
English: for his sins which he sinned in doing that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, in walking in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin which he did, to make Israel to sin.

Tailo: Guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ teh siàu-liām lín. Tuì lín tsìng lâng ū tsit khuán ê kám-tsîng sī tong-jiân ê tāi-tsì, in-uī bô-lūn guá tī kaⁿ-ga̍k lāi, á-.sī uī-tio̍h hok-im teh piān-hō͘ kah tsò-tsìng ê sî, lín lóng ū kah guá hun-hióng Siōngtè ê un-tián.
English: It is even right for me to think this way on behalf of all of you, because I have you in my heart, because, both in my bonds and in the defense and confirmation of the Good News, you all are partakers with me of grace.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tshò tshiū ê sî, pó͘-thâu bah ka-la̍uh tī tsuí-.ni̍h. I tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tshám ah! Guá ê Tsú ah, tsit ki pó͘-thâu sī tsioh lâi ê.
English: But as one was felling a beam, the axe head fell into the water; and he cried, and said, Alas, my master! for it was borrowed.

Tailo: Ū kau, khuah tsi̍t pa-tsiúⁿ, tìng-tiâu tī lāi-bīn ê sì-kho͘-uî; toh tíng ū tsè-bah.
English: The hooks, a handbreadth long, were fastened within round about: and on the tables was the flesh of the offering.

Tailo: Iésu kā Tho-má-suh kóng, Tshun tsíng-thâu-á lâi bong guá ê tshiú, tshun tshiú lâi bong guá ê hing-khám-piⁿ. M̄-thang giâu-gî, tio̍h siong-sìn.
English: Then he said to Thomas, Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don't be unbelieving, but believing.

Tailo: I ē khui hue bō͘-sīng lâi huann-hí, ē ū huann-hí kah tshiùⁿ kua. Le-ba-nòng ê îng-kng, Kal-mel kah Sia-lông ê suí ē kui i. In ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê îng-kng, lán ê Siōngtè ê bí-biāu.
English: It will blossom abundantly, And rejoice even with joy and singing. Lebanon's glory Lebanon will be given to it, The excellence of Carmel and Sharon. They will see Yahweh's glory, The excellence of our God.

Tailo: Guá ū lâu hó bô͘-iūⁿ hō͘ lín, sī beh hō͘ lín thang tsiàu guá tuì lín só͘ tsò ê khì tsò.
English: For I have given you an example, that you also should do as I have done to you.

Tailo: Lín lóng tsin tshing-tshó tsiah tio̍h; tshù ê tsú-lâng nā tsai tsha̍t-á tang-sî-tsūn ē kàu, it-tīng ē kíng-síng, bē hō͘ tsha̍t-á ó͘ piah-khang ji̍p-lâi tshù lāi.
English: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch of the night the thief was coming, he would have watched, and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.

Tailo: Kiû Lí si tuā-un hō͘ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, hō͘ guá ē-tàng ua̍h-.leh lâi tsun-thàn Lí ê uē.
English: Do good to your servant. I will live and I will obey your word.

Tailo: Ahisuah tsò kuán-ke ê, Amí-tah ê kiáⁿ Atonîlâm tsò tok-kang ê.
English: and Ahishar was over the household; and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the men subject to forced labor.

Tailo: Páulô kah Sela̍h king-kuè Àm-hui-po-lí, A-po-lô-nî-a, lâi-kàu The-sa-lô-nî-ke, tī hia ū Iô-tá-iah lâng ê huē-tn̂g.
English: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.

Tailo: Guā-pang lâng ná ē kóng In ê Siōngtè tī tó-uī? Guān Lí uī Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê lâu hueh lâi sin-uan, thang hō͘ guā-pang lâng tsai, koh hō͘ guán tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Why should the nations say, Where is their God? Let it be known among the nations, before our eyes, That vengeance for your servants' blood is being poured out.

Tailo: Guá beh án-ne sím-phuàⁿ Aigi̍p, in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: Thus will I execute judgments on Egypt; and they shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Nā-sī lín lia̍h ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú tsò m̄-hó, kin-á-ji̍t lín tio̍h kíng-suán lín só͘ beh ho̍k-sāi ê, khuànn sī lín tsó͘-sian tī tuā hô hit pîng só͘ ho̍k-sāi hiah-ê sîn-bîng, á-.sī lín só͘ tuà in ê tē ê Amô͘lī lâng hiah-ê sîn-bîng? Kóng-tio̍h guá kah guá ê ke, guán tsua̍t-tuì beh ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú.
English: If it seem evil to you to serve Yahweh, choose you this day whom you will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell: but as for me and my house, we will serve Yahweh.

Tailo: Sua-huan sī luán-jio̍k ê tōng-bu̍t, tsóng-.sī, ē-hiáu tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng khí tshù.
English: The conies are but a feeble folk, Yet make they their houses in the rocks;

Tailo: Só͘ ì-ài ê tāi-tsì sîng-kong, sim tsiū huann-hí; gōng lâng m̄-guān lī-khui pháiⁿ tāi.
English: Longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, But fools detest turning from evil.

Tailo: Kā sé-tn̄g ê phûn hē tī huē-bō͘ kah tuâⁿ ê tiong-kan, phûn lāi té tsuí, thang sé-tn̄g.
English: He set the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water therein, with which to wash.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōngtè ah, in-uī Lí ū khé-sī hō͘ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsai, Lí ē kā i kiàn-li̍p tsi̍t-ê ke, só͘-í, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k hó-tánn tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng kî-tó.
English: For you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house: therefore has your servant found in his heart to pray before you.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, lâng tshut-sì tiāⁿ-tio̍h ū huān-lān, tshin-tshiūnn hué-tsheⁿ pue tsiūⁿ-kuân.
English: But man is born to trouble, As the sparks fly upward.

Tailo: Siâⁿ guā ū tsi̍t-ê Tse-ú-su biō ê tsè-si, i khan gû-á, the̍h hue-khuân, lâi-kàu siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, beh kah tsìng lâng tsò-hué tuì in hiàn tsè.
English: The priest of Jupiter, whose temple was in front of their city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, and would have made a sacrifice along with the multitudes.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōngtsú koh bīng-līng guá, tio̍h kā lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘ kà-sī lín, hō͘ lín tī só͘ beh kuè-.khì lâi tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē thang tsun-thàn lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Yahweh commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it.

Tailo: Kú-si̍t lâng, Put lâng, Lùt lâng, tsham-tshap ê jîn-bîn kah Ku-p lâng, í-ki̍p tông-bîng ê kok ê jîn-bîn, lóng ē kah in tsò-hué tó tī to hā.
English: Ethiopia, and Put, and Lud, and all the mixed people, and Cub, and the children of the land that is in league, shall fall with them by the sword.

Tailo: Pêⁿ-pêⁿ siū Siōngtè suán-tiàu, tsiâⁿ-tsò Ki-tok-tô͘ ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín tio̍h tshim-tshim su-khó hit uī lán só͘ sîng-jīn tsò sù-tsiá koh tsò tuā-tsè-si ê Iésu.
English: Therefore, holy brothers, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Jesus;

Tailo: Abulahàm tsiū tshun tshiú gia̍h to, beh thâi i ê kiáⁿ.
English: Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to kill his son.

Tailo: In ū tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng ê thâu-mn̂g, koh ū tshin-tshiūnn sai ê gê.
English: They had hair like women's hair, and their teeth were like those of lions.

Tailo: Ông siat-li̍p i tsò ông-ka ê tsáiⁿ-siòng, kuán-lí i it-tshè só͘-ū ê tsâi-bu̍t,
English: He made him lord of his house, And ruler of all of his possessions;

Tailo: Lí nā tshe guán sió-tī kah guán tsò-hué khì, guán tsiū lo̍h-.khì, kā lí tia̍h bí-niûⁿ.
English: If you'll send our brother with us, we'll go down and buy you food,

Tailo: Guá tsiàu kong-gī hing-khí Ko-le-si, koh beh siu-ti̍t i it-tshè ê lō͘; i beh khí-tsō Guá ê siâⁿ, tháu-pàng Guá siū lia̍h ê tsú-bîn, m̄-sī uī-tio̍h kè-tsîⁿ, mā m̄-sī uī-tio̍h pò-siúⁿ. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: I have raised him up in righteousness, and I will make straight all his ways: he shall build my city, and he shall let my exiles go free, not for price nor reward, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Mô͘se kóng, Tsú ah, Lí kah-ì tshe siáⁿ lâng, tsiū tshe i khì!
English: He said, Oh, Lord, please send someone else.

Tailo: Isulael lâng iā tsíng liáu-āu, Mítiân lâng, Amáli̍k lâng kah tang-hong ê lâng, lóng khí-lâi kā in kong-kik.
English: So it was, when Israel had sown, that the Midianites came up, and the Amalekites, and the children of the east; they came up against them;

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tsū-tsi̍p uá-.khì, iau-kiû Pí-la̍h-to tsiàu kuàn-lē lâi pàng tsi̍t-ê huān-lâng.
English: The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them.

Tailo: Siat-sú tsa-bó͘ gín-á m̄-khíng tuè lí lâi, guá kah lí tsiù ê tsuā tsiū kah lí bô kuan-hē; tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang tshuā guá ê kiáⁿ tńg-khì hia.
English: If the woman isn't willing to follow you, then you shall be clear from this my oath. Only you shall not bring my son there again.

Tailo: In-uī I īng tuā hong phah guá; bô-iân bô-kò͘ ke-thinn guá ê siong.
English: For he breaks me with a tempest, Multiplies my wounds without cause.

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ Nebutsalatàn tsiū kā jîn-bîn tiong sàn kàu bô puàⁿ-hāng ê lâng lâu tī Iôtah tē, tong-sî mā hō͘ in phû-tô hn̂g kah tshân.
English: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, who had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.

Tailo: Huē tiong siū-sǹg ê lâng só͘ tshut ê gîn, tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê tshìn-á lâi tshìn, ū tsi̍t-pah tha-lan-t koh tsi̍t-tshing tshit-pah tshit-tsa̍p-gō͘ si-khel.
English: The silver of those who were numbered of the congregation was one hundred talents, and one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:

Tailo: In-uī tse sī ' hîng-hua̍t ê ji̍t-tsí', sī beh ìng-giām king-tián só͘ kì-tsài ê it-tshè.
English: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

Tailo: Isulael ông kah Iôtah ông Iô-sa-huat, ta̍k-ê tsē i ka-kī ê tsō-uī, tshīng lé-ho̍k, tī Sa-má-lī-a siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi, tsìng sian-ti ta̍k-ê tī in ê bīn-tsîng ī-giân.
English: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah were sitting each on his throne, arrayed in their robes, in an open place at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.

Tailo: I bô tsun-thàn só͘ tuì i kóng ê uē, bô siū kà-sī, bô uá-khò Siōngtsú, bô tshin-kīn i ê Siōngtè.
English: She didn't obey the voice. She didn't receive correction. She didn't trust in Yahweh. She didn't draw near to her God.

Tailo: Taⁿ Siōngtè beh tī hiān-kim ê sè-tāi, thong-kuè kàu-huē, hō͘ thian-kài ê tsip-tsìng-tsiá kah tsiáng-kuân-tsiá lóng tsai I ta̍k hāng ê tì-huī.
English: to the intent that now through the assembly the manifold wisdom of God might be made known to the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places,

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, sī hông hiat tī hué-.ni̍h tsò hué-tshâ, siang thâu í-king hō͘ hué sio liáu-liáu, tiong-ng mā sio-tiāu, kám iáu ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lō͘-īng?
English: Behold, it is cast into the fire for fuel; the fire has devoured both the ends of it, and the midst of it is burned: is it profitable for any work?

Tailo: Pik-hāi guá ê, tí-ti̍k guá ê lâng tsin tsē, tsóng-.sī, guá bô phian-lī Lí ê kà-sī.
English: Many are my persecutors and my adversaries. I haven't swerved from your testimonies.

Tailo: i ê lāu-pē thiaⁿ-tio̍h i só͘ hē ê guān kah iok-sok ka-kī ê iok, i ê lāu-pē nā tiām-tiām bô tshap i, i só͘ hē tsiah-ê guān tsiū it-tīng sîng-li̍p, i só͘ ka-kī iok-sok ê iok mā it-tīng sîng-li̍p.
English: and her father hears her vow, and her bond with which she has bound her soul, and her father holds his peace at her; then all her vows shall stand, and every bond with which she has bound her soul shall stand.

Tailo: Isáiah án-ne kóng sī in-uī i ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu ê îng-kng, tsiah kóng kuan-hē I ê tāi-tsì.
English: Isaiah said these things when he saw his glory, and spoke of him.

Tailo: ' Mā m̄-thang tsò ké ê kiàn-tsìng, lâi hām-hāi lí ê tshù-piⁿ.
English: Neither shall you give false testimony against your neighbor.

Tailo: Lín kám iáu-koh bē liáu-kái? Lín kám bē kì-tit guá hō͘ gō͘-tshing lâng tsia̍h gō͘ tè piáⁿ, tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê líng ū khioh kuí nâ?
English: Don't you yet perceive, neither remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?

Tailo: Lâng ē kóng, ' Sī in-uī in khì-sak Siōngtsú — in tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè ê iok, sī I tshuā in tshut Aigi̍p tē ê sî só͘ li̍p ê,
English: Then men shall say, Because they forsook the covenant of Yahweh, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the land of Egypt,

Tailo: In kā só͘-ū hiàn tī Siōngtsú tiān ê gîn tuà tshut-khì ê sî, tsè-si Hilkíiah ngó͘-jiân tit-tio̍h Mô͘se só͘ thuân Siōngtsú lu̍t-huat ê tsheh.
English: When they brought out the money that was brought into the house of Yahweh, Hilkiah the priest found the book of the law of Yahweh given by Moses.

Tailo: Tng i tsē-uī ê sî, ū Bethel lâng Hiel tîng khí I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ; hē tē-ki ê sî, sí tuā-kiáⁿ Amí-lâm, hē mn̂g ê sî, sí suah-bué kiánn Se-gup, tú tsiàu Siōngtsú thok Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: In his days did Hiel the Bethelite build Jericho: he laid the foundation of it with the loss of Abiram his firstborn, and set up the gates of it with the loss of his youngest son Segub, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke by Joshua the son of Nun.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū tshun i ê kuái-á, kí Aigi̍p tē. Siōngtsú tsiū hō͘ tang-hong kui ji̍t kui mê tshue tī tē-.ni̍h. Kàu bîn-á tsá-khí, tang-hong tsiū kā tsháu-me̍h tshue-.lâi.
English: Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt, and Yahweh brought an east wind on the land all that day, and all the night; and when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.

Tailo: Lótoh tiàm tī Tso-al ū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, tsiū kah i nn̄g-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tuì Tso-al tsiūⁿ-khì tiàm tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h; i kah nn̄g-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tiàm tī tsi̍t-ê tōng lāi.
English: Lot went up out of Zoar, and lived in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he was afraid to live in Zoar. He lived in a cave with his two daughters.

Tailo: Siōngtsú īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú tsí-sī guá, īng uē kíng-kài guá kóng m̄-thang kiânn tsiah-ê jîn-bîn só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘. I tuì guá kóng,
English: For Yahweh spoke thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me not to walk in the way of this people, saying,

Tailo: Tī lí ê sì-kho͘-uî-á lāi, tshit ji̍t lóng m̄-thang khuàⁿ-tio̍h kàⁿ, thâu tsi̍t ji̍t ê-hng só͘ hiàn ê tsè-bah, m̄-thang lâu tsi̍t-tiám-á kàu thiⁿ-kng.
English: There shall be no yeast seen with you in all your borders seven days; neither shall any of the flesh, which you sacrifice the first day at even, remain all night until the morning.

Tailo: Tī ông-kiong lāi ê thài-kàm — Kú-si̍t lâng E-bia̍t-me-li̍k thiaⁿ-tio̍h in kā I-é-lí-miah luī-lo̍h tséⁿ ( hit sî, ông tsē tī Biāniámín mn̂g-kháu ) .
English: Now when Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, a eunuch, who was in the king's house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon ( the king then sitting in the gate of Benjamin ) ,

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lí só͘ kóng ê uē ē tsin kín tsiânn, kàu tsiânn ê sî, in tsiū ē tsai bat ū sian-ti tī in tiong-kan.
English: When this comes to pass, ( behold, it comes ) , then shall they know that a prophet has been among them.

Tailo: Sàulô huan-hù i ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Lí tio̍h kā guá tshuē ang-î, hō͘ guá thang khì i hia mn̄g i. Lô͘-po̍k kóng, Tī Ian-tol ū tsi̍t-ê ang-î.
English: Then said Saul to his servants, Seek me a woman who has a familiar spirit, that I may go to her, and inquire of her. His servants said to him, Behold, there is a woman who has a familiar spirit at Endor.

Tailo: Kah Ki-tok kiat-liân ê lâng, bē kè-sio̍k huān tsuē; kè-sio̍k huān tsuē ê lâng, m̄-bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ki-tok, mā lóng m̄-bat I.
English: Whoever remains in him doesn't sin. Whoever sins hasn't seen him, neither knows him.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tsiū kóng, Lí kiânn siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-jiah hō͘ guán khuànn, thang hō͘ guán lâi sìn Lí? Lí beh tsò ê kang sī siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: They said therefore to him, What then do you do for a sign, that we may see, and believe you? What work do you do?

Tailo: Mā m̄-thang uī ka-kī tshāi tiau-khik ê thiāu, tse sī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ uàn-hūn ê.
English: Neither shall you set yourself up a pillar; which Yahweh your God hates.

Tailo: Lí tsi̍t-sì-lâng kàu íng-uán m̄-thang kah in tô͘-bô͘ pîng-an kah hok-khì.
English: You shall not seek their peace nor their prosperity all your days forever.

Tailo: Taⁿ suaⁿ-.ni̍h ê tsháu, kin-á-ji̍t teh ua̍h, bîn-á-tsài to̍h hō͘ lâng hiat lo̍h-khì hué-lô͘, Siōngtè iáu-koh án-ne teh kā in táⁿ-pān, I kám bē koh khah kā lín khuàⁿ-kò͘? Lín ná ē tsiah-ni̍h bô sìn-sim?
English: But if this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?

Tailo: tī Náhuthalím tsi-tso̍k ê tē, ū Ga-lí-la-iah ê Ketésih kah i ê kau-iá, Ham-móng kah i ê kau-iá, Ki-lia̍t-tháim kah i ê kau-iá.
English: and out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its suburbs, and Hammon with its suburbs, and Kiriathaim with its suburbs.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ê lâng, sī tī kng-bîng tiong teh sing-ua̍h, bē tì-sú hō͘ lâng pua̍h-tó huān tsuē.
English: He who loves his brother remains in the light, and there is no occasion for stumbling in him.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì tuì Sàulô kóng, i tsiū tshe pa̍t-ê sù-tsiá khì, in mā kóng sian-ti uē. Sàulô tē-saⁿ pái tshe sù-tsiá khì, in mā kóng sian-ti uē.
English: When it was told Saul, he sent other messengers, and they also prophesied. Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they also prophesied.

Tailo: Tsú ê Sìng Sîn lîm-kàu guá, in-uī I īng iû buah guá, hō͘ guá thuân hok-im hō͘ sàn-tshiah lâng. I tshe-phài guá lâi suan-pò͘ kóng, siū lia̍h ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h tháu-pàng, tsheⁿ-mê-.ê ē khuànn-kìnn, siū ap-pik ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h tsū-iû,
English: The Spirit of the Lord is on me, Because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to heal the brokenhearted, To proclaim release to the captives, Recovering of sight to the blind, To deliver those who are crushed,

Tailo: Taⁿ lí tio̍h si un hō͘ lí ê lô͘-po̍k, in-uī lí tsá-tsîng ū hō͘ lí ê lô͘-po̍k kah lí kí Siōngtsú lâi kiat iok. Guá nā ū tsuē, tshiáⁿ lí pún-sin thâi guá, ná tio̍h tuà guá kàu lí ê lāu-pē hia?
English: Therefore deal kindly with your servant; for you have brought your servant into a covenant of Yahweh with you: but if there be in me iniquity, kill me yourself; for why should you bring me to your father?

Tailo: Guá tshut bīng-līng, lâng tsiū tshing-khì hiah-ê pâng-king; jiân-āu guá kā Siōngtè tiān lāi ê khì-kū kah sò͘-tsè, jú-hiuⁿ, koh puaⁿ ji̍p-.khì.
English: Then I commanded, and they cleansed the chambers: and there brought I again the vessels of the house of God, with the meal offerings and the frankincense.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ Guá koh tsun-siú Guá kài-bīng ê lâng, Guá ē si un hō͘ i, it-ti̍t kàu tshing-tāi.
English: and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kám ū tsò bē-kàu ê tāi-tsì? Sî-kan nā kàu, mê-nî ê tsit sî, guá ē koh lâi lí tsia, Sala̍h ē seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ.
English: Is anything too hard for Yahweh? At the set time I will return to you, when the season comes round, and Sarah will have a son.

Tailo: Tsit saⁿ lâng tiong-kan, lí siūⁿ tó tsi̍t-ê sī tú-tio̍h thó͘-huí hit-ê lâng ê tshù-piⁿ?
English: Now which of these three do you think seemed to be a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì teh beh huat-sing ê sî, lín tio̍h gia̍h thâu thíng-hing, in-uī lín ê tit-kiù teh beh kàu à.
English: But when these things begin to happen, look up, and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá tuì Manouah kóng, Guá kā tsa-bó͘ lâng só͘ kóng it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, i lóng tio̍h tsim-tsiok.
English: The angel of Yahweh said to Manoah, Of all that I said to the woman let her beware.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t tiâu lō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò sī tsìng-ti̍t, kàu bué ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sí-bông ê lō͘.
English: There is a way which seems right to a man, But in the end it leads to death.

Tailo: Guá taⁿ kiû Lí, guān Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ, ba̍k-tsiu khuànn, thiaⁿ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsit sî mê-ji̍t uī Lí ê lô͘-po̍k Isulael lâng lâi kî-tó, tī Lí bīn-tsîng ê kî-tó, sîng-jīn Isulael lâng ê tsuē, to̍h-sī guán ū tik-tsuē Lí; guá kah guá ê lāu-pē ê ke lóng ū tsuē.
English: Let your ear now be attentive, and your eyes open, that you may listen to the prayer of your servant, which I pray before you at this time, day and night, for the children of Israel your servants while I confess the sins of the children of Israel, which we have sinned against you. Yes, I and my father's house have sinned:

Tailo: Kì-jiân Siōngtè liân-bín guán, kā tsit-ê jīm-bū kau-thok guán, guán tsiū bô koh lué-tsì.
English: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, even as we obtained mercy, we don't faint.

Tailo: Lí tuì Siōngtè hē guān, siā guān m̄-thang iân-tshiân; in-uī I bô huann-hí gû-gōng ê lâng, lí só͘ hē ê guān ing-kai tio̍h siā.
English: When you vow a vow to God, don't defer to pay it; for he has no pleasure in fools. Pay that which you vow.

Tailo: I tuì hn̄g-hn̄g khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu, tsiū tsáu-lâi phak tuà Iésu ê bīn-tsîng,
English: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,

Tailo: Kong-pêⁿ kah gī-lí sī Lí pó-tsō ê tē-ki; tsû-ài kah sìn-si̍t kiânn tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne. Loving kindness and truth go before your face.

Tailo: Lēbī lâng tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng ê, lóng king-kuè tiám-sǹg, tsiàu só͘ tiám-sǹg tsa-po͘ lâng ê gia̍h-sò͘, kiōng saⁿ-bān peh-tshing.
English: The Levites were numbered from thirty years old and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty-eight thousand.

Tailo: Uē hiah tsē, kám m̄-tio̍h ìn? Kāu-uē ê lâng, kám thang kiò-tsò gī?
English: Shouldn't the multitude of words be answered? Should a man full of talk be justified?

Tailo: Iū-koh ài tī tuā lō͘-kháu hō͘ lâng tshíng-an, mā ài hō͘ lâng tshing-ho͘ in tsò ' La̍h-bí' ( lāu-su ) .
English: the salutations in the marketplaces, and to be called Rabbi, Rabbi' by men.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsò ông, lia̍t pang to̍h phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah! I tsē tī ki-lō͘-ping, tē to̍h iô-tāng.
English: Yahweh reigns! Let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned among the cherubim. Let the earth be moved.

Tailo: m̄-thang tsiūⁿ-.khì, in-uī Siōngtsú bô tī lín tiong-kan, khióng-kiaⁿ lín ē hō͘ tuì-ti̍k phah-pāi.
English: Don't go up, for Yahweh isn't among you; that you not be struck down before your enemies.

Tailo: I nā bô koh kè sī koh khah ū hok-khì. Tse sī guá ê siūⁿ-huat; tsóng-.sī, guá siūⁿ guá mā ū siū Siōngtè ê Sìng Sîn khé-sī.
English: But she is happier if she stays as she is, in my judgment, and I think that I also have God's Spirit.

Tailo: M̄-thang tsiàu guā-māu-lâi phuàⁿ-tuàn lâng, tio̍h tsiàu kong-tō lâi phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: Don't judge according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.

Tailo: Tī iàn-si̍k ê tshit ji̍t lāi, i tī tiōng-hu ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu, kàu tē-tshit ji̍t tsiū kā i kóng, in-uī i pik i tsin thiám, i ê bó͘ tsiū kā i pún-kok ê lâng kóng.
English: She wept before him the seven days, while their feast lasted: and it happened on the seventh day, that he told her, because she pressed him sore; and she told the riddle to the children of her people.

Tailo: Tsè-si tiong ê tsa-po͘ ting lóng tio̍h tsia̍h tsiah-ê mi̍h, tī sìng ê só͘-tsāi tsia̍h, tse sī tsì-sìng ê.
English: Every male among the priests may eat of it. It shall be eaten in a holy place. It is most holy.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Isulael lâng ho̍k-sāi Mô͘ap ông Egúlóng tsa̍p-peh nî.
English: The children of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen years.

Tailo: Koh ū lu̍t-huat án-ne kóng, ' Lâng nā beh kah i ê bó͘ lî-hun, tio̍h hō͘ i lî-hun-su. ' ( tsù, SBK 24:1 )
English: It was also said, Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorce,'

Tailo: Mā hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tse sī tī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè kah i ê sò͘-tsè kah i ê kuàn-tiān í-guā.
English: and one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering, and the meal offering of it, and the drink offering of it.

Tailo: Liāu-lí pâi-lia̍t ê piáⁿ, sò͘-tsè ê mī-hún, á-.sī bô kàⁿ ê po̍h piáⁿ kah tiáⁿ lāi só͘ piak ê, í-ki̍p tiâu-hô ê mi̍h, koh kuán-lí tshìn kah niû ê tāi-tsì.
English: for the show bread also, and for the fine flour for a meal offering, whether of unleavened wafers, or of that which is baked in the pan, or of that which is soaked, and for all manner of measure and size;

Tailo: Lâng nā kah i ê tsím-ḿ su-thong, to̍h-sī lîng-jio̍k i ê tsik-peh; in tio̍h tam-tng in ka-kī ê tsuē, ē tsi̍t-sì-lâng bô kiáⁿ.
English: If a man lies with his uncle's wife, he has uncovered his uncle's nakedness: they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.

Tailo: thang īng tsiah-ê lâi tshì-giām Isulael lâng, khuànn in khíng tsip-siú Siōngtsú ê tō-lō͘ lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn, tshin-tshiūnn in ê tsó͘-sian bat tsip-siú, á-bô.
English: that by them I may prove Israel, whether they will keep the way of Yahweh to walk therein, as their fathers did keep it, or not.

Tailo: Lí ē siū kàng kē, tuì thô͘-kha kóng-uē; lí kóng-uē ê siann ē sè-sè, tuì tîn-ai tshut-.lâi. Lí ê siann-im tuì tē tshut-.lâi, ē tshin-tshiūⁿ hō͘ kuí hū-sin ê siann-im; lí ê giân-gí kiū-kiū háu, tuì tîn-ai tshut-.lâi.
English: You will be brought down, and will speak out of the ground. Your speech will mumble out of the dust. Your voice will be as of one who has a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and your speech will whisper out of the dust.

Tailo: Samuel kóng, Τio̍h tī Mi-su-peh tsū-tsi̍p Isulael jîn-bîn, guá ē thè lín tuì Siōngtsú kî-tó.
English: Samuel said, Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray for you to Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, kui îng-kng hō͘ Siōngtè kóng, Lán tiong-kan ū hing-khí tsi̍t-ê tuā sian-ti. Koh kóng, Siōngtè ū teh khuàⁿ-kò͘ I ê tsú-bîn.
English: Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying, A great prophet has arisen among us! and, God has visited his people!

Tailo: Tio̍h ē kì-tit kó͘-tsá ê ji̍t, siàu-liām li̍k-tāi ê nî; mn̄g lí ê lāu-pē, i ē kā lí tsí-sī, mn̄g lí ê sī-tuā, in ē kā lí kóng.
English: Remember the days of old, Consider the years of many generations: Ask your father, and he will show you; Your elders, and they will tell you.

Tailo: Guá tú teh kóng ê sî, Sìng Sîn kàng-lîm tī in, tshin-tshiūnn tong-tsho͘ kàng-lîm tī lán sin tsiūⁿ kāng-khuán.
English: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, even as on us at the beginning.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsē sī kok-ông ê îng-kng; jîn-bîn tsió ê kun-ông ē tì-kàu sue-pāi.
English: In the multitude of people is the king's glory, But in the lack of people is the destruction of the prince.

Tailo: in-uī tuì Guá tshuā Isulael khí-.lâi ê ji̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t, Guá m̄-bat tuà tī tshù lāi, sī tuì tsit-ê pò͘-pênn kàu hit-ê pò͘-pênn, tuì tsit-ê tiùⁿ-pâng kàu hit-ê tiùⁿ-pâng.
English: for I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up Israel, to this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tent to another.

Tailo: Iésu kóng hō͘ bîn-tsiòng thiaⁿ ê uē kóng suah liáu-āu, tsiū ji̍p-khì Ka-peh-ná-um.
English: After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

Tailo: Iā tī tsio̍h-thâu-á tē ê, sī tsí in thiaⁿ-tio̍h hok-im tsiū suî-sî huann-hí lâi tsiap-siū,
English: These in like manner are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng sìng-kiat ê toh tíng kā piáⁿ pâi tsò nn̄g tsuā, muí tsuā la̍k tè.
English: You shall set them in two rows, six on a row, on the pure gold table before Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōngtè ah, guá pîng-sî uá-khò Lí; kiû Lí m̄-thang hō͘ guá kiàn-siàu, m̄-thang hō͘ guá ê tuì-ti̍k in-uī iâⁿ-kuè guá lâi khua-kháu.
English: My God, I have trusted in you, Don't let me be shamed. Don't let my enemies triumph over me.

Tailo: Siú-ua lâng Biltat ìn kóng:
English: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered,

Tailo: Tsò guán ê tîn-pâi ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí khuàⁿ-kò͘, khuànn Lí buah iû siat-li̍p tsò ông ê bīn!
English: Behold, God our shield, Look at the face of your anointed.

Tailo: Lí bô-iân bô-kò͘ kā hiann-tī the̍h tí-ah-phín; koh thǹg bô thang tshīng ê lâng ê saⁿ.
English: For you have taken pledges from your brother for nothing, And stripped the naked of their clothing.

Tailo: Ē ū pó-tsō in-uī tsû-ài lâi kiàn-siat, ē ū sîng-si̍t ê tsē tī hit tíng-bīn, tī Tabi̍t ê pò͘-pêⁿ lāi teh sím-phuàⁿ, kiû kong-pêⁿ, kín kiânn kong-gī.
English: A throne will be established in loving kindness. One will sit on it in truth, in the tent of David, judging, seeking justice, and swift to do righteousness.

Tailo: Ké sian-ti sī sio̍k sè-kan, kóng sè-kan-sū, só͘-í, sè-kan lâng tsiah thiaⁿ in ê uē.
English: They are of the world. Therefore they speak of the world, and the world hears them.

Tailo: to̍h-sī khòng-iá pîng-guân ê Betsik, uī-tio̍h Lūbiān lâng Siat ê; Gilia̍t ê Lah-bua̍t, uī-tio̍h Ga̍t lâng Siat ê; Basiáng ê Ko-lân, uī-tio̍h Mánáse lâng Siat ê.
English: namely, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.

Tailo: Sàulô kah tsè-si kóng-uē ê sî, Huilīsū iâⁿ tiong hán-huah ê siann ná lâi ná tuā. Sàulô tsiū kā tsè-si kóng, Bián tāng lí ê tshiú!
English: It happened, while Saul talked to the priest, that the tumult that was in the camp of the Philistines went on and increased: and Saul said to the priest, Withdraw your hand.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín m̄-thang bú-bān, nā bô, khióng-kiaⁿ kā lín pa̍k ê soh ē khún khah ân; in-uī guá tuì Tsú — bān-kun ê Siōngtsú thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, I tsua̍t-tuì ē tī tsuân tē-tsiūⁿ kiânn só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h bia̍t-bông ê tāi-tsì.
English: Now therefore don't be scoffers, lest your bonds be made strong; for I have heard a decree of destruction from the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, on the whole earth.

Tailo: Isulael lâng bô-lūn lâm-lí, kiàn-nā sim huann-hí hiàn lé-mi̍h hō͘ Siōngtsú ê, lóng huann-hí the̍h lé-mi̍h lâi hiàn, tsò Siōngtsú kau-thok Mô͘se só͘ kā in huan-hù khì tsò it-tshè ê kang.
English: The children of Israel brought a freewill offering to Yahweh; every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all the work, which Yahweh had commanded to be made by Moses.

Tailo: Iésu gia̍h thâu khuànn I ê bûn-tô͘, kóng, Lín tsiah-ê sàn-tshiah lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì, in-uī Siōngtè kok-tō͘ sī lín ê.
English: He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said, Blessed are you who are poor, For yours is the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: Tshiáⁿ lí kā guá ho̍k-sāi lí só͘ tit-tio̍h ê bó͘-kiáⁿ hō͘ guá, tshiánn iông-ín guá khì; guá án-tsuáⁿ ho̍k-sāi lí, lí lóng tsai.
English: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know my service with which I have served you.

Tailo: Iésu khuàⁿ-tio̍h kui tuā-tīn ê lâng uî uá-.lâi, tsiū huan-hù bûn-tô͘ khui-tsûn kuè-khì hit pîng huāⁿ.
English: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes around him, he gave the order to depart to the other side.

Tailo: Suî-jiân ū kun-ping tsat iâⁿ beh kong-kik guá, guá ê sim mā bô kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ; suî-jiân tuì-ti̍k hing-khí to-ping kong-kik guá, guá iû-guân an-jiân tsū-tsāi.
English: Though an army should encamp against me, My heart shall not fear. Though war should rise against me, Even then I will be confident.

Tailo: Hit sî, Amáli̍k lâng lâi-kàu Le-hui-tim kah Isulael lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: Then Amalek came and fought with Israel in Rephidim.

Tailo: Siōngtè īng Páulô ê tshiú, kiânn hui-siông hi-hán ê sîn-jiah.
English: God worked special miracles by the hands of Paul,

Tailo: Ông tsiū tshut līng, lâng tsiū khì tshuā Taniel lâi, beh kā i hiat lo̍h-khì sai hia̍t. Ông tuì Taniel kóng, Lí ê Siōngtè, lí só͘ tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ teh ho̍k-sāi ê, I ē lâi kiù lí.
English: Then the king commanded, and they brought Daniel, and cast him into the den of lions. Now the king spoke and said to Daniel, Your God whom you serve continually, he will deliver you.

Tailo: Ta-ke mn̄g i kóng, Lí kin-á-ji̍t tī tó-uī khioh be̍h-sap? Tī tó-uī tsò-kang? Guān hit-ê khuàⁿ-kò͘ lí ê tit-tio̍h hok-khì. I tsiū kā ta-ke kóng i tī tó-uī tsò-kang, kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t, guá tī hia tsò-kang, hit-ê lâng ê miâ kiò-tsò Bôohtsuh.
English: Her mother-in-law said to her, Where have you gleaned today? and where have you worked? blessed be he who did take knowledge of you. She shown her mother-in-law with whom she had worked, and said, The man's name with whom I worked today is Boaz.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā tsiah-ê lâng só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê khì kā Tabi̍t kóng, i tsiū tshe lâng khì tsiap in, in-uī hiah-ê lâng tsin kiàn-siàu; ông huan-hù kóng, Tio̍h tshiánn tuà tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ, thìng-hāu tshuì-tshiu huat tn̂g tsiah thang tńg-.lâi.
English: Then there went certain persons, and told David how the men were served. He sent to meet them; for the men were greatly ashamed. The king said, Stay at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.

Tailo: Sàulô tsia̍h pá liáu-āu tsiū ióng-kiāⁿ khí-.lâi. I kah Ta-má-su-ko ê bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué tuà kuí-nā ji̍t.
English: He took food and was strengthened. Saul stayed several days with the disciples who were at Damascus.

Tailo: Tsit-ê uē kah lí tsin kīn, to̍h-sī tī lí ê tshuì tī lí ê sim, hō͘ lí thang lâi tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ.
English: But the word is very near to you, in your mouth, and in your heart, that you may do it.

Tailo: Lín taⁿ tio̍h khuànn, Guá, Guá to̍h-sī; Guá í-guā bô ū Siōngtè. Guá hō͘ lâng sí, Guá hō͘ lâng ua̍h; Guá kā i sún-siong, Guá kā i i-tī, bô tsi̍t-ê ē tuì Guá ê tshiú kiù tshut.
English: See now that I, even I, am he, There is no god with me: I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal; There is none who can deliver out of my hand.

Tailo: Lí ē ke-thinn ông ê huè-siū, i ê nî-huè beh kàu bān-sè-tāi.
English: You will prolong the king's life; His years shall be for generations.

Tailo: Tī lín tiong-kan ū tsiap-siū o͘-se lâi lâu lâng ê hueh, lí mā ū the̍h lī-sik, thó lī-sik. Lí in-uī tham-sim, li̍k-sik tshù-piⁿ, tit-tio̍h tsâi-lī, lí kìng-jiân bē kì-tit Guá. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: In you have they taken bribes to shed blood; you have taken interest and increase, and you have greedily gained of your neighbors by oppression, and have forgotten me, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: khì-sak in tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú, to̍h-sī tshuā in tshut Aigi̍p tē ê, khì tuè pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, to̍h-sī sì-kho͘-uî hiah-ê jîn-bîn ê sîn-bîng, kā in kuī-pài, lâi jiá Siōngtsú ê tuā siū-khì.
English: and they forsook Yahweh, the God of their fathers, who brought them out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the peoples who were round about them, and bowed themselves down to them: and they provoked Yahweh to anger.

Tailo: Guá án-ne sú-iōng ta̍k tsióng hong-huat, lóng sī uī-tio̍h hok-im, bo̍k-tik sī beh hun-hióng hok-im ê tsiok-hok.
English: Now I do this for the sake of the Good News, that I may be a joint partaker of it.

Tailo: Lín tāi-ke ná ē án-ne tsò? Guán mā sī lâng kah lín lóng kāng-khuán. Guán lâi tsia thuân hok-im, sī beh hō͘ lín lī-khui tsiah-ê hi-ké ê ngó͘-siōng, lâi kui-ǹg hit uī íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtè, I sī thiⁿ, tē, hái kah kî-tiong bān-mi̍h ê tshòng-tsō tsiá. ( tsù, SPh 146:6 )
English: Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and bring you good news, that you should turn from these vain things to the living God, who made the sky and the earth and the sea, and all that is in them;

Tailo: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t, Iôtah ê kuì-tso̍k tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kià phue hō͘ Tobiiah, Tobiiah mā īng phue kā in huê-hok.
English: Moreover in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters to Tobiah, and the letters of Tobiah came to them.

Tailo: Ông kah in kóng-uē, tī in tsìng lâng ê tiong-kan, khuàⁿ bô tsi̍t-ê kah Taniel, Hananiah, Misael kah Atsalíah ē pí-.tit, só͘-í in tit-tio̍h khiā tī ông ê bīn-tsîng ê khuán-thāi.
English: The king talked with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before the king.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá khak-sìn Tsú ē hō͘ guá pún-sin mā tsin kín ē-tàng khì kìⁿ lín.
English: But I trust in the Lord that I myself also will come shortly.

Tailo: Elísiah mn̄g i kóng, Guá ē-tàng kā lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí kā guá kóng; lí tshù lāi ū siáⁿ-mi̍h? kuáⁿ-hū kóng, Lí ê lú-pī tshù lāi tshun tsi̍t pân iû, í-guā lóng bô puàⁿ-hāng.
English: Elisha said to her, What shall I do for you? tell me; what have you in the house? She said, Your handmaid has nothing in the house, except a pot of oil.

Tailo: Lí kám ē huì-tû Guá ê kong-pêⁿ? Lí kám ē gí-tiāⁿ Guá ū tsuē lâi hián-bîng lí ka-kī tsò gī?
English: Will you even annul my judgment? Will you condemn me, that you may be justified?

Tailo: Guá bat án-ne tī sìng-só͘ tiâu-kìnn Lí, uī-tio̍h ài beh khuànn Lí ê kuân-lîng kah îng-kng.
English: So I have seen you in the sanctuary, Watching your power and your glory.

Tailo: Tī iâⁿ tiong ê jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-tio̍h Tsim-lī puē-puān, koh thâi-sí ông, só͘-í, Isulael jîn-bîn hit ji̍t tsiū tī iâⁿ tiong siat-li̍p kun-tiúⁿ Omlī tsò Isulael ông.
English: The people who were encamped heard say, Zimri has conspired, and has also struck the king: therefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the army, king over Israel that day in the camp.

Tailo: Tsè-si ji̍p-lâi lāi-īⁿ ê sî, lóng m̄-thang lim tsiú.
English: Neither shall any of the priests drink wine, when they enter into the inner court.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ē kì-tit guá só͘ thuân ê hok-im, Iésu Ki-tok sī Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun, Siōngtè hō͘ I tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h.
English: Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the seed of David, according to my Good News,

Tailo: ( Khóla̍h ê kiáⁿ-sun ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) Siōngtsú ah, Lí í-king si un tī Lí ê tē, Iâkop siū lia̍h ê lâng, Lí kā in kiù tńg-.lâi.
English: Yahweh, you have been favorable to your land. You have restored the fortunes of Jacob.

Tailo: Huilīsū ê tsuân tē, m̄-thang in-uī phah lí ê kuái-á í-king áu-tn̄g lâi huann-hí. In-uī tuì tsuâ ê nn̄g ē seⁿ-tshut to̍k-tsuâ, i só͘ seⁿ ê sī ē pue ê hué-tsuâ.
English: Don't rejoice, O Philistia, all of you, because the rod that struck you is broken; for out of the serpent's root an adder will emerge, and his fruit will be a fiery flying serpent.

Tailo: I tsiū tsín-kiù lán, m̄-sī in-uī lán ka-kī ê hó hîng-uî, sī in-uī I ê liân-bín. I thong-kuè tîng-thâu-seⁿ ê sé-lé kah Sìng Sîn ê uāⁿ sin lâi tsín-kiù lán.
English: not by works of righteousness, which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,

Tailo: Tī hia ū tsi̍t-ê té-muá sng-tshò͘ ê pân, in tsiū the̍h hái-mî tsìm tshò͘, pa̍k tuà gû-tshik-tsháu bué, tu khì-kàu Iésu ê tshuì.
English: Now a vessel full of vinegar was set there; so they put a sponge full of the vinegar on hyssop, and held it at his mouth.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tuì lí tshut ê lâng, beh khí-tsō tsin kú í-king hong-huì ê só͘-tsāi; lí beh kiàn-li̍p li̍k-tāi huí-huāi ê tē-ki. Lí ē hō͘ lâng tshing-tsò ' Pó͘ siâⁿ tshiûⁿ phuà-khiah ê', kah ' Siu-lí ke-lō͘ thang hó tuà ê'.
English: Those who shall be of you shall build the old waste places; you shall raise up the foundations of many generations; and you shall be called The repairer of the breach, The restorer of paths to dwell in.

Tailo: Mô͘se kā Siōngtsú tshe i só͘ kóng ê uē kah huan-hù i kiânn ê sîn-jiah, lóng tuì Alông kóng.
English: Moses told Aaron all the words of Yahweh with which he had sent him, and all the signs with which he had charged him.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, to̍h-sī kàu thiⁿ-tē siau-sit kah lu̍t-huat ê bo̍k-tik lóng ta̍t-sîng ê sî, lu̍t-huat ê tsi̍t-tiám tsi̍t-ui̍h to bē siau-sit-.khì.
English: For most assuredly, I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not even one smallest letter or one tiny pen stroke shall in any way pass away from the law, until all things are accomplished.

Tailo: Guá tī khòng-iá tuì in ê kiáⁿ-jî kóng: M̄-thang tsun-thàn lín lāu-pē ê lu̍t-lē, m̄-thang tsun-siú in ê huat-tō͘, mā m̄-thang in-uī in ê ngó͘-siōng kā ka-kī phah lâ-sām.
English: I said to their children in the wilderness, Don't you walk in the statutes of your fathers, neither observe their ordinances, nor defile yourselves with their idols.

Tailo: Beh bong i ê lâng, tio̍h īng thih-khì kah tshiuⁿ-pèⁿ, tī i ê só͘-tsāi beh hō͘ hué tsuân-pō͘ sio-.khì.
English: But the man who touches them Must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear: They shall be utterly burned with fire in their place

Tailo: In tsiū tuā kiaⁿ, hō͘-siong kóng-lâi kóng-khì, kóng, Tsit-ê sī siáⁿ lâng? Liân hong kah tsuí-íng to lóng sūn-ho̍k I!
English: They were greatly afraid, and said to one another, Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?

Tailo: Hiah-ê kok ê bua̍t-ji̍t lîm-kàu ê sî, lâng ê tsuē-ok kuàn-buán, tsiū ē ū tsi̍t-ê ông hing-khí, bīn-māu hiong-ok, gâu īng kuí-tsà ê uē.
English: In the latter time of their kingdom, when the transgressors are come to the full, a king of fierce face, and understanding dark sentences, shall stand up.

Tailo: Ka-tîng nā khí hun-tsing, hit-ê ka-tîng mā it-tīng khiā bē tiâu.
English: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

Tailo: Lín tsin-tsiàⁿ sī jîn-bîn, lín sí, tì-huī mā kah lín tsò-hué sí.
English: No doubt, but you are the people, And wisdom shall die with you.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê Iô-tá-iah lâng ê kuaⁿ-uân lâi mn̄g Iésu kóng, Hó ê lāu-su ah, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò tsiah ē-tàng tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā?
English: A certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

Tailo: Tsè-si ho̍k tíng-bīn kî-khiáu ê kang-hu só͘ tsit ê tuà, tio̍h kah i sio-siâng ê tsò-huat, hō͘ i sio-liân tsò tsi̍t-ê, īng kim kah nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu, í-ki̍p kuè-pháng ê iù-tē lâi tsò.
English: The skillfully woven band, which is on it, that is on him, shall be like its work and of the same piece; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.

Tailo: Tsiū tuì Pa-li̍k-pí-lī-thó͘ ê tshù the̍h tshit-tsa̍p-ê gîn-á hō͘ Amí-me-li̍k, i tsiū īng hiah-ê tsînn lâi tshiàⁿ tsiah-ê bô hē-lo̍h ê huí-luī, hiah-ê lâng tsiū lâi tuè i.
English: They gave him seventy pieces of silver out of the house of Baal Berith, with which Abimelech hired vain and light fellows, who followed him.

Tailo: Lí bô-lūn īng siáⁿ-mi̍h tsioh tshù-piⁿ, m̄-thang ji̍p-khì i ê tshù the̍h tsún-tǹg.
English: When you do lend your neighbor any manner of loan, you shall not go into his house to get his pledge.

Tailo: Án-ne kè-sio̍k nn̄g nî, hō͘ só͘-ū tuà tī A-si-a síng ê lâng, bô-lūn Iô-tá-iah lâng á-.sī Hi-la̍h lâng, lóng ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h Tsú ê tō-lí.
English: This continued for two years, so that all those who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.

Tailo: I mn̄g guá kóng, ' Lí sī siáⁿ lâng? ' Guá ìn kóng, ' Guá sī Amáli̍k lâng. '
English: He said to me, Who are you? I answered him, I am an Amalekite.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín só͘ beh ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap ê tē, to̍h-sī ū suaⁿ, ū suaⁿ-kok, lâi sîng-siū thinn ê hō͘-tsuí ê tē,
English: but the land, where you go over to possess it, is a land of hills and valleys, and drinks water of the rain of the sky,

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, i kā tû-pâng-tiúⁿ tiàu khí-.lâi, tú-tú tsiàu Iôséhuh só͘ kā in kái-bāng ê.
English: but he hanged the chief baker, as Joseph had interpreted to them.

Tailo: Pîn-tuāⁿ lâng khuànn ka-kī ū tì-huī, iâⁿ-kuè tshit-ê gâu ìn-tap ê lâng.
English: The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes Than seven men who answer with discretion.

Tailo: Iosiúah kah Isulael lâng kā in thâi-sí tsē-tsē, kàu tsuân-pō͘ tsâu-bia̍t tsiah suah; kî-tiong tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng lóng ji̍p-khì kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ.
English: It happened, when Joshua and the children of Israel had made an end of killing them with a very great slaughter, until they were consumed, and the remnant which remained of them had entered into the fortified cities,

Tailo: I ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tshiū tsai tī khe-tsuí piⁿ, tsiàu-sî kiat kué-tsí, hio̍h mā bē ta-.khì; i it-tshè só͘ tsò ê lóng hing-thong.
English: He will be like a tree planted by the streams of water, That brings forth its fruit in its season, Whose leaf also does not wither. Whatever he does shall prosper.

Tailo: Kuan-hē gī lâng, lín tio̍h kóng, i ū hok-khì, in-uī i ē tsia̍h ka-kī hîng-uî só͘ kiat ê kué-tsí.
English: Tell the righteous Good! For they shall eat the fruit of their deeds.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kā i kóng, Lí tī guá tsia ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khiàm-khueh, lí kìng-jiân ài beh tńg-khì pún-kok? I ìn kóng, Guá bô khiàm-khueh siáⁿ-mi̍h, tsóng-.sī, tshiánn iông-ín guá tńg-.khì.
English: Then Pharaoh said to him, But what have you lacked with me, that behold, you seek to go to your own country? He answered, Nothing: however only let me depart.

Tailo: Thamal tsiū lâi-kàu i ê a-hiaⁿ Amnon ê tshù, Amnon tó-.leh. Thamal the̍h mī-hún, tī i ê bīn-tsîng tshiau tsò piáⁿ, koh piak hiah-ê piáⁿ,
English: So Tamar went to her brother Amnon's house; and he was laid down. She took dough, and kneaded it, and made cakes in his sight, and did bake the cakes.

Tailo: In hn̄g-hn̄g gia̍h thâu khuànn, bē jīn-tit i, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu; ta̍k lâng thiah-li̍h guā-saⁿ, ǹg thiⁿ tī ka-kī ê thâu-khak iā thô͘-sua hún.
English: When they lifted up their eyes from a distance, and didn't recognize him, they raised their voices, and wept; and they each tore his robe, and sprinkled dust on their heads toward the sky.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú kóng-tio̍h siàu-siūⁿ lí ê sèⁿ-miā ê Anáthot lâng, I án-ne kóng, In kóng: Lí m̄-thang hōng Siōngtsú ê miâ lâi ī-giân, bián-tit lí sí tī guán ê tshiú-thâu.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning the men of Anathoth, who seek your life, saying, You shall not prophesy in the name of Yahweh, that you not die by our hand;

Tailo: Piattò͘ tsiū tshut-lâi tuè thiⁿ-sài khì; i m̄-tsai thiⁿ-sài teh tsò ê sī tsin-si̍t ê, lia̍h-tsò sī khuàⁿ-tio̍h ī-siōng.
English: And he went out and followed him. He didn't know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he saw a vision.

Tailo: Esáu tsiū tsai i ê lāu-pē Ísak bô kah-ì Ka-nân ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á,.
English: Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan didn't please Isaac, his father.

Tailo: Suàⁿ-huē liáu-āu, Iô-tá-iah lâng kah kái-tsong ji̍p Iô-tá-iah-kàu ê kìng-khiân ê lâng, tsin tsē tuè Páulô kah Ba-ná-ba tshut-.khì. Tsit nn̄g-ê sù-tô͘ kah in kóng-uē, khuàn-bián in tio̍h khò Siōngtè ê un-tián lâi sing-ua̍h.
English: Now when the synagogue broke up, many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas; who, speaking to them, urged them to continue in the grace of God.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī kah lán ê tsó͘-sian Abulahàm só͘ li̍p ê iok,
English: The oath which he spoke to Abraham, our father,

Tailo: Lí í-king tsí-sī guá ua̍h-miā ê lō͘. Hō͘ guá tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng muá-sim khuài-lo̍k. ( tsù, SPh 16:8-11 )
English: You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence.'

Tailo: Kám-siā kā in ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ Isulael lâng tsò sán-gia̍p ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: And gave their land as an inheritance; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Guá khuànn, m̄-koh khuàⁿ bô pang-tsān ê; Guá tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, in-uī bô lâng kā Guá hû-tshî. Só͘-í, Guá ka-kī ê tshiú kā Guá kiânn tsín-kiù; Guá ê tuā siū-khì kā Guá hû-tshî.
English: I looked, and there was none to help; and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore my own arm brought salvation to me; and my wrath, it upheld me.

Tailo: Αpsalôm kóng, Nā bô, tsiū hō͘ guá ê a-hiaⁿ Amnon kah guán khì. Ông kóng, Án-tsuáⁿ tio̍h i kah lí khì?
English: Then said Absalom, If not, please let my brother Amnon go with us. The king said to him, Why should he go with you?

Tailo: I koh kā jîn-bîn kóng, Lín tio̍h tsìn-tsîng khì se̍h siâⁿ, tuà kun-khì ê tio̍h kiânn tī Siōngtsú ê kuī tsîng.
English: They said to the people, Pass on, and compass the city, and let the armed men pass on before the ark of Yahweh.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Iô-tá-iah lâng ê thâu-lâng, tiúⁿ-ló kah king-ha̍k kàu-su, tsū-tsi̍p tī Êlúsalèm.
English: It happened in the morning, that their rulers, elders, and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê tô-tsáu ê lâng, lâi kā Hi-bú-lâi lâng Abúlâm kóng; hit sî, Abúlâm tuà tī Amô͘lī lâng Mamlē ê siōng tshiū hit só͘-tsāi, Mamlē, E-si-kol kah Anel lóng sī hiann-tī, ū kah Abúlâm liân-bîng.
English: One who had escaped came and told Abram, the Hebrew. Now he lived by the oaks of Mamre, the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner; and these were allies of Abram.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ē kā tse it-tshè ê tsiù-tsó͘, hē tī lí ê tuì-ti̍k kah uàn-hūn lí koh pik-hāi lí ê lâng ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: Yahweh your God will put all these curses on your enemies, and on those who hate you, who persecuted you.

Tailo: Kuan-hē lâng ê tāi-tsì, I bô su-iàu lâng koh lâi tuì I tsìng-bîng, in-uī I tsin liáu-kái lâng ê lāi-sim.
English: and because he didn't need for anyone to testify concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.

Tailo: Alông tńg-lâi-kàu Mô͘se hia, lâi-kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, un-i̍k tsiah suah.
English: Aaron returned to Moses to the door of the tent of meeting: and the plague was stayed.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú ah, Lí sī tshì-liān gī lâng, kàm-tshat lâng ê sim-su ì-liām ê, kiû Lí hō͘ guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí tuì in pò-siû, in-uī guá kā guá ê àn-kiāⁿ pín-bîng tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: But, Yahweh of Armies, who tests the righteous, who sees the heart and the mind, let me see your vengeance on them; for to you have I revealed my cause.

Tailo: I lo̍h pha̍uh hō͘ in tsò hō͘; tī in ê thó͘-tē kàng-lo̍h iām-hué.
English: He gave them hail for rain, With lightning in their land.

Tailo: Guá kiû-kiò Siōngtè, Lí m̄ ìn guá; guá khiā khí-.lâi, Lí kan-taⁿ teh khuàⁿ.
English: I cry to you, and you do not answer me. I stand up, and you gaze at me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Tsiah-ê siú-líng hiàn lé-mi̍h, ta̍k-ê tio̍h tī i ê ji̍t lâi hiàn, lâi kiâⁿ hiàn-tuâⁿ ê lé.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, They shall offer their offering, each prince on his day, for the dedication of the altar.

Tailo: Tsè-si tshiú tiong só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê iû, tio̍h piàⁿ tī hit-ê ài tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng ê thâu-khak tíng, tsè-si tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kā i sio̍k-tsuē.
English: The rest of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall put on the head of him who is to be cleansed, and the priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín khuànn! Βeh tshut-bē guá hit-ê lâng kah guá tsò-hué tshun tshiú tī toh tíng.
English: But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k huan-tsháu á-.sī pun-tê ê tiong-kan m̄-thang tsia̍h ê, to̍h-sī tsiah-ê: lo̍k-tô — in-uī i ū huan-tsháu, bô pun-tê, tuì lín lâi kóng sī bô tshing-khì ê.
English: Nevertheless these you shall not eat of those that chew the cud, or of those who part the hoof: the camel, because he chews the cud but doesn't have a parted hoof, he is unclean to you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē hong ba̍t phô͘-tháⁿ ê tshuì-tûn, kuah-tn̄g kóng tuā-uē ê tshuì-tsi̍h.
English: May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips, And the tongue that boasts,

Tailo: Tsí-ū Sisela̍h kiâⁿ lō͘ tô-tsáu, kàu Kenî lâng Ê-bel ê bó͘ Ia-el ê pò͘-pênn, in-uī Hatsool ông Ia-bín kah Kenî lâng Ê-bel ê ke hô-hó.
English: However Sisera fled away on his feet to the tent of Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite; for there was peace between Jabin the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang kám-kak tsit-ê tāi-tsì kî-kuài, in-uī sî teh beh kàu, só͘-ū tī bōng-.ni̍h ê sí-lâng ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h Kiáⁿ ê siann, tuì bōng-.ni̍h tshut-.lâi.
English: Don't marvel at this, for the hour comes, in which all that are in the tombs will hear his voice,

Tailo: Aigi̍p ông tuì in kóng, Lín kā Hi-bú-lâi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng khioh-kiáⁿ, khuànn in lîm-phûn ê sî, nā-sī tsa-po͘ gín-á, tio̍h hō͘ i sí; nā-sī tsa-bó͘ gín-á, tsiah thang hō͘ i ua̍h.
English: and he said, When you perform the duty of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them on the birth stool; if it is a son, then you shall kill him; but if it is a daughter, then she shall live.

Tailo: Iésu khì-kàu-uī ê sî, La̍h-tsa-lō͘ í-king bâi-tsòng tī bōng-.ni̍h sì ji̍t ā.
English: So when Jesus came, he found that he had been in the tomb four days already.

Tailo: Taⁿ tshiáⁿ lí īng tí-ah hō͘ guá ê tsú — Asiul ông, guá hō͘ lí nn̄g tshing tsiah bé, khuànn lí hit bīn ē-tàng tsún-pī lâng lâi khiâ á-bē.
English: Now therefore, please make a pledge to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to set riders on them.

Tailo: In ē huí-huāi Tulô ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, thiah i ê tsiú-keⁿ lâu; guá mā beh khau i ê thô͘-sua hún, hō͘ i tsiâⁿ-tsò kng liu-liu ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ.
English: They shall destroy the walls of Tyre, and break down her towers: I will also scrape her dust from her, and make her a bare rock.

Tailo: Gín-á í-king sí à, guá kìm-tsia̍h beh tshòng siáⁿ? Guá kám ē hō͘ i tò tńg-.lâi? Guá beh khì i hia, i bē-tàng lâi guá tsia.
English: But now he is dead, why should I fast? can I bring him back again? I shall go to him, but he will not return to me.

Tailo: In-uī guá mā sī hō͘ lâng kuán ê lâng, mā ū ping hō͘ guá kuán. Guá kā tsit-ê kóng, ' Khì! ', i tsiū khì; kā hit-ê kóng, ' Lâi! ', i tsiū lâi; kā guá ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, ' Án-ne tsò', i tsiū án-ne khì tsò.
English: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, Go!' and he goes; and to another, Come!' and he comes; and to my servant, Do this,' and he does it.

Tailo: Tabi̍t īng to hâ tī kun-ho̍k, tshì-khuàⁿ kiânn tsi̍t ē, in-uī m̄-bat tshīng tio̍h. Tabi̍t kā Sàulô kóng, Tshīng tsiah-ê guá kiânn bē khì, in-uī m̄-bat tshīng-kuè.
English: David girded his sword on his clothing, and he tried to go; for he had not proved it. David said to Saul, I can't go with these; for I have not proved them. David put them off him.

Tailo: Ông tsiàu-siông tsē i ê uī, to̍h-sī uá tī piah piⁿ ê uī, Ionáthan teh khiā, Apnel tsē tī Sàulô ê sin piⁿ, Tabi̍t ê uī pàng khang.
English: The king sat on his seat, as at other times, even on the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul's side: but David's place was empty.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Iésu kā in kóng, Lín kí-khí Jîn-tsú ê sî, tsiū tsai guá sī hit uī. Guá só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì bô tsi̍t hāng sī tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù, lóng sī tsiàu Thiⁿ-pē kà-sī guá ê lâi kóng.
English: Jesus therefore said to them, When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I AM he, and I do nothing of myself, but as my Father taught me, I say these things.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ê nn̄g-ê bó͘, E-tsu-le-el lâng Ahinoám kah bat tsò Kal-mel lâng Nabal ê bó͘ Abigail, mā hō͘ in lia̍h-.khì.
English: David's two wives were taken captive, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

Tailo: Nā ū hó-gia̍h lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ū khiàm-khueh, m̄-koh, bô tông-tsîng liân-bín ê sim, ná ē-tàng kóng i thiàⁿ Siōngtè?
English: But whoever has the world's goods, and sees his brother in need, and closes his heart of compassion against him, how does the love of God remain in him?

Tailo: Ū sî tī ke-lō͘-.ni̍h, ū sî tī khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi; ū sî tī ta̍k-ê hāng-á kháu teh tng-tán.
English: Now she is in the streets, now in the squares, And lurking at every corner.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hō͘-siong jīn tsuē, sio-thè kî-tó, thang tit-tio̍h i hó. Gī lâng ê kî-tó ū tsin tuā ê kong-hāu.
English: Confess your offenses to one another, and pray one for another, that you may be healed. The insistent prayer of a righteous person is powerfully effective.

Tailo: Kóng, Tsú kó-jiân koh-ua̍h ā, I í-king tshut-hiān hō͘ Símòng khuànn.
English: saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!

Tailo: Tsè-si tsiū tio̍h kā i giām, lí khuàⁿ, hué-pan tiong ê mn̂g nā piàn-pe̍h, khuán-sit koh tshim-ji̍p-khì tī phuê-hu lāi, sī thái-ko tī hué-sio ê tiong-kan huat khí-.lâi, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tuàn-tīng i tsò bô tshing-khì, sī thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu.
English: then the priest shall examine it; and behold, if the hair in the bright spot has turned white, and the appearance of it is deeper than the skin; it is leprosy. It has broken out in the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is the plague of leprosy.

Tailo: La̍hban kā i ê lú-pī Jilpah hō͘ i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Leah tsò lú-pī.
English: Laban gave Zilpah his handmaid to his daughter Leah for a handmaid.

Tailo: Guá ē pí tsit-ê koh khah tsho͘-sio̍k, ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò pi-tsiān. Lí só͘ kóng hiah-ê lú-pī, guá ē siū in tsun-tiōng.
English: I will be yet more vile than this, and will be base in my own sight: but of the handmaids of whom you have spoken, they shall honor me.

Tailo: In īng kiáu bu̍t-io̍h ê tsiú hō͘ Iésu lim. I m̄-lim.
English: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn't take it.

Tailo: Tsit nn̄g tsi-tso̍k, koh ū puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k, í-king tī Ioltàn hô guā, I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê tang pîng, ǹg ji̍t tshut ê só͘-tsāi tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p.
English: the two tribes and the half-tribe have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise.

Tailo: Isulael ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lâng ē lâi kah Kal-tí-ah lâng kau-tsiàn, put-kò sī hō͘ sin-si tshiong-muá tsiah-ê tshù, to̍h-sī Guá tī siū-khì kah tuā siū-khì ê tiong-kan só͘ thâi-sí ê lâng, in-uī in it-tshè ê pháiⁿ, Guá tsiū am Guá ê bīn, m̄-khuàⁿ tsit-ê siâⁿ.
English: while men come to fight with the Chaldeans, and to fill them with the dead bodies of men, whom I have killed in my anger and in my wrath, and for all whose wickedness I have hid my face from this city:

Tailo: Lótoh gia̍h thâu khuànn Ioltàn hô kui-phiàn ê pîng-guân, it-ti̍t kàu Tso-al ê lō͘ lóng tsin tsu-jūn; hit-ê tē tī Siōngtsú iáu-buē bia̍t So͘tóm kah Ammo͘la̍h í-tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtsú ê hn̂g, mā tshin-tshiūnn Aigi̍p ê tē.
English: Lot lifted up his eyes, and saw all the plain of the Jordan, that it was well-watered everywhere, before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt, as you go to Zoar.

Tailo: In-uī lán iáu luán-jio̍k ê sî, Ki-tok tī Siōngtè tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê ji̍t-tsí, uī-tio̍h ū tsuē ê lâng sí.
