English: For while we were yet weak, at the right time Christ died for the ungodly.

Tailo: Suî-jiân án-ne, Iô-tá-iah lâng ê thâu-lâng ū tsin tsē sìn Iésu, in kiaⁿ Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, tsiah bô kong-khai sîng-jīn I, bián-tit hông kuáⁿ-tshut huē-tn̂g.
English: Nevertheless even of the rulers many believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they didn't confess it, so that they wouldn't be put out of the synagogue,

Tailo: I īng lîng-li̍k kik-tōng tuā hái, I īng tì-sik phah-phuà La̍h-hap.
English: He stirs up the sea with his power, And by his understanding he strikes through Rahab.

Tailo: Asah ū tuì Iôtah tshut ê kun-ping saⁿ-tsa̍p bān, giâ pîn-pâi kah tshiuⁿ, koh ū tuì Biāniámín tshut ê jī-tsa̍p peh bān, giâ pîn-pâi khui kiong. Tsiah-ê lóng sī tuā la̍t ê ióng-sū.
English: Asa had an army that bore bucklers and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bore shields and drew bows, two hundred eighty thousand: all these were mighty men of valor.

Tailo: Palân tsiū khí-.lâi, tńg-khì i pún só͘-tsāi; Baal mā tsiàu án-ne kiâⁿ i ê lō͘.
English: Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place; and Balak also went his way.

Tailo: Guá ê iûⁿ thiaⁿ guá ê siann, guá bat in, in mā tuè guá.
English: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kià phue hō͘ só͘-ū siū lia̍h ê lâng, kóng, ' Siōngtsú kóng-tio̍h Ne-he-lâm lâng Simáiah kóng: In-uī Simáiah tuì lín suan-pò͘ ê, Guá bô tshe i, i hō͘ lín uá-khò pe̍h-tsha̍t;
English: Send to all them of the captivity, saying, Thus says Yahweh concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, and I didn't send him, and he has caused you to trust in a lie;

Tailo: Batseba kóng, Guān lí kā Siu-ném ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á Amí-siak, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê a-hiaⁿ Atonîiah tsò bó͘.
English: She said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother as wife.

Tailo: M̄-thang kóng kiàn-siàu kah siâ-îm, á-.sī hā-liû ê uē, tian-tò tio̍h kóng kám-siā Siōngtè ê uē.
English: nor filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not appropriate; but rather giving of thanks.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè tsiong-lâi tuì lín tsìng tsi-tso̍k tiong só͘ beh kíng-suán ê só͘-tsāi, thang tī hia an-tì I ê miâ, to̍h-sī I tuà ê só͘-tsāi, lín tio̍h khì hia tshuē I,
English: But to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose out of all your tribes, to put his name there, even to his habitation shall you seek, and there you shall come;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsè-si siuⁿ tsió, bē-tàng tsuân-pō͘ pak hiah-ê sio-tsè tsing-seⁿ ê phuê, só͘-í, in ê hiann-tī Lēbī lâng kā in pang-tsān kàu hit-ê tāi-tsì uân-sîng liáu-āu, koh thìng-hāu hiah-ê tsè-si ka-kī tshing-khì; in-uī Lēbī lâng sîng-sim tì-ì ka-kī ê tshing-khì, iâⁿ-kuè tsè-si.
English: But the priests were too few, so that they could not flay all the burnt offerings: therefore their brothers the Levites helped them, until the work was ended, and until the priests had sanctified themselves; for the Levites were more upright in heart to sanctify themselves than the priests.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tē-jī ji̍t, ông tī tsiú-iàn ê tiong-kan koh mn̄g Êsutel kóng, Ông-hō͘ Êsutel, lí só͘ tshíng ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá beh hō͘ lí; lí só͘ kiû sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsiū-sī kok ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ mā ē tsò-.tit.
English: The king said again to Esther on the second day at the banquet of wine, What is your petition, queen Esther? and it shall be granted you: and what is your request? even to the half of the kingdom it shall be performed.

Tailo: Tì-huī ê ông kā pháiⁿ lâng puà tiāu, īng tshia-lián kā i kauh kuè.
English: A wise king winnows out the wicked, And drives the threshing wheel over them.

Tailo: Huē-tsiòng tsū-tsi̍p kong-kik Mô͘se kah Alông ê sî, ǹg huē-bō͘ khuànn, lí khuàⁿ, ū hûn khàm-.leh, Siōngtsú ê îng-kng hián-hiān.
English: It happened, when the congregation was assembled against Moses and against Aaron, that they looked toward the tent of meeting: and behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of Yahweh appeared.

Tailo: Lú-su-toh kah Í-ko-ni-óng ê sìn-tô͘ lóng o-ló i.
English: The brothers who were at Lystra and Iconium gave a good testimony about him.

Tailo: In-uī i tī i ê tsuē koh ke-thinn puē-gi̍k; i tī lán tiong-kan phah tshiú, koh īng tsin tsē uē huán-tuì Siōngtè.
English: For he adds rebellion to his sin. He claps his hands among us, And multiplies his words against God.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ē kì-tit, Tsú ē kā lín pò-siúⁿ, hō͘ lín tuì I tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p. Lín sī teh ho̍k-sāi Tsú Ki-tok.
English: knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; for you serve the Lord Christ.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng khí-lâi kah Su-tê-hua-no͘h piān-lūn, in sī tuì Kó͘-lī-nāi kah A-li̍k-san-toh lâi ê Iô-tá-iah lâng, in sī sio̍k Tsū-iû lâng Huē-tn̂g ê huē-uân; í-ki̍p tuì Ki-lí-kiah kah A-si-a síng lâi ê lâng.
English: But some of those who were of the synagogue called The Libertines, and of the Cyrenians, of the Alexandrians, and of those of Cilicia and Asia arose, disputing with Stephen.

Tailo: Ông ìn Taniel kóng, Lí í-king ē hián-bîng tsit-ê pì-bi̍t ê tāi-tsì, lín ê Siōngtè tsin-tsiàⁿ sī tsiah-ê sîn-bîng ê Siōngtè, tsiah-ê ông ê Tsú, koh sī hián-bîng hiah-ê pì-bi̍t ê.
English: The king answered to Daniel, and said, Of a truth your God is the God of gods, and the Lord of kings, and a revealer of secrets, seeing you have been able to reveal this secret.

Tailo: Án-ne, tuì tshòng-tsō sè-kài í-lâi só͘ lâu tsìng sian-ti ê hueh lóng beh kā lín tsit sè-tāi thó,
English: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

Tailo: Isulael ê tsú-bîn, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú tuì lín só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: Hear the word which Yahweh speaks to you, house of Israel!

Tailo: Nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ tshuā Mô͘ap ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Oolpah, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Lùthuh, in tuà tī hia tsha-put-to ū tsa̍p nî.
English: They took them wives of the women of Moab; the name of the one was Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth: and they lived there about ten years.

Tailo: ' Tuì Guá tshuā Guá ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng tshut Aigi̍p í-lâi, Guá m̄-bat tī Isulael tsìng tsi-tso̍k tiong-kan kíng tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ, khí tiān hō͘ Guá ê miâ tī hia, to̍k-to̍k kíng Tabi̍t tī-lí Guá ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng. '
English: Since the day that I brought forth my people Israel out of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house, that my name might be there; but I chose David to be over my people Israel.

Tailo: I kóng, Taniel, lí tsò lí khì; in-uī tsiah-ê uē í-king am-khàm hong ba̍t, ti̍t-kàu lō͘-bué ê sî.
English: He said, Go your way, Daniel; for the words are shut up and sealed until the time of the end.

Tailo: Hō͘ guán kah lín lâi kah Ki-tok kiat-liân ê sī Siōngtè, koh sī Siōngtè pún-sin kíng-suán lán tsiâⁿ-tsò I ê tsú-bîn.
English: Now he who establishes us with you in Christ, and anointed us, is God;

Tailo: Kâng tsit-hāng tāi-tsì ū koh kóng, In tsua̍t-tuì bē-tàng tsìn-ji̍p guá ê an-hioh. ( tsù, SPh 95:11 )
English: and in this place again, They will not enter into my rest.

Tailo: Guān hiah-ê tsuē-ok tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tì-sú I kā in ê miâ tuì sè-kan siau-bia̍t!
English: Let them be before Yahweh continually, That he may cut off the memory of them from the earth;

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn in-uī iu-khó͘ lâi siau-iûⁿ; kiû Lí tsiàu Lí ê ìng-ín hō͘ guá ióng-kiāⁿ.
English: My soul is weary with sorrow: Strengthen me according to your word.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsò-hué tuà, kî-tiong nā tsi̍t-ê sí-khì bô kiáⁿ, sí-lâng ê bó͘ m̄-thang kè guā-lâng, i tiōng-hu ê sió-tī tio̍h ji̍p-khì i hia, tshuā i tsò bó͘, lâi tsīn sió-tsik ê pún-hūn.
English: If brothers dwell together, and one of them die, and have no son, the wife of the dead shall not be married outside to a stranger: her husband's brother shall go in to her, and take her to him as wife, and perform the duty of a husband's brother to her.

Tailo: In ìn i kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t lí nā guān-ì tsò tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê lô͘-po̍k, lâi kā in ho̍k-sāi, īng hó uē lâi kā in ìn-tap, in tsiū ē íng-uán tsò lí ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: They spoke to him, saying, If you will be a servant to this people this day, and will serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be your servants forever.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh tuì i kóng, Guá sī Siōngtsú, bat tshuā lí tshut Kal-tí-ah ê El siâⁿ, sī uī-tio̍h beh kā tsit-ê tē hō͘ lí tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: He said to him, I am Yahweh who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give you this land to inherit it.

Tailo: Siōngtè kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi ē kah lí tông-tsāi, lí tshuā jîn-bîn tshut Aigi̍p liáu-āu, lín ē tī tsit-ê suaⁿ ho̍k-sāi Siōngtè; tse beh tsò Guá tshe lí ê tsìng-kì.
English: He said, Certainly I will be with you. This will be the token to you, that I have sent you: when you have brought forth the people out of Egypt, you shall serve God on this mountain.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng khí tiān í-king uân-sîng.
English: So Solomon built the house, and finished it.

Tailo: In ê pò͘-pênn kah iûⁿ-kûn ē hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-.khì, kā tiùⁿ-pak kah it-tshè ê khì-kū, í-ki̍p lo̍k-tô, lóng tshiúⁿ-khì tsò ka-kī ê. Lâng tuì in huah, ' sì-kho͘-uî lóng ū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ'.
English: Their tents and their flocks shall they take; they shall carry away for themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry to them, Terror on every side!

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Só͘lômóng tsē tī Siōngtsú só͘ siúⁿ-sù ê uī, suà-tsiap i ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t tsò ông, ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì lóng hing-thong, Isulael jîn-bîn mā lóng tsun-thàn i.
English: Then Solomon sat on the throne of Yahweh as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.

Tailo: I tshuā in, hō͘ in an-ún, hō͘ in bô kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, hō͘ hái im-sí in ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: He led them safely, so that they weren't afraid, But the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Aigi̍p tē ē ū gō͘-ê siâⁿ kóng Ka-nân ê khiuⁿ-kháu, koh kí bān-kun ê Siōngtsú lâi tsiù-tsuā. Ē ū tsi̍t-ê kiò-tsò bia̍t-bông ê siâⁿ.
English: In that day, there will be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan, and swear to Yahweh of Armies. One will be called The city of destruction.

Tailo: In tuì hn̄g ê só͘-tsāi lâi, tuì thinn-pinn lâi; Siōngtsú kah tsip-hîng I ê siū-khì ê ke-si, teh beh huí-bia̍t tsit-ê tsuân tē.
English: They come from a far country, from the uttermost part of heaven, even Yahweh, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.

Tailo: Jiânāu Iésu koh kā in kóng, Taⁿ lín tio̍h kā tsuí iúⁿ tshut-.lâi, phâng khì hō͘ pān toh ê hū-tsik-jîn. In tsiū phâng khì hō͘ i.
English: He said to them, Now draw some out, and take it to the ruler of the feast. So they took it.

Tailo: Su-tê-hua-no͘h tshiong-muá un-tián kah tsâi-lîng, tī bîn-tsiòng ê tiong-kan kiânn tuā ê kî-sū kah sîn-jiah.
English: Stephen, full of faith and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.

Tailo: In-uī in bô-iân bô-kò͘ àm-tiong siat lô-bāng tī hām-kheⁿ lāi, ku̍t hām-kheⁿ beh hāi guá ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: For without cause they have hidden their net in a pit for me. Without cause they have dug a pit for my soul.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k hiah-ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ iáu-buē tuì Isulael tiong tû-.khì, tsóng-.sī, Asah ê sim tsi̍t-sì-lâng tsuan-it bô iô-tsuah.
English: But the high places were not taken away out of Israel: nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect all his days.

Tailo: Iôséhuh ē jīn-tit in a-hiaⁿ, m̄-koh, in bē jīn-tit i.
English: Joseph recognized his brothers, but they didn't recognize him.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h iô hiah-ê tsè-mi̍h kah khí-thâu si̍k ê be̍h ê piáⁿ, tsò iô-tsè tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kah hit nn̄g tsiah iûⁿ-á tio̍h kā in hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, lâi kui hō͘ tsè-si.
English: The priest shall wave them with the bread of the first fruits for a wave offering before Yahweh, with the two lambs. They shall be holy to Yahweh for the priest.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín m̄-sī tī o͘-àm tiong teh kuè-ji̍t, hit-ê ji̍t bē tshin-tshiūnn tsha̍t-á hut-jiân-kan lâi-kàu lín tau.
English: But you, brothers, aren't in darkness, that the day should overtake you like a thief.

Tailo: Lín mā tio̍h kā guá tī Aigi̍p it-tshè ê îng-kng kah lín só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì, lóng kā guá ê lāu-pē kóng, koh tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín kā guá ê lāu-pē puaⁿ-lâi guá tsia tuà.
English: You shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that you have seen. You shall hurry and bring my father down here.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá kin-á-ji̍t beh kiâⁿ sè-kan lâng só͘ tio̍h kiânn ê lō͘, lín it-sim it-ì tsai-iáⁿ, Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè só͘ ìng-ín sù-hok hō͘ lín ê uē, bô tsi̍t kù lo̍k-khong, lóng tī lín ê sin tsiūⁿ ìng-giām, kî-tiong bô lo̍k-khong kah tsi̍t hāng.
English: Behold, this day I am going the way of all the earth: and you know in all your hearts and in all your souls, that not one thing has failed of all the good things which Yahweh your God spoke concerning you; all are happen to you, not one thing has failed of it.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, Iésu tuì be̍h-hn̂g king-kuè, I ê bûn-tô͘ tiah be̍h-suī, īng tshiú juê lâi tsia̍h.
English: Now it happened on the second Sabbath after the first, that he was going through the grain fields. His disciples plucked the heads of grain, and ate, rubbing them in their hands.

Tailo: Mā tio̍h īng i ê tsíng-thâu-á hiù hueh tī tuâⁿ-.ni̍h tshit pái, hō͘ i tshing-khì, lī-khui Isulael lâng ê bô tshing-khì, kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: He shall sprinkle some of the blood on it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and make it holy from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Guá ē tsò i ê Thiⁿ-pē, i ē tsò Guá ê kiáⁿ; Guá bô beh hō͘ Guá ê tsû-ài lī-khui i, tshin-tshiūnn Guá tsá-tsîng hō͘ i lī-khui hit-ê lí tsîng tsi̍t-ê ông.
English: I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my loving kindness away from him, as I took it from him that was before you;

Tailo: Hit sî, Ha-ta̍t iáu-sī sè-hàn ê gín-á. Ha-ta̍t kah i ê lāu-pē ê jîn-sîn tiong kuí-nā-ê Etóm lâng tsáu-khì Aigi̍p.
English: that Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father's servants with him, to go into Egypt, Hadad being yet a little child.

Tailo: I nā m̄ sio̍k-huê hit-ê tē, á-.sī kā tē bē hō͘ pa̍t lâng, tsiū bē-tàng koh sio̍k tit.
English: If he will not redeem the field, or if he has sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more;

Tailo: In tsàu ông ê pió-tsiuⁿ lāi ū kóng, Guān Ta-lió-suh ông bān sū pîng-an.
English: they sent a letter to him, in which was written thus: To Darius the king, all peace.

Tailo: Guān guá ē tsai tuì án-tsuáⁿ lâi tsáu-tshuē Siōngtè, hō͘ guá thang kàu I ê tsō-uī!
English: Oh that I knew where I might find him! That I might come even to his seat!

Tailo: Kià-kha tī guá tshù lāi ê lâng kah guá ê lú-pī, lóng kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò sī guā-lâng; in kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò sī guā-pang lâng.
English: Those who dwell in my house, and my maids, count me for a stranger. I am an alien in their sight.

Tailo: Hilâm ê lô͘-po̍k kah Só͘lômóng ê lô͘-po̍k, tuì O͘-huil tuà kim lâi ê, koh tuà tuâⁿ-hiuⁿ tshâ kah pó-tsio̍h lâi.
English: The servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon, who brought gold from Ophir, brought algum trees and precious stones.

Tailo: Iâkop kóng, Mài án-ne, guá nā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, kiû lí tuì guá ê tshiú siu guá ê lé-mi̍h, in-uī guá kìⁿ-tio̍h lí ê bīn, tshin-tshiūnn kìⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtè ê bīn, koh lí mā tsiap-la̍p guá.
English: Jacob said, Please, no, if I have now found favor in your sight, then receive my present at my hand, because I have seen your face, as one sees the face of God, and you were pleased with me.

Tailo: Hit sî, thian-hā ê kháu-im, giân-gí lóng sio-siâng.
English: The whole earth was of one language and of one speech.

Tailo: In tuì hia tshut-huat, kàu Kok-ko-tāi, koh tuì Kok-ko-tāi kàu Iok-pa-tha, to̍h-sī ū khe tsuí ê tē.
English: From there they traveled to Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of brooks of water.

Tailo: Bān-kok tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p, tsìng lâng tio̍h tsū-huē. Kî-tiong siáⁿ lâng ē kā tsit-ê kóng bîng, mā kā í-tsîng ê tāi-tsì lóng kóng hō͘ guán thiaⁿ? In thang tshuā kiàn-tsìng lâi, ka-kī hián-bîng in tsò tio̍h, á-.sī lâng nā thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kóng: Tse sī tsin-si̍t.
English: Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the peoples be assembled: who among them can declare this, and show us former things? let them bring their witnesses, that they may be justified; or let them hear, and say, It is truth.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, m̄-thang khuànn-khin Siōngtsú ê kíng-kài, mā m̄-thang thó-ià, khuànn-khin I ê tsik-pī.
English: My son, don't despise Yahweh's discipline, Neither be weary of his reproof:

Tailo: Sè-kan ū tsin tsē-tsióng ê im-gí, ta̍k-ê lóng ū ì-sù.
English: There are, it may be, so many kinds of sounds in the world, and none of them is without meaning.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, miâ kiò-tsò A-ná-ni-a, i kah i ê bó͘ Sap-hui-la bē in ê sán-gia̍p.
English: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira, his wife, sold a possession,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì in kóng: Tse to̍h-sī m̄ tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè ê uē, bô siū kàu-tok ê jîn-bîn; sîng-si̍t tsiū siau-sit-.khì, tuì in ê tshuì tsua̍t-tn̄g.
English: You shall tell them, This is the nation that has not listened to the voice of Yahweh their God, nor received instruction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth.

Tailo: Phòng-hong koh hàm-kó͘ ê lâng, lí kám m̄-tsai bô tsiàu tō-lí kiânn ê sìn-gióng lóng bô lō͘-īng?
English: But do you want to know, vain man, that faith apart from works is dead?

Tailo: Taⁿ lí ê tsiong-kio̍k í-king kàu à, Guá beh hō͘ Guá ê siū-khì lîm-kàu tī lí, mā beh tsiàu lí ê só͘ kiâⁿ lâi kā lí sím-phuàⁿ; tsiàu lí it-tshè khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì kā lí pò-ìng.
English: Now is the end on you, and I will send my anger on you, and will judge you according to your ways; and I will bring on you all your abominations.

Tailo: Sī gōng lâng ê tsí-tō tsiá, sī siàu-liân lâng ê lāu-su. Lí siūⁿ kóng kì-jiân ū lu̍t-huat, tuì tì-sik kah tsin-lí tsiū ū pá-ak.
English: a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babies, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, bô tsuan-sim tuè Siōngtsú, tshin-tshiūnn i ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t.
English: Solomon did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and didn't go fully after Yahweh, as did David his father.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá ta̍k ji̍t teh piàⁿ-miā, in-uī lán pêⁿ-pêⁿ sī kah Tsú Ki-tok Iésu kiat-liân, guá uī-tio̍h lín kám-kak tsin kong-îng, só͘-í, guá káⁿ án-ne kóng.
English: I affirm, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.

Tailo: Lín kā hiah-ê gī lâng tīng tsuē, koh kā in thâi-sí, in mā bô kā lín tí-khòng.
English: You have condemned, you have murdered the righteous one. He doesn't resist you.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kah Mâlíah tī tshù lāi teh an-uì i ê Iô-tá-iah lâng, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i kuáⁿ-kín khí-lâi tshut-.khì, tsiū tuè i khì, siūⁿ kóng i beh khì bōng-.ni̍h thî-khàu.
English: Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and were consoling her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, She is going to the tomb to weep there.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Lín gia̍h to kah thuî-á tshut-lâi lia̍h guá, tshin-tshiūnn beh lia̍h tsha̍t-á, sī-.bô?
English: Jesus answered them, Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?

Tailo: Lí tsai tsit khuán lâng í-king pāi-huāi, i án-ne kè-sio̍k huān tsuē sī teh gí-tiāⁿ ka-kī ê tsuē.
English: knowing that such a one is perverted, and sins, being self-condemned.

Tailo: I koh phah-sí kok lāi só͘-ū ê tuā-kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī hiah-ê teh beh tsiâⁿ-tsò in khuì-la̍t ê khí-thâu.
English: He struck also all the firstborn in their land, The first fruits of all their manhood.

Tailo: sian-ti thuân hi-ké, tsè-si uá-khò in lâi pà-kuân; Guá ê tsú-bîn mā ài i án-ne, kàu kiat-kio̍k, lín beh án-tsuáⁿ tsò?
English: the prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will you do in the end of it?

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú sī tshòng-tsō tsiah-ê thiⁿ ê, I tsin-tsiàⁿ sī Siōngtè; I tsō tē lâi kā i uân-sîng, koh kā i kian-kò͘, m̄-sī khang-khang tsō ê, sī tshòng-tsō i lâi hō͘ lâng tuà ê. I án-ne kóng: Guá sī Siōngtsú, í-guā bô pa̍t-ê.
English: For thus says Yahweh who created the heavens, the God who formed the earth and made it, who established it and didn't create it a waste, who formed it to be inhabited: I am Yahweh; and there is no one else.

Tailo: Lí ná ē hō͘ lâng tshin-tshiūnn hái-.ni̍h ê hî, koh tshin-tshiūnn teh sô ê thâng, bô thâu-ba̍k teh kuán-lí?
English: and make men like the fish of the sea, like the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?

Tailo: I ê jîn-sîn kā i kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, guán thiaⁿ-tio̍h Isulael jîn-bîn ê lia̍t ông sī jîn-tsû ê ông, kiû lí tsún guán hâ muâ-pò͘ tī guán ê io, thâu-khak phua̍h soh-á, tshut-khì tâu-hâng Isulael ông, kiám-tshái i ē jiâu lí ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: His servants said to him, See now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings: let us, we pray you, put sackcloth on our bodies, and ropes on our heads, and go out to the king of Israel: peradventure he will save your life.

Tailo: Ông khiā tī thiāu piⁿ, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng li̍p-iok, beh tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng sūn-ho̍k Siōngtsú, siú I ê kài-bīng kah kiàn-tsìng ê uē, í-ki̍p lu̍t-lē, lâi tsiâⁿ tsit pún tsheh só͘ kì li̍p-iok ê uē. Jîn-bîn lóng sîng-jīn tsit-ê iok.
English: The king stood by the pillar, and made a covenant before Yahweh, to walk after Yahweh, and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and all his soul, to confirm the words of this covenant that were written in this book: and all the people stood to the covenant.

Tailo: Guá ê ì-sù sī beh thong-ti lí kóng, tio̍h tī tsiah-ê tsē-.leh ê lâng ê bīn-tsîng kah guá ê jîn-bîn ê tiúⁿ-ló ê bīn-tsîng kóng hō͘ bîng, lí nā beh sio̍k, tsiū kā i sio̍k-huê; lí nā m̄-sio̍k, tsiū kóng hō͘ guá tsai, in-uī lí í-guā bô pa̍t lâng thang kā i sio̍k-huê; pâi tē-jī ê to̍h-sī guá. I ìn kóng, Guá beh kā i sio̍k-huê.
English: I thought to disclose it to you, saying, Buy it before those who sit here, and before the elders of my people. If you will redeem it, redeem it: but if you will not redeem it, then tell me, that I may know; for there is none to redeem it besides you; and I am after you. He said, I will redeem it.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī O-biat-e-tóm ê kiáⁿ-sun, in kah in ê kiáⁿ in ê hiann-tī lóng sī ióng-sū, ū khuì-la̍t gâu pān tāi-tsì ê, kiōng la̍k-tsa̍p jī lâng, lóng sī O-biat-e-tóm seⁿ ê.
English: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom: they and their sons and their brothers, able men in strength for the service; sixty-two of Obed-Edom.

Tailo: Guá ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h hâ muâ-pò͘, kō tī hué-hu tiong. Tio̍h pi-siong, tshin-tshiūnn sòng-sit to̍k-seⁿ kiáⁿ, thòng-sim thî-khàu, in-uī tsân-sat ê ē hut-jiân lâi-kàu lán tiong-kan.
English: Daughter of my people, gird you with sackcloth, and wallow yourself in ashes: make you mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation; for the destroyer shall suddenly come on us.

Tailo: Ing-tsiáu tshìng kuân tī kuân ê só͘-tsāi tsò siū, kám sī tsiàu lí ê bīng-līng?
English: Is it at your command that the eagle mounts up, And makes his nest on high?

Tailo: Kóng kok tsióng kńg-tsi̍h-uē ê lâng m̄-sī teh tuì lâng kóng, sī teh tuì Siōngtè kóng, in-uī bô lâng thiaⁿ ū. Tsóng-.sī, i ū teh kóng sio̍k-lîng ê ò-pì.
English: For he who speaks in another language speaks not to men, but to God; for no one understands; but in the Spirit he speaks mysteries.

Tailo: tuà tī Hebúlông ê, í-ki̍p Tabi̍t kah tuè i ê lâng pîng-sî só͘ óng-lâi ê só͘-tsāi, lóng ū pun hō͘ in.
English: and to those who were in Hebron, and to all the places where David himself and his men used to stay.

Tailo: Nā án-ne kóng-khí-.lâi, hiah-ê thún-ta̍h Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ, biáu-sī hō͘ in pún-sin sìng-huà kui Tsú ê iok ê hueh, koh bú-jio̍k si un ê Sìng Sîn ê lâng, lín siūⁿ in ing-kai siū ê hîng-hua̍t tio̍h ke guā tāng?
English: How much worse punishment, do you think, will he be judged worthy of, who has trodden under foot the Son of God, and has counted the blood of the covenant with which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and has insulted the Spirit of grace?

Tailo: Koh khí Siōngtsú ê tsè-tuâⁿ, tī tuâⁿ tíng hiàn siā-un-tsè kah kám-siā-tsè, bīng-līng Iôtah lâng ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè.
English: He built up the altar of Yahweh, and offered thereon sacrifices of peace offerings and of thanksgiving, and commanded Judah to serve Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Tsú kah in tông-tsāi, ke-thinn in ê khuì-la̍t, tsin tsē lâng sìn lâi kui Tsú.
English: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.

Tailo: Thuân-tō-tsiá m̄-nā ū tì-huī, i koh kà-sī jîn-bîn tì-sik, mā tiām-tiām siūⁿ, tshâ-khó, koh tsiàu tshù-sū pâi-lia̍t tsin tsē tsim-giân.
English: Further, because the Preacher was wise, he still taught the people knowledge. Yes, he pondered, sought out, and set in order many proverbs.

Tailo: koh huí-huāi hiah-ê thiāu-siōng, tshò hiah-ê A-si-lah, hō͘ lâng ê kut-thâu tshiong-muá hiah-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: He broke in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Asherim, and filled their places with the bones of men.

Tailo: I īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò toh-á, tn̂g nn̄g tiú, khuah tsi̍t tiú, kuân tiú puàⁿ,
English: He made the table of acacia wood. Its length was two cubits, and its breadth was a cubit, and its height was a cubit and a half.

Tailo: Kìng-ài ê Thê-o-hui-lô tāi-jîn, ū tsin tsē lâng í-king kā guán tiong-kan só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì tsíng-lí kì-lio̍k lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Since many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,

Tailo: Tuì Ho-lep king-kuè Seil suaⁿ ê lō͘ kàu Ka-te-su-pa-nî-a, ū tsa̍p-it ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng.
English: It is eleven days' journey from Horeb by the way of Mount Seir to Kadesh Barnea.

Tailo: I koh kā lô͘-po̍k kóng, Lâi, lán tio̍h lâi-khì tsiah-ê só͘-tsāi tiong-kan ê tsi̍t-ê, lâi hioh tī Gi-be-at á-.sī La̍h-má.
English: He said to his servant, Come and let us draw near to one of these places; and we will lodge in Gibeah, or in Ramah.

Tailo: Lán í-king kí Siōngtsú lâi tsiù-tsuā, bô beh kā tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kè hō͘ in, taⁿ tsiū in só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng, lán beh tuì tó-uī hō͘ in ū bó͘?
English: How shall we do for wives for those who remain, seeing we have sworn by Yahweh that we will not give them of our daughters to wives?

Tailo: Siōngtè hō͘ lín kah Ki-tok Iésu kiat-liân, hō͘ Ki-tok tsiâⁿ-tsò lán tuì Siōngtè lâi ê tì-huī, koh hō͘ lán kah Siōngtè hô-hó, tsiâⁿ-tsò Siōngtè sìng-kiat ê tsú-bîn, iū-koh hō͘ lán tit-tio̍h kiù-sio̍k.
English: But of him, you are in Christ Jesus, who was made to us wisdom from God, and righteousness and sanctification, and redemption:

Tailo: Seⁿ-sí ê kuân-pìng tsāi tī tshuì-tsi̍h; thiàⁿ i ê lâng ē tsia̍h i ê kué-tsí.
English: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; Those who love it will eat its fruit.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hiah-ê lâng m̄-thiaⁿ i ê uē, hit-ê lâng tsiū kā i ê sè-î khan tshut-khì guā-bīn kau in, in tsiū kah i kau-ha̍p, kui mê kā i lîng-jio̍k, kàu tsá-khí thiⁿ beh kng ê sî, tsiah pàng i khì.
English: But the men wouldn't listen to him: so the man laid hold on his concubine, and brought her forth to them; and they knew her, and abused her all the night until the morning: and when the day began to spring, they let her go.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsin tio̍h-kip, in-uī tsìng lâng kóng tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā Tabi̍t tìm-sí. Lâng-lâng uī-tio̍h in ê kiáⁿ-jî tsin huân-ló, tsóng-.sī, Tabi̍t uá-khò Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè, ka-kī kian-kò͘.
English: David was greatly distressed; for the people spoke of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every man for his sons and for his daughters: but David strengthened himself in Yahweh his God.

Tailo: In-uī Abulahàm teh kî-thāi Siōngtè só͘ siat 計 khí-tsō hit-ê ū tē-ki ê siâⁿ.
English: For he looked for the city which has the foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

Tailo: Kiû Lí īng Lí ê kuái-á tshī Lí ê tsú-bîn, to̍h-sī Lí ê sán-gia̍p ê iûⁿ-kûn, tī Kal-mel suaⁿ ka-kī tiàm tī tshiū-nâ lāi ê, tshī in tī Basiáng kah Gilia̍t, tshin-tshiūnn tsá-sî án-ne.
English: Shepherd your people with your staff, The flock of your heritage, Who dwell by themselves in a forest, In the midst of fertile pasture land, let them feed; In Bashan and Gilead, as in the days of old.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Siōngtsú tshuā Isulael lâng, tsiàu in ê kun-tuī, tshut Aigi̍p tē.
English: It happened the same day, that Yahweh brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.

Tailo: Hó lâng tuì só͘ tsik-tsū ê hó lâi hián-tshut liông-siān; pháiⁿ lâng tuì só͘ tsik-tsū ê pháiⁿ lâi hián-tshut siâ-ok.
English: The good man out of his good treasure brings out good things, and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings out evil things.

Tailo: Sàulô tsiū kā i ê kun-ho̍k hō͘ Tabi̍t tshīng, īng tâng ê thâu-khue hō͘ i tì, koh hō͘ i tshīng tsiàn-kah.
English: Saul clad David with his clothing, and he put a helmet of brass on his head, and he clad him with a coat of mail.

Tailo: Guān Siōngtè hō͘ Iá-hia̍t huat-tián, hō͘ i tuà tī Sémh ê pò͘-pênn, Ka-nân mā tsò i ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: God enlarge Japheth, Let him dwell in the tents of Shem; Let Canaan be his servant.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù Isulael lâng, kā hit-ê uī-tio̍h beh tsiò-kng só͘ kheh tshing ê kaⁿ-ná iû, the̍h-lâi hō͘ lí, hō͘ ting tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tiám-to̍h.
English: You shall command the children of Israel, that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.

Tailo: Iosiúah kong-tshú hiah-ê ông só͘-ū ê siâⁿ kah in ê ông, īng to kā in thâi-sí, kā in tsuân-pō͘ siau-bia̍t, tsiàu Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng ê.
English: All the cities of those kings, and all the kings of them, did Joshua take, and he struck them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed them; as Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded.

Tailo: Kiû lí tsún lí ê lô͘-po̍k tńg-.khì, hō͘ guá thang sí tī guá ê pún-siâⁿ, guá ê pē-bú ê bōng hia. Lí khuàⁿ, lí ê lô͘-po̍k Kim-hám tī tsia, hō͘ i kah guá ê tsú — guá ê ông kuè-.khì, tsiàu lí só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê lâi kā i khuán-thāi.
English: Please let your servant turn back again, that I may die in my own city, by the grave of my father and my mother. But behold, your servant Chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what shall seem good to you.

Tailo: Lín ê Siōngtè ê tiān nā iáu ū su-iàu siáⁿ-mi̍h, lí só͘ ing-kai tio̍h īng ê, lí thang tuì ông ê kim-khò͘ the̍h-khì īng.
English: Whatever more shall be needful for the house of your God, which you shall have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king's treasure house.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tio̍h ta̍k-ê tah i ka-kī ê pò͘-pênn, tī ka-kī ê tuā kî hā, tī pún tso̍k ê kî-hō hia, uî-uî ǹg huē-bō͘ tsat iâⁿ.
English: The children of Israel shall encamp every man by his own standard, with the banners of their fathers' houses: at a distance from the tent of meeting shall they encamp around it.

Tailo: I kóng, Tuā-tuā tit-tio̍h thióng-ài ê lâng, m̄-bián kiaⁿ, guān lí pîng-an! Lí tio̍h ióng-tsòng, tio̍h ióng-tsòng. I tsi̍t-ē tuì guá kóng uē, guá tsiū tit-tio̍h ū la̍t, kóng, Guá ê tsú ah, tshiáⁿ lí kóng, in-uī lí í-king hō͘ guá ū la̍t.
English: He said, Greatly beloved man, don't be afraid: peace be to you, be strong, yes, be strong. When he spoke to me, I was strengthened, and said, Let my lord speak; for you have strengthened me.

Tailo: Taⁿ tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê! I kóng, Khí-.lâi! Lí tio̍h tī tsiah-ê suaⁿ ê bīn-tsîng piān-lūn, hō͘ tsiah-ê suaⁿ-niá thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê siann.
English: Listen now to what Yahweh says: Arise, plead your case before the mountains, And let the hills hear what you have to say.

Tailo: In koh kā Abúlâm ê ti̍t-á Lótoh kah i ê tsâi-bu̍t tshiúⁿ-.khì; hit sî, Lótoh tuà tī So͘tóm.
English: They took Lot, Abram's brother's son, who lived in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī i ê thâu-khak huāⁿ-tshiú, tī huē-bō͘ tsîng kā i thâi. Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun tio̍h kā hueh hiù tī tuâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: and he shall lay his hand on its head, and kill it before the tent of meeting; and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its blood on the altar round about.

Tailo: Koh tshuā i nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Kelsióng, in-uī Mô͘se kóng, Guá kià-kha tī guā-pang.
English: and her two sons. The name of one son was Gershom, for Moses said, I have lived as a foreigner in a foreign land.

Tailo: Guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū siaⁿ tuì thinn-tíng tshut-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn tuā-tsuí teh tshiâng ê siann, mā tshin-tshiūnn luî teh tân ê siann; guá só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê siann, tshin-tshiūnn khîm-tshiú teh tuâⁿ khiā-khîm ê siann.
English: I heard a sound from heaven, like the sound of many waters, and like the sound of a great thunder. The sound which I heard was like that of harpists playing on their harps.

Tailo: Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ Abisai kā ông kóng, Tsit tsiah sí-káu, kám thang tsiù-tsó͘ guá ê tsú — guá ê ông? Kiû lí tsún guá kuè-.khì, kuah i ê thâu.
English: Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah to the king, Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? Please let me go over and take off his head.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē tsai I khíng ua̍t tò tńg-lâi hō͘-hué, lâu hok-khì tī āu-lâi, to̍h-sī ū sò͘-tsè kah kuàn-tiān hiàn hō͘ lín ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú.
English: Who knows? He may turn and relent, And leave a blessing behind him, Even a meal offering and a drink offering to Yahweh, your God.

Tailo: M̄-koh, bô-lūn ji̍p-khì siáⁿ-mi̍h siâⁿ, lâng nā m̄ tsiap-la̍p lín, lín tio̍h tshut-khì in ê tuā ke-lō͘, kóng,
English: But into whatever city you enter, and they don't receive you, go out into the streets of it and say,

Tailo: Tuà tī Gilia̍t ê Thi-si-bih lâng Eliiah tuì Ahap kóng, Guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī guá khiā tī I ê bīn-tsîng ê lâi kóng: Tsit kuí nî, guá nā bô kóng, ē bô lō͘-tsuí, bô hō͘.
English: Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the foreigners of Gilead, said to Ahab, As Yahweh, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.

Tailo: Hō͘ in tshing-khì tio̍h án-ne kiânn, īng tû-khì tsuē ê tsuí hiù tī in sing-khu, koh kah in īng thì thâu to thì tsuân sing-khu, sé saⁿ-khò͘, tshing-khì pún-sin.
English: Thus shall you do to them, to cleanse them: sprinkle the water of cleansing on them, let them shave their whole bodies with a razor, and let them wash their clothes, and cleanse themselves.

Tailo: E-hú tsio-tsi̍p tsìng lâng, kā in kóng, Ahap ho̍k-sāi Baal iáu-sī sió-khuá, E-hú ē tuā-tuā kā i ho̍k-sāi.
English: Jehu gathered all the people together, and said to them, Ahab served Baal a little; but Jehu will serve him much.

Tailo: Tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê sio-liân, khuì to bē-tàng thàu-ji̍p hit tiong-kan.
English: One is so near to another, That no air can come between them.

Tailo: In-uī Guá beh kā tsuí piàⁿ hō͘ tshuì-ta ê lâng, īng hô tsuí kuàn-ak ta tē. Guá beh kā Guá ê sîn kàng-lo̍h tī lí ê kiáⁿ-sun, kā Guá ê hok-khì kàng-lo̍h tī lí ê āu-tāi.
English: For I will pour water on him who is thirsty, and streams on the dry ground; I will pour my Spirit on your seed, and my blessing on your offspring:

Tailo: Lín tsò tiōng-hu ê mā tio̍h kah ka-kī ê hū-jîn-lâng tuà tsò-hué, thé-thiap in jio̍k-thé siōng khah nńg-tsiáⁿ; tio̍h kā in tsun-tiōng, in-uī in mā pêⁿ-pêⁿ kah lín tsò-hué sîng-tsiap Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù ua̍h-miā ê un-tián. Án-ne, lín ê kî-tó tsiah bē tú-tio̍h tsó͘-gāi.
English: You husbands, in like manner, live with your wives according to knowledge, giving honor to the woman, as to the weaker vessel, as being also joint heirs of the grace of life; that your prayers may not be hindered.

Tailo: Sìng-tiān lāi bīn tshiong-muá Siōngtè ê îng-kng kah kuân-lîng tshìng tshut-.lâi ê ian. It-ti̍t kàu tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài ê tshit-hāng tsai-hō kiat-sok tsìn-tsîng, bô lâng ē-tàng ji̍p-khì sìng-tiān.
English: The temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God, and from his power. No one was able to enter into the temple, until the seven plagues of the seven angels would be finished.

Tailo: Lí gia̍h thâu khuànn sì-hng, in lóng tsū-tsi̍p lâi lí tsia. Lí ê tsìng kiáⁿ tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lâi; lí ê tsìng tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ mā beh hō͘ lâng phō-.lâi.
English: Lift up your eyes round about, and see: they all gather themselves together, they come to you; your sons shall come from far, and your daughters shall be carried in the arms.

Tailo: Tsí-ū Lí sī thang kiaⁿ-uì ê! Lí ê siū-khì tsi̍t-ē huat-tshut, siáⁿ lâng tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng khiā ē tiâu?
English: You, even you, are to be feared. Who can stand in your sight when you are angry?

Tailo: Taⁿ Lí nā thâi-sí tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, tshin-tshiūnn thâi-sí tsi̍t-ê lâng, hiah-ê thiaⁿ-tio̍h Lí ê miâ-siaⁿ ê lia̍t kok ē gī-lūn kóng,
English: Now if you shall kill this people as one man, then the nations which have heard the fame of you will speak, saying,

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā Ionáthan kóng, Bîn-á-tsài sī tshe-it, guá ing-kai tio̍h kah ông tsē-toh, kiû lí iông-ín guá khì bih tī tshân-.ni̍h, kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t ê-hng.
English: David said to Jonathan, Behold, tomorrow is the new moon, and I should not fail to sit with the king at meat: but let me go, that I may hide myself in the field to the third day at evening.

Tailo: Alông tio̍h khan uī ka-kī tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê gû-káng-á, uī-tio̍h ka-kī kah i ê ke sio̍k-tsuē, mā tio̍h thâi uī ka-kī tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê gû-káng-á.
English: Aaron shall present the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and shall make atonement for himself and for his house, and shall kill the bull of the sin offering which is for himself.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán m̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn kî-tha ê lâng teh khùn, tio̍h kíng-síng kín-sīn.
English: so then let's not sleep, as the rest do, but let's watch and be sober.

Tailo: Kā tsìng lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì liáu-āu, Iésu tsiū ji̍p-khì tsa-bó͘ gín-á ê pâng-king, khan i ê tshiú. Tsa-bó͘ gín-á tsiū khí-.lâi.
English: But when the crowd was put out, he entered in, took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó, àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá ê tshuì só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: Hear my prayer, God. Listen to the words of my mouth.

Tailo: Siōngtè sī guá ê pang-tsān, Tsú sī guá ê pó-hō͘-tsiá.
English: Behold, God is my helper. The Lord is the one who sustains my soul.

Tailo: In-uī lín í-king sí, lín ê ua̍h-miā kah Ki-tok tsò-hué ún-tsông tī Siōngtè lāi-bīn.
English: For you died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.

Tailo: in-uī tsit-ê enn-á bē-hiáu kiò a-pa, a-bú ê tsìn-tsîng, Ta-má-su-ko ê tsâi-pó kah Sa-má-lī-a siū tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h lóng ē hông puann-khì tī Asiul ông ê bīn-tsîng.
English: For before the child knows how to say, My father,' and, My mother,' the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria will be carried away by the king of Assyria.

Tailo: In ho̍k-sāi Ke-tah-láu-mel tsa̍p-jī nî, kàu tsa̍p-saⁿ nî puē-puān.
English: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year, they rebelled.

Tailo: Kuì-tso̍k kah tsìng lâng tsiū kā tsè-si, sian-ti kóng, Tsit-ê lâng bô ing-kai tīng i sí-tsuē, in-uī i sī thok Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè ê miâ lâi tuì lán kóng-uē.
English: Then said the princes and all the people to the priests and to the prophets: This man is not worthy of death; for he has spoken to us in the name of Yahweh our God.

Tailo: Guá uī-tio̍h tsit-ê hok-im siū khó͘, sīm-tsì tshin-tshiūnn huān-lâng hō͘ lâng kuà kha-liâu tshiú-khàu. Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtè ê tō-lí bô siū khún-pa̍k.
English: in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God's word isn't chained.

Tailo: Ū ê-hng, ū tsá-khí, sī tē-saⁿ ji̍t.
English: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.

Tailo: Tún ngó͘-kok m̄ thiò ê lâng ē hō͘ jîn-bîn tsiù-tsó͘; kam-guān thiò tshut ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h tsiok-hok.
English: People curse someone who withholds grain, But blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.

Tailo: I kā guá kóng, Lí ji̍p-.khì, khuànn in tī hit lāi-bīn só͘ kiâⁿ khó-ò͘ⁿ ê pháiⁿ tāi.
English: He said to me, Go in, and see the wicked abominations that they do here.

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t tsiah tuā ing, si̍t tuā, mn̂g tsa̍t, lí khuàⁿ, tsit-ê phû-tô tshiū tuì tsai-tsìng ê só͘-tsāi uan i ê kin ǹg i, huat i ê ki ǹg i, ǹg-bāng i lâi kuàn-ak.
English: There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers: and behold, this vine did bend its roots toward him, and shot forth its branches toward him, from the beds of its plantation, that he might water it.

Tailo: Pe̍h-tsha̍t ê tshuì-tûn sī Siōngtsú só͘ thó-ià; tsò tāi-tsì sîng-si̍t ê lâng sī I só͘ huann-hí.
English: Lying lips are an abomination to Yahweh, But those who do the truth are his delight.

Tailo: Tshit gue̍h tsa̍p-tshit, tsûn khuà tī A-la̍h-la̍t ê suaⁿ.
English: The ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on Ararat's mountains.

Tailo: Etsula̍h kî-tó, jīn tsuē, thî-khàu, phak tī Siōngtè tiān tsîng ê sî, ū tuì Isulael tiong-kan lâi ê lâm-lí gín-á tsū-tsi̍p tī i hia, tsiâⁿ-tsò tāi-huē, jîn-bîn khàu kah tsin tshiⁿ-tshám.
English: Now while Ezra prayed and made confession, weeping and casting himself down before the house of God, there was gathered together to him out of Israel a very great assembly of men and women and children; for the people wept very sore.

Tailo: Mā tuà sio-tsè tsiàu lē lâi hiàn.
English: He presented the burnt offering, and offered it according to the ordinance.

Tailo: Jiânāu, Nepkatnetsal kiâⁿ kīn iām-jua̍h ê hué-lô͘ kháu, tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tsì-kuân Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k — Sia-to-la̍k, Me-siak kah A-bia̍t-ne-go͘, tshut-.lâi, lâi guá tsia! Sia-to-la̍k, Me-siak kah A-bia̍t-ne-go͘ tsiū tuì hué tiong tshut-.lâi.
English: Then Nebuchadnezzar came near to the mouth of the burning fiery furnace: he spoke and said, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, you servants of the Most High God, come forth, and come here. Then Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego came forth out of the midst of the fire.

Tailo: mā tsia̍h gû-ling-iû kah iûⁿ-ling, puî ê iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ, Basiáng só͘ tshut ê mî-iûⁿ-káng kah suaⁿ-iûⁿ, kah siōng hó ê sió-be̍h, mā lim phû-tô-tsiap ê tsiú.
English: Butter of the herd, and milk of the flock, With fat of lambs, Rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats, With the finest of the wheat; Of the blood of the grape you drank wine.

Tailo: Kî-tiong mā ū ê siū siat-li̍p lâi kuán-lí hiah-ê khì-kū kah sìng-só͘ ê khì-kū, í-ki̍p mī-hún, tsiú, iû, jú-hiuⁿ kah phang-liāu.
English: Some of them also were appointed over the furniture, and over all the vessels of the sanctuary, and over the fine flour, and the wine, and the oil, and the frankincense, and the spices.

Tailo: Guán lāu-pē sí tī khòng-iá, i m̄-sī tī Khóla̍h ê tóng lāi, bô kah in kâng tóng tsò-hué kong-kik Siōngtsú; sī tī ka-kī ê tsuē tiong sí; i mā bô kiáⁿ.
English: Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not among the company of those who gathered themselves together against Yahweh in the company of Korah: but he died in his own sin; and he had no sons.

Tailo: Lán tio̍h án-ne khuán-thāi in, iông-ín in ua̍h-.leh, khióng-kiaⁿ lán uī-tio̍h tuì in só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê siū-khì lîm-kàu tī lán.
English: This we will do to them, and let them live; lest wrath be on us, because of the oath which we swore to them.

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê kài-hān sī Lí só͘ siat-li̍p; jua̍h-thinn kah kuâⁿ-thiⁿ sī Lí só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h.
English: You have set all the boundaries of the earth. You have made summer and winter.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú ê ji̍t teh beh kàu, lí ê tsâi-bu̍t ē hō͘ lâng pun tī lín tiong-kan.
English: Behold, a day of Yahweh comes, when your spoil will be divided in your midst.

Tailo: Thih sī tuì tē-.ni̍h tshú tshut-.lâi, tâng sī tuì tsio̍h-khòng iûⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: Iron is taken out of the earth, And copper is smelted out of the ore.

Tailo: Páulô kah Ba-ná-ba hām in ū tuā tsing-lūn, tāi-ke tsiū phài Páulô kah Ba-ná-ba, í-ki̍p in tiong-kan līng-guā kuí-nā-ê lâng, tsiūⁿ Êlúsalèm khì kìⁿ sù-tô͘ kah tiúⁿ-ló, kā só͘ piān-lūn ê tāi-tsì kah in thó-lūn.
English: Therefore when Paul and Barnabas had no small discord and discussion with them, they appointed Paul and Barnabas, and some others of them, to go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders about this question.

Tailo: Gōng lâng bô koh kiò-tsò ko-bîng, tàng-sng ê lâng bô koh kiò-tsò tuā-liōng.
English: The fool will no longer be called noble, Nor the scoundrel be highly respected.

Tailo: In kā Ehulaim suaⁿ tô-siám ê siâⁿ, Sīkhiàm kah i ê kau-iá hō͘ i, koh kā Getsel kah i ê kau-iá hō͘ in,
English: They gave to them the cities of refuge, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim with its suburbs; Gezer also with its suburbs,

Tailo: Kî-tha ê lâng kóng, Sió tán tsi̍t ē, khuànn Eliiah ē lâi kā I kiù á bē.
English: The rest said, Let him be. Let's see whether Elijah comes to save him.

Tailo: Guán ê ji̍t-tsí lóng tī Lí ê tuā siū-khì tiong king-kuè; guán ê nî-huè kuè-liáu tshin-tshiūnn thó͘ tsi̍t-ê khuì.
English: For all our days have passed away in your wrath. We bring our years to an end as a sigh.

Tailo: Lí ê tsi̍t ki kha nā ín-khí lí huān tsuē, tio̍h kā i tsām hiat-ka̍k; lîng-khó kiám tsi̍t ki kha phuà-siùⁿ lâi ji̍p-khì íng-uán ua̍h, pí siang kha hó-hó lo̍h tē-ga̍k khah hó.
English: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna, into the fire that will never be quenched

Tailo: Tuì tsit-ê lâng kóng, ' Lí ê tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián', á-.sī kóng, ' Lí khí-lâi kiâⁿ', tó tsi̍t hāng khah kán-tan?
English: For which is easier, to say, Your sins are forgiven;' or to say, Get up, and walk?'

Tailo: Á-sī ū tsi̍t-ê ông nā siūⁿ beh kah pa̍t-ê ông kau-tsiàn, kám bô tāi-sing tsē lo̍h-.lâi, siūⁿ khuàⁿ ē-tàng īng tsi̍t-bān-ê ping tí-khòng hit-ê tshuā nn̄g- bān-ê ping lâi kong-kik ê ông á-bē?
English: Or what king, as he goes to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?

Tailo: I ē tsiàu guá ê tuì-ti̍k tuì guá só͘ tsò ê pháiⁿ kā in pò-ìng; kiû Lí tsiàu Lí ê sìn-si̍t kā in huí-bia̍t.
English: He will repay the evil to my enemies. Destroy them in your truth.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú tuì guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t kóng, ' Lí ê sim ū ì-sù beh uī guá ê miâ khí tiān, lí tsit-ê ì-sù tsin hó;
English: But Yahweh said to David my father, Whereas it was in your heart to build a house for my name, you did well that it was in your heart:

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh teh beh kàu, tseh-kî tsìn-tsîng, tsin tsē lâng tuì tsng-thâu-tsiūⁿ-lâi Êlúsalèm, beh siú kiat-tsīng-lé.
English: Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand. Many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves.

Tailo: i ê kài tuì sai pîng uat lo̍h lâm, tuì Pak-hô-lûn thâu-tsîng lâm pîng ê suaⁿ, it-ti̍t kàu Iôtah lâng ê siâⁿ Ki-lia̍t-pa-li̍k ( Tsiū-sī Ki-lia̍t-iâ-lîm ) , tse sī in sai pîng ê kài.
English: The border extended there, and turned about on the west quarter southward, from the mountain that lies before Beth Horon southward; and the goings out of it were at Kiriath Baal ( the same is Kiriath Jearim ) , a city of the children of Judah: this was the west quarter.

Tailo: Guá tsiū beh tuì Guá siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê tē pue̍h in ê kin, jî-tshiánn Guá uī ka-kī ê miâ só͘ hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê tsit king tiān, mā beh tuì Guá ê bīn-tsîng kā i khì-sak, hō͘ i tī bān-kok tiong tsiâⁿ-tsò uē-pèⁿ lâi siū khau-sé.
English: then will I pluck them up by the roots out of my land which I have given them; and this house, which I have made holy for my name, will I cast out of my sight, and I will make it a proverb and a byword among all peoples.

Tailo: In sìn Hui-li̍p-pò͘ só͘ thuân ê hok-im, tâm-lūn Siōngtè kok-tō͘ kah Iésu Ki-tok ê miâ liáu-āu, tsiū ū lâm-lí tsiap siū sé-lé.
English: But when they believed Philip preaching good news concerning the Kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

Tailo: In ê lō͘ uan-khiau, in ê só͘ kiâⁿ hîng-gi̍k.
English: Who are crooked in their ways, And wayward in their paths:

Tailo: Lán nā kóng lán kah Siōngtè ū thuân-khè ê kuan-hē, m̄-koh, iáu kè-sio̍k tī o͘-àm tiong sing-ua̍h, án-ne sī teh kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t, bô tsiàu tsin-lí teh kiâⁿ.
English: If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in the darkness, we lie, and don't tell the truth.

Tailo: Lín ka-kī mā tio̍h kín-sīn! Lín ê hiann-tī nā huān tsuē, tio̍h kā i tsik-pī. I nā hué-kái, tio̍h kā i sià-bián.
English: Be careful. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.

Tailo: Hit sî, guán mn̄g hiah-ê tiúⁿ-ló, kā in kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng tshut līng hō͘ lín khí tsit-ê tiān, tshiâⁿ tsit-ê tshiûⁿ? '
English: Then asked we those elders, and said to them thus, Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?

Tailo: Tshit ji̍t ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t thàu-tsá, ji̍t tú-á tshut ê sî, in lâi-kàu bōng-tē.
English: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Isulael lâng, Isáiah bat suan-pò͘ kóng, Isulael ê kiáⁿ-sun, suî-jiân sò͘-bo̍k tshin-tshiūnn hái sua hiah-ni̍h tsē, ē tit-tio̍h kiù ê sī só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tsió-sò͘ niā-niā.
English: Isaiah cries concerning Israel, If the number of the children of Israel are as the sand of the sea, It is the remnant who will be saved;

Tailo: Án-ne, lín ê sìn-sim ē-tàng kian-kò͘, tī lán ê Tsú Iésu kah I ê tsìng sìn-tô͘ koh-tsài lâi-lîm ê sî, tī lán ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, ē-tàng sìng-kiat bô thang hiâm.
English: to the end he may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.

Tailo: Guá kám bô tuì Isulael tsìng tsi-tso̍k, kíng i tsò Guá ê tsè-si, tī Guá ê tuâⁿ tíng hiàn tsè, sio hiuⁿ, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng tshīng tsè-si ho̍k, Isulael tso̍k só͘ hiàn ê hué-tsè Guá kám bô lóng hō͘ i ê tsó͘-sian ê ke?
English: and did I choose him out of all the tribes of Israel to be my priest, to go up to my altar, to burn incense, to wear an ephod before me? and did I give to the house of your father all the offerings of the children of Israel made by fire?

Tailo: Tsò tsing-thàm ê khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng tuì siâⁿ lāi tshut-.lâi, tsiū tuì i kóng, Kiû lí kā ji̍p siâⁿ ê lō͘ pò guán tsai, guán ē hó khuán-thāi lí.
English: The watchers saw a man come forth out of the city, and they said to him, Show us, we pray you, the entrance into the city, and we will deal kindly with you.

Tailo: In tsiū kî-tó, kóng, Tsú ah, Lí tsai ta̍k lâng ê sim, kiû Lí tsí-sī guán, tsit nn̄g-ê lâng tiong-kan tó tsi̍t-ê sī Lí kíng-suán,
English: They prayed, and said, You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two you have chosen

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, tī thinn-tíng mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, ē uī-tio̍h tsuē-jîn tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê lâng hué-kái lâi huann-hí, pí uī-tio̍h ū káu-tsa̍p-káu ê m̄-bián hué-kái ê gī lâng koh khah huann-hí.
English: I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.

Tailo: ( Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ E-to-tòng. ) Guá bat kóng, Guá ē kín-sīn guá ê giân-hîng, guá ê tsi̍h tsiah bián-tit huān tsuē; pháiⁿ lâng tī guá bīn-tsîng ê sî, guá ē tshin-tshiūⁿ īng bé-kā-kiuⁿ lâi iok-sok guá ê tshuì.
English: I said, I will watch my ways, so that I don't sin with my tongue. I will keep my mouth with a bridle while the wicked is before me.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí tio̍h lim lí ê tuā-tsé só͘ lim ê pue; hit-ê pue tshim koh khuah, té tsin tsē mi̍h, lí tsiū ē hō͘ lâng thí-tshiò, khau-sé.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: You shall drink of your sister's cup, which is deep and large; you shall ridiculed and had in derision; it contains much.

Tailo: Guá ê kong-gī kīn lah; Guá ê kiù-un huat-tshut. Guá ê tshiú beh phuàⁿ-tuàn lia̍t pang; tó-sū lóng beh thìng-hāu Guá, koh beh uá-khò Guá ê tshiú.
English: My righteousness is near, my salvation is gone forth, and my arms shall judge the peoples; the islands shall wait for me, and on my arm shall they trust.

Tailo: In tit-tio̍h Amô͘lī lâng ê tsuân kíng-kài, tuì Al-nông kàu Iá-bo̍k, tuì khòng-iá kàu Ioltàn.
English: They possessed all the border of the Amorites, from the Arnon even to the Jabbok, and from the wilderness even to the Jordan.

Tailo: Siōngtsú sī guá ê khuì-la̍t, sī guá ê si-kua, mā sī tsò guá tsín-kiù ê Tsú. I sī guá ê Siōngtè, guá beh o-ló I, sī guá ê pē ê Siōngtè, guá beh tsun I tsò tuā.
English: Yah is my strength and song, He has become my salvation: This is my God, and I will praise him; My father's God, and I will exalt him.

Tailo: Tsit sî í-āu, Iobuh koh tsia̍h tsi̍t-pah sì-tsa̍p huè, tit-tio̍h khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê kiáⁿ, i ê sun, kàu sì tāi.
English: After this Job lived one hundred forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, to four generations.

Tailo: In thàm-khuàⁿ hit-ê tē-sì-tsa̍p kang tsiah tńg-.lâi.
English: They returned from spying out the land at the end of forty days.

Tailo: Iésu mn̄g in kóng, Lín kah in teh piān-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: He asked the scribes, What are you asking them?

Tailo: Lâng kah sim-pū su-thong ê, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ in nn̄g lâng lóng sí; in kiânn gi̍k-lûn ê tāi-tsì, in ê tsuē kui tī in.
English: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death: they have committed a perversion; their blood shall be upon them.

Tailo: Lín bē mi̍h hō͘ tshù-piⁿ, á-.sī tuì tshù-piⁿ bé mi̍h, lín m̄-thang sio khik-khui.
English: If you sell anything to your neighbor, or buy from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another.

Tailo: Lí nā sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng: Tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì ná ē lîm-kàu tī guá leh? Sī in-uī lí ê tsuē-kò tsin tāng, só͘-í, lí lō͘-thé tshiah-kha.
English: If you say in your heart, Why are these things come on me? for the greatness of your iniquity are your skirts uncovered, and your heels suffer violence.

Tailo: Iésu lī-khui hit só͘-tsāi, thè-khì-kàu Tulô kah Sitòng ê kíng lāi.
English: Jesus went out from there, and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.

Tailo: Tuì Siōngtsú hia lâi ê pháiⁿ sîn lîm-kàu Sàulô ê sî, Tabi̍t tsiū the̍h khîm īng tshiú lâi tuâⁿ. Sàulô tsiū khuan-sim, tit-tio̍h hó, pháiⁿ sîn tsiū lī-khui i.
English: It happened, when the evil spirit from God was on Saul, that David took the harp, and played with his hand: so Saul was refreshed, and was well, and the evil spirit departed from him.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h i hiah-ê kiáⁿ kah i só͘ siū ê kíng-kài, í-ki̍p i siu-lí Siōngtsú ê tiān ê tāi-tsì, lóng kì tī Lia̍t ông-kì lio̍k ê tsù-kái. I ê kiáⁿ Amátsiah suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Now concerning his sons, and the greatness of the burdens laid on him, and the rebuilding of the house of God, behold, they are written in the commentary of the book of the kings. Amaziah his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Guá koh khuànn, lí khuàⁿ, puî ê tshân piàn-tsò pha-hng ê tē; só͘-ū ê siâⁿ tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, in-uī I ê tuā siū-khì, tsuân-pō͘ tó-huāi.
English: I saw, and behold, the fruitful field was a wilderness, and all the cities of it were broken down at the presence of Yahweh, and before his fierce anger.

Tailo: Kok lāi ê tsóng-tiúⁿ, khim-tshe, tsóng-tok, bô͘-sū kah sûn-hú lóng tsò-hué gī-lūn, ài beh siat tsi̍t tiâu ông ê tiâu-lē, lâi li̍p tsi̍t tiâu giâm-keh ê kìm-līng, to̍h-sī tī saⁿ-tsa̍p kang lāi, tû-khì kiû ông í-guā, kiàn-nā bô-lūn tuì siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-bîng, á-.sī tuì lâng lâi kî-kiû ê, lóng tio̍h kā i hiat lo̍h-khì sai hia̍t.
English: All the presidents of the kingdom, the deputies and the satraps, the counselors and the governors, have consulted together to establish a royal statute, and to make a strong interdict, that whoever shall ask a petition of any god or man for thirty days, save of you, O king, he shall be cast into the den of lions.

Tailo: Hn̂g-tsú koh tshe tē-sann ê lô͘-po̍k khì, hiah-ê tshân-tiān mā sī kā i phah-siong, koh kā i kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.

Tailo: i ê sin-si m̄-thang tiàu tī tshâ-.ni̍h kuè-mê, it-tīng tio̍h tī hit ji̍t kā i bâi-tsòng, bián-tit uè lah-sap Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē, in-uī hông tiàu-sí ê lâng sī siū Siōngtsú só͘ tsiù-tsó͘ ê.
English: his body shall not remain all night on the tree, but you shall surely bury him the same day; for he who is hanged is accursed of God; that you don't defile your land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance.

Tailo: Huāⁿ lê ê lâng lê guá ê kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ, lê ê kau-hûn thua tsin tn̂g.
English: The plowers plowed on my back. They made their furrows long.

Tailo: Iôséhuh tshénn khí-lâi liáu-āu, tsiū tsiàu Tsú ê thiⁿ-sài só͘ bīng-līng ê, khì tshuā Mâlíah lâi tsò bó͘.
English: Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;

Tailo: Iôséhuh kā i ê lāu-pē kóng, Guá ê pē, m̄-sī án-ne. Tsit-ê sī tuā-kiáⁿ, kiû lí īng tsiàⁿ tshiú huāⁿ i ê thâu-khak.
English: Joseph said to his father, Not so, my father; for this is the firstborn; put your right hand on his head.

Tailo: Guán ê Siōngtè ah, Lí kám m̄-sī bat tī Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng ê bīn-tsîng kuáⁿ-tio̍k tuà tī tsit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn, kā i siúⁿ-sù hō͘ Lí ê pîng-iú — Abulahàm ê kiáⁿ-sun, ti̍t-kàu íng-uán?
English: Did not you, our God, drive out the inhabitants of this land before your people Israel, and give it to the seed of Abraham your friend forever?

Tailo: Isulael lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, Isulael tsuân huē-tsiòng lóng tsū-tsi̍p tī Sī-lô, beh tsiūⁿ-khì kah in kau-tsiàn.
English: When the children of Israel heard of it, the whole congregation of the children of Israel gathered themselves together at Shiloh, to go up against them to war.

Tailo: Sù-tsiá koh lâi kóng, Bian ha-tat án-ne kóng: Guá ū tshe lâng khì kìⁿ lí, ài lí kā lí ê gîn, kim, bó͘ kah kiáⁿ-jî lóng kau hō͘ guá.
English: The messengers came again, and said, Thus speaks Ben Hadad, saying, I sent indeed to you, saying, You shall deliver me your silver, and your gold, and your wives, and your children;

Tailo: Iâkop ê sè-hē kì tī ē-té: Iôséhuh tsa̍p-tshit huè kah i hiah-ê a-hiaⁿ tsò-hué kò͘ iûⁿ. I sī tsi̍t-ê gín-á kah i ê lāu-pē ê sè-î Bilha̍h ê kiáⁿ Jilpah ê kiáⁿ, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsò-tīn. Iôséhuh kā i hiah-ê a-hiaⁿ ê pháiⁿ phín-hīng kā in lāu-pē kóng.
English: This is the history of the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brothers. He was a boy with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father's wives. Joseph brought an evil report of them to their father.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Kai-ín kóng, Lí án-tsuáⁿ teh siū-khì? Lí ná ē pìⁿ-bīn?
English: Yahweh said to Cain, Why are you angry? Why has the expression of your face fallen?

Tailo: Mā hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tse sī tī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè kah i ê sò͘-tsè kah i ê kuàn-tiān í-guā.
English: and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, the meal offering of it, and the drink offering of it.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng tuì lín kóng, Lín tio̍h khì mn̄g tâng-ki kah kiâⁿ siâ-su̍t ê lâng, in ê siann-im ki-ki kiu̍h-kiu̍h, giân-gí sè-sè. Lín tio̍h ìn kóng, Jîn-bîn mn̄g i ê Siōngtè kám m̄-tio̍h? Kám thang uī-tio̍h ua̍h-lâng khì mn̄g hiah-ê sí-lâng?
English: When they tell you, Consult with those who have familiar spirits and with the wizards, who chirp and who mutter: shouldn't a people consult with their God? Should they consult the dead on behalf of the living?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí tio̍h siám-phiah gû-gōng ê tsing-lūn, tso̍k-phó͘ ê hun-tsing kah lu̍t-huat ê tsing-tsip, in-uī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng sī bô lī-ik koh bô kè-ta̍t.
English: but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

Tailo: Ông tiàu tuā-tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah lâi, kā i kóng, Lí ná ē bô pik Lēbī lâng tuì Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm bō͘-khuán lâi, to̍h-sī tsiàu Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se kah Isulael ê huē-tsiòng, só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h tio̍h hiàn tsò kiàn-tsìng ê pò͘-pênn ê lō͘-īng ê?
English: The king called for Jehoiada the chief, and said to him, Why haven't you required of the Levites to bring in out of Judah and out of Jerusalem the tax of Moses the servant of Yahweh, and of the assembly of Israel, for the tent of the testimony?

Tailo: Apnel uī-tio̍h pún-sin tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ Tabi̍t kóng, Tsit-ê só͘-tsāi sio̍k siáⁿ lâng? Koh kóng, Lí kah guá li̍p-iok, guá ê tshiú beh pang-tsān lí, hō͘ Isulael lóng kui tī lí.
English: Abner sent messengers to David on his behalf, saying, Whose is the land? saying also, Make your league with me, and behold, my hand shall be with you, to bring about all Israel to you.

Tailo: Isulael ông kā Iô-sa-huat kóng, Iáu ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, sī Im-lah ê kiáⁿ Mikaiah, lán thang tuì i lâi mn̄g Siōngtsú. Tsóng-.sī, guá uàn-hūn i, in-uī i só͘ ī-giân guá ê, lóng bô hó uē, tsí ū tsai-hō niā-niā. Iô-sa-huat kóng, Tshiánn ông m̄-thang án-ne kóng.
English: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, there is yet one man by whom we may inquire of Yahweh, Micaiah the son of Imlah: but I hate him; for he does not prophesy good concerning me, but evil. Jehoshaphat said, Don't let the king say so.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú hō͘ guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t hāng, guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t luâ jua̍h-thinn ê kué-tsí.
English: Thus the Lord Yahweh showed me: behold, a basket of summer fruit.

Tailo: Án-ne, E-hú tī Isulael tiong bia̍t-bông Baal.
English: Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel.

Tailo: Kìng-uì Siōngtsú sī tì-sik ê kin-pún; gû-gōng ê lâng biáu-sī tì-huī kah kà-sī.
English: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge; But the foolish despise wisdom and instruction.

Tailo: ' Lí kā iá-siù tuà-.lâi, kā i tsú hó tsu-bī, hō͘ guá tsia̍h. Guá beh tī buē sí tsìn-tsîng, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kā lí tsiok-hok. '
English: Bring me venison, and make me savory food, that I may eat, and bless you before Yahweh before my death.'

Tailo: Tsò hó ê lâng ē koh khí-lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā, tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng ē koh khí-lâi siū sím-phuàⁿ tīng tsuē.
English: and will come out; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life; and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of judgment.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tio̍h tī tuì-thâu kàu-bué lóng kah lán tsò-hué ê lâng tiong-kan, suán tsi̍t-ê lâi kah guán tàu-tīn tsò Iésu koh-ua̍h ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn.
English: Of the men therefore who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

Tailo: I kóng, ' Lí gia̍h thâu khuànn, phah iûⁿ-bó ê iûⁿ-káng, lóng sī ū bûn ê, ū tiám ê, ū hue-pan ê; só͘-ū La̍hban tuì lí só͘ tsò ê, guá lóng ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: He said, Now lift up your eyes, and behold, all the male goats which leap on the flock are streaked, speckled, and grizzled, for I have seen all that Laban does to you.

Tailo: Tī tsit-ê tuâⁿ tíng, m̄-thang hiàn pa̍t tsióng ê hiuⁿ, mā m̄-thang hiàn sio-tsè kah sò͘-tsè, mā m̄-thang kuàn-tiān tī i ê tíng-bīn.
English: You shall offer no strange incense on it, nor burnt offering, nor meal offering; and you shall pour no drink offering on it.

Tailo: In sit-bōng, guá kā in an-uì; in bē-tàng kái-piàn guá ê bīn ê kng.
English: I smiled on them when they had no confidence. They didn't reject the light of my face.

Tailo: Hit sî, sù-tô͘, tiúⁿ-ló kah tsuân kàu-huē kuat-tīng, beh tuì in tiong-kan kíng-suán tāi-piáu, to̍h-sī kiò-tsò Ba-sà-bah ê Iôtah kah Sela̍h, tsit nn̄g-ê lâng sī hiann-tī tiong ê kia̍t-tshut jîn-bu̍t.
English: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole assembly, to choose men out of their company, and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas: Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brothers.

Tailo: Guá ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan lóng ū tsuē ê lâng kóng: Tsai-eh bē jiok-tio̍h guán, mā bē tú-tio̍h guán ê, in ē sí tī to hā.
English: All the sinners of my people will die by the sword, who say, Evil won't overtake nor meet us.'

Tailo: Āu-lâi, i koh tshut khì tshuā tshit ê pí ka-kī khah pháiⁿ ê siâ-sîn, ji̍p-khì hia tsò-hué tuà; án-ne, hit-ê lâng ê kiat-kio̍k pí khí-thâu koh khah tshám. Tsit-ê siâ-ok ê sè-tāi mā ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne.
English: Then he goes, and takes with himself seven other spirits more evil than he is, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first. Even so will it be also to this evil generation.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h Sàulô kah i ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan, kah Siōngtsú ê tsú-bîn, í-ki̍p Isulael ê tsú-bîn, pi-ai, thî-khàu, kìm-tsia̍h kàu ji̍t àm, in-uī in tó tī to hā.
English: and they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of Yahweh, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.

Tailo: Khióng-pò͘ kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ lîm-kàu tī in. Siōngtsú ah, in-uī Lí ê tshiú ê tuā kuân-lîng, in tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tsio̍h-thâu, thìng-hāu Lí ê tsú-bîn king-kuè, thìng-hāu Lí só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsú-bîn kuè-.khì.
English: Terror and dread falls on them. By the greatness of your arm they are as still as a stone; Until your people pass over, Yahweh, Until the people pass over who you have purchased.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōngtsú tuā m̄-kam-guān, tuì lín siū-khì, guá tsiū tsin kiaⁿ, in-uī I siū-khì beh kā lín siau-bia̍t; tsóng-.sī, hit pái Siōngtsú ū koh-thiaⁿ guá.
English: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, with which Yahweh was angry against you to destroy you. But Yahweh listened to me that time also.

Tailo: Êsutel tsiū huan-hù lâng huê-hok Moltékái kóng,
English: Then Esther bade them return answer to Mordecai,

Tailo: Āu-lâi, lín nā thiaⁿ tsiah-ê huat-tō͘, tsip-siú lâi tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè in-uī án-ne ē kā lí si̍t-hîng I tuì lí ê tsó͘-sian só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê iok kah tsû-ài.
English: It shall happen, because you listen to these ordinances, and keep and do them, that Yahweh your God will keep with you the covenant and the loving kindness which he swore to your fathers:

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng kah Isulael lâng kau-tsiàn, Isulael lâng tī Huilīsū lâng ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu, siū-siong lâi sí, tó tī Gil-buah suaⁿ.
English: Now the Philistines fought against Israel: and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain on Mount Gilboa.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, hū-jîn-lâng só͘ seⁿ ê, bô tsi̍t-ê lâng pí kiânn sé-lé Iô-há-neh khah uí-tāi; tsóng-.sī, tī thian-kok siōng bî-sè-.ê, iáu-koh pí i khah uí-tāi.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.

Tailo: Lín hiàn tsiah-ê, tio̍h tī tsá-khí sî ê sio-tsè, to̍h-sī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè í-guā.
English: You shall offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.

Tailo: Guá í-king ū hō͘ in bat Lí ê miâ, mā beh kè-sio̍k tsí-sī in, thang hō͘ Lí tuì guá ê thiàⁿ tī in lāi-bīn, guá mā tī in lāi-bīn.
English: I made known to them your name, and will make it known; that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them.

Tailo: Iôséhuh ē kì-tit í-tsîng só͘ bāng-kìnn kuan-hē in ê hiah-ê bāng, tsiū tuì in kóng, Lín sī tsing-thàm, beh lâi thàm-thiaⁿ tsit só͘-tsāi ê hi-si̍t.
English: Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed about them, and said to them, You are spies! You have come to see the nakedness of the land.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, tuì Siōngtsú hia lâi ê pháiⁿ sîn tuā-tuā lîm-kàu Sàulô, i tsiū tī tshù lāi kóng sian-ti uē. Tabi̍t tsiàu-siông īng tshiú tuâⁿ khîm, Sàulô tshiú-.ni̍h ū tshiuⁿ.
English: It happened on the next day, that an evil spirit from God came mightily on Saul, and he prophesied in the midst of the house: and David played with his hand, as he did day by day. Saul had his spear in his hand;

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t pái, tsin tsē thiu-suè ê kah tsuē-jîn lâi Iésu hia beh thiaⁿ I káng tō-lí.
English: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming close to him to hear him.

Tailo: Siōngtsú phīⁿ-tio̍h sio-tsè ê phang-bī, sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, Guá bô beh koh in-uī lâng ê iân-kò͘ tsiù-tsó͘ tē, in-uī lâng tuì sè-hàn ê sî, sim só͘ siūⁿ ê to̍h-sī pháiⁿ; Guá bô beh koh tsiàu Guá tsit-má só͘ tsò ê, koh-tsài huí-bia̍t kok tsióng ê ua̍h-mi̍h.
English: Yahweh smelled the sweet savor. Yahweh said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake, because the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I ever again strike everything living, as I have done.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h uī Isulael ê ông-tshin tsò ai-ko:
English: Moreover, take up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,

Tailo: Ē-sin lâu-lâng ê lâng só͘ khiâ ê bé-uaⁿ mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Whatever saddle he who has the discharge rides on shall be unclean.

Tailo: Isulael ông ìn kóng, Guá ê tsú, guá ê ông, tsiàu lí ê uē, guá kah guá só͘-ū ê lóng sī lí ê.
English: The king of Israel answered, It is according to your saying, my lord, O king; I am yours, and all that I have.

Tailo: I khui khut, ku̍t hō͘ i tshim, i kìng-jiân pua̍h-lo̍h tī ka-kī só͘ khui ê hām-kheⁿ.
English: He has dug a hole, And has fallen into the pit which he made.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kám-siā thinn-tíng ê Siōngtsú, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: Oh give thanks to the God of heaven; For his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Lín nā tsù-ì tsun-thàn Guá, tī An-hioh-ji̍t bô taⁿ siáⁿ-mi̍h tàⁿ ji̍p-khì tsit-ê siâⁿ mn̂g, to̍k-to̍k lia̍h An-hioh-ji̍t tsò sìng-ji̍t, tī hit ji̍t lóng bô tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h kang;
English: It shall happen, if you diligently listen to me, says Yahweh, to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but to make the Sabbath day holy, to do no work therein;

Tailo: Tiān ê mn̂g tíng ū khik ki-lō͘-ping kah tsang tshiū, kah khik tī tshiûⁿ tíng ê kāng-khuán. Tī guā-bīn lông ê thâu-tsîng ū kāu ê tshâ-pán.
English: There were made on them, on the doors of the temple, cherubim and palm trees, like as were made on the walls; and there was a threshold of wood on the face of the porch outside.

Tailo: ( Tabi̍t ê si; kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) Siōngtsú ah, ông ē in-uī Lí ê khuì-la̍t lâi huann-hí, in-uī Lí ê tsín-kiù, i hui-siông khuài-lo̍k!
English: The king rejoices in your strength, Yahweh! How greatly he rejoices in your salvation!

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā ka-kī sé tshing-khì, tuì Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tû-khì lín só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ, thîng-tsí lín ê tsò pháiⁿ!
English: Wash yourselves, make yourself clean. Put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes; Cease to do evil.

Tailo: Tâng tsē-toh ê lâng bô tsi̍t-ê tsai-iáⁿ Iésu ná ē tuì i kóng tsit kù uē.
English: Now no man at the table knew why he said this to him.

Tailo: Tsú koh kóng, Lín tio̍h thiaⁿ tsit-ê put-gī ê phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ só͘ kóng ê uē!
English: The Lord said, Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.

Tailo: I ê siàu-liân lâng ē tī ke-lō͘ tó lo̍h-.khì; tng hit ji̍t, i só͘-ū ê ping-á ē bia̍t-bông. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Lí nā lâi-kàu Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tē, lí m̄-thang o̍h hiah-ê kok khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì lâi kiâⁿ.
English: When you are come into the land which Yahweh your God gives you, you shall not learn to do after the abominations of those nations.

Tailo: Tsū tshòng-sè í-lâi, lâng khuànn bē-tio̍h Hit-ê Siōngtè ê pún-sìng, to̍h-sī I íng-uán ê tuā lîng-li̍k kah sîn-sìng, lâng nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h I só͘ tshòng-tsō ê mi̍h tsiū ē-tàng tsai-iáⁿ, só͘-í, lâng lóng bô piān-kái ê î-tē.
English: For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse.

Tailo: Bô sìn Tsú ê tsa-po͘ lâng in-uī tshuā sìn Tsú ê lâng tsò bó͘, ē tit-tio̍h Siōngtè ê tsiap-la̍p. Kāng-khuán án-ne, bô sìn Tsú ê tsa-bó͘ lâng in-uī kè sìn Tsú ê ang, ē tit-tio̍h Siōngtè ê tsiap-la̍p. Nā m̄-sī án-ne, lín ê kiáⁿ-jî tsiū bô sio̍k Siōngtè, kî-si̍t in sī kui-sio̍k Siōngtè ê.
English: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified in the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified in the husband. Otherwise your children would be unclean, but now are they holy.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī nn̄g ki thiāu kah hiah-ê puânn, kah thiāu tíng nn̄g-ê thiāu-táu kah khàm thiāu tíng nn̄g-ê thiāu-táu ê puânn ê bāng,
English: the two pillars, and the bowls, and the two capitals which were on the top of the pillars, and the two networks to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars,

Tailo: Guán mā bat huâi-īn, bat kiáu-ká, só͘ seⁿ ê kìng-jiân tshin-tshiūnn hong. Guán tī tē-.ni̍h m̄-bat kiânn siáⁿ-mi̍h tsín-kiù ê tāi-tsì; sè-tsiūⁿ ê jîn-bîn mā bô pua̍h lo̍h-.khì.
English: We have been with child. We have been in pain. We gave birth, it seems, only to wind. We have not worked any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h gia̍h thâu ǹg thiⁿ, ànn thâu khuànn tē; in-uī tsiah-ê thiⁿ ē tshin-tshiūⁿ ian-hûn siau-suàⁿ, tē ē tshin-tshiūⁿ saⁿ tsiām-tsiām kū-.khì; tuà tī hia ê jîn-bîn mā ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne sí-bông. Tsí-ū Guá ê kiù-un ē íng-uán tsûn-tsāi, Guá ê kong-gī mā bô huì-tû.
English: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, and look on the earth beneath; for the heavens shall vanish away like smoke, and the earth shall wax old like a garment; and those who dwell therein shall die in like manner: but my salvation shall be forever, and my righteousness shall not be abolished.

Tailo: Sì-tsa̍p-nî āu, tī Si-nái suaⁿ ê khòng-iá, ū thiⁿ-sài tī tshì-phè ê hué-iām tiong, tuì Mô͘se hián-hiān.
English: When forty years were fulfilled, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.

Tailo: Guá tsai Siōngtsú tsò tuā, mā tsai lán ê Tsú puâⁿ-kuè só͘-ū ê sîn-bîng.
English: For I know that Yahweh is great, That our Lord is above all gods.

Tailo: Tsiàu tsa-po͘ ting ê sò͘-gia̍h, tuì muá-gue̍h í-siōng siú sìng-só͘ ê tsik-jīm ê, tsóng-kiōng ū peh-tshing la̍k-pah miâ.
English: According to the number of all the males, from a month old and upward, there were eight thousand six hundred, keeping the charge of the sanctuary.

Tailo: Nā Satán kuáⁿ Satán, sī ka-kī hun-tsing, i ê ông-kok kám khiā ē tiâu?
English: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lâng pí sûn-kim khah tsió, hō͘ lâng pí Ohui ê kim khah tsió.
English: I will make people more rare than fine gold, even a person than the pure gold of Ophir.

Tailo: Tsit-má ua̍h-.leh lâi sìn guá ê lâng, íng-uán bē sí. Lí ū án-ne sìn bô?
English: Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?

Tailo: Lí mā ē siang tshiú mo͘h thâu-khak, tuì hia tshut-.lâi; in-uī Siōngtsú í-king khì-tsua̍t lí só͘ uá-khò ê, lí mā bē tuì in tit-tio̍h hing-thong.
English: From there also shall you go forth, with your hands on your head: for Yahweh has rejected those in whom you trust, and you shall not prosper with them.

Tailo: Tsa̍p-it nî tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-tshit, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: It happened in the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, that the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Hiah-ê ki kah hiah-ê hue lóng kah i liân tsò tsi̍t-ê, lóng īng sûn-kim, tsiàu phah ê hong-huat lâi tsò.
English: Their buds and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole thing was one beaten work of pure gold.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, Io-lâm ông tńg-khì E-tsu-le-el, i-tī i ê siong, to̍h-sī i tī kah Alâm ông Hatsael kau-tsiàn ê sî, Alâm lâng kā i phah-tio̍h ê. ) E-hú kóng, Lín ê ì-sù nā-sī án-ne, tsiū m̄-thang iông-ín lâng tsáu tshut siâⁿ, khì E-tsu-le-el pò siau-sit.
English: but king Joram was returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which the Syrians had given him, when he fought with Hazael king of Syria. ) Jehu said, If this be your mind, then let none escape and go forth out of the city, to go to tell it in Jezreel.

Tailo: Ê-hng sî, ū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ; thiⁿ iáu-buē kng, in tsiū sí-.khì. Tse sī kā guán tshiúⁿ-tua̍t ê lâng só͘ tit-tio̍h ê hūn-gia̍h, sī kā guán tshiúⁿ-kiap ê lâng ê pò-ìng.
English: At evening, behold, terror! Before the morning, they are no more. This is the portion of those who plunder us, and the lot of those who rob us.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h thó͘-khuì kah-ná io-kut at-tn̄g lâi thòng-khó͘; tī in ê bīn-tsîng thó͘-khuì.
English: Sigh therefore, you son of man; with the breaking of your thighs and with bitterness shall you sigh before their eyes.

Tailo: Sàulô ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mikal thiàⁿ Tabi̍t, ū lâng kā Sàulô kóng, Sàulô huann-hí tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: Michal, Saul's daughter, loved David: and they told Saul, and the thing pleased him.

Tailo: Hit sî, Amátsiah tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ E-hú ê sun, Ehuahátsuh ê kiáⁿ, Isulael ông Io-a-si, kóng, Lâi, lán nn̄g lâng tī tsiàn-tiûⁿ sio kìⁿ-bīn.
English: Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash, the son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us look one another in the face.

Tailo: Muí tshit ji̍t ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t, lín ta̍k lâng tio̍h tsiàu ka-kī ê siu-ji̍p puah tsi̍t-kuá tsînn khí-lâi khǹg, bián-tit guá khì lín hia ê sî tsiah khai-sí bō͘-khuán.
English: On the first day of the week, let each one of you save, as he may prosper, that no collections be made when I come.

Tailo: Koh tuì Asel tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p tiong-kan, īng Bí-sa-li̍k kah i ê kau-iá, Aptóng kah i ê kau-iá,
English: Out of the tribe of Asher, Mishal with its suburbs, Abdon with its suburbs,

Tailo: lí khuàⁿ, i huí-pòng i ê pháiⁿ tāi, kóng, ' Guá khuànn lí ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ bô tsāi-sik-lí ê pîn-kì, kî-si̍t tsit-ê sī guá ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsāi-sik-lí ê pîn-kì. ' Pē-bú tsiū kā hit-ê pò͘ pâi tī pún-siâⁿ tiúⁿ-ló ê bīn-tsîng.
English: and behold, he has laid shameful things to her charge, saying, I didn't find in your daughter the tokens of virginity; and yet these are the tokens of my daughter's virginity. They shall spread the garment before the elders of the city.

Tailo: Guá in-uī kìm-tsia̍h kha-thâu-u sng-nńg; guá ê bah siau-sán bô tsu-jūn.
English: My knees are weak through fasting. My body is thin and lacks fat.

Tailo: Kè-sio̍k huān tsuē ê lâng sī sio̍k Mô͘-kuí, in-uī Mô͘-kuí tuì khí-thâu to̍h huān tsuē; Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ hián-hiān ê bo̍k-tik sī beh huí-huāi Mô͘-kuí-ê kang-tsok.
English: He who sins is of the devil, for the devil has been sinning from the beginning. To this end the Son of God was revealed, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

Tailo: Lín hiàn siā-un-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú ê sî, tio̍h hiàn thang tit-tio̍h tsiap-la̍p ê.
English: When you sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving to Yahweh, you shall sacrifice it so that you may be accepted.

Tailo: Guá bat Ehulaim; Isulael mā bē ún-ba̍t tī Guá. Ehulaim, taⁿ lí kiânn kan-îm, Isulael bak-tio̍h lah-sap.
English: I know Ephraim, And Israel is not hidden from me; For now, Ephraim, you have played the prostitute. Israel is defiled.

Tailo: In só͘ beh ho̍k-sāi ê kok, Guá ē kā in hîng-hua̍t, āu-lâi in ē tuà tsin tsē tsâi-bu̍t tuì hia tshut-.lâi.
English: I will also judge that nation, whom they will serve. Afterward they will come out with great wealth,

Tailo: Pak-bīn mā tio̍h ū uî, tn̂g tsi̍t pah tiú, i ê thiāu ū jī-tsa̍p ki, tâng-khū jī-tsa̍p-ê. Thiāu ê kau kah huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ lóng tio̍h īng gîn tsò.
English: Likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings one hundred cubits long, and the pillars of it twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, miâ kiò-tsò Ne-ko té bó, sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê kuann.
English: Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.

Tailo: Hit sî, mā ū nn̄g-ê thó͘-huí kah Iésu tâng-tsê tìng si̍p-jī-kè, tsi̍t-ê tī tsiànn pîng, tsi̍t-ê tī tò pîng.
