English: Then there were two robbers crucified with him, one on his right hand and one on the left.

Tailo: Ông kah hiah-ê tāi-sîn lóng lia̍h i ê uē tsò hó, ông tsiū tsiàu Memukan ê uē lâi kiâⁿ.
English: The saying pleased the king and the princes; and the king did according to the word of Memucan:

Tailo: Ông ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tī ông-kiong lāi hui-siông îng-huâ; i ê saⁿ-khò͘ sī īng kim-suàⁿ siù ê.
English: The princess inside is all glorious. Her clothing is interwoven with gold.

Tailo: Hit sî, Babúlông ông ê kun-ping teh kong-kik Êlúsalèm, koh kong-kik Iôtah só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê siâⁿ, to̍h-sī La̍hkisih kah A-tse-kah. In-uī Iôtah kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, tsí ū tshun tsiah-ê.
English: when the king of Babylon's army was fighting against Jerusalem, and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish and against Azekah; for these alone remained of the cities of Judah as fortified cities.

Tailo: Mā ē khik pó-tsio̍h lâi siuⁿ mi̍h-kiāⁿ, mā ē tiau-khik tshâ, ē tsò ta̍k tsióng kî-khiáu ê kang.
English: and in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all manner of workmanship.

Tailo: tsiū tshe-tsa̍p-ê pō͘-hā, Tabi̍t huan-hù hiah-ê pō͘-hā, kóng, Lín tio̍h tsiūⁿ-khì Kal-mel, kìnn Nabal, īng guá ê miâ kā i tshíng-an.
English: David sent ten young men, and David said to the young men, Go up to Carmel, and go to Nabal, and greet him in my name:

Tailo: Ū hué tuì Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tshut-.lâi, sio tuâⁿ tíng ê sio-tsè kah iû; tsìng lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tshut tuā huann-hí ê siann, phak tī tē-.ni̍h.
English: There came forth fire from before Yahweh, and consumed the burnt offering and the fat upon the altar: and when all the people saw it, they shouted, and fell on their faces.

Tailo: kóng tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Ū tsi̍t tsiah tuā ing, si̍t-kó͘ tuā, si̍t-bué tn̂g, mn̂g-tsháu tsa̍t, ū ngó͘-tshái-sik, pue kàu Le-ba-nòng, tshú pik-hiuⁿ tshiū tiong-ki ê ki bué,
English: and say, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: A great eagle with great wings and long feathers, full of feathers, which had various colors, came to Lebanon, and took the top of the cedar:

Tailo: Sàulô tsiū tsio-tsi̍p jîn-bîn tī Thi-la̍k-in, kā in tiám-sǹg, tsóng-kiōng pō͘-ping jī-tsa̍p bān, Iôtah lâng tsi̍t bān.
English: Saul summoned the people, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen, and ten thousand men of Judah.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Sâmsóng tī So-lia̍t suaⁿ-kok luân-ài tsi̍t-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, i ê miâ kiò-tsò Te-li-lah.
English: It came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.

Tailo: Tsú tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kā i liân-bín, kóng, M̄-thang háu.
English: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her, Don't cry.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tiong thâu-tsiūⁿ ê tsa-po͘ ting, pí Lēbī lâng khah tsē nn̄g-pah tshit-tsa̍p-saⁿ-ê, lí beh kā i sio̍k tshut-.lâi.
English: For the redemption of the two hundred seventy-three of the firstborn of the children of Israel, who exceed the number of the Levites,

Tailo: Iâm tsin ū lō͘-īng; iâm nā sit-bī, beh án-tsuáⁿ huê-ho̍k i ê kiâm-bī?
English: Salt is good, but if the salt becomes flat and tasteless, with what do you season it?

Tailo: Tsiàu lín só͘ tsún-pī ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu ta̍k tsiah ê gia̍h-sò͘, lóng tio̍h án-ne tsò.
English: According to the number that you shall prepare, so shall you do to everyone according to their number.

Tailo: M̄-koh, liân-tiúⁿ siong-sìn tsûn-tiúⁿ kah tsûn-tsú ê uē, bô beh thiaⁿ Páulô kóng ê uē.
English: But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship than to those things which were spoken by Paul.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū tsi̍t phiàn hûn kā in tah-teh, koh tuì hûn-.ni̍h tshut siaⁿ kóng, Tsit-ê sī guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê Kiáⁿ, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ I ê uē.
English: A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, This is my beloved Son. Listen to him.

Tailo: Lóng sī Siōngtsú tī Si-nái suaⁿ só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê, to̍h-sī i tī Si-nái khòng-iá bīng-līng Isulael lâng hiàn lé-mi̍h hō͘ Siōngtsú ê ji̍t.
English: which Yahweh commanded Moses in Mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their offerings to Yahweh, in the wilderness of Sinai.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsīn-liōng tī kuâⁿ-thiⁿ í-tsîng lâi. Iû-bú-lō͘, Pò͘-tē, Lí-nò͘, Ku-láu-tia kah tsìng hiann-tī tsí-muē, lóng beh kā lí tshíng-an.
English: Be diligent to come before winter. Eubulus salutes you, as do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers.

Tailo: Abulahàm ìn kóng, Lí tio̍h tuì guá ê tshiú siu tsit tshit tsiah bó ê iûⁿ-ko, tsò guá khui tsit-kháu tséⁿ ê tsìng-kì.
English: He said, You shall take these seven ewe lambs from my hand, that it may be a witness to me, that I have dug this well.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá koh khah tì-ì beh tshe i tńg-khì lín hia, hō͘ lín koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h i lâi huann-hí, mā thang kiám-tsió guá ê iu-siong.
English: I have sent him therefore the more diligently, that, when you see him again, you may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

Tailo: Abulahàm siū kat-lé ê sî, káu-tsa̍p-káu huè.
English: Abraham was ninety-nine years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

Tailo: Mô͘se tuì i kóng, Lí kám sī uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘ teh tsi̍t-tò͘? Guān Siōngtsú ê tsú-bîn lóng tsò sian-ti, Siōngtsú kā I ê Sìng Sîn kàng-lo̍h tī in ê tíng-bīn.
English: Moses said to him, Are you jealous for my sake? would that all Yahweh's people were prophets, that Yahweh would put his Spirit on them!

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu kiânn tī tsuí-bīn, kiaⁿ kah phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, tuā-siaⁿ huah, Kuí-á lâi lò͘!
English: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It's a ghost! and they cried out for fear.

Tailo: Lín koh kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, hiah-ni̍h lo-so huì-khì! ' Mā am phīⁿ-khang thó-ià I. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê. Lín kā só͘ tshiúⁿ ê, pái-kha-.ê, phuà-siùⁿ ê, the̍h-lâi hiàn tsò lé-mi̍h, Guá kám ē tuì lín ê tshiú tsiap-la̍p? Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: You say also, Behold, what a weariness it is!' and you have sniffed at it, says Yahweh of Armies; and you have brought that which was taken by violence, the lame, and the sick; thus you bring the offering. Should I accept this at your hand? says Yahweh.

Tailo: Gilia̍t lâng I-é-hú-thah sī tsi̍t-ê tuā kuân-lîng ê ióng-sū, sī ki-lí ê kiáⁿ, I-é-hú-thah sī Gilia̍t só͘ seⁿ ê.
English: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valor, and he was the son of a prostitute: and Gilead became the father of Jephthah.

Tailo: In-uī guá tsai, lín ê sìn-gióng king-kuè khó-giām ē sán-sing jím-nāi.
English: knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tio̍h hó-tánn lâi tsiū-kīn Siōngtè un-tián ê pó-tsō, thang niá-siū liân-bín, mā thang tit-tio̍h un-tián, tsò lán ki̍p-sî ê pang-tsān.
English: Let us therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy, and may find grace for help in time of need.

Tailo: Guá ta̍k pái khui tshuì ê sî, tsiū tshut ai-siong ê siann, guá tuā-siaⁿ huah, kiông-pō! Tshiúⁿ-kiap! In-uī Siōngtsú ê uē kui ji̍t tsiâⁿ-tsò guá ê lîng-jio̍k kah khau-sé.
English: For as often as I speak, I cry out; I cry, Violence and destruction! because the word of Yahweh is made a reproach to me, and a derision, all the day.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsīn-liōng kuáⁿ-kín lâi guá tsia.
English: Be diligent to come to me soon,

Tailo: Peh-kak m̄-sī īng lāi ê khì-kū phah ê, khîn-tshài m̄-sī īng tshia-lián lún ê; to̍h-sī īng thuî-á phah peh-kak, īng kuái-á phah khîn-tshài.
English: For the dill are not threshed with a sharp instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned over the cumin; but the dill is beaten out with a stick, and the cumin with a rod.

Tailo: I khuànn tē, tē tsiū tín-tāng; I bong suaⁿ, suaⁿ tsiū tshut ian.
English: He looks at the earth, and it trembles. He touches the mountains, and they smoke.

Tailo: I koh kóng, Tio̍h tsīn-sim, tsīn-ì, tsīn-la̍t thiàⁿ Siōngtè, koh tio̍h thiàⁿ tshù-piⁿ tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī, tse pí hiàn kui-tsiah tsing-seⁿ ê sio-tsè kah tsè-mi̍h khah iàu-kín.
English: and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.

Tailo: I tsiū tó tī i ê kha tsîng, kàu thiⁿ iáu-buē kng bē jīn-tit lâng ê sî, tsiū khí-.lâi. Bôohtsuh kóng, M̄-thang hō͘ lâng tsai ū tsa-bó͘ gín-á lâi-kàu tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: She lay at his feet until the morning. She rose up before one could discern another. For he said, Let it not be known that the woman came to the threshing floor.

Tailo: tsa̍p-ê tsō kah tsō tíng ê tsa̍p-ê phûn;
English: and the ten bases, and the ten basins on the bases;

Tailo: Tī hia tio̍h uī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, to̍h-sī tsio̍h-thâu ê tuâⁿ, tī hit tíng-bīn m̄-thang tāng-tio̍h thih-khì.
English: There shall you build an altar to Yahweh your God, an altar of stones: you shall lift up no iron tool on them.

Tailo: Só͘-í, in ìn kóng, Guán m̄-tsai sī tuì tó-uī lâi ê.
English: They answered that they didn't know where it was from.

Tailo: Isulael lâng kā tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah in ê kau-iá, hō͘ Lēbī lâng.
English: The children of Israel gave to the Levites the cities with their suburbs.

Tailo: Guá ê tsi̍h beh kui ji̍t káng-lūn Lí ê gī, in-uī hiah-ê kè-bô͘ beh hāi guá ê lâng í-king kiàn-siàu siū lîng-jio̍k.
English: My tongue will also talk about your righteousness all day long, For they are disappointed, and they are confounded, who want to harm me.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Ahasuiló͘ ông kā Iôtah lâng ê tuì-ti̍k Hamán ê ka-sán siúⁿ-sù hō͘ ông-hō͘ Êsutel. Moltékái mā lâi ông ê bīn-tsîng, in-uī Êsutel í-king kā ông kóng, Moltékái sī i ê tshin-lâng.
English: On that day did the king Ahasuerus give the house of Haman the Jews' enemy to Esther the queen. Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he was to her.

Tailo: guá tsiū ē tsiàu-sî koh tsiàu lí ê tē só͘ su-iàu ê lo̍h hō͘, to̍h-sī í-tsîng ê hō͘, í-āu ê hō͘, hō͘ lí thang siu-sîng lí ê ngó͘-kok, lí ê tsiú, lí ê iû,
English: that I will give the rain of your land in its season, the former rain and the latter rain, that you may gather in your grain, and your new wine, and your oil.

Tailo: Guán ai-kiû Siōngtsú ê sî, I thiaⁿ guán ê siann, tshe-khián sù-tsiá tshuā guán tshut Aigi̍p, taⁿ guán tī lí ki̍k piⁿ-á ê siâⁿ Ka-té-si.
English: and when we cried to Yahweh, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and brought us forth out of Egypt: and behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of your border.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsiū khí-lâi kah tuè i ê la̍k pah lâng, kuè-khì-kàu Gat ông — Má-gô ê kiáⁿ Akisi hia.
English: David arose, and passed over, he and the six hundred men who were with him, to Achish the son of Maoch, king of Gath.

Tailo: Guān lán ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè kah lán ê Tsú Iésu kā guán khui lō͘, hō͘ guán thang khì lín hia.
English: Now may our God and Father himself, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way to you;

Tailo: Bîn-tsiòng kóng, Lí m̄-bat khi-hū guán, m̄-bat ap-tsè guán, mā m̄-bat tuì lâng ê tshiú the̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h mi̍h.
English: They said, You have not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither have you taken anything of any man's hand.

Tailo: Án-ne, Iosiúah tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se it-tshè ê uē, kong-tshú hit-ê tsuân tē, Iosiúah kā tē pun hō͘ Isulael lâng tsò sán-gia̍p, tsiàu in ê tsi-tso̍k, in ê tsong-tso̍k. Tsiū án-ne, hit-ê tē thài-pîng bô koh kau-tsiàn.
English: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that Yahweh spoke to Moses; and Joshua gave it for an inheritance to Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. The land had rest from war.

Tailo: Elī tsin lāu, thiaⁿ-tio̍h i ê kiáⁿ tuì Isulael jîn-bîn só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h in kah huē-bō͘ mn̂g tsîng teh tsò-kang ê tsa-bó͘ lâng su-thong.
English: Now Eli was very old; and he heard all that his sons did to all Israel, and how that they lay with the women who served at the door of the tent of meeting.

Tailo: Siat-sú lâng īng thih-khì phah lâng tì-sú sí, i to̍h-sī hiong-huān, hiong-huān it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: But if he struck him with an instrument of iron, so that he died, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: In ê sò͘-gia̍h kì tī ē-bīn: kim-puâⁿ saⁿ-tsa̍p tè, gîn-puâⁿ tsi̍t tshing tè, to jī-tsa̍p káu ki,
English: This is the number of them: thirty platters of gold, one thousand platters of silver, twenty-nine knives,

Tailo: Lí siū kuáⁿ-tio̍k ê, nā ū tī thinn-pinn ê, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè mā ē tuì hia kā lí tsū-tsi̍p, tuì hia kā lí tshōa tńg-.lâi.
English: If any of your outcasts are in the uttermost parts of the heavens, from there will Yahweh your God gather you, and from there he will bring you back:

Tailo: Kàu Iésu tsa̍p-jī huè ê sî, mā tsiàu kuàn-lē khì Êlúsalèm kuè-tseh.
English: When he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast,

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Isulael lâng koh khah ū sè-li̍k, khah iâⁿ Ka-nân ông Ia-bín, it-ti̍t kàu kā Ka-nân ông Ia-bín tsuân-pō͘ bia̍t-tiāu.
English: The hand of the children of Israel prevailed more and more against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they had destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.

Tailo: Taⁿ tsiah-ê lóng sī Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, Lí ê tsú-bîn, to̍h-sī Lí īng Lí ê tuā khuì-la̍t kah tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú só͘ kiù-sio̍k ê.
English: Now these are your servants and your people, whom you have redeemed by your great power, and by your strong hand.

Tailo: Lí la̍k ji̍t tio̍h tsò-kang, tē-tshit ji̍t tio̍h an-hioh, tī tsai-tsìng siu-kuah ê sî mā tio̍h an-hioh.
English: Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest: in plowing time and in harvest you shall rest.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, thè i sio̍k-tsuē, i bô-lūn tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h sū hō͘ i ū tsuē, lóng ē tit-tio̍h sià-bián.
English: The priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh, and he will be forgiven concerning whatever he does to become guilty.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lí ná ē mn̄g guá siáⁿ-mi̍h sī hó sū? Uân-tsuân koh hó ê tsí ū tsi̍t uī, tsóng-.sī, lí nā ài tsìn-ji̍p íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā, tio̍h tsun-siú tsiah-ê kài-bīng.
English: He said to him, Why do you call me good? No one is good but one, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.

Tailo: Kiû Lí siū-khì lâi kā in tsâu-bia̍t, kā in thiat-té siau-bia̍t, hō͘ in tsai Siōngtè tī Iâkop ê tiong-kan tsiáng-kuân, sīm-tsì kàu tī tē-ki̍k. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Consume them in wrath. Consume them, and they will be no more. Let them know that God rules in Jacob, To the ends of the earth. Selah.

Tailo: Ông nā lia̍h-tsò sī hó, tio̍h tshut bīng-līng lâi kā in siau-bia̍t; guá tsiū īng gîn tsi̍t-bān tha-lan-t kau tī kuán-lí tsit-ê tāi-tsì ê lâng ê tshiú, thang siu ji̍p-khì ông ê khò͘-pâng.
English: If it please the king, let it be written that they be destroyed: and I will pay ten thousand talents of silver into the hands of those who have the charge of the king's business, to bring it into the king's treasuries.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, kàu guá nî lāu thâu-mn̂g pe̍h ê sî, kiû Lí m̄-thang pàng-sak guá! Hō͘ guá thang kā Lí ê khuì-la̍t tsí-sī ē-tāi, kā Lí ê tuā kuân-lîng tsí-sī só͘-ū bī-lâi ê lâng.
English: Yes, even when I am old and gray-haired, God, don't forsake me, Until I have declared your strength to the next generation, Your might to everyone who is to come.

Tailo: Tuì sian-ti Samuel ê ji̍t í-āu, tī Isulael tiong bô ū tshin-tshiūnn tsit sî só͘ siú ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh; jî-tshiánn Isulael lia̍t ông mā lóng bô tshin-tshiūnn Io-si-iah, tsè-si kah Lēbī lâng, í-ki̍p tông-tsāi ê Iôtah, kah Isulael lâng, kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn só͘ siú ê án-ne teh siú Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh.
English: There was no Passover like that kept in Israel from the days of Samuel the prophet; neither did any of the kings of Israel keep such a Passover as Josiah kept, and the priests, and the Levites, and all Judah and Israel who were present, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā ông kóng, Sian-ti Náthan tī tsia. Náthan ji̍p-khì ông ê bīn-tsîng, phak tī thô͘-kha pài ông.
English: They told the king, saying, Behold, Nathan the prophet. When he was come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.

Tailo: I nā hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin tsiū suî-sî tuā-siaⁿ huah, siâ-sîn hō͘ i thiu-tshuah kah phū pe̍h-pho nuā, koh tāng-tāng kā i siong-hāi, lóng bô beh pàng i suah.
English: Behold, a spirit takes him, he suddenly cries out, and it convulses him so that he foams, and it hardly departs from him, bruising him severely.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hâ io tshin-tshiūnn tāi-tiōng-hu, guá mn̄g lí, lí ìn guá.
English: Brace yourself like a man, For I will question you, then you answer me!

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah uī Io-si-iah ai-siong, hiah-ê tshiùⁿ kua ê lâm-lí tī in ê ai-sû lóng ū kóng-khí Io-si-iah, kàu tī kin-á-ji̍t, koh tī Isulael tiong īng tsiah-ê tsò tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē. Lí khuàⁿ, hiah-ê lóng kì tī ai-sû tiong.
English: Jeremiah lamented for Josiah: and all the singing men and singing women spoke of Josiah in their lamentations to this day; and they made them an ordinance in Israel: and behold, they are written in the lamentations.

Tailo: Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín ti̍k-pia̍t ê un-tián, hō͘ hiah-ê lâng koh khah kìng-ài lín, koh uī lín kî-tó.
English: while they themselves also, with supplication on your behalf, yearn for you by reason of the exceeding grace of God in you.

Tailo: In í-king pûn sàu-kak, tsún-pī tsê-tsuân; tsóng-.sī, bô lâng tshut-khì kau-tsiàn, in-uī Guá ê tuā siū-khì lîm-kàu in tsìng lâng.
English: They have blown the trumpet, and have made all ready; but none goes to the battle; for my wrath is on all the multitude of it.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín m̄-thang hō͘-siong kóng pháiⁿ uē; kóng hiann-tī tsí-muē ê pháiⁿ uē á-.sī phue-phîng hiann-tī tsí-muē ê lâng, to̍h-sī teh kóng lu̍t-huat ê pháiⁿ uē, teh phue-phîng lu̍t-huat. Lí nā phue-phîng lu̍t-huat, tsiū m̄-sī siú lu̍t-huat ê lâng, sī teh phue-phîng lu̍t-huat.
English: Don't speak against one another, brothers. He who speaks against a brother and judges his brother, speaks against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge.

Tailo: In koh phah Gelal sì-kho͘-uî hiah-ê siâⁿ, in-uī Siōngtsú hō͘ in tsin kiaⁿ. In mā tshiúⁿ in só͘-ū ê siâⁿ, in-uī siâⁿ lāi ū tsin tsē mi̍h thang tshiúⁿ.
English: They struck all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of Yahweh came on them: and they despoiled all the cities; for there was much spoil in them.

Tailo: Iésu sim-lāi tsai-iáⁿ bûn-tô͘ in-uī tsit-ê tāi-tsì teh nga̍uh-nga̍uh-liām, tsiū kā in kóng, Tsiah-ê uē jiá-tio̍h lín, sī-.bô?
English: But Jesus knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this, said to them, Does this cause you to stumble?

Tailo: Ta̍k-ê siâⁿ ê lâng in-uī bé-ping kah siā tsìnn ê lâng ê huā-huā háu, tsiū lóng tô-tsáu, tsìn ji̍p-khì tshiū-nâ, peh-tsiūⁿ tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng; ta̍k-ê siâⁿ tú-tio̍h siū khì-sak, bô lâng tuà.
English: Every city flees for the noise of the horsemen and archers; they go into the thickets, and climb up on the rocks: every city is forsaken, and not a man dwells therein.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tshîng-peh tshâ tsò tuā tsûn, tsûn lāi tio̍h keh pâng-king, lāi-guā īng tá-má-ka iû kā i kô͘.
English: Make an ark of gopher wood. You shall make rooms in the ark, and shall seal it inside and outside with pitch.

Tailo: Guān bô lâng suà-tsiap si un hō͘ i! Guān bô lâng khó-liân i ê ko͘-jî!
English: Let there be none to extend kindness to him, Neither let there be any to have pity on his fatherless children.

Tailo: Lâm-hong ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h Esáu ê suaⁿ, pîng-guân ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h Huilīsū, mā ē tit-tio̍h Ehulaim ê tshân kah Sa-má-lī-a ê tshân; Biāniámín lâng ē tit-tio̍h Gilia̍t.
English: Those of the South will possess the mountain of Esau, and those of the lowland, the Philistines. They will possess the field of Ephraim, and the field of Samaria. Benjamin will possess Gilead.

Tailo: Iobuh, lí tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá ê uē, tio̍h tiām-tiām, guá tsiū beh kóng.
English: Mark well, Job, and listen to me: Hold your peace, and I will speak.

Tailo: Tsí-ū tshun Iâkop ka-kī tī hia. Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng lâi kah i sio-ián, it-ti̍t kàu thiⁿ-phú-kng.
English: Jacob was left alone, and wrestled with a man there until the breaking of the day.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ-sun kian-kò͘ ti̍t-kàu íng-uán, koh kiàn-li̍p lí ê pó-tsō kàu bān-sè-tāi. [Sè-la̍h]
English: I will establish your seed forever, And build up your throne to all generations.' Selah.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, i kā guá kóng, ' Lí huâi-īn ē seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ, só͘-í, po̍h tsiú kāu tsiú lóng m̄-thang lim, bô tshing-khì ê mi̍h mā lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h, in-uī tsit-ê gín-á tuì thai-.ni̍h kàu i sí ê ji̍t, lóng beh kui Siōngtsú tsò hiàn-sin-tsiá ê lâng. '
English: but he said to me, Behold, you shall conceive, and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing; for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death.

Tailo: Siōngtsú, Lí sī kong-gī; Lí ê phuàⁿ-tuàn mā sī kong-tsìng.
English: You are righteous, Yahweh. Your judgments are upright.

Tailo: In tsiū tī khó͘-lān tiong ai-kiû Siōngtsú, I tsiū kái-kiù in thuat-lī huān-lān.
English: Then they cried to Yahweh in their trouble, And he saved them out of their distresses.

Tailo: Lí sue-pāi ê sî beh án-tsuáⁿ tsò? Suî-jiân tshīng tsu-âng ê saⁿ, īng kim-khì táⁿ-pān, īng sik-liāu uē lí ê ba̍k-tsiu, án-ne tián hó khuànn, sī khang-khang! Luân-ài lí ê khuànn-khin lí, koh siàu-siūⁿ lí ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: You, when you are made desolate, what will you do? Though you clothe yourself with scarlet, though you deck you with ornaments of gold, though you enlarge your eyes with paint, in vain do you make yourself beautiful; your lovers despise you, they seek your life.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng pâi tīn kong-kik Isulael lâng. Kau-tsiàn ê sî, Isulael lâng tī Huilīsū lâng ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su. Huilīsū lâng tī pîng-guân kā in thâi-sí ê kun-ping, tsha-put-to ū sì tshing lâng.
English: The Philistines put themselves in array against Israel: and when they joined battle, Israel was struck before the Philistines; and they killed of the army in the field about four thousand men.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Nā m̄-sī guá ê Thiⁿ-pē tsai-tsìng ê mi̍h, lóng beh kā i khau khí-.lâi.
English: But he answered, Every plant which my heavenly Father didn't plant will be uprooted.

Tailo: Kàu īng o͘-mel lâi niû, khioh tsē-.ê bô tshun, khioh tsió-.ê mā bô khiàm, ta̍k lâng tsiàu in tsia̍h ê liōng lâi khioh.
English: When they measured it with an omer, he who gathered much had nothing over, and he who gathered little had no lack. They gathered every man according to his eating.

Tailo: Ehulaim suaⁿ-tē ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, miâ kiò-tsò Mika.
English: There was a man of the hill country of Ephraim, whose name was Micah.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì in kóng, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng: Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, Guá tsua̍t-tuì bô huann-hí pháiⁿ lâng sí-bông, to̍k-to̍k huann-hí pháiⁿ lâng ua̍t tńg-lâi lī-khui i só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘ lâi ua̍h. Isulael ê tsú-bîn, lín tio̍h ua̍t tò tńg-.lâi, lī-khui pháiⁿ lō͘, lín ná ē beh tshú sí?
English: Tell them, As I live, says the Lord Yahweh, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked; but that the wicked turn from his way and live: turn you, turn you from your evil ways; for why will you die, house of Israel?

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, lí khuàⁿ, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tuì iâⁿ-pâng, tuì Sàulô hia lâi, saⁿ-khò͘ thiah-li̍h, thâu-khak sám thô͘-sua hún, lâi-kàu Tabi̍t hia, tsiū phak tī thô͘-kha kā i pài.
English: it happened on the third day, that behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul, with his clothes torn, and earth on his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.

Tailo: I kā tsiáng-kuân ê lâng, tuì i ê ông-uī thua lo̍h-.lâi, kā pi-bî ê lâng ko-sing.
English: He has put down princes from their thrones. And has exalted the lowly.

Tailo: Kàu ji̍t àm, La̍hban kā i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Leah, sàng lâi hō͘ Iâkop; Iâkop tsiū kah i tâng-pâng.
English: It happened in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him. He went in to her.

Tailo: In lâi-kàu Ioltàn hô guā, A-ta̍t ê tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ, tsiū tī hia tuā thî-khàu, tuā ai-siong; Iôséhuh uī-tio̍h lāu-pē pi-siong tshit ji̍t.
English: They came to the threshing floor of Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, and there they lamented with a very great and sore lamentation. He mourned for his father seven days.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, in-uī Tulô ǹg Êlúsalèm, kóng, ' Ah-hah! Hit-ê tsò lia̍t pang ê mn̂g ê í-king phuà, taⁿ kui-ǹg Guá; i í-king pha-hng, Guá ē hong-sīng. '
English: Son of man, because Tyre has said against Jerusalem, Aha, she is broken: the gate of the peoples; she is turned to me; I shall be replenished, now that she is laid waste:

Tailo: Suaⁿ-kok ê thô͘-uân i lia̍h-tsò tinn; ē ū kûn-tsiòng tuè tī i ê āu-bīn, tshin-tshiūnn tī i tāi-sing ê sǹg bē-liáu.
English: The clods of the valley shall be sweet to him. All men shall draw after him, As there were innumerable before him.

Tailo: Alâm ê kun-ping tshuā tsi̍t sió-tuī ê lâng lâi, Siōngtsú īng tuā tuī ê lâng kau tī in ê tshiú, sī in-uī in pàng-sak Siōngtsú — in tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè, tsiah īng án-ne lâi tsik-hua̍t Io-a-si.
English: For the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men; and Yahweh delivered a very great army into their hand, because they had forsaken Yahweh, the God of their fathers. So they executed judgment on Joash.

Tailo: M̄-koh, tsiú-tsìng-tiúⁿ bô tài-liām tio̍h Iôséhuh, kìng-jiân kā i bē kì-.tit.
English: Yet the chief cupbearer didn't remember Joseph, but forgot him.

Tailo: La̍k ji̍t lāi lí tio̍h tsò lí ê kang, tē-tshit ji̍t tio̍h an-hioh, hō͘ gû, lî thang hioh-khùn, mā hō͘ lú-pī ê kiáⁿ kah tshut-guā lâng lóng thang ióng tsing-li̍k.
English: Six days you shall do your work, and on the seventh day you shall rest, that your ox and your donkey may have rest, and the son of your handmaid, and the alien may be refreshed.

Tailo: Tī hia, liân-tiúⁿ tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah tuì A-li̍k-san-toh lâi ê tsûn, beh khui-khì I-ta-lí-ah, i tsiū kiò guán tsē hit tsiah tsûn.
English: There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board.

Tailo: Koh lín ē tsia̍h lín ê kiáⁿ ê bah, lín ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê bah lín mā beh tsia̍h.
English: You will eat the flesh of your sons, and you will eat the flesh of your daughters.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Lí thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, lí khuàⁿ, Huâ-láu beh kàu tsuí piⁿ, lí khiā tī i ê bīn-thâu-tsîng, kā i kóng, ' Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, tsún Guá ê tsú-bîn lī-khui, thang lâi ho̍k-sāi Guá.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; behold, he comes forth to the water; and tell him, This is what Yahweh says, Let my people go, that they may serve me.

Tailo: In ê bōng tī kheⁿ tiong ki̍k tshim ê só͘-tsāi, i ê jîn-bîn tī i ê bōng ê sì-kho͘-uî, lóng sī siū thâi tó tī to hā ê; in bat tī ua̍h-lâng ê tē hō͘ lâng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: whose graves are set in the uttermost parts of the pit, and her company is round about her grave; all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who caused terror in the land of the living.

Tailo: Iésu tshut-khì tī lō͘-.ni̍h, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tsáu-lâi kuī tī I ê bīn-tsîng, mn̄g kóng, Hó ê lāu-su ah, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò tsiah ē-tàng tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā?
English: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him, Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?

Tailo: Siat-sú Siōngtsú tsò tsi̍t hāng sin ê tāi-tsì, hō͘ tē khui tshuì, kā in kah só͘-ū sio̍k in ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng thun lo̍h-.khì, hō͘ in ua̍h-ua̍h tuī-lo̍h im-kan, lín tsiū tsai tsiah-ê lâng sī teh biáu-sī Siōngtsú.
English: But if Yahweh make a new thing, and the ground open its mouth, and swallow them up, with all that appertain to them, and they go down alive into Sheol; then you shall understand that these men have despised Yahweh.

Tailo: E-hú huan-hù tsiáng lé-ho̍k ê lâng kóng, The̍h lé-ho̍k tshut-lâi hō͘ só͘-ū pài Baal ê lâng tshīng. I tsiū the̍h lé-ho̍k tshut-lâi hō͘ in.
English: He said to him who was over the vestry, Bring forth vestments for all the worshippers of Baal. He brought them forth vestments.

Tailo: Tang pîng ê mn̂g ū sī-uē pâng, tsit pâng saⁿ king, hit pâng saⁿ king, lóng kāng-khuán ê tshùn-tshioh; tsit pîng ê thiāu kah hit pîng ê thiāu mā sī kāng-khuán ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: The lodges of the gate eastward were three on this side, and three on that side; they three were of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guán ê Tsú ah, Lí ê miâ tī tsuân tē kàu hiah kuân-tuā!
English: Yahweh, our Lord, How majestic is your name in all the earth!

Tailo: só͘-í, Iosiúah sí ê sî só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê ta̍k tso̍k, í-āu Guá bô beh koh tī in ê bīn-tsîng kuáⁿ-tshut tsi̍t tso̍k,
English: I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the nations that Joshua left when he died;

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū kiû-kiò Siōngtsú kóng, Guá tuì tsiah-ê jîn-bîn beh án-tsuáⁿ tsò tsiah hó? In tsha-put-to beh īng tsio̍h-thâu kā guá tìm.
English: Moses cried to Yahweh, saying, What shall I do with these people? They are almost ready to stone me.

Tailo: Hit-ê ji̍t nā kàu, lín tio̍h hōng guá ê miâ kî-kiû. Guá bô kā lín kóng, guá beh thè lín tuì Thiⁿ-pē khún-kiû.
English: In that day you will ask in my name; and I don't say to you, that I will pray to the Father for you,

Tailo: Lín só͘ tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê thó͘-tē, tio̍h tsún lâng sio̍k-huê.
English: In all the land of your possession you shall grant a redemption for the land.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Lí tio̍h tī Isulael lâng ê tiong-kan tiám-sǹg, tuì muá-gue̍h í-siōng kiàn-nā thâu-the ê tsa-po͘ ting, kì in ê miâ-gia̍h.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Number all the firstborn males of the children of Israel from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.

Tailo: Su-kì Siahuánn koh tuì ông kóng, Tsè-si Hilkíiah ū the̍h tsi̍t pún tsheh hō͘ guá. Siahuánn tsiū tī ông ê bīn-tsîng kā i tiah iàu-tiám lâi tha̍k.
English: Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest has delivered me a book. Shaphan read therein before the king.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, Siōngtè hiah-ni̍h thiàⁿ lán, lán mā tio̍h sio-thiànn.
English: Beloved, if God loved us in this way, we also ought to love one another.

Tailo: Tse beh kā in tsò íng-uán ê lē, koh hit-ê kā lâng hiù tû-khì lah-sap ê tsuí, hit-ê lâng tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ; kiàn-nā bong hit-ê tû-khì lah-sap ê tsuí ê, it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: It shall be a perpetual statute to them: and he who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and he who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until even.

Tailo: Guá só͘ kóng ê iàu-tiám to̍h-sī, lán ū tsit khuán ê tuā-tsè-si, I tsē tī thinn-tíng tsì-tuā Siōngtè pó-tsō ê tsiànn pîng.
English: Now in the things which we are saying, the main point is this. We have such a high priest, who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu kā i kóng, Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng pān tuā iàn-si̍k, tshiánn tsin tsē lâng.
English: But he said to him, A certain man made a great supper, and he invited many people.

Tailo: Lín ê tsó͘-sian tī khòng-iá tsia̍h má-ná, in mā sī sí-.khì.
English: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.

Tailo: Un-jiû ê lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì, in-uī Siōngtè ē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in I só͘ ìng-ín ê thó͘-tē!
English: Blessed are the gentle, For they shall inherit the earth.

Tailo: Huâ-láu mā tiàu tì-huī ê lâng kah sai-kong lâi, in sī Aigi̍p ê tsheⁿ-siōng-ka, mā īng in ê siâ-su̍t tsiàu án-ne tsok-huat.
English: Then Pharaoh also called for the wise men and the sorcerers. They also, the magicians of Egypt, did in like manner with their enchantments.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū kóng, Siōngtè kok-tō͘ tshin-tshiūnn siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá tio̍h īng siáⁿ-mi̍h lâi pí-phīng?
English: He said, What is the Kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?

Tailo: I uá-khò Siōngtè, Siōngtè nā beh kiù I, tsit-má tio̍h kā I kiù, in-uī I kóng, ' Guá sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ. '
English: He trusts in God. Let God deliver him now, if he wants him; for he said, I am the Son of God.'

Tailo: I huì-tû suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, huí-huāi thiāu-siōng, tshò A-si-lah, phah-tshuì Mô͘se só͘ tsō ê tâng-tsuâ, in-uī kàu hit sî Isulael lâng tuì i sio hiuⁿ, kā i kiò-tsò Ne-hu-si-tàn ( tsù, tsí Mô͘se tī khòng-iá sî só͘ tsù ê tâng-tsuâ, i tsiâⁿ-tsò Isulael lâng moh-pài ê tuì-siōng ) .
English: He removed the high places, and broke the pillars, and cut down the Asherah: and he broke in pieces the brazen serpent that Moses had made; for to those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it; and he called it Nehushtan.

Tailo: I tsiū kā hit kháu tséⁿ ê miâ kiò-tsò Síbah, só͘-í, kàu kin-á-ji̍t, hit-ê siâⁿ ê miâ kiò-tsò Bel-sí-bah.
English: He called it Shibah. Therefore the name of the city is Beersheba to this day.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Uī-tio̍h Mô͘ap huān tsuē kàu tē-saⁿ pái, mā kàu tē-sì pái, Guá bô beh bián-tû i ê hîng-hua̍t; in-uī i kā Etóm ông ê kut-thâu sio-tsò hue.
English: Thus says Yahweh: For three transgressions of Moab, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; Because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime;

Tailo: Mô͘se tshuā in tshut Aigi̍p, tuà tī Aigi̍p, Âng-hái kah khòng-iá sì-tsa̍p nî, kiânn tsin tsē kî-sū sîn-jiah.
English: This man led them out, having worked wonders and signs in Egypt, in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.

Tailo: Sala̍h tsiū tuì Abulahàm kóng, Τio̍h kā tsit-ê lú-pī kah i ê kiáⁿ kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, in-uī lú-pī ê kiáⁿ bē-tàng kah guá ê kiáⁿ Ísak kāng-khuán tsò lí ê hō͘-sû.
English: Therefore she said to Abraham, Cast out this handmaid and her son! For the son of this handmaid will not be heir with my son, Isaac.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ uàn-tò͘ Iôséhuh, kā i bē khì Aigi̍p; m̄-koh, Siōngtè kah i tông-tsāi,
English: The patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. God was with him,

Tailo: Siōngtè sī sìn-si̍t ê, I ho͘-tiàu lín lâi kah I ê Kiáⁿ, lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok kiat-liân.
English: God is faithful, through whom you were called into the fellowship of his Son, Jesus Christ, our Lord.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh huan-hù guá kóng, ' Guá khuànn tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, lí khuàⁿ, sī ām-kún ngē ê jîn-bîn.
English: Furthermore Yahweh spoke to me, saying, I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stiff-necked people:

Tailo: I tsiū hō͘ Sâmsóng khùn tī i ê kha-thâu-u, kiò tsi̍t-ê lâng lâi thì i tshit-kó͘ ê thâu-mn̂g. Tsiū án-ne hō͘ i khùn khó͘, i ê khuì-la̍t tsiū lī-khui i.
English: She made him sleep on her knees; and she called for a man, and shaved off the seven locks of his head; and she began to afflict him, and his strength went from him.

Tailo: In kóng, Ū tsi̍t-ê Aigi̍p lâng kiù guán thuat-lī kò͘ iûⁿ ê lâng ê tshiú, koh thè guán tshut-la̍t tshiūⁿ tsuí hō͘ iûⁿ-kûn lim.
English: They said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and moreover he drew water for us, and watered the flock.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê lâng kóng beh huí-huāi sìng-tiān, saⁿ ji̍t lāi koh khí khí-.lâi. Taⁿ tio̍h kiù Lí ka-kī. Lí nā-sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ, tio̍h tuì si̍p-jī-kè tíng lo̍h-.lâi.
English: and saying, You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!

Tailo: Hit-ê kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá koh lâi kā guá kiò-tshéⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn lâng teh khùn hông kiò-tshéⁿ.
English: The angel who talked with me came again, and wakened me, as a man who is wakened out of his sleep.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā it-tshè ê tshau-huân kau-thok hō͘ Siōngtè, in-uī I kuan-sim lín.
English: casting all your worries on him, because he cares for you.

Tailo: Kì-jiân kiáⁿ-jî lóng sī ū hueh ū bah ê lâng, Iésu pún-sin mā kāng-khuán tsiâⁿ-tsò ū hueh ū bah ê lâng. Tse sī uī-tio̍h beh thong-kuè I ê sí lâi huí-bia̍t hit-ê tsiáng-kuán sí-bông ê Mô͘-kuí,
English: Since then the children have shared in flesh and blood, he also himself in like manner partook of the same, that through death he might bring to nothing him who had the power of death, that is, the devil,

Tailo: Iésu tī Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ ǹg sìng-tiān teh tsē ê sî, Piattò͘, Iâkop, Iô-há-neh kah An-to-le̍h thau-thau-á mn̄g Iésu kóng,
English: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè kok-tō͘ m̄-sī khò kóng-uē, sī khò kuân-lîng.
English: For the Kingdom of God is not in word, but in power.

Tailo: koh tī tuâⁿ tíng thâi-sí hit só͘-tsāi suaⁿ-thâu biō ê tsè-si, mā tī tuâⁿ tíng sio lâng ê kut-thâu liáu-āu tsiah tńg-khì Êlúsalèm.
English: He killed all the priests of the high places that were there, on the altars, and burned men's bones on them; and he returned to Jerusalem.

Tailo: tiám kng ê ting-tâi kah i ê khì-kū, ting-tsuáⁿ kah tiám kng ê iû,
English: the lampstand also for the light, with its vessels, its lamps, and the oil for the light;

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tuà tī Seil ê Esáu ê kiáⁿ-sun kah tuà tī Al ê Mô͘ap lâng khuán-thāi guá sio-siâng, thìng-hāu guá kuè Ioltàn hô, ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú — guán ê Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ guán ê tē. '
English: as the children of Esau who dwell in Seir, and the Moabites who dwell in Ar, did to me; until I shall pass over the Jordan into the land which Yahweh our God gives us.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Asiul ông m̄-sī tsit khuán ì-sù, i ê sim mā m̄-sī tsit-ê phah-sǹg. I ê sim-lāi tian-tò siūⁿ beh huí-bia̍t, siūⁿ beh tsâu-bia̍t tsin tsē kok.
English: However he doesn't mean so, neither does his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy, and to cut off not a few nations.

Tailo: Lín iáu teh kóng, ' Tsú ê lō͘ bô kong-pêⁿ! ' Isulael ê tsú-bîn, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ! Guá ê lō͘ kám bô kong-pêⁿ? Kám m̄-sī lín ê lō͘ bô kong-pêⁿ?
English: Yet you say, The way of the Lord is not equal. Hear now, house of Israel: Is my way not equal? Aren't your ways unequal?

Tailo: Guá iáu-buē lâi ê tsìn-tsîng, lí só͘-ū ê tsin tsió, taⁿ lí tuā huat-ta̍t; Siōngtsú kā hok-khì tuè guá ê kha lâi hō͘ lí, taⁿ guá tio̍h kàu tang-sî tsiah ē-tàng uī guá ê ke kiàn-tì sán-gia̍p?
English: For it was little which you had before I came, and it has increased to a multitude. Yahweh has blessed you wherever I turned. Now when will I provide for my own house also?

Tailo: Aiah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Li-tsu-bah the̍h tsho͘ muâ-pò͘, uī ka-kī tshu tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng, tuì khí-thâu siu-kuah ê sî kàu thiⁿ lo̍h hō͘-tsuí tī sin-si ê sî, m̄-tsún ji̍t-sî khong-tiong ê tsiáu kah àm-sî ê tsáu-siù lâi-kàu tī hiah-ê sin-si.
English: Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her on the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water was poured on them from the sky; and she allowed neither the birds of the sky to rest on them by day, nor the animals of the field by night.

Tailo: Piattò͘ ìn kóng, Guá nā tio̍h kah Lí tsò-hué sí, guá mā tsua̍t-tuì bē m̄-jīn Lí. kî-tha ê bûn-tô͘ mā lóng án-ne kóng.
English: Peter said to him, Even if I must die with you, I will not deny you. All of the disciples also said likewise.

Tailo: Liân-tiúⁿ kah hiah-ê kò͘-siú Iésu ê ping-á, tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h tē-tāng kah só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì, hui-siông tio̍h-kiaⁿ, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng kó-jiân sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ.
English: Now the centurion, and those who were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake, and the things that were done, feared exceedingly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.

Tailo: Lín to̍h-sī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn.
English: You are witnesses of these things.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng tâng kā i tsò tsi̍t-ê bāng, tī bāng ê sì-kak tsò sì-ê tâng khuân,
English: You shall make a grating for it of network of brass: and on the net you shall make four brazen rings in its four corners.

Tailo: Tī ē-té, i ê kin-thâu ē ta-.khì; tī tíng-bīn, i ê ki ē siū tsián-tû.
English: His roots shall be dried up beneath, Above shall his branch be cut off.

Tailo: Lí ê tshiú huāⁿ tī i ê tíng-bīn; ē kì-tit kah i kau-tsiàn ê tāi-tsì, tsiū m̄-káⁿ koh án-ne tsò.
English: Lay your hand on him. Remember the battle, and do so no more.

Tailo: Tsú kóng, In-uī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tshin-kīn Guá, īng tshuì, īng tshuì-tûn tsun-kìng Guá, sim khiok lī-khui Guá hn̄g-hn̄g. In tsun-kìng Guá, tsí-put-kò sī tsun-thàn lâng só͘ kà-sī ê bīng-līng niā-niā.
English: The Lord said, Because this people draws near with their mouth and with their lips to honor me, but they have removed their heart far from me, and their fear of me is a commandment of men which has been taught;

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ kā I kóng, Lâng ê ang-bó͘ kuan-hē Nā-sī án-ne, lîng-khó mài kiat-hun khah hó.
English: His disciples said to him, If this is the case of the man with his wife, it is not expedient to marry.

Tailo: Tuā hái khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsiū tô-tsáu; Ioltàn hô mā tò-tńg-lâu.
English: The sea saw it, and fled. The Jordan was driven back.

Tailo: Hit sî, ke tsiū thî tē-jī pái. Piattò͘ siūⁿ-khí Iésu kā i kóng ê uē, Ke thî nn̄g pái í-tsîng, lí ē saⁿ pái m̄ jīn guá , tsiū tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu.
English: The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the word, how that Jesus said to him, Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times. When he thought about that, he wept.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsin tsē jîn-bîn tsū-tsi̍p lâi that-ba̍t só͘-ū ê tsuí-guân kah lâu-kuè hit só͘-tsāi ê khe, kóng, Asiul hiah-ê ông lâi, ná ē-sái hō͘ i tit-tio̍h tsin tsē tsuí?
English: So there was gathered much people together, and they stopped all the springs, and the brook that flowed through the midst of the land, saying, Why should the kings of Assyria come, and find much water?

Tailo: Guá tshim-tshim su-sióng guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘, tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin kui-ǹg Lí ê lu̍t-lē.
English: I considered my ways, And turned my steps to your statutes.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t só͘ kiâⁿ ê, Siōngtsú huan-hù tio̍h án-ne kiânn, uī-tio̍h lín sio̍k-tsuē.
English: What has been done this day, so Yahweh has commanded to do, to make atonement for you.

Tailo: Huán-tńg kah guā-pang lâng hūn-tsa̍p thong-hun, o̍h in ê só͘ tsò,
English: But mixed themselves with the nations, And learned their works.

Tailo: Lín in-uī guá ê iân-kò͘ ē hō͘ tsìng lâng uàn-hūn,
English: You will be hated by all men for my name's sake.

Tailo: Tán kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, lí tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín lo̍h-khì kàu lí tsîng tú-tio̍h tāi-tsì só͘ bih ê só͘-tsāi, tī Í-sik ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ hia thìng-hāu.
English: When you have stayed three days, you shall go down quickly, and come to the place where you did hide yourself when the business was in hand, and shall remain by the stone Ezel.

Tailo: Lí tó-.leh, mā bô lâng ē kā lí phah tio̍h-kiaⁿ, koh ū tsin tsē lâng tuì lí kiû in.
English: Also you shall lie down, and none shall make you afraid; Yes, many shall court your favor.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tsai, tio̍h bîng-pi̍k, tuì tshut bīng-līng tiông-sin khí-tsō Êlúsalèm ti̍t-kàu siū buah-iû ê kun-ông ê sî, ē ū tshit-ê tshit-ji̍t kî. Koh-tsài king-kuè la̍k-tsa̍p-jī-ê tshit-ji̍t kî, tng teh kan-lân ê sî, siâⁿ kah ke-lō͘ í-ki̍p hô-kau lóng ē koh khí-tsō khí-.lâi.
English: Know therefore and discern, that from the going forth of the commandment to restore and to build Jerusalem to the Anointed One, the prince, shall be seven weeks, and sixty-two weeks: it shall be built again, with street and moat, even in troubled times.

Tailo: Isulael ông kā Iô-sa-huat kóng, Iáu ū tsi̍t-ê lâng lán thang tuì i lâi mn̄g Siōngtsú. Tsóng-.sī, guá uàn-hūn i, in-uī i só͘ ī-giân guá ê bô tsi̍t hāng sī hó, tsí ū tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kóng tsai-hō niā-niā. Tsit-ê lâng sī Im-lah ê kiáⁿ Mikaiah. Iô-sa-huat kóng, Tshiánn ông m̄-thang án-ne kóng.
English: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man by whom we may inquire of Yahweh: but I hate him; for he never prophesies good concerning me, but always evil: the same is Micaiah the son of Imla. Jehoshaphat said, Don't let the king say so.

Tailo: Tī hiah-ê kok lāi, lí bē-tàng an-jiân, lí ê kha mā bē-tàng hioh-khùn; Siōngtsú mā ē hō͘ lí tī hia sim-kuann pho̍k-pho̍k-tshíng, ba̍k-tsiu sit-bîng, tsing-sîn sue-pāi.
English: Among these nations shall you find no ease, and there shall be no rest for the sole of your foot: but Yahweh will give you there a trembling heart, and failing of eyes, and pining of soul;

Tailo: ( Khóla̍h kiáⁿ-sun ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) 	Lín tsìng lâng lóng tio̍h phah pho̍k-á! Tio̍h īng tik-sìng ê siann tuā-siaⁿ o-ló Siōngtè!
English: Oh clap your hands, all you nations. Shout to God with the voice of triumph!

Tailo: Mô͘se tuì in kóng, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng, ' Lín ta̍k lâng tio̍h tshah to tī tuā-thuí-.ni̍h, tī iâⁿ tiong óng-lâi, tuì tsit-ê mn̂g kàu hit-ê mn̂g, ta̍k lâng thâi-sí i ê hiann-tī kah i ê tâng-phuāⁿ, í-ki̍p i ê tshù-piⁿ. '
English: He said to them, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Every man put his sword on his thigh, and go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and every man kill his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.

Tailo: Kuáⁿ-hū khì kā Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Elísiah kóng, Lí khì bē iû lâi hîng-tsè, só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ thang tō͘ sing-ua̍h.
English: Then she came and told the man of God. He said, Go, sell the oil, and pay your debt, and live you and your sons of the rest.

Tailo: Lí tuà Le-ba-nòng, tsò siū tī pik-hiuⁿ tshiū ê, thòng-khó͘ lîm-kàu lí, thàng-thiàⁿ tshin-tshiūnn beh seⁿ kiáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, hit sî, lí ê khó-liân ē kàu án-tsuáⁿ!
English: Inhabitant of Lebanon, who makes your nest in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied shall you be when pangs come on you, the pain as of a woman in travail!

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā tuì i kóng ê siàu-liân lâng kóng, Lí án-tsuáⁿ tsai-iáⁿ Sàulô kah i ê kiáⁿ Ionáthan sí-.khì?
English: David said to the young man who told him, How know you that Saul and Jonathan his son are dead?

Tailo: Sàulô ê lāu-pē Kisi phah-m̄-kiàn kuí-nā tsiah lô͘-bú, Kisi kā i ê kiáⁿ Sàulô kóng, Lí tshuā tsi̍t-ê lô͘-po̍k tshut-huat khì tshuē lî-bó.
English: The donkeys of Kish, Saul's father, were lost. Kish said to Saul his son, Take now one of the servants with you, and arise, go seek the donkeys.

Tailo: Lí tsiū tio̍h thàm-thiaⁿ, tshâ-khó, siông-sè mn̄g; lí khuàⁿ, kó-jiân sī tsin ê, tsún-tsún ū tsit-ê khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì kiânn tī lín tiong-kan,
English: then shall you inquire, and make search, and ask diligently; and, behold, if it be truth, and the thing certain, that such abomination is done in the midst of you,

Tailo: Ionáthan kā Tabi̍t kóng, Guān Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè tsò kiàn-tsìng, bîn-á-tsài tsit sî á-.sī tē-saⁿ ji̍t, guá thàm-khuàⁿ guá ê lāu-pē, nā ū hó ì-sù ǹg Tabi̍t, guá kám bē tshe lâng kā lí kóng?
English: Jonathan said to David, Yahweh, the God of Israel, be witness: when I have sounded my father about this time tomorrow, or the third day, behold, if there be good toward David, shall I not then send to you, and disclose it to you?

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê tshiú hē tī guá ê sin tsiūⁿ, Siōngtsú īng I ê sîn-lîng tshuā guá tshut-.khì, kā guá hē tī suaⁿ-kok tiong; hit-ê suaⁿ-kok ū kut-thâu muá-muá.
English: The hand of Yahweh was on me, and he brought me out in the Spirit of Yahweh, and set me down in the midst of the valley; and it was full of bones.

Tailo: to̍h-sī an-tì gōng lâng tī kuân uī, hó-gia̍h lâng tsē tī kē uī.
English: Folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in a low place.

Tailo: Lán-si ê lâng khùn tāng-bîn, pîn-tuāⁿ ê lâng ē tú-tio̍h iau-gō.
English: Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep. The idle soul shall suffer hunger.

Tailo: Lín tsit tsa̍p pái lîng-jio̍k guá, lín pháiⁿ khuán-thāi guá mā bô ka-kī kiàn-siàu.
English: You have reproached me ten times. You aren't ashamed that you attack me.

Tailo: In-uī Babúlông ông khiā tī siang-tshe lō͘ hia, tī nn̄g tiâu lō͘ thâu beh tsiam-pok, i ē iô tsìnn lâi mn̄g ngó͘-siōng, giām sing-lé ê kuaⁿ.
English: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination: he shook the arrows back and forth, he consulted the teraphim, he looked in the liver.

Tailo: Tsò lāu-pē ê lâng m̄-thang kik kiáⁿ-jî siū-khì, tsiah bē hō͘ in hue-sim sit-tsì.
English: Fathers, don't provoke your children, so that they won't be discouraged.

Tailo: Tuà tī hái-huāⁿ ê jîn-bîn kah tsá-sî kuè hái hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h tshiong-sīng ê Sitòng sing-lí lâng, taⁿ lín tio̍h tiām-tiām.
English: Be still, you inhabitants of the coast, you whom the merchants of Sidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.

Tailo: Lí kám ē kah i tshit-thô, tshin-tshiūnn tsiáu-á? Lí kám ē kā i pa̍k khí-.lâi, hō͘ lí siàu-liân ê lú-tsú khan?
English: Will you play with him as with a bird? Or will you bind him for your girls?

Tailo: In teh kìng-pài Tsú, kìm-tsia̍h ê sî, Sìng Sîn kóng, Tio̍h uī guá tshe-phài Ba-ná-ba kah Sàulô, khì tsò guá ho͘-tiàu in khì tsò ê kang-tsok.
English: As they served the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, Separate Barnabas and Saul for me, for the work to which I have called them.

Tailo: In tī in pò͘-pêⁿ lāi huat-tshut uàn-hūn ê uē, m̄-thiaⁿ-thàn Siōngtsú ê uē.
English: But murmured in their tents, And didn't listen to Yahweh's voice.

Tailo: Kng-bîng tuà ê só͘-tsāi, hit tiâu lō͘ tuì tó-uī khì? O͘-àm ê só͘-tsāi tī tó-uī?
English: What is the way to the dwelling of light? As for darkness, where is the place of it,

Tailo: Án-ne, uī-tio̍h ka-kī tsik-tsū tsâi-pó, bô hō͘ Siōngtè khuàⁿ-tsò hó-gia̍h ê lâng mā sī kāng-khuán.
English: So is he who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.

Tailo: Tsiàu kì-tsài, guá kah-ì Iâkop, bô kah-ì Esáu. ( tsù, MLK 1:2-3 )
English: Even as it is written, Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.

Tailo: In tsiū kā i bâi-tsòng tī i ê sán-gia̍p ê kài lāi, to̍h-sī tī Ehulaim suaⁿ-tē ê Tîng-ná-hi-lia̍t, tī Ga-sih suaⁿ ê pak pîng.
English: They buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath Heres, in the hill country of Ephraim, on the north of the mountain of Gaash.

Tailo: Lí í-king thè guá sin-uan, thè guá piān-bîng; Lí tsē tī pó-tsō, tsiàu kong-gī teh sím-phuàⁿ.
English: For you have maintained my just cause. You sit on the throne judging righteously.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, hit sî, Guá beh hō͘ Tabi̍t huat-tshut gī ê tshiū-ki, i ē tī tē-tsiūⁿ kiânn kong-pêⁿ kah kong-gī.
English: In those days, and at that time, will I cause a Branch of righteousness to grow up to David; and he shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tsiū tshut-khì guā-bīn, tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu.
English: He went out, and wept bitterly.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Lâi tsia̍h tsá-tǹg. bûn-tô͘ bô lâng káⁿ kā I mn̄g, Lí sī siáⁿ lâng? In-uī in tsai I sī Tsú.
English: Jesus said to them, Come and eat breakfast. None of the disciples dared inquire of him, Who are you? knowing that it was the Lord.

Tailo: In pun guá ê saⁿ, liam-khau lâi pun guá ê saⁿ-khò͘.
English: They divide my garments among them. They cast lots for my clothing.

Tailo: Isulael kám sī lô͘-po̍k? Kám sī tshù lāi seⁿ ê lô͘-po̍k? Ná ē tsiâⁿ-tsò hông tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h?
English: Is Israel a servant? is he a native-born slave? why is he become a prey?

Tailo: Ū lâng kóng, Tsia̍h sī uī-tio̍h pak-tó͘, pak-tó͘ mā sī uī-tio̍h tsia̍h. Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtè lóng beh kā tsit nn̄g hāng huí-huāi. Sing-khu m̄-sī uī-tio̍h îm-luān, sī uī-tio̍h ho̍k-sāi Tsú, Tsú mā ē kiong-kip lán sing-khu ê su-iàu.
English: Foods for the belly, and the belly for foods, but God will bring to nothing both it and them. But the body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.

Tailo: nn̄g tsiah gû-káng, gō͘ tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò siā-un-tsè. Tsiah-ê sī Ok-lân ê kiáⁿ Phagiel ê lé-mi̍h.
English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Pagiel the son of Ochran.

Tailo: Tī khah tsá bat kā in kóng Lín m̄-sī Guá ê tsú-bîn ê só͘-tsāi, kāng-khuán tī hia in beh hông kiò-tsò Íng-uán-ua̍h ê Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ. ( Tsù, HSA 1:10 )
English: It will be that in the place where it was said to them, You are not my people,' There they will be called children of the living God.'

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng koh mn̄g i kóng, Án-ne, lí sī Eliiah, sī-.bô? Iô-há-neh ìn kóng, M̄-sī. In koh mn̄g i kóng, Lí sī hit-ê sian-ti, sī-.bô? Iô-há-neh ìn kóng, M̄-sī.
English: They asked him, What then? Are you Elijah? He said, I am not. Are you the Prophet? He answered, No.

Tailo: Guá bô beh khuànn lâng ê sin-hūn, mā bô beh phô͘-tháⁿ lâng.
English: Please don't let me respect any man's person, Neither will I give flattering titles to any man.

Tailo: Siōngtè nā bô kiám-tsió hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí, tsiū bô tsi̍t-ê lâng ē-tàng tit-kiù; to̍k-to̍k Siōngtè ē uī-tio̍h I ê suán-bîn lâi kiám-tsió hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí.
English: Unless those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved. But for the sake of the chosen ones, those days will be shortened.

Tailo: Á-sī kun-ông tshe-phài lâi hîng-hua̍t pháiⁿ lâng kah tsióng-lē hó lâng ê kuaⁿ-uân, lín lóng tio̍h sūn-ho̍k.
English: or to governors, as sent by him for vengeance on evil-doers and for praise to those who do well.

Tailo: Lí ū lia̍h-tio̍h guá, sī thang tsò kiàn-tsìng; guá ê siau-sán khí-lâi kong-kik guá, tam guá ê bīn-tsîng tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: You have shriveled me up. This is a witness against me. My leanness rises up against me, It testifies to my face.

Tailo: Guá beh tī tsit-ê só͘-tsāi hō͘ Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm ê kè-bô͘ kui tī khang-khang, mā beh hō͘ in tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng tó tī to hā kah siàu-siūⁿ in ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ê tshiú-thâu. In ê sin-si, Guá beh hō͘ khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê iá-siù tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place; and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hand of those who seek their life: and their dead bodies will I give to be food for the birds of the sky, and for the animals of the earth.

Tailo: I tuì I ê pó-tsō khuànn lo̍h-.lâi, khuànn I tē-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê tsú-bîn.
English: From the place of his habitation he looks out on all the inhabitants of the earth,

Tailo: Guá to̍h-sī Iô-tá-iah lâng, tshut-sì tī Ki-lí-kiah ê Tà-soh, tī Êlúsalèm siâⁿ tsò Gâmáliel ê bûn-tô͘ tióng-tuā kah kin-á-ji̍t tī tsia ê kok-uī kāng-khuán, ū siū lán tsó͘-sian giâm-keh lu̍t-huat ê kà-sī, jia̍t-sim ho̍k-sāi Siōngtè.
English: I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, instructed according to the strict manner of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are this day.

Tailo: Hāi ah! Huān-tsuē ê kok, tsuē-ok ê jîn-bîn, kiâⁿ pháiⁿ ê tsíng-luī kah pāi-huāi ê kiáⁿ-jî! In lī-khui Siōngtsú, khuànn-khin Isulael ê sìng ê, kah I tsheⁿ-so͘, ua̍t tńg-sin lī-khui khì.
English: Ah sinful nation, A people loaded with iniquity, A seed of evil-doers, Children who deal corruptly! They have forsaken Yahweh. They have despised the Holy One of Israel. They are estranged and backward.

Tailo: Mô͘se kā in kóng, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Bîn-á-tsài sī tiōng-iàu ê an-hioh, to̍h-sī ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú sìng ê An-hioh-ji̍t. Lín ài piak ê tsiū piak, ài tsú ê tsiū tsú, só͘ tshun-.ê, tio̍h ka-kī siu-.leh, lâu kàu keh kang tsá-khí.
English: He said to them, This is that which Yahweh has spoken, Tomorrow is a solemn rest, a holy Sabbath to Yahweh. Bake that which you want to bake, and boil that which you want to boil; and all that remains over lay up for yourselves to be kept until the morning.

Tailo: Lín nā bô kah kî-tha ê kiáⁿ-jî kāng-khuán siū kuán-kà, to̍h-sī su-sing-tsú, m̄-sī tsin-tsiàⁿ ê kiáⁿ-jî.
English: But if you are without discipline, of which all have been made partakers, then are you illegitimate, and not children.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ìn tsè-si kā i kóng, Kàu-taⁿ tsha-put-to ū saⁿ ji̍t, m̄-bat tshin-kīn tsa-bó͘ lâng; guá tshut-mn̂g ê sî, suî-jiân sī pîng-siông ê tāi-tsì, siàu-liân lâng ê khì-kū sī tshing-khì, hô-hòng kin-á-ji̍t in ê khì-kū kám bô sìng?
English: David answered the priest, and said to him, Of a truth women have been kept from us about these three days; when I came out, the vessels of the young men were holy, though it was but a common journey; how much more then today shall their vessels be holy?

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng sī teh sū-hāu ông ê, līng-guā ū ông só͘ an-tì tī Iôtah ta̍k-ê kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ ê.
English: These were those who waited on the king, besides those whom the king put in the fortified cities throughout all Judah.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang tsá-khí, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: In the morning came the word of Yahweh to me, saying,

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsiū tuì tē-.ni̍h khí-.lâi, sé sing-khu, buah iû, uāⁿ saⁿ, ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān kìng-pài, jiân-āu tńg-khì i ê tshù. I huan-hù lâng pâi mi̍h tī i ê bīn-tsîng, i tsiū tsia̍h.
English: Then David arose from the earth, and washed, and anointed himself, and changed his clothing; and he came into the house of Yahweh, and worshiped: then he came to his own house; and when he required, they set bread before him, and he ate.

Tailo: Hitsekia tuì tsè-si kah Lēbī lâng tsa-mn̄g hiah-ê tui.
English: Then Hezekiah questioned the priests and the Levites concerning the heaps.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsai, bô-lūn tsò lô͘-po̍k á-.sī tsū-iû ê lâng, Tsú lóng ē tsiàu ta̍k lâng ê kiâⁿ-ta̍h lâi kā in pò-siúⁿ.
English: knowing that whatever good thing each one does, he will receive the same again from the Lord, whether he is bound or free.

Tailo: Hit-ê siâⁿ ê tiúⁿ-ló tio̍h lia̍h hit-ê lâng lâi kā i tsik-hua̍t,
English: The elders of that city shall take the man and chastise him;

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng koh ū līng-guā tsi̍t-ê tiāu-thâu tshut-hiān, tsi̍t bué tshiah-sik ê tuā bé lîng, ū tshit-ê thâu, tsa̍p ki kak, thâu-khak tì tshit tíng ông-kuan.
English: Another sign was seen in heaven. Behold, a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and on his heads seven crowns.

Tailo: In-uī Guá to̍h-sī Siōngtsú, Guá beh kóng, jî-tshiánn Guá só͘ kóng ê uē ē ìng-giām, bô koh iân-tshiân. Lín tsit-ê puē-gi̍k ê ke, Guá beh tī lín ua̍h-.leh ê ji̍t lâi kóng, lâi kā i tsiânn. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: For I am Yahweh; I will speak, and the word that I shall speak shall be performed; it shall be no more deferred: for in your days, rebellious house, will I speak the word, and will perform it, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Apnel in-uī I-si-bo-siat ê uē, tsiū tsin siū-khì, kóng, Guá kám sī Iôtah ê káu-thâu? Guá hó khuán-thāi lí ê lāu-pē Sàulô ê ke kah i ê hiann-tī pîng-iú, bô kā lí kau tī Tabi̍t ê tshiú tiong, lí kin-á-ji̍t kìng-jiân in-uī tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng lâi kā guá tsik-pī?
English: Then was Abner very angry for the words of Ishbosheth, and said, Am I a dog's head that belongs to Judah? This day do I show kindness to the house of Saul your father, to his brothers, and to his friends, and have not delivered you into the hand of David; and yet you charge me this day with a fault concerning this woman.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tuā kî, thiaⁿ-tio̍h sàu-kak ê siann; beh kàu guā kú?
English: How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?

Tailo: Tio̍h tsù-ì hit tīn káu tóng, thê-hông hiah-ê pháiⁿ lâng, tsù-ì hiah-ê kian-tshî kat-lé ê lâng.
English: Beware of the dogs, beware of the evil workers, beware of the false circumcision.

Tailo: Tabi̍t phài kuí-nā-ê Lēbī lâng tī Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī tsîng ho̍k-sāi, lâi kì-liām-kám-siā, o-ló Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè.
English: He appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of Yahweh, and to celebrate and to thank and praise Yahweh, the God of Israel:

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī tuì thiⁿ kàng-lo̍h ê piáⁿ, hō͘ lâng tsia̍h liáu bē sí.
English: This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, that anyone may eat of it and not die.

Tailo: Lín uī-tio̍h kuí-nā pé tuā-be̍h, kuí-nā tè piáⁿ, tī Guá ê tsú-bîn tiong-kan siat-to̍k Guá, tuì Guá hiah-ê ài thiaⁿ pe̍h-tsha̍t uē ê jîn-bîn kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t, hāi-sí hiah-ê bô ing-kai sí ê sîn-hûn, mā hō͘ bô ing-kai ua̍h ê sîn-hûn ua̍h khí-.lâi. '
English: You have profaned me among my people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread, to kill the souls who should not die, and to save the souls alive who should not live, by your lying to my people who listen to lies.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tû-khì só͘-ū ê ok-to̍k, kuí-tsà, guī-siān, uàn-tò͘ kah huí-pòng.
English: Putting away therefore all wickedness, all deceit, hypocrisies, envies, and all evil speaking,

Tailo: In ìn kóng, Guá ê tsú án-tsuáⁿ ē kóng tsit khuán uē? Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsua̍t-tuì bô tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì.
English: They said to him, Why does my lord speak such words as these? Far be it from your servants that they should do such a thing!

Tailo: Nepkatnetsal ông bat kah i kí Siōngtè lâi tsiù-tsuā, tsóng-.sī, i puē-puān, ngē i ê ām-kún, kò͘-tsi̍p i ê sim, m̄ kui-sūn Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè.
English: He also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God: but he stiffened his neck, and hardened his heart against turning to Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Bôohtsuh kā Lùthuh kóng, Guá ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ, m̄-thang khì pa̍t khu hn̂g khioh be̍h-sap, mā m̄-thang lī-khui tsia, tio̍h án-ne kah guá tsiah-ê lú-pī tsò-tīn.
English: Then said Boaz to Ruth, Don't you hear, my daughter? Don't go to glean in another field, neither pass from hence, but abide here fast by my maidens.

Tailo: Kuan-hē tsè-kuè ngó͘-siōng ê mi̍h, lán tsai lán lóng ū tì-sik. Tì-sik ē hō͘ lâng kiau-ngō͘, m̄-koh, thiàⁿ-sim ē tsō-tsiū lâng.
English: Now concerning things sacrificed to idols: We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm hō͘ i sí, in-uī i siūⁿ beh ín-iú lí lī-khui Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī tshuā lí tshut Aigi̍p tē — tsò lô͘-lē ê ke ê.
English: You shall stone him to death with stones, because he has sought to draw you away from Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

Tailo: Lâng nā hō͘ tsiáu-á khuàⁿ-tio̍h i teh Siat ê lô-bāng, siūⁿ beh lia̍h tsiáu á-.sī bô tshái kang.
English: For in vain is the net spread in the sight of any bird:

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tsai Lí siū-khì ê kuân-ui? Siáⁿ lâng tsai Lí siū-khì thang hō͘ lâng kìng-uì?
English: Who knows the power of your anger, Your wrath according to the fear that is due to you?

Tailo: Phak tī Tabi̍t ê kha tsîng, kóng, Guá ê tsú ah, guān tsit-ê tsuē kui tī guá, kiû lí tsún lí ê lú-pī kóng hō͘ lí thiaⁿ, koh kiû lí thiaⁿ lí ê lú-pī ê uē.
English: She fell at his feet, and said, On me, my lord, on me be the iniquity; and please let your handmaid speak in your ears. Hear the words of your handmaid.

Tailo: Αpsalôm tsáu kàu Ge-siul, tī hia tuà sann nî.
English: So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.

Tailo: Pasea ê kiáⁿ Io-ho-iá-tah kah Pí-só͘-tāi ê kiáⁿ Mesiulám siu-lí kū mn̂g, hē i ê ênn-á, an i ê mn̂g-sìⁿ, i ê só kah i ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ.
English: The old gate repaired Joiada the son of Paseah and Meshullam the son of Besodeiah; they laid the beams of it, and set up the doors of it, and the bolts of it, and the bars of it.

Tailo: Guá ài i-tī Isulael ê sî, Ehulaim ê tsuē-kò kah Sa-má-lī-a ê tsuē-ok tsiū lō͘-hiān. In-uī in tsò tāi-tsì hi-ké, lāi-bīn ū tsha̍t ji̍p-.lâi, guā-bīn ū kui tīn ê tshiúⁿ-kiap.
English: When I would heal Israel, Then the iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered, Also the wickedness of Samaria; For they commit falsehood, And the thief enters in, And the gang of robbers ravages outside.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh thuân hok-im hō͘ bîn-tsiòng ê sî, lóng īng tsin tsē hong-huat lâi khó͘-khǹg.
English: Then with many other exhortations he preached good news to the people,

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Taⁿ in-uī lín kiânn tsiah-ê it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, Guá ū tuì lín kóng, mā sī tsá-tsá khí-lâi kóng, m̄-koh lín m̄-thiaⁿ; Guá koh kiò lín, m̄-koh lín m̄ ìn.
English: Now, because you have done all these works, says Yahweh, and I spoke to you, rising up early and speaking, but you didn't hear; and I called you, but you didn't answer:

Tailo: M̄-thang pháiⁿ khuán-thāi kuáⁿ-hū kah ko͘-jî;
English: You shall not take advantage of any widow or fatherless child.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kàng-lîm, beh khuànn sè-kan lâng só͘ khí ê siâⁿ kah thah.
English: Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built.

Tailo: Iâkop in-uī ū sìn-sim, beh sí ê sî tsiah kā Iôséhuh ê nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ tsiok-hok, koh huāⁿ tuà kuái-á thâu kìng-pài Siōngtè. ( tsù, CSK 47:31 LXX )
English: By faith, Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph, and worshiped, leaning on the top of his staff.

Tailo: Nā-sī guá, guá beh gióng-bōng Siōngtsú, mā beh thìng-hāu kiù guá ê Siōngtè; guá ê Siōngtè ē thiaⁿ guá.
English: But as for me, I will look to Yahweh. I will wait for the God of my salvation. My God will hear me.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ iáu bô huè-.khì, jîn-bîn iû-guân tī suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ hiàn tsè sio hiuⁿ.
English: However the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.

Tailo: Tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-tsa̍p, jîn-bîn tuì Ioltàn hô khí-.lâi, tsiū tsat iâⁿ tī Gilgal, tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tang pîng ê kíng-kài.
English: The people came up out of the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and encamped in Gilgal, on the east border of Jericho.

Tailo: Hō͘ in khiàm-khueh piáⁿ kah tsuí, tsò-hué tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, koh tī in ê tsuē-kò lâi siau-bia̍t.
English: that they may want bread and water, and be dismayed one with another, and pine away in their iniquity.

Tailo: Hián-bîng ê tsik-pī, iâⁿ-kuè ún-ba̍t ê ài-tsîng.
English: Better is open rebuke Than hidden love.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê tsò I ê kun-ping, tsò I ê tshe-sài, kiânn I só͘ huann-hí ê lâng lóng tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú!
English: Praise Yahweh, all you armies of his, You servants of his, who do his pleasure.

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t-ê Lēbī lâng kiâⁿ kàu hit só͘-tsāi, khuàⁿ-liáu mā kāng-khuán tuì lō͘ ê hit pîng kuè-.khì.
English: In the same way a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.

Tailo: I ê tiūⁿ-lâng, to̍h-sī tsa-bó͘ gín-á ê lāu-pē kā i lâu lo̍h-.lâi, i tsiū kah tiūⁿ-lâng tuà saⁿ ji̍t, in tsiū tsò-hué lim-tsia̍h, tī hia tuà.
English: His father-in-law, the young lady's father, retained him; and he abode with him three days: so they ate and drink, and lodged there.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Io-si-iah ê kiáⁿ — E-hō͘-iá-kim tē-sì nî, ū uē tuì Siōngtsú lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: It happened in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, that this word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

Tailo: Tio̍h tī tsi̍t king tshù lāi tsia̍h, tsi̍t tè bah mā m̄-thang tuà tshut-khì tshù guā, i ê kut tsi̍t ki mā m̄-thang phah-tn̄g.
English: In one house shall it be eaten; you shall not carry forth anything of the flesh abroad out of the house; neither shall you break a bone of it.

Tailo: Ehulaim kóng： Guá si̍t-tsāi tsin hó-gia̍h, í-king tit-tio̍h tsâi-pó; tī guá só͘ lô-khó͘ tit-tio̍h ê, bô thang tshuē-tio̍h guá ū put-gī, lâi sǹg-tsò ū tsuē.
English: Ephraim said, Surely I have become rich, I have found myself wealth. In all my wealth they won't find in me any iniquity that is sin.

Tailo: Gī lâng ín-tshuā i ê tshù-piⁿ kiânn tsiàⁿ lō͘; pháiⁿ lâng ê lō͘ hō͘ lâng sit-bê.
English: A righteous person is cautious in friendship, But the way of the wicked leads them astray.

Tailo: In ê sò͘-tsè, īng tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng hiàn tsa̍p-hūn tsi saⁿ e-huat, uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-káng hiàn gō͘-hūn tsi-it e-huat.
English: and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil, three tenth parts for each bull, two tenth parts for the one ram,

Tailo: Guān hiah-ê tsò guá sèⁿ-miā tuì-ti̍k ê lâng tú-tio̍h kiàn-siàu lâi bia̍t-bông; guān hiah-ê kè-bô͘ beh hāi guá ê lâng siū lîng-jio̍k làu-khuì.
English: Let my accusers be disappointed and consumed. Let them be covered with disgrace and scorn who want to harm me.

Tailo: Iésu m̄-tsún, kā i kóng, Tńg-khì lí ê tshù tshuē lí ê tshin-lâng, kā Tsú liân-bín lí, tuì lí só͘ tsò hiah tuā ê tāi-tsì lóng pò in tsai.
English: He didn't allow him, but said to him, Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.

Tailo: In tsiū tī hia uī-tio̍h Iésu tsún-pī àm-tǹg. Mal-tha teh sū-hāu, La̍h-tsa-lō͘ kah Iésu tsē kâng toh.
English: So they made him a supper there. Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with him.

Tailo: Guá ê thòng-khó͘ ná ē kú-tn̂g bô suah? Guá ê siong ná ē bē i-.tit, i bē hó? Lí khuán-thāi guá kám ē tshin-tshiūⁿ khi-phiàn ê khe, khò bē tsū ê tsuí?
English: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuses to be healed? will you indeed be to me as a deceitful brook, as waters that fail?

Tailo: Tsit-ê ua̍h-miā í-king tshut-hiān, guán ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsit-má lâi tsò kiàn-tsìng, beh pò lín tsai hit-ê íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā; I pún-lâi to̍h kah Thiⁿ-pē tông-tsāi, taⁿ tuì guán hián-hiān.
English: ( and the life was revealed, and we have seen, and testify, and declare to you the life, the eternal life, which was with the Father, and was revealed to us ) ;

Tailo: Tē-jī ji̍t, Isulael lâng tsiū tsìn-tsîng khì kong-kik Biāniámín lâng.
English: The children of Israel came near against the children of Benjamin the second day.

Tailo: Lo̍k-tô lim liáu-āu, hit-ê lâng tsiū the̍h tsi̍t-ê kim-khuân, tāng puàⁿ si-khel, nn̄g-ê kim tshiú-khuân, tāng tsa̍p si-khel hō͘ hit-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á.
English: It happened, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold,

Tailo: Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun tiong, hiàn siā-un-tsè ê hueh kah iû ê, tio̍h tit-tio̍h tsit-ê tsiànn-thuí tsò in ê hūn-gia̍h.
English: He among the sons of Aaron who offers the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right thigh for a portion.

Tailo: Kám m̄-sī huān-lān lîm-kàu put-gī ê lâng, tsai-hāi lîm-kàu tsok-gia̍t ê lâng?
English: Is it not calamity to the unrighteous, And disaster to the workers of iniquity?

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm tuà tī Êlúsalèm, tī Iôtah tē khí kuí-nā-ê siâⁿ tsò siâⁿ-pó.
English: Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem, and built cities for defense in Judah.

Tailo: La̍hban thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, kah i ê guā-sun í-ki̍p i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsim-tshuì, kā in tsiok-hok, tsiū tshut-huat tńg-khì ka-kī ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Early in the morning, Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them. Laban departed and returned to his place.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú ē pó-hō͘ in; in ē thun-bia̍t tuì-ti̍k, thún-ta̍h só͘ hiat lâi ê tsio̍h-thâu. In ē lim lâi huah, tshin-tshiūnn teh lim tsiú; in ē tshin-tshiūⁿ té-muá ê uánn, tshin-tshiūnn tuâⁿ tíng hiah-ê kak.
English: Yahweh of Armies will defend them; And they will destroy and overcome with sling stones; And they will drink, and roar as through wine; And they will be filled like bowls, Like the corners of the altar.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ siàn-tōng kûn-tsiòng, tian-tò iau-kiû Pí-la̍h-to pàng Bala̍h-ba hō͘ in.
English: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should release Barabbas to them instead.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū khiú i ê saⁿ, kóng, Lí lâi kah guá khùn. Iôséhuh kā saⁿ pàng tī i ê tshiú, tsáu tshut-khì guā-bīn.
English: She caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me! He left his garment in her hand, and ran outside.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā guá kóng, ' Lí tio̍h kā in kóng: M̄-thang khì, mā m̄-thang kau-tsiàn, in-uī Guá bô tī lín tiong-kan, khióng-kiaⁿ lín ē thâi-su tuì-ti̍k. '
English: Yahweh said to me, Tell them, Don't go up, neither fight; for I am not among you; lest you be struck before your enemies.

Tailo: Mô͘se sì-tsa̍p huè ê sî, siūⁿ beh khì khuànn ka-kī ê hiann-tī — Isulael ê tông-pau.
English: But when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers , the children of Israel.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tiong-kan tsin tsē lâng sìn I, kóng, Ki-tok lâi ê sî, kám ē pí tsit-ê lâng kiânn khah tsē sîn-jiah?
English: But of the multitude, many believed in him. They said, When the Christ comes, he won't do more signs than those which this man has done, will he?

Tailo: Guá án-ne kóng, sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lín bián siū hua-giân khá-gí ê bê-hi̍k.
English: Now this I say that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech.

Tailo: Tī Siōngtsú só͘ beh kíng-suán ê só͘-tsāi, lí tio̍h siú Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê tseh tshit kang, in-uī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tī lí it-tshè ê bu̍t-sán kah lí ê tshiú it-tshè só͘ tsò ê, ē kā lí sù-hok, lí tsiū ē tuā huann-hí.
English: Seven days shall you keep a feast to Yahweh your God in the place which Yahweh shall choose; because Yahweh your God will bless you in all your increase, and in all the work of your hands, and you shall be altogether joyful.

Tailo: Tsú kóng, Tī Si-óng — Guá ê sìng-suaⁿ, Guá í-king siat-li̍p Guá ê ông.
English: Yet I have set my king on my holy hill of Zion.

Tailo: Tsú ē hō͘ lín tī huān-lān tiong ū piáⁿ, tī kan-khó͘ tiong ū tsuí, lín ê lāu-su bô koh siám-bih; lí ē tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí ê lāu-su.
English: Though the Lord may give you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, yet your teachers won't be hidden anymore, but your eyes will see your teachers;

Tailo: Tsè-si Alông ê kiáⁿ Êlīatsal só͘ tio̍h kò͘-siú ê, sī tiám ting ê iû kah phang-liāu, í-ki̍p tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sò͘-tsè kah buah ê iû, mā tio̍h kò͘-siú tsuân huē-bō͘ kah hit tiong-kan só͘-ū ê, í-ki̍p sìng-só͘ kah sìng-só͘ só͘-ū ê khì-kū.
English: The charge of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall be the oil for the light, the sweet incense, the continual meal offering, and the anointing oil, the charge of all the tabernacle, and of all that is in it, the sanctuary, and its furnishings.

Tailo: Ông khì Gi-bóng hiàn tsè, in-uī tī hia ū ki̍k tuā ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, Só͘lômóng tī tuâⁿ tíng hiàn sio-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ tsi̍t-tshing tsiah.
English: The king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place: a thousand burnt offerings did Solomon offer on that altar.

Tailo: Lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ ji̍p-khì huē-bō͘ ê sî, po̍h tsiú, kāu tsiú lóng m̄-thang lim, bián-tit lín ē sí-bông, tse beh tsò lín ta̍k sè-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: Drink no wine nor strong drink, you, nor your sons with you, when you go into the Tent of Meeting, that you don't die: it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations:

Tailo: Lí ū khó-giām guá ê sim, Lí tī àm-sî kàm-tshat guá; Lí tuàn-liān guá, bô tshuē-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ; guá li̍p-tsì bô beh hō͘ guá ê tshuì ū kuè-sit.
English: You have proved my heart; you have visited me in the night; You have tried me, and found nothing; I have resolved that my mouth shall not disobey.

Tailo: Lín í-king tuì sūn-ho̍k tsin-lí lâi kiat-tsīng ka-kī, koh kah kî-tha ê sìn-tô͘ ū sûn tsin ê tshiú-tsiok-tsi-tsîng, lín tio̍h tuì sim-té jia̍t-tshiat sio-thiànn.
English: Seeing you have purified your souls in your obedience to the truth through the Spirit in sincere brotherly affection, love one another from the heart fervently:

Tailo: I tsiū lo̍h-khì kàu tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ, lóng tsiàu i ê ta-ke só͘ huan-hù ê khì tsò.
English: She went down to the threshing floor, and did according to all that her mother-in-law told her.

Tailo: Kàu sì-pah saⁿ tsa̍p nî muá, tú-tú hit ji̍t, Siōngtsú ê kun-tuī lóng tuì Aigi̍p tē tshut-.lâi.
English: It happened at the end of four hundred thirty years, even the same day it happened, that all the armies of Yahweh went out from the land of Egypt.

Tailo: guān Lí tuì thiⁿ-.ni̍h, Lí só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi lâi thiaⁿ, lâi kā i sià-bián. Lí tsai in ê sim, tsiàu in ta̍k lâng ê hîng-uî lâi khuán-thāi in, ( in-uī sè-kan lâng ê sim, tsí ū Lí tsai niā-niā ) ,
English: then hear from heaven, your dwelling place and forgive, and render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart you know; ( for you, even you only, know the hearts of the children of men; )

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Asiul bat tsò Le-ba-nòng ê pik-hiuⁿ tshiū, ki-ue tsin suí, ìm-ńg tshin-tshiūnn tshiū-nâ, tshiū-sin kuân-tuā, ki bué tshun ji̍p-khì tī hûn tiong.
English: Behold, the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with beautiful branches, and with a forest-like shade, and of high stature; and its top was among the thick boughs.

Tailo: Kàu hit ji̍t, lín bē koh mn̄g guá siáⁿ-mi̍h. Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, lín hōng guá ê miâ tuì Thiⁿ-pē só͘ kiû ê, I lóng ē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín.
English: In that day you will ask me no questions. Most assuredly I tell you, whatever you may ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.

Tailo: Guá tsá-tsîng hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ-tio̍h Lí, taⁿ guá ê ba̍k-tsiu khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí;
English: I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear, But now my eye sees you.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsiū nga̍uh-nga̍uh-liām, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng suah ji̍p-khì tsuē-jîn ê tshù tuà!
English: When they saw it, they all murmured, saying, He has gone in to lodge with a man who is a sinner.

Tailo: Tsik-pī pháiⁿ lâng ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h huann-hí, hó uē ê tsiok-hok mā ē lîm-kàu i.
English: But it will go well with those who convict the guilty, And a rich blessing will come on them.

Tailo: Sian-ti I-é-lí-miah kóng, A-men! Guān Siōngtsú án-ne kiânn, guān Siōngtsú tsiânn lí só͘ ī-giân tsiah-ê uē, hō͘ Siōngtsú tshù lāi ê khì-kū kah só͘-ū siū lia̍h-.khì ê lâng, tuì Babúlông tńg-lâi tsit só͘-tsāi.
English: even the prophet Jeremiah said, Amen: Yahweh do so; Yahweh perform your words which you have prophesied, to bring again the vessels of Yahweh's house, and all them of the captivity, from Babylon to this place.

Tailo: Esáu kóng, Sió-tī, guá ê í-king kàu-gia̍h, lí ê iû-guân kui lí.
English: Esau said, I have enough, my brother; let that which you have be yours.

Tailo: ( Khóla̍h kiáⁿ-sun ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; tiāu sī īng lú-im. ) Siōngtè sī guán tô-siám ê só͘-tsāi kah khuì-la̍t, mā sī huān-lān tiong ki̍p-sî ê pang-tsān.
English: God is our refuge and strength, A very present help in trouble.

Tailo: Lia̍t-pang hām-lo̍h tī in ka-kī só͘ khui ê hām-kheⁿ; in ê kha tîⁿ tī in thau-thau-á siat ê lô-bāng.
English: The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made; In the net which they hid, their own foot is taken.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Guá ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Satán tshin-tshiūnn sih-nà tuì thiⁿ lak lo̍h-.lâi.
English: He said to them, I saw Satan having fallen like lightning from heaven.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsit-kháu tséⁿ ê miâ kiò-tsò Be-el-la-hai-loi, to̍h-sī tī Ka-té-si kah Bel-lia̍t ê tiong-kan.
English: Therefore the well was called Beer Lahai Roi. Behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.

Tailo: In-uī tshiū-nâ lāi ê pah-siù kah tsìng suaⁿ ê tsing-seⁿ lóng sī guá ê.
English: For every animal of the forest is mine, And the livestock on a thousand hills.

Tailo: Lán tsiàu jio̍k-thé ê pún-sìng teh ua̍h ê sî, lu̍t-huat kik-khí lán huān tsuē ê io̍k-liām, tī lán sing-khu pah-thé teh ūn-tsok, kiat-kó sī kiat sí-bông ê kué-tsí.
English: For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions which were through the law, worked in our members to bring forth fruit to death.

Tailo: In kiânn khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, kám tsai kiàn-siàu? Bô, in lóng bô kiàn-siàu, bīn mā bē âng. In-uī án-ne, in ē tī pua̍h-tó ê lâng ê tiong-kan pua̍h-tó; Guá pān in ê sî, in ē tian-tian tó-tó. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among those who fall; at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Hāi ah! Lí m̄-bat thiaⁿ Guá ê bīng-līng! Nā thiaⁿ, lí ê pîng-an tsiū ē tshin-tshiūⁿ hô tsuí, lí ê kong-gī ē tshin-tshiūⁿ hái-íng.
English: Oh that you had listened to my commandments! then had your peace been as a river, and your righteousness as the waves of the sea:

Tailo: Mikaiah kóng, Só͘-í, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú ê uē. Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú tsē tī pó-tsō, thinn-tíng ê bān-kun khiā tī I ê tsó-iū.
English: Micaiah said, Therefore hear you the word of Yahweh: I saw Yahweh sitting on his throne, and all the army of heaven standing on his right hand and on his left.
