Tailo: Hit-ê tshuā i tuì lō͘ tńg-.lâi ê lāu sian-ti thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū kóng, Tse sī hit-ê Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, i uî-puē Siōngtsú ê uē ê, só͘-í, Siōngtsú kā i kau hō͘ sai, sai kā i peh-thiah, kā i kā-sí; sī tsiàu Siōngtsú tuì i kóng ê uē.
English: When the prophet who brought him back from the way heard of it, he said, It is the man of God, who was disobedient to the mouth of Yahweh: therefore Yahweh has delivered him to the lion, which has torn him, and slain him, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke to him.

Tailo: Tè-ông tuì guá lâi tsē uī; kun-ông tuì guá tiāⁿ-tio̍h kong-pêⁿ ê lu̍t-huat.
English: By me kings reign, And princes decree justice.

Tailo: Tī hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí, ū sin-īn kah hō͘ enn-á tsia̍h ling ê hū-jîn-lâng tsin put-hīng, in-uī ū tuā tsai-lān teh beh lîm-kàu tsit-ê só͘-tsāi. Siōngtè ê tuā siū-khì mā teh beh lîm-kàu tsiah-ê jîn-bîn.
English: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.

Tailo: Iâkop, Guá só͘ tiàu ê Isulael, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ Guá! Guá sī Siōngtsú, Guá sī khí-thâu ê, mā sī lō͘-bué ê.
English: Listen to me, O Jacob, and Israel my called: I am he; I am the first, I also am the last.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ē hō͘ ka-kī ê tsuē-kò khîⁿ-tiâu; i ē hō͘ i tsuē-ok ê soh-á pa̍k-.leh.
English: The evil deeds of the wicked ensnare him. The cords of his sin hold him firmly.

Tailo: Hûn nā ū hō͘ muá-muá, tsiū piàⁿ lo̍h-lâi tē-tsiūⁿ. Tshiū nā ǹg lâm á-.sī ǹg pak tó, tshiū tó tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi, tsiū tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī hia.
English: If the clouds are full of rain, they empty themselves on the earth; And if a tree falls toward the south, or toward the north, In the place where the tree falls, there shall it be.

Tailo: Tsit-ê Hesibóng sī Amô͘lī ông Sihông ê siâⁿ, i bat kah Mô͘ap tsîng ê ông kau-tsiàn, tuì i ê tshiú tshiúⁿ tsuân tē, it-ti̍t kàu Al-nông.
English: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand, even to the Arnon.

Tailo: Kuè saⁿ ji̍t, kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ piàn kiâⁿ iâⁿ tiong,
English: It happened after three days, that the officers went through the midst of the camp;

Tailo: Isulael ê kiáⁿ-sun, lín só͘ tshim-tshim puē-gi̍k ê, taⁿ tio̍h kui-ǹg I.
English: Return to him from whom you have deeply revolted, children of Israel.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Páulô tuā-siaⁿ huah, M̄-thang siong-hāi ka-kī, guán lóng tī tsia.
English: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Don't harm yourself, for we are all here!

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, I beh thâi-sí guá, guá bô thang ǹg-bāng, tsóng-.sī, guá beh tī I ê bīn-tsîng piáu-bîng guá ê só͘ tsò.
English: Behold, he will kill me; I have no hope. Nevertheless, I will maintain my ways before him.

Tailo: I kā hái tsuí tsū-tsi̍p kui tui, kā tshim-ian siu-tsông tī khò͘-pâng.
English: He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap. He lays up the deeps in storehouses.

Tailo: Guá — Taniel, guá ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê ī-siōng, ài beh bîng-pi̍k hit-ê ì-sù. Hit sî, hut-jiân ū tsi̍t uī tshin-tshiūnn lâng ê khuán-sit ê khiā tī guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: It happened, when I, even I Daniel, had seen the vision, that I sought to understand it; and behold, there stood before me as the appearance of a man.

Tailo: In-uī guá khak-sìn, bô-lūn sī sí, á-.sī ua̍h; sī thiⁿ-sài, á-.sī thinn-tíng tsiáng-kuân-.ê; sī hiān-kim ê, á-.sī tsiong-lâi ê, á-.sī ū kuân-lîng ê;
English: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,

Tailo: Guá bīng-līng Lēbī lâng tshing-khì ka-kī lâi kò͘-siú siâⁿ mn̂g, hō͘ An-hioh-ji̍t tsiânn-tsò sìng. Guá ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí in-uī tsit-ê tāi-tsì lâi kì-liām guá, tsiàu Lí ê tuā tsû-pi lâi thiàⁿ-sioh guá.
English: I commanded the Levites that they should purify themselves, and that they should come and keep the gates, to sanctify the Sabbath day. Remember to me, my God, this also, and spare me according to the greatness of your loving kindness.

Tailo: Puàⁿ-mê ū lâng tuā-siaⁿ huah, ' Sin-lông lâi lò͘! Kín tshut-lâi gîng-tsiap. '
English: But at midnight there was a cry, Behold! The bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!'

Tailo: Tē-jī nî ê jī-gue̍h jī-tsa̍p, hûn tuì tsìng-kì ê huē-bō͘ siu tńg-.khì.
English: It happened in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth day of the month, that the cloud was taken up from over the tent of the testimony.

Tailo: Tuā siaⁿ huah, Tsì-kuân Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ Iésu, Lí hô-pit lâi kan-sia̍p guá? Guá kí Siōngtè ê miâ lâi khún-kiû Lí, m̄-thang kā guá tsik-hua̍t.
English: and crying out with a loud voice, he said, What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don't torment me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū tuì guá kóng, ' In só͘ kóng ê sī hó,
English: Yahweh said to me, They have well said that which they have spoken.

Tailo: I thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tsiù-tsó͘ ê uē, sim-lāi iû-guân ka-kī an-uì, kóng, ' Guá suî-jiân tsò tāi-tsì sim ngē, kā ta ê kah tâm ê lóng huí-bia̍t, guá iáu-koh ē pîng-an. '
English: and it happen, when he hears the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart, to destroy the moist with the dry.

Tailo: Kàu bān-mi̍h khut-ho̍k tī Ki-tok ê sî, Kiáⁿ mā ē khut-ho̍k tī hō͘ bān-mi̍h lóng khut-ho̍k ê Siōngtè, thang hō͘ Siōngtè uân-tsuân kuán-hat bān-mi̍h.
English: When all things have been subjected to him, then the Son will also himself be subjected to him who subjected all things to him, that God may be all in all.

Tailo: Abúlâm thiaⁿ-tio̍h i ê ti̍t-á hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì, tsiū tshuā seⁿ-thuàⁿ tī i ê ke-.ni̍h tsing-liān ê tsòng-ting saⁿ-pah tsa̍p-peh lâng, jiok kàu Tàn.
English: When Abram heard that his relative was taken captive, he led forth his trained men, born in his house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan.

Tailo: Kāu-uē ê lâng bē-bián ū kuè-sit; iok-sok tshuì-tsi̍h ê lâng sī ū tì-huī.
English: In the multitude of words there is no lack of disobedience, But he who restrains his lips does wisely.

Tailo: Siâⁿ ê su-kì-kuaⁿ hō͘ kûn-tsiòng an-tsīng liáu-āu, tsiū kóng, Ê-hu-soh lâng, siáⁿ lâng m̄-tsai Ê-hu-soh lâng ê siâⁿ sī tuā A-té-mih ê biō kah tuì thinn-tíng lak lo̍h-lâi hit tè sìng-tsio̍h ê siú-hō͘-tsiá?
English: When the town clerk had quieted the multitude, he said, You men of Ephesus, what man is there who doesn't know that the city of the Ephesians is temple keeper of the great goddess Artemis, and of the image which fell down from Zeus?

Tailo: Lāu-su ah, Mô͘se kóng, ' Ū lâng bô senn kiáⁿ to̍h sí-.khì, i ê sió-tī tio̍h tshuā hiaⁿ-só lâi tsò bó͘, thang seⁿ kiáⁿ lâi uī i ê a-hiaⁿ thuân-tsong tsiap-tāi. ( tsù, SBK 25:5 )
English: saying, Teacher, Moses said, If a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed for his brother.'

Tailo: Tng Abiiah ua̍h-.leh ê ji̍t, Ia-lô-ba-am bē-tàng koh kiông-sīng; Siōngtsú kā i phah, i tsiū sí.
English: Neither did Jeroboam recover strength again in the days of Abijah: and Yahweh struck him, and he died.

Tailo: tsiū kā hit-ê gîn kau hō͘ tsò-kang ê lâng, lâi siu-lí Siōngtsú ê tiān.
English: for they gave that to those who did the work, and repaired therewith the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: mā hō͘ in m̄ tsai-iáⁿ ê kiáⁿ-jî ē-tàng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tī lín kuè Ioltàn hô só͘ sîng-tsiap ê tē, tsiàu lín tuà tī hia it-tshè ê ji̍t, thang ha̍k-si̍p kìng-uì Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè.
English: and that their children, who have not known, may hear, and learn to fear Yahweh your God, as long as you live in the land where you go over the Jordan to possess it.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lín khì kā hit tsiah hô͘-lî kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, kin-á-ji̍t, bîn-á-tsài, guá kuáⁿ kuí, i-pēⁿ, kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t uân-sîng guá ê kang-tsok. '
English: He said to them, Go and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission.

Tailo: In-uī guá ē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín kháu-tsâi kah tì-huī, hō͘ lín ê tuì-ti̍k lóng bē-tàng tuì-khòng kah piān-pok.
English: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-sái tshin-tshiūnn khe tsuí teh lâu, in-uī lâng bô tsun-siú Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: Streams of tears run down my eyes, Because they don't observe your law. TZADI

Tailo: Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng it-tshè ê uē, Iosiúah tī Isulael ê tsuân huē-tsiòng kah tsa-bó͘ lâng, gín-á, í-ki̍p in tiong-kan óng-lâi ê tshut-guā lâng ê bīn-tsîng, bô kah tsi̍t kù bô tha̍k.
English: There was not a word of all that Moses commanded, which Joshua didn't read before all the assembly of Israel, and the women, and the little ones, and the foreigners who were among them.

Tailo: In-uī tsi̍t-ê lâng ê puē-gi̍k, tsìng lâng lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò tsuē-jîn; kāng-khuán, in-uī tsi̍t-ê lâng sūn-ho̍k, tsìng lâng lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò gī lâng.
English: For as through the one man's disobedience many were made sinners, even so through the obedience of the one will many be made righteous.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, án-ne, lín kì-jiân tāi-sing tsai tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h kíng-kài, tsiah bián-tit hō͘ hiah-ê pháiⁿ lâng īng tshò-gō͘ ê giân-lūn tshuā lín kiâⁿ-ji̍p-khì bê-lō͘, lâi sit-lo̍h lín kian-kò͘ ê sìn-gióng.
English: You therefore, beloved, knowing these things beforehand, beware lest, being carried away with the error of the wicked, you fall from your own steadfastness.

Tailo: La̍k ji̍t lāi tio̍h ing-kai lô-khó͘, tsò lí só͘-ū ê kang;
English: You shall labor six days, and do all your work,

Tailo: Tú-hó ū tsi̍t-ê tsè-si tuì hit tiâu lō͘ lo̍h-.khì, khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê lâng tsiū siám tuì lō͘ ê hit pîng kuè-.khì.
English: By chance a certain priest was going down that way. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

Tailo: Hit sî, Isulael tsiânn-tsò sìng kui Siōngtsú, tsò I khí-thâu si̍k ê lông-sán-bu̍t; kiàn-nā thun-tsia̍h i ê, ē sǹg-tsò ū tsuē, tsai-hō ē lîm-kàu in. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Israel was holiness to Yahweh, the first fruits of his increase: all who devour him shall be held guilty; evil shall come on them, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Tse m̄-sī kóng guán ka-kī ū tsâi-tiāu tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì; guán ê tsâi-tiāu sī tuì Siōngtè lâi ê.
English: not that we are sufficient of ourselves, to account anything as from ourselves; but our sufficiency is from God;

Tailo: Mô͘ap beh tsò guá ê i̍k-phûn; guá beh hiat guá ê ê tī Etóm lâi ióng-iú; guá beh in-uī khah iâⁿ Huilīsū lâi tuā-siaⁿ huah.
English: Moab is my wash pot. I will toss my sandal on Edom. I will shout over Philistia.

Tailo: Ông tsiū tshe lâng khì tiàu A-hi-top ê kiáⁿ, tsè-si Ahiméli̍k kah i lāu-pē tsuân ke, to̍h-sī tuà tī Νo͘p hiah-ê tsè-si, in tsiū lóng lâi ông hia.
English: Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father's house, the priests who were in Nob: and they came all of them to the king.

Tailo: Αpsalôm siat-li̍p Amasa tsò kun-tiúⁿ lâi tāi-thè Ioap. Amasa sī Isulael lâng, Etella̍h ê kiáⁿ. Etella̍h bat kah Nahasi ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Abigail tâng-pâng; tsit-ê Abigail kah Ioap ê lāu-bú Tse-lú-iah sī tsí-muē.
English: Absalom set Amasa over the army instead of Joab. Now Amasa was the son of a man, whose name was Ithra the Israelite, who went in to Abigail the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah, Joab's mother.

Tailo: Guá tshin-bi̍t ê pîng-iú lóng thó-ià guá; guá pîng-siông sî só͘ thiàⁿ ê lâng tuì guá pìⁿ-bīn.
English: All my familiar friends abhor me. They whom I loved have turned against me.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kì-jiân tshing Ki-tok tsò Tsú, Ki-tok ná ē tsò Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun?
English: David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?

Tailo: Mô͘se tuì Mô͘ap pîng-guân tsiūⁿ Nebó suaⁿ, tsiūⁿ hit-ê kah I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ sio-tuì ê Pi-su-gah suaⁿ-thâu. Siōngtsú hō͘ i khuànn Gilia̍t tsuân tē-it-ti̍t kàu Tàn,
English: Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, that is over against Jericho. Yahweh showed him all the land of Gilead, to Dan,

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, Ài-beh khua-kháu ê lâng, tio̍h īng Tsú lâi tsò khua-kháu. ( tsù, ILM 9:24 )
English: that, according as it is written, He who boasts, let him boast in the Lord.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, lâi kong-kik Êlúsalèm ê lia̍t kok, Guá tiāⁿ-tio̍h ì-sù beh kā in bia̍t-tiāu.
English: It will happen in that day, that I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.

Tailo: I jīn-tshut sī Piattò͘ ê siann, huann-hí kah bē kò͘-tit khui mn̂g, tsáu ji̍p-khì pò-kò kóng, Piattò͘ khiā tī mn̂g-kha-kháu.
English: When she recognized Peter's voice, she didn't open the gate for joy, but ran in, and reported that Peter was standing in front of the gate.

Tailo: lí tio̍h īng tsǹg-á tuì mn̂g-.ni̍h kǹg i ê hīnn-á, i tsiū íng-uán tsò lí ê lô͘-po̍k. Lí khuán-thāi lí ê lú-pī mā sī án-ne.
English: then you shall take an awl, and thrust it through his ear to the door, and he shall be your servant forever. Also to your female servant you shall do likewise.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came again to me, saying,

Tailo: Tuì tiong-tàu khí saⁿ tiám-tsing, tsuân tē lóng o͘-àm.
English: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

Tailo: Guá beh kā Guá ê thòng-hūn piàⁿ tī lí ê sin tsiūⁿ, kā Guá tuā siū-khì ê hué pûn tī lí; kā lí kau tī tsân-jím koh gâu thâi lâng-.ê ê tshiú.
English: I will pour out my indignation on you; I will blow on you with the fire of my wrath; and I will deliver you into the hand of brutish men, skillful to destroy.

Tailo: In koh īng gîn hō͘ tsio̍h-tshiūⁿ, ba̍k-tshiūⁿ, īng lim-tsia̍h ê mi̍h kah iû hō͘ Sitòng lâng, Tulô lâng, hō͘ in kā pik-hiuⁿ tshiū tuì Le-ba-nòng ūn kàu hái lâi-kàu Io̍p-pe, sī tsiàu Phelsiah ông Ko-le-si só͘ ín-tsún ê.
English: They gave money also to the masons, and to the carpenters; and food, and drink, and oil, to them of Sidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea, to Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.

Tailo: Tī hit ji̍t, in kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tshiū-nâ lāi kah suaⁿ tíng bué-liu só͘ khì-sak ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī in tī Isulael lâng ê bīn-tsîng só͘ khì-sak ê; tē tsiū án-ne pha-hng.
English: In that day, their strong cities will be like the forsaken places in the woods and on the mountain top, which were forsaken from before the children of Israel; and it will be a desolation.

Tailo: Īng Aigi̍p siù-hue ê iù-tē pò͘ tsò lí ê phâng, tsò lí ê kî; īng Elísiah tó-sū nâ-sik, tsí-sik ê pò͘ tsò lí ê liâng-pêⁿ.
English: Of fine linen with embroidered work from Egypt was your sail, that it might be to you for a banner; blue and purple from the islands of Elishah was your awning.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tuì Isulael ê tsú-bîn kóng, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Isulael ê tsú-bîn, Guá kiânn tsit-ê m̄-sī uī-tio̍h lín ê iân-kò͘, to̍h-sī uī-tio̍h Guá ê sìng-miâ ê iân-kò͘, to̍h-sī lín tī kiâⁿ kàu ê lia̍t kok tiong só͘ siat-to̍k ê.
English: Therefore tell the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: I don't do this for your sake, house of Israel, but for my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations, where you went.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Siōngtsú tsiū kàng un-i̍k tī Isulael, Isulael lâng sí ê ū tshit bān.
English: So Yahweh sent a pestilence on Israel; and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.

Tailo: Kiû lí m̄-thang thiaⁿ in ê uē, in-uī in ū sì-tsa̍p guā lâng bâi-ho̍k teh tán i. In bat tsiù-tsuā kóng, nā bô thâi-sí Páulô, m̄-lim m̄-tsia̍h. Taⁿ in lóng tsún-pī hó-sè, teh thìng-hāu lí ê ín-tsún.
English: Therefore don't yield to them, for more than forty men lie in wait for him, who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have killed him. Now they are ready, looking for the promise from you.

Tailo: Kî-tha ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h lóng ē kiaⁿ, tī lín tiong-kan tsiū bô koh kiânn tsit khuán pháiⁿ.
English: Those who remain shall hear, and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more any such evil in the midst of you.

Tailo: Tshia-lián kah in ê tsò-huat ê khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn n̂g-gi̍k ê sik-tì; sì-ê lián ê hîng-siōng siâng tsi̍t-khuán, in ê khuán-sit kah tsò-huat sī tshin-tshiūnn lián tiong ū lián.
English: The appearance of the wheels and their work was like a beryl: and they four had one likeness; and their appearance and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel.

Tailo: Siōngtsú sī I ê tsú-bîn ê khuì-la̍t, mā sī I siū buah iû ê ông tit-kiù ê siâⁿ-pó.
English: Yahweh is their strength. He is a stronghold of salvation to his anointed.

Tailo: Guá tsiū kàu Thel-a-bí-buh, tiàm tī Ke-bal hô piⁿ siū lia̍h ê lâng hit uī, kàu in só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi; tī in tiong-kan tsē tshit kang, tī hia tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì.
English: Then I came to them of the captivity at Tel Aviv, that lived by the river Chebar, and to where they lived; and I sat there overwhelmed among them seven days.

Tailo: Bô sí ê lâng lóng tio̍h liàp-á tsìng, siâⁿ tiong thî-khàu ê siann thàu kàu thiⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: The men who didn't die were struck with the tumors; and the cry of the city went up to heaven.

Tailo: Só͘-í, i ing-kai uī-tio̍h pún-sin, tshin-tshiūnn i uī-tio̍h jîn-bîn ê tsuē lâi hiàn tsè.
English: Because of this, he must offer sacrifices for sins for the people, as well as for himself.

Tailo: Tng Jîn-tsú tshuā I ê tsìng thiⁿ-sài tsài-lîm ê sî, I ē tsē tī îng-iāu ê pó-tsō,
English: But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng i ê khì tsò; i tshuā Iosiúah lâi, hō͘ i khiā tī tsè-si Êlīatsal kah tsuân huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng,
English: Moses did as Yahweh commanded him; and he took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation:

Tailo: Guán tshim-huān Ke-le-thih ê lâm pîng, kah sio̍k Iôtah ê tē, kah Ka-le̍p tē ê lâm pîng, koh īng hué sio Tsik-lak.
English: We made a raid on the South of the Cherethites, and on that which belongs to Judah, and on the South of Caleb; and we burned Ziklag with fire.

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng uî uá-lâi kā I kóng, Lí beh hō͘ guán ê sim giâu-gî kàu tang-sî? Lí nā-sī Ki-tok, tio̍h tsiàu-si̍t kā guán kóng.
English: The Jews therefore came around him and said to him, How long will you hold us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Khì! Lí lo̍h-.khì, in-uī lí ê jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī tuì Aigi̍p tē tshuā tshut-.lâi ê, í-king pāi-huāi ka-kī.
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, Go, get down; for your people, who you brought up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves!

Tailo: Êlúsalèm lâng, lín tio̍h siū kà-sī. Bián-tit Guá ê sim kah lí so͘-uán, bián-tit Guá hō͘ lí pha-hng, tsiâⁿ-tsò bô lâng tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Be instructed, Jerusalem, lest my soul be alienated from you; lest I make you a desolation, a land not inhabited.

Tailo: Ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì tio̍h tsiàu tia̍t-sū, kui-kui kú-kú lâi tsò.
English: Let all things be done decently and in order.

Tailo: Lí kong-gī ê phuàⁿ-tuàn, guá bat tsiù-tsuā beh tsun-siú, guá it-tīng beh án-ne kiânn.
English: I have sworn, and have confirmed it, That I will obey your righteous ordinances.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī ta̍k gue̍h tshe-it ê sio-tsè kah i ê sò͘-tsè, í-ki̍p tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè kah in ê sò͘-tsè, í-ki̍p i ê kuàn-tiān, kok tsiàu i ê lē í-guā, lóng tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: besides the burnt offering of the new moon, and the meal offering of it, and the continual burnt offering and the meal offering of it, and their drink offerings, according to their ordinance, for a sweet savor, an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

Tailo: He-lo̍t tsiū tiàu-tsi̍p só͘-ū ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah bîn-kan ê king-ha̍k kàu-su, mn̄g in kóng, Ki-tok ing-kai tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi tshut-sì?
English: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them where the Christ would be born.

Tailo: Lí tī in ê bīn-tsîng kā hái hun-khui, hō͘ in tuì hái tiong ná tshin-tshiūnn kiânn ta tē kuè-.khì, Lí kā jiok in ê lâng hiat tī tshim hái, ná tshin-tshiūnn hiat tsio̍h-thâu tī tuā-tsuí tiong;
English: You divided the sea before them, so that they went through the midst of the sea on the dry land; and their pursuers you did cast into the depths, as a stone into the mighty waters.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: In-uī lâng tuì lín kóng, ' Lí sī thun-tsia̍h lâng ê, koh hō͘ jîn-bîn tsua̍t-sû',
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: Because they say to you, You land are a devourer of men, and have been a bereaver of your nation;

Tailo: Ho̍k-sāi ū tsin tsē khuán, m̄-koh, sī ho̍k-sāi kāng tsi̍t-ê Tsú.
English: There are various kinds of service, and the same Lord.

Tailo: Pò hó siau-sit, thuân hô-pîng, pò hok-khì ê hó siau-sit, thuân kiù-un ê, i tuì Si-óng kóng: Lí ê Siōngtè tsò ông à! I ê kha tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tíng, i ê kha-jiah kàu tsiah suí!
English: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace, who brings good news of good, who publishes salvation, who says to Zion, Your God reigns!

Tailo: ' Siōngtsú ū siat-li̍p lí tsò tsè-si, lâi thè tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah, hō͘ lín kàm-tok Siōngtsú ê tiān, thang kā só͘-ū khong-khám ka-kī kiò-tsò sian-ti ê lâng, īng tshâ-kê kā i kê, īng só kā i só.
English: Yahweh has made you priest in the place of Jehoiada the priest, that there may be officers in the house of Yahweh, for every man who is mad, and makes himself a prophet, that you should put him in the stocks and in shackles.

Tailo: Siū tshe ê sù-tsiá kuè hái, tsē lô͘-uí ê tsûn tī tsuí-bīn, kóng, Lín tsiah-ê tsáu tsin kín ê sù-tsiá, tio̍h kàu kuân-tuā, phuê-hu kng-ku̍t ê jîn-bîn hia. Tuì khai-kok í-lâi, hiah-ê jîn-bîn hui-siông thang kiaⁿ, sī hun tē-kài kā lâng thún-ta̍h ê, in ê tē ū kang-hô hun-khui.
English: that sends ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of papyrus on the waters, saying, Go, you swift messengers, to a nation tall and smooth, to a people awesome from their beginning onward, a nation that measures out and treads down, whose land the rivers divide!

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tiong-kan ū lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē tsiū kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī hit-uī sian-ti.
English: Many of the multitude therefore, when they heard these words, said, This is truly the prophet.

Tailo: Tsáu bûn-su ê tsi̍t siâⁿ kuè tsi̍t siâⁿ, piàn kiâⁿ Ehulaim, Mánáse kàu Tse-bú-lông, m̄-koh, hiah-ê lâng kā in thí-tshiò, kā in khau-sé.
English: So the posts passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, even to Zebulun: but they ridiculed them, and mocked them.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē tī i ba̍k-tsiu kim-kim ê sî lia̍h-tio̍h i? Á-sī īng ua̍h-khàu kǹg i ê phīⁿ?
English: Shall any take him when he is on the watch, Or pierce through his nose with a snare?

Tailo: Guá sī Siōngtsú, tī Guá í-guā bô ū pa̍t-ê, tû Guá í-guā bô ū tsin-sîn. Lí suî-jiân m̄-bat Guá, Guá beh kā lí hâ io.
English: I am Yahweh, and there is none else; besides me there is no God. I will gird you, though you have not known me;

Tailo: Aigi̍p lâng tī hô ê siang pîng ku̍t tē, ài beh tit-tio̍h tsuí thang lim, in-uī hô ê tsuí in bē lim-.tit.
English: All the Egyptians dug round about the river for water to drink; for they couldn't drink of the water of the river.

Tailo: Pik-tshiat khún-kiû kóng, Guá sè-hàn ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ teh beh sí à. Kiû Lí lâi kā i huāⁿ-tshiú, hō͘ i tit-tio̍h i hó, ē-tàng koh-ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: and begged him much, saying, My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.

Tailo: Tuā-kiánn ìn kóng, ' Guá m̄-khì. ' Āu-lâi kái-piàn sim-ì, ū khì.
English: He answered, I will not,' but afterward he changed his mind, and went.

Tailo: Koh kā i tsò nn̄g-ê kim-khuân, an-tì tī khí-suàⁿ ê ē-bīn, tsò tī tuâⁿ ê siang pîng nn̄g ki huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ ê tíng-bīn, tsiah-ê khuân sī tsò tshng kǹg ê lō͘-īng, thang kng tuâⁿ.
English: He made two golden rings for it under its molding crown, on its two ribs, on its two sides, for places for poles with which to carry it.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá beh khiā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, tī Ho-lep ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng. Lí phah hit-ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ, tsiū ē ū tsuí tuì hia lâu tshut-lâi hō͘ jîn-bîn lim. Mô͘se tsiū tī Isulael tiúⁿ-ló ê bīn-tsîng án-ne tsò.
English: Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock in Horeb. You shall strike the rock, and water will come out of it, that the people may drink. Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k tio̍h hō͘ kong-pêⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tuā-tsuí ti̍t-ti̍t lâu, hō͘ kong-gī tshin-tshiūnn tn̂g-lâu ê kang-hô.
English: But let justice roll on like rivers, And righteousness like a mighty stream.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsheⁿ-mê lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu ē khui, tshàu-hīⁿ-lâng ê hīⁿ-khang ē lāi.
English: Then the eyes of the blind will be opened, And the ears of the deaf will be unstopped.

Tailo: Iôná tī hî ê pak-tó͘ lāi tuì i ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú kî-tó, kóng:
English: Then Jonah prayed to Yahweh, his God, out of the fish's belly.

Tailo: Tsìng sian-ti lóng án-ne ī-giân kóng, Thang tsiūⁿ-khì Gilia̍t ê La̍h-mot, ē tik-sìng, in-uī Siōngtsú ē kā i kau tī ông ê tshiú.
English: All the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth Gilead, and prosper; for Yahweh will deliver it into the hand of the king.

Tailo: I ê pâng, i ê thiāu, i ê mn̂g-lông, lóng tsiàu í-tsîng ê tshùn-tshioh; i ê lāi-bīn kah i ê mn̂g-lông sì-kho͘-uî lóng ū thang; tn̂g gō͘-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p gō͘ tiú.
English: and the lodges of it, and the posts of it, and the arches of it, according to these measures: and there were windows in it and in the arches of it round about; it was fifty cubits long, and twenty-five cubits broad.

Tailo: Siōngtè í-king siat-li̍p I ê lô͘-po̍k, sing tshe I lâi kā lín sù-hok, hō͘ lín ta̍k lâng ua̍t tńg-sin, lī-khui siâ-ok.
English: God, having raised up his servant, Jesus, sent him to you first, to bless you, in turning away everyone of you from your wickedness.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Iosiúah kóng, Khí-.lâi! Lí ná ē án-ne phak tī tē-.ni̍h?
English: Yahweh said to Joshua, Get you up; why are you thus fallen on your face?

Tailo: Guá tuì Siōngtè kî-kiû, tsiàu I hong-sīng ê îng-kng, thong-kuè Sìng Sîn sù lín khuì-la̍t, hō͘ lín sim-lāi ê ua̍h-miā ióng-tsòng khí-.lâi.
English: that he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, that you may be strengthened with power through his Spirit in the inward man;

Tailo: Lín tī Hô-lep suann koh jiá Siōngtsú siū-khì, tì-sú Siōngtsú tuì lín siū-khì, beh kā lín bia̍t-bông.
English: Also in Horeb you provoked Yahweh to wrath, and Yahweh was angry with you to destroy you.

Tailo: In īng lâng ê huat-tō͘ tòng-tsò Siōngtè ê kài-bīng lâi kà-sī lâng. In kìng-pài guá lóng bô tshái-kang. ' ( tsù, ISI 29:13 )
English: But in vain do they worship me, Teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.'

Tailo: Tio̍h ū phi-kian nn̄g tè, liân tī siang pîng hō͘ i sio-liân.
English: It shall have two shoulder straps joined to the two ends of it, that it may be joined together.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū khì, tsiàu Eliiah ê uē lâi kiâⁿ. Tsa-bó͘ lâng kah i ê ke kah Eliiah tsò-hué tsia̍h tsin tsē ji̍t.
English: She went and did according to the saying of Elijah: and she, and he, and her house, ate many days.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tshiánn guá lâi, guá bô the-sî tsiū lâi. Taⁿ tshiáⁿ-mn̄g lín tsit pái tshiánn guá lâi, ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kuì-sū?
English: Therefore also I came without complaint when I was sent for. I ask therefore, why did you send for me?

Tailo: Tsi̍t-kuá bat hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin á-.sī phuà-pēⁿ hō͘ Iésu i hó ê hū-jîn-lâng mā kah in tsò-hué, kî-tiong ū Ma̍k-ta-lé ê Mâlíah. Iésu bat tuì tsit-ê Mâlíah sin tsiūⁿ kuáⁿ-tshut tshit-ê kuí.
English: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

Tailo: Huē-tn̂g ê tsú-kuán Ku-lí-su-pò͘ kah i ê tsuân ke lóng sìn Tsú, koh ū tsin tsē Ko-lîn-to lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tō-lí liáu-āu lâi sìn Tsú, mā niá siū sé-lé.
English: Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord with all his house. Many of the Corinthians, when they heard, believed and were baptized.

Tailo: Án-ne, i lō͘-hiān i ê îm-hīng, koh lō͘-hiān i ê ē-sin, Guá ê sim tsiū kah i líng-tām, tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng kah i ê tuā-tsé líng-tām.
English: So she uncovered her prostitution, and uncovered her nakedness: then my soul was alienated from her, like as my soul was alienated from her sister.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsù-ì A-pit-gue̍h, lâi siú Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh, in-uī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tī A-pit-gue̍h àm-sî tshuā lí tshut Aigi̍p.
English: Observe the month of Abib, and keep the Passover to Yahweh your God; for in the month of Abib Yahweh your God brought you forth out of Egypt by night.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, Io-si-iah í-king kā tiān siu-tsíng liáu-āu, ū Aigi̍p ông Ne-ko khí-.lâi, beh phah Iu-hu-la-té hô piⁿ ê Ka-ki-bí-si. Io-si-iah tsiū tshut-khì kā i tí-tòng.
English: After all this, when Josiah had prepared the temple, Neco king of Egypt went up to fight against Carchemish by the Euphrates: and Josiah went out against him.

Tailo: Tuì uá thô͘-kha ê té-tsō kàu ē-tsàn ê khiat-á, kuân nn̄g tiú, khuah tsi̍t tiú, tuì sè khiat-á kàu tuā khiat-á, kuân sì tiú, khuah tsi̍t tiú.
English: From the bottom on the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the lesser ledge to the greater ledge shall be four cubits, and the breadth a cubit.

Tailo: Tsi-bah tuì ông kóng, Ionáthan iáu ū tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ, sī pái-kha-.ê. Ông kā i kóng, I tī tó-uī? Tsi-bah ìn ông kóng, I tī Lô-tí-pa lâng Ammíel ê kiáⁿ Makil ê ke.
English: The king said to him, Where is he? Ziba said to the king, Behold, he is in the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, in Lo Debar.

Tailo: Lín lâi-kàu Sin-iok ê tiong-pó — Iésu ê bīn-tsîng kah só͘ hiù ê hueh hia; tsit-ê hueh pí Abel ê hueh só͘ piáu-ta̍t ê koh khah hó.
English: to Jesus, the mediator of a new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better than that of Abel.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn ū tsi̍t hāng tsai-hō hō͘ lâng ū tāng-tàⁿ,
English: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is heavy on men:

Tailo: Bô tsò-hué tsham-siông ê kè-uē ē sit-pāi; tsin tsē bô͘-sū tsò-hué kè-uē ē sîng-kong.
English: Where there is no counsel, plans fail; But in a multitude of counselors they are established.

Tailo: Hué-hu ē tī Aigi̍p tsuân tē piàn-tsò tîn-ai, tī Aigi̍p tsuân tē, tī lâng kah tsing-seⁿ ê sing-khu, lóng seⁿ liàp-á, tsiâⁿ-tsò tshng.
English: It shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with boils on man and on animal, throughout all the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Iôtah tuì i ê a-hiaⁿ Simiān kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kah guá tsò-hué lâi-khì guá só͘ liam-tio̍h ê tē kah Ka-nân lâng kau-tsiàn; guá mā beh kah lí khì, kàu lí só͘ liam-tio̍h ê tē. Simiān tsiū kah i khì.
English: Judah said to Simeon his brother, Come up with me into my lot, that we may fight against the Canaanites; and I likewise will go with you into your lot. So Simeon went with him.

Tailo: Tshiáⁿ lí mā tio̍h tsún-pī só͘-tsāi hō͘ guá tuà, in-uī guá ǹg-bāng Siōngtè ē thiaⁿ lín ê kî-tó, hō͘ guá ē-tàng khì lín hia.
English: Also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

Tailo: Guá sî-siông tī ta̍k-ê huē-tn̂g kā in hîng-hua̍t, kiông-pik in kóng siat-to̍k ê uē, īng pō-li̍k tuì-thāi in, sīm-tsì kàu guā-kok ê siâⁿ-tshī mā kā in pik-hāi.
English: Punishing them often in all the synagogues, I tried to make them blaspheme. Being exceedingly enraged against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities.

Tailo: Páulô tī A-thé-nè teh thìng-hāu Sela̍h kah Tî-mó͘-theh ê kî-kan, khuàⁿ-tio̍h muá siâⁿ lóng sī ngó͘-siōng, tsiū siong-sim tio̍h-kip.
English: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was provoked within him as he saw the city full of idols.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê Lēbī lâng, to̍h-sī Mô͘se kah Alông tsiàu Siōngtsú ê bīng-līng só͘ sǹg ê, tsiàu in ê ke, tuì muá-gue̍h í-siōng ê tsa-po͘ ting, tsóng-kiōng ū nn̄g-bān nn̄g-tshing miâ.
English: All who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered at the commandment of Yahweh, by their families, all the males from a month old and upward, were twenty-two thousand.

Tailo: Hit sî, tī Iôtah tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah Êlúsalèm ê ke-lō͘, Guá beh hō͘ huann-hí ê siann, khuài-lo̍k ê siann, sin-lông ê siann kah sin-niû ê siaⁿ suah-.khì, in-uī tsit-ê tē lóng ē piàn-tsò pha-hng.
English: Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land shall become a waste.

Tailo: In lóng sī gû-tshún bû-ti; ngó͘-siōng ê kà-sī, tsí-put-kò sī tshâ niā-niā.
English: But they are together brutish and foolish: the instruction of idols! it is but a stock.

Tailo: Páulô siūⁿ beh ji̍p-khì kûn-tsiòng ê lāi-bīn, bûn-tô͘ kā i tsó͘-tòng.
English: When Paul wanted to enter in to the people, the disciples didn't allow him.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tsai, Siōngtè tsit ê tsín-kiù ê sìn-sit í-king thuân hō͘ guā-pang lâng, in ē thiaⁿ koh ē tsiap-siū.
English: Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations. They will also listen.

Tailo: Tio̍h ióng-kám, lán tio̍h uī lán ê jîn-bîn kah lán Siōngtsú ê siâⁿ tsò tāi-tiōng-hu. Guān Siōngtsú tsiàu I só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò sī hó ê lâi kiâⁿ!
English: Be of good courage, and let us play the man for our people, and for the cities of our God: and Yahweh do that which seems him good.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kiàn-li̍p tsiah-ê thiⁿ, tī tshim-ian ê tíng-bīn an-tì îⁿ-khuân.
English: When he established the heavens, I was there; When he set a circle on the surface of the deep,

Tailo: I ē tshing-ho͘ Guá kóng: Lí sī guá ê pē, sī guá ê Siōngtè, sī kiù guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ.
English: He will call to me, You are my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation!'

Tailo: I ê sing-khu tshin-tshiūnn n̂g-gi̍k, bīn-māu tshin-tshiūnn sih-nà ê khuán, i ê ba̍k-tsiu tshin-tshiūnn hué-pé, i ê tshiú kah kha sik-tì tshin-tshiūnn buâ-kng ê tâng, i kóng-uē ê siann tshin-tshiūnn kui tīn lâng ê siann.
English: his body also was like the beryl, and his face as the appearance of lightning, and his eyes as flaming torches, and his arms and his feet like burnished brass, and the voice of his words like the voice of a multitude.

Tailo: Lí kā Isulael lâng kóng: Tuì in gia̍h kuái-á, ta̍k tsi-tso̍k tsi̍t ki, to̍h-sī tuì hiah-ê tsi-tso̍k ê siú-líng, tsóng-kiōng gia̍h tsa̍p-jī ki. Lí siá ta̍k lâng ê miâ tī i ê kuái-á.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, and take of them rods, one for each fathers' house, of all their princes according to their fathers' houses, twelve rods: write you every man's name on his rod.

Tailo: In tsiū kā i lia̍h khí-.lâi, hiat lo̍h-khì tséⁿ ni̍h; hit kháu tséⁿ sī ta ê, lāi-bīn bô tsuí.
English: and they took him, and threw him into the pit. The pit was empty. There was no water in it.

Tailo: Gû nā tak-tio̍h lô͘-po̍k á-.sī lú-pī, tio̍h īng gîn saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel hō͘ in ê tsú-lâng, mā tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā gû tìm-sí.
English: If the bull gores a male servant or a female servant, thirty shekels of silver shall be given to their master, and the ox shall be stoned.

Tailo: Hit-ê í-tsîng in-uī huān tsuē kah jio̍k-thé bô siū kat-lé ê líng í-king sí-.khì, taⁿ Siōngtè hō͘ lín kah Ki-tok tsò-hué koh-ua̍h. Siōngtè í-king sià-bián lán só͘-ū ê tsuē-kò,
English: You were dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh. He made you alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses,

Tailo: Kàu thiⁿ-kng, Huâ-láu sim bô pîng-an, tsiū tshe lâng tiàu Aigi̍p só͘-ū ê su̍t-sū kah tsheⁿ-siōng-ka lâi; Huâ-láu tsiū kā i só͘ bāng-kìnn ê kā in kóng, in bô lâng ē-hiáu kā Huâ-láu kái-bāng.
English: It happened in the morning that his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called for all of Egypt's magicians and wise men. Pharaoh told them his dreams, but there was no one who could interpret them to Pharaoh.

Tailo: Αpsalôm tshe lâng khì kiò Ioap, beh tshe i khì kìnn ông, tsóng-.sī, Ioap m̄-khíng lâi i hia. I tē-jī pái tshe lâng khì kiò i, i iû-guân m̄ lâi.
English: Then Absalom sent for Joab, to send him to the king; but he would not come to him: and he sent again a second time, but he would not come.

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, Iosiúah tsiàu Mô͘se só͘ kā i kóng ê khì tsò, kah Amáli̍k lâng kau-tsiàn. Mô͘se, Alông kah Huul lóng tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tíng.
English: So Joshua did as Moses had told him, and fought with Amalek; and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.

Tailo: Tuì thâu tsi̍t ji̍t kàu lō͘-bué ji̍t, Etsula̍h ta̍k ji̍t tha̍k Siōngtsú ê lu̍t-huat. Tsìng lâng siú tseh tshit ji̍t, kàu tē-peh ji̍t ū giâm-siok-huē, lóng tsiàu tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē.
English: Also day by day, from the first day to the last day, he read in the book of the law of God. They kept the feast seven days; and on the eighth day was a solemn assembly, according to the ordinance.

Tailo: I tī hia at-tn̄g tuì-ti̍k ê kiong-tsìnn, tîn-pâi, to-kiàm kah kau-tsiàn ê ke-si. [Sè-la̍h]
English: There he broke the flaming arrows of the bow, The shield, and the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah.

Tailo: Kò i kóng, Tsit-ê lâng siàn-tōng lâng, īng uî-puē lu̍t-huat ê hong-sik lâi kìng-pài Siōngtè!
English: saying, This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.

Tailo: Lán iáu tuà tī tsit-ê pò͘-pênn teh thua-buâ thó͘-khuì, m̄-sī ài kā tē-tsiūⁿ ê thé thǹg khí-.lâi, sī ài tha̍h sio̍k-thiⁿ ê thé, thang hō͘ ua̍h-miā lâi khik-ho̍k hit-ê ē sí ê thé.
English: For indeed we who are in this tent do groan, being burdened; not that we desire to be unclothed, but that we desire to be clothed, that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ ê kè-bô͘ sī Siōngtsú só͘ thó-ià; m̄-koh, hó ê uē tī I gán-tiong sī tshing-kiat.
English: Yahweh detests the thoughts of the wicked, But the thoughts of the pure are pleasing.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù Isulael lâng, kā in kóng: Lín kàu guá siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín hit-ê tē ê sî, tē tsiū tio̍h kā Siōngtsú siú an-hioh.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, When you come into the land which I give you, then the land shall keep a Sabbath to Yahweh.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tsing-seⁿ ū pun-tê bô thiah-tshe, mā bô huan-tsháu ê, tuì lín lâi kóng sī bô tshing-khì ê, kiàn-nā bong-.tio̍h ê lâng mā sǹg-tsò sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Every animal which parts the hoof, and is not cloven-footed, nor chews the cud, is unclean to you. Everyone who touches them shall be unclean.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h uī ka-kī tshú tshit tsiah gû-káng, tshit tsiah iûⁿ-káng, kàu Guá ê lô͘-po̍k Iobuh hia, uī ka-kī hiàn sio-tsè; Guá ê lô͘-po̍k Iobuh ē thè lín kî-tó; in-uī Guá beh tsiap-la̍p i, bián-tit Guá tsiàu lín ê gû-gōng lâi kā lín khuán-thāi; in-uī lín gī-lūn Guá, bô kóng ha̍p-lí ê uē, tshin-tshiūnn Guá ê lô͘-po̍k Iobuh só͘ kóng ê.
English: Now therefore, take to yourselves seven bulls and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you, for I will accept him, that I not deal with you according to your folly. For you have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job has.

Tailo: Kàu hit ji̍t, Siōngtsú ē khà i ê kué-tsí, tuì tuā hô kàu Aigi̍p ê khe, lín Isulael lâng, ē tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê hō͘ I siu-khioh khí-.lâi.
English: It will happen in that day, that Yahweh will thresh from the flowing stream of the Euphrates to the brook of Egypt; and you will be gathered one by one, children of Israel.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Iôséhuh tńg-khì kā i ê lāu-pē bâi-tsòng. Kah i tsò-hué tńg-.khì ê, ū Huâ-láu ê tsìng jîn-sîn kah Huâ-láu tshù lāi ê tiúⁿ-ló, í-ki̍p Aigi̍p kok ê tsìng tiúⁿ-ló,
English: Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, all the elders of the land of Egypt,

Tailo: I ē kā lô-bāng pha tī pháiⁿ lâng ê sin tsiūⁿ; ū hué-iām, liû-hông kah iām-jua̍h ê hong tsò in ing-kai siū ê pò-ìng.
English: On the wicked he will rain blazing coals; Fire, sulfur, and scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.

Tailo: Tiâⁿ ê sai-bīn tio̍h ū uî, khuah gō͘-tsa̍p tiú, uî ê thiāu tsa̍p ki, khū tsa̍p-ê.
English: For the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits; their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.

Tailo: I tshin-tshiūnn tuì-ti̍k khui kiong, I khiā-teh gia̍h-khí tsiàⁿ tshiú tshin-tshiūnn siû-ti̍k, mā tsuân-pō͘ tsâu-bia̍t ba̍k-tsiu só͘ huann-hí ê. Tī Si-óng tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê pò͘-pênn, tshin-tshiūnn hué piàⁿ-tshut I ê tuā siū-khì.
English: He has bent his bow like an enemy, he has stood with his right hand as an adversary, Has killed all that were pleasant to the eye: In the tent of the daughter of Zion he has poured out his wrath like fire.

Tailo: Guá tsiah-ê kiáⁿ, taⁿ m̄-thang pîn-tuāⁿ, in-uī Siōngtsú kíng-suán lín khiā tī I ê bīn-tsîng lâi ho̍k-sāi I, tam-tng tsit-jīm sio hiuⁿ hō͘ I.
English: My sons, don't be negligent now; for Yahweh has chosen you to stand before him, to minister to him, and that you should be his ministers, and burn incense.

Tailo: Siōngtsú khiā tī thui tíng, kóng, Guá sī Siōngtsú — lí ê tsó͘-sian Abulahàm ê Siōngtè, mā sī Ísak ê Siōngtè. Guá beh kā lí hiān-tsāi só͘ khùn ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: Behold, Yahweh stood above it, and said, I am Yahweh, the God of Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac. The land whereon you lie, to you will I give it, and to your seed.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtè bô sìn-jīm I hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê lâng; tsiah-ê thiⁿ tī I bīn-tsîng mā bô tshing-khì.
English: Behold, he puts no trust in his holy ones; Yes, the heavens are not clean in his sight:

Tailo: Asahel jiok Apnel, bô phian tsó-.bô phian iū, ti̍t-ti̍t jiok-tio̍h Apnel.
English: Asahel pursued after Abner; and in going he didn't turn to the right hand nor to the left from following Abner.

Tailo: Bô-lūn sī tuì Iô-tá-iah lâng, Hi-la̍h lâng á-.sī Siōngtè ê kàu-huē, lín lóng m̄-thang tsiâⁿ-tsò in ê tsó͘-gāi.
English: Give no occasions for stumbling, either to Jews, or to Greeks, or to the assembly of God;

Tailo: I tshe sù-tsiá khì tuā hô piⁿ ê Pî-tuat, kàu Bohol ê kiáⁿ Palân ê pún só͘-tsāi kiò i lâi, kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ū tsi̍t-ê bîn-tso̍k tuì Aigi̍p tshut-.lâi; lí khuàⁿ, in jia muá tē-bīn, mā tuà tī guá ê tuì-bīn.
English: He sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor, to Pethor, which is by the River, to the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, Behold, there is a people come out from Egypt: behold, they cover the surface of the earth, and they abide over against me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ē tshuā lí ji̍p-khì lí ê tsó͘-sian só͘ sîng-tsiap ê tē, lí mā sîng-tsiap i; I mā ē hó khuán-thāi lí, hō͘ lí ê lâng-gia̍h ke-thinn pí lí ê tsó͘-sian khah tsē.
English: and Yahweh your God will bring you into the land which your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it; and he will do you good, and multiply you above your fathers.

Tailo: Guān Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê un-tián kah lín tông-tsāi.
English: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

Tailo: I ê lé-mi̍h nā tuì gû-kûn tshú-tsò sio-tsè, tsiū tio̍h hiàn tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám ê gû-káng-á, tio̍h tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu hiàn, tsiah ē-tàng tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h tsiap-la̍p.
English: If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall offer a male without blemish. He shall offer it at the door of the Tent of Meeting, that he may be accepted before Yahweh.

Tailo: Iâⁿ-tuī beh tshut-huat ê sî, Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ kā sìng-só͘ kah sìng-só͘ só͘-ū ê khì-kū khàm liáu-āu, jiân-āu Kohat ê kiáⁿ-sun tio̍h lâi kng. Tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang bong sìng ê mi̍h, bián-tit in sí; huē-bō͘ lāi tsiah-ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng sī Kohat ê kiáⁿ-sun só͘ tio̍h kng ê.
English: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary, and all the furniture of the sanctuary, as the camp moves forward; after that, the sons of Kohath shall come to carry it: but they shall not touch the sanctuary, lest they die. These things are the burden of the sons of Kohath in the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú khí-tsō Si-óng, tī I ê îng-kng tiong hián-hiān.
English: For Yahweh has built up Zion. He has appeared in his glory.

Tailo: Ū suan-hua ê siann tuì siâⁿ lāi huat-tshut! Ū hiáng-siaⁿ tuì tiān lāi huat-tshut! Tsiū-sī Siōngtsú pò-ìng I ê tuì-ti̍k ê siann.
English: A voice of tumult from the city, a voice from the temple, a voice of Yahweh that renders recompense to his enemies.

Tailo: In hì-lāng suah, kā hit niá tsí-sik ê tn̂g-phàu thǹg khí-.lâi, koh kā Iésu ka-kī ê saⁿ-tshīng tò tńg-.khì, jiân-āu kā I ah-khì tìng si̍p-jī-kè.
English: When they had mocked him, they took the purple off of him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him.

Tailo: Hit sî, Malésiah lâng To͘-ta-uah ê kiáⁿ Elíetsel, īng ī-giân kong-kik Iô-sa-huat kóng, In-uī lí kiat-kau Ahatsiah, Siōngtsú phò-huāi lí ê só͘ tsò. Tsiū án-ne, tsûn tsiū phuà-.khì, suah bē-tàng khì Talsisih.
English: Then Eliezer the son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, Because you have joined yourself with Ahaziah, Yahweh has destroyed your works. The ships were broken, so that they were not able to go to Tarshish.

Tailo: Hiàn-sin-tsiá-tio̍h tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu thì ka-kī hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê thâu, kā ka-kī hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê thâu-mn̂g hē tī siā-un-tsè ē-bīn ê hué tíng.
English: The Nazirite shall shave the head of his separation at the door of the Tent of Meeting, and shall take the hair of the head of his separation, and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of peace offerings.

Tailo: Kuah-be̍h ê thâu-lâng ìn kóng, Tsit-ê sī Mô͘ap ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kah Naomih tuì Mô͘ap tē tńg-.lâi ê.
English: The servant who was set over the reapers answered, It is the Moabite lady who came back with Naomi out of the country of Moab:

Tailo: Lâng nā tú-tio̍h i ê tuì-ti̍k, kám ū pàng i pîng-an khì? Guān Siōngtsú in-uī lí kin-á-ji̍t tuì guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê, īng hó pò lí.
English: For if a man finds his enemy, will he let him go away unharmed? Therefore may Yahweh reward you good for that which you have done to me this day.

Tailo: Guá án-ne kóng, kám sī siūⁿ beh tit-tio̍h lâng ê o-ló? M̄-sī, sī beh tit-tio̍h Siōngtè ê o-ló; guá kám teh kiû hō͘ lâng huann-hí? Guá nā iáu-koh ài hō͘ lâng huann-hí, guá tsiū m̄-sī Ki-tok ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: For am I now seeking the favor of men, or of God? Or am I striving to please men? For if I were still pleasing men, I wouldn't be a servant of Christ.

Tailo: In-uī tsìng sian-ti kah lu̍t-huat ê ī-giân kàu Iô-há-neh ê sî uî-tsí.
English: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

Tailo: In tuì Ioltàn hô só͘ tshú hit tsa̍p-jī tè tsio̍h-thâu, Iosiúah tsiū kā in tshāi tī Gilgal,
English: Those twelve stones, which they took out of the Jordan, did Joshua set up in Gilgal.

Tailo: Lín īng tshì-á hiâⁿ hué, tiánn iáu-buē jia̍t, I beh īng kńg-lê-á hong kā seⁿ ê kah teh to̍h ê tshì-á tsò tsi̍t-ē sàu-khì.
English: Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns, He will sweep away the green and the burning alike.

Tailo: Iésu kóng tsiah-ê uē, sī teh tsí Piattò͘ ē án-tsuáⁿ sí lâi îng-kng Siōngtè. Án-ne kóng suah, Iésu kā i kóng, Lâi tuè guá.
English: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him, Follow me.

Tailo: Tī sai pîng, tsiàu in ê kun-tuī, sī Ehulaim iâⁿ ê tuā kî, A-mi-hut ê kiáⁿ Elísiamah tsò Ehulaim lâng ê siú-líng.
English: On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of Ephraim according to their divisions: and the prince of the children of Ephraim shall be Elishama the son of Ammihud.

Tailo: Lí kah Leah ê kiat-hun tio̍h muá tshit ji̍t, jiân-āu guán tsiū ē kā La̍h-khel mā kè hō͘ lí, lí tio̍h uī La̍h-khel koh kā guá tsò-kang tshit nî.
English: Fulfill the week of this one, and we will give you the other also for the service which you will serve with me yet seven other years.

Tailo: Guān guá ê tuì-ti̍k īng lîng-jio̍k tsò saⁿ-tshīng! Guān in īng in ê kiàn-siàu tsò phâu mua sing-khu!
English: Let my adversaries be clothed with dishonor. Let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê thiⁿ hián-bîng I ê kong-gī, lia̍t pang khuàⁿ-tio̍h I ê îng-kng.
English: The heavens declare his righteousness. All the peoples have seen his glory.

Tailo: Koh kā siâⁿ lāi só͘-ū ê, bô-lūn lâm-lí ló-iù, gû, iûⁿ kah lî-á, lóng īng to tsuân-pō͘ kā in bia̍t-tiāu.
English: They utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, both young and old, and ox, and sheep, and donkey, with the edge of the sword.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng pak i ê guā-saⁿ? Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng ji̍p-khì i tíng-ē-huâiⁿ ê tiong-kan?
English: Who can strip off his outer garment? Who shall come within his jaws?

Tailo: Tī tseh-kî kah tāi-huē ê sî, sò͘-tsè tio̍h uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng hiàn tsi̍t-ê e-huat, uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng hiàn tsi̍t-ê e-huat, uī-tio̍h hiah-ê iûⁿ-ko tsiū tsiàu i ê king-tsè li̍k-liōng, tsi̍t-ê e-huat phuè iû tsi̍t hin.
English: In the feasts and in the solemnities the meal offering shall be an ephah for a bull, and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs as he is able to give, and a hin of oil to an ephah.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā Abigail kóng, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè sī ing-kai o-ló ê, in-uī I kin-á-ji̍t tshe lí lâi tú-tio̍h guá.
English: David said to Abigail, Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me:

Tailo: Guán bô īng pa̍t lâng lô-khó͘ uân-sîng ê tāi-tsì tòng-tsò ka-kī ê sîng-tsik lâi khua-kháu; guán ǹg-bāng lín ê sìn-sim ē ná tsing-tióng, guán tī lín tiong-kan kang-tsok ê huān-uî ē ná khui-khuah.
English: not boasting beyond proper limits in other men's labors, but having hope that as your faith grows, we will be abundantly enlarged by you in our sphere of influence,

Tailo: Ū lâng kàu sí iáu khuì-la̍t tsê-pī, tshiong-muá tit-tio̍h pîng-tsīng an-jiân.
English: One dies in his full strength, Being wholly at ease and quiet.

Tailo: Guá ka-kī ua̍t tńg-lâi khuànn tì-huī, tian-kông kah gû-gōng; tī kun-ông hō͘-puè ê lâng iáu ē-tàng tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsiū-sī tsá-tsîng í-king tsò-kuè ê tāi-tsì niā-niā.
English: I turned myself to consider wisdom, madness, and folly: for what can the king's successor do? Just that which has been done long ago.

Tailo: In pháu-tsáu tshin-tshiūnn ióng-sū, peh-tsiūⁿ siâⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tsiàn-sū; ta̍k-ê tsiàu lō͘ kiânn, bô luān tuī-ngó͘.
English: They run like mighty men. They climb the wall like warriors. They each march in his line, and they don't swerve off course.

Tailo: Lí nā m̄-tsún Guá ê jîn-bîn khì, Guá beh tshe kui tīn ê hô͘-sîn kàu lí kah lí ê jîn-sîn hia, í-ki̍p lí ê jîn-bîn, mā ē ji̍p-khì lí hiah-ê tshù, koh ū Aigi̍p lâng ê tshù kah in só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi, lóng ē ū kui tīn ê hô͘-sîn muá-muá.
English: Else, if you will not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies on you, and on your servants, and on your people, and into your houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.

Tailo: Guā-pang lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē lóng tsin huann-hí, o-ló Siōngtè ê tō-lí. Só͘-ū siū Siōngtè kíng-suán thang tit-tio̍h íng-uán ua̍h-miā ê lâng, lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò sìn-tô͘.
English: As the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God. As many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

Tailo: Iésu muá-sim liân-bín, tshun tshiú kā i bong, kóng, Guá khíng, lí thang tshing-khì.
English: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him, I want to. Be made clean.

Tailo: Mn̄g Iésu kóng, Lí tio̍h kā guán kóng, Lí sī khò siáⁿ-mi̍h kuân-pìng lâi tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì? Sī siáⁿ lâng hō͘ Lí tsit-ê kuân-pìng?
English: They asked him, Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú tuì in kóng ê uē, sī bīng-līng koh bīng-līng, bīng-līng koh bīng-līng, lu̍t-lē koh lu̍t-lē, lu̍t-lē koh lu̍t-lē, tām-po̍h tsia, tām-po̍h hia, tì-sú in khì, tsiū hiàⁿ-āu pua̍h-tó, koh pua̍h kah tshuì-tshuì, hām-lo̍h lô-bāng, hông lia̍h-tio̍h.
English: Therefore the word of Yahweh will be to them precept on precept, precept on precept; line on line, line on line; here a little, there a little; that they may go, fall backward, be broken, be snared, and be taken.

Tailo: Tshiáⁿ-mn̄g tī lí tshut-sì í-tsîng kàu taⁿ, tuì Siōngtsú tshòng-tsō lâng tī sè-kan hit ji̍t í-lâi, tuì thiⁿ ê tsit pîng kàu thinn ê hit pîng, kám ū tshin-tshiūnn hit khuán ê tuā sū? Kám bat thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū án-ne?
English: For ask now of the days that are past, which were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and from the one end of the sky to the other, whether there has been any such thing as this great thing is, or has been heard like it?

Tailo: Thâu tsi̍t-ê tshut-.lâi ê, sing-khu âng-âng, tsuân sing-khu tshin-tshiūnn phuê-á saⁿ, só͘-í tsiū kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Esáu.
English: The first came out red all over, like a hairy garment. They named him Esau.

Tailo: I khut-sin phak-teh tng-tán, bô i-uá ê lâng tsiū tó tī i ê jiáu gê ē-bīn.
English: The helpless are crushed, they collapse, They fall under his strength.

Tailo: Án-ne, lâu hit-ê hueh ê tsuē kah i bô kuan-hē. Án-ne tsiū tuì lín tiong-kan tû-khì lâu bô tsuē ê hueh ê tsuē, sī in-uī lí ū kiânn Siōngtsú khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê.
English: So shall you put away the innocent blood from the midst of you, when you shall do that which is right in the eyes of Yahweh.

Tailo: Kóng, Ki-tok ah, Lí sī sian-ti, tann kā guán kóng, siáⁿ lâng kā Lí phah?
English: saying, Prophesy to us, you Christ! Who hit you?

Tailo: Lí ê sim m̄-thang sò-sìng lâi siū-khì; in-uī siū-khì tsûn tī gōng lâng ê sim-huâi.
English: Don't be hasty in your spirit to be angry, for anger rests in the bosom of fools.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kám-siā Siōngtsú, in-uī I sī hó; in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi!
English: Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, For his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Lí só͘ hō͘ guá tsò-phuāⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, i kā hit-tsâng tshiū ê kué-tsí hō͘ guá, guá tsiū tsia̍h.
English: The man said, The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I ate.

Tailo: In ê tsòng-liân í-king sue-thè, in tshiú ê khuì-la̍t kah guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kuan-hē?
English: Of what use is the strength of their hands to me, Men in whom ripe age has perished?

Tailo: In tuì Su-kot tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī kīn khòng-iá ê E-thám.
English: They took their journey from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, in the edge of the wilderness.

Tailo: Hiah-ê siàu-siūⁿ beh bia̍t guá sèⁿ-miā ê lâng, i ē hām-lo̍h tī tē-hā tshim ê só͘-tsāi.
English: But those who seek my soul, to destroy it, Shall go into the lower parts of the earth.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit ki kak kah sìng ê tsú-bîn kau-tsiàn, lâi thâi-iâⁿ in.
English: I saw, and the same horn made war with the saints, and prevailed against them;

Tailo: Iésu iáu teh kóng ê sî, tsa̍p-jī bûn-tô͘ tiong-kan ê Iôtah lâi-kàu-uī, mā ū kui tīn lâng gia̍h to kah thuî-á, tuè tsè-si-tiúⁿ, king-ha̍k kàu-su kah tiúⁿ-ló tsò-hué uá-.lâi.
English: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, cameand with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

Tailo: i ê io nā bô kā guá tsiok-hok, i mā bô tuì guá ê iûⁿ-mn̂g lâi tit-tio̍h un-luán,
English: If his heart hasn't blessed me, If he hasn't been warmed with my sheep's fleece;

Tailo: Lu̍t-huat ū kì-tsài, Tsú kóng, guá beh īng kóng guā-kok-uē ê lâng, īng ī-pang lâng ê tshuì-tûn, tuì Guá ê tsú-bîn kóng-uē; án-ne, in iû-guân m̄-thiaⁿ. ( tsù, ISI 28:11-12 )
English: In the law it is written, By men of strange languages and by the lips of strangers I will speak to this people. Not even thus will they hear me, says the Lord.

Tailo: khióng-kiaⁿ lí í-king tsia̍h pá, í-king khí suí ê tshù lâi tuà,
English: lest, when you have eaten and are full, and have built goodly houses, and lived therein;

Tailo: Kóng-uē sò-sìng ê lâng tshin-tshiūnn to teh tsha̍k lâng; tì-huī lâng ê tshuì-tsi̍h ē i hó lâng.
English: There is one who speaks rashly like the piercing of a sword, But the tongue of the wise heals.

Tailo: In-uī in khuànn thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí tsò sí-ìm, in-uī in tī sí-ìm tsin kuàn-sì.
English: For the morning is to all of them like thick darkness, For they know the terrors of the thick darkness.

Tailo: Kóng, Tuā-lâng, guán ē kì-tit hit-ê pián-sian-á ua̍h-.leh ê sî bat kóng, ' Saⁿ ji̍t āu guá beh koh-ua̍h. '
English: saying, Sir, we remember what that deceiver said while he was still alive: After three days I will rise again.'

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī Isulael lâng, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsiàu in ê kun-tuī, tī tsiah-ê iâⁿ tiong só͘-ū king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, ū la̍k-tsa̍p-bān saⁿ-tshing gō͘-pah gō͘-tsa̍p miâ.
English: These are those who were numbered of the children of Israel by their fathers' houses. All who were numbered of the camps according to their armies were six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tiong-kan lîng-sìng sîng-si̍k ê lâng, tio̍h ū kāng-khuán ê sim-tsì; lín tiong-kan nā ū bô kāng-khuán ê sim-tsì, Siōngtè mā ē īng tsit-ê tāi-tsì kā lín khé-sī.
English: Let us therefore, as many as are perfect, think this way. If in anything you think otherwise, God will also reveal that to you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē tshin-tshiūⁿ sai teh háu, in ē tuè I lâi kiâⁿ. I háu ê sî, hiah-ê kiáⁿ tsiū phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, tuì se-hong kuáⁿ-kín lâi.
English: They will walk after Yahweh, Who will roar like a lion; For he will roar, and the children will come trembling from the west.

Tailo: mā tuì siū khún-pa̍k ê lâng kóng: Lín tio̍h tshut-.lâi! Tuì hiah-ê tiàm tī o͘-àm ê lâng kóng: Lín tio̍h hián-hiān! In beh tī lō͘-.ni̍h tit-tio̍h tsia̍h, tī it-tshè bô tsháu ê suaⁿ tit-tio̍h niû-tsháu.
English: saying to those who are bound, Go forth; to those who are in darkness, Show yourselves. They shall feed in the ways, and on all bare heights shall be their pasture.

Tailo: Koh īng gîn tsi̍t pah tha-lan-t, tuì Isulael tsio-bō͘ tuā lîng-li̍k ê ióng-sū, tsa̍p bān lâng.
English: He hired also one hundred thousand mighty men of valor out of Israel for one hundred talents of silver.

Tailo: Hit sî, lán tsing-ho̍k i só͘-ū ê siâⁿ, bô kah tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ bô hō͘ lán tsing-ho̍k, tsóng-kiōng la̍k-tsa̍p-ê siâⁿ. Tse sī Algop ê tsuân kíng, to̍h-sī O͘k tī Basiáng ê kok.
English: We took all his cities at that time; there was not a city which we didn't take from them; sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

Tailo: Iôséhuh kā i kóng, Lí ê bāng sī án-ne kái, sann ki to̍h-sī saⁿ ji̍t,
English: Joseph said to him, This is the interpretation of it: the three branches are three days.

Tailo: Io-si-iah kóng, M̄-thang tshap i, lâng m̄-thang tshian-suá i ê kut-thâu. In tsiū bô tāng-tio̍h i ê kut-thâu, mā bô tāng-tio̍h tuì Sa-má-lī-a lâi hit-ê sian-ti ê kut-thâu.
English: He said, Let him be; let no man move his bones. So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet who came out of Samaria.

Tailo: In kā in ê kiáⁿ-jî tsò tsè-mi̍h, lâi hiàn hō͘ kuí-sîn,
English: Yes, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá uī-tio̍h in lâi sìng-huà guá ka-kī hō͘ Lí īng, thang hō͘ in mā ē-tàng thong-kuè tsin-lí lâi sìng-huà in ka-kī hō͘ Lí īng.
English: For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.

Tailo: Ísak tsiū lī-khui hia, tī Gelal ê suaⁿ-kok tah pò͘-pêⁿ, tiàm hia tuà.
English: Isaac departed from there, encamped in the valley of Gerar, and lived there.

Tailo: Kuái-á kah tsik-pī ē ke-thinn tì-huī; pàng tshut-tsāi i ê gín-á, ē hō͘ lāu-bú kiàn-siàu.
English: The rod of correction gives wisdom, But a child left to himself causes shame to his mother.

Tailo: Iésu huan-hù i kóng, M̄-thang kā lâng kóng, m̄-koh tio̍h khì hō͘ tsè-si giām, mā tio̍h tsiàu Mô͘se só͘ kui-tīng, uī-tio̍h lí tit-tio̍h tshing-khì lâi hiàn tsè, thang tuì tsìng lâng tsìng-bîng.
English: He charged him to tell no one, But go your way, and show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing according to what Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.

Tailo: Guān hit-ê lâng tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtsú só͘ tshia-tó ê hiah-ê siâⁿ, mā bô hō͘-hué ê; guān i tsá-khí sî thiaⁿ-tio̍h ai-tshám ê siann, ji̍t-tiong-tàu thiaⁿ-tio̍h huah-hiàm ê siann.
English: Let that man be as the cities which Yahweh overthrew, and didn't repent: and let him hear a cry in the morning, and shouting at noontime;

Tailo: siú Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ kau-tài lí siú ê, kiânn I ê tō-lō͘, tsiàu Mô͘se lu̍t-huat só͘ siá ê lâi siú I ê lu̍t-lē, I ê kài-bīng, I ê huat-tō͘ kah I kiàn-tsìng ê uē. Án-ne, lí bô-lūn tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h, bô-lūn tuì tó-uī khì, lóng ē hing-thong.
English: and keep the charge of Yahweh your God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his ordinances, and his testimonies, according to that which is written in the law of Moses, that you may prosper in all that you do, and wherever you turn yourself.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, thiⁿ kah tsiah-ê thiⁿ ê thiⁿ, tē kah tē-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê, lóng sio̍k Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè.
English: Behold, to Yahweh your God belongs heaven and the heaven of heavens, the earth, with all that is therein.

Tailo: Iésu uá khì khan i ê tshiú, kā i hû khí-.lâi, i ê jia̍t tsiū thè. Tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng tsiū tsiap-thāi in.
English: He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her, and she served them.

Tailo: Guá ê sim uī-tio̍h Mô͘ap pi-ai! I ê kuì-tso̍k tsáu kàu Tso-al, kàu Ik-lat-si-li-siah. In tsiūⁿ Lu-hit ê lō͘, ná kiâⁿ ná háu; tī Ho-lo-niám ê lō͘, in-uī huí-bia̍t tshut ai-khàu ê siann.
English: My heart cries out for Moab! Her nobles flee to Zoar, to Eglath Shelishiyah; for they go up by the ascent of Luhith with weeping; for in the way of Horonaim, they raise up a cry of destruction.

Tailo: Lí ē tsia̍h bān-kok ê ling, koh suh tsiah-ê kun-ông ê ling-thâu. Lí tsiū ē tsai Guá — Siōngtsú sī lí ê Kiù-tsú, sī kiù-sio̍k lí ê Tsú, Iâkop ê tuā kuân-lîng-.ê.
English: You shall also suck the milk of the nations, and shall suck the breast of kings; and you shall know that I, Yahweh, am your Savior, and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

Tailo: Bû-ti ê lâng bē liáu-kái; gû-tshún ê lâng mā bē bîng-pi̍k tsit-ê ò-pì.
English: A senseless man doesn't know, Neither does a fool understand this:

Tailo: Guān Tsú Iésu Ki-tok ê un-tián, Siōngtè ê thiàⁿ-thàng, Sìng Sîn ê siong-thong kah lín tāi-ke tông-tsāi.
English: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit, be with you all. Amen.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t sī pī-pān ji̍t, Iô-tá-iah lâng bô ài tī keh tńg kang ê An-hioh-ji̍t, lâu sin-si tī si̍p-jī-kè tíng, só͘-í, in kiû Pí-la̍h-to kiò lâng kòng tn̄g siū-hîng-jîn ê kha-kut, thang kā sin-si siu lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Therefore the Jews, because it was the Preparation Day, so that the bodies wouldn't remain on the cross on the Sabbath ( for that Sabbath was a special one ) , asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

Tailo: I iáu teh kóng ê sî, koh ū tsi̍t-ê lâi, kóng, Kal-tí-ah lâng hun-tsò saⁿ tuī hut-jiân lâi, phah lo̍k-tô lâi tshiúⁿ-tua̍t, suà īng to thâi-sí hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k; tsí ū guá tsi̍t-ê lâng tsáu-lī, lâi kā lí pò-kò.
English: While he was still speaking, there came also another, and said, The Chaldeans made three bands, and swept down on the camels, and have taken them away, yes, and killed the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to tell you.

Tailo: Tsiú lóng lim-liáu ê sî, Iésu ê lāu-bú tsiū tuì I kóng, In bô tsiú à.
English: When the wine ran out, Jesus' mother said to him, They have no wine.

Tailo: ū sì-bān tsi̍t-tshing gō͘-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Asher, were forty-one thousand five hundred.

Tailo: Guá tuì Isulael lâng tiong kíng-suán Lēbī lâng, siúⁿ-sù Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun, thang thè Isulael lâng tsò huē-bō͘ ê tshe-īng, koh uī Isulael lâng sio̍k-tsuē; bián-tit Isulael lâng uá-kīn sìng-só͘ ê sî, ū tsai-hō lîm-kàu Isulael lâng ê tiong-kan.
English: I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the service of the children of Israel in the Tent of Meeting, and to make atonement for the children of Israel; that there be no plague among the children of Israel, when the children of Israel come near to the sanctuary.

Tailo: Hit sì-ê thiⁿ-sài siū tháu-pàng ê tāi-tsì, tsá to̍h an-pâi hó-sè, tī hit-ê sî, hit-ê ji̍t, hit-ê gue̍h, hit-ê nî, beh lâi hāi-sí-lâng luī ê saⁿ-hūn tsi-it.
English: The four angels were freed who had been prepared for that hour and day and month and year, so that they might kill one third of mankind.

Tailo: Lí ná ē m̄ sià-bián guá ê kuè-sit, tû-khì guá ê tsuē-kò? In-uī guá taⁿ beh tó tī tîn-ai, Lí ē tì-ì tshuē guá, tsóng-.sī, guá í-king bô tī-.leh.
English: Why do you not pardon my disobedience, and take away my iniquity? For now shall I lie down in the dust. You will seek me diligently, but I shall not be.

Tailo: Guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, Isulael jîn-bîn ê ba̍k-tsiu lóng teh khuàⁿ lí, thìng-hāu lí kā in kóng, siáⁿ lâng ē suà-tsiap guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, lâi tsē i ê uī.
English: You, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, that you should tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.

Tailo: Huâ-láu thàu-mê tiàu Mô͘se kah Alông lâi, kóng, Khí-.lâi! Kiò Isulael lâng tio̍h tuì guá ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan tshut-.khì, tsiàu lín só͘ kóng ê, khì ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú!
English: He called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, Rise up, get out from among my people, both you and the children of Israel; and go, serve Yahweh, as you have said!

Tailo: In bat kóng, guán beh khò tshuì-tsiap lâi khah iâⁿ; tshuì-tûn sī guán ê, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng tsò guán ê Tsú?
English: Who have said, With our tongue we will prevail. Our lips are our own. Who is lord over us?

Tailo: Tang bīn ê tang pîng, gō͘-tsa̍p tiú.
English: For the east side eastward fifty cubits.

Tailo: I it-tīng ē phah-tshuì Aigi̍p tē ê Bia̍t-si-mé-si tiau-khik ê thiāu, īng hué sio Aigi̍p hiah-ê sîn-bîng ê biō. '
English: He shall also break the pillars of Beth Shemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of Egypt shall he burn with fire.

Tailo: Tì-sú guá ē hông tshui-sí, ài sí-bông, khah iâⁿ tshun tsiah-ê kut.
English: So that my soul chooses strangling, Death rather than my bones.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Lí ê bó͘ ē tī siâⁿ lāi tsò tshiong-ki, lí ê kiáⁿ-jî ē sí tī to hā; lí ê tē, lâng ē īng soh niû lâi pun hō͘ pa̍t lâng, lí pún-sin ē sí tī ù-uè ê só͘-tsāi. Isulael jîn-bîn it-tīng ē siū lia̍h lī-khui pún só͘-tsāi. '
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh: Your wife shall be a prostitute in the city, and your sons and your daughters shall fall by the sword, and your land shall be divided by line; and you yourself shall die in a land that is unclean, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of his land.'

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lâng nā uàn-hūn i ê tshù-piⁿ, bih khí-lâi kā i phah, kā i siong-hāi kàu sí, tsiū ē-tàng tsáu kàu hiah-ê siâⁿ ê tsi̍t-ê.
English: But if any man hate his neighbor, and lie in wait for him, and rise up against him, and strike him mortally so that he dies, and he flee into one of these cities;

Tailo: Siōngtsú tiāⁿ-tio̍h ì-sù beh kong-kik Babúlông, lâi kā i huí-bia̍t. Só͘-í, kik-tōng Ma-tái kun-ông ê sim, kóng, Lín tio̍h buâ kng lín ê tsìnn, giâ-tiâu lín ê tîn-pâi. In-uī tse sī Siōngtsú ê pò-siû, to̍h-sī I uī-tio̍h I ê tiān lâi pò-siû.
English: Make sharp the arrows; hold firm the shields: Yahweh has stirred up the spirit of the kings of the Medes; because his purpose is against Babylon, to destroy it: for it is the vengeance of Yahweh, the vengeance of his temple.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê ke tī in ê tso̍k-phó͘ tiong tshuē in ê sè-hē, mā tshuē bô, só͘-í, sǹg-tsò bô tshing-khì, m̄-tsún in tng tsè-si ê tsit.
English: These sought their register among those who were reckoned by genealogy, but it was not found: therefore were they deemed polluted and put from the priesthood.

Tailo: Sâmsóng khùn kàu puàⁿ-mê, tī puàⁿ-mê khí-.lâi, kā siâⁿ mn̂g ê mn̂g-sìⁿ kah nn̄g ki mn̂g-khing, í-ki̍p mn̂g-tshuàⁿ lóng thiah khí-.lâi, hē tī king-kah-thâu tíng, giâ kàu Hebúlông tuì-bīn ê suaⁿ tíng.
English: Samson lay until midnight, and arose at midnight, and laid hold of the doors of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and plucked them up, bar and all, and put them on his shoulders, and carried them up to the top of the mountain that is before Hebron.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Lāi-īⁿ ǹg tang ê mn̂g, tī tsò-kang ê la̍k kang lāi it-tīng tio̍h kuainn; to̍k-to̍k tī An-hioh-ji̍t tio̍h khui, muí gue̍h ê tshe-it mā tio̍h khui.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: The gate of the inner court that looks toward the east shall be shut the six working days; but on the Sabbath day it shall be opened, and on the day of the new moon it shall be opened.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì tó-uī tit-tio̍h bah hō͘ tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tsia̍h? In-uī in lóng tuì guá thî-khàu kóng, ' Lí tio̍h the̍h bah hō͘ guán, hō͘ guán thang tsia̍h! '
English: Where should I get meat to give to all this people? for they weep to me, saying, Give us meat, that we may eat.

Tailo: Kuan-hē sí-lâng koh-ua̍h, lín kám bô tha̍k-tio̍h Mô͘se ê tsheh, ' Teh to̍h ê tshì-phè' hit phiⁿ só͘ kì-tsài ê? Siōngtè kā Mô͘se kóng, ' Guá sī Abulahàm ê Siōngtè, Ísak ê Siōngtè, Iâkop ê Siōngtè. ' ( tsù, CAG 3:6,15-16 )
English: But about the dead, that they are raised; haven't you read in the book of Moses, about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?'

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê kun-tiúⁿ, sī ông uá-khò i ê tshiú ê, ìn Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Siat-sú Siōngtsú tuì thiⁿ khui thang-á, kám ē án-ne? Elísiah kóng, Lí ē tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsóng-.sī, tsia̍h bē-tio̍h.
English: Then the captain on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God, and said, Behold, if Yahweh should make windows in heaven, might this thing be? He said, Behold, you shall see it with your eyes, but shall not eat of it.

Tailo: Kóng suah, tsiū kā tshiú-.ni̍h ê tshuì-phué kut hiat-ka̍k, hit só͘-tsāi tsiū kiò-tsò La-mat-le-hi ( Tsù, Hi-bú-lâi gí ê ì-sù sī Ē-huâi-kut ê lûn á ) .
English: It happened, when he had made an end of speaking, that he cast away the jawbone out of his hand; and that place was called Ramath Lehi.

Tailo: Isulael jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-tio̍h Sàulô phah Huilīsū lâng ê kun-iâⁿ, koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h Isulael lâng hō͘ Huilīsū lâng thó-ià, jîn-bîn tsiū lâi kin-tuè Sàulô, tsū-tsi̍p tī Gilgal.
English: All Israel heard say that Saul had struck the garrison of the Philistines, and also that Israel was had in abomination with the Philistines. The people were gathered together after Saul to Gilgal.

Tailo: Lâng phah guá ê kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ, guá tshut-tsāi i phah; lâng tshuah guá tshuì-phué ê tshuì-tshiu, guá tshut-tsāi i tshuah; lâng lîng-jio̍k guá, kā guá phuì nuā, guá mā bô am bīn.
English: I gave my back to the strikers, and my cheeks to those who plucked off the hair; I didn't hide my face from shame and spitting.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kò͘-siú ê uē-ping kiaⁿ kah phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, suah piàn kah tshin-tshiūnn sí-lâng.
English: For fear of him, the guards shook, and became like dead men.

Tailo: Hāi ā, lín tò-thâu siūⁿ à! Kám thang kā sio-huî ê lâng khuàⁿ-tsò tshin-tshiūnn thô͘? Siū tsō ê mi̍h kám thang lūn tsō i ê Siōngtè, kóng, I bô tsō guá ? Á-sī siū tsò ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ, kám thang lūn tsò i ê kóng, I bô tshong-bîng ?
English: You turn things upside down! Should the potter be thought to be like clay; that the thing made should say about him who made it, He didn't make me; or the thing formed say of him who formed it, He has no understanding?

Tailo: Iésu koh kā bûn-tô͘ kóng tsi̍t-ê phì-jū, kà-sī in tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kî-tó, m̄-thang ià-siān.
English: He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray, and not give up,

Tailo: In hiàn tsè hō͘ in ê sîn-bîng, tshiánn jîn-bîn lâi hù, jîn-bîn tsia̍h in ê tsè-mi̍h, suà kuī-pài in ê sîn-bîng.
English: for they called the people to the sacrifices of their gods; and the people ate, and bowed down to their gods.

Tailo: Kî-tiong ū kuí-nā-ê lâng kóng, I kuáⁿ kuí sī khò kuí-ông Be̍h-tse-bul.
English: But some of them said, He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ê siàu-liân lâng lâi-kàu-uī, tsiū kā tsiah-ê uē īng Tabi̍t ê miâ, lóng kā Nabal kóng, i tsiū tiām-tiām thìng-hāu.
English: When David's young men came, they spoke to Nabal according to all those words in the name of David, and ceased.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tsiū kiò in lóng tshut-.khì, kuī lo̍h-.khì, kî-tó, jiân-āu ua̍t tńg-sin tuì sin-si kóng, Ta-bí-thah, khí-.lâi. Tol-ka ê ba̍k-tsiu thí-khui, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Piattò͘, tsiū khí-lâi tsē.
English: Peter put them all out, and kneeled down and prayed. Turning to the body, he said, Tabitha, get up! She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

Tailo: Hit-ê siâ-sîn tsiū koh khì tuà tshit ê pí ka-kī khah pháiⁿ ê siâ-sîn lâi, ji̍p-khì hia tuà. Hit-ê lâng ê kiat-kio̍k pí khí-thâu koh khah tshám.
English: Then he goes, and takes seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng tsia̍h kàu pá, koh khioh só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê piáⁿ-tshuì muá tshit nâ.
English: They ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

Tailo: Hit-ê tit-tio̍h i hó ê lâng m̄-tsai I sī siáⁿ lâng, in-uī ū tsin tsē lâng tī hia, jî-tshiánn Iésu mā í-king tiām-tiām-á lī-khui hia.
English: But he who was healed didn't know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a crowd being in the place.

Tailo: Ahap ná ē tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng ka-kī khiam-pi, lí kám ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h? In-uī i ka-kī tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng khiam-pi, só͘-í, Guá bô beh tī i ua̍h-.leh ê ji̍t kàng tsit-ê tsai-hō, sī beh tī i ê kiáⁿ ê ji̍t, kàng tsit-ê tsai-hō tī i ê ke.
English: See you how Ahab humbles himself before me? because he humbles himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days; but in his son's days will I bring the evil on his house.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, tsin tsē lâi kuè-tseh ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iésu beh lâi Êlúsalèm,
English: On the next day a great multitude had come to the feast. When they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

Tailo: Sàulô tī Gi-be-at ê La̍h-má, tsē tī suî-si-liú ê tshiū kha, tshiú-.ni̍h gia̍h tshiuⁿ, tsìng jîn-sîn uî tī i ê tsó-iū. Sàulô thiaⁿ-tio̍h kóng Tabi̍t kah tuè ê lâng hō͘ lâng tú-.tio̍h,
English: Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men who were with him: now Saul was sitting in Gibeah, under the tamarisk tree in Ramah, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing about him.

Tailo: Lí ū kiânn lí ê tuā-tsé ê lō͘, só͘-í Guá beh kā i ê pue kau tī lí ê tshiú.
English: You have walked in the way of your sister; therefore will I give her cup into your hand.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, in tsun-thàn Palân ê kè-bô͘, hō͘ Isulael lâng tī Bohol ê tāi-tsì tik-tsuē Siōngtsú, tì-sú Siōngtsú ê huē-tsiòng tú-tio̍h un-i̍k.
English: Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against Yahweh in the matter of Peor, and so the plague was among the congregation of Yahweh.

Tailo: I lī-khui lâng kià-kha ê só͘-tsāi khì khui hia̍t, kiânn tī hit tíng-bīn ê lâng bô siūⁿ-tio̍h i; in lī-khui lâng suah tuī lo̍h-khì hia̍t tiong, hàiⁿ-lâi hàiⁿ-khì.
English: He breaks open a shaft away from where people live. They are forgotten by the foot. They hang far from men, they swing back and forth.

Tailo: Pò͘-pênn ê tiùⁿ só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tn̂g, tsit pîng tsi̍t tiú, hit pîng tsi̍t tiú, tio̍h suê tī huē-bō͘ ê siang pîng lâi kā i jia-.leh.
English: The cubit on the one side, and the cubit on the other side, of that which remains in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tent on this side and on that side, to cover it.

Tailo: In pīng bô teh siàu-liām lī-khui hn̄g-hn̄g ê ke 鄉, nā ū, tsá to̍h ū ki-huē thang tńg-.khì.
English: If indeed they had been thinking of that country from which they went out, they would have had enough time to return.

Tailo: Thiu-tshiam kò͘-siú tang-mn̂g ê sī Silemiah, i ê kiáⁿ Tsa-kha-lī-a sī tsing-thong ê bô͘-sū, lâng kā i thiu-tshiam lâi kò͘-siú pak-mn̂g.
English: The lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counselor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.

Tailo: pò-siû-.ê nā tī tô-siám ê siâⁿ ê kíng-guā tú-tio̍h i, lâi thâi-sí hit-ê hiong-huān, pò-siû-.ê tsiū bô thâi-sí-lâng ê tsuē.
English: and the avenger of blood find him outside of the border of his city of refuge, and the avenger of blood kill the manslayer; he shall not be guilty of blood,

Tailo: In-uī him-bō͘ tseh-kî lâi iu-būn ê, Guá beh kā in tsū-tsi̍p, in sī sio̍k lí ê, in tam-tng lîng-jio̍k tshin-tshiūnn taⁿ tāng-tàⁿ.
English: Those who are sad for the appointed feasts, I will remove from you. They are a burden and a reproach to you.

Tailo: Jiânāu Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ khì-kàu tsi̍t-ê kiò-tsò Gia̍t-se-má-neh ê só͘-tsāi. I tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Lín tuà tsia tsē, thìng-hāu guá khì hia kî-tó.
English: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to his disciples, Sit here, while I go there and pray.

Tailo: Liân guá tī The-sa-lô-nî-ke ê sî, lín mā kuí-nā pái tshe lâng lâi kiong-kip guá ê su-iàu.
English: For even in Thessalonica you sent once and again to my need.

Tailo: Tsóng-tok Le-hóm kah su-kì Simsiai beh kò Êlúsalèm lâng, mā tsiūⁿ-pió tsàu Altasiásuta ông, hit-ê pió tshin-tshiūnn án-ne:
English: Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort:

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, nn̄g lâng tsò-hué kiânn, lâi-kàu Bia̍tléhèm. In kàu Bia̍tléhèm ê sî, tsuân siânn lóng uī-tio̍h in hing-hùn khí-.lâi; hiah-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Tse kám sī Naomih?
English: So they two went until they came to Bethlehem. It happened, when they were come to Bethlehem, that all the city was moved about them, and the women said, Is this Naomi?

Tailo: I ê tiōng-hu ê sim uá-khò i, lóng bô khiàm-khueh siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: The heart of her husband trusts in her. He shall have no lack of gain.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k lín tio̍h kìng-uì Siōngtsú, sîng-sim si̍t-ì ho̍k-sāi I, in-uī lín tio̍h ē kì-tit I uī lín só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì ū guā tuā.
English: Only fear Yahweh, and serve him in truth with all your heart; for consider how great things he has done for you.

Tailo: Pe̍h-tsha̍t-uē sī guá só͘ thòng-hūn, só͘ thó-ià ê; Lí ê lu̍t-huat sī guá só͘ ì-ài ê.
English: I hate and abhor falsehood. I love your law.

Tailo: Lí ê kài-bīng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah guá tông-tsāi, hō͘ guá pí guá ê tuì-ti̍k khah ū tì-huī.
English: Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies, For your commandments are always with me.

Tailo: M̄-thang hō͘ lí ê ba̍k-tsiu khùn-.khì, m̄-thang hō͘ lí ê ba̍k-tsiu phuê pàng-kheh-kheh.
English: Give no sleep to your eyes, Nor slumber to your eyelids.

Tailo: Elihu koh suà-tsiap kóng:
English: Elihu also continued, and said,

Tailo: Hit sî, guá koh kā jîn-bîn kóng, Ta̍k lâng kah i ê lô͘-po̍k tio̍h tī Êlúsalèm ê lāi-bīn hioh mê, thang àm-sî lâi pó-hō͘ guán, ji̍t-sî khì tsò-kang.
English: Likewise at the same time said I to the people, Let everyone with his servant lodge within Jerusalem, that in the night they may be a guard to us, and may labor in the day.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, ū lâng tī A-só-to͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h Hui-li̍p-pò͘, i iân-lō͘ tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ-tshī thuân hok-im, it-ti̍t kàu Kai-sa-lī-a.
English: But Philip was found at Azotus. Passing through, he preached the Good News to all the cities, until he came to Caesarea.

Tailo: Tuì siong-sim ê lâng tshiùⁿ kua, tú tshin-tshiūnn kuâⁿ-thiⁿ ê sî thǹg saⁿ, koh tshin-tshiūnn kā tshò͘ piànn tī kinn ê tíng-bīn.
