English: As one who takes away a garment in cold weather, Or vinegar on soda, So is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.

Tailo: In ē tshin-tshiūⁿ ióng-bíng ê sai hm̄-hm̄ háu, tshin-tshiūnn sè-tsiah sai teh háu-kiò.
English: They shall roar together like young lions; they shall growl as lions' cubs.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng tuì i kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, lí tsai Sàulô ê só͘ tsò, i tuì kíng lāi tsián-tû tsiah-ê kuí hū-sin ê kah kiâⁿ siâ-su̍t ê. Lí ná ē siat-kè beh hāi-sí guá ê sèⁿ-miā?
English: The woman said to him, Behold, you know what Saul has done, how he has cut off those who have familiar spirits, and the wizards, out of the land: why then lay you a snare for my life, to cause me to die?

Tailo: Siōngtsú hō͘ in tī Isulael lâng ê bīn-tsîng hun-luān, tsiū tī Gi-bóng kā in thâi-sí tsin tsē, tī tsiūⁿ Bia̍t-ho-lông ê lō͘ kā in jiok, kā in phah kàu A-tse-kah kah Ma̍kketah.
English: Yahweh confused them before Israel, and he killed them with a great slaughter at Gibeon, and chased them by the way of the ascent of Beth Horon, and struck them to Azekah, and to Makkedah.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng tsin tsun-tiōng tsiah-ê sù-tô͘, m̄-koh, tsin tsē lâng m̄-káⁿ kah in tsiap-kīn.
English: None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them.

Tailo: I kā lāu-pē kóng, Guá ê thâu-khak, guá ê thâu-khak! I ê lāu-pē kā lô͘-po̍k kóng, Kā i phō khì i ê lāu-bú hia.
English: He said to his father, My head, my head. He said to his servant, Carry him to his mother.

Tailo: Siū kíng-suán lâi kò͘-mn̂g ê, kiōng nn̄g-pah tsa̍p-jī lâng. In tī in ê tsng-thâu, tsiàu sè-hē lâi sǹg, sī Tabi̍t kah sian-kiàn ê Samuel só͘ hun-phài lâi tam-tng tsit-ê tsik-jīm ê.
English: All these who were chosen to be porters in the thresholds were two hundred and twelve. These were reckoned by genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer did ordain in their office of trust.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú tī tsi̍t ji̍t ê tiong-kan ē tuì Isulael tsám-tn̄g thâu kah bué, tsang tshiū-ki kah lô͘-uí.
English: Therefore Yahweh will cut off from Israel head and tail, palm branch and reed, in one day.

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t nā tsia̍h siā-un-tsè ê bah, tsit-ê tsè bô tit-tio̍h tsiap-la̍p, mā bô kā hiàn ê sǹg gia̍h, tian-tò sī tsò thang thó-ià ê, tsia̍h ê lâng tsiū tio̍h tam-tng i ê tsuē.
English: If any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings is eaten on the third day, it will not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed to him who offers it. It will be an abomination, and the soul who eats any of it will bear his iniquity.

Tailo: Abúlâm kah Hagal tâng-pâng, Hagal tsiū huâi-īn; i tsai ka-kī ū sin, tsiū khuànn-khin tsú-bó.
English: He went in to Hagar, and she conceived. When she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.

Tailo: Isulael ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tio̍h uī-tio̍h Sàulô thî-khàu! I bat hō͘ lín tshīng tsu-âng sik lâi huann-hí, hō͘ lín ê saⁿ-khò͘ ū n̂g-kim ê táⁿ-pān.
English: You daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, Who clothed you in scarlet delicately, Who put ornaments of gold on your clothing.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iôná khí-.lâi, ài tsáu-khì Talsisih, lâi siám-phiah Siōngtsú; lo̍h-khì Io̍p-pe, tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah tsûn beh khì Talsisih. I tsiū hō͘ i tsûn-phiò tsîⁿ, tah hit tsiah tsûn beh kah in khì Talsisih, lâi siám-phiah Siōngtsú.
English: But Jonah rose up to flee to Tarshish from the presence of Yahweh. He went down to Joppa, and found a ship going to Tarshish; so he paid its fare, and went down into it, to go with them to Tarshish from the presence of Yahweh.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat kóng, Tī tsia kám bô Siōngtsú ê sian-ti, lán thang thok i lâi mn̄g Siōngtsú? Isulael ông tsi̍t-ê lô͘-po̍k ìn kóng, Tsîng piàⁿ tsuí tī Eliiah ê tshiú ê, Siahuat ê kiáⁿ Elísiah tī tsia.
English: But Jehoshaphat said, Isn't there here a prophet of Yahweh, that we may inquire of Yahweh by him? One of the king of Israel's servants answered, Elisha the son of Shaphat is here, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.

Tailo: Khí-.lâi, tshuā enn-á kah I ê lāu-bú tńg-khì Isulael tē, in-uī hiah-ê beh sat-hāi enn-á ê lâng í-king sí à.
English: Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young child's life are dead.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Iésu bîng-pi̍k kā in kóng, La̍h-tsa-lō͘ sí-.khì à.
English: So Jesus said to them plainly then, Lazarus is dead.

Tailo: Hit sî, hut-jiân lâng ê tshiú-tsíng-thâu-á tshut-hiān, tī ông-kiong kah ting-tâi sio-tuì ê hún-piah siá jī, ông khuàⁿ-tio̍h siá jī ê tshiú,
English: In the same hour came forth the fingers of a man's hand, and wrote over against the lampstand on the plaster of the wall of the king's palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.

Tailo: Tik-sìng koh kè-sio̍k tsun-siú guá ê bīng-līng ti̍t-kàu lō͘-bué ê lâng, guá beh hō͘ i ū kuân-pìng thang tī-lí bān-kok.
English: He who overcomes, and he who keeps my works to the end, to him I will give authority over the nations.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Guá īng Guá pîng-an ê iok siúⁿ-sù hō͘ i,
English: Therefore say, Behold, I give to him my covenant of peace:

Tailo: Guá uī ka-kī tsò kiàn-tsìng, tshe-phài guá lâi ê Thiⁿ-pē mā uī guá tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: I am one who testifies about myself, and the Father who sent me testifies about me.

Tailo: Tsú ê jîn-tsû ta̍k tsá-khí uāⁿ sin; Lí ê sîng-si̍t hui-siông khuah-tuā!
English: They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.

Tailo: Kuáⁿ-hū tsiū lī-khui Elísiah, tńg-khì tshù-.ni̍h, kā mn̂g kuainn khí-.lâi, i kah i ê kiáⁿ tiàm lāi-bīn; kiáⁿ tuà khì-kū lâi hō͘ i, i tsiū thîn iû.
English: So she went from him, and shut the door on her and on her sons; they brought the vessels to her, and she poured out.

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t-ê khit-tsia̍h miâ kiò-tsò La̍h-tsa-lō͘, kui sing-khu seⁿ kah tsuân liàp-á, tó tī hit-ê hó-gia̍h lâng ê mn̂g-kháu,
English: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was laid at his gate, full of sores,

Tailo: Siōngtè ìn kóng, Guá ê un-tián kàu-gia̍h lí īng, in-uī lí luán-jio̍k ê sî, guá ê khuì-la̍t ē-tàng uân-tsuân huat-hui. Só͘-í, guá tsin huann-hí, khah ài khua-kháu guá tsiah-ê luán-jio̍k, thang hō͘ Ki-tok ê khuì-la̍t tiàm tī guá ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: He has said to me, My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore I will rather glory in my weaknesses, that the power of Christ may rest on me.

Tailo: Lí ē koh tsai-tsìng phû-tô hn̂g tī Sa-má-lī-a tsiah-ê suaⁿ, tsai-tsìng ê ē tsai-tsìng, lâi hióng-siū i ê kué-tsí.
English: Again shall you plant vineyards on the mountains of Samaria; the planters shall plant, and shall enjoy the fruit of it.

Tailo: Páulô kóng suah, the̍h piáⁿ, tī tsìng lâng ê bīn-tsîng kám-siā Siōngtè liáu-āu, kā piáⁿ peh-khui lâi tsia̍h.
English: When he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it, and began to eat.

Tailo: Lín bô-lūn tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h, tio̍h tsīn-sim lâi tsò, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh ho̍k-sāi Tsú, m̄-sī teh ho̍k-sāi lâng.
English: And whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord, and not for men,

Tailo: I tī tsiah-ê sai ê tiong-kan tsáu-lâi tsáu-khì, tsiâⁿ-tsò ióng ê sai, ha̍k-si̍p kā mi̍h lâi tsia̍h lâng.
English: He went up and down among the lions; he became a young lion, and he learned to catch the prey; he devoured men.

Tailo: Tio̍h hiù hit-ê thái-ko beh tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng tshit pái, tsiū tuàn-tīng i tsò tshing-khì, koh pàng hit tsiah ua̍h-tsiáu khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: He shall sprinkle on him who is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird go into the open field.

Tailo: suî-jiân ū tsit saⁿ-ê lâng tī in tiong-kan, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng: Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, in bē-tàng kiù in ê kiáⁿ-jî, tsí ū in pún-sin tit-tio̍h kiù niā-niā.
English: though these three men were in it, as I live, says the Lord Yahweh, they should deliver neither sons nor daughters, but they only should be delivered themselves.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, in beh hāi guá hiah-ê kè-bô͘, Lí lóng tsai. Kiû Lí m̄-thang sià-bián in ê tsuē-kò, mā m̄-thang tuì Lí ê bīn-tsîng tshat-siau in ê tsuē-ok; tio̍h hō͘ in tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng pua̍h-tó; Lí siū-khì ê sî, tio̍h kā in pān.
English: Yet, Yahweh, you know all their counsel against me to kill me; don't forgive their iniquity, neither blot out their sin from your sight; but let them be overthrown before you; deal you with them in the time of your anger.

Tailo: In-uī tshiū-á nā tshò khí-.lâi, iáu-koh ū ǹg-bāng koh puh íⁿ, nńg ê ki huat bē suah.
English: For there is hope for a tree, If it is cut down, that it will sprout again, That the tender branch of it will not cease.

Tailo: Tio̍h sing tui-kiû Siōngtè kok-tō͘ kah tsiàu I ê tsí-ì lâi kiâⁿ, tsiah-ê mi̍h tsiū lóng ē sūn-suà siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín.
English: But seek first God's Kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things will be given to you as well.

Tailo: Lín ta̍k tsá-khí tio̍h kiânn kong-pêⁿ, tsín-kiù siū tshiúⁿ-kiap ê lâi thuat-lī kiông-pō ê lâng ê tshiú, khióng-kiaⁿ Guá ê siū-khì ē in-uī lín só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ lâi huat-tsok, tshin-tshiūnn hué to̍h khí-.lâi, sīm-tsì bô lâng ū huat-tō͘ phah-hua.
English: House of David, thus says Yahweh, Execute justice in the morning, and deliver him who is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor, lest my wrath go forth like fire, and burn so that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín sī siū tsiù-tsó͘ ê, lín tiong-kan tsò lô͘-lē ê íng-uán bē tn̄g, kā guán Siōngtsú ê tiān tsò phuà tshâ kah tshiūⁿ tsuí ê kang-lâng.
English: Now therefore you are cursed, and there shall never fail to be of you bondservants, both wood cutters and drawers of water for the house of my God.

Tailo: Eliiah lâi kìnn tsìng lâng kóng, Lín tsûn nn̄g-iūⁿ sim bô kuat-tuān, ē kàu tang-sî? Nā Siōngtsú sī Siōngtè, tsiū tio̍h tsun-thàn Siōngtsú; nā Baal sī Siōngtè, tsiū tio̍h tsun-thàn Baal. Jîn-bîn bô ìn kah tsi̍t kù uē.
English: Elijah came near to all the people, and said, How long will you waver between the two sides? If Yahweh is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him. The people answered him not a word.

Tailo: Gîtióng khuàⁿ-tshut i sī Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá, tsiū kóng, Hāiⁿ-ah! Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú ah, in-uī guá tng-bīn khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá.
English: Gideon saw that he was the angel of Yahweh; and Gideon said, Alas, Lord Yahweh! because I have seen the angel of Yahweh face to face.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, tāi-tsì tú-tú tsiàu i só͘ kā guán kái-bāng ê lâi si̍t-hiān, lí hō͘ guá ho̍k-tsit, hit-ê lâng siū tiàu lâi sí.
English: It happened, as he interpreted to us, so it was: he restored me to my office, and he hanged him.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá tshe Guá ê sù-tsiá, i ē tī Guá ê thâu-tsîng tsún-pī lō͘. Lín só͘ tshuē ê Tsú, ē hut-jiân lâi-kàu I ê tiān; bîng-iok ê sù-tsiá, to̍h-sī lín só͘ him-bō͘ ê, lí khuàⁿ, i lâi à.
English: Behold, I send my messenger, and he will prepare the way before me; and the Lord, whom you seek, will suddenly come to his temple; and the messenger of the covenant, whom you desire, behold, he comes! says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Hitsekia ông tsa̍p-sì nî, Asiul ông Senahkhelip lâi kong-kik Iôtah it-tshè kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah did Sennacherib king of Assyria come up against all the fortified cities of Judah, and took them.

Tailo: Lí ê jîn-bîn iáu teh kóng, ' Tsú ê lō͘ bô kong-pêⁿ', kî-si̍t sī in ê lō͘ bô kong-pêⁿ.
English: Yet the children of your people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal.

Tailo: Iésu tshuā tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ khì piⁿ-á kā in kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, taⁿ lán beh tsiūⁿ Êlúsalèm, sian-ti só͘ kì-tsài kuan-hē Jîn-tsú ê it-tshè lóng ē ìng-giām.
English: He took the twelve aside, and said to them, Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè pí lán ê sim khah tuā, mā ta̍k hāng lóng tsai.
English: because if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things.

Tailo: In án-ne tsò jiá-khí I ê siū-khì, tsiū ū un-i̍k tī in tiong-kan liû-hîng.
English: Thus they provoked him to anger with their deeds. The plague broke in on them.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê siàu-liân lâng, miâ kiò-tsò Iû-tu-kó͘, tsē tī thang-á-mn̂g. Páulô kè-sio̍k káng-lūn tsin kú, hit-ê siàu-liân lâng suah khùn lo̍h-bîn, tuì saⁿ-tsàn lâu pua̍h lo̍h-.khì. Tāi-ke kā i hû khí-.lâi ê sî, i í-king sí à.
English: A certain young man named Eutychus sat in the window, weighed down with deep sleep. As Paul spoke still longer, being weighed down by his sleep, he fell down from the third story, and was taken up dead.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h siat tsi̍t tiâu lō͘, hō͘ to lâi-kàu Ammóng lâng ê Lap-bah, mā thang khì-kàu Iôtah kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ — Êlúsalèm.
English: You shall appoint a way for the sword to come to Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and to Judah in Jerusalem the fortified.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tsai Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, I sī Siōngtè, koh sī sìn-si̍t ê Siōngtè, uī-tio̍h thiàⁿ I hiah-ê siú I kài-bīng ê lâng, si̍t-hîng I ê iok kah tsû-ài, it-ti̍t kàu tshing-tāi.
English: Know therefore that Yahweh your God, he is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with them who love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hit-ê bat siū thòng-khó͘ ê tē bô koh tiàm tī o͘-àm. Tsá-tsîng Siōngtè hō͘ Tse-bú-lông kah Náhuthalím ê tē siū khuànn-khin, āu-lâi tsiū hō͘ iân hái ê lō͘, Ioltàn hô ê hô guā, guā-pang ê Ga-lí-la-iah tit-tio̍h îng-kng.
English: But there shall be no more gloom for her who was in anguish. In the former time, he brought into contempt the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali; but in the latter time he has made it glorious, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.

Tailo: Sian-ti ī-giân pîng-an, hit-ê sian-ti ê uē tit-tio̍h ìng-giām, tsiū tsai hit-ê sian-ti tsin-tsiàⁿ sī Siōngtsú só͘ tshe ê.
English: The prophet who prophesies of peace, when the word of the prophet shall happen, then shall the prophet be known, that Yahweh has truly sent him.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsìn-tsîng tit-tio̍h hok-im ê lâng, in-uī m̄ sūn-ho̍k, suah bē-tàng tsìn-ji̍p an-hioh, Siōngtè tsiū uī kî-tha ê lâng pó-liû tsit-ê an-hioh.
English: Seeing therefore it remains that some should enter therein, and they to whom the good news was before preached failed to enter in because of disobedience,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì in kóng: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Bô tsun-thàn tsit-ê iok ê uē ê lâng tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: and say you to them, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man who doesn't hear the words of this covenant,

Tailo: Hit sî, Tsú tshin-tshiūnn lâng khùn tsing-sîn, tshin-tshiūnn ióng-bíng ê lâng lim tsiú liáu-āu teh huah.
English: Then the Lord awakened as one out of sleep, Like a mighty man who shouts by reason of wine.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè it-tīng bē íng-uán bē kì-tit sàn-tshiah lâng, khùn-khó͘ ê lâng ê ǹg-bāng it-tīng bē íng-uán bô-.khì.
English: For the needy shall not always be forgotten, Nor the hope of the poor perish forever.

Tailo: Τio̍h īng bô kuè-phah ê tsio̍h-thâu khí Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê tuâⁿ, tī hit tíng-bīn tio̍h hiàn sio-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè.
English: You shall build the altar of Yahweh your God of uncut stones; and you shall offer burnt offerings thereon to Yahweh your God:

Tailo: Guá uàn-hūn guá it-tshè ê lô-lo̍k, to̍h-sī guá tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn só͘ lô-lo̍k ê; in-uī guá tio̍h lâu hō͘ guá í-āu ê lâng.
English: I hated all my labor in which I labored under the sun, seeing that I must leave it to the man who comes after me.

Tailo: Isulael ông kā Iô-sa-huat kóng, Guá kám bô kā lí kóng, tsit-ê lâng só͘ beh ī-giân guá ê, bô kóng hó uē, tsí ū tsai-hō niā-niā?
English: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Didn't I tell you that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?

Tailo: Ì-hiòng jio̍k-thé ê kiat-kó sī sí, ì-hiòng Sìng Sîn ê kiat-kó sī ua̍h-miā kah pîng-an.
English: For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace;

Tailo: Koh tio̍h kā lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘ kà-sī in, tsí-sī in só͘ tio̍h kiânn ê lō͘, só͘ tio̍h tsò ê tāi-tsì;
English: You shall teach them the statutes and the laws, and shall show them the way in which they must walk, and the work that they must do.

Tailo: In īng tsit-sîng ê iù-tē pò͘, kā Alông kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ tsò lāi-saⁿ.
English: They made the coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,

Tailo: tī Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tē, Ke-bal ê hô piⁿ, Siōngtsú ê uē thiau-tî lîm-kàu Bu-tsih ê kiáⁿ — tsè-si I-tse-kel; tī hia Siōngtsú ê tshiú hē tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: the word of Yahweh came expressly to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the river Chebar; and the hand of Yahweh was there on him.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá kā lín kóng, nā ū lâng sim tsûn siâ-io̍k lâi khuànn hū-jîn-lâng, i tī sim-lāi í-king kah i huān kan-îm ā.
English: but I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.

Tailo: Iobuh ìn kóng:
English: Then Job answered,

Tailo: Taⁿ Siōngtsú ìng-giām I só͘ kóng ê uē, guá tsiàu Siōngtsú ê uē khí-lâi suà-tsiap guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t, tsē Isulael ê kok-uī, koh uī Siōngtsú — Isulael Siōngtè ê miâ khí tiān.
English: Yahweh has established his word that he spoke; for I am risen up in the room of David my father, and sit on the throne of Israel, as Yahweh promised, and have built the house for the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Hit sî, Alâm ông Hatsael tńg-khì kong-kik Gat, kā i tsing-ho̍k, tsiū tiāⁿ-tio̍h ì-sù beh tńg-khì kong-kik Êlúsalèm.
English: Then Hazael king of Syria went up, and fought against Gath, and took it; and Hazael set his face to go up to Jerusalem.

Tailo: ' Kàu tē-tshit nî, lín tio̍h ta̍k lâng tháu-pàng bē hō͘ lí ê hiann-tī — Hi-bú-lâi lâng; i í-king ho̍k-sāi lí la̍k nî, lí tio̍h kā i tháu-pàng, lī-khui lí lâi tsū-iû. ' Tsóng-.sī, lín ê tsó͘-sian m̄-thiaⁿ Guá ê uē, mā bô àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ.
English: At the end of seven years you shall let go every man his brother who is a Hebrew, who has been sold to you, and has served you six years, you shall let him go free from you: but your fathers didn't listen to me, neither inclined their ear.

Tailo: Tiâⁿ-mn̂g ê mn̂g-lî sī īng siù-hue ê kang-hu, īng nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu kah kuè-pháng ê iù-tē tsò ê, tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú, kuân gō͘ tiú kah tiâⁿ ê uî sio-phuè.
English: The screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. Twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, like to the hangings of the court.

Tailo: Kò͘-iûⁿ ê lâng tńg-.khì, uī-tio̍h só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h kah só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì lóng kah thiⁿ-sài só͘ kóng ê uân-tsuân kāng-khuán, tsiū kā îng-kng kah o-ló kui hō͘ Siōngtè.
English: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, just as it was told them.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h īng sìng-kiat ê lé-gî hō͘-siong tshíng-an. Ki-tok ê tsìng kàu-huē lóng kā lín tshíng-an.
English: Greet one another with a holy kiss. The assemblies of Christ greet you.

Tailo: Amnon ū tsi̍t-ê pîng-iú, miâ kiò-tsò Io-Nátap, sī Tabi̍t ê a-hiaⁿ Simeah ê kiáⁿ. Io-Nátap sī tsi̍t-ê tsin lîng-khiàu ê lâng.
English: But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab, the son of Shimeah, David's brother; and Jonadab was a very subtle man.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng, Gîn sī Guá ê, kim mā sī Guá ê.
English: The silver is mine, and the gold is mine,' says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tshú tshâ-liāu, lâi khí tsit-ê tiān, Guá tsiū ē in-uī án-ne lâi huann-hí, koh tit-tio̍h îng-kng. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Go up to the mountain, bring wood, and build the house. I will take pleasure in it, and I will be glorified, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Ū bé-pinn ê siann, ū tshia-lián hū-hū háu ê siann, bé phut-phut thiàu, tshia khōng-khōng háu;
English: The noise of the whip, the noise of the rattling of wheels, prancing horses, and bounding chariots,

Tailo: Tī Lēbī hit ki kuái-á tio̍h siá Alông ê miâ, in-uī ta̍k tsi-tso̍k ê thâu-lâng lóng ū tsi̍t ki kuái-á.
English: You shall write Aaron's name on the rod of Levi; for there shall be one rod for each head of their fathers' houses.

Tailo: I uat kàu se hng, īng ko-tshioh lâi niû, gō͘-pah ko-tshioh.
English: He turned about to the west side, and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.

Tailo: Siōngtè pīng bô iông-ín huān tsuē ê thiⁿ-sài, só͘-í kā in hiat lo̍h-khì im-hú, kā in kuainn tī o͘-àm ê tshim kheⁿ, tī hia thìng-hāu sím-phuàⁿ.
English: For if God didn't spare angels when they sinned, but cast them down to Tartarus , and committed them to pits of darkness, to be reserved to judgment;

Tailo: Só͘-í, kuan-hē tsia̍h tsè-kuè ngó͘-siōng ê mi̍h, lán tsai sè-kan ê ngó͘-siōng lóng m̄-sī tsin ê; lán mā tsai Siōngtè tsí ū tsi̍t-ê, í-guā bô pa̍t-ê.
English: Therefore concerning the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that no idol is anything in the world, and that there is no other God but one.

Tailo: In-uī guá ū pîng-iú lí-hîng lâi tshuē guá, guá bô mi̍h thang tshiánn i tsia̍h. '
English: for a friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him,'

Tailo: Kong-gī hō͘ pang-kok ko-sing; tsuē-ok hō͘ jîn-bîn siū lîng-jio̍k.
English: Righteousness exalts a nation, But sin is a disgrace to any people.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, khe tsuí ta-.khì, in-uī hit-ê só͘-tsāi bô hō͘-tsuí.
English: It happened after a while, that the brook dried up, because there was no rain in the land.

Tailo: Guá kóng: Lí to̍k-to̍k tio̍h kìng-uì Guá, tio̍h siū kà-sī, tsiah hō͘ i ê tshù bô tsiàu Guá só͘ pān-lí i ê lâi siū tû-bia̍t. Tsóng-.sī, in thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, ka-kī pāi-huāi in it-tshè ê só͘ kiâⁿ.
English: I said, Just fear me. Receive correction, so that her dwelling won't be cut off, according to all that I have appointed concerning her. But they rose early and corrupted all their doings.

Tailo: Piⁿ-á teh khiā ê lâng mn̄g in kóng, Lín tháu lî-á beh tshòng siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Some of those who stood there asked them, What are you doing, untying the young donkey?

Tailo: Tsò hū-jîn-lâng ê, tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn sūn-ho̍k Tsú án-ne lâi sūn-ho̍k ka-kī ê tiōng-hu.
English: Wives, be subject to your own husbands, as to the Lord.

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am ông thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k kong-kik Bethel ê tuâⁿ só͘ huah ê uē, i tsiū tuì tuâⁿ tíng tshun tshiú, kóng, Tio̍h kā i lia̍h khí-.lâi! I só͘ tshun beh lia̍h i ê tshiú tsiū ta-.khì, bē-tàng koh kiu tò tńg-.khì.
English: It happened, when the king heard the saying of the man of God, which he cried against the altar in Bethel, that Jeroboam put forth his hand from the altar, saying, Lay hold on him. His hand, which he put forth against him, dried up, so that he could not draw it back again to him.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū huan-hù bûn-tô͘ kā kûn-tsiòng hun-tso͘, tsē tuà tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tsháu-po͘.
English: He commanded them that everyone should sit down in groups on the green grass.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-phú-kng ê sî, Iésu tuì ô͘ ê tsuí-bīn kiâⁿ-kuè lâi bûn-tô͘ tsia.
English: In the fourth watch of the night, Jesus came to them, walking on the sea.

Tailo: Tāi-ke bô sio e-kheh, ta̍k-ê tsiàu i ê lō͘-suàⁿ tsìn-hîng, tú-tio̍h tshiuⁿ, to mā bô siám-phiah.
English: Neither does one jostle another; They march everyone in his path, And they burst through the defenses, And don't break ranks.

Tailo: Le-kap ê kiáⁿ Io-Nátap só͘ huan-hù i ê kiáⁿ-sun m̄-thang lim tsiú ê uē, in lóng tsun-siú, kàu kin-á-ji̍t mā bô lim, in-uī in tsun-thàn sian-tsó͘ ê bīng-līng. Tsóng-.sī, Guá ū tuì lín kóng, tsá-tsá to̍h khí-lâi kóng, m̄-koh, lín m̄-thiaⁿ Guá ê uē.
English: The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab, that he commanded his sons, not to drink wine, are performed; and to this day they drink none, for they obey their father's commandment: but I have spoken to you, rising up early and speaking; and you have not listened to me.

Tailo: M̄-koh, ū tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì, guá tio̍h kā lí tsik-pī, to̍h-sī lí í-king khì-sak tong-tsho͘ tuì guá ê thiàⁿ.
English: But I have this against you, that you left your first love.

Tailo: Samuel kā in kóng, Lín tī guá ê tshiú bô tshuē-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h mi̍h, kin-á-ji̍t Siōngtsú tuì lín tsò kiàn-tsìng, I só͘ buah iû ê, mā tsò kiàn-tsìng. In kóng, Guān I tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: He said to them, Yahweh is witness against you, and his anointed is witness this day, that you have not found anything in my hand. They said, He is witness.

Tailo: M̄-thiaⁿ lāng tsuâ ê lâng ê siann, á-.sī gâu uē hû liām tsiù ê lâng ê siann.
English: Which doesn't listen to the voice of charmers, No matter how skillful the charmer may be.

Tailo: Ki-tok nā bô koh-ua̍h, guán só͘ thuân ê sī khang-hi bô si̍t, lín ê sìn mā sī khang-khang.
English: If Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is in vain, and your faith also is in vain.

Tailo: Lō͘-tsuí ta ê sî, lí khuàⁿ, khòng-iá ê tē-bīn ū sè-sè înn-înn ê mi̍h, sè kah tshin-tshiūnn sng.
English: When the dew that lay had gone, behold, on the surface of the wilderness was a small round thing, small as the frost on the ground.
